a6uM6iw3rANjGOfLk0pZ5g.text: This place is amazing! The food is expertly crafted by talented chefs with a keen eye for detail. I was thoroughly impressed! You have to try the creme brulee! OMG the best desert I've had in a long time, or perhaps ever. Actually, I opened a Yelp account just to comment on how wonderful this place is. What a gem here in Las Vegas!

pOpzSWtwhL5JTMSJp2Ms9A.text: Steak and eggs are really good for $12.99... 2nd time back this trip!  Literally I will be back here every time I come to Vegas!!  Better than my anjin I give 5 stars and is triple the price!

Mno2R9p-kLOq5nxLO5nGCg.text: This is a must-go when you are in Vegas. I love Vietnamese comfort food. My friends took me here and I am glad that they did. I have been here over 10x's already. The food here is amazing. I can tell that District 1 really cares about their customers and the quality of their food. I tried a taste of almost the whole menu already from my friends. Every dish is on point. The food here does not even compare to the Vietnamese food in San Jose. I will definitely take my girlfriend to D1 on our next trip to Vegas.

bdijuZoUnjlhsd59D3D-eQ.text: District one is own by a respected individual name Kai.  From a real estate agent toba restaurant owner.  Enough of his creditablity.  They have this rice dish, ox tail fried rice. It's amazing.  And their pho's is on point.  Highly recommended

hS1Gepqx_QeRLTnNXguIig.text: I went there for a late night bite, instead I got a late night experience! I love everything about this place! The food is outstanding!

aPI9BNtFx4bwdUPS5vytLg.text: Expect a real treat when coming down to district one! My coworker recommended that we try this little gem! It's not your traditional farm fresh selection, so be ready for something different! Best selections: Black peppered lobster, pork belly buns, and bone marrow pho. House Oysters are a must have also !!!! I've visited here three times and have almost had everything on the menu. So far, so good...no complaints on the food. However, BEWARE of the bar! Drink knowledge is far below acceptable, so don't be upset when you don't get what you want...or they have no idea how to make your favorite cocktail. Yet if you like soda water in your old fashioned, this is the bar for you (Hah). Four stars for great food and atmosphere. Minus one star for lousy bar.

hLNzqx0DFfPrqKmOtkzTlQ.text: This place is worth checking out, I've been here twice, both times my meal has been excellent. Lobster with black pepper sauce is too die for. Oxtail garlic noodles were super tasty. The beef carpaccio is delicious. The belly buns are super good. My husband has had the Oxtail pho, and the bone soup, both were very good, but the flavor of my meals was superb. I can't complain about anything other than their computer system, both times we've been stuck waiting over a half hour for our check. For that, they lose one star. The service otherwise is great! Their happy hour is fantastic!

rctD7jqTm6ktn-mIsoH9Kw.text: Service suck so bad that the manager would not even spend any time to listen to our complaint that she send one of her servers to lister to our complaint.  Managers are more busy mingling with their friends at the bar instead of listening to customers complaints and rectify the issues.  This is my first and last visit to this establishment and I will make sure that I tell my friends to take their business else where.  This place is only a hype and careless about their service and customer appreciation.

rM5VuKxIolJGDKuXQgDJfQ.text: This place has great Asian fusion type foods, a little Vietnamese with the Pho noodle dishes, some Hawaiian dishes with the Ox Tail Loco Moco and stuff in between. I had the District One Short Ribs, lap cheong sausage, rice, and a fried egg were delicious!

When in doubt who better than the people who work there.

y9hKG23-8IuA5lOR5HK4Ag.text: Very nice place and spacious. Food was excellent especially their pho soup . Service was fast and well organize.

8Je67O3PAJeDQlASVw6bQw.text: Went here with friends and was extremely impressed with the quality and flavors of the food. Great for sharing entrees and appetizers. Full bar at your disposal is a plus. Friendly staff. Go here! Trust the fat kid.

9h68ZLItuRrMQZYxQ27Z5w.text: Finally had a chance to try this place with friends and we had a great time! The coconut mojito was amazing and almost a meal itself. If we weren't in a hurry to make it to our show, I would have taken the time to scrape all the meat out of the coconut. It was cool and refreshing and not overpoweringly strong. _t904Y4_caG6kWciICkRyA.text: Pretty cool spot. Cool to place to come get drinks. Had the oxtail and veggies. Was a little lacking in flavor. Maybe a pinch of seasoning for the veggies. Sea salt even. Tomato rice was not bad. The beef shanken salad was pretty solid. Liked it. Would get it again. Good soy vinaigrette and good sauce on the beef. I'll try it again. Hopefully gets better.

pESSXdiYJw869AbLKE-ezw.text: I have tried many Pho places in town. This happens to be my favorite now. The soup is very clean taste so fresh. The seafood selection is amazing as well. Each time we go we try something new and it just gets better.

YUqDXU-D_siUo15QB7HsqA.text: Terrible service on a night where the restaurant was empty. Friend's food ended up coming out 30 mins after me and my bf's food was given. Grilled squid was good. Oxtail pho wasn't cooked to the point where the meat should fall off the bones. Friends ordered a pound of shrimp which looked less than a pound, and off par crispy birds nest noodles. We came here once before and enjoyed the food and ambiance, but after this experience we won't be back.

vAfXPnwbNppcJhmahjXZmw.text: Friendly staff and really good service.  We ordered the soft shell crab, pork belly bun, oxtail fries, beef carpaccio and garlic noodles.  Everything was really good. I also ordered the Leche martini,  which was awesome.  I think my favorite was the oxtail fries. The oxtail was a huge compliment to the  fries. Not to mention the gravy and the egg.

WMfXli_lVXa51M4ZDT9PHg.text: This place is a go-to whenever we have company in town! Food is unique- Asian with a twist! Their cocktails are yummy too! I normally always order the steak and eggs, but their oxtail fried rice and oxtail fries are to die for! Belly buns are a good appetizer too! But I'm pretty sure most people come here for the infamous big bone soup and their lobster pho! And yes I can say they are both pretty darn tasty! But save some room for dessert! Their coconut ice cream served in a real coconut with shavings and peanuts is my favorite!

SEOAEP3T-P-ZKvyCwRL9iw.text: Excellent food, great presentation. The service is top notch as well. The staff is very attentive and often checks on you. Love that.  And this joint is super clean. I highly recommend this place for anyone who enjoys flavor and relaxing atmosphere.

5EKNePdYxOg8k2-t6XWT7g.text: This is my favorite Pho restaurant. The food is amazing, the service is exceptional, and the atmosphere is perfect. A+

v0VLZEY1NzyuUNVWgtXxiA.text: I enjoyed my evening as I spent my time with her walking through the District holding hands and choosing a restaurant to have dinner. We decided on Kings Seafood then afterwards went inside the GVR and gambled a bit.

4ILcCLyuBkKI4k70orqt-g.text: District One is on a strip mall  on the corner of Spring Mountain and Jones and that corner and intersection is a certified foodie's paradise.   It used to be anchored by Chada Thai.  Now, District One anchors it.  It has a sports-bar ambience serving Vietnamese fusion dishes but their dishes do not deviate too much away from the basic Vietnamese food.  They're still your traditional Vietnamese dishes, they just add a little something something and modernize them a bit.    Everything on their menu is very good.  I've tried just about everything on their menu, except that am not a big fan of their overpriced lobster pho.  For some reason, that doesn't appeal to me at all.  I've been to HCM more than once and I don't remember seeing lobster pho being served in the real District One of Ho Chi Minh City.  If they do, I must've missed it or never saw the restaurant that serves it.    Anyway, I sometimes think some people order them here just to show-off and make the people next table a bit inferior and impoverished (LOL).   Just imagine you enjoying and slurping on a regular $9.99 pho then out of the pantry you see lobster antennae, claws and tail sticking out of, and placed so deliberately, on a smaller bowl to make them look bigger being delivered to the table next to you, among other things.   I tend to always order either their big bone soup or oxtail pho,  or garlic noodles and garlic serrano wings.     District One is a must visit joint!  The staff is friendly, the place is clean and trendy-ish with good music in the background. And of course, it doesn't hurt when the food IS damn good!

AYdL0J6P0Lsl_c4pz1ULaQ.text: Oxtail pho!! And chicken wings! Sooooooo delicious!! I couldn't stop eating! I even took a oxtail fried rice to go!   Will be back for sure!

828ma-9i-2Jp5WNI6w6juQ.text: I wish I could write two separate reviews.   This is my second time here. The first time I came I specifically came for the garlic noodles but unfortunately they were out. I ordered the oxtail rice and grilled squid and they were great. Service was great as well!  Second visit. I had spring rolls, garlic noodles, steak and rice, and a shrimp skewer. The spring rolls + dipping sauce were good, they have a surprise crunch -from a fried egg roll wrap(?). The garlic noodles and steak had a great flavor profile, just a tad heavy handed on the salt/fish sauce, other than that, great! The shrimp skewer is one shrimp on a skewer, I had it grilled. It was seasoned perfectly, not too much salt. Our server, Louisa was also pleasant, 5 stars for her!  My 2 stars comes from the bar. As we were dining, a song came on that prompted the bartender, Janelle, to say "No! No, turn this shit off. I'm sick of hearing this child molester!" When we asked her why she said that, she quickly changed her tone when she realized she shouldn't have said that. She said "Those weren't my words, they were the customers, I was just repeating them." Firstly, everyone is entitled to their own opinions. Secondly, it is not okay for an employee, in any circumstance, to "repeat" outwardly things a guest may or may not have said. She could have politely asked for her coworker just to change the song, or walked over to change it herself instead of yelling over the bar. Third, I was sitting at a table near the bar and facing her the entire time. The comment came from her, the two gentlemen sitting in front of her did NOT say anything in regards to the music. I dislike dishonesty, if you want to say something, own it. Do not put the blame on a guest when you realize you were in the wrong for saying it in the first place.

mBCKRVAryhlFHj68dYK2bw.text: If you like Vietnamese Food across a broad range. This is the place to go! 2THUMBSUP.

MmwHgYAY396k5SQYho7rBw.text: Went there this past Spring break with the family. Great service and great food. We had Oxtail pho, Beef ball pho, chicken wings, garlic fries, Wonton Noodle, Spring rolls, Pork buns and Spicy beef noodle. Beef ball tasted like it was homemade, definitely a plus. The chicken wings were on point. I was little disappointed in the spicy beef noodle; it was missing that spice, again it's a fusion restaurant I shouldn't put too much into this noodle, as it takes one of a kind restaurant to get it right. Lastly, I got the "Big Bone" soup, as saw the waiter bring it from the across the restaurant my mouth drop as it holds True to its name THE BIG BONE. It was it bone with lots of bone marrow which I took a straw to suck the marrow out. The soup was not salty but full of onions, yet so good. It took about 6 of us which me, my brother in law, my husband, two sisters in laws and my son to somewhat finish this. We be back for another round of the Big Bone Soup, pho, chicken wings,Spring rolls, garlic fries, but pass on the Spicy beef noodle.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying to get the bone marrow
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another view of it
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Big Bone soup

Hoea4eNJt31UzZku9xvjgg.text: *EDC WEEK/ LATE REVIEW*  I would've rated this place higher if i haven't called 5-10 minutes before I arrived confirming if they had the bone marrow and was lied to. Considering I was only visiting Vegas and was really looking forward to this meal I am beyond lost for words on how whoever picked up the phone straight up lied to me.   On Monday after picking up around rental car we decided to go to District One based on the many recommendations we got from friends and online. When we got there, I asked for the big bone soup which they said they didn't have. I was fine with that considering they told me to come earlier on Wednesday (I flew out Wednesday night) cause they are closed on Tuesday. Fine. So we ordered the oxtail fried rice, baby bak choi, garlic serrano wings, pho tai nam and the pho oxtail. All were nothing short of amazing but I reaaaaaaally wanted the bone marrow.   Fast forward to Wednesday, I call the restaurant to confirm they have it so I don't waste my time and money going there and they don't have, the female who picked up the phone said "they have it at the time of the call but they don't have the lobster" fine I didn't want the lobster anyways. So I call a uber and rush over to district One, ask for the a table for two and then was told they didn't have the big bone pho at all, and didn't have it all day.   Are you kidding me. I literally rushed over full of joy and left with nothing but hated and a tummy empty of bone marrow :(. It's alright though, I went to Hobak BBQ (review to come) and that was one easily of the best korean meals I've ever had I am still hoping for the next time I come to Vegas they still have this so I can try it :(.  I'm coming back to Vegas in May hopefully it's available then. Will update

PG9-SAVpoNtYlrW9GLLE_g.text: Every time I go to Vegas day after drinking. This is the best spot for soup oxtail. Food is so delicious. Best hangover cure, brings you back to life.

QNPlNnalL0t-THDJh7x47w.text: Always pass by this place on my way to the house. Every time I drove by I mentally noted that I wanted to try it. Well it was about time I put that thought into action. I came with a group of four during happy hour and we were greeted and sat by our server. We knew this was going to be to try the drinks but we figured we grab some finger food while we drink. I ordered the pork belly buns, an order of the chicken wings and Eggrolls. The chicken wings didn't really have a lot of flavor but they were very crispy and had a jalapenos roasted on top of it. I wouldn't really say they're anything special. The pork belly bun and the eggrolls were a 10. Definitley great finger food. The service was a little slower but it was slammed and there was really like four people on the floor. The bar was packed because the drinks are soooo good ! We came on national margarita day and they were having a special on them. The Thai basil margarita was very refreshing. We also ordered the coconut mojito! MUST TRY COCONUT MOJITO! So good and they serve it in a fresh coconut! I also ordered the cafe sua da which is viatnemese drip coffee with hennnesy and I asked for the condensed creme on the side! It was a perfect after dinner drink! The drinks are worth returning ! Service was great and the soundtrack is FIRE

vOu41todGBbo83f9DVbz7w.text: Another stop we take whenever we're in town! Love the oysters and oxtail fried rice. We have tried other dishes that were pretty good as well. It's a little bit on the pricier side but def worth it!

byXscDElO0UrZfpyTMsiaQ.text: I've been eating at District One regularly since I moved to Vegas. There's something about D1 that keeps drawing me back. Other than the food, I'm not sure if it's the spacious layout of the restaurant or if it's the trendy casual vibe I feel as soon as I enter. But either way, they found a regular customer in me!  They're mostly known for the Pho but the rest of the menu is amazing! If you're willing to splurge a little extra, your server will bring a Specials Chalkboard to your table with some options for you but otherwise, you'll probably be very satisfied with their menu!   TO SHARE:  Spring Rolls- Personally was never a fan of spring rolls until I tried the ones here. The rolls taste so fresh that I sometimes tell myself that I'm eating healthy whenever I order these. I also like to ask for no mint just because it tastes too strong but otherwise, I can eat them all day.   Oxtail Fries- VERY generous with the oxtail meat and the fries. That's all you need to know!  ENTREE:  Rice Combo Platter- You get rice, an egg cooked to your preferred taste, sliced Taiwanese sausages, and you get the option of either pork chop or short rib. I HIGHLY recommend asking for both and paying extra! They're BOTH so good that no one should have to choose between one or the other. With a hungry stomach, you'll be able to finish the plate and feel quite full/happy. But if you're not that hungry, I would suggest asking for both meats and sharing it with someone else or taking the rest! It'll be more than enough.   Never had an issue with service. They know what they're doing!  Can't wait to go back soon!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice combo platter...with BOTH types of meat!

EXmAArExGngIh9Ce32reUw.text: Great restaurant with Pho and many cool small bites. I got the oxtail pho which I thought was really good. Broth flavor was good but not the best I have had but good enough. What I really liked about the pho was the Oxtail as you don't get that anywhere else.   Also got oyster which was fresh and good as expected.   Did also try the pork belly bun which were amazing. Something new that I hadn't tried before but was really good and flavorful. Also helped that it was part of the happy hour menu too.

O0_7f9UjZvE2T2OGi9925A.text: The service is amazing. A waitress helped us and made us feel super comfortable. She was super sweet and it was also her birthday.   We ordered the lobster pho-- it was okay. It's one that you want to cross off your bucket list. However, it is expensive.

AWUHDQlfz8ER7_zKH3Enjw.text: The food here is epic. This was hands down the best meal I had while I was in Vegas! It's definitely going to be a must-do whenever I come back.  The lobster pho was phenomenal and totally worth the price. The pork belly buns were perfect and the summer rolls were delicious but pretty standard. But my absolute favorite for the price and taste was the oxtail fried rice - sooo good!  Love the atmosphere and vibe of this place! A great place to have drinks and dinner with friends!

grSiWfapms5X3e0euRb7zA.text: We ate here one night for dinner and were lucky enough to make it for happy hour.  I think we ordered almost everything on the happy hour menu!  The food is very flavorful and I definitely overate but well worth it. I had the Mandarin Orange Crush for a cocktail and it was delicious.  A tad on the sweet side but I still enjoyed it.  The Oxtail Fried Rice was excellent and I was craving it the next day.  I look forward to returning here.

h3LJ4dlhjhiyX96Bxw4npg.text: Got dragged by the girlfriend and friends to District One and dont know what to expect. I kept hearing the bone marrow pho popping up in the conversation along the way. We got seated pretty quick once we arrived. Tried to order the bone marrow pho and coconut mojito and they ran out. EDC weekend and folks just killed the entire batch. Still i respect a restaurant that only serve what they can handle. We got the oxtail pho and double down instead. The pho is very clean and lighter than i expected even with all the ingredients. Overall the meal is very good. The service was attentive and they told us there will be more bone marrow pho on Tuesday! If you have time and a car in Vegas definitely visit this place off the strip.

1VpwLkAkJ2sQAektTjlnjg.text: This place has always been good to me.  Nice and clean, seating is ample and comfortable, staff has always been very attentive. Tvs are in view from pretty much any table, booth, or seat at the bar.   Almost without fail, I'll order a fresh coconut to drink with my meal, because yes. Once you're done, ask them to cut it in half to get to all the glorious meat! Make sure you get the grilled whole squid! The seasoning on it is perfect and the shichimi (I think?) mayo matches so well. Anything with oxtail is a hit for me here, including oxtail loco moco and oxtail fries. Bone marrow soup is delicious, with some gigantic bones. Ask for extra broth if you end up running out.   Love hanging out here with friends, and will continue coming back for sure.

I can't even say which one was my all time favorite bc they all were AMAZING in their own right! Please go. You will not be disappointed. Oh and the bartender looks like Jidenna; he's cool too.

tpq8fOW0iTuxhkeet-7XsA.text: Yum Yum! Love the food!  Papaya salad = refreshing  Pho = authentic  Fish hard shell tacos ( appetizers) = could have been better for the price. There were barely any fish.  Bone soup = super ! Love the bone marrow :)

pV2terwSBedW7JQY4iIwFw.text: I'm so sad that I didn't get to try this place sooner but I have to say this is by far the best restaurant I have been to in Vegas. I had ordered the oxtail pho and OMG I barely didn't have to put anything extra in it. The broth taste so smooth and the portion was pretty decent side. My husband ordered the steak and eggs and it was very delicious. He couldn't finish his food because it was a lot for him. We also got the chicken wings as an appetizer, that was good too. On a spicy side but good. Kind of a little disappointed that I didn't get to try any of their dessert because I was so full but next time when I come back, I will!!

4d8s--GOZdlaQUuwLeKxug.text: First time here came from Denver ! Super Delicious !! Finally a place that have snails and it was delicious !!! Ox tail soup was BOMB!!

9VLLtOrmWLLp09Q6lXydAQ.text: Asian Fusion in Vegas?!! Now I can get my fix when I am on vacay, YES!   Food:  During my visit here, my friend and I shared the oxtail fries, half a dozen house special oysters and we both got our own order of the Pho tai rib eye. Call us piggies, we have NO SHAME!   Oxtail Fries: COMFORT FOOD ALERT The oxtail fries definitely hit the spot, it kind of reminded me of Chinese beef stew but they substituted the cubed potatoes for french fries. YOU MUST FINISH IT WHEN DINING IN. Since we got a little carried away with ordering, we had to to-go most of it and let's just say it did not look pretty. The sauce became clumpy when it cooled, so i just ate the oxtail and threw away the rest.   House special oyster:  The oysters were super yummy and fresh. I do not remember the actual name and description the waitress gave us but GET THIS! All I remember about this dish is it had a tangy sauce and fish eggs on top. Hopefully this helps :/ !  Pho tai rib eye:  I love PHO and this place knows how to make it right. The soup tasted really good and tasted of little to no MSG. The noodles  were also cooked perfectly. My only complaint about this dish was that the texture of the beef slices were inconsistent. Some were extremely tender, while others were really tough so I was so pretty sad about that.   Service: Our waitress was really attentive and helpful. It was our first time here and she went through the menu/ specials with us and also came by to refill our waters a couple times.     Final Verdict: I will definitely be back for the oysters/ oxtail fries and not to mention their pork belly buns! Let's see if this place tops the LA version at Dip's Grill.. we will have to just wait and see !

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai rib eye
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special oysters

jZtCB0qNk5Md48iRfcbw_A.text: Came here on a Friday around 2pm and our party of 3 was seated promptly. I ordered the matcha tea which was very floral and refreshing on such a hot day. For food I ordered the double down with short rib. Didn't have the strength to sweat through a bowl of pho, though my friends got some and said it was good. The double down was tasty and a good amount of food. I hate overcooked meat, which I feel like I always get with rice or noodle dishes, but these short ribs were juicy and flavorful. And love me a fried egg on top! Overall a good meal and a cool space.

1hgTWEflJaLqm-bX3hcAig.text: Interesting concept and a hidden gem in Las Vegas Chinatown.  Food: We weren't particularly too hungry this day so we ordered the Garlic Serrano Wings and Steak and Eggs. I've been to a restaurant in the past where they served a dish similar to the steak and eggs so I was pretty excited about this dish. Although all around it was good, it wasn't noteworthy. The beef was a little bit on the tough side, but the flavor made up for that. As for the rice that came alongside it, it definitely lacked some flavor. The Garlic Serrano wings were also subpar. These little wings didnt much meat clinging to the bones and the flavor was lacking as well. The flavors sounded really good on paper, but to be honest I probably won't order this again. I really wanted to try their famous Lobster Pho, but that will have to be ordered during my next visit.   Environment/ambiance: The restaurant itself is placed in the middle of what looks like an old school Asian plaza. The decor is new and different, almost screaming that it's modern next to its neighbors. On a sunny day you can't miss it---it shines in the sun. Indoors it looks like it used to be a Boiling Crab. They do a good job of representing their seafood theme. It's cozy, a little musty, and the only thing missing is nearby seawater. There's booths along the walls and a few tables for large groups in the middle.   Service: We came early during the lunch hour so we were seated right away. We were also attended to right away by our server, but he didn't do much talking. It would've been helpful if he explained the menu more (although I already had in mind what I wanted to order so no explanation needed).  Tips: This is definitely a place to eat, drink, watch a game, and hang out with friends. It got pretty busy as it got later during the lunch rush. They have different menu items than other restaurants so give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs (it has tomato rice!)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Serrano Wings. Smaller than I expected
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink menu page 2

-Ke5OlnOYsJa7h4__BuR2w.text: This restaurant was recommended by a friend I'm glad we stopped by. When you walk in there's a nice hip and modern feel. Plenty of tvs to watch the games plus amazing appetizers and cocktails. I tried the lobster pho and it was amazing. The broth was sweet from the brine and it didn't need any hoisin or Siracha sauce. 1.5lb worth of lobster and it's all shelled for you to enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q-W0_Cj5XgQtbCU3qAZ7tQ.text: I took my family out for dinner and wanted to try something new. This was an important dinner so it had to be somewhere good. The glowing reviews brought us here. We had to wait for a few minutes for a table which was bearable thanks to all their flat screen TV's with the OKC game on.  Pork Belly Buns: Braised pork belly with sauce, peanuts and cilantro. This was tasty and fatty. 4/5  Soft Shell Crab: Big pieces of deep-fried soft shell crab with a dipping sauce. 4/5  Lobster Pho: Here's a dish you won't see at most Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas. The broth was quite tasty. They serve the whole lobster with head, claws and tail - the body and claws have been de-shelled so all you have to do is eat and enjoy. Market price for when I went was $32. 4.5/5  Mi Sate: A big bowl of egg noodles and beef in peanut sauce. It tastes like Filipino kare-kare but much watery and with noodles. 3.5/5  District One Rice Combo Platter: Short ribs (or you can get pork chop), kimchi, fried egg, Chinese sausage, and rice. A big plate that will not leave you hungry. The short ribs were flavorful and grilled. 4/5  The place seems like a good place to hang out at. The bar looks promising and I was watching the bartender interact with people at the bar during commercials - the people at the bar seemed pleased. They do serve alcohol, Vietnamese coffee, soda, etc. Our server, Tien was alright. He forgot to check on our drinks though. A different server gave us our check and asked if we wanted refills - too late! Tien came back to offer is refills - again, too late! Service could definitely be improved.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow Soup
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fried Rice
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Rolls

asS8S1Pb2BL36KxcJbittQ.text: On a trip out to Las Vegas, my buddies and I wanted to get off the strip one night and get dinner. We randomly selected District One based on other positive Yelp reviews while searching "Asian Fusion restaurants" and decided to give it a try. Turned out to be an excellent decision! It was outstanding! Great service and delicious food. We ordered a ton of food and alcohol, and all of it was delicious, but the Big Bone Soup, Coconut Pork Belly, and the Double Down stand out in my mind. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed!

e1yMfy4GzzkvnhisX2knFg.text: This is restaurant is one of my favorite place to eat at in Las Vegas. Their pho is always on point. The bone marrow soup is a must if you have a hangover. Everything on the menu are good.

1nN2znD695Lew7yMU5LDUg.text: This place gets 5 stars especially due to our last visit. I've been coming here since it's opened, and pretty much just get the same thing-oxtail loco moco. The best thing ever. Now the pho is good, don't get me wrong.... but I just prefer pho so 1, more meat and slightly bigger portion there. I would have given this place a 4 star, but this last visit the entire restaraunts staff was so accommodating. We had originally thought we had a party of 8.... it grew to a party of 15. They were happy to move us. Service was quick. My water was always full. And the staff was very attentive. I think they have been working on this because my last few visits prior the staff didn't seem as attentive. Great job district one! Everything on the menu is delicious. I just wish I could get a bowl of kimchi. Lol

VSQpDRc2g5bZEgvwBGeU1A.text: Boyfriend and I were in Vegas for the week visiting from Canada! We heard about this place from Facebook and a bunch of friends did recommend us to check District out. My boyfriend and I have a food blog so our trip to Vegas was mainly for the food! We enjoyed the atmosphere, service and food very much. We ordered the lobster pho because we saw a couple of videos on Facebook about it... We knew we had to try it.  It was good and I understand why it was $50, but I wish there was a bit more pho noodle in it. Overall it was tasty and beautifully presented.  We also ordered the baos; both steamed and deep fried.. Delicious and beautifully presented as well!  We will definitely come back to District One the next time we're in Vegas!  Thank you for the wonderful experience! Great fusion dishes! We will definitely recommend it to our friends and blog followers.

DCCVL-oFCCfNMRUcF2ozFA.text: My friends and I were in town for a convention and being huge pho fans, we decided to make our way to District One. I've actually been here before didn't realize it until I walked the restaurant.  All and all, the outing to District One was a positive one. Staff was super friendly and attentive. We all had a lot of fun trying the different things. There were definitely foods we enjoyed, and then there were things that we were indifferent about.  Sashimi Tacos - I enjoyed them, but there's hardly any fish in them. Also hard to justify the price.  Oxtail Fries - AMAZING. That's it! If you are with a group, get this and share!  Lobster Pho - I am kind of on the fence about this one. Nothing wrong with it. The dish did taste good, but given the price, I felt a little underwhelmed by it. Don't get me wrong, I totally finished every last a bit of it, but my opinion... let's say it like this... If I had to choose the oxtail fries or lobster pho as an entree, I'd go with oxtail fries. I think this dish is a great experience, but I don't see myself getting the lobster pho again.  All and all. A very positive experience. Definitely would like to come back and try some of the other dishes. 4 out of 5 stars. Unique experience. Attentive staff. Mindblowing lobster pho would have propelled my rating to 5 stars. Oxtail fries is a must!

FkGfarbdZsdmHmG3F7fW-w.text: Probably one of the top 3 pho places in Las Vegas . Personally being my fave. And the oxtail fried is hands down the best fried rice ever.

xMkmuJAG4bbO_dTTEilK7Q.text: Came here for happy hour with my girls. Waited for almost an hour for our food. We thought they were busy, so we waited patiently, but when we saw the table next to ours came in way after us already received their food, we asked our waiter and ended up they never put our order into the system.   Instead of letting us cancelling the order, they just went ahead and put in the order and told us the food was already in the making.  So we had to take it to go.   They were trying to make it up for us by giving us one of the dishes for free, guess what, instead of the happy hour price, they charged us full price, because by the time they put in the order into the system( an hour later) it was already 7:06pm(happy hour 4-7) So we ended up paying more....   I'm glad it happened to me thought, because I'm a hospitality business owner, can't imagine if I recommend my guests to come here and experience the same shitty treatment.   Food was okay, and by okay, I mean average American Asian style, very greasy.

XYtBeHfC9bjimb-AbqJ_GA.text: I recently went to Las Vegas for a conference, and my girlfriend and I were craving pho before going out. So we took to Yelp and saw that this place was pretty well rated, and decided to give it a shot. After eating here, I'm sort of depressed. This was basically the best rare steak pho I've ever had, being on par with OB Noodle House in Ocean Beach, CA (which I think is the best). Pho is one of my favorite foods, and it really is a sad twist of fate that a bowl of pho this good is so far away from my hometown in Orange County.   For starters, the broth was absolutely delicious. There was a hint of anise that was just enough to recognize, but it was downplayed by the clove, which was the star in my book. The broth had a nice complexity to it, but at the same time, it was that simple, wholesome broth that you expect from a good bowl of pho.   The meat - wow. A good cut of ribeye that also happened to have a fair amount of marbling (I always get the meat on the side) for this type of food. It was perfect. The service was also very good, the staff were all nice. I definitely will be back here the next time I come to Vegas.

7WEC_hibnu1xPf2N6tYb4Q.text: I've never been there before, my roommate always picks up food from there. I got the shaken beef salad to go.. And not even halfway into eating it.. I found a LIVE BUG on my lettuce!!!!!! Obv they don't wash their lettuce and I am totally grossed out. The dressing is good but after seeing the bug.. I feel like there might be little chopped bugs in everything else.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The LIVE bug on my lettuce from the shaken beef salad I got to go.

06uiDiUptdTCZyL85Q7ivg.text: This review is for a Saturday night dinner service and not for their happy hour service.  I guess I am definitely in the minority here, but I thought the best thing about my visit was serendipitously meeting Eric and Lisa R and having them join us for dinner. Beyond that this place had mediocre food and terrible service. From the moment I walked through the door, it was nothing but waiting.  Waiting for a host/-ess or anyone to acknowledge us or tell us to put our name down, etc. After being seated and ordering, it was waiting for my ice tea which came after everyone else's drinks were served and only after prompting the waitress. Then waiting for everyone's entree. I ordered the bun bo hue and green papaya salad, which came out in that order.  The green papaya salad had large, steamed 20/25 shrimp, instead of the dehydrated small bay shrimp (which add additional saltiness to the dish). It was okay. The bun bo hue had a good, robust beef flavor and was not too spicy, but it was missing the pig hock and the pig's blood. When I asked if they forgot, the waitress replied they were out. Gee, you couldn't tell us that before we ordered?! You can't send someone across the street to 168 Market to  buy some? To add insult to injury, while waiting our waitress to refill my ice tea, I see a waiter carrying a pitcher of ice tea by, look at my empty glass, walk to his table to fill a glass of ice tea, and then walk away to set the pitcher down. Really dude?! I know we were not your table but I guess you would've died on the spot if you had filled, or even inquired about, another customer's ice tea.  At the end of the meal, after all the waiting, I could not leave this place fast enough.

dVWQAgJphGBerM4Z6ucvOQ.text: I've heard amazing things about District 1 since I have moved away. Everyone always raves about the amazing food and service here so I was very excited to come here.   I didn't get a chance to order and explore the menu when I came here for my first visit but I had ordered the oxtail pho and vietnamese coffee. I was very impressed with the flavor of the broth of the pho and the portion size! They are very generous with the meat here and the oxtail was very tender and fall off the bone goodness.   I know the bone soup and lobster pho is a huge hit here. I am looking forward to coming back here to try the rest of the menu.  TRUST ME when I say there aren't many good pho places to eat in Las Vegas. I lived there for 6 years and am very particular about my pho. If you are visiting from out of town this would be the place to try!

MGe8vAnhgyMsTgmBPjPgoQ.text: I went here for happy hour and the quality of the food is amazing! I ordered their fish tacos(yellow tail tuna in a wonton taco shell) and their belly buns(braised pork belly in a fresh Chinese bun) with a vodka tonic. The staff was really friendly. They were getting ready for their one year anniversary party. The bartender invited me come back to their celebration which was really nice of her. Looking forward to my next Las Vegas trip so that I can sample some of their main dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belly Buns.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Tacos.

3P1XnNc_S9IiKhKJGoUrPA.text: I've been here a few times before. In fact this time I brought my family who are visiting from out of town.  Tonight MUST be an off night.  Upon entering, the hostess never greeted me, or even smiled at me.  I had to approach her. When she sat us she didn't know the difference between a booster seat versus a high chair.  (Admittedly, I didn't know the difference when I had my first job)   The waitress was definitely trying her best, but she made too many mistakes to just overlook. We ordered the steak on the side. She even confirmed with us that we wanted it separate from the bowl of Pho. It was in the soup.  We asked for an extra spoon 3 times before getting it. The coconut water we asked for took asking twice for it and nearly 10 minutes.   Then, the runner bringing the food out just held the food right in my sister-in-law's face rather than placing it on the table. On top of all that the rice was under cooked.  The beef carpaccio was less than lackluster.   I MIGHT be back.

PdXFUVpIyd8TDX6v2Jjmyw.text: I obviously don't "get this place" while I appreciate the decor the food leaves a ton to be desired.  Honestly I don't care if I am eating at a bus stop out of a paper hat if the food is good I will eat there every day.  This is literally the reason I hate trying new places.  When I arrived for a late lunch around 2pm the place was pretty busy. I later put two and two together and figured the only people drinking a bottle of Veuve on a Monday afternoon would be the owner and his friends.    I ordered the rib eye pho, I may not be an expert but I have had pho at more than 20 places in Las Vegas and LA including staples like Pho Kim Long.  The pho at District One tasted like they took beef jerky from Wal-Mart and soaked it in hot water then threw in some "Fresh vegetables" also from Wal-Mart with maybe a dash of MSG but certainly not enough to add any flavor.  It was the worst Pho I have ever had. Period. I am writing this review absolutely starving because I took two bites and realized that even the entire bottle of cheap Hoisen sauce couldn't improve the flavor.  When I told the server it wasn't good and I just wanted a box and the check (In hindsight I don't even know why i would bother taking it to go.) She didn't include any utensils or sauces so she must have imagined I would just throw it out. She did give a half hearted apology and offer something different however I was so disgusted with the food so far I couldn't picture anything else on the menu edible.  Here is the worst part of the entire experience, I believe the level of ineptitude transcends anything thing the "chef" could ruin in the back of the house. So I have already voiced my frustration with how awful the food is and I am actually offering to pay for it as opposed to just walking out and telling them where to stick it. I put my debit card in the $8 check and she promptly returns to inform me there is a $15 minimum on CC transactions. REALLY? Do I have cash? No... I don't have cash.  I will go ahead and lay out the reasons why this pisses me off so much.  1. $15 dollar minimum! Seriously?  This is illegal according to the Dodd-Frank Financial Reform Bill  (3) LIMITATION ON RESTRICTIONS ON SETTING TRANSACTION MINIMUMS OR MAXIMUMS.  (A) IN GENERAL.--A payment card network shall not, directly or through any agent, processor, or licensed member of the network, by contract, requirement, condition, penalty, or otherwise, inhibit the ability (i) of any person to set a minimum dollar value for the acceptance by that person of credit cards, to the extent that (I) such minimum dollar value does not differentiate between issuers or between payment card networks; and (II) such minimum dollar value does not exceed $10.00  2. This is stupid, what do you think their average transaction for lunch is? I'm going to go ahead and say their average check is just under $15. You are only going to piss people off with these kinds of restrictions. This may have flown 15 years ago but when the lady selling tamales out of her van started accepting credit cards on her iPhone it made this place look ridiculous. When McDonald's started allowing credit card payments, they found that the average purchase size increased from $4.50 to $7.00 (source: NPR). A broad study across multiple industries conducted by Dunn & Bradstreet found that purchase sizes were 12% to 18% more when paid for with credit card.  3. I am obviously already having a bad experience, why not just proactively handle the problem and when you drop off my check let me know "for next time"?  Would it really have been that hard for her do think autonomously without me needing to get more upset than I already was?  In conclusion: Don't go here. It isn't worth the hassle or frustration, maybe the owner should put down his noontime Champaign and get in the kitchen. I don't know what else can save this place from becoming yet another mediocre eatery in a city that deserves better.

IPPzq-2buNfRTUV8WurBqg.text: Great atmosphere. Came in for lunch with my girlfriends. Service was quick initially, all the servers help with all the tables, but since they're all running around its hard to get their attention later when you want to order more. Ordered the beef carpaccio, oxtail fries, spring rolls and rib eye abd oxtail pho. Broth was great. Everything came in good portions for 4 people. Total came to about $70. Definitely would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio

U4E7g0RtONRKxUMdSgyqwQ.text: Trendy place in Chinatown in Vegas.  Everything we ordered was yummy.  I had the ox tail pho...wow...that was good!

eIeYOS3sYJacXgdtX3gf6w.text: Seeing that this place received 4/5 stars and 900+ reviews, I believed that this restaurant would live up to the hype. There were so many good reviews on the bone marrow and oxtail pho as well as many other dishes from the menu. However my experience here fell short. I usually don't write reviews but I thought I would share my experience.  First thing was when we walked in, there was a host stand but no host. There was a sign for patrons to sign in on a sheet with a name and number of guests. Our presence wasn't acknowledge until about 25 minutes later. Not sure if this is a Vegas thing because they're so busy (we had a similar experience at another restaurant) or that's how they operate.  Once we sat down we looked over the menu. Most of the dishes had unique twists on Vietnamese cuisine. But long story kind of short - we wanted to try the oxtail fries, they were out of fries. My friend and I wanted to try the bone marrow pho, they were out of bone marrow.  Since trying the bone marrow was out of the question I went with a basic meatball pho. After 30 minutes the dishes started to arrive to the table. This is also when one of the servers informed me that they were out of meatballs for the meatball pho.  Are you F'n serious!?!? I mean bad enough you made me wait 30 minutes to tell me this but  those meatballs  for pho ( and French fries) are usually frozen.  You would think.. running a restaurant that serves PHO you would make sure you have some of them suckers in the freezer at least.  Manager probably wasn't on top of inventory this week.  At this point I was getting really HANGRY. Everyone at the table had gotten their food and now I had to look at the menu and decide what to get (being if they didn't run out of it already) I decided to go with the oxtail fried rice remembering that there were rave reviews on the dish on Yelp. The dish came out about 15 minutes later and let me tell you... I thought you couldn't really mess up fried rice but.. this was pretty horrible. I don't know if they forgot to season it bc they were in a hurry to push it out since they didn't have any ingredients left in their kitchen for any other dish on that menu or what but.. it just tasted like i was eating steamed white rice with onions. Because there was a lot of white onions in it with maybe a bit or a shred of oxtail meat here and there.  I ended up having to season the rice with whatever condiments they had at the table, which wasn't much. I should have known- any Vietnamese restaurant that doesn't have fish sauce or soy sauce on the table as a condiment should be a warning sign.    I don't know..maybe we went at the wrong time or maybe that's just how they roll.. but I would not recommend this place to anyone- not even hipster foodies. This place is just overrated and over priced.

Wwj8FZwLhDZhdifP3AEFSQ.text: This is the best Vietnam restaurant in town with their fusion style dishes and awesome Vietnamese coffee that's just addicting. I highly recommend the ox tail fried rice.   the only reason it's not a 5 star is because their hours have changed and now I can't frequent there at 1 am in the morning after a night out.   I hope they change their hours back!

VD3MVxL6fCzyO-3PJKLxUQ.text: They have the best oxtail loco moco, oyster and pork belly here. Wouldnt recommend the slow pork braised here.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

15X0Ja6R9pZ6GVdMnX_TXw.text: The place was neat and artsy. A good place to hang out with some friends if you want to bring a lot of friends. The food was alright, not really the best. The servers were very accommodating although parking was a bit of an issue. Just be there early if you want to enjoy the food.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8l8salar2ckM7AMwn_hL5Q.text: After wasting my lunch break, I'm appalled to see the type of ratings they've managed to receive. It really does give me an indication of what money can buy because quality certainly wasn't on their priority list when opening a restaurant. I felt like pho-bomination they served me today was cooked in a toilet bowl after the violent passing of spring rolls and slim jim.  Mind you, I have eaten a fair share of Pho places throughout the WORLD, including in Vietnam. I'd be ashamed to serve this lukewarm soaked garbage with chunks of shoe leather to my own enemies.   Will i go back? I would rather fallete a vagabond with a mild case of gonorrhea then put myself through another wasted meal at District One.

JisnozpvoFMUJP5czGkfrw.text: So bomb. Unique menu, weekly specials, amazing pho!

JFv_eQNc5KMdP9URUQAYvQ.text: Came for dinner with the fiance. I've been meaning to try this place as we can always use some variety into our late night eats rotation.  The waitress brought over a chalkboard menu with specials and explained each one. We decided to get the oxtail fried rice off this menu. I thought this was pretty yummy fried rice as the rice was flavored well and there was plenty of chunks of oxtail in the rice. It had one egg on top, but it definitely needed more as after mixing it up into the rice, it sort've disappeared so perhaps consider getting a extra egg if you're a egg slut like me.  We also got the fried cornish hen with tomato rice. I rarely ever see cornish hen on menus, which is unfortunate as it's a more juicy,personal sized chicken. The fry on the bird was good, light crisp and it had a pleasant seasoning on it where I detected a hint of cinnamon that was lovely. If you love natural style fried chicken (no heavy kfc style breading) then this might be your jam. I was into this, it reminds me of Maxs Filipino style chicken that I grew up eating.   Our server was pretty good about checking in on us. I like that this place is clean, modern  and has a young atmosphere with upbeat dance music. It's refreshingly different from the minimal utilitarian nature of most Asian establishments. The food is good so the fun vibe is just icing. I will be back soon to try the pho!

8QcNNNI_0TMsORUaENCT_A.text: Superb! I am an asian food junkie and I had an amazing ox tail pho and I went back today for the Vietnamese Carpaccio.....  Get off the strip and head over District One!

HHXxdxOQVloLh9NSL75AbA.text: We accidentally came here during happy hour, we had the oysters which tasted good but was a bit too warm and needed to be more chilled, the fish tacos were very good, the oxtail fried rice ordered spicy is to die for (omfg), and the bone marrow soup was awesome too!!!  My diet cokes were filled up fast and we had great service!!

pg5ZrKWLXLhAffWUlEabBg.text: Im a very picky person when it comes to food, so I stick to what I know.   But it's a really good spot to eat after a night of partying...  You cant go wrong with the Oxtail pho, oxtail chili cheese fries, and the steak and eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs!

Q-rSJbPugb3-j2mPSj-quA.text: BEST VIETNAMESE/ASIAN FUSION FOOD IN TOWN!!   So GOOD I didn't even have the chance to take pictures of my food!! Seriously delicious & amazing service!!

syalvpDrfreFjEnerLfW2A.text: The service is outstanding. Indira was our waitress. The grilled squid was nice. Sauce is a punch of heat. Very spicy. One of the managers brought a couple different sauces to go with the squid. Steak salad was meh. Beef seemed a bit old. Gamey, weird after taste.  Ox tail pho was delicious. Although, as I was washing my hands ( they have sinks outside the restrooms just for hand washing) I saw one of their team members exit the restroom and not washing their hands. Then the same person handed us the plate with bamboo shoots, sliced jalapenos and "mint" leaves. Besides that, it was delicious. Ox tail was tasty.   We will definitely be back!

_JljvWU9zflv9QiIreZZ6g.text: Amazing food.  Great flavor.  Took my fiancee here for a new restaurant and to try something different,  he loved it. The lobster fried rice is to die for!

H-ysawztO9oZl57JXMFXBA.text: This place is highly overrated and overpriced for what they serve. The menu is minimal. Food blah.  I went there once a couple years back and now I know why I never returned. Many better choices in that area....

8WZfmUwKehRfhk-AWZWazQ.text: We were able to get a last minute reservation for a large party.  You must enter your credit card and will be charge for no show.  My husband scarfed down the $50 pho with lobster.  The favorites for the night was the calamari, pho, ox tail fried rice and garlic noodles.  Good: sea snails, grill octopus and pork belly buns.  Bad:  papaya salad - looks good but not to my taste.  The service was good and 18% was automatically added to larger party.  Great dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qC1zNyrAei327cNIh_46fw.text: Lobster Pho:  Perhaps my expectations are too high but lobster pho should have some lobster flavor not just broth with light pho herbs. Additionally, the lobster did not taste fresh. It seemed like it was dead a while ago. Not sure, if they have a live tank or where they sourced it, but expected it to be a live lobster for $49; especially since frozen lobster is less pricey. Overall it was okay. I would not order it again if I come back. I was told the Big Bone soup was good, so maybe that next time (if I do come back)  Ox tail fried rice:  I liked the flavor in this but it seemed like beef fried rice. Was expecting actual oxtails but they cut it up, which is cool when you're eating fried rice. I think if they put in actual ox tail, it would have tasted more like ox tail.   Garlic noodles:  This was okay. I was told they served it with lobster. If I had known, I would have ordered this with lobster.

XpvBWDGKn81D_00hWCPNiQ.text: My Mom and I came here 1 for late night Happy Hour appetizers and some yummy food .  Corey was our server and we had the joy of also having help from Brian when we were getting out left overs he was super friendly and awesome! Which helped bring the rating to a steady 5 ..   Lets be real the food alone is really delicious as long as you order the right choice for you . This is Vietnamese fusion which means they have a lot of the flavor but more Americanized vibe when it comes to how it's run and the food is a fused sooo I was able to eat and get good service plus feel like the quality of the food and dishes Just Had more upscale vibe ... but it also still kept to its roots and was Vietnamese to me ..   I guess they are famous for two things which get talked about in other reviews but we didn't try those so I will just breakdown the stuff I got ..  Shrimp pho-11.99 I think which many feel is a lot for pho but compared to a lot of our pho places I've been to this price isn't bad for the size and for the fact that I have a server with a smile lol  Oysters - I got 6 they were decent   Wings on happy hour - they were dry but I think my server felt I didn't want any sauceso that is why I didn't get ones like in the picture but they were tasty flavor   Shaken beef salad - so so good like melt in your mouth meat and good dressing   I can't wait to come back and try more stuff especially dessert but over all this is a nice spot to get booze and food   We got the Gin drink to try that I can't remember it's name but it was tasty too

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pho

s65kEOvGoq1ww9cATIWF-A.text: Great oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice.  If you like oxtail this is the best place to have an Asian flare dish with oxtail. Good selection of draft beer which includes changing ipa selections.

ucOFPsSNfcSISZS3ZnnwDw.text: I love this place! Everything is so yummy! They have oxtail pho, oxtail fries, they have lobster, huge bone marrow soup, garlic noodles, whole fried fish, braised ribs, beef carpaccio and so manyyyy other totally amazing food! The place is very hip and has lots of tvs around so you can watch sports while sitting at the bar or even at the table. I haven't been here for a while so I placed a take out order after work one day. My food was ready in 15 min. When I got there I wanted to add some garlic noodles with oxtail. Well, no problem, they put my order in and it literally was ready in 5 min. The staff is super nice, helpful and attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic noodles with TONS of oxtail! So soft!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the juicy soft pieces

YuIu_ENePxzRjY6g6OKloQ.text: District One has done what few have successfully achieved in bringing us a more gourmet Vietnamese dining experience. Although pho is ubiquitous as a quick, affordable, and tasty meal for any time of the day, here one can find pairings not only with finer cuts off sliced beef, but also with terrific Maine lobster. Many pho broths rely on MSG to improve flavor, but the District One broth is goodness in a bowl. No thirstiness afterwards. Only a deeply flavor broth achieved by a very long stew. Don't miss this place!

jIIyl8h-SiYnUkWY6sM5zA.text: Named after the area in Saigon, District one is a bar/restaurant putting a tiny spin on popular Vietnamese cuisine. For example, their oxtail fried rice. Who would have thought, substituting oxtail for your traditional beef, chicken, or Chinese sausage would be so amazing. The oxtail just gives it that added richness and flavor that you're accustomed to with oxtail. My only knock was the dish was a bit greasy and salty, otherwise very tasty. Although, I didn't try their Pho it seems like it's very popular here with large slabs of beef bones swimming in the bowls. The night we visited there were a quite a bit of families with their kids. Unusual for a bar like atmosphere, but maybe a lot of it had to do with the holidays, and table settings to accommodate large parties.

0b6oetWyS-b-4WRoSh-ZaQ.text: I've never been here and agreed to give it a try after all these years since we had family in town. We came in late with a party of ten, half being kids and the rest adults. This place has outdone themselves with exceptional service since they tended to our table as often as any table should. It's difficult to have good dining experiences with big parties, since servers can possibly get overwhelmed. A few of us were there more for the company and weren't hungry, including me, but everything I tried that night was flavorful. Calamari is my son's favorite and the calamari here is a bit on the spicy side, but still so good. The pork belly was wow, phenomenal. The oxtail pho is something I MUST order, not just try, on my next visit.   I love the setup of this restaurant...spacious, cool, and did I mention they have a bar? Yes. Something about this place gives a good ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QZ71W2Oa_qqsgsaAK5DVPQ.text: I remember the days when I used to get excited about going out for Kobe Pho. It sounded so extravagant. And the local place that served Kobe pho wasn't even using Kobe but people were still getting excited over it.  Move over pseudo-Kobe, Now, I have a new love, LOBSTER PHO.   Ok I know it sounds excessive, but I came here to Vegas to have an entire lobster in my pho. No regrets. Was it delicious? Yes. Was it expensive? The market price was around $49 for a 1.5 lb lobster so it was worth it.   First of all, I pictured myself breaking apart a lobster in a bowl of pho. So I brought handi wipes picturing the worst case hand messiness scenario. This was not the case. The lobster was already extracted and placed on the shell of the lobster. Every last bit of meat was extracted, I was pleased to find whole claws while digging through my pho. The broth needed no add ons, and was pretty solid. I drank the whole thing and even that the bowl was HUGE this was a lot of broth consumption.   While the Lobster Pho is a major attraction and so instagrammable and photogenic, there are a lot of sleeper hits on the menu that might not get the attention they deserve, including:  -The oysters in house special style. We got blue point oysters since they ran out of the other oysters and with ponzu, tobiko and topped with a serrano pepper they were outstanding. I'm not sure how I can go back to oysters with just cocktail sauce and lemon.  -The crispy egg rolls with pork and taro were a great appetizer selection. Crispy overload. The pork was tender and the taro was a surprise ingredient.  I wasn't too impressed by the green papaya salad. Given the choices, I would have gone with the Shaken Beef Salad.   I am intrigued by the Big Bone Soup and Pho Oxtail they have here. If I ever plan another trip to Vegas, I'll be hitting up this spot again.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs (shaky beef)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho

ixJ662kO30YMYNgj_E_oYQ.text: Pros: delicious food, large dining area, happy hour, ox tail fried rice!! Cons: the fried rice was $16, the parking lot is horrible, and sometimes the service is a bit lacking

g0UU26umGKyGGQWrRlIrnQ.text: 1st time and it had GREAT ambiance and food to boot. Will be going back when we hit Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xedFm48NMyOx_w4N3rkHJQ.text: Come for the drinks and atmosphere, but not for the (majority of the) food  Great craft cocktails and love the beer tap selections  Got the following:   Oxtail fried rice: 5 stars, would definitely grab a drink and some oxtail fried rice and call it a night  Belly baos: 2 stars, nothing special  Papaya salad: 1 Star, totally lacking in flavor  Squid: 1 Star is not fresh and the inside was like mush  Wont be back to eat, but would return to drink!

51EdqsgnQmW8rCnNbZXdaw.text: Casual, contemporary Vietnamese fusion spot in Vegas Chinatown. My sister brought me here to try the lobster pho, which was so impressive to look at, delicious, but a bit small and pricey (market prices). Servers were cool/friendly but took us a long time to get our check. There is a full bar here and Hennessy on tap (!), great decor/feel, kid-friendly

yzV4VmpW-vusjPjnPPrTNA.text: This was a great venue, very modern, clean and spacious. There was plenty of table seating and booth seating for any size group. Lots of very helpful and good looking staff to help serve. Everything was done quickly and efficiently. They got us seated and answered all questions about the menu pretty quickly.  We tried the spicy noodles, pork belly bun, and steak rolls. All were good dishes, nothing that blew our minds out, but flavors were well developed. The spicy noodles could have used more meat and more spice. It definitely was a good take on a very traditional vietnamese dish. The fried pork belly buns was a cool take on the traditional bun. I mean... "anything fried makes it better' right?! I liked that extra crunch to contrast the tender pork belly. Finally the steak roll was subpar for me. I had one and it was plenty to see that it was just a filler, not so much a homerun dish.  Will definitely be back next time to try more dishes. There is plenty of parking, and the bathroom was very clean and modern. All around great experience. Happy eating!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. front of venue
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried pork buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

46OrXjw3AZq7e9I6jOGAVw.text: Incredible fast administration. Great sustenance. Oxtail fries and pork tummy buns were delectable. This inside is constantly pressed. I'd park in the court close-by to spare time finding a parking space.

Gfw4nCjDwLk5rb1rm9XFmw.text: Get the bone marrow soup. One of my favorite soups of all time. Can not resist the succulent buttery taste of bone marrow. To get get full effect; pour some soup down the bone marrow opening, mix and try to dislodge remaining pieces of bone marrow from the inner wall, grab a straw, then start sucking out the flavor.

xEptaFrJgXPA3xGZPtgO0g.text: Was super good.  Just tried the spring rolls and pork belly.  Friendly and fun environment.  Enjoyed sitting at the bar.

TJxsKCmr1x7_1yfP0ErwQA.text: Man, I can't stop thinking of this place. I am Vietnamese and I want to say this is one of the best pho I had in my life- Sorry mom! Please don't disown me!  I'm not sure it was a long night of drinking and that I was super hungry. But everything we ordered were so damn perfect.   Surf'n'Turf Pho: 1/2 lobster with Ribeyes steaks slices. $35. Not only the toppings tasted fresh and perfectly cooked/prepared, the broth was very tasty. It was full of flavor and very aromatic. It was so good that I did not need to add any sauce in my soup because it was perfect " just the way you are". I'm drooling while writing this review.  We ordered the grilled squid and ox tail Fries (not in picture) as well. They were good but I was too full after finishing my pho. Yeah the appetizers came after the pho. But it's all good. I'm glad I saved my tummy for the delicious pho. Yummmm! I drank all the soup, technically cleaned my bowl ! no shame!   Oh and they have Hennessy on Tap! Right? How awesome is that? I don't see this too often. So yes... while in Vegas, Why Not!   I will make it as an tradition to visit this place every time I visit Vegas now. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-M5JPpW6ktZj24BMsz-2eQ.text: Haven't been back here in over a year. Service is great but taste of food seems to have gone down. Pho was brought out lukewarm, and oxtail fried rice has lost its magic. Not sure if the kitchen staff has changed but I was rather sad & disappointed. We look forward to coming here every time we visit Vegas. Unfortunately, that isn't the case anymore.

wSPYeAN03MXI7cvqLM3Q5w.text: I recently came here with my boo and his family after our original plan had failed. We've been wanting to try this place for awhile so it actually worked out perfectly. We came on a Friday around 6 pm with 6 people and were able to easily get a table. Throughout our entire meal the servers were super helpful and friendly.  To start the meal we took advantage of their happy hour specials and went with some house oysters, belly buns, and crispy egg rolls. We also had to add in some drinks of course too so we shared the asahi pitcher of beer and a sake flight. Hands down my favorite part of the entire meal was the house oysters. They were super fresh and came topped with a ponzu sauce and jalapeno. I honestly could have eaten just a dozen of these by myself. As for the belly buns and egg rolls they were just alright to me. I felt they could have been a bit more flavorful, but overall still good. Next for entrees I went with the garlic noodles and fish tacos. The noodles were good, but a little bit bland. I added some hot sauce to give it a little extra kick. The fish tacos though, amazing! They're a bit on the smaller side, but the perfect size with a side of noodles.  I'm so glad we came here and I can't wait to get back and go ham on some house oysters!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic noodles

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy egg rolls

GKeVLYFmB8QmIMfZAr8nUg.text: District One isn't a traditional Vietnamese  restaurant but definitely a modern fusion focused on Vietnamese food. The flavors here are very refined and almost everything I've had here would at least be described as delicious.   Service is thorough and attentive here. I've never had an issue throughout my half a dozen or so visits.  They have an impressive list of beers and whiskeys as well as other spirits, for an Asian restaurant.   Some of my favorite items to grab here are the short rib rice, the pho and any of their happy hour specials.  I only knock off one star because the prices definitely are on the higher side here. The basic pho isn't different enough to justify a higher cost. Still one of the best places to go for Asian food late night.

1tQbfaFGmqSIrNritWXXpw.text: Such a great neighborhood place to visit. We were greeted promptly by the hostess who asked our preference of booth or table. Staff was very friendly. The food was amazing. Get the lobster pho! Everything is very shareable so we ordered the Serrano chicken wings, two orders of bao buns (I won't share those... Way too yummy), spicy edamame and whole squid. The flavors and textures were on point. For the amount of food we ate, the price was very fair. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho...  So amazing.

8KtwamLzhWF3UOV_Wgc_HA.text: I have gone here at least four separate times. Different hours of the day, different days, with a +1, a group of 8, and most recently by myself for lunch break. Jason is an absolute delight and always very friendly. There are a few of the waitresses I've met and thus far they've all been very nice as well. I have only ever had a long wait for food ONCE and that was in my party of 8 (my college graduation night a few weeks ago) for about 5 different appetizers. Ordered a second round and that came within five minutes! Crazy fast, can't complain! Glen is a great chef! Matcha green tea drink is sooo good and my aunty really loves the coconut drink. I always order the Veggie Pho for my meal and it always comes quickly and DELICIOUS! Five stars.

U_QtQqYcvSRL9VhZlFBqvg.text: Hype is real. In a plaza in Chinatown. Service is friendly and portions are decent.   Got the Lobster Pho to share with 7 girls ($50). Nice to have a bite each to try. Very flavorful and lobster was cooked perfectly.  The beef carpaccio is really good. Has a little smokey flavor to it.  The egg rolls and spring rolls are ok. Nothing special.  Now for the bone marrow pho. It's massive and a ton of work. Ask for gloves to dig out all that marrow and make sure you order a side of noodles because it doesn't come with it. DELICIOUS!

y5WFhrOP2FkCvO-GP7iC5g.text: Jason,  Thank you for the AMAZING service! Food is impeccable! From Oxtail Fries to Big Bone Soup, & from the Pho Tai Rib Eye to DoubleDown Rice Combo.....simply delish!    Need breaks from the LV Strip and buffets, District One is a "MUST Do" & a can't miss!!!!!  We'll try Big Bone through TSA next time =\

iMusizY_btdJ1ncYc60Aog.text: I am so disappointed with this restaurant, the food is average, the service is OK, but they have already added 18% of the tip in the bill in advance. When the checkout, the tip of the tip is still empty for me to fill out! So I gave a 20% tip for 2 times! This behavior is too hateful!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6qsbAvnzBqf1s1EN1h5gFg.text: This was our first stop when we got to Vegas, I've heard so much about their ox tail pho and their lobster pho. My whole family basically ordered the ox tail, because we have so much seafood dinner plans for SOCAL. So we had ordered a little way too much for our first meal.  Their papaya salad was so bland, I did not enjoy it at all. The looks on yelp was too deceiving.  The chicken wings were ok, not bad but not the best. Their ox tail fries were so salty. And the fries were so soggy.  Their oxtail pho, was also very salty. And their ox tail was huge. I ended up eating only one.   I Won't say this place is perfect for Asian people. I think their taste cater to American style taste so much more.

Fke-I1kuTjYfHFIAIJX7jA.text: What can I share that hasn't been shared already? I brought my family here for happy hour.  My less than one year old daughter loves their ox-tail big bone soup broth with rice.  My mom likes their veggie pho but always says she wishes that it had more asian veggies in it. We all liked the pork belly buns and fried chicken wings that you'll find on the happy hour menu. I had the pho tai. It was just what I needed.  Service was awesome.  We ordered a few drinks, a sake bomb and a donkey...one of an asian variety seeing as though it came with some lychee in it. Yum!!! I love FRESH lychee!! We spent about $100 for dinner, for the 3 of us. We tried so many things and made a night of it, really. Goodness, I cannot tell you how wonderful the service was.  The probably 8 or so different servers that came to check on us were so fantastic. We never had to search for them. They anticipated some of our needs. They watched to see if my lil one needed anything, aside from a change of clothes because she wanted to swim in the big bone soup broth because it was so good. LOL. This was definitely a unique dining experience, drinking a donkey, slurping out bone marrow, and waving our hands around because the wings were so hot. It was a fun time. And again, service was impeccable! The happy hour menu is a great deal. I hope more people will come in for happy hour. I'm sure you won't leave UNhappy!  items we ordered drink: sake bomb drink: Vietnamese donkey (I think was the name of it) pork belly buns spicy fried chicken veggie pho ox tail big bone soup w rice  pho tai 1/2 dozen oysters egg rolls

If you do go, the only thing I would go for (if my appetite is up for it) is the big bone soup.  other than that, it's decent.

oeu4U0O1rzJosNMWguWjLA.text: Friends recommended district one .. first! this is not a traditional  vietnamese Restaurant or traditional pho restaurant . "Fusion " as people will say .. trendy spot!!! Ordered all their hype dishes ... oxtail fried rice was just ok ,soy base with what we assumed was oxtail. Pork belly buns (non fried) the belly taste kind of off ( refrigerator smell?).. fish taco was nothing too exciting could not taste the yellowtail plus the wonton skin taste like it was sitting for awhile after it was fried..ribeye pho was ok "the best part was the ribeye".. many people will get that "wow" over a lobster with pho . Yes wow it was .. "was" .. in all for a few drinks , small plates yes.. for traditional no!

ZGI0tD75QU4GPeQo89QAmw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! Everything is so delicious from the beef carpaccio to the oxtail fried rice to the amazing coconut ice cream!

Please note that you can order it with rice noodles, but since we were cutting down on carbs, the right thing to do was to go noodle-less!   Drinks are pretty legit and can't wait to go back. Glad that there's a bunch of Vietnamese spots in vegas where I don't have to break my wallet in

RRAVi4bQ5Ns-01KUC4MnCQ.text: We had a great dinner with our entire family.. It was a casual dinner with great food. They blended traditional Vietnamese cuisine and updated the menu to meet young foodies to come and eat... we will definitely be dining again.

IFvAGvHLL9Lkv9uIh5dDXA.text: Came here on 2 occasions: Dinner and Happy hour 4-7PM A) for dinner- def recommend for their regular menu. Great scene  Veggie pho- delicious for being all veggies House oysters- during dinner- Super pricey and not very tasty- btw the 3 of us we ordered 12 and there was a HAIR in one of the oysters which threw our appetite out of the way for the oysters so we didnt even eat them Shaken beef salad- delicious deep fried beef- very flavorful and DEF recommend  Notifications stout- Deep and chocolately Shrimp Bloody Mary- see attached pics- so much stuff inside but not very strong  LOBSTER PHO or lobster fried rice is supposedly the thing to try here: didnt try in- because it is 45$ per order for approximately a 1.5lb lobster  Happy hour: see attached pics- drinks and food (Friday Afternoon) DEF NOT RECOMMENDED FOR HAPPY HOUR- the food was terrible and not I understand why this place wasnt more busy for happy hour especially with such a nice venue and space. But after eating, my hubby and I both said this place probably had the worst happy hour ever. We actually left feeling unhappy.  - kronenboug blanc-witbeir: Great beer- Def recommended - Dogfish Head - Seaquencg Ale- Sour sour sour beer, not for all -Oysters 1.00 a piece- THEY LOOKED SUPER SUPER OLD and dried out. I returned my first order of 6, just to have them bring me a set of oysters (which looked like the ones i just sent back) that were old and dried out and stuck to the shell because they looked like they had been previously shucked and just sitting in the fridge- They also tasted old (not juicy, not salty with the brine from the inside of the shell)- Worst worst oysters I have ever ordered and I cant believe i didnt get sick after trying one  - Serrano fried chicken wings: regular deep fried wings- no flavor at all. When they say serrano fried chicken, I was expecting a sauce that would make the wings more flavorful. But the serrano chiles looked like they were fried in oil with garlic and then just pour with oil over the wings- DEF NOT RECOMMENDED- order came with 6 and my husband and I couldnt even finish the order- and we love chicken wings - deep fried and regular pork buns: DEF recommended and you can get one of each since the order comes with 2 buns  Overall: happy hour was super disappointing but the dinner menu is more promising 4 stars for dinner menu and 1 star for happy hour  Not sure if ill be back except for the veggie pho
