XgVxSeN0ElRtT045ySrSIQ.text: What a cute Vietnamese Asian fusion spot, with a full stock bar. I mean really, who wouldn't want their pho with a glass of Dom Perignon lol.  Service was superb, after seated our hostess let us know that our waiter would be around soon. After having some time to look over the menu, our waiter arrived and told us about the daily specials and asked if we had any questions about the menu. Very attentive and informative.   I wanted to try a bit of everything so I ordered: The Five spice hen over tomato rice and pickled, Vietnamese beef carpaccio, Oxtail Pho, Pork belly buns, and the Oxtail Fries. Five spice hen over tomato rice: first off, I'm a sucker for five spice. Then hen was juicy on the inside with a fried crispy other skin. Vietnamese beef carpaccio was different but full of flavor. It was a little heavy on the sauce for my taste on carpaccio but hey its fusion. Perk belly buns, were delicious and juicy. Full of flavor with a soft steamed bun. Oxtail pho, had to try this. Oxtail, in pho? crazy! but they nailed it. I will honestly say, cleanest pho in town. What I mean by clean is, you don't get that heavy feeling of salt ans msg. Just a really good broth with chunks of soft oxtail finger picking goodness. If you have room spring for the oxtail fries. Its topped with a fried egg and oxtail infused gravy. So good.

APUaVwTMYl8oMj0qg_P_xA.text: The squid was not edible and the oxtail fries were like prison slop. The beer and pho were great. Stick to that!

H_v91cwGI8Pf0tzJt3-97A.text: Had the steak and egg. Others had district one combo and pho tai nam. All was not very tasty. Overpriced for what you get. Service was ok. But the food was just so mediocre. Pho tasted sour and the steak and egg was nothing to write home about.

3Ah77XVohn71uzRZ52ZeyQ.text: THIS PLACE MAKES ME SO HAPPY.  When you walk into a trendy-looking bar, the last thing you expect is the amazing smell of pho wafting through the air. It's so brilliant.   I appreciate the decor, cleanliness, service, and of course, the food. Despite the ambience which would be appealing to a younger generation, my parents really enjoy coming here. I've held business meetings here as well.   Their menu is absolutely solid, and I've been having fun working my way through the list. It's not just fusion for the sake of being fusion -- there are traditional items working in the freshest ingredients. And they make of the best pho in town (and the Mekong River Noodle Soup is also great, harking to the California Tung Kee noodle house combination bowl... I know some of you know EXACTLY what I'm talking about....).  And their creme brulee and coconut ice cream is worth cramming into your full stomach.

wXhyXhQi0_RxVvrIgZ0SSQ.text: It's disappointing after hearing all the great reviews. Ordered pho rib eye and pho oxtail. Soup is underflavored. Oxtail is not tender enough. Crispy egg roll is good but overpriced. Lastly stay away from Shrub drink unless you want to drink vinegar.

ohedUD57oDezn5vuxBZMhA.text: Very tasty. Spicy Hue Noodle Soup was bomb!!! I saved the left over broth it was so good and took it home and made a second meal with the broth. I will be returning:)

GTwKbXyksxQRgvuLtMy33g.text: Terrific food, awesome waitor. What more can you ask for? go for the bone marrow soup and happy hour oysters.

A9p-apGCRPcD2A2HpJFkFQ.text: good ambiance... food "looks" good but average in taste   good hang out place though if you are not too picky about your food  I would skip lobster next time

PJSz76HQC_oIAtRHfzbdQw.text: There's always something new to try here at District One and it's all good! Special today was the sea snail and the oysters that had fish roe (caviar?) sprinkled over it. We really like the big bone soup and the oxtail pho. Also tried the oxtail fried rice and wasn't disappointed. The servers are young which normally means impatient and abrupt but not the ones here. They're all nice and polite. Would always come back here and and bring friends from out of town, too, to show off one of the great dining options in Vegas. Why only 4 stars? They did have a little slip once but they made it right.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute but really tasty oysters!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea snail soup

MgjkiEFaDcKGTt_4TNkbbQ.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I stop here. Every. Time. Sometimes twice a day!  For sure the carpaccio and it's a toss up for the main dish as everything is delicious.

R_WH7jervx7jQm2EEhuvwg.text: Great place, great food, awesome people! Abundant selection of libations, from craft beers  to high end Japanese whiskey. I'm a happy man :) Vy rocks!

ZBQWlpZ2VXU4i4KWsXJWbA.text: We had a great meal here!  The oxtail fried rice was delicious and not too heavy.   The atmosphere is cool with a sports bar gastro pub feel.   We will definitely come back and try more!

z21mgIG0TnK06C1LS9IOJg.text: A favorite when I'm in Vegas, District One never disappoints. Bottom line: show up with an appetite. The prices won't break the bank either.   Oysters with ponzu sauce topped with chives and roe? On point.  Garlic noodles topped with braised oxtails? Amazing.   Crab fried rice? Solid.  Pho? Good, but not the best.   Overall, get over there if you can. Great late night food.

F35p_dabQOm6ADNlIDwcXA.text: I have been hearing about this place and I made a reservation for my birthday. The atmosphere there is really cozy and really nice. The staff are friendly and always there when you need them. Their food was really good. I like the oxtail friend rice and the platter combo was good. There was one thing I didn't like was the Chinese sausages. It was bit hard, but other than that it was good. I would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice

uYKRWBJnP0BnlspdnEHrBQ.text: 5 star for food 4.5 star for atmosphere (only because it was kind of dark inside and it was hard to see menu) (maybe I should of went in the day time l, duh)  To be honest I've never heard of this place nor care to know about it when people actually talk about it but I wish I did. Seriously the stuff on the menu are pretty wild.  Example: oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice, oxtail pho, lobster pho (with the actual 2-3 lb of lobster, not the ones they chop up and mix it in the bowel).  My friends and I shared the oxtail fries and I thought it was okay (Note that I don't really eat fried food so if it's okay for me, it's probably bomb for some of you). My man and I shared the oxtail pho with extra oxtail and extra noodle and that was amazing. Omg. If it wasn't so expensive we would of ordered another one (I think about $17.99 plus tax).  This is good food and it's definitely on the pricier side but you get what you pay for.

ZAh-ye2t6aw1mK7mn71iKg.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. I like the decor, vibe and the service is friendly. Their menu looked very interesting which was what drew us in but i guess some of the food is seasonal or they change their menu often cuz some of what we saw on yelp was not available at this time . Some of the dishes were a hit or miss. First the good - Oxtail fried rice, crispy red snapper were excellent and a must order.  The bad - the papya salad tasted like it was marinated with soy sauce instead of fish sauce, the chicken wings w/ garlic was a lil bland, the grilled whole squid i guess was okay but needed a lil more flavor or more of a char from grilling but did look very appetizing.  The varieties of pho were cool and was enough to satisfy my hunger.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KVSDxn-89aOMqcx35-_Q7g.text: I am definitely a regular here. I get the oxtail fried rice and or the oxtail fries and they are always on point! little pricey but the quality Is worth it. I call it in and pick it up and they are quick as well.

7wgjaGgYQB8mB7NpzSM2Hw.text: Enough variety to satisfy our hANGRY and hungover party of ten. Everything we ordered was excellent: spring rolls had big shrimp, the egg rolls were served with greens to make wraps, my shaken steak was tender and the egg was cooked perfectly over tomato rice, oxtail in the pho was falling off the bone tender, lobster pho was good, bun bo hue beef had a slight spicy kick, the Mekong river soup was comfort food at its finest, and big bone bowl had tasty marrow in a fatty broth. And we drank our fill of electrolytes out of fresh coconuts! Thumbs up all around! Chicago approved

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How do we even begin to arrack this big bone soup?
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big bone bowl! My friend said it was big and bony, fatty deliciousness
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho!!

mb_8U-JHy_iQJo1ULfVz8w.text: A must try when you are in Vegas!!! Very cool fusion Vietnamese food and Wow, delicious! I'm a local so I know my food spots

OWau8WGJVm8gR6JUoykNyA.text: This restaurant is awesome. The food was great. The waiter even better,  his name was Cory fabulous. My brother, his friend and myself had the best Christmas dinner in years. Cory was patient, helpful, and prompt. We tipped 30 percent and Cory was worth it. I hope people in Las Vegas are taking care of the workers in Las Vegas because the tourist aren't. Vegas strong.

kjy6nrqOznVKT_HYzPGAKw.text: Yummy Lobster Pho! Well worth the drive. Opens at Noon for lunch stays open till 4am!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese Ice Coffee
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese Ice Coffee
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho

brZbefw5T6l8NiGPqQeeGg.text: First time here with the hubby. Yelped this place first before trying it..did not disappoint at all! Had the papaya salad medium spicy, chicken wings, oxtail fried rice and the reason I just had to try this place was for the big bone marrow soup...OMG....delicious!  The broth itself was awesome!!! Ended meal with home made coconut ice cream served with peanut sprinkles in a coconut shell.....wow!!! Great meal....will be back again when back in Vegas! Need to also mention that the staff was A1 attentive and great! THANKS! Our compliments to the chefs for a great meal.

flwczF7cbvwUPO0GB2HotA.text: Bringing my friends in for game night and my lady for date night. One stop dining experience. Ask for chef Khai!

4mialO4Y_c3lMjKTo3_CAQ.text: Tamarind wings, yum! I had the pho bo vien. My friend had the short rib combo. Everything was good.  Would return, nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

Thuj99zVGvDDua5rV5qxBA.text: My Girlfriend and I went to try it out because we knew the owner from his family's other restaurant. Everything was excellent from the second we walked in until we walked after finishing. Greeted right away by wait staff and owner then seated. Started with some Delicious Shrimp Papaya Salad as an appetizer, then for our meal 2 very generous size bowls of Pho with Ribeye that were also very good. Then as we finished the waitress asked if we would like some dessert and recommended the coconut icecream inside of a young coconut topped with roasted nuts, all I could say is WOW. District one also has a very nice bar and great happy hour. I had a great experience, we definitely will be back there again.

k0ZwXNxRlAt55-RfwPB0XA.text: On a late night run to White Rabbit, we came across District One. It seemed really packed in a strip mall location but we figured we'd give it a shot. The restaurant is new and has a great, hip vibe. The decor is American and is geared towards a younger crowd. We were seated and ordered some drinks. Looking through the menu, we ordered Oxtail Fries, Shrimp Spring Rolls, and the Ribeye Pho. Pho Kim Long used to be my main spot but this new place blew them away. The portions are bigger and the food has intense flavor. You know how you go to a restaurant and wash your hands, then you have to touch the dirty doorknobs to get out? Well, this spot has the sinks OUTSIDE of the bathroom so that you can wash your hands and keep them clean. All around, this place has the perfect vibe, great, friendly staff, amazing food, and the right set up. They close at 3 am so you have plenty of time to get there after a night out. So, try it with your friends. You won't be disappointed. Promise.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Phö with Sriracha &amp; Hoisin.

jlV-W-RaE5rlmjqc2KTUyw.text: The food was awesome. The service was a little off, but not bad by any means. I would recommend this location to others.

V7SVn1ZD2BYl2MsXA48uLA.text: I like this spot, it's solid. The combo plate with short ribs and Chinese sausage are just enough food, pork buns are delicious and the chicken wings are really tasty. They also have a decent late night happy hour, the only issue I have with the place is the parking lot! It's in a plaza with a bunch of other asian business....which means lots of asian people. In cars. Trying to park.......so, just be careful in the parking lot, and if you make it to district one won't be let down!

dBCCgT-m2Q0rj--XSjwJGg.text: The food is unique and special. Very fresh, I've been coming here since day one , Quality !!

r158akROl5lWzGdGm9nwsg.text: Good happy hour. steamed pork buns, oysters, and chicken wings. my favorite were the wings. can't wait to go back again and try other items

ZLQ1TEh7LtYY_N6wU9sOcA.text: we had a fantastic anniversary dinner here on jan 1st and I will say the pho was delicious I had mine with flank steak and brisket My hubby had the oxtail fried rice with an egg ( his 1st sunny side egg) the service was fantastic and the people were soon happy to give us there option on what was good and the lady with the purple hair was sweet

Nn8gypx71kC-M2U4f2Z0jA.text: Very limited menu, and strickly Vietnamese, but their Pho was wonderful, and service was also great.  Also very nice atmosphere.  Nicer than most Chinatown restaurants.  A bit more modern and trendy, with TV's everywhere.

GE4JkikIOmzQo9jKxzl3PA.text: I had the Edamame Xo , it was yummy also tried the tamarind chicken wings and had pho. It was all very tasty and the staff was very friendly.

XdO036R28QeIHi8znzeGtQ.text: had the lobster pho...eh, it was ok. if i wasn't expensing it i don't think i would have paid $50 for a bowl of pho.

0wDHoPZnxPVuaakVXwvabQ.text: The food tasted as good as it looks on the menu. We had oxtail pho, fresh oyster, garlic noodles with crabs, pork belly buns, and oxtail loco moco special. Everything was on point. Must try the pho and pork belly buns! Service was excellent and the atmosphere was great. A nice break from Vegas strip food.

RrziDKqOAI87XRvOYhCIRg.text: We came here on a recent trip to Vegas thanks to good Yelp reviews. It was worth it, we couldn't have enough of the oxtail fried rice. Food was exceptional. Desserts were also tasty. Everything is great about this place. Hipster atmosphere, great food, great service and reasonable prices.

c6eI8_0kIuR-1vZkLLtc2A.text: I love District one! The bartender Adrian is amazing, she recommended the Stir Fried Pepper Lobster with Garlic Noodles and it was incredible! 3 pounds of heaven! Thank you Adrian! You made my birthday so special and those coconut mojitos blow my mind!

Z7Dky_kGa9kplw5hjMsRbA.text: Awesome food and atmosphere! Love the pork belly buns and spicy garlic chicken wings! Lobster pho next..!!

fmYJ7z60bpSxtqlq06Sylw.text: After 2 visits, District One didn't disappoint!  Food is creative and delicious.  A little bit of soul food, Asian fusion style.  Plus light, more fresh palette choices too.  And the beer and whiskey choices are tasty!

dje1iHsN_nQ_BOGupx1-8Q.text: As soon as we stepped in, we were greeted promptly and was sat immediately. Our server gave us some options since it was our first time here. Loved the lobster pho! My kids enjoyed the pork belly bun and hubby loved the steak and egg.

qT2AivRt0j8bHXTwX5D6JQ.text: All I have to say is this is a MUST eat!  One of the best foods I have had in Vegas.    We ordered so much and it was all great,   Ox tail fried rice, oysters, snail, carpaccio, fish sauce wings, lemon grass beef and more.   I was surprised how great the bar was.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3YbSEuat8g1sZHTRFdYkfA.text: Loved my visit here! I was afraid the food would be too Americanized for my taste but I was so wrong. We had the ox tail pho and it was delish!! Flavorful and very beefy. My brother ordered the "big bone" on the side and it too was amazing! So much flavor and the marrow was so so so good!! For the amount and quality of pho, I was surprised by how cheap the prices were. This is a must try when in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;big bone&#34;

ImlAIDqBRhazlvjdK46VFA.text: the lobster pho wasn't worth it at all. It was just a normal pho soup and a regular lobster in it. Even the lobster wasn't that good. It was salty, not much lobster flavor, and it's $56 a bowl. Do not recommend. Other food like the big bone soup. It is just a few big bones and lot of tenders. It gets gross after a few bites. The other phos are like the normal pho, tons of MSGs, taste good, make you want to drink a gallons of water afterwards.

EFwC6SnhQUXEMBcU0uZ0Ug.text: I love this place.  Chicken in a clay pot, the small plate items and of course the pho.  Located in a strip mall where the eating can be hit and miss, this is definitely a hit.  Excellent food and good service.

oUAay6rt76lY9a3RbxJGsw.text: Wholly cow! I've been here plenty of times but this is my first review. Had the special crab and noodles and it was the perfect blend of garlic and spicrs. The noodle was nice and chewy and not like over done noodles at some chinese restsurants. Come here anytime and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab

NwMuAqQTJ9FPpTugH_bLqw.text: The pho is wonderful. We've tried the Big Bone soup and the oxtail pho. They are both the best I've ever had! Their fish tacos are amazing if you are a sushi lover! Warning, they are addictive! From hand crafted, unusual cocktails, to great draft selections, this place doesn't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari is not only beautiful, but delicious!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos made with sashimi yellow tail are a must!

1GEfbx8PS0oeQTzSuhL28A.text: I like the atmosphere of the restaurant.  We went at a busy time but felt like we weren't attend to that much at all it took forever for us to put in our order and getting our check.  We had to chase down one of the bussers and even after that we still waited another 15 mins after already waiting 20 minutes for our check.  We order the big bone and lobster pho which are amazing.  Also we order the garlic Serrano chicken it was pretty good and the papaya salad that was OK I just like the shrimp.  I thought it was a different type of papaya salad so I didn't enjoy too much.  It's a little on the sour side for me.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Both pho was amazing! !

IR-MqXKT2dDct1paudmpoA.text: the food is pretty good, the Bone marrow pho is a must try, the portion is HUGE! I would definitely share. the fried chicken wing it was ok, but the grilled calamari was pretty good.

nSpUWhhRjjCjvbH1JjHDsA.text: The food was incredible! My husband and I shared the black pepper lobster and it was quite an experience. We had not had a whole lobster before so we laughed and had a great time trying to crack the shell. The flavor was incredible! We loved the vibe of the restaurant too! They had a great cocktail list. I had a juniper spice and it was delicious and refreshing.

9uBUHMkl_WQv21rpKhk27Q.text: This place is really close to my job and the food is delicious, I love their veggie pho and their signature coconut cocktails. The service sometimes can be not so great when it's super busy which is understandable. But other than that this place is top notch in my book.

nHIoKT2cDwPYOd1ubJaxug.text: Busy place on a sunday. Place was pack. First time try sea snail and It was actually good with Thai flavor. Raw oyster so fresh, sauce is a bomb, you definietly try it .They also had ox bone soup with giant bone ever and it was delicious. Definitely will be back when I'm in town. Service was great and fast. we feel like home ( Sai Gon ) when we came to your restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bRb6EWyMHpkvirD-MYQbVA.text: I ordered their Double-Down item off the menu, specifically with the short ribs and Chinese sausage combo with my eggs scrambled, and I was soooooooooooooo satisfied with the dish.  10/10 delicious and good proportions!  Note: I'm a very petite, 5'3" Asian girl at 82 lbs so maybe that's why it seemed like a lot of food to me, but still, everything was yum.  I finished everything but the rice.  It really hit the spot for someone who had just hopped out of a 5hr car ride.  Atmosphere was going for a trendy, Asian hangout prime of Instagram photos despite being a bit dark.  My dad had their tea and said it was good.  Also, they brew/drain your Vietnamese coffee right in front of you the traditional way so they gained brownie points there too.  Staff was very friendly.  Just noticed that even though it was an Asian eatery, they had posted a white, blonde chick to greet everyone while the actual Asian staff was standing way in the back.  That didn't sit right with my parents since they came to this Vietnamese restaurant expecting to be greeted by fellow Vietnamese people.

k7flmvB9tIWqc0Xqo41svQ.text: Excellent service. Way beyond expectation. Happy hour specials was the favorite part. Ordered some pho, wings, oysters and the bomb ass porkbelly . Definitely returning for that famous lobster pho.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aYOGDuoG1_URkpstpR1W8Q.text: This place has easily won as my favorite restaurant in Vegas!! Ambiance is great, servers are great, and the food is AMAZING. I got the lobster pho, which had an entire lobster in it and the broth was unique but in a great way. It was $45 dollars, but totally worth it to try once.. though I'm not sure I would get it again, just because of the price. My boyfriend got the oxtail fried rice, which was very reasonably priced and also amazing. I will come back here every time I'm in Vegas, I need to try ALL of the other dishes on the menu and all the drinks look delish!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster pho

DnwwK0iytWUtQJcH5a44bQ.text: I was looking forward in trying District One because of the hype! However, it didnt live up to my expectations.   We were there on a weekday night, and they were not that busy. We were seated right away but it took a while for our party to order because it was our first time. We ended up ordering pork belly sliders as appetizer, ox tail pho, beef pho, spicy noodle and like a bbq combo with rice. The broth of our soup was average. It did not have a depth of flavor. The bbq was good, but it was not something special.

oIsvuGiZyRtnDGKTuSBySQ.text: I have got to come back again. I really love how everything seems on the menu. Since I couldn't decide, I tried the District One Rice Combo with Pork Chops. So delicious. Very tasty.  Obviously, this joint isn't your standard Vietnamese Pho joint. It's wide open, the servers speak English, and it doesn't that scuzzy feel that we all love about Pho joints. Service was very good, and it even has this sports bar area with lots of TVs tuned into your favorite sporting event or sports show. I'm not sure how I feel about watching College Football over Pho, but I'm willing to give it a try!  There are way too many good looking items to not come back again, so I will!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Today&#39;s choice: Oxtail Fried Rice. $13.99
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. District One Rice Combo Platter with pork chop .

Y5xQirZyGr_3iWLGRUsTfw.text: So great do discover this gem!  The oxtail fried rice was super flavorful and moist and the yellow tail "collar" was really tasty as well. Really enjoyed the vibe too. Having a great bar and very nice selection of beers was icing on the cake.

lrIgngjEq4TYiiZDrXwSjA.text: District One is our dining location after our basketball tournament in las vegas. Plenty of space for the entire team to sit and dine on some delicious mixture of vietnamese, Hawaiian, and seafood dished.  They were extra helpful in procuring me a bag of ice for my head at the gym. Now thats servive.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood noodle soup
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggrolls

a2Hye7Ww1CNgyOw1C0jdwQ.text: Second time here, amazing like the first time! I've been dying to come back for the grilled squid and beef carpaccio. Besides those two, I also wanted to try the sea snails. Last time I ate snails was when I was a lot younger and these were huge compared to the kind I used to eat lol, they were great.  For entrees, my table got the fish tacos, coconut pork belly, and oxtail fried rice. All were amazing! Oxtail fried rice is definitely good for sharing. We were all stuffed and had to take some to go, but still made room for dessert of course haha. Pandan creme brulee and coconut ice cream were just as amazing. Jason was our awesome server, thank you Jason!  They also have one of my favorite beers, Kronenbourg Blanc 1664! My fiance (quickly) enjoyed his Matcha cocktail, as did I with the Tropical Blue   Long story short, everything was amazing. We will all be back for sure, and I most definitely recommend this place!

Gmm6oq_AJpxXyJIgIBh0cg.text: The highlight of my Vegas trip.  The lobster Pho is worth every pennies. We also ordered the chicken with Chinese sausages, it's taste so yummy!  On top of all the yummy food, their service is also 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9SSWP7U_OwtSiLGNRKR-dw.text: My family checked this place out, the ambience was pretty good it has a modern, hip look to it. This used to be craving Cajun. I tried the braised pork and it was tender tasted really good. I didnt get the chance to order their specials . I will definitely come back and try out some of the other dishes on the menu.

cpR-7K5xPJorZ6aZZEjtOQ.text: Oh, wow.  Where do I start?  One of my friends brought me here.  It's in the old Ragin' Cajun, but it's nothing like that.  The menu is only what I can call "Asian Eclectic."  I had the whole Maine lobster pho, my friend had the razor clams in lemongrass and Thai basil.  The staff are great and the service is fantastic.  To quote a TV show I like, "You Gotta Eat Here."

IZCgFBKT22M8_IWxsTPzrw.text: They ran out of sake bomb which sucked because my friend and I really wanted one. The pho was okay, but when I return I'm not going to be ordering pho. The meat didn't cook and even when we asked for a hotter soup it still wasn't hot enough. This place is not bad though I liked it & the atmosphere is nice. I'll definitely be coming back to try the other food they have.

vB-J0z88vAT1ZvrPxE1PdQ.text: I'm a little disappointed in this place considering all the hype I've heard about from others. The experience that I had wasn't as close to what others may have gone through. I came here with my boyfriend a little before noon way before the crowd even started to come in. We had ordered the pho nam, braised pork belly and egg rolls. The pho nam wasn't as great as expected. When coming to a vietnamese restaurant, you'd think the flavor would have some tradition in there and not a bland flavor. It seemed as though the broth was altered and not as delicious as you'd expect. As I waited for my dish to arrive, the braised pork, we started to notice that the other customers who came way after we ordered started to get their dish before mine. We asked the waiter/waitress where my order was as it had already been ten minutes after the pho came out. They said there was a back order in the kitchen. How the heck is there a back order when no one was there yet when we ordered?! great cover up...but not really because we told them there was no one here when we ordered and they just looked stumped......... by the time it finally did arrive which was 20 minutes later.... the food looked like it had been sitting under the warmer the whole time and so did the taste of it.   For a place that received so many great reviews, highly disappointed. Rather go to their parent company Pho So 1 which actually makes great food and has the food come out in time instead of making up excuses. The Only Reason they are getting two stars is because they decided to give us 15% off our meal. So for that they get an extra star.

fm1aupmR1RMO7PPRvnLDrg.text: I've tried this place twice now hoping to find something I really like and tbh I don't find it to be anything special food wise. I tried several items on their menu from the pho to the steak and eggs and the spring rolls but none of them really stood out.   In summary, experience is as cool and modern as they say, but the food is quite bland. The Vietnamese coffee is a must try, and it's not a good place for a date being that the music can get super loud and intense.

5FY5YLiuKQSCRYrcOTcQCw.text: I love this place.  Ate there the other day.  The services was beyond my expectation.  Everyone who works there was so pleasant.  The food was delicious, probably the best PHO I had.  You have to try their garlic fries!  Enough said and try it yourself!

8a-ftBRjFp3tO5oc8Dtb3Q.text: Good food with large portions, full bar with a lot of draft selections. There are plenty of TVs around the place so you should be able to see one or more from where ever you sit. The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive. This place has a very laid back, cool vibe. I will definitely be coming back.

zywnSNzF8h2K0TRm3eC_jg.text: Garlic wings with jalapeno, snails in lemon grass and leek broth, razor clams in oyster sauce, oxtail fried rice, spicy grilled whole squid (my favorite) , green papaya salad with shrimp, rib eye pho & kalbi plate... Wow couldn't go wrong with any of these!!!  Looking forward to trying other items off the menu like the Grilled whole Kauai Shrimp & Live Whole Lobster Pho which was voted for best use of whole lobster in Las Vegas Weekly.  Best thing is Chef Khai out does himself each week with new special creative & delicious dishes!!  Do yourself a favor and check it out...& bring your crew!!

8fsSaRohGqDkf8X4PCumYw.text: We went to this place two days, back to back because our first visit was so great. The second time around was a complete 180. They lost our reservation. They didn't bring us enough menus. The first time we came in, the server brought over the specials board and suggested different items since we had never been there before. This time, we had to ask about the specials and he didn't even bring the board, he mentioned the few that he could remember. We saw all the other servers bringing the specials board to the tables. Our share plates WERE NOT WASHED! They had food remnants from the last guests. When they brought "new" ones, they were also dirty! We asked for everything to be brought out as it was ready. We placed our order at 6:40, by 7:25 we had not received the appetizers or my sister's meal. We had to ask the manager and then the server about the missing items. When the pork buns finally came out, one at a time, and they were hard and inedible. By that time, everyone had completed their meal and my sister was not interested in her meal. I asked the manager to remove the buns, she apologize and said she would, but the check was presented with the buns. At that point, the server, Johnny L, was scared, and stopped coming to the table. He wasn't attentive anyways. We had other servers stop by the table more times than he did. The "manager", Vy, was too busy talking it up with her friends, to assist us. We were so impressed the first time and brought our family back to try it. Had high hopes in becoming regulars at this place. That's definite no.

IZJSdkVsirj9HhqyrlVy8Q.text: We've been to this place a few times in the past, always heartily satisfied with our favorite Vietnamese dishes, but were still amazed with how they've expanded their menu  that's probably drawing this large late, Sunday night crowd. Lobster with black pepper beckons!  As always service was great.

Qrh2NJ0jQ8yYPN3bdlvHXg.text: If u like mediorce fusion, then u would like this place. Had the fish tacos (too fishy and was sent back)  grilled whole squid, bone soup, oxtail fried rice... all of it was - meh. The novelty of the big knuckle bones were cool but lackluster in actual taste and gratification. With all the great options in chinatown, money may be better spent elsewhere with a whole lot more options to choose from. Service was attentive and swift, deserves the extra star.

uHOVp59tnRUDaMsvPo0fXw.text: Attention to detail, all of the elements are on target.  Friendly, accommodating service, interesting atmosphere and then there is the food.  Subtle things that some places miss, spice or seasoning a little bit lazy or haphazard, not here.  Straightforward, cared for and obviously well thought out, not over the top, but delicious, clean, and flavorful.  Like the academic so intelligent she can make physics relatable, the kitchen here has spent the time necessary to master the wonderful art of your grandmother's cooking and then present it in an approachable way.   They then change the game by slightly altering the traditional and making it modern, making it seem like it was or should have been that way all along.  No one dish stands out, they all do...this is a place where I try something new every time...because I can.

FYdWbMYzZz92r_vvmU_iog.text: Shaken beef salad was amazing. Shrimp skewers were delicious. The atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable. I am already planning our return meal.

uDGY_m11-XcUKKPzGibbfA.text: This is the best Vietnamese restaurant ever!!! I love this place. Christina and Kai are awesome. I had a fish tacos. It's soooooo good!!! You have to order this one. I had a fresh oysters. It's really refreshing. One of the best oyster I've ever had. They have a full bar now. They have so many drink to choose from. They are open till 4am now on weekend. This place is gonna be pack soon!!! Come check it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters!!!!!!!!! Yum
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They use the ice ball for the whiskey. The first place beside my house that use this cool ice ball!!!!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yKXJ48VViUb-0pYM1bHfRw.text: We love this place! Happy hour twice a day and it's open late night! We always sit at the bar because we love the bartenders! Marcus and Tomas are awesome! Ask Tomas for his famous lemongrass Siracha shot (sounds weird but they're soooo good). Oysters are $1 each during happy hour too.. Great beer selection and amazing service!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ke_pKEjPXBeIH4QG4MnP1Q.text: Awesome pho ox tail soup, beef carpaccio, oysters were bomb with ponzu sauce and fucking caviar! Ohh and coconut ice cream bomb.

6E1jjcC5iJw63PBEVDvnSQ.text: I just had the worst experience here. It started with a cluster of a mess waiting for a table since there was no hostess or waitlist. We saw another aggravated couple seat themselves at the bar so we did the same. We ordered egg rolls, chicken pho, and rice combo. Simple enough right? No lobster this, no oxtail that.   Am I suppose to ask for my side garnishes when ordering pho? Accept my apology if it's suppose to be ordered a la carte. My pho came out first and sat there as I tried to flag down any staff member. Fifteen minutes later, my boyfriend's rice combo comes out so we asked the food runner for the garnishes for my pho and fish sauce for his rice. By the time that came out, she brought along the eggrolls. I'm not even upset about the sequence of the food but damn, 2 of 4 of my eggrolls were soggy because it was placed under all the wet greens. I asked for our check since we seem to be adding on to the masses that were stressing out the staff. I am in the restaurant industry so I totally understand, but for such a beautiful business opportunity... staff up, get more organized, and be consistent. Smile even if you're stressed from all the big tops, I lived in Vegas prior and learned to treat the tourists kindly. This might be their first and only time out here so make their experience amazing.   I couldn't eat anymore because I was just so upset with the experience. I was really hoping for a good last lunch before my flight. This just ruined it for me.

o-VOQzf3iRketcxcyv76XQ.text: Went there last night; very convenient hours for those of us working late on the strip.  Setting was very clean, modern, and a good hang out spot. Overall, the pho was the highlight and very delicious but other items weren't as flavorful and just missed the mark a little bit.  Here's a break down:  Fish taco: just ok, kind of fishy but it was a good concept.  Needed a flavorful relish or something else.  Spring rolls: crunchy and the garnish (perilla leaf, lettuce, mint) was amazingly fresh and abundant. (I hate it when they only give you one perilla leaf or mint).  But the radish and carrot chips could've been marinated longer.  Manila clams: good and full of clammy goodness but again, not super flavorful.  Lacked salt and maybe more herbs.  Cornish game hens: well cooked, sauce was good, tomato rice could've had more flavorful.  Ribeye and flank pho: we got this just to see how their standard pho was and it was deeeelicious.  Beefy broth with a hint of sweetness.  As with everything else the garnishes were super fresh.  Tender meat, and a lot of it.  It definitely makes me want to try more of their pho.  Service:  I don't care about service that much especially because service at a lot of Asian spots on spring mountain is almost non-existent but this place was just odd.  Our wait staff were all young and very nice, but you could tell they lacked experience.  They sort of seemed to want to talk to each other and hang out with their friends who were sitting at another table.  One time we wanted another beer and tried to make eye contact with one of them and he just looked at us and waved awkwardly and turned around and sat down so he can talk to his friends some more...was hilarious and very weird.   And then 3 of them cleared our table but none of them offered to get us our check.  It's like if I opened a restaurant and hired my little brother and let him hire all his friends.   But all in all I love that we have a new late night pho place!

rgX16S-GGdH_cULnnVzMfg.text: Excellent service. Delicious food.  Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice...!!!  It's so flavorful, a must have!!!  ^_^

RzrS7EZMTdFHxXnBKwUCKQ.text: The food quality was not very good. The flavors were neither authentic Vietnamese or well executed fusion. Confused as to what their objective is.  It definitely isn't tasty, fresh food. Wish Chada Thai would have been open :)

hpyiGDTSK-xJTBgfUpVFJA.text: Came here during MDW with my husband and family. One of our bestest friends is actually a regular here so we definitely trust his judgement.   We walked in late Saturday night and surprisingly it wasn't crowded at all. We opted for the bar and got started right away. Our bartender Janell was off the chain. She got us a round of shots right away followed by drinks. Cheers to Janell!!!   For food, my husband and I ordered the Oxtail Fried Rice, Oxtail Pho, and Lemongrass Beef. Everything was really good. The broth of the pho was very flavorful. The fried rice was sooooooo comforting and the lemongrass beef was perfect with the rice. Comfort food at its finest!   I also had a taste of the Beef Carpaccio and OMG!!! That beef carpaccio is FIIIIIIIRE!!!!!!! If you're not scared of red meat, you HAVE TO order this dish. Its fucking AMAZING! Excuse my language but damnnnn!!! Its so good!   So yeah, great local spot with great food and drinks. We're definitely coming back and trying more of their menu.

UsFb1omeExMWRkYc_i7Rmg.text: Always Great food and Service. Loses 1 Star for price. My wife and I have been many times. Really innovative with food.

tbfHYoaZURbZcmg1edZqmQ.text: I am so impressed with their surf and turf pho.  Our friendly and knowledgeable waiter suggested this as a walker friendly version rather than the pho a vie.   My boyfriend and I couldn't get over the flavor of the broth and the lobster and steak in the pho.   Spring rolls were inhaled.  Baby bok choy was sauteed with a hint of carnelization.   Thank you Distruct One.  I am in love.

ZgqQWzzZEgKODl7cNsvV3w.text: Now's about that time when I give this restaurant five stars. After having dined here for a third time, District One has become one of my favorite spots in town. Here's a rundown of what was ordered during my last visit.  Crispy Bird's Nest Noodle: Reminds me of Hong Kong-style noodles. The nest-shaped bowl of noodles held a delicious mix of veggies, meat and seafood. Stir it up and you get a tasty, crispy plate of deliciousness.  Spicy Pork String Beans: Get this. It's amazing. I don't know how else to describe this.   Baby Bok Choi: Light, wok fried dish with a subtle garlic flavor. If you like baby bok choi, this could be your jam.  Fried Whole Fish: DELICIOUS. The sweet and sour glaze gives off a strong aroma but the flavors aren't heavy to the palate. The fish we ordered was a red snapper. There are smaller and larger sizes; the small can feed about 2 to 3 people. Watch out for those fish bones.  Double Down: Meat lovers, rejoice in this short rib + Chinese sausage + fried egg on rice. So, so good!

4GgOA3Ks4kKJ-iMc1nwRzg.text: Pho is terrible. They tried being different but sometimes theres a reason why people dont do it. Order pho here and compare it to other pho places here in vegas. You will quickly figure out theres alot of things missing from district ones pho. Like veggies cilantro combination meats. Portion of bowls ect. NOTHING SPECIAL. It's more of a bar than a restaurant.

SDCa2eGItQ1oOIGyjTDZ_Q.text: Not authentic Vietnamese food, not recommend for Vietnamese.  Maybe good enough to some other groups. Tried their beef broth and papaya salad, none was good. Papaya salad tasted bland, if didnt want to say awful. Paid $30 something and we did not even touch the food much. Really upset!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I77RLhJ2ev0nTBghcUKxeQ.text: BIG BONE SOUP! That's all you need to remember about this place. Yeah, they have other Asian fusion/Vietnamese style dishes, but the BBS is the star of the show. The soup itself is $18. If you want noodles it's an extra  $5 served in a separate bowl and $3 for rice. It took me a good 45 minutes to eat the soup. The bones have so much meat, tendons, and marrow that it takes time to work through each piece of bone. I was filled with joy as I was cutting off pieces of meat and mixing it up with the noodles. The marrow is flavorful and there is a lot of it. You could easily order 2 bowls of noodles and split the big bone.   We did order some appetizers. Belly buns and  spring rolls. Buns were tasty. I would order again. The spring rolls were good but I have had better.   It was kind of weird how they brought out our food. There was a large party of about 20 people and about a half full restaurant, so our orders were coming out sporadically. They brought my wife's dish out and the noodles for my soup before the appetizers. Then the belly buns came out, but no soup for me. Finally, the soup showed up and my wife was pretty much done with her dish. Then a few minutes later the spring rolls showed up. I took away a star for the kitchen service. The server, Blanca was nice and she apologized for the service. I understand. It was a little inconvenient but the BBS made up for it.   Drinks were good. The Hennessey Cafe Sua Da was excellent. Slow dripped Vietnamese coffee with Hennessey over ice for $15. Well worth it. Plus it gave me a nice pick me up after a long day in the sun.   I did appreciate Blanca and her kindness during our visit. She was excellent at her job and made us feel welcome.   Great place to visit if you're looking at getting away from the strip. With tip we paid just over $100. There are also some kareoke spots in the shopping center and near the Chubby Cattle if you are looking for Korean bbq. We took a Lyft frim the Orleans and it was a 5 minute drive. Give them a try and take on the Big bone soup. Happy eating!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath of the Big bone soup
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls, $7

6NDMkl8uizbxEs_Deg4M3Q.text: Second time here! Came in for a late lunch and it was decently packed. Had a party of three and ordered the following:  Ribeye Pho has a very flavorful broth with plenty slices of meat to complement the noodles. I personally did not try the whole dish but per coworker it was phenomenal.  I ordered the papaya salad. I wasn't a fan of it as the shrimp had an odd taste that almost seemed like it was over frozen. Would not recommend.   Also got the ribeye fries - at first glance it wasn't all that impressive but the taste was very savory.   Another appetizer we got was the Vietnamese carpaccio. Flavorful but had too much greasy underneath the meat for what I was expecting.  I previously came here and ordered the oxtail fried rice which is excellent. Portion size was decent, but price not so much.   Overall experience was decent and food is above average. But prices are a bit over. Would maybe consider coming back again.

LHfiw0PxToWvP-sNVU0p0g.text: This place is known for the lobster pho, however I actually ended up trying the oxtail pho. The broth was very rich and not too salty at all. Me and my group actually shared all of our plates and ordered multiple items on the menu. All dishes were 4/5. We were planning on going out to the club after so we spoke to the manager about possibly buying a whole bottle of which the manager made an exception for us. We even also had extra drinks on the house. Customer service definitely gets a 5/5. Would recommend anyone coming into Vegas to stop by here for great food and drinks prior to going out

R8Dl-iQUQIkvG3_T8Hjqvg.text: I went to District One to take my friend from out of town for a nice dinner on a Thursday. My friend had heard about their lobster pho from the food network, but when we got there, the prices scared us into sharing a dish of black pepper lobster which was served at "market price".  The location was located in a busy plaza that was difficult to find parking. The service was decent and the servers were friendly and attentive. Overall this would be a place I would take a date due to the cozy atmosphere.    Service: 4/5 (2 Glasses filled) I was thirsty, and after the second glass, the server gave up. However, servers were very friendly.  Food Quality: 3/5 The black pepper lobster was good, but seemingly just tasted like lobster with well made ramen.  It wasn't made for two people, and we shared, but the flavor was ordinary.  Value: 3/5  The value point was alright.  The atmosphere was dark and trendy. The price was a little on the high side, but if you want to try a place that's been on TV, then you should definitely try it.

hNIX5IXqJEmrIXtYxl9wVw.text: I was super excited that my crew decided to eat at District One yesterday, 'cuz this place has beeeeeen on my bookmark list of places to try once I moved to Henderson. So of course the big question here is, does the hype live up to what everyone says it is?! Well, let me start off by stating that I didn't get their most ordered item which is the Lobster Pho or Bone Marrow Pho or even the Ox Tail Pho (it's too HOT outside for Pho, right now) with that said I will be back to try those items when it gets cold outside...  My hubby, homegirl and I arrived on a Sunday morning at around 11:15ish and there was no wait- we were seated right away. Jennifer was our server, who provided the perfect amount of customer service! She provided great recommendations all of which we practically ordered:   1) Garlic Serrano Chicken Wings: 5 Stars. Great crunch and a spicy flavor kick. I loved the slices of serranos sprinkled atop the wings.   2) Ox Tail Fried Rice: 5 Stars. I can eat this all day! The rice is cooked perfectly, there are tons of pieces of beef ox Tail; add sriracha, and this dish is bomb! Great portion size, we shared this between 3 hungry people. *wink   3) Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio: I love me some raw meat, of course the best I've ever had was in France- but who's asking. Lol. This particular Carpaccio wasn't that great. I would give it a hard 3 Stars, that's it. Idk what it is but the sauces on the meat seemed to have cooked it a bit so it wasn't as raw as I prefer. I love me some truffle oil, but it gave a weird taste. Would I order this again? Probably not. It's not a True Carpaccio dish, in my opinion -also for the price it's not worth it.  All in all, District One offers delicious food in a cool-hipster ambiance environment. I would totally come back to try the Pho!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Ice Cream
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Carpaccio $13.99
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fried Rice $15.99

b0Q3TlRsjeKhdGEvy5Zisg.text: District One is one of my favorite Modernized Vietnamese-American restaurants in Vegas. I've been here probably three times already and their service and food are usually great.   The Oxtail Fried Rice is one of their popular items for sure, at least to me because I always find myself ordering it everytime I'm there. The portion is huge so I can never finish it and very well flavored. The fried sunny side up egg on top is magical when you take your fork or spoon and split it down the middle. Let it slowly ooze down covering the mostly the entire rice dish, wowwww!  My mouth is salivating just writing about it. Anyways, please if it's the only menu item you can afford there, get that Oxtail Fried Rice! The only down side is I wish there was more meat. Lol   Another highlight is their Vietnamese shredded chicken salad. It's very good. The dressing is not too sweet, but not too sour either. Reminds me of how my mom would make it at home. A lot of chicken, shredded cabbage, and topped with crushed peanuts alongside fried rice chips. You eat it by scooping some of the salad mix onto the chips and it's as easy as that.   Additionally, the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio was great as well. If you can eat rare beef seasoned with citrus soy, truffle oil and sesame oil then order this! You won't regret it!   One last recommendation was the Grilled Squid! Oh man! That was delicious! Perfectly grilled and flavored. Came out sliced in portions easy to eat with a spicy creamy sauce to dip it in. Frankly, I liked it by itself without the dipping sauce.   Other than those three, I've tried their Oysters, Snails, Yellow-Tail Fish Tacos, and Green Papaya Salad and they were all mediocre. Nothing very special or memorable. The oysters were okay, I've had better and the Snails as well. One thing about it was the lemongrass they cooked the snails in because it made sipping the broth delicious - very flavorful! The Thai salad was too spicy and sour for my taste. The tacos were alright and I didn't feel like it was worth $11 for three. Too many veggies and salad, not enough of the yellow-tail. So overall, I would definitely recommend those above and hope to come back and try their pho next time!

RKGN-isn1fih-Gc7JWW-9g.text: Oxtail fried rice was absolutely the star of the meal. Wow, really tasty. I will absolutely go back for that. Bao, Birdsnest...meh.  Wings were decent but a second place to Pok Pok at the Cosmo assuming you're looking for fish sauce type wings.  Service was friendly and the room itself is good. I will go back but D1 is just not near the top of my list for viet-casual cuisine.

5Soh-D6_lJJiBdgk1QxuwQ.text: Came here during noon time on a saturday. The place wasn't too busy and we were seated right away. We ordered the house special oysters, the spicy hue, and pho tai nam.   The oysters either come with horseradish or the house special sauce for $2 more, we opted for the house special. The ponzu sauce which is included in the house special gave a nice alternative to lemon juice by giving it some acidity. The spicy hue noodles was on the spicier side than what we are normally used to getting at other vietnamese restaurants. The heat was definitely tolerable and was very tasty. The pho tai nam was also very good. The broth felt clean with not much MSG, but was still flavorful. The meat in the pho was very tender as well.  Service was also good, it wasn't too busy so our waiter was able to fill our water multiple times without asking.

rHQiy8QsdxAIElaGtYwHGA.text: Lots of unique menu items and isn't your typical Vietnamese restaurant.  My friends and I decided to venture off of the strip for some good Asian food and decided to come here.  The oxtail pho caught my eye since that isn't something you see too often in Vietnamese restaurants, at least in Dallas.  The broth was delicious and there were large chunks of meat on the bones.  I liked how the broth wasn't oily and tasted very clean.  Service was quick and staff was attentive and friendly.  I'll be back here when I visit and am in the need for some pho.

lNtFpZzYph1ljz3BnQccMQ.text: First time here. Late afternoon on a Monday. Had the bone soup, chicken wings, oxtail fried rice, pork belly bun. The wings were really good- crispy and tasty and fresh! Pork belly bun came in two. Delicious and saucy! The soup bone was great, with several large bones and was what I expected. The broth was also flavorful. The oxtail fried rice with fried egg on top was something new for me and it taste good but is an item that could be skipped.   Ate too quickly and no photos sorry!

nhD-rzjZS0pyStAoBjJxBA.text: If you knew how much I think about pho.....you'd probably think I'm a ...Best pho I ever had !!!And past that yummy  bowl is the VietnaneseDonkey ...which I couldn't even take a pic of before taking it down  @DistrictOneLV #thebestpho #oxtailpho #comfort-food #vietnanesedonkey #midnightcravings

RXhp_6klOGkxAWmaEBCuyw.text: This is an easy go-to place if you have friends in town! It's a hip Viet fusion restaurant, and has a modern take on some authentic dishes. Some of the dishes are a little bland for my taste, but I understand that the "usual" fishier foods are diluted so that it's more appealing to a wider audience.  Here are some of the plates I've had: Spring rolls (3/5) It has pork, shrimp, and a fried wonton wrapper(?) in the middle to give it that extra crunch. If you've ever had Brodard, I felt like they were trying to meld that into this spring roll. It wasn't bad, but I personally don't care for pork and shrimp spring rolls very much so take that into account.  Viet Beef Carpaccio (4/5) It came out warm, which is not what I expected. However, the flavors were pretty rich - probably due to the truffle oil, and I would definitely order this again.   Serrano Wings (3.5/5) I really want to love these wings, they have a nice crunch and flavor. It's lacking in contrast or texture...I'm not sure what it needs but maybe an extra saucy marinade. They did give us a sweet fish sauce when we asked, and that made it taste even better! I think this could be a 5/5 if that option was already there.   Yellowtail tacos (4/5) These remind me of the mini tacos at Catch. It's a flaky, light shell with yellowtail and you squeeze some lime on top. It's not OMG AMAZING, but I would easily add this as an appetizer.  Sea Snails (2/5) I personally did not like these sea snails. They are larger than I'm accustomed to, so its pretty chewy. The lemon grass sauce that it comes in is extremely light so it doesn't coat the meaty parts well, so I'm not a fan.  Double Down (3.5/5) It comes with chinese sausage, a sunny side egg over white rice, and we chose pork chop instead of short rib. The dish itself doesn't really call for anything spectacular, so I would say it's okay. If I was having one of those homesick days, and wanted something simple, I would order this. OR you could just go some place else and order com tam/broken rice.  Bird's Nest (3/5) I'm underwhelmed by this dish. The egg noodles weren't as thick so when it's fried, you don't get the same hard crunch. That's just a preference I have, and again I'm a viet food snob so this isn't saying that the dish itself is bad...I just don't like the way it's done here. I will say that it doesn't taste as greasy as the less high end viet restaurants.  Lobster Pho (4/5) I haven't tried the other pho options they have here, and they have a lot! We chose the lobster pho because we've never had a lobster pho, plus its so instagram-able. I'm not sure what the broth base is, we didn't ask. But it didn't have the same aroma as the earthy beef broths my palette is used to. After adding the hoison sauce, siracha, and the other herbs, the broth was to our liking. There was surprisingly A LOT of lobster meat, I'm very pleased with that as we had to force ourselves to eat all the lobster so it didn't go to waste.  Ox Tail Fried Rice (5/5) Out of all the dishes I've had so far, I like this the most.I don't have the fancy vocab to describe the flavor, but its not bland haha. Definitely order this if it's your first time here.  It's a good restaurant overall, has a decent selection for happy hour, and also a viable option if you have a larger party - I've seen multiple birthday dinners of 12+ people.

7Bh6X31-criydxau5pNhMg.text: Came here based on the Insta photos of the whole lobster pho.  While the pho is pretty good, it's not really worth $49 for the bowl.  We also had the oxtail pho which is solid but a bit pricey at $16, where we can get a similar bowl for less than $10 In San Jose, CA.  Cocktails were good.  Overall for quality this is a strong bet, and if it were on the Strip then the prices would be fine, but it's a little high for Chinatown.

kdzoOQ1k69j0VFIxTwFdaA.text: We really had high hopes for this place. Husbands love a good beer and we wanted some Viet food.   Service - Friendly.  Reservations - Recommended.  Food - Blah. 1. Grilled Whole Squid - Favorite dish of the night.  Squid was really tender. Great portion.  2. Garlic Serrano Wings - Needed a dipping sauce.  Dry otherwise. 3. Goi Ga Chicken Salad - The cabbage was grated more fine on this version.  I prefer the regular goi ga where the cabbage is a little thicker.  A thicker cut cabbage is better for mixing the ingredients together,. 4. Steak and Eggs - Just terrible.  The meat was very gamey and the sauce had raw pieces of garlic which needed to be cooked more. Rice was dry. 5. Crispy Bird's Nest Noodle - Bland.  Lots of vegetables which was a plus.

MMFRCDWpelBNgoXsQFwN3Q.text: Pretty cool spot to eat. Environment is fun for friends & family meals. Service is nice.   Ordered: Spring Rolls - Yum! Fried Calamari - ok. Thick batter and spicy aoli, no lemon is given :( Garlic Noodles - Yum Oxtail Fried Rice - Super Yum! Just wish it came with more egg.  Coconut Pork Belly - Tasty, but there was nothing coconut about this. Just tasted like stewed pork belly. Pickled veggies were bland that came with.  Double Down w/kalbi - Yum! Can't go wrong with this meal.   I'm wondering if there's some secret menu because there wasn't Oxtail Loco Moco on the menu and neither was Viet Ice coffee. Seen in other people photos. We decided to ask about the coffee and they do serve it. We didn't see any "Specials" posted either.

hGgfR555aDGtS55KQdx5YQ.text: Best Ox Tail Pho!!! Cooked and seasoned to perfection. Rich broth so yummy. Satiates my craving every time. All their specialty dishes are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST OX tail Pho in the entire USA. Kitchen staff has it down pat...perfect consistency EVERY TIME; and the broth, mhmmmmmm! All their menu!

TMSyKcS2TWkpTjzbUX95pg.text: I've been coming here EVERYTIME Im in vegas since I first ate here about 3 years ago!!!  The parking lot is huge. I've never had a problem finding a spot. If I don't have a rental then I take a lyft or uber, and get dropped off. Nothing stops me from eating here.  The service is really good. The staff consistently checks up on your table to make sure everything is okay, if you need anything, or any refills on your drinks.   Things I've ordered: Oysters- love, love, love Serrano wings- crispy goodness Ox tail fries- DELICIOUS everytime, perfect flavor combo Belly buns- okay, I never ordered it again Beef carpaccio- truffle anything n it's AMAZING Lobster pho- okay, I did it for the gram (not worth price) Big bone soup- I LOVE bone marrow, I get this EVERYTIME Ox tail pho- okay, I like my Ox tail fall off the bone tender Ox tail fried rice- really good, full of flavor  I want to say that I've ordered everything that I would like to eat from the menu, and now it's hard to choose what I want everytime I go. I try to go with more people, so I can order more and SHARE family style. Sharing is caring!!!  Looks like vegas is calling my name...

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big bone soup is bigger than my head

H0ex79O1CbSamt1odHU16A.text: Always wanted to try it because people say it's good so we went to check to see if the hype was real. If Yelp allowed .5 star reviews this would be 3.5/5. All the things we ordered were off the menu specials minus The Big Bone Soup but this is what we ordered:  Lobster Fried Rice - Huge chunks of lobster with claws and shell as decorative display. Flavor was ok and not the best fried rice or lobster I had especially for the price but the the presentation was done well.  The Big Bone Soup - Shit looks like something a caveman would eat. Not the most flavorful and some may find this shit intimidating with this pre-historic looking ass dish. We kept the bones for the lil homies back home.   Loco Moco - Yah we ordered this, so fuckin what hahaha. It was okay and not the best loco moco we have had. We honestly wasn't expecting much.   Overall this place is really cool and the vibe is chill. The one issue I have is the smell of this place. I don't know if it's because of the cooking but the smell fuckin hits you like Ranch 99. We will probably come back and actually try the items that they are known for.

jA8Wevsfh6QXXWnS5V9rBg.text: This place is for the Gram. Much like the Ice Cream Museum, don't do it! We were lured in here by Insider's marketing video of their Lobster Pho. The video made it look so good that we had to try it when we came down to Vegas. Little did we know, their Market Price for a 1.5 pound lobster would be $55.  Okay, no fault of their own since we didn't do our due diligence and called ahead of time and ask for the price. They had other "Gram" worthy Phos from Oxtail Pho to Bone Marrow Pho.  I saw some other people order the Bone Marrow Pho and it seemed like they had the hardest time sharing a bowl of it and scraping the good stuff from it.   My family and I ended up ordering their other dishes from Pho to Bun Bo Hue to Rice Dishes.  None of them were worth the price and definitely not worth the time. I'm glad we didn't try the Lobster Pho or I would have walked out regretting that I paid for something so ridiculous.  Social media sure does cloud your judgement.

Zu40BwlrqPwc2WwtOdpusA.text: I have never seen this place slow at all !! Why?? Because it is that good!! So be prepared for long wait times.   Located somewhat centrally towards the west side of town, this place has a limited amount of parking.. only because there are a lot of other great establishments around the area.  Right away walking into this place... it's loud! This place is a bar/restaurant after all.. With many people eating and drinking and music playing.. this place is not your quiet spot to dine...   Booth style seating that can fit from 4 people to 8 comfortably.. and many tables in the center.   I came here for the Lobster Pho.. and this Lobster Pho was not something to mess with.. Market Price.. i paid around $60 for mine... i think it could've been a little cheaper given the size of the lobster. Nonetheless it was really great. Service was great and no complains about the atmosphere and vibe of the place.   Other than that, i can see myself coming back and trying other things on the menu!  Enjoy!

d7VIimyuHGm1TRwi282iVA.text: if there is one place i tell people to visit in vegas its district one. i am in LOVE. its legit the best pho place ive ever had. i legit come from NY to Vegas atleast ONCE a year and everytime i come i HAVE to come here no doubt. i did try the lobster pho once. honestly for me im not a fan not that its bad, but not worth the price. i am in LOVE with just the plain pho WITH the meatballs. the broth is out of this world and the meatballs are NOTHING like the ones in NY. theres so much flavor and i dont know what's in it but so good.   oxtail pho was good too i had that before so flavorful!   OXTAIL FRIES THOOO! [:   honestly its just so good.

a7Bbw68QVWQUy4aRBzH1cw.text: I'm pleasantly surprised by the pho here. I'm from L.A. with a considerably larger Asian community and food-fare and I wasn't expecting much when I came here.  After a night of heavy partying ("getting lit" or "turnt" as the cool kids like to say these days), I always find pho to be one of the best hangover cures/comfort foods to have the next morning. And this place definitely hits the spot. I ordered the pho tai nam, my standard go-to, and collectively shared an order of their "big bone soup" with the rest of my group. The pho tai nam did not disappoint at all. It was very delicious and satisfying. The big bone soup is also a surprise to me. Very tasty large beef bones cooked in their own broth, with delicious tendon hanging off the bone and bone marrow inside. I think they would go great with some of the other more carb-loaded dishes.  Our server was decent, but she seemed pretty busy and didn't check on us as often as we like. They also have a wicked bar selection of amazing Japanese whiskies; too bad I wasn't in the mood to have any alcohol at that point of visit. Maybe next time!  Would highly recommend this place to visit for your pho cravings in Vegas!  Pro-tip: Definitely order the big bone soup.

qi93LerEqG4grYlrxx38Mw.text: This place is a must visit while in Vegas if you enjoy asian dishes. Think your traditional southeast Asian dishes with a twist. My favorite would have to be the oxtail fries. The fries are covered in an oxtail gravy and an egg perfectly cooked sunny side up. Cut into the yoke and let it run down all over the gravy and fries! It is a unique dish that any fry lover won't be able to stop eating.   This place does offer a lobster pho bowl. The bowl is large and is sold at Market Price. That day it was a $35 bowl. The broth is pretty good. I'm not sure I would pay $35 again for a 2nd bowl. Hey, you're there for the first time, might as well right?  A definite must is the pandan creme brulee. Like most Asian desserts, it is just slightly sweet and not overpowering your sweet tooth. This hit the spot. Do not skip this.   This place was pretty busy even at 2pm on a Friday afternoon. I believe I waited about 15-20 minutes for a table for 3 people. Worth the mini wait!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pandan creme brûlée is divine!

yK9DDAFYFH6LRXMrso75Kg.text: I love their innovative dishes. Must try the big bone soup. I tried several dishes: papaya salad, oxtail french fries, big bone soup, grilled squid, and bun bo hue. I also had the Hennessy cafe su da.  Oxtail french fries look appealing but not a practical dish in my opinion, the fries were way too soggy and the oxtail marmalade just doesn't mix as it is much greasier at taste than when you have loaded fries (melted cheese and bacon). If the fries were very crispy, I'd enjoy the dish.  Papaya salad was decent but the big bone soup took the show for me. I enjoyed it as it had a lot of taste. The broth did need a lot of lime (but that is my own preference). What a presentation! Although they should consider machine sawing it to smaller piece so you can actually chew at it.   The bun bo hue was enjoyable. But the grilled squid wasn't too great for me. I enjoy Cafe Moda's squid better, it is not chewy and was too dry.  They did forget about my Hennessy cafe su da but I ended up reminding them and they comped it. Honestly I'd rather this place 3-3.5 stars but I'll give it 4 for the customer service.  Place has awesome decor and is definitely a place to try. But I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon. At the price and actual product served, I think this place is for a different kind of crowd. Don't get me wrong, it's not a bad place at all!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Salad and Oxtail Fries

wOISAdDktgU4wVWltY6xnQ.text: Visited this place a few days ago on my first trip to Vegas.  It was recommended by my server at Aria for having a whole lobster in their pho.  I'm Vietnamese so I'm kind of picky on pho... let's just say it was exquisite!! The noodles were on point and the broth omggggggg so amazing!!! I got the half lobster and half ribeye pho and I finished the whole thing... and I never finish my pho.  This was just perfect! My boyfriend tried the oxtail pho and that was amazing as well! The egg rolls too.... omg everything was done so well!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zEcgz7kqi_-u6GYLMASTjA.text: For a place that got tons of reviews and a for a Vietnamese restaurant, you would think that they would have excellent pho: a staple Vietnamese dish, especially the interesting sounding oxtail pho and and lobster pho. Unfortunately, the pho is very blan and overpriced. It was more so salty than anything, as if the salt was trying to compensate for the lack of flavor.   The oxtail in the pho was tough and difficult to eat: oxtail meat is supposed to fall of the bone!  The standout items here isn't  what you expect it to be. The garlic noodles was delicious. If you are a fan of garlic, you would LOVE as it packs a nice garlic punch. The oxtail fries was also good: the oxtail in the fries was a decent portion and was tender and marinated in a flavorful sauce.  The oxtail fried rice, was was also good, but a little on the greasy side and not really special: it did have some bits of oxtail but other than that, not overly special.  So really, other than the appetizers, the dishes here are average,at least for its price point. You can probably get real lobster separately or solid pho elsewhere in Vegas and save yourself a few bucks.

6RaJgc_KhMtnKnqP9FVDtw.text: Came here around 7p on a Saturday night.  Was busy but not overwhelming, we were seated quickly and given menus.  They have a decent sized drink menu when it comes to alcoholic beverages, but as I am not really a drinker I got water.  (This is because I don't drink Soda lol). Waiters and staff were great at making sure all of our drinks were full.   After looking at the menu,  they have a variety of items,  from different kinds of fried rice and pho, spring rolls, skewers, noodles etc.    We opted for a couple appetizers to start with,  Spring rolls and Belly Buns.   Both of these were good,  spring rolls definitely taste better with the peanut sauce. Came with 4 rolls. The belly buns were delicious and a great start to our meal.  Came as an order of 3.   As for my meal I got the Pho Bo Vien.  It came steaming hot and Delicious and Of course in an enormous bowl, with a plate on the side for toppings.  I always add lots of hoisin sauce and bean sprouts.  I left completely stuffed and satisfied.     We were able to split the bill easily and left with a great dinner experience.

l1tSwWkiFL8r6q6RZ5raJg.text: Standard good. I love the happy hour options and price -- highly encourage going during these times for a great deal. Beef carpaccio is usually good, but sometimes too saucy. Always order the oxtail pho and the fish tacos. I've never loved the oysters, so pass on that. This is a regular go-to for us when in Vegas, so I'll definitely be back.

KCeVjtvRLHWJvd72GcxI1Q.text: What a treat outside of the strip! The bachelor/ette party we're missing Asian cuisine so we searched for some Pho! Nice gem! Friendly staff and what a menu! We saw a lobster Pho come out to a table and said YES WE NEED ONE OF THOSE. All the phos tasted so good yum yum and the drinks came out fast!

HfWy-plu3Ry-5ZhjoFPrrA.text: My friend and I came here around 8pm on a Thursday night. It wasn't too busy so we were seated right away. I ordered the pho tam nam and my friend ordered the oxtail pho. We both had generous portions of meat and just the right amount of noodles. The broth was very flavorful that I hardly had to doctor it up. It came with all the traditional sides. Will definitely be back again.

PnujLlsE3tcDU7lIU-Lr5A.text: During one Vegas trip with friends, we decided to drop by in the morning when they opened. If you have a big party (like we did of 8 people), it's best to show up early to be able to get some of the bigger tables.   Everyone got a few different things so we decided to share a few different things. My friend and I shared the oxtail fries - kind of like poutine fries - really good.   I ended up ordering the pho because well I may have drank a little too much the night before and needed some hydration. It was pretty good - nothing to write home about, but nothing bad either.   I wanted to get the lobster pho, but that was a bit too rich for my blood.   Protip: get some things and share with friends

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MhRBh37wVL-VtTeuDBPEqg.text: Came to District One while visiting because a friend recommended the place. We ordered the oxtail fried rice (which was by far the best dish), fried chicken, papaya salad, five spiced cornish hen with garlic noodles, and pork buns.   Everything was delicious except for the fact that the papaya salad was a way too sour for our taste and the breast of the five spiced cornish hen was a bit dry. We brought this up to our waiter not to expect our money back, but just to give them a little constructive criticism. To our surprise, not only did they take off the papaya salad off our bill, they gave us two free desserts, creme brule and coconut ice cream, which were both amazing.   Great food and even better customer service. I will come back the next time I'm in town!

i1vGwd84-b2rQTJvjm5jmQ.text: Party of four, 3 pho, 1 clay pot.  Service 2 stars - good try but left us hanging at the end  Food 3 stars - it was so-so. We could have gotten the same quality with better service elsewhere  My biggest pet peeve was the wait time. It took 30 mins to be seated, 45 minutes after ordering to receive our food; we were done eating in 10-12 minutes. The restaurant was full when we got there and more than half empty when we were done. One of the worst services I've had in my life.

tpP3di0jjWi9XGrU5MxZJA.text: YAAAASSS!!!! I never thought it could be done, but District One has somehow managed to pull off what I call "Fancy pho."  That's right - delicious, flavorful, high quality spring rolls, pho, and other Vietnamese dishes in an upscale restaurant...wait for it...WITHOUT being obnoxious or super over-priced or TOO high end.    The prices are great for what you get - and the soup is VERY good.  Their spring rolls are my fave in the city (sorry Pho Kim Long).  Oh - and there's a full bar?! WHAT?!  What is this world coming to?    You MUST come check out District One.  Definitely get the egg rolls - I was HIGHLY impressed!

L3G-j2UrZu611uTy9UwlKw.text: The rib eye beef noodle was good and bad.  The beef was awesome, thin and well cooked.  Meat balls were also great!  But the problem comes in the noodles.  They were too soggy and they fell apart into short piece so I had to eat it with a spoon!!!  Broth was great, even better than some from San Jose!!!  If they improve on the noodle then it's perfect!  Customer service was great, waiters were very aware of what we need and when we need their attention, but I didn't appreciate the female manager having a training session while the restaurant was opened for business!  That seemed a bit unprofessional tho the rest of the staff were very polite.  The lady in charge was just loud and sounded obnoxious.  Kind of annoying while trying to enjoy a great bowl of beef noodles.    Pork belly bun is a must have, with steam buns!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye beef bowl with extra meat balls and extra noodles!!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bun with streamed bun!!  Must try!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. March mania margarita!  Tasty!

3CBz3ryqqRjqOveCaKgXNA.text: I VOLUNTEER AS TRIBUTE TO EAT HERE!   Am I the only one who is reminded of the Hunger Games because of this restaurant's name?  Let's start off with the appearance of this place. Let's just put it simply.. I feel pretty freakin' cool eating here. I definitely wouldn't mind having a photoshoot against their wall of typography. You'll know what I'm referring to once you go here. Look for the words: WTF (Where's The Food) pretty clever.  Let's move onto the menu. They keep everything pretty simple on a clip board and one sheet of paper. Yes, you read correctly... One. Sheet. Each order is pretty much broken down on the menu. They also have specials, so be sure to ask your server on that.  I ordered the steak and eggs both times. What can I say? If I like something, I really like something. The best part of this entree is the steak! It is seriously COOKED TO PERFECTION and even already cut into perfect bite sizes =') They give you a good portion size of rice and an egg on top. I'm seriously still in awe over how amazing their steak is. My boyfriend got their oxtail fried rice, which I found pretty darn tasty. My friend gets their garlic noodles. Who knew that garlic noodles could be so FLAVORFUL?!   District One, you have definitely caught my heart and stomach. I'll be back to explore more of your menu soon.
