qlrse-SMT4BR5fgTuR3ckg.text: My husband and I have been going to this place for quite sometime now. His ultimate favorite is the pho oxtail. As for me, I love their ice cream that is served inside a young coconut on its shell. I just crave for this!!!

c5WhY7jGZQlLDHznxGf6FQ.text: My friends and I were in vegas last weekend for a friends birthday and or plan was to stop by here before heading back to San Diego. We heard a lot of about this place and their lobster pho. This is probably the first time I ever heard of lobster pho which caught my attention.   We got here Sunday at 11AM and got seated right away. My friend got the lobster pho which was $40 (market price) and the rest of us got the rib eye pho, steak and eggs and spring rolls. We literally came here to see the lobster pho for ourselves and to take pictures of course! Haha my rib eye pho was $9 and the steak and eggs was $15. Although, I wouldn't spend $40 on pho even if it was for lobster but the presentation might and taste was amazing. So maybe next time I'm in town I'll order that! The broth they have for the pho is tasty and didn't taste like there was a bunch of msg in it.   The employees here were nice and constant on refueling drinks and checking up on us. The food came out quickly and didn't take too long. The amount of food that was given for the price we paid was fair. I'll be back in vegas in 2 in a half weeks. Maybe you'll catch me here again if I'm in the area!

WEvlatHPW7hCaAtwvQCtxA.text: I came here from my friends' suggestion. I ordered the fried belly buns and they were so good. They also had fresh coconut drink and alcoholic coconut drink too. I dont like their services somehow because some of them cared for the customers, some was not, but the store was very comfortable.

UXadXYhzKQKasQxTt0W7Xg.text: I was doing some shopping at 168 Supermarket and than I found out  District One was across the street so I gave it a shot and to tell you the honest truth it was a big disappointment. I came in around 3:10 PM and I was excited they have the special lobster fried rice and also their bone in ribeye special. I waited almost 35 mins for my meal to come out I guess they got some amateur cooks back there or some sou chefs making the food. I ordered the following it's a big disappointment I don't want to do a review on it but Yelpers must know.  Server 3/5 server was apologetic and seemed friendly at first but I think she got annoyed with me because I waited for almost 35 mins for my bland food.  Lobster fried rice with cavier 2/5 for almost $50 alone this has to be top five worst fried rice I've ever had because it was oily and seemed like they use oil for frying some kind of meats or something when cooking my fried rice.   Bone in Ribeye 2/5 asked for Med Well and some of the parts came out Med cook and it was so bland and flavorless it makes Dennys ribeye mouth watering.   Garlic fries 3/5 nothing special some sauteed garlic with regular fries.  Anyways District one is a fushion Vietnamese restaurant which the real Vietnamese taste and Unami is not there. I got comp for the ribeye the manager does not want to come over and asked how was things becuase she was too busy doing nothing but chatting with another male customer. Put all things aside TK the server or one of the owners was nice and apologize for my bad experience but it won't have me coming anytime in the future.

OlEdJqxYidsjR9xHjcrmlw.text: My parents were in town and I really wanted to take them to Raku. But, unfortunately, their earliest reservation was 10:30 pm, so District One became plan B. Serendipitously, we were just in time to catch the tail end of happy hour. The happy hour menu features some great appetizers at 30-40% off. We started off with the fish tacos, beef carpaccio, belly buns, spring rolls, a half dozen fresh oysters, and the garlic fries to start. Of those, I really enjoyed the fish tacos and beef carpaccio. The fish tacos featured yellowtail sashimi and a lot of acid (serrano pepper, cherry tomato) wrapped in a crispy taco shell. It was an interesting take on a not so taco Tuesday fish taco. The Vietnamese beef carpaccio was the most flavorful dish of the bunch. The thinly-sliced beef was just ever-so-slightly seared and mixed with lime juice, peanuts, and onions for the most flavorful carpaccio I've had. The belly buns were their featured braised pork belly. The pork belly was very tender and the buns were perfect (I've had a lot of shitty buns), but I didn't get too much flavor. The spring rolls and garlic fries were standard fillers. The fresh oysters were huge (not the typical small, sweet ones you find) and worth a try.   As for the entrees, we were quite full from the happy hour appetizers, so we decided to split two dishes. We had to get the popular oxtail fried rice. This dish is as amazing as everyone says. The fried rice is nicely seasoned and the ox tail meat is flavored well although some portions are more fibrous than expected. No fried rice is complete without a sunny side up egg to top it off. The other dish we tried was the crispy bird nest noodle. I liked most of the food up until this point, but this noodle dish was just plain awful. It was so salty and the combination of stir-fried beef, fish balls, and shrimp made no sense. The flavors of sweet, savory, and mostly just salt made it unpalatable. The noodles were also completely fried instead of having the outside crispy and the inside soft as it traditionally is. This disaster dish aside, I liked the overall menu and atmosphere. Happy hour beers are $3-4 so check out happy hour 5:00 to 7:00 pm or reverse happy hour 12:00 to 3:00 am.

hrGOxr3LcMpSsM_TyLJsCg.text: not coming back..... my first time me and my boyfriend we had a GREAT experience and thats why we came back, but after today I don't think Im coming.  We came to the bar and always a great experience we order our food and app, our app came out but after that I had 2 more drinks and still waiting for our food to come out......   Still waiting for our food and people that show up after us they got there food and "we still waiting"  My boyfriend order a steak that came with corn and fries, that corn came first and we wait, Steak came out 5min after so corn was cold by the time steak came out, well we still waiting for My FOOD to 5 7 min after my food came out by that time my boyfriends food was cold.   No happy at all.... he eat his food cold because first they took FOR EVER, after that they star bringing the items one by one and everything got cold....   Yeah the bartender   and drinks was good but everything else was horrible Im sorry but IHATE eating my food cold and nobody came and talk to us to make our experience better so drinks  were good but I don't think im coming back.

qxnWbB1TEC2gwbRfKUxMhQ.text: We had a friend who wanted to go here so bad because of the lobster pho he saw on instagram. He never got around to it, but we did.  The lobster pho was $39.99 but so worth it. It was huge with a super fresh-tasting lobster. And the broth is to die for! My only complaint is the amount of MSG. I felt so heavy and tired after. But while I was eating it, it was amazing. I wish we could have brought the leftovers home, but we were going to be traveling by plane.  We also ordered the oxtail loco moco, even though we couldn't find it on their menu. It was awesome. Super flavorful and cooked to perfection. The rice was not dry or too moist, and the egg was perfect and the yolk burst perfectly when you poked it with a form. My BF ate the whole thing.  We're coming back next time we're in Vegas.

YUdbOvOUyIjyqAmBOB3AgQ.text: The best oxtail fried rice!!!! I cant fins anything comparable in orange county. Not only they do not skimp on the oxtail meat, their fried rice is very tasty and full of flavor.

WR8bolh1f_N4f9k1gMdeww.text: This place used to be the cravin cajun, our usual go-to if we're ever craving for shrimp. They closed down and luckily opened up a better joint to replace it!  Glad we tried this place out because it's really good! Ordered a cider beer along with 2 appetizers. They were super delicious! My main dish was the rice platter combo with pork chops, and the sauce that came with it is EVERYTHING! It also came with an egg, which made it ever better. Who doesn't love egg on everything??? Okay, well maybe not everything, but you guys know what I mean.  Our waiter was super consistent, always made sure we were okay and not the annoying type of waiters neither.  Overall, this place was satisfying. Can't wait to come back here when I'm craving for an Asian dish!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Claypot. Was really good. Next time get it spicy will be extra yummy!

-KV4zF5-mLikJxOBRhUWgQ.text: Wanted to try some place new in Vegas and this place was recommended to me. Food here is great and service is so nice.  This place is like a Vietnamese infusion because they have traditional Vietnamese food but some dishes have a nice twist to it. I ordered almost all of their seafood dishes (I was on a seafood crave that day) and it was all great. Their snails were huge and the broth that it came in was sooo good. Their clams, oysters, calamari, pho, everything was just delicious. There wasn't anything here that I did not like.   Needless to say, I will be returning here to try more of their specials when I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dessert (scoop of ice cream)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams

2a04Mlu9AgTCys1XR033dw.text: Pros: the food is pretty amazing! I had their famous lobster pho and it was really good! They do all the work for you in terms of getting all the good parts of the lobster out. The pho is quite light and not overly oily for a nice clean broth. The atmosphere is very edgy and hipster with their wood decor and hanging light bulbs. The manager also came to greet and chat with us so definitely a plus for good service!  Cons: the food at be a bit on the pricier end (the lobster pho expect to pay $40)... But of course it's because you get a whole lobster. The quantity is on the smaller side but you still get full.  Overall: definitely highly recommended for this Asian fusion restaurant with their delicious food, quality service, and hip ambience!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho!!!

01I7zcrM_egGZT0LldU24Q.text: Total Hipster Pho spot. Loved the interior and food is Delicious!!!!!!!!!! Oxtail heaven  My fiance and I shared the oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice is. We got a side of the oxtail locomoco gravy and mixed with our fried rice and I almost cried, burst of flavor! Definitely will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail heaven

CEyTNVgP99jd3GiWfvmhDA.text: Great to bring the family for lunch and dinner.  Great service.   Awesome oxtail soup!!! Mahalo!!!!

TNcJ238Fyl4eKaM3qWl5Pg.text: HONESTLY didn't know what to expect... but finally got the chance to come in especially since we promised to come in after we met one of the managers while dining at our favorite sushi joint YUMMY GRILL & SUSHI while we were eating at the bar top...  The decor of this place is simple & in my opinion if what I call cute & chic. They have a chalk wall where they have handwritten specials & social media references. They have booths along the wall & tables in the center of the resteraunt with the bar closest to the kitchen.   We were greeted right away & seated right away. Our hostess gave us a rundown of what they were all about & lucky for us we came in for HAPPY HOUR TIME which we thought ended at 6 but was informed that it ends at 7 YAY =]  Our server came right over & helped us out on what are the best items as well as showing us the portable chalkboard of their daily special! I did wish they had the prices written down though. Multiple servers checked up on us throughout our dinner & constant refills on our waters.   WHISKEY BARREL BREW BEER 15.00- I personally do not like whiskey but the hubby loves it & I love beer but he doesnt... then this large bottle of AWSOME came along & it was a whole new world & connection for us ahhaha. It was suttle & smooth with a caramely richness with a bit of chocolate bitterness. YOU JUST GOTTA TRY IT!!  VIETNAMESE BEEF CARPACCIO 11.95(9.95 HH) - WOW amazing sauce that it is served with & thinly thinly sliced beef that is rare & o so TENDER!!  SERRANO WINGS 6.95(0.50 each HH) - so crispy & hot (temperature wise) the wings could have definately used a little more seasoning itself but when you eat it with the serranos  it has some more flavor.  GARLIC FRIES 2.95HH - crispy fries with fresh sauteed chopped garlic giving it a full blast of flavor  BIG BONE SOUP 14.95 - O My... FLINTSTONES sized bones as it is served whole bones with some meat at the bottom of the soup bowl with broth! So much marrow comes out of the bones when you poke it out with the knife provided. You also get the tendon!  STEAK & EGGS 13.95 - like the traditional cubed peppered steak that most Vietnamese resteraunt serve but i would say a little different & maybe the least favorite of the choices that I ate but still good. Just different from what I was expecting.  SEA SNAIL SOUP - not really for my taste buds... ahhah the broth was a little too fish saucy for me  1/2 DOZEN OYSTERS 9.95(1.25 each HH) - amazingly fresh with awsome cocktail sauce   CRISPY EGG ROLLS 6.95(3.99 HH) - taro & pork with veggie filling served with lettuce and mint leaves  OXTAIL LOCO MOCO - a little liquidy compared to most Loco Mocos I have had but maybe that is there style... regardless the flavor is tasty goodness.  OXTAIL FRIES 9.95 - full of flavor & seriously think they use some of the pho broth to make the oxtail sauce that is drenched over the crispy thin fries.  PORK BELLY BUNS 7.95(3.99 HH) - the pork literally just melts in your mouth & the white bun so soft & chewy as it should be   COCONUT ICE CREAM - not 100% sure if they make it but the ice cream itself also has some chunks in it & it also comes in a fresh coconut shell!  PANDAN CREME BRULEE - I THINK that's wat it was called but honestly the most addicting creme brulee... rich in flavor & vibrant in color with a perfect sugar shell  Overall this is a new favorite place for Vietnamese cravings that is a GIVEN! The broth for the pho soup base also reminds me of pho back in Cali which is always comforting with blasts of flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH oysters 1.25
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox Tail Loco Moco
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiskey Beer 15.99

8_yrfFxDPAhC-LlxjHOq3g.text: I so wish I could've loved this place because I was dying to try it!  Our server was nice. But the food was ok. Definitely overpriced. We were told the special was razor clams for an appetizer not being told the price, it was 4 bites for $16! Ridiculous! Our check for 2 people with tip and no alcohol was about$100. Had their pho which was actually tasty, good broth. That oxtail fried rice not only took long to get but was so not worth the wait nor $16! It was super greasy and loaded with tons of fat! Yuck! The pork belly buns were cold and dry. Ugh..... The spring rolls were different....had some weird crunchy thing in the center and some type of herb that I just did not like. And their peanut sauce was bland. Uhhhhh, no matter what I ordered other than their pho was cold, dry and yuck. Even their chicken wings were over cooked! Not a happy customer. Maybe next time I come I will just have their ice cream, if I there's a next time.

zRXZ2C55ppG1_VsS3IKJHw.text: Good to have this restaurant nearby! Mostly Vietnamese, with a twist of fusion.  We had Fish Taco, Steak & Egg, Mekong River Style Noodle Soup and everything was tasty! The ambience was good too.

poktzq64SIRTsUazmnIifA.text: I enjoyed my meal, the ambiance, and most of all the music! Try the oxtail fried rice with oxtail gravy, it was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice.

SEEDIfMNa4NRU2Fgpf1FsQ.text: Food and service were excellent! The lobster Pho was exceptional and the bone marrow soup was in a class of its own. Oxtail fries, and the oxtail fried rice were out of this world. Even my dogs were happy...

Lzqg6zxuAHSa0jVCFXJJSA.text: The appetizers were delicious, but that's about it. The traditional dishes are subpar and overpriced. My girlfriend and her family are Vietnamese and they were severely disappointed. The appetizers alone cannot bring me back here.   However, the staff was nice and helpful and the decor was great.

7YR5ecQABSb968UaWP7wgw.text: Oxtail pho! Yum yum yum!  I kept seeing this place pop up on yelp so decided to give it a try. Turns out, pho so 1's owner's son runs this place! My family and I have been going to pho so 1 for years so when I found out, I was super excited. My mom got to the restaurant first and she was waiting outside.  As soon as Khai saw her, he ran out and told her he'd get a table started while she waited for the rest of us to arrive. What awesome service. We felt like VIPs :P  Not your typical vietnamese pho place. They have the common pho combos and also offer a variety of other fresh seafood items. I got the oxtail pho. It was ~$12, on the pricey side for pho... but totally worth it. My bowl came out with 3 huge pieces of oxtail! It also comes with a side of dipping sauce for the meat. Mix them up and squeeze a little bit of lemon and its delicious!  My sister got Mi Sate. It came out and looked delicious but it definitely was not. It tasted like someone took half a jar of peanut butter and mixed it in with her soup. Way too peanut-y and sweet. Not a fan.  One other minor complaint I have about this place is that my very Vietnamese mother had a difficult time ordering the specific pho combo she wanted. Their menu had the basics. She typically gets pho chin tai nam... not on the menu. Totally not a problem but when she tried to order, both my mother and the waitresses were confused. Neither of them spoke Vietnamese. I don't mind this at all but I know my mom wasn't too happy. She'd be more comfortable with going to a solely Vietnamese speaking establishment so I probably wont be coming here with my family but I know for sure I will be back with some friends! I really wanna try the Lobster Pho!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho menu
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dipping sauce for the oxtail

JqSQBn8QQNjCoYxk8aSgrg.text: First time here but will definitely be back with more people! Food was so good there was no time for picture taking! I can't wait to explore more of their menu!

Hks3kWT-2CA1NbCL7Gpa0w.text: I had been anxious to try this restaurant and am happy to report everything was outstanding. We shared the scallop special of the day, beef carpaccio,  fried rice, soup and coconut ice cream.  The food was fresh, everything was balanced and tasty.  I can't wait to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop sashimi

khw5jq_BZwea9cMzK4rpSA.text: Tried the ox tail pho today and it was ok. Ox tail was good..soup was just ok.  Atmosphere was cool. Service is fast and friendly. Clean place.

cgtAIAmTXDiUsn9nh4wKpA.text: This place is truly some of the best fusion of American and Vietnamese fusion food I've ever had. Located about fifteen minutes from the vegas strip, district one is superb at bringing intense flavors to each customers dish.  Some of the dishes they are known for are the oxtail fried rice, the oxtail pho, the Mekong soup ( I believe it's made with beef, shrimp, fish balls, and pork. Also there known for the Grilled squid and the fish tacos. So when my wife and I took out friend there we offered half the menu, Lol...with no regrets. We had to eat the oxtail fried rice, pork buns, grilled squid and a few other entrees.   The oxtail fried rice was a bit salty but very unique in texture and taste. We enjoyed it and would definite try it again. The grilled squid had ok it had a few to much of a burnt taste to it and I couldn't enjoy it like I thought I could. The fish tacos we ordered didn't come with soft tacos like I was hoping they would. They were very small in size and reminded me of fried wontons. Although the fish was very small the fresh vegetables on it had great flavor and was refreshing for my tastebuds.   All in all we were satisfied with our good and the staff is very nice and attentive here. They provided excellent customer service and had no problem helping us with our orders and offer us their sound advice about dishes.  Overall we had about six dishes and our bill was about seventy dollars and that's before the tip. The serving sizes are decent and filling. Another great aspect about this location is that there open from 11am- 3pm everyday. That's definitely great when you wanna late night meal and don't wanna deal with the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There menu.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice

42nR8mGqiI54x8eYkx2D0g.text: Place is nice good vibes friendly staff order the ox tail Loco Moco it is amazing!! A+++

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail

aRbqN1ebfWJwXzHAxZO-Lg.text: It was so hard deciding what to order here because everything sounds amazing! One of my new favorite spots in Vegas. I will definitely come back and try other food from their menu!  Hue Spicy Beef Noodle (Bun Bo Hue) Steak & Egg rice dish- steak was seasoned very well with the tomato red rice  Bronzino? Carpaccio- the seasoning was so delicious!! i've had food with truffle oil but this had a great balance to it! the slices of fish were too tiny though which was kind of disappointing.  House Special Oysters- super fresh!

6EzX6hmx2HYz2prjmMNg8g.text: I honestly thought food here was The top notch but was not really impressed although place looks clean and atmosphere is nice.Staff were friendly and service was not bad.

r5LHSs-vvF6Qx7HlWfSobA.text: Great happy hr and they have 2 (one late night).  The Pho is out of this worldrib eye for me)! And the fried pork belly buns are yummy. Or you can get them steamed.   Happy hour also has .50 cent wings.

MB2ScWZU8x8qw-UmQA2oGg.text: Food was awesome, service was almost non existant.   I ordered the menu basically.Fish sauce and serano wings, pork belly bun, shrimp skewer and Beef Carpaccio. I empty plated clubbed all of it. Favorite dish was the Carpaccio by far.  Where I had an issue was the service. We he 5-6 different waiters/waitresses and not one gave off the impression they were our server. They were all really friendly but it was no wonder our order was wrong twice and had to wait 20 minutes for shrimp after I finished everything else.  I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say it was an off night. The food was too good to not want to go back. Especially when I saw bone marrow soup and lobster pho at the table next to mine.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish sauce wings
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio wayy too good

-B5ZOj5w38PklM2-zQlZ2g.text: I saw this place on my cousin's Instagram so I bookmarked it to try the next time I was in Vegas.  The first time I went was in September with my family. We ordered the: oxtail pho, oxtail fried rice, big bone marrow soup. Everything we ordered were delicious! My mom is difficult to please because either she thinks she can make it better or the food was too expensive but this is the first time she did not complain despite the fact that a bowl of oxtail pho is $11.95! (She was so happy that she took a business card) Her reasoning is that the bowl of pho comes with three pretty decent sized ox tails so she thinks it's worth it! The broth was tasty, the only thing is they need to add more noodles. Oxtail fried rice was decent to me. The big bone marrow soup was yum, it was like a mountain of bony goodness!! My dad wanted to take the bones back to my dog and according to the waiter, a lot of people do that!  Anyway, the second time I was in Vegas was this month and during my visit, i dined here twice! We ordered the same thing as my first visit plus we tried the garlic noodles, garlic wings, edamame. The garlic noodles were out of this world amazing! It was so simple yet so garlicky good! If you're a fan of garlic, you need to get this dish! Garlic wings were ok...I think they were like 6.95 for six wings, pretty pricey in my opinion. I didn't try the edamame but my friend liked it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big bone marrow soup!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho!! $11.95
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic noodles...sooooo good!

zoVrbelVylPNqBMgkH74Uw.text: Went for Happy Hour and the service was pretty good. The egg rolls were meaty and stuffed with pork. The fish tacos didnt have much fish in them for the price paid but they were satisfying. The cornish hen was dry and lacked flavor. It looks good in pics but I'll go to Krung Siam for their version which is juicer and spicier. Liquor is not on the happy hour menu but their well vodka is Belvedere which went down really smooth at $8 a pop. Id go back to try the oxtail fried rice and get another order of the garlic fries and egg rolls.

GOGtbYLPYxeHFmIZCapNeQ.text: I went here for happy hour last week and ended up getting chicken wings, fish tacos, pork belly buns, taro egg rolls, and french fries.  There was not anything notable about any of these appetizers.  The chicken wings and the egg rolls were good, but really nothing memorable.  The chicken wings would definitely benefit from an extra dipping sauce - like the fish sauce that came with the egg rolls.  The egg rolls had taro in them, which is why I wanted to come here.  The meat to taro ratio was off, as shown by the slightly mushy texture of the filling.  The pork belly buns come as either steamed or deep fried - I got the steamed.  The buns were not as soft as I hoped and the filling was very skimpy.  French fries were fine, but again, nothing memorable - McDonald's makes better fries.  The fish tacos were good, but tasted kinda odd - a little too fishy?  I think it's a ceviche like filling, but I'm not sure.  Although nothing was bad, I don't think I would come back here.  There are too many other restaurants in the area to try before I give this place another try.

Yeorey_za-Fm8f1b9unErA.text: A great Asian restaurant in Las Vegas. It is very clean and modern style.  Food taste good and fresh.  We went twice in 3 days.  Kids liked it too.

aGSSAYwbt7YqmM8c8-ngYw.text: Delicious Surprise  Asian-fusion is consistently good. My date and I shared a oysters, fish tacos, and hot wings for appetizers, and then main dish: the beef brisket and flank Pho- it was absolutely delicious and way too much food! The server was a huge help. I would highly recommend this restaurant!  District one was the best of the Asian restaurants in Las Vegas by far. My friend had belly buns and they looked very good. I had a saki on tap which was also good. We've been here before and have also been very pleased. Delicious gourmet food!!

lmjvApWZpmta_QQdpexEJQ.text: Our server was nice and gave us samples of the beers to see which one was good. I went with the sculpin IPA.   We had the pork belly bao, the bone marrow soup, and the garlic noodles with steak and eggs. I wish the garlic noodles were more garlicky. The food overall was great.   I'd recommend anyone to come here.

lABtySfk3ZaC9jJnN0Al1w.text: I was craving for Kalbi so we decided to try this place. We were originally going to the Chinese Noodles place just down the shopping complex but the line there was too long. We tried the chicken wings and they were probably one of the best wings I've ever tried in a long time. They were spicy and had chopped jalapenos all over it. Even the jalapenos were good to eat because they tasted like they had just been chopped. The chicken had the right amount of crispiness. For my entree, you guessed it, I got the Kalbi beef ribs. The serving size was definitely enough for two people. It was really good also. It was served with en egg, Chinese sausage and riceThe meat was very tender. The staff were also very attentive. They checked on my friend and I a lot to see if we needed anything. The establishment is very spacious so you don't feel like your moves are restrictive. Lol I will definitely come back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings - to die for. Drink it with beer and you&#39;ll be a happy camper.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi

qTXQft6FYB5EVvnvOctfkg.text: Nice, casual place. Great for dates or with a group of friends. Average noise level but could get loud if there are big groups. Customer service was great! We ordered oxtail fries, oxtail pho, and the district 1 combo plate. Everything was delicious! I have nothing bad to say about any one of those options. Definitely a must try! Will be coming back here for sure.

ROnszmE_Blk5vnoh6qXHBg.text: The food its salty and the service it's bad. I'm not happy and my whole family not gonna come here anymore...

kY9aLhC019aoF3Rh9aChmA.text: This place has really good pho the meat is so tender it melted in my mouth I got the pho with the meats. I could only imagen how good the rest of the food is, I will definitely be back!!

aSUwped4_tXbVzL9pqFojw.text: This place is great. They have a fantastic beer selection on tap, great food, and Christina has a wonderful staff. Love D1!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful and delicious! !

s0xr9tXgIlq5PKUajyTBEA.text: BRING A HOODIE. Sounds weird? This place was freezing. Probably an ingenious plan to get you in the mood for pho in the middle of summer.   Came in to try this trendy joint. Again, the first thing you are hit with is the freezing cold. Did I mention to bring a hoodie? Yeah, bring a hoodie.  To warm myself up in the mean time, grabbed a drink. I always a major plus when a restaurant has decent beer. The Sculpin IPA is a very big plus.  The servers were prompt, showed us the specials for the day. There IS lobster pho, but we didn't HAVE lobster money this night so we opted for Oxtail Fried Rice, Pho Oxtail, and the Pho Tai Rib Eye.  The Oxtail Fried Rice ($12.95) is really overpriced. Everyone of their rice dishes seem like that. It was a good portion of rice, but I've had better fried rice (Japaniero) for cheaper. The chunks of oxtail in the rice was tender and delicious. Nothing else really exciting about the fried rice though. Lacking a flavor other than oxtail. So hope you got oxtail in every bite.  The Pho Oxtail is huge, you get the huge bone in there with plenty of oxtail for cheaper than the rice ($11.95). My Pho Rib Eye also had delicious slices of meat. I did think it was a little skimp on meat with a little too much broth. I don't know if it was just me. What I did have though, was delicious. I overdid the sriracha and jalapeno.   I ended up with bastard broth. The broth was so spicy that my head sweat and I was crying. I finished it all. Why? It was delicious.  The atmosphere and the different specials assures me that I'll be back. I will have to get lobster pho eventually and try out their different appetizers.   Did I mention to bring a hoodie?

Dchvts6ndLnGEa9M3Xo0gg.text: Was excited to come here after reading all the other reviews. Ended up having to take off one star due to very slow service. Eating if you bowl of noodles should not take this long. Spent well over an hour in the restaurant when I should've taken half as long. I get the feeling that place is more about drinking and about food. If you are interested in getting dinner, I would go somewhere else. If you have lots of time and want to have a few drinks and eat some good food then come here.  Pho was good but took way too long to come. I honk they use MSG too. Fish tacos were quite good.   Don't think I would come back since I can get pho elsewhere

JN4vupiUOicvsGGzd6PzCw.text: Introduced my brother and sister in law to District One Kitchen. They moved to Vegas and wanted to know where we go when we're in town. Food is tasty, service is great, very friendly. We each ordered something for ourself and shared the other dishes. They had plenty of leftovers to enjoy! They loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice with egg on top
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Able to do the happy hour for our wings (18 pcs). Leftovers! They were yummy!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs with a scoop of rice and egg on top

HgBpZOO5NrjRhN1vfYS9DA.text: This place has definitely improve since it open.  The menu has been diversified but at the same time very simple and clear.  I like how they make some of the simple dishes, creative.  Of course, this first time back I was very un-original and ordered the pho thai ribeye steak and the spring rolls.  The spring rolls were plump and fat, meaning they were large and delish on it's own, but their peanut sauce for dipping has quite a bite, nutty and spicy!  The pho thai ribeye steak was a lot, I wish I had a larger stomach!  The broth was less MSGish, which is good, for me...I didn't leave with a feeling of heavy greasy tummy.  The flavor and aroma in their pho was just enough!  As dessert, I split a Vietnamese coffee with a colleague...talk about quality coffee!  The coffee they use is strong and aromatic.  Let's say once I left and went back to work, I was wired!    This is definitely a place I will return over and over again to try all the new creative dishes they have.  Next time, lobster pho!!!

KZp5lBezb5Wc8uh-q_WUHQ.text: Wow wow wow this place is so good. They have delicious raw oysters on a half shell, mouth watering oxtail fried rice, oxtail pho, fried noddles, and garlic bok choy. We didn't order too much but I know other people rave about their other dishes. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas!!!

VO3MVgFFkefwkn27ixlmTg.text: Well been here 4 times the partner of the establishment, Christina, is very welcoming and sweet. The bartender that took care of my friend and I, Adrian, was great, remembered our names and very attentive to what was going on!   The food is great from what I tried which were some of the daily specials, fresh shrimp on a bed of salt, Serrano pepper wings, some speciality oysters. In my opinion were all great. Flavor was on point as well as the overall quality of each plate.  The cocktails I had were the Vietnamese donkey and the coconut mojito. Both very delicious, balanced and refreshing.   The atmosphere is very nice, music and tvs for those who enjoy just hanging out having a drink and some nice bites.   Highly recommend this place to any one looking for a laid back place with great service and great food   5/5

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W25taSbI3ji3CSXvk1Pj1A.text: Husband and I finally decided to try  this place after talking about it for months. Location of the restaurant appears to be in a very popular and busy plaza but parking is ample to accommodate the crowds. My husband ordered the very popular "big bone" bone marrow pho. He enjoyed the flavor and highly complimented the taste of the broth. The soup naturally required a lot of messy work to eat and for $18 I would think it included noddles but thats an option for an extra $2. Overall though my husband gave it a 4/5. I ordered the double down which included Kalbi short ribs, Chinese sausage with a side of rice topped with an egg. Very hearty dish and good portion. I had enough leftover to take home for another meal. We ended our meal with their coconut ice cream served in an actual coconut. Delicious and the perfect end to a great meal. The highlight of our meal was definitely the pho. Can't wait to return and try more of their yummy noodle soups!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream 5/5
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail tacos appetizer
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_0Zt35M2KJjTt-KS8wwJOw.text: Umm... Okay so I guess I missed the bandwagon on this place because after leaving here tonight I'm a little confused as to what's the big hooplah about this place? Listen I'm all for given credit where it's due however this place just doesn't get my vote. My co workers love it and I have had their food and now tonight a chance for the happy hour! This review is strictly for the happy hour and nothing else. For starters lets talk about the joke of a menu they have for happy hour? You might as well not even offer happy hour with the half ass menu they are offering? Like cmon now it seriously only benefits people who like beer and cheap wines that will leave you with a headache? Oh and the little bit of food they have listed is a joke as well. I ordered those extremely fried chicken wings that were .50 cents a piece.. And yeah full of grease when you bite into them and extra freaking crispy, no thanks. The drinks are priced I guess we'll for beers but what about the folks that want a good cocktail on the happy hour menu! NONE of the regular cocktails are priced differently during this time frame and that sucks a lot being that most places at least list the well drinks. The service is cool but just put it like this they won't ever get another dime from me and I'm sure they are okay with it because seems from the other reviews this place is a hit! The entrees I've tried before in the past were "just okay" as well. The whole garlic noodle thing throws me all the way off. If the happy hour improved and they listed more relevant items I may or may not try them again but for now they are most definitely on my skip list!

hUeFsaMhPhdTcOG7RMRtZA.text: My experience at district one was fantastic.   First, the food is delicious. Not your typical pho spot. Has a few creative dishes. You must try the fish tacos and oxtail fries.   Second, decor and ambiance has a feel good feeling. The music and employees makes it a really fun atmosphere.   Third, most people wouldn't notice but they have one of the most impressive drink lists I've seen especially coming from a pho spot. I mean every single single malt Japanese whiskey you can think of and if you're lucky enough to meet "momma" she might have a shot of fernette with you to cure your hangover.   I can't wait to come back to this place.

NvYrAVAbTWWzrIYu9_TZSw.text: The food is amazing here!  The kiddos love the garlic fries and calamari.  This is our to go place.  My husband is very picky with food and services, this place delivers the best of both. --Great Music--  S.Y.

q4N8HKNULCqBq9C9FxTcLA.text: Really good. Loved the atmosphere. Went for lunch. We had the crispy bird noodle nest, oxtail fried rice & fish tacos. Loved the first two the tacos ok. Will definitely be back!

SnQW_ryOGKGpLFIBKhclSQ.text: Great customer service. Our server was very friendly and helpful. We ordered their ox tail fried rice, and it was sooo good and not dry like most fried rice. Super moist, just how I like!!;) I would def come back here again when I'm in Vegas!!!

pPKRhfItsoYCf9m6N1Bk2Q.text: D1 is hands down the BEST Vietnamese/Fusion spot in Vegas. My family and I make it a point to eat here every time we visit.  They are always able to accommodate our group of 16+ which is a plus. We love the friendly staff and atmosphere. We have tried almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed yet. Big Thanks to the District One family for always taking such good care of our Family while we are hungry in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Fam loves District One!

buo3_MjjhdZM0hAIj5W51A.text: Wooosh!! Out with the old in with the new. Out of the ashes of one of my favorite crab eating joints in the city a new restaurant is born, to replace what was once the Cravin Cajun. I've been through many of meals devouring king crab legs in what once was until one solemn day I pulled on the door only to find out it would not open no more, the Cravin Cajun was no more...  What can come next?? In my small world I would wonder who would fill that void and that space?? Until once day upon one of my travels up Jones I looked up and saw the sign...and it read "District One"......huh what is this I asked myself....who has replaced Cravin Cajun?!? Vietnamese fusion with flair? Has this been done before? Beyond Pho? I thought to myself "I MUST TRY THIS".  I tossed and turned over the loss of Cravin Cajun and waited before trying District One as if it would be a sin, I couldn't disrespect the nonexistent King Crab gods, NO I MUSN'T I would cry out, until one day after reading numerous reviews from fellow yeeps on District One I decided it was time to stop mourning and move on. If other people can get over it then I can to!! So myself and Ellen F. went there for lunch and oh it was good...  I wasn't ready to try the King Crab legs so I ordered their 5 Spice Cornish Hen with a side of the famed Oxtail Fries. I was tempted to try their Pho Ga but why when you can have it at a ton of  places down Spring Mountain (the pictures looked good btw) , let's live a little!!  I very much enjoyed the roasted hen, seasoning was good, rice was equally delicious. The oxtail fries were off the heezy! Whatever the hell sauce it is it is damn bueno. The service was fantastic, I had different servers come up to my table multiple times to ensure the lunch feast was coming along smoothly and that I had an ample amount of water to wash down this Vietnamese fusion.   I actually regretted not trying the crab legs and other interesting sounding menu selections but due to my time constraints (1 hour) and limited freedom regarding lunch (little thing called work, yuck!) I could not. Next time though!!! As I will be coming back. Oh and the prices are more than reasonable, if you haven't tried it yet it's a must among Chinatown revelers.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 spice Cornish hen.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Washing sinks for when your fingers get too dirty! Remnants from Cravin Cajun. Just outside the bathrooms.

cOKmfzEeGT54Y4Z0S-hV7A.text: Oyster too weak and small. Chicken wings and Lemons dried, not fresh. Cocktails are so so. Salad is ok. Over all not satisfied. Service not bad. Need to upgrade your food.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too small

zqsdSv1Tqi1prhQ61ondxA.text: Came here with my cousin and aunt this past weekend while in Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was here!  For appetizers, we ordered the Vietnamese beef carpaccio dish and some garlic serrano pepper wings. The carpaccio had this super yummy sauce, which my aunt loved so much she ate it with rice! It wasn't too salty! The chicken wings were BOMB. Nicely crisped and seasoned, these wings had a kick to them! For my main meal, I ordered the pho tai nam, which came out in a pretty big bowl. They were super generous with the meat portion too! The broth was delicious and didn't taste too MSG-y as some of the pho places do in San Jose. My aunt ordered this claypot dish and my cousin ordered the spicy beef noodle soup and both seemed to be enjoying their dishes as well!   The service was very attentive here although it was pretty busy. Our waiter even boxed up my pho and our other dishes for us to take to go! I am so glad I got to eat some yummy Asian food in Vegas. Most of the time I stay on the strip and most of the Asian restaurants there are terrible. I will definitely be coming back when I'm back in Vegas! :)

Fvx7ljQOZqNmfsm8fMCP6g.text: Loved everything about this place! It's on the pricey side but that's what you pay for friendly attentive service, hip atmosphere, and fusion food. It's a Vietnamese fusion. There were 2 of us so we sat at the bar, which is a full bar but we ordered their specialty drinks along with 5 food items.  Vietnamese donkey: 5/5 basically a lychee Moscow mule. Very light  Fresh coconut mojito: 5/5 it comes in a real coconut and tastes very refreshing. They also give you coconut juice on the side to drink as well  Pork belly buns: 4/5 good appetizer, nothing amazing. They used Vietnamese radish and carrots which was different but it didn't blow me away.   Oxtail fries: 5/5 I loved it! Definitely recommend this as an appetizer or even a side dish. The meat was very tender and had a pulled pork consistency. It comes with a sunny side up egg too so if you don't want it to get too soggy just put the fries to the side and break the egg on the other side and dip it in   Garlic noodles: 4/5 pricey for what it is. It was on the dry side and the garlic flavor wasn't completely there but the garnishes added a fresh flavor to it   Shaken beef: 5/5 super tender and they used the more traditional Vietnamese butter rice I believe. This entree also came with eggs and you get to choose how it's cooked  Short rib combo plate: 4/5 short ribs were marinated very well and tasty, but portion on that was small. I only got 1 small slab of kalbi and the Chinese sausages were hard so I only had a bite of that and I was done. I liked that they also included an egg in the meal so I had it sunny side up so the yolk dropped over my rice when I punctured it.. Yummmm I love runny yolk   Overall, I would defiantly recommend this place and come back to try other items on their menu

vSJInnEeOq3X7O7zhDtJyg.text: Second time here. This time we brought the clan! 6 adults and 6 kids from toddler-7y/o. Customer service again exceeded my expectations. This was also our friends first time here and they absolutely loved it!  Even with the kids running around and being "kids," the staff didn't seem to mind and still maintained bearing, and while keeping up with our requests. Food delivery was spot on, and they really made us feel welcome.  The ribeye and oxtail pho are dynamite! The Serrano wings are bomb, and the fish tacos are tasty and refreshing and pairs well with the Japanese hefe.  I'll be coming back again for happy hour! Thank you guys for making our night worthwhile!!

Vqrq4Dr6BOuaKFERBTp8-w.text: My boyfriend and I came here for lunch today and we were definitely impressed. We ordered the steamed pork belly buns as an appetizer which were delicious. We didn't know you can also order it fried so we will be sure to try that next time. My boyfriend ordered the oxtail pho and I ordered the oxtail fried rice. I definitely have to say that this place did live up to its great reviews regarding the food. The service was a bit slow at times (having to wait for our waiter to place our order for food and drinks) but we didn't mind. He made up for it by coming a few times to refill our drinks and check in on us from time to time. Overall, the food was great. We will definitely be coming back to try their other dishes.

-HIg0omqRNYRSnPMgiB7CA.text: We went to District One Kitchen & Bar for happy hour on a Wednesday evening.  We sat at the bar and the enthusiastic charming bartender was very friendly and told us what he recommended. Due to being so famished, we ended up ordering everything on the happy hour menu.   Everything was wonderful and delicious.  My favorite was the wings which were spiced to perfection.  Make sure you try the tacos, they were simply amazing. I will definitely go back to try some of the other sea food on their menu.

6J8u3P7-1pvpnyGfWRjn5g.text: This used to be the Cravin Cajun place. I hadn't been to either but I was headed somewhere else for dinner and this place caught my eye. I thought maybe it would be good.  It wasn't bad but wasn't something I would go back to, either.   It has an upbeat atmosphere. Everything is kind of new inside so it looks nice. There is a giant chalkboard that somebody spent a lot of time writing the signature dishes but the chalkboard is back in a corner so being a new customer, with so much other noise going on, I didn't even notice it until halfway into my meal. There's also an 8 foot picture of their lobster pho advertisement that is also positioned in a way that only the hostess pointing it out, I would've noticed. In a dimly lit place, these types of signs need a highlight light to get noticed.  The hostess asked if I wanted a booth but I was by myself so, I decided to sit at the bar. There was a guy bartender that seemed to be eyeing me like he was going to take my order. If I sit at a bar to order food, I prefer to order from a server but I've never been here so I just go with the flow. The lobster pho obviously is something they are trying to push. I decided to try that. The price is listed as 'Market Price.' My personal opinion when a guest orders something listed with this label is that the server should suggest the price. Only after it is ordered. And, this is why...  A woman dressed in plain clothes who appeared to be either a manager or maybe even the owner because she was sitting with guests and overriding the register and accepting a delivery ( which was strange for 9pm on a Saturday night, but...who am I ). But, she casually walked by while I was eating and asked how it was. So, lemme get to that...the important part.  The lobster pho had the full shell as garnish. It was hollow but the only thing that gave the dish substance. The broth was clean and flavorful but was bare. There were the typical pile of noodles in the bottom of the bowl but the entire dish was 1. Broth 2. Noodles 3. Lobster 4. Couple slices of onion...from most to least. The flavor was right but I was hoping for more so when this manager asked me halfway through, I couldn't really give a correct assessment. If she asked me at the moment of service or after I was finished, I would probably have had more to say but asking while my mouth is full is an indication that something isn't right.   Like I said...it wasn't bad but it wasn't anything to knock my socks off. Although the dish is actually more traditional than the Americanized versions that are so popular, it was only so so. And, if the bill is going to show up $40 for the pho and $5 for tea, I would prefer to have known what it was going to be priced because what started as a so so dish dropped immensely upon learning what they value as such.   On a side note, the bartender was a little personal with his questions. I understand a bartender is supposed to be a sort of quasi therapist for patrons but he acted more like he was a reporter with his questions. And, I wasn't ordering any alcohol. But, he found out that I'm involved in a community event beauty pageant for girls. He told me that one of the servers was competing but, I think he was trying to grab my attention. Problem is, while trying to get the girls attention that he pointed out to me, she was almost running from me. I didn't recognize her but she was in work clothes so I just wanted to verify. He told me her name and I still didn't recognize it so I'm wondering if this is the same as the price of the pho...deceiving and in the end, a disappointment like getting a Thai massage without a happy ending.   It's a shame because the broth was good. The place has an upbeat atmosphere but the location is bad and the prices are a little inflated for being in a rundown area and getting surprised with a fifty dollar bill for soup and tea kills any good taste in my mouth. I know seafood is not cheap but I was thinking that would be the sugar on top. Instead, it was like eating a bowl of rice and after finishing, finding out it was actual fried meal worms.   I don't think I'll return again.

Ld3df_zQtkaf_zedC-6sMg.text: The pork belly sliders were amazing! The menu is pretty small but everything we had was great! The house oysters are hands down best ones we have had in Vegas.

We got the the chicken wings, garlic noodles, combo plate, pork belly sliders and the spring rolls.. The only thing that I really had a problem with was the garlic noodles being a little dry.. C2T3Hf45RK7-sKEHkPOSvw.text: The establishment has a great atmosphere. Their are servers everywhere so with my experience I had no problems getting my orders right away. GVSUJjMcUcmMD6GKXyFFQQ.text: It was my boyfriend and I's first time here and we will definitely be coming back for more! Great atmosphere and fast service. We were given our food within 10 minutes of ordering! We heard about the popular oxtail fried rice and the rib eye pho which were both spectacular so I highly recommend you to try one of those. We also got the coconut ice cream for dessert and it was such a cute display! Delicious coconut ice cream sprinkled with roasted peanuts and inside a coconut shell, yum!!! It wasn't too sweet either, it was more of a refreshing taste after all the food we had haha  Definitely will be coming back to try the lobster pho that everyone is raving about :)

MChqatmyF4Wem5LmEMnajQ.text: Came in for a few beers. Got hungry and had the oxtail fries. Atmosphere was awesome, bar tender was knowledgable and friendly, and the fries were awesome.

It couldn't even cook our raw beef.we asked for another extra side bowl of extra hot Soup and still the beef wouldn't cook we ended up throwing the beef away. Clean place but we most likely would not return as we don't eat raw beef. Good customer service.

cLcxEXSEysSuRoFT-dTBkg.text: Cory is amazing. Attention to detail. I stop by at this hidden gem Janelle who is at the steak place close to me cannot brother spelling the franchise like the sauce we can never spell chose to leave us with great and amazing training.  Recommend the oxtail whatever if there is a fried egg on top.

9iFdO7PWABI0Spx-F_XHGQ.text: This place makes their pho the right and good way. I love it. I got the oxtail pho soup. I wanted to try the surf and turf pho but I didn't feel like paying $35+ for a bowl of pho. Next time I will come back and try it. The price here is pretty expensive. The food is great but if you dine here make sure you are ok spending a bit more than other pho places. My oxtail pho was $15.99. The flavor of the broth was excellent and I slurped most of the broth down. Loved the meat on the oxtail. The noodles amount they give you was just right as well. They didn't give way too much noodles like other places. Our server kinda took his time and didn't greet us right away and he didn't really come back to check on us so I would probably want a friendlier and better server next time. Otherwise the food here is very good, just a bit on the expensive side.

CQd5aoVbIpxqKIoXZ8FDcg.text: BS   "I told you to separate our checks!!!"  I mean seriously this rating is not about just the food but the customer service.  Ok first the location - super busy area.  Parking is limited at night.  The inside is hipster authorized and designed.  It's rustic and country modern.  I love  that your waiter is quick at taking orders.  But I specified and said it TWICE to make sure we have a separate check because I didn't feel like paying for 10 people (which I ended up doing!).  Plus TIP was automatically included at 18%!!! Are you serious? Even in NYC they don't do that.  At least 15% and give me the option to pay you more.  Ok Sorry D 1 but you are about to get the BIG D from me.   So I ordered the pork rib meal - $13.99 I believe and the fried spicy calamari.  A beer and wine.  And my total ended up $180 and change.  I mean seriously? Anyway, so the calamari came! Wow that's a lot of breading for a chewy octopus.  I wish I had the jaw power of a hyena or a pitbull to eat it.  It was gnarly to chew on it.  The dip was nice and yummy.  It was spicy that it made me smile.  The  short ribs was super hard and overcooked.  The sausage that came with it was the cheap shriveled hot dog. The egg tasted like it was microwaved.  This place get's a lot of high praises but I was not happy at all.  The waiter even took 20 minutes to come with my beer.  I love the guy but COME ON! I want to get lit but instead I got burnt.  Anyway, I was charged $20 for my wife's wine.  I get that price but at least bring it in a nice cleaner glass.  Anyway, overall this place is super hyped.  I might  love it if I was just eating the chicken wings.  Maybe I'll come back during happy hour.  Overall, it was an ok experience.  It's not impressive at all.  Maybe I can be impressed next time I visit Vegas.    * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

49DrSUmXbNU57oJmHo4KJw.text: Oh, man!! This place is so good. Totally worth the drive into the "Chinatown" of LV. I never knew   this part of town even existed!   Anyway, a lot of folks say go for the lobster pho... But I would recommend the salted pepper lobster. It's not done exactly in the same style as most salted pepper stuff, but it's pretty close. The sauce is amazing perched a top a bed of garlic noodles. I think it was the owner that came over to us and said that's actually his favorite way of cooking up the lobsters. They don't have it all the time though so we did get pretty lucky.   We also had the mekong noodles and the sirloin pho. The mekong noodles were really good... Loved the quail eggs in this. I do have to say that the pho was only ok - I would probably not order this again.   Drinks... They have some great things on the menu. My fiancee and I got the Vietnamese coffee with Henny. Really tasty.

vf2TqKct5uIJLDc0ZcJWbQ.text: I met up with a friend of mine here today. Parking was full today. I had to park on the next strip parking area.   The restaurant was packed and loud.  The place offers Vietnamese cuisine and incorporates Japanese, Thai, Chinese, and American influences onto a menu of seafood, appetizers, rice bowls, and noodle soup.   We ordered The Big Bone Soup, OMG it was huge!! there were some bone marrow inside the bones. It was average, not really worth $17.99 but it satisfied my craving.   Happy Hour is from Mon-Friday 5pm-7pm and Sunday from 12am-2am.  From the Happy hour menu, we had Fish Tacos, Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio which was surprisingly flavorful and Belly Buns.  The service was attentive. Overall, 3.5 stars on food but I rounded up to 4 stars for the great service.

awlWoapnTXr2ovQ0oVONeA.text: Coming here was not the plan...there is another place that is in the same strip mall that we were going to...they weren't open so we came here.   The selection is not as robust as I would have liked, but good enough.  The food, the waitstaff, the atmosphere is great (If a sportsbar and an Asian-Fusion restaurant had a child...this would be this place).  We had the Garlic Serrano Wings, Spring Rolls, Belly Buns (the star of the appetizers), wife ordered the Mi Wonton (good thing she was full from the appetizers, I got to eat half of this) and I had the Garlic Noodles.  All great items.   We'll be back pho sure :)

The food overall was fine and a nice change from your typical Vegas food.   serrano wings- a little plain, but nicely crisped  papaya salad- love the peanut flavoring, and the nice chunky pieces of shirmp  five-spice conrish hen- the chicken has some nice spice to it and the sauce is a nice complment

9eYWLQwmlR70hxztbOcVnQ.text: This is the best restaurant we've been to in Vegas hands down. Excellent oxtail pho, crab legs, oxtail fries, and yellow tail tacos. OMG. And then to end with their dantastic coconut ice cream. Took my lady and my mom here for Mothers day and we really enjoyed the service and most importantly the food. The owner Tony and the girls were so amazing.

9W70M-0CBzTGoLAVS0OYzA.text: This place is an affordable modern mixed/fusion Asian restaurant in my opinion. I have never had a problem with this place when it has come to service. I generally see the same servers and theyre all friendly and pretty chill.   Their options are different but I enjoy all of it here! My husband finds some things "exotic." For example, eating snails!   This place is affordable in a way, but I have come to realize that the prices of their foods have increased in the last year or so.

l3MrZy29e9IB4jdczng-Xg.text: I went here with a friend of mine recently..  The atmosphere is kinda like a crawfish joint.. has a bar.. has nice booth seatings.. The service was not bad as well. the parking is a PAIN in the butt tho... its always so busy in that shopping center so you literally have to circle around a bunch to shark for a parking spot.   So lets talk about the food.. One of the first things i ordered was the pork belly buns.. it was tasty but nothing mind blowing or nothing. priced at $10.  I ordered the coconut pork belly with boiled egg as my entree. Theres 3 big chunks of the meat  and an egg. The pork belly was tasty but I would prefer it to  be more tender! its on the chewy side. As a vietnamese person with having it made in my household.. its usually cut more on the smaller side and more tender! its priced at $13. It comes with a small bowl of rice and some pickled cabbage.  I also ordered the papaya salad with shrimp. its priced at $12. Its BARELY SPICY.... so if you're used to the thai style made papaya salad this is not anything like it. its ok tasting but not what I had expected. I had them adjusted it to more spicy.. which was okay i suppose but not what Im used to. kinda disappointed in this dish. I would say PASS on this dish.  my friend ordered the creme brulee i believe and it was mediocre ..nothing that wows me. I had a taste of it ...but glad i didn't order it.   Overall I would say this place is okay in food but needs lots of improvements ...service is okay as well.. ambiance is alright. I would not bend over backwards to come here.. Im not too sure if i wanna come here in the future.. probably not. I'm just not wowed by this place... pricing is kinda high and food isn't amazing.

pY-j1lckaIUd8k92ux1qbQ.text: been here twice before and although service is fine, the food isn't really worth the price. however, the third time coming here? my bf got a bowl of pho and grilled squid.   tell me why he has been in pain from both ends for the past 2 days since he ate here. either you guys messed up on storing squid or in some universe, made pho go bad.   either way, i'm never coming back here. this was the finishing disappointment, and a painful one.

pkwYHhT0C9uyGsArqiGy5A.text: My parents have been urging me to try this place, so when I finally got back to Vegas I had to make a stop here.  Went on a Sunday for lunch back in Jan.  Wasn't too hungry going in, but I was forcing myself to at least try this place.  As soon as I did a once over on the menu, my hunger grew, everything sounded delicious.  I appreciate the creativity of this place.  True definition of trying something new.  I had to start with the bao's.  Pork belly filling nothing special, but the option to have it fried, just blew my mind.  When I ordered them, the waitress asked if I wanted it fried and I excitedly replied "why yes, not sure how the idea of fried bao's have not been a part of my life till now."  Of course I was not disappointed when it arrived.  Not as oily as I was concerned they would be, I was rather impressed.  This might be a new twist the a so 5 year ago trend.   Then had the short ribs, the garlic noodles and the oxtail fried rice.  I'll start with the least impressive, the short ribs.  They were good and more generous on the portion size then most restaurants, but nothing unique.  Then was the garlic noodles, look rather plain, but as soon as you take your first bite, it explodes with flavors.  They totally are deceiving.  So delicious, but you better love garlic, it is True to its name.  I was so impressed by this dish that I went home and tried to make it at home (as I don't live in Vegas so going back for seconds will take a little longer).  Lastly was the oxtail fried rice.  Ya ya ya, I had a starch fest, so what of it, just let me enjoy my meal.  The oxtail fried rice was top notch.  I'm no expert cook, but I have truly been making fried rice since I was 10 (just about every Sunday morning going up), so I know what I like about fried rice and this place had it down.  Not to oily, not to dry, also to my surprise not too much oxtail (which is a good call).  The oxtail adds a richness, but does not over power the dish and take over the flavor profile.  Over all very well done.  I want to go back to Vegas now just so I can eat at District One again.  Some many more items I want to try.

-z7FdtRUVeKV1-QprxyJpg.text: Food was awesome and the music was dope! I had the double down plate. Got both meat for it with the substitute of fried rice.   Our server was great. She was friendly and attentive. Answered all our questions. There was some secret food that my friend knew about and she was well aware of it.   The place was really chill and fun. The decor was dope to see and read off the walls. This place throws a really great vibe to be at. 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4wG1LKutp0pu2UrNXenaQ.text: Great Vietnamese spot off the strip. Located in a random strip plaza , this place is banging! Fun atmosphere with killer food! Wish I had a biggest appetite to eat more . The squid tasted like meat it was so flavorful and the dipping sauce complimented it well. The beef rib also tender and loaded with flavor. Def worth a trip of the strip !

cXoINdpB3fFBznPmicNH4A.text: Everything was very tasty. Presentation of the food was also pretty good. The overall service was not great, although the hostess did phenomenal from the time we called to put a reservation in to the time we arrived. As always the restaurant is slammed!  Again, the overall experience at the restaurant was good. It just didn't send us over the top the way you would think it would (considering the venue is always picked with a line out the door). It was a little on the pricey side for Chinatown (as well as for the overall good experience).   I do have to mention that the grilled squid was absolutely delicious & presentation on point. That's my side note.   With as many opportunities in the area, it is going to be a while before I decide to go back. There is just to much to taste.   Thank you for the experience.

xVmF_Zld3pEnqq0PZk9SWg.text: I'm from New York and I just spent the EDC weekend in Vegas. I really want to like this place but not after I tried the lobster pho.   I called in advance to reserve seatings for 2 but I was told they are not taking any reservation during the EDC weekend. We went anyways because of the good ratings. The customer service was good and the waiters were friendly.   This place was famous for the lobster pho and we learned that it was 50$ from the waiter there and the portion is good for 2. We ordered the lobster pho and the Vietnamese style carpaccio. The carpaccio was good I like it. The lobster pho was very disappointing; you get a whole 1.5 lb lobster, it looks ok if you don't mind it missing a few legs... when your lobster tastes mushy... you know it means it is not fresh. The broth was very salty and on top of that we were told by the waiter it was good for 2 people and nope! I really not think so... I really hate to say don't expect good seafood in the middle of a desert. We didn't order another pho because we afraid they will use the same salty broth.   We didn't like the pho but the carpaccio was nice. I may missed out the good dishes but I definitely not recommend this place if you are looking for some good lobster pho!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho that is missing a few legs with mushy meat :( $50
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio Viet style

bgCOyakcooyuX3ewciXmMg.text: This place knows how to throw down and serve asian fusion food correctly!!!  First dish: Oxtail fried rice with eggs served your way. Delicious and not oily at all. You can taste the wok fried rice and the rich texture of the oxtail. A must try for the value. $12  Second dish: Garlic noodles. Its as good as you can get! We ordered it plain without proteins but Im pretty sure it would have elevated the dish if I added shrimp to it. $7  Third dish: the lobster pho! Lobster cooked anyway is going to be great! All I cared about was the broth flavor! The broth flavor did not disappoint! The lobster was just as good but it wasnt mind blowing amazing! It was definitley a one hit wonder for me..meaning its not something I would go out of my way for to order again. $49  YOLO dish!  Fast and friendly service!   Tip: this place tend to get busy. I suggest calling ahead to get an idea on wait time or going during slow hours (2pm to 5pm)

fKjhqAoVypyq7fwuEyU1Uw.text: Flavorful food, great atmosphere, attentive wait staff.  Came here on a weekend and waited 30 min for a seat. Got the wings, pho, fish tacos. Everything was excellent.

fx4ag9wQt9HwcKnkWvDkVg.text: This place.  This was kinda disappointing, Yelp.  How or why this place is so highly yelped is beyond me. Everything we ordered was just meh.  In fact, the only thing everyone raved over was the garlic noodles, which ironically was the least expensive of all the things we ordered.  Grilled squid $13 was okay.  I think the tentacles were the best part of it, but the body lacked the char that good grilled squid gets, but maybe that's just my preference.    The fried chicken wings were extremely average to below average.  That definitely was an order that I regretted. It tasted like under seasoned crispy chicken under mound of peppers.    Now to the real reason I splurged nearly half a Benjamin: The lobster pho.  Hardly any lobster (but it does say it's only 1.5lbs) but worse yet, there's hardly noodles!  It tasted decent, but nothing that I will ever wish I could have again.  At the end of the day it just did not live up to the hype, or it's price tag.    It tasted like regular pho broth that had boiled lobster. Lol. Which is pretty much what that was. I felt the noodles were overcooked, and the lobster itself lacked the bite that one expects from fresh lobsters.  Definitely have had better without having to break the bank.

ylsuj7GCQvuqU71kQ00Fiw.text: Bomb dot com! The pho with oxtail hit the spot. I was a bit iffy and thought it would've been a hype. I am visiting from east bay and have high expectation in oxtail soup because that's my all time favorite! But this, this spot is delicious! The broth was very flavorful with a generous amount of oxtail. The Vietnamese iced coffee is really good too. It's almost like home. The decor in the restaurant is nice. A little on the hipster side, but well designed with the board. My friend ordered Surf N Turf which consist of lobster and the broth. He said it was tasty. Whenever I visit Vegas again I would love to try different items on their menu. Fusion food are the best food!

CkIhEtHWHvZU8uiz0rBa0w.text: I'm a stickler when it comes to people getting creative with pho.   Pho burrito? No thanks. Instant pho? Ew.  Pho fries? Nice try.  So as you can believe, I was not really interested in trying a lobster pho. But I gave in to the hype one day and wow. This is really as amazing as they say. This broth is freakin divine. We decided to get the Surf & Turf Pho (~$30) since it was a LOT cheaper than the $50 Maine Lobster Pho, and our server told us that they were practically the same except the Surf & Turf came with rare steak. I don't even like lobster THAT much, and now I'm a lobster pho convert. It's still so pricey, but I really do think this is worth the $. I think the only problem with it is that there wasn't enough of it. It's served in a deep dish that looks huge, but wasn't enough for two to share. It would be an average amount of food for one person. And lemme also just point out that the restaurant itself is really clean, trendy, and the beer was great.  Highly recommend if you're out in Vegas and trying to treat yo self.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf pho

NU6SwT15I8cnp1idual4qw.text: Stopped by here on a recommendation of a friend. I believe it was a Thursday night, they weren't busy so service was pretty fast and the restaurant had a trendy feeling to it.  I ordered the lobster pho, which after taxes came out to about $50. The pho was good but for the price, I felt it could of been done better. If you want to present your friends with some shock value of an entire lobster in pho soup than you won't be disappointed. If I come back to the are I'd like to try other dishes.

0c7L3DIVG-t9zz4UXQKo3A.text: LOBSTER PHO? That is what intrigued me to this place! They also have a location in Taipei!  I came with group of friends (8 people) and it was pretty spacious inside. We got seated right away and the service was great. They play some good music, some old jams, so I was digging it.   I tried: Lobster Pho: This was $49 dollars and it wasn't bad, but I wasn't amazing. They do give you a whole lobster which is great. The broth didn't really taste like lobster broth to me, but the noodles were good, very QQ. I think it's worth trying once, but not twice.  Loco Moco Oxtail Fries: This was interesting. Super creative and the oxtail was BOMB! It was fatty and meat was tender! It went super well with the fries! I recommend!  Overall, this place is pretty instagram worthy and definitely should try once! They have a lot of other great asian fusion dishes that look interesting!

rUVThrv3rBsdXBvQ2r37QA.text: This was bad and expensive.  We will never be a patron of this place ever again.  Lobster Pho was $50.  But all they did was cook the pho separately and plop down the lobster in it.  The taste of the beef bone broth and the lobster did not match at all.  They are two distinct flavors.  Since the dish was $50, they could have done something to bring in the flavors together.  It's too bad they are just lazy.  But I have to give them the fact that the lobster was indeed fresh.  Yellowtail tacos were around $11.  They were the smallest tacos that I ever saw for that price.  The taste was okay.  The did use fresh fish and added some sauce along with the mix.  Slice of lime does help kick it up a notch.  Coconut Pork Belly was also around $12.  This was disappointing.  Waitress told me that this was braised, but it doesn't look or taste like it.  I have made a better braised pork belly that these.  The colors does not look appetizing at all.  It looks like gray and it tasted just like his to looks.  Very nasty.  But I have to give them credit for the half cook egg.  That was fine beautifully.   It I also wish the egg had some of the flavor of the liquid.

h-n7JuDG7gBqVk0Yu3d0cQ.text: Food was delicious and service was great! This is a nice restaurant off the strip (about 10 minutes). The decor is nice and the menu is straightforward. We came for the lobster pho and oxtail pho which did not disappoint. We also had the oxtail fries which were cooked perfectly. The pho was delicious and was nicely sized. We came on a Friday at lunch and it wasn't too busy. We will definitely be coming back when we come to Vegas again!

-zOU8SgrXFRiema9qUp_dQ.text: My wife and I came here for a late dinner. We ordered 3 items to share.   Thing I liked: The Garlic Serrano Wings - it was the best dish we had that night. It was packed of flavor. The wings were crispy and was spicy which I liked but may be just a tad greasy.  Things that were okay: Belly Buns - I like the idea that they deep fried the buns and put a soft and tender slice of pork belly inside the buns, the texture contrast was fun to eat. Flavor was fine no complaints there.  Pho Tai Rib Eye - it was a solid bowl of pho. The noodle texture was fine nice and firm and not soggy. Beef was fine but the soup was a little sweet for my taste.  Service was okay. Nothing great nothing bad.  Overall no big complaints about the restaurant.
