2qF8Lo01xvsQBo9E2eaAmg.text: We went here on Sunday for lunch and everything was excellent.  We got a table right away since the place wasn't busy.  The bun bo hue was good, but they didn't put too many noodles.  Not spicy at all.  My friend ordered com bo luc lac with an egg and he said it was good.  We also ordered coconut ice cream for dessert and it was delicious.  Overall, this place is clean, the services are excellent, and the prices are not bad.

SiPDS2X_-GKBs29TvsteKQ.text: First time here at district one and I'm glad we came. Ask the Chef to do a tasting menu for you and you won't be disappointed. A must try restaurant here in Vegas.

EhVF_ci4HUZgeFhgRIY3kw.text: My family and I visited District One for the first time and we loved the appetizers and Pho. We came during their happy hour and ordered nearly everything on that menu! The staff were very attentive and our waitress Julia was fantastic and engaged with everyone. The Serrano wings were so delicious, not spicy at all, but crunchy and perfectly seasoned. We actually ordered another dozen later on! The garlic fries, beef carpaccio, egg rolls, pork belly buns (delish!), and papaya salad were tasty. The fish tacos were ok, the flavor wasn't that outstanding/bold. We ordered the ribeye Pho and the broth was flavorful, and the noodles perfectly cooked. I tried the Bloody Mary, which was pretty good. The ambience inside was very modern and clean. My mom was with us and she was happy with everything...which is a rarity since she's hard to please, especially with new fusion/modern places! That, plus the awesome service is what makes it 5 stars! Definitely a must visit!

_7owT40MArqsG7lwd7jx1A.text: This places really sucks the worst place I been to in Vegas. They don't have half the food in their menu the food takes like 45 min to come out. I don't know why the pho takes over 50 min to come out when you just add soup and make the noodle.  I would never come again

5Yac17PmDyLNMfLAT3MOjg.text: This place is outstanding. I'm visiting Vegas for a few days and decided to get away from the strip and try something new. The place is a nice sports restaurant with excellent Asian food. The fried rice was awesome along with the noodle soup.  I will be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

ZCLiRbrdnvY6aEhUpEDSgQ.text: went to get a take-away. Excellent service & easy atmosphere. Good choice of IPAs on the tap. Food was as good as advertised! Going back

zHw2-fatD-wBkVmFx8_30g.text: I've dined here twice and both times the food was incredibly tasteless.  The first time I dined at this establishment I had the whole squid. It was so tough and chewy, I had to send it back! The second time, I thought I'd give them another chance and  I ordered the spring rolls and whatever they've in it that's crunchy tasted old and spoiled , like it's been cooked for days, then I had the oxtail loco moco and too much onions in it. The basil that was brought out for the pho was dried and not fresh. I suggest you hire a new cook and come out with fresh ingredients. But on the positive note, I think the service was exceptional!

XsFk-PotV2B9TBzp5zaIPA.text: so far this place has yet to disappoint.  they are known for their bone marrow pho, which I have to to try cause they sell so fast, but their other pho dishes are good.   it's a little more north than china town, which gives locals a chance to done without so many tourist around.  staff is friendly and have seem to gotten to know my friends and I for coming so often.    won't disappoint.  check them out!!

UxduyD2qHdlG_CdBMHNBxA.text: This place was amazing! I've seen some pictures of the food here from friends and decided to take my boyfriend to a late lunch today.Well we scored and came in during happy hour! $1 oysters and .50 cent serano chili wings! Obviously we couldn't pass that up, I also had the fresh scallop sashimi which is only on their specials menu, well worth the $17. For my main dish I had the steak and egg! All delicious and very reasonably priced. Definitely going to be back for some late night happy hour in which they are open till 3am. Everyone who worked here was very friendly and it was a great atmosphere! Awesome job District One :))

oV91b5O00Zpz6Hb1p-eYVA.text: District One - Vietnamese restaurant that is lounge and bar style. Incredibly great service, average check ranging from $13-$15. The food looks beautiful yet it's not the best, however the service is so nice and great that you can't even complain. I would give this restaurant 4/5 because how great the service is.

9ki3Qr8I2SfkT22lVvEDtQ.text: Great place and food! A little different from regular pho, they have lobster or oxtail. I always get the steak and egg and substitute the rice with garlic noodles!  mom always gets the belly bun too

p528shYmuS1z6CU9BsP0pg.text: We came for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon and had a delicious meal. We started with a dozen raw oysters (blue point, $1.50 each), then ordered the coconut pork belly with an egg and the steak and egg dish. My son had the steak pho. We were very pleased with the oysters but thought the main dishes could have used a little work. The pho was delicious! We had some drinks as well and were happy with their draft beer selection. The decor is relaxed and stylish and we enjoyed a nice leisurely lunch. Our server was very friendly and made good suggestions. Definitely worth the $8 Uber ride from our hotel, this unassuming strip mall restaurant was one of our favorite spots we visited all week!

KXGmNI_sAzRRN3TVTZZOMg.text: we got there for happy hour which is from 5-7 pm monday-friday. The pork belly bao buns were on happy hour and it was delicious. It comes two pieces to an order but the pork belly melted in the mouth and the seasoning on it was not too salty. We tried the grill squid and it cooked perfectly the best part of it was the legs because it had the charred taste. The service was good and they kept refilling our water which was a plus. Also tried the spicy beef noodle and it was surprising that it had a kick to it. the oxtail pho was yummy and both the broth was good in balance. Overall the food and service was great will come back again.

ZzKNpift33RvxJKkLzRtCg.text: Food is ok , 4 stars for the lemon they use for PHO was so old the lemon was brown and yellow, the coke was flat but they changed to the new one so it better . Staff was nice , very clean looking place .

ChhgCuQuG2lr7GUMsYT8Xg.text: Was thinking this was a high- class joint catered to the richer...but have to say not bad at all! Loved the food, the feel, and the service! Our party had the oxtail pho, the bone marrow soup, pho meatball, green papa salad, chef's special steak with fries & corn, and garlic noodles....all were tasty! The only warning I must give though is that the papa salad is NOT like your typical one you know and love. This one is light in flavor and has basil plus meats (shrimp, beef, & pork). Hence, very different. Pho broth was great although there was a lack of sauces and seasoning that you could add yourself...only sriracha and his on available. Service was by far the best I've had. Most Asian places lack service A LOT, but this place was top notch on service! I would highly recommend this place.

4Z6gus9K76WbH33ynRtpfQ.text: Ok everyone......when I FINALLY got my bowl of Pho, it tasted great.  So did the spring roll. The price was also reasonable. This review is more about the marginal service and snooty/snotty attitudes of all the staff which is a deal breaker in my book.  2 of us got our Pho 30 min after everyone else at the table. I should have known this was going to happen because the dimwit waitress was STRUGGLING to take our order on the fancy iPad. Then she made up some lame excuse about they ran out of broth and it needed to be heated up. Blah blah blah........save it already.   And finally some stripper chick walked in the place, exposing her side boob to all in attendance.  I, and my family, can't unsee that.

7J5auJvycSUryFSd2ZF5fg.text: It took me a while to realize this but Distrct One was on Munchie's Chefs Night Out. When we got sick of eating the food available on the strip we looked further outward and found Distrct One Kitchen and Bar. We came around dinner time on a Saturday night but was seated almost immediately upon arrival.  What drew my here was the Lobster Pho. Little did I know it was going to be $50 for a bowl...so we decided to grab some quick bites before heading out into the night. We started off with the Fish Sauce Glazed Chicken Wings. Fried perfectly on the outside and still retaining its juicy tenderness inside, the fish sauce glaze was spot on. While pungent, like any fish sauce type dish, it still had that perfect balance of sweet and tangy but nothing overpowering your palate. With the pork buns, I greatly appreciated the addition of pickled carrots and radish that added another layer of texture. The pickled vegetables really helped balance the heaviness of the oyster sauce and fatty pork. And that fatty pork...soooo tender..so fatty...so guilt inducing. We finished out the meal with their oxtail fried rice. For the $12, you get your money's worth with their generous portions and plentiful amount of shredded oxtail. I loved finding the random large clumps sprinkled here and there. Coming with a fried egg helped add a savory texture to the already flavorful fried dish.  Service was decent. They were quick to seat us and explain the menu. Once our order was taken we were rarely checked on beside the refilling of water. When it came to paying for our bill they disappeared with my card for quite some time before returning with the menu.   Now seeing how great our meal of apps and side dishes were, I really wonder if the Pho Lobster would be worth $50. If they can take items as simple as chicken wings and fried rice to a new level, I'm excited to see what they can do with Pho.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano Chicken Wings
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafe Sua Da
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Buns

mPir7wy0Ykmt8V2Z1TvBww.text: Tonight we were able to catch happy hour for 30 minutes. Loved the variety they had on the happy hour menu; however I was a little disappointed that there were no cocktails, only beer or wines. The ultimate goal tonight was to get my hands on the Oxtail Fries(not on the happy hour menu). We got to try the wings, pork buns and fish tacos. The wings let me tell you are divine. Super crunchy and full of flavor without having to drench it in sauce. The pork buns are always a safe and flavorful bet. The tacos though were a disappointment. I saw no fish, only avocados and the other veggies that were inside. It had flavor but it's called fish tacos for a reason. The restaurant was clean, the waiters were friendly and there was no wait for a table. Can't wait to visit again!!!

jNwTsALDJ8kFLHNXfPGGVw.text: We went to district one because of my pho obsession. I have heard a lot of hype about the lobster pho. We ordered it and it had tasted like someone had scooped up the bottom of the ocean and put it in a bowl. It was so foul tasting we had to throw in half a bottle of sriracha and hoison sauce just to get it down. It was so bad we couldn't even finish it. When we got the bill and saw that they charged $50 for one bowl of pho I was pissed!  I'm giving it two stars because our server was nice and the spring rolls where good.  There are much better and much cheaper places to go for pho in Vegas!

BtAJNnxauRJsUhgbPiS1jg.text: Great service, great food! Everything I've tried here is really good. My boyfriend and I especially love the garlic noodles! Never disappoints!

kFxgSmCogpPJT8Csowetuw.text: My 2nd time here and brought family.  Oxtail pho, Oxtail fries, coconut ice cream, bone marrow soup are all good. This visit, service was really slow compared to my 1st visit. I'd have to ask for every frking thing... veggies for the phos. A server brought out 2 veggie plates for 7 bowls of pho... & the last bowl of pho came out after 6 of us finished our foods. Rediculous! & my bone marrow order was given away to the next table and a server said they ran out.... okay... && no apologies! The server said "I guess we gave it to them, yup." Not my luck at restaurants lately. Felt disrespected.

xwdIyBCohp0IWvh7qjkVZQ.text: Awesome food and services. Oxtail Soup and Big-Bone Soup are very good, but my favorites were the Oxtail Fried Rice and the Coconut Icecream. Mixed drinks are also on-point. Overall, I highly recommend this joint!!! Will be back...

bBxl5JNwjSiN6waxm6GoKg.text: In Las Vegas, you probably can relate to how everyone eats at the "hotel" part of Vegas. And they forget that Las Vegas is a city with homes, schools, and restaurants. But District One feels and tastes like the Gordan Ramsey's Hell's Kitchen. The food was great as the steak and eggs I ordered was juicy and cooked to perfection. The service was quick,under five minutes, and note that I'm a kid, so that means for me to say that the sevice was fast, it means fast. As kids are super impatient, our sever, Dash, was great at recommending foods and was super nice. When I first came, I did'nt think this would be so great, as you know, anything that's not connected to the hotels in Vegas but at Vegas is not that popular. Overall, this is a great place to eat if you have enough money to dine at the buffets at the hotels or if you're trying to save money, the food was super good and I hope this message spreads out to other people so many more can try this cusine.

5WJio94mr9Gjtt-yKYaspQ.text: The food here was great and waiters were very friendly. The broth for the big bone was so good. We also order the surf and turf pho and that was ok, not worth $35 but it did taste great. The big bone was 17$ and you can add the noodle for $2 more. The location based off value is not amazing since it's considered a high end viet location, however the food is amazing and I do recommend you to try it when you stop by Vegas. You won't regret it!

YNgqG4knhag3c9OXZ928Ug.text: This place came highly recommended. I will say that it certainly lived up to the hype.   I had the oxtail fried rice. This dish was delicious and came with a generous amount. You could easily share this dish with someone.   My mom got the lobster pho. Let me tell you that was the best pho I have ever tasted. The broth, it's all about the broth. Great portion size and very tasty.   My husband and friend got the garlic noodles with dungeons crab. It was huge! They even shared with us and still had leftovers. It was well worth the money. I will be back for sure!

H2u2cbcIA6wC-bZyCPywMg.text: Haven't been here for years but damn this place cleaned up foreal. Love the decor love the music and the bartender is so cute haha her names Emily. Got the coconut pork belly. Came with rice and pickled Vegies. My boy got the oxtail fried rice and man booooooom dot com. I've never seen such a talented bartender off the strip definitely recommend this place

Dfa0tjLBYyW6OEbYLXuR7A.text: Very good.  we had calamari that might be the best I've ever had. We had ox tail fried rice and lobster pho. Both were very good. the lobster pho came with a whole. It was $50 though we should've asked market price before we ordered.

8OXwwWW5UsN3bhhPwAQ7Dg.text: I was recommended here by many of my friends from the area. Nice place, with great decor. Service is very fast. I ordered the Lobster Pho which was $49 which looks really appealing, but the pho was just normal pho that I would of have tasted from home, but with a lobster. It was nothing special. My girlfriend bought the Bone Marrow pho which was really delicious. All the food is super filling. Would recommend if you are hung over in Vegas. Also, they have Hennessy on tap!

7ZwnEKhbFK_07JyxgGIizA.text: Felt that I needed to give an honest personal opinion. First time there the food was good. This time we decided to try the $50 lobster pho and garlic noodle. I couldn't understand the rave on this. Personally felt it was salty, noodle over cooked, lobster was mushy, soup did not have lobster flavor. Really not worth the money or taste. Garlic noodle was dry and didn't had much garlic taste, this could be the worst garlic noodle I've had. Skipping our third dish, not worth mentioning. However, their service was friendly and attentive which is great. Didn't want to rate 3 stars but felt everyone should know lobster pho is waste of your money.

Z5fRIQLLy4915PxB1-Eqag.text: Cool new find in the Vegas area, off-strip, at the recommendation of a friend. Not your traditional pho, you can order Lobster pho, oxtail pho, or big bone (bone marrow) pho. Naturally we had to try one of each! The lobster pho broth is very light, and you get a decent amount of lobster with your pho. My oxtail pho was delicious, complete with a nice rich broth. The big bone broth was a sight to see! They even give you a straw to suck out the marrow.   We also ordered calamari, belly buns and oxtail fries to start. All fantastic!

G5Jolj_AI9dnFSHt3tT-Sg.text: I love this place. They have the best bo luc lac! It's to tasty and flavorful and was quickly eaten! We order that, the giant beef bone marrow, the chicken clay pot, cornish hen with rice, and a few other dishes. The oysters on ice with caviar, soy sauce, and a thin slice of jalapeno was a big hit. It was delicious and quickly devoured. Everyone there was so friendly and service was very fast. I'd definitely go back here when I'm in town again =)

kX2mMLY7lPbki7MhAXQPQQ.text: Tried the carpaccio and the belly buns. Carpaccio is a must-try. Everyone has pork belly bao buns nowadays,but District One's were the best I have had so far. I want to go back and try other dishes,but it will be hard not to order these two items every time. Very friendly service.

cQw4GfBulTlSq-utdo_Ojw.text: I enjoyed the Pho! That's mainly what's offered on the menu... We had the vegetable spring rolls and the size was great, wasn't a fan of the minty taste in them though... Service was great. Only other recommendation aside from the minty minty spring roll was to have more menu options... Not really much to choose from...

MXEIRG2ncAGufyAnfw4TWQ.text: Had a great lunch here: garlic serrano wings, beef lemongrass in betel leaves, pork spring rolls and the Piece de resistance, shrimp with D1 goodness.  Major props for shrimp with heads on.  REALLY looking forward to them getting their liquor license because the meal warranted some serious beer.  Our server was excellent and attentive.   A few gentle suggestions since I know they are brand new:   1. The little pieces of garlic/serrano didn't really stick to the wings. The pieces that fell into the accompanying daikon salad were delicious though! Would love to have more of that flavor on the actual wing or maybe a special dipping sauce?  2. Would love to see Banh mi on the menu.   3. Also, could use a delicious baguette to soak up the D1 Goodness in the shrimp boil.  4. Maryland blue crabs added to the seafood boil menu when in season.  Can't wait to go back and have BEER.

3Q47X92coJj75d61ZA4weg.text: District One is an interesting place. The food was flavorful and they had great presentation. The portions however, weren't really fit for a meal, more of a "fast food" id recommend this for a one time experience

V1oJqr_g8m2fq8TTUbyM2A.text: The portion size was great and the service was really friendly.

sw7POTcgljzI_Hq7bQUElg.text: Not my favorite Vietnamese place in the valley. I got the birds nest platter and I thought that they could have added more flavor to their sauce and I personally like having mushrooms in mine. The beef was fatty and I didn't eat it. The shrimp was good but could have added more, since I didn't eat the beef. Their spring rolls are TO DIE FOR!!! Some of the best that I've had! Great service but just doesn't have the flavors I want here. Will come back to try the lobster pho tho.

B_qndFLSo4qJR3jnbPW-8Q.text: My first time at this restaurant... The food was generally tasty. Service was awesome and everyone was super friendly. I would go back.

ExuYiNNTuKNaNamPFylCfg.text: I came here and had the oysters and they were fresh. I also tried the lobster pho. It was delicious and the service is just great. They are always there to make sure everything is great. I would recommend this place.

BihMFMjsa41HuOQ3JHQc4g.text: Great service, so many things on the menu I would like to try. Definitely will return on my next visit to Vegas.

w2Ki2mmjRv6L91nfdA_HDQ.text: This place is amazing!!! I took my friends from out of town (LA) and they absolutely loved it. A few days after our first visit, my friends requested to eat there once more before driving back to LA. Our favorite menu items were the fish tacos (a perfect light crunchy shell with diced yellowtail inside), spicy beef noodle soup, their oysters are to die for( topped with caviar and a light ponzu sauce for dressing), the beef carpaccio has plentiful of flavors and melts in your mouth, their spring rolls and fried egg rolls are great, and their lobster pho is one of a kind. I love it here and will be  coming back often. I don't care about what they wear or what shoes they have on as long as the food is good and their service is friendly. The staff is awesome and their manager crystina made sure our whole experience was perfect. And it was! Thank you crystina and district one for two great dinners during this past weekend!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!!!

zCKu-2gKlEKJlPg6vrMP6A.text: I can't believe it's taken me this long to check out District One. I'm a pretty big fan of variety and District One has it. Not only is the food pretty darn good, but the place is CLEAN, with a full bar, and service staff that not only speaks English, but is very friendly, too. D1 has my favorite things to eat in LV: pho, peel and eat crawfish/shrimp in spicy sauce, and fresh spring rolls that actually has fresh herbs in it. Kudos to D1 for paying attention to details: gloves, a bib, and extra bowl pre-set on the table for the shells rather than dumping the shells on the table, egg rolls presented on a bamboo tray, spring rolls looking fresh, cut in half for easy consumption, and did I mention the restaurant is CLEAN?!  On my first visit, I ordered crawfish in spicy D1 sauce and fresh spring rolls. The crawfish were huge and succulent and the sauce was nice and spicy. I mean, my lips turned a shade of red that I wish I was a lipstick color. However, I would have to say that I do favor Hot n Juicy's sauce, but I have no problem batting for the D1 team if they continue to be consistent with their service and food. Looking over their menu, I can't wait to come back for more because I know I'll be a regular for sure.

NPxmoPlRUJnJrbYK7dbR5w.text: This is by far the most unique and amazing Vietnamese fusion. Can't wait to return!  Bravo.

4Wj1gcevCbPdDLIMxtOYUQ.text: Tamarind crab was superb, a little spicy but worth it. Chicken wings good and the rice was good. I would go back. Curious how this place is at night.

tHb2Z3-1myg9eibSC8arPg.text: This place was awesome. We came in around 1am and everyone was nice. Brittany was our server. She was super funny and cute. she did more than a good job catering to my friends and I will def come back whenever I'm in Vegas.

oeYjr-8EfPY6iR573vjhKw.text: they ran out of lobster pho (only reason to drop by).  their other pho was pretty msg'd out otherwise i guess if your hometown pho is already pretty dope, coming to vegas for viet is a step down.   i love the fact that they have a bar and it's a laidback interior.  otherwise, keep your viet urges till you leave sin city.  o yes, service and timeliness was almost worst than your average chinese hole-in-the-wall (too bad!)

9wiFW8gEuBSh57pEY8zEYQ.text: Sooooo good! Delicious twists to traditional foods. Amazing beef carpaccio! And oxtail pho.

OfVQa60c7lUjedgecr1QXw.text: Overall I have to say it is one of the best Vietnamese places in town!  It's young & hip AND authentic.  I ordered the lobster pho to share, oxtail fries of course, and a few other appetizers which were all tasty.  I'm not a big french fry person, but I highly recommend ordering them.  They do a happy hour each day and I definitely plan on coming to that.  The staff is young & friendly. They will talk to you and recommend items as well as just chatting.

_w2ijcDt5i2BfyOHIfk5kA.text: Awesome combination of Vietnamese food and American dining style. I always have the spicy beef noodle and spring roll. It's reAlly good!

XIVDEJEASx66d4JznmJuNQ.text: The lobster pho was ridiculously yummy!! I wish this was closer to my house so I could eat it all the time! Open one in Henderson please!!

upWT-XHAW17kEF14jGIgdw.text: Our waiter was great he helped me narrow down the menu to pick the oxtail with the spicy hue broth which was amazing! Everything we ordered was incredible, the food wasn't the only great thing! The customer service was as well! Our waiter was very accommodating, helpful, and knowledgeable. I wish I could remember his name and will update this if one of my friends remember! He was nice enough to special order the edamame with the garlic and Serranos. It was so delicious! Next time I am in town I will go out of my way to come back!

JkKF3W-11viektkm-l9vBw.text: Came here on a Sunday night for dinner with some friends. I've never heard of this place so I was really excited to dine here. Atmosphere was really nice and relaxing and it wasn't too busy.  We ordered some drinks at the bar before we got seated. The hostess was really sweet and sincere. She sat us at a big booth, that was able to sit the 6 of us. We started with 2 orders of the fish tacos. 1 taco each person and they were mini. Tacos were good, but literally were a teaser. I then ordered 2 fresh springs rolls that came with 4 per order. They were your average spring roll, but still very good. Then we were ready to order, I ordered the oxtail fried rice with an over medium egg. My bf ordered the District 1 combo rice platter which came with short ribs, kim chee, chinese sausage, and either your choice of garlic noodles or white rice. He chose the white rice. Our friends at the table ordered the Birds nest which was crispy noodle chow mein, and also got an order of the grilled squid which was really gooood and not rubbery. Everything was cooked really good and tasted even better.  I would definitely come back to this place and try their lobster pho, which is their most popular menu item.

vdaaq0672HwScEAdTDEHEA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! hands down one of the best oxtail places that i've been to. server was extremely nice and accommodating, and very friendly! food was totally amazing... oxtail pho was super tender and the oxtail locomoco was very tasty. the pork belly buns were very flavorful and slightly spicy, and the bun itself was soft and warm. garlic noodles were also really good... all the dishes we ordered totally surpassed expectations. would definitely come here again.  we ordered: oxtail loco moco oxtail pho rib combo with garlic noodles

YvK6OdRgtYpqXXtq3nqfgg.text: Food is amazing we got oxtail fried rice pork belly bum and bone marrow!! So yummy for my tummy everything tasted so wonderful  definitely coming back again to try the lobster pho next time hehe

tFXFijiOWpVK0RvT7alM3g.text: Pho nam (soup w noodles n beef) is really good for 9.99. Nice portion and good quality. Service friendly and not pretentious. Great selection of spirits. Good, reasonable ,and a very interesting menu.....Lobster Pho......wow! .food is the hit on this trip.. only area of improvement I could see was a better wine list and put drink prices at local prices not the strip. Atmosphere comfortable but nothing over the top to demand nightclub drink prices.  I would return if I was near there. ..

vCXxBafiDFClWljdDOk9Cg.text: We came here for a birthday dinner with twenty people, mostly from Portland, Oregon. And we loved it! We had a prix-fixe menu with oysters on the half shell, pork belly buns, cured beef dish, fried rice, squid, fried fish, and a few other dishes I am forgetting. The only complaint I have was that the squid was too spicy for my liking and was over-grilled. Otherwise everything else was delicious! Seriously, this place tastes ten times better than how it actually looks. It looks like any normal pho place but tastes better than any Vietnamese restaurant that I've ever had. Their cuisine is definitely modern and trendy and everything is packed with flavor.  Then the drinks! I had a moscow mule with a lychee and this was very good. There was also a coconut mojito that was served in an actual coconut and this was also delicious.   For dessert, we had the creme brulee which was pandan flavored, I believe (like the green Asian fruit cakes, if you're familiar with those). And I did not think I would like it since I'm loyal to the classic creme brulee but this was once again, delicious! Packed full of flavor.  I will be CRAVING this place while I'm in Oregon and now I have a new, more trendy Asian restaurant that I can take my parents to - they're very traditional and mostly like only Asian food.  Must-try!!!

YN6qxpi35fRHwFrzDnCIrQ.text: District one is an amazing restaurant. The service is great, fast and friendly. I highly recommend ordering the oxtail fries as a starter .The oxtail meat is tender and an egg on top just makes it that much better . I also recommend the lobster pho , the broth is delicious on its own and the lobster is fresh and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SzQIClnIBL6MNDm0Fel7Pw.text: Oh hell yeah....  off the hook with Surf & Turf Pho....  wow, the cocktails are awesome, the menu is really impressive.  Laid back staff who can actually tell you the specials from memory  ( nice ! ), and alert....  they nail the kalbi ( short ribs ) on the spot. Perfectly done.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1oD_c5mtH1JX7yyed8LlHw.text: The grilled salmon was perfectly seared and skin was nice and crisp. I like salmon, but can be critical on the smell and taste. This was well seasoned and prepared w/the nice contrast of flavors from the topping and further accented w/the pesto on the bottom of the seared potato mash. This place is smart too, because the bowls of soup come in one good size, to make things quick and simple. The lobster ribeye was an even better portion reasonable for the type of food you get. This is a place I can appreciate because of the young fusion aspect that our Era or generation now have grown to expect. I would recommend this place if your into Asian and American variety or looking for a place to hang out w/a group for some fun. Oh yeah, service from the maitre d to the waiter was excellent all around.

FUUIqbooOlKPCm4TqvpnUw.text: We came here the morning after EDC and it did not disappoint. We were all drained and hungover and the food def made us feel better. We ordered the papaya salad and the oysters to start off. Both were very fresh and delicious. The oxtail fried rice was amazing! Our waitress was very nice and patient with us. I would def recommend this place if you are ever in the vegas area.

uUNi-ls-2k7812oQh1Uliw.text: Oxtail pho by itself gets 5 stars!  This is way better than the one at the California and they give you large pieces of oxtail with fall off the bone meat.  The broth is insanely good, especially on the cold winter days in Vegas.  We also tried the big bone marrow soup...that definitely has the wow factor for size, but if you are looking for a healthy portion of meat to noodle to soup ratio...go with the oxtail pho.  Trust me, you will not be disappointed!

EWmIPC8zpBHHxGqHVvj8CQ.text: I think this place was way too hyped up in my opinion. The presentation on all the dishes made my mouth water and got me very excited to come and try this place, but the food was so so. I ordered the ox tail pho which had a lot of meat, but the broth was over powered by star anise flavor. The fish tacos very good but nothing special about it. The goi ga (chicken salad) had a fish sauce dressing which was very sweet.... Too sweet for my tasting. The big bone soup, their speciality.. The meat on the bone was soft and tender, but the marrow the god's butter was extremely cold which made it hard to eat. The broth was the same broth use for the pho so again too much star anise. The best thing was the coconut mojito which was tasty and refreshing. Overall I'm glad I was able to try this place out but I don't think I'll ever be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goi ga pretty good
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special oysters
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail pho, surprisingly there was a lot of meat. Too bad the broth was over powered by too much star anise

cdvhL3Jqm8weELBeWJfeDQ.text: Seriously, not much gets me more excited about coming to the sparkling lights of Las Vegas than money, booze and strippers. Ok I'm lying, I also enjoy the arcade games at Circus Circus and the Bellagio Fountains a great deal but recently District One Kitchen & Bar has resoundingly become one of the reasons I desire coming to Sin City more than I already do.  The Vietnamese inspired food here is simply just amazing and is only rivaled by the incredible service, ambiance and family-friendly vibe this cozy hangout offers up in droves. Oh if these walls could talk, it's the joint to meet up with friends to watch the game, share some drinks, have some laughs, nurse that hangover and have damn good eats. Inventive menu selections include live Maine lobster pho, Surf n Turf pho (lobster and tender slices of ribeye) and oxtail anything. The food presentation is also spot on, for those who love to post their meals on social media (you know who you are) a post from here will guarantee 100 likes and new followers. But seriously, there's really something for any type of mood you're in. I mean let's be honest pho can cure all maladies, I know I eat it to stay young and virile, but the stuff can probably cure Ebola too.  Well, if you're a fan of fun and good food then swing your way on down here and give it a whirl, don't take my word for it. With a full bar, a bodacious staff of waiters and waitresses who are ready to pour your next shot of Fernet or glass of Veuve Clicquot, it's a for sure good time that is certainly Vegas worthy. There's a reason they've recently been named Best New Restaurant of 2014 by Las Vegas Weekly. I'm already planning my next adventure to my home away from home and D1 is going to be on my agenda at least a couple times.

ga0yrfGS62-JKiIb3C9XCw.text: Overall great place to eat. Good Pho, Great creme brulee and Service! Oxtail with Large oxtails. Good size Calamari portion. And Padang Creme Brulee (different but good) and friendly service.

fBativrabyDTQLVAtk6ASw.text: This spot is located in Vegas' very own China Town (yes- Vegas also has a China Town). The place has a modern, industrial feel but smells like your Vietnamese grandma's kitchen. We sat at a booth, but there are tables and a bar to sit at during the wee hours of the night. We showed up here after dinner for some cocktails, yet we ended up eating a second dinner. Cocktails are awesome here-i got the juniper and spice, which has thai basil, gin and chili peppers. Fresh spring rolls came out and they are my favorite- there was something different about them though. They are fresh on the outside with the rice paper wrapped fresh raw veggies and herbs, dunked in peanut sauce, but they also feature a crispy center of fried wonton crunchiness. King crab is served broken into easy chunks with spicy aioli on top- so good. Min Ahi tuna sashimi tacos were also ordered and shared- now these were good! I cannot wait to come back for pho and rice and the crispy bird nest- sounds amazing. Definitely arrive hungry!

aagSXJbeHWwcONMOw0_Whg.text: A friend and I happened upon this place when trying to find another. We decided to stay and luckily enjoyed excellent service. We had oysters and calamari for appetizers which was phenomenal. The oyster toppings were exquisite! I ordered the oxtail pho and requested it a bit spicy. All I can say is DELICIOUS! It had me craving pho for days after we left. We both ordered specialty drinks which weren't much to rave about. I definitely recommend giving the food a try, you'll be hooked.

_Y2j9DPIVc6rFppxKhYMjQ.text: The lobster pho here is my go to every time I come to Vegas. The oxtail fried rice was also bangin. This place have yet to disappoint me out of the four times I've visited. Get the lobster pho don't sleep on it, after all we are in Vegas to ball out.

I couldn't finish all of it. The portions were surprisingly filling for a happy hour menu. The papaya salad was refreshing, but spicy. The egg rolls were savory, they came in 4s. But the best part of the meal in my opinion were the pork buns. Filling and fatty, but soooo good. The place also has a pretty big bar. Next I need to try their lobster pho. That's on the bucket list.

JNWgo8sHQdOLnPOc5Ydbtw.text: I love this place, it's a trendy  Asian fusion pho restaurant with a bar and Tv's all around. Located at shopping center, with plenty of parking space, off the Las Vegas strip. Usually I come here on a Sunday before leaving back to LA. It a casual restaurant and service is great.   Here are my favorites....  Ox Tail Fried Rice it has fried eggs on top.  Bone & Marrow soup,  Oxtail pho,  Slow braised pork belly Belly bun Shaken beef salad Clay pot chicken rice  I didn't really like the lobster pho, I like my lobster to have its own sauce and not drenched in soup but that's just me but I know this place is known for this specialty.  And of course real Coconut juice and Vietnamese drip coffee.

thjzh55Tep8LZAe9gr9UHg.text: District One is an upscale sports bar styled Vietnamese fusion restaurant, nestled in Chinatown amongst a number of other Asian restaurants in a strip mall. I was definitely not expecting a modern atmosphere, and was happy not to have to wait in line at around 11:45am for lunch before my flight out. Highly recommend making the trek from the strip for some good Vietnamese eats here!  * Ox Tail Fried Rice - 5 stars: The oxtail fried rice was chock full of delicious ox tail, large pieces though a little oily as expected. I liked that it was not overly fatty. My favorite dish here! * Pork Belly Buns - 5 stars: Recently went to a food event, Cochon 5050 in Napa which featured  restaurants serving all types of pork. This dish could stand head to head against those dishes. So tender, so flavorful, meaty, delicious! Pro tip: you can order half fried half steamed. Both good but prefer fried for a crispy chewy bun.  * Ox tail pho - 4 stars: Decent pho, have had better noodles. Broth was quite good and there was a lot of tender nonfatty oxtail meat - came with 2 large pieces. I think next time I will opt for the lobster pho. * Chicken Wings - 3 stars: Needed to be bigger and meatier. Too small, tasted dry, and very salty.  * Side soup - 4 stars: salty goodness. Huge bowl only $3.  * Chicken Salad - 2.5 stars: tasted like shredded Costco chicken breast chunks on cabbage. Dressing was just ok. Prefer le Pho.   The service was awesome, the food was great - can't wait to come back and try the rest of their menu! Come early, the restaurant was full with a line at 1230pm on a Saturday!

Get one of each and you wont regret it. Everything was delicious. Must try in Vegas. Bonus-it's away from the strip!!   My glass was cracked and I noticed it after I devoured my drink. But other than that great experience.

vGtNVo-shMnOGd0X-WJTRQ.text: Came here for happy hour...stayed for the happy memories. First of all, this place has happy hour on Fridays and it ends at 7pm. This place is an Asian fusion with familiar names with a modern twist. I can't review their dinner menu since I only ate off the happy hour. Prices are fair for happy hour and service is amazing. I pretty much ordered everything on the happy hour menu and loved most of it. The chicken wings were delicious and crispy. I didn't care for the fish tacos but all my friends loved it. Oysters are fresh and decently sized. Only dish I didn't like was the beef carpaccio. Me and my friends felt it was TOO raw. I enjoyed this restaurant and I'm excited to try their dinner menu.

AJq0xzmy3vwuo-2ZBjJrgA.text: Horrible food. The fried rice and pho we got was disgusting. I would never return. The place was not clean. One star only because the server and manager seemed to care for their customers.

xhzM4LiqjrK357EiSoGUEA.text: My husband and I love coming here. We have tried the famous Oxtail fried rice, crispy egg rolls, oysters and their pho soups. All delicious! The staff is very accommodating. So far no complaints and worth the drive!

mBbFcB_gc9df2w9QiWx6xg.text: Probably my favorite pho place in Vegas. We always stop by before heading home to LA for that hangover cure. The restaurant is located in a big plaza, plenty of parking. There's usually no wait when I come but it does get pretty busy.   Here are a few things I've tried: - Shrimp and pork spring rolls, one of my favorites because I love the dipping sauce that comes with it. Only down side is that it only comes with 2 spring rolls cut into 4 pieces for $6. Pretty steep in my opinion, but I always order it anyways.  - Pork belly buns: meh, they were okay. I've had better elsewhere.  - Pho dac biet: my bf always orders this, he seems to like it. No complaints.  - Ox tail pho: yum! My favorite because the meat literally falls off the bone! They give you a good amount of ox tail as well. The broth is super flavorful. I crave this and I wish we had a good ox tail pho place back in LA.  - Mekong River noodle soup: was not a fan, stick to the pho  Food takes some time to come out, but service is always friendly. Will be back the next time I'm in town!

U7Xl_DX_WduMmpP1gC1ifg.text: We wanted to be adventurous one night so we decided to try District One. Once we were there, I remembered that I had been there once when I first moved here, but I couldn't remember anything besides the interesting drink menu.  The decor inside is kind of a mix between a casual restaurant and a sports bar. They have a lot of interesting-sounding dishes, but unfortunately, a lot of them do not live up to their interesting descriptions.  The garlic chicken wings were probably the last thing we ordered that came out, and I was excited for them the whole time we waited. By the time they came, they were pretty disappointing. Very dry and no flavor on the outside. When I asked for any sort of sauce they thought could go with it, they brought me a chipotle mayonnaise, which was really unappetizing and does not go with chicken wings.  We got the short rib, which was alright, but extremely salty, to the point that I couldn't eat more than a few bites.  We also ordered a papaya salad, as my boyfriend love love loves those, and he said it was the worst he's had :/ After having a few papaya salads since then I would have to agree. It was just not made the same way they usually are - very little flavor and no crunch to the salad.  On a high note, the garlic noodles were very good as was the steak tartare, which I believe was titled a vietnamese take on the dish and I found it to be uniquely tasty.  The dessert was the best part of the meal. Coconut ice cream inside half a coconut - very delicious, crisp and not overwhelmingly sweet.

P2vdzWUBrQ-GG7G3f9p8EQ.text: Long overdue review!  I personally think District One is underrated. I've been several times in the past few years - and my experiences have all been quite delightful!   Food:  Pretty good, however, the main reason why they get 4 stars and not 5. It's not over the top impressive but there are some tasty dishes I've enjoyed!   - Shaken Beef Salad: Greens topped with Extremely tender pieces of flavorful marinated meat and dressing   - Grilled Whole Squid  A dish I never get sick of, sliced grilled squid that comes with a spicy (siracha mayo?) aioli for dipping   - Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup  Great heat, decent flavor, not a lot of noodles but comes with a variety of different meats   I've also tried various specials of the day including fresh oysters, king crab legs, whole boiled sea snails (in the shell) - all were tasty and unique  Service: Very friendly bartenders and servers! Servers are knowledgeable about the menu and provide the specials of the day, which always vary   Ambiance:  Hip and visually appealing. Lots of seating available: bar, tables, and booths. I love the large comfortable booths!   Overall District One is a fun spot to grab food and drinks, great for all occasions. If you haven't checked it out I would definitely recommend it!

B9Gr5T-1ok1FJkzV2HHqtw.text: I really, really love this place. From the food, to the drinks, and the service--this place is awesome! As a vegetarian, the garlic noodles have become something that I literally crave. So so good and garlic-y. I also like the tofu spring rolls. The drink selection here is great too. The bartenders (more like mixologists) really know what they're doing and can make the most delicious and customized concoctions imaginable. The staff are so kind too. This place has seriously become one of my favorite places in town!

JYmVqamLVJE1FaTez2u5DQ.text: I ordered the double down with spare ribs and it was just like a home cooked meal. The ribs were cooked to perfection,  it was not dry...or was juicy and very flavorful. The rice was nicely steamed. I did not have any dried pieces of rice like how some restaurants serve their rice. The pickled veggies were done just right.perfect balance of sweet and tangy. My BF ordered the coconut pork belly...he thought it was going to be fried...but it's a soup with a sour bite at the end...not for me. But he liked it. We also ordered the Vietnamese donkey and Viet Chelada and they were both really flavorful and unique...great creation by the restaurant. My Chelada was nice and toasty and the bits of toasted sesame seeds gave a nice texture to it too. The other drink was sweet but not over powerful. We'd definitely recommend the restaurant and return soon.

XMHzyM1V6TBqAfBMeXZINA.text: District One is probably one of the trendiest places that you can order pho from. Almost everywhere you look has a TV screen that shows live games. A huge plus for me was that they had NBATV. The music is also nice, setting a "hip" atmosphere.  District One has an impressive bar selection. Usually, I would order a Blue Moon. Enter: Kronenbourg Blanc. I was introduced to Kronenbourg Blanc at District One, and I am glad that I have stumbled upon it. I haven't found many restaurants that offer it, but it's better than Blue Moon!  I ordered the steak and eggs. It contained small cut pieces of steak, tossed around in some sauce, tomato rice, and a fried egg. Not your typical steak and eggs, but this tasted pretty good.  They have pho oxtail as well here too, which I recommend. Their broth is better than most in Vegas which are bland. Another famous dish they have is the lobster pho, which is great for pictures. Not to also mention their Big Bone soup, which consists of a huge bone where you can stick a long spoon in and get all of the bone marrow goodness!   Great atmosphere, place to watch the games, and grub!

62Sm-JHGh5qguA9O7gGYiw.text: I learned quickly that is a late night spot for industry folks and I can see why. Their menu is full of unique eats that will make your mouth water at all hours. Their mission? To create a unique dining experience that reflects their personalities. If their menu is any indication of the folks behind the business, I want to meet every single one of them.   My (so-far) favorite is the the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio. Thinly sliced with a mix of citrus soy, truffle oil, sesame, and peanuts. It's simply mouthwatering, melt in your mouth good.  I simply must try the Oxtail Fries and The Big Bone Soup.  I can't wait to plan my next late night Happy Hour experience, except it won't be a Tuesday, because they are closed,.

UtliNHh2j-dePFlrshd_Mg.text: We came here to watch the stupid Trojans lose to BC.  Seriously, BC?  What the hell guys, where was that defense?  BC, really????  Aaaaaarrrggghhhhhhhh!!!!!!  Not sure what's worse, that or UNLV losing to Northern Illinois... Pathetic and Pathetic-er.  Okay, done venting.  So it is great to find a cool ASIAN bar where you can actually watch games!  And they come with great food, which is double great!  $20 pitcher of Heineken is a bit steep, but it does fill up about 6 tall glasses and it comes in those pitchers with built in ice cooler.  Miller Lites are $15 for the pitcher, if you're looking for better bargains.  The food is more Vietnamese fusion than diverse Asian, but no matter, it's still good stuff.  We had a few dishes:  Ox Tail Pho, Garlic Serrano Pepper Wings, Beef Lemongrass skewers, and Calamari.  The pho was fantastic, calamari was great, and wings and skewers were good but not great.  The meatiness of the ox tail and the light & crispy batter on the calamari stood out.  There are other interesting dishes we want to try out, which will have to wait for the next time.  The real winner that is a great accompaniment to the good food is the atmosphere.  Wait staff was great for the most part, and like a typical Asian restaurant they don't have "designated" sections for each server so you can flag anybody down for what you need.  They're very good about coming around and waiting on your table, and many of them were even social with the customers in a pleasant and non-intrusive way.  Big ups for the wait staff.  There are TVs all around every section of the place, so wherever you sit you will have multiple views of the action.  Wish the TVs were a bit bigger though, although they were close enough that it wasn't a bother.  Great atmosphere, great wait staff (including the super cutie that appeared to be the hostess/manager?), and great food all make for a great "bar" that deserves at least 4.5 stars.  Oh, the tab came to $150 before tips for the 4 of us, but I suppose when you order 4 $20 pitchers... but the price is a bit steeper than your typical Vietnamese.  Table-for-1 Factor:  I'm not seeing this place as a great atmosphere for sitting alone (might be awkward), but there is a bar with good 8-10 bar stools if you have the inkling.

6TXCDU5JkJeWUzmuoyzMyQ.text: Awesome service .... Great food. I love the snails :) Beef carpaccio is the best, I love almost every dishes.

l5_cc6DbCq70OQ3AlmJB3A.text: We used to go here 3-5 times a week. Always ordering a slew of food, bringing friends, family and associates and recommending them left and right. Then we stopped completely.   Gone are the days of our favorite lobster pho, braised pork belly and oxtail pho. The food is delicious. The service is abysmal.   What happened district one? Why'd the servers get so sour?   Competition in Vegas is fierce. You were top contenders on being amongst the best of the best. And then- kaploot.   BUT-- not to take away from the food. It's delicious. The service just needs work.

BVZlMueizWHip9YYHayxvw.text: amazing.   the best pho in vegas  I've been here 5 or 6 times and I've gotten the rare ribeye pho,  the spring rolls and the calamari.. all 3 exceed expectations.   they have a maine lobster pho that i will try eventually.. noone else offers it  i usually go to my local place for pho when i crave it but i will come here when i want a lil extra  quality service and quality food  cant go wrong here

jydsSiBaPXjaAN4cuEf5fQ.text: Awesome Vietnamese joints are a dime a dozen in Vegas, so let me tell you why you should choose this one.  First, the whole place can only be described as stellar Vietnamese food meets hip, modern, clean Brooklyn-hipster decor meets Texas BBQ-sized portions. Allow me to elaborate:  - I have gone here three times in the last week, each time with a big crowd. This means I've sampled a lot of the menu. Must eat: eggrolls with lettuce wrap, thai basil, radish; pork buns pork buns pork buns; steak Pho--I almost never get pho anywhere because I find it boring, flavorless, and not-filling. This is not the case here. This is, hands down, the best pho I've ever had; fish tacos  - This place is huge and clean, with "chalkboard" walls, long tables, concrete floors, and plenty of room to spread out. It's not one of those drab, dark, maroon carpeted joints that Spring Mountain has plenty of.   - The portions are enormous. Every plate is just overflowing with goodness.  On top of all of that, the service is great. Friendly, attentive but not overbearing, and speedy. This is clearly a family-owned and run establishment and it's likely that the people telling you about the specials and serving your food have a vested interest in making sure you have an excellent time, and it shows.

ejWH5DEhUWsPE52d84TexQ.text: This place is amazing! First time trying we got take out and ate at home and everything was great... Second time went and ate there and was even more impressed.  Really fast service and the atmosphere is pretty cool in there.  Got the whole grilled squid... The sauce it comes with is bomb... Super spicy.  Tried the shrimp when we went there, I've had boiling crab and hot n juicy before and I feel like the spices for district one are way better! Also tried the pork bao puns which are sooooo good.  Definitely a cool little spot Id recommend.  They have a good mixture of food for different options

Order  chicken wing-very bland, no flavor what so ever not even the chile. Fish tacos- could not taste the fish only avocado, made me wonder if there were any fish so I head to do a double take. Bun bo- good flavor just a little too salty for my taste.  Best thing that  actually  redeem itself was the oxtail fried rice, it was delicious. Overall will  give it another.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No flavor, even chile had no taste must have forgotten the sauce.

UOUe9_PUy3s2kDbnBidl9w.text: I have been here twice now and and it's because this place had a lot of buzz over the summer. Even though I am really curious as to how the oxtail pho is I have yet to try it. Since this is an Asian fusion place, both of the times I brought visitors here from out of town and the food did not disappoint. For the most part they execute their dishes pretty well. Often times Asian fusion restaurants tend to over due it as in "trying to hard," but that is not the case here because their fusion is just a slight twist on the original dishes. The first time I was not too hungry and I ate the tacos which were phenomenal. The light crispness of the wonton and then the freshness of the yellow tail make it a match made in heaven. Although delicious they are super small and kind of pricey for what you pay for. However, I guess the fresh fish constitutes it. On both of my visits we ordered the tacos and they did not disappoint any members of my party. The second time I had the combo platter with the beef short ribs and I do love me some short ribs. I am usually not a fan of Chinese sausage, but surprisingly I ate what was served on my plate because the flavor wasn't too overwhelming like it usually is. I must say I originally ordered the pork chop but then it was served with short ribs. Our server who took my order even saw the short ribs on my plate and immediately told his co-server that it's supposed to be pork chop. I was hungry and did not want to wait so I didn't mind the short ribs at all. My 2 other friends who were with me also ordered the combo platter but with both meats. I tried the pork chop from their plate and thought it was good. This place is pretty popular considering both times I've come here I've bumped into people I know. My friend ordered a coconut martini and it was served in a coconut, pretty awesome I must say. That's probably Asian fusion at it's finest. I've also been told by 2 friends that the coconut ice cream is to die for. So I must try that the next time I'm here. In regards to service, service is pretty good. On my first visit our server was Adrienne and she was pretty spectacular. The other members of our party could not decide to order so she basically gave a description of everything on the menu. She even gave my friend suggestions on what to order based off of what he craving. She was really patient and pleasant during our entire dining experience. This place has definitely become a stable in town and it certainly is one now in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib platter

p4djV3d1McEZaUrTYwhX3w.text: World's best fish tacos. Full Bar, quality seafood selection, and a great atmosphere! This is a well thought out business that cares about quality!

0RlU68EeLBJxW9b2FLxR-Q.text: Every time I go to Vegas I stop by here about two to three time before I when home ... Food is very good ... A little salty but I know why they wanted you to drink more. The food range from French to Vietnam with an American twist I quess  that is why they call it fusion. You must try all the dish and pick your favorite as for me the wings and service is the reason why I come back every time ... All my friends love the fish Tacos

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef salad , fish taco ( must order) and ox tail gravy fries
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef with truffle oil and ox tail Phö and rice with short ribs and pork chop

qwd1RbSxAdfqd1Z6_frjpA.text: Stopped in for a quick bite while we were in town. Came here about 4 months ago and thought the world of this place. The ambiance was super cute for a Vietnamese spot, definitely different from your normal pho place. Since the time we were here last, they jacked up the prices a few dollars! $14 for oxtail pho?? I can get that back home for $7 and it's way tastier. Also tried the pork belly braised in coconut juice... $10 for 3 pieces of pork and 1 egg. I think my grandma would freak out if she knew I paid that much for "thit kho". Service was great but not sure if its worth it to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi tacos, ox tail pho, ox tail fried rice and pork belly buns. Tacos were my fav, the rest was eh. Oxtail needs more love!

Z1BVNGpiKQ9_VDTyUc61Tg.text: Came here for dinner on Friday night and it was pretty good. I ordered the oxtail pho which had good flavor and 2 huge oxtails. The oxtail meat was tender and fell off the bone easily. I also ordered the snails which was one of their specials. It was so good. I wanted to try the razor clams but they didn't have it that day. But the snails were delicious - very sweet and most of the snails were a good size. Service was good from the hostess. I had a lychee martini  - at first they didn't have lychee because they ran out but somehow they got some for me. From the pictures, I thought the restaurant was more fancy but when you enter the restaurant, it has a more casual dining vibe. I will definitely come back to try their bone marrow soup, lobster pho and maybe some of the desserts. Highly recommend - especially for the unusual items like razor clams and sea snails!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee martini

P3g9e-S5AJzjDbMhwIraRg.text: My best friend and I loved their shrimp the first time we tried them. We had to come back for more! This is our go to place when we have a seafood craving late at night. Their service is good. The servers are nice and friendly. I get a good vibe from this place, which adds on to the pros. Presentation of the food is cute. Simple but nice.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Y2Nk09EBGSJULnEaw2CrA.text: This place is LEGIT!!!  Servers are sweet.  Britney and Jonnazel are the sweetest and attentative!!!  Their fusion stuff is awesome. Definitely a better variety compared to other places.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O2w7Vn6ljkhO9XH-WxYf1A.text: What a great experience trying modern Vietnamese food! So here's my reviews on the dishes:  *Oxtail fried rice was perfect! There was a good amount of meat.They give you a good portion to share with at least 3 people.   *Yellowtail tacos were delish! They tasted like ceviche fish tacos. I just think they were a little small for $6 for two tacos.  *Sea Snails were okay. They gave you at least 10 and they're the big sea snails too. I just thought they needed more seasonings.  *Pork Buns weren't that good. It was kinda dry and the meat was small. I wouldn't order it again.   Adrienne was our server and she was great and attentive! I would come back here and try their pho!

xQjlolo6ba7EzEHvyD0rtA.text: Pork Belly Buns Fish Taco Wok Clams and Basil  Friday late night (ten-something)... I expected a bigger crowd. And I especially expected a bigger crowd with the type of service we received. Two servers walked by and neither returned to fill my empty water glass.  I found the food un-inspiring. I literally said to myself, "Why did I get clams and basil here when it's so much better at a traditional Chinese restaurant?" I thought the the proportion of fat to meat in the pork belly buns was overwhelming. The fish tacos, I don't even remember them enough for an accurate description.   It's unlikely we will return here. It's just too mediocre.

Kc2hd7oVq9m0WuLaqEbZ6Q.text: Amazing Asian food! Get a variety and go all out. Don't miss the in tail that was my favorite. But honestly it's all great. Amazing cocktails and fun atmosphere is come back.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LvSzLqdOwLbI2XKSANEY-w.text: Awesome! Lobster Pho, oysters, Vietnamese chicken salad. Need I say more?    Wonderful!

ZL8XO7P0CPIqZYpRP7uvzw.text: I can't believe I have never been to this little nook filled with so many great restaurants. A group and I came on a Sunday night, and we were seated immediately by a friendly hostess - All of the staff was incredibly friendly!  They had an eclectic menu, filled with lots of meats and fish. I am not a big meat or fish eater, but I was able to order some dishes that were more veggie-based. I started with a pear cocktail and some tofu-veggie rolls. Their cocktails are incredible! I sampled a few others and would come back for these cocktails alone ;) The tofu spring rolls were quite filling and had some sort of tempura crunch at the center.   The group ordered a bunch of other items including oysters and fish tacos, but I just took pictures, since that really wasn't my thing. I ordered the "Bird's Nest" with veggies only. This thing was massive! I don't think I have ever had crispy noodles again, but they were so tasty, covered in a savory gravy (and would definitely help if your'e getting over a hangover fyi). The gravy combined with the crispy noodles softened the noodles into a smoother texture. And all of the veggies on top created a dynamic flavoring to the dish.   The table finished off with two orders of creme brulee. This was no ordinary creme brulee. Unfortunately, I can't remember the name of the primary ingredient, but the green filling tasted more earthy (in a good way) than the normal version. Topped with raspberries and powdered sugar, this was definitely a memorable dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crime brûlée
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The birds nest

_k4XK7RobSQnualT_sDE7A.text: My girlfriends and I stopped by here on the way home from Vegas. It was my first time here and oh my gosh - I was blown away! Why haven't I came here sooner?! We got many dishes and shared between 6 girls. In no particular order, we got:   1) oxtail fries 2) Vietnamese beef carpaccio 3) goi ga chicken salad 4) oxtail fried rice 5) oxtail pho 6) rib eye pho 7) big bone soup  8) fresh coconut   Definitely try the carpaccio if you love truffle like me! It was my favorite dish out of all the items. The oxtail fried rice and pho was also "fall off the bone" delicious. If you also like none barrow, get the big bone soup! It does not come with noodles so we got an extra bowl of noodles $5 but none of us even ate it so I could pass on the extra noddles next time! The soup, meat and bone barrow in itself is enough to satisfy my tastebuds. Yum! I wish they would have a place like this in CA. I will come back next time I'm in Vegas!

ZEL9IpH9ijiyS9nQlpNW3Q.text: Everything on the menu is 5 Stars!!! But the level of customer service the entire team provides is nothing but the best if I could give Cristina and Kai 10 Stars I would but I guess 5 stars will have to suffice.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole 1.5 LB Main Lobster Pho! Ask for Mama and tell her Alex from Seattle sent you for a surprise!

O_bUBHubAU6AkQlEOSlZ8g.text: Found this spot on a list of "best Vegas restaurants" so decided to drop by for lunch over the weekend. It's nestled among a bunch of different Asian restaurants and businesses in a charming Chinatown strip mall. The inside has a casual kind of punk-rock feel with natural light illuminating the darker color palette.   I thought the western-influenced Asian food was tasty but none of the dishes were truly exceptional. Of the small plates, we sampled the sea snails, fried calamari, and yellow-tail fish tacos. The sea snails had to be coaxed out of their large shells with a stick and fork; they were meatier than other escargot I've had in the past, and the natural ocean-like flavors weren't overly masked by butter and garlic. One or two were a treat, but the strong flavor sort of overwhelms your palate after that. The tacos were nice, but I wish the buttery yellowtail flavor shone more strongly with each bite. The calamari was the best appetizer in my opinion. The exterior was crunchy, but the inside was tender and the seasoning was just right. The accompanying aioli was on point as well. For dishes, we chose the Pho Oxtail and Coconut Pork Belly. The pho broth was fairly standard and underwhelming, but the meat was flavorful and abundant in the bowl. The pork was very rich and, similar to the snails, almost TOO much of a good thing. I also couldn't really identify the taste or fragrance of coconut in the rice. Overall, I enjoyed the dining experience at District One and it was well worth the trip. I should also note that they're drinks were a big hit, particularly their refreshing non-alcoholic juices with restorative ingredients like honey and ginger.

J5P3FmN2SGK-Lw7r0RPHTg.text: We originally planned to eat at another restaurant in this restaurants galore strip mall but it was closed on Friday.  So glad District One was less than 20 feet away.  As someone who needs to eat gluten free, District One has options.  I've had the pork belly dish and oxtail fried on other occasions, but this time I was craving a spicy bowl of Bun bo Hue.  They offer it here and it is marvelously spicy.  The broth did not disappoint. It had numerous flavors that gave it a depth that other Vietnamese restaurants can't seem to achieve.  It was almost too spicy for me.  I really enjoyed it though and would come again to try other options.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cRtVZN22Dy_nSTuWq5UAeg.text: Excellent the best food on earth  highly recommended . I've to come here every time I visit Las Vegas

cGCDFPO1rlAGYC0JbQqT1A.text: This place is always packed with the regular customer always come back for more, and they delivery inventive, great-tasting and that will please your taste buds. Chef Khai is a chef on the rise and is always out to blow our senses and tastebuds

ryTCsMczlp0MAjGq5H3LYg.text: We discovered this place by mentioning to our Uber driver that we were hungry. He asked what we like, we said Asian. And he recommended District One. We took the leap and agreed to check it out. He drove for what felt like a long time and serenaded us all the way there (but that is for a different review).  It felt like we were going way out of Vegas, but the Uber ride was still only $8, we ended up in Chinatown.  District One, what a find. We had the Pho. When they tell you it is spicy, believe them. We order the Spring Rolls. Amazing. But the winner for us was the Oxtail Fried Rice. This is hands down the best Fried Rice I have ever had. In my life. If you come here, this is the must order. I also had the Vietnamese Mule, which is their version of the Moscow Mule. It was also the best Mule I have ever had.  For all three of us, the food and cocktails - $54.  We are going back for sure.

VoBptKfRZGWgbw7M_BWrIQ.text: we had a large party of like 10 girls i think & they were nice and let us sit before the entire party was there. but it wasn't a busy day, came on a Friday afternoon and there was plenty of seating inside, not much of a wait. parking lot seems easy to park but we did take uber from our hotel.   we ordered quite a bit of food. the appetizers are probably enough to fill you up! we had the spring rolls, calamari, pork belly steamed buns, and oxtail fries for appetizers between 3 girls (we were really hungry), and upon finish all this we were SO FULL that we couldn't even touch the actual entree haha.   spring rolls were alright, it had a crunch in the inside and honestly, thought it was good, i'd pass on this and save room for other items on the menu! the calamari + the sauce was so bomb! the calamari had a lot of peppers and jalapenos in there so it can be a spicy bite for those who can't eat spice, be careful! pork belly with steamed buns could've been a bit more saucier/juicier, and it's literally all fat of the pork belly lol i'll probably pass on this too next time. the oxtail fries were so good though! i would suggest you try this and the calamari of everything.   the other girls ordered the giant bone marrow soup, it's literally the bone marrow and soup lol but it's HUGE! we also had their pho and the meat was good and tender, the pho noodles and soup were good too! the soup was tasty and not too oily! we also ordered the Vietnamese coffee, it's like a french style drip coffee with condensed milk inside, so if you don't like sweet coffee, ask for it without condensed milk!   overall, i really enjoyed my meal and truly overstuffed myself this time! lol i'll come back to try all the other pho soup meals or their district one specials they have instead of focusing on the appetizers lol

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 07/2018
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese coffee
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hujvGGjCToMYtrz1t1sYWg.text: Went to Vegas for my birthday and District One was my first stop. Love the atmosphere, very modern and fun. Service was fast and attentive as well. We opt out of getting the lobster pho but we did get oxtail pho and just a regular pho. A good Vietnamese restaurant shouldn't butcher pho, and it definitely didn't disappoint. Yes, I've had better pho but the pho wasn't the star of the show anyways. We also got garlic noodles and paired it with their grill squid. Grill squid paired with their sauce on the side was amazinggg. Highly addictive and paired well with the garlic noodles. We also got the double down, which was probably the most disappointing dish we got. Nothing spectacular, can't really mess up rice, lap xuong, meat and eggs. The oxtail fried rice was definitely more worth it if you're going to get a rice dish. Very flavorful and filling. For the five of us, it was barely $100 and we were all full and satisfied. Would definitely return.

JYJVBiDipFz9N5NZfkHKUw.text: This was recommended by couple friends. I didnt order Pho lobster bc I can't justify paying $50 for a bowl of Pho. I ordered black pepper garlic noodle with lobster, 1/2 dozen oysters, fish tacos, oxtail Pho, wine, coconut ice cream. Nothing special about oysters.. not as fresh as we expected. Fish tacos were decent, however, super small!!! Oxtail Pho was shared by my kids. I tasted the broth and it was good but my husband felt it has msg in it.   Biggest disappointment was the garlic noodle with lobster. The noodle was soggy and super salty. Lobster was small and salty. A lot of oyster sauce in this dish. We ended up trying to eat the lobster to justify paying $50 for it. Let the waitress know the dish is so salty... prob can tell from all the noodles and some lobster being leftover and not bother to pack home .   Coconut ice cream is actually very good. Very creamy.   Overall, not coming back nor recommending to friends.

de6beLvq7sREvspVv1UU4w.text: Came here today and had the "Surf and Turf" Pho. It was the lobster + ribeye slices. The broth was very good, a little on the sweeter side. The lobster had some sizable pieces including the claw and the ribeye was of higher quality.   The only drawback to the "Surf and Turf" pho was that they do not give you as much noodle and it was fairly expensive. It came out to a whopping $33. I would say that you should either try the "Maine Lobster Pho" or "Surf and Turf Pho" at least once, but its probably something that I would only get once.   They seemed to have a decent collection of whiskey here. I was surprised that they had the Yamazaki Japanese Whiskey which is a definite plus.

LYdLvx12DPscEh5MBumR0Q.text: Price is a little on the high end. The grilled squid appetizer was great and portion is huge!

as-lyVL3FDcW-DPxpi5-Tw.text: Pho-king delicious! Definitely a bit pricy since I am used to spending around $10 for regular beef pho, so spending $50 can be hard to digest, but considering you are getting a full lobster, which was very fresh, I think this was worth trying! Broth was nice and doesn't feel greasy or filled with MSG that you would get from other pho soups.   We also tried the pork belly buns, which come with 3 buns. They give you the option to have the buns fried or regular and since we typically have had the regular ones we decided to try something different and get 2 fried and 1 regular. The fried ones were ok, but if I had to go back I would definitely stick to the regular versions. Overall it was pretty good.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho

djSesJ14_bwvC6yQlP_dxw.text: We originally came for PHO, but ended up eating off the Happy Hour menu except for one of us who actually ordered PHO.   This place has a really good Happy Hour Menu.  What we ordered:  Serrano Pepper Wings (6pc) .50 ea Belly Buns (2) $3.99  Crispy Egg Rolls (4) $3.99  Green Papaya Salad $5.99  Garlic Fries $2.99  I was really happy with it, especially the Green Papaya Salad.  I couldn't stop telling my co-workers how much I enjoyed it.  It was great in taste.  Not to salty, nor to spicy.    I didn't care too much for the belly buns.  They were just okay.  The garlic fries, wings and egg rolls were decent.  The wings had the right amount of heat.  Service was good.  Made reservations and when I got there it wasn't busy.  Waiter told me to pick a seat.  I was offered a drink when I sat down and the staff was attentive to when the rest of my party arrived.  I did wish they had calamari on the Happy Hour menu.  So with that being said, I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu.  Happy Eatings!

5i9HjrTRta80bE1i-jm8_A.text: Get the lobster pho added with some ribeye steak ( tip as for it to be nice and hot made the broth all the better) they even have a joint promo for dom and Hennessy would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love. Lobster pho with added meat on the bottom.

Pt5XrOSyaXRNrgfm02IPUA.text: I've been coming here for a while and the food and staff are always fantastic. Some menu items are better than others. Today we had lobster pho, oxtail pho, and the king crab.  The lobster pho is never a disappointment. The broth is very flavorful and you can taste the lobster that was cooked in the broth- it's worth every penny.  I'm not sure what they did differently with the oxtail pho but I've become addicted. It was okay before but now it's AMAZING. The meat is so tender and flavorful we keep coming back for more. It'a now one of the top places in town for oxtail.  The king crab with spicy aioli is fairly new and is a must try. They did an excellent job with the flavors although it was a bit spicy for me. I don't eat too much hot food but that certainly didn't prevent me from finishing it.  Although pho-ghetti is no longer on the menu, I'm mentioning it in hopes that it will return one day. It was such a unique, delicious dish that I was coming at least once a week for it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho

C2z_wUuIHCx2ZjbB00Ft_w.text: This restaurant is located in the Mountain View Plaza. They create a fusion of Asian and Vietnamese Cuisines. They have Happy Hour from Monday to Friday 5pm-7pm and Monday to Thursday 12am-2am. There is a young camaraderie and casual feel in the atmosphere, and there are plenty of seating. If you enjoy the sports channel, they have at least 10 televisions at every angle. So it doesn't matter where you sit, you will always find something to watch.  Even though the menu looks simple, the meal that they create are full of flavor. I chose the Garlic Noodles ($7.99) with Chicken ($3) and Mix Vegetables ($3). My order came with egg noodles sauteed in wok fried garlic, tender chicken, broccoli, slice carrots, onions, chunks of zucchini and yellow squash, and cilantro. I really love the garlic noodles and how they leave a little crunch in the mix vegetables. It taste perfect!  What intrigue me most is how on point the service is. It didn't take long for the food to arrive and during my meal they ask if everything is okay. They also come by to refill my drink and I really appreciate how they handle payment efficiently.

jVaIbJgCSMtH_0he3W19Lw.text: BOMB!  Can't wait to go back.   Killer cocktails and the oysters gave me LIFE!   Happy Hour is bomb. The customer service is even better.  And I really love the ambience!

x3Sxz14eIAUZHmmx7X5rMg.text: Big bone pho is legit definitely share with someone you've been warned haha Jennifer was sweet and very attentive to us.  Food was great service was great price was right. Highly recommended and you better come hungry!

DMdsyylXHwV1TxsV5enu8A.text: This is my go to place for quality pho. I also love the oxtail fried rice! I wish it came in a small size as well, because i would love to get pho and a small side of fried rice.  The reason this place only gets four stars is because whenever I order the oxtail fried rice, they put soooo much onions. Im not an onion hater, but its like they barley even cut the onions (see photos). So I would recommend anyone to just order light onions.  Also almost everytime the egg comes overcooked. It tastes good however the egg comes, but why ask how I want my egg (over easy) when it almost always comes with a completely cooked yolk.
