Ny-Y4d-SoFjPwic2-dJOtQ.text: The food was very good but do expect to pay a bit extra. Service was nice and friendly.  We ordered a bunch of seafood and meat dishes to share, since they all know I'm a total 'carni-whore'. The king crab legs were very unique and flavored with chili powder. The grilled octopus was also flavored well and unique tasting. They also had a blackboard with a bunch of specials.   Service was friendly, fast and efficient. Bathrooms are clean.

J0mziG1snWL33haIA_r9dw.text: Their Pho Oxtail and Pho Tai RibEye - both good! The meat is really tender, although the pho oxtail is somewhat costly ($15.99). I've dined here the last 3 times I've visited Vegas and needless to say, the restaurant was fully occupied each time.

j677v30Wm8ei9RxkkMJqHg.text: Don't go there if you have reaction to MSG or favor enhancer. We ordered big bone soup and braised seasonal greens for me and our one-year-old. My tongue tingled after just eating some braised veggies and some meat off the bone in big bone soup. And my one-year-old got rashes & swelling all over his face and neck after I fed him about half cup of big bone soup and some broth and veggies.  We had to rush to the emergency to have him checked out. I don't mind spending $$ on a good meal. But the truth that my son and I suffered because of the food really pissed me off. All restaurant owners should have the guts to inform the customers about MsG if added to the food.

TYUxXs4tnOP__kdqC9hISg.text: We ordered the oxtail fries and it was heaven in my mouth! The gravy, tender oxtail and fried egg just topped it off. We also ordered the coconut pork belly. It was good but not "oh my god" good. I gave them a 4 because I didn't get to try my garlic noodles which I'm a sucker for so I was a little disappointed. Other than that, I definitely recommend this place! If you have a big group, make sure to call ahead.

NYkHETDrXxY_2j7MTr8ppQ.text: We stopped by for a few drinks and snacks en route to another place.  The atmosphere feels familiar and fresh.  Full of locals and visitors alike, District One gives off an aura of welcomness.  Cozying up to the bar, we order some drinks then peruse the menu.  A few items jumped out right away.  The grilled squid with spicy mayo and sea snails in an aromatic broth.  I really wanted to like both dishes, but a few minutes too long cooking proved both items to be a bit chewy and less enjoyable.  The flavors for both were quite enjoyable.  The broth of the sea snails was exceptional despite the chewy shell inhabitants.  The squid remainded me or the same I saw in travels oversea, but these were overcooked a bit too much.  Another friendly and knowledgable bartender provided an upbeat, casual environment providing some other dining options for us to try.  The menu seemed to cover a lot of different food types and the energy of the restaurant was upbeat and energetic.  I'll give this place another try, but will look towards items of the meat style for eating.

jJEFgjWcLL0ZdRtagzTCgQ.text: Food was delicious and definitely unique! Staff was very nice in explaining things on the menu and everything was just great! I'll be back!

nGUCwNfwZqJV3dUUdU24mA.text: Over hyped, over priced.  Had the famous whole lobster Pho. Great picture, but taste was average. Broth was lacking in flavor and lobster was nothing to write home about.  Ox tail fried rice was average at best. Meat was shredded too thin to get the full oxtail taste, would of preferred solid chunks.   Baby bok choy was great. Cooked very well and another in a delicious garlic sauce.

PKg_E_RprkYMr2hk6lt6Ew.text: Lobster pho was 50.00 not worth 50. Pay 15bucks more and goto Ceasars seafood buffet instead.

Efm5cLaRh0LyJXAyXRoNaQ.text: Came here on a recommendation of my cousin so we took her here for her birthday. This is located is the Chinatown (Asian area) of Las Vegas so you're going to have to drive out of the tourist-ridden strip.   I ordered the grilled squid which was way overcooked and chewy so I can't recommend that dish. However, I told my waiter and he gladly sent it back and I ordered what I originally wanted: District One Rice Combo Platter with Short Ribs & fish sauce. Absolutely delish!  This place is unpretentious and serves really good food at reasonable prices. We had a Filipino server and he was personable and funny. Great location among many other Asian restaurants and worth the extra miles to get there. Very hip, good food. Go explore! :)

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the best!

dcFsSE5NpEiMthWEAf6Wxg.text: The menu to this place is pretty condensed but they do have daily specials that they tell you when you're seated. The menu is very unique and appealing.  I would have made this a 5 star review if it wasn't for the wait to get my food. The beau got his food very quickly but mines did not come out until 15 minutes later! Don't get me wrong, I do not mind waiting 15 minutes to get my food. I understand things have to be prepped and cooked but c'mon, you have to time things correctly. You can NOT just have one person eating while the other stares for 15 minutes.   Other than that the food was amazing!  5 Spice Hen w/ Tomato Rice -- The spices used on the chicken was pretty good. Chicken could've been a little more moist but none the less pretty well cooked. It was also a good portion. It looked like a whole chicken (or should I say hen) was used. It was about $13, which was is a good price for the portion.   Oxtail Fries-- This was part of their specials & not on the menu. It was fries with oxtail, gravy, chopped green onions, and an over easy egg on top. The flavors really burst in your mouth. It was very unique. Honestly, I thought it was going to be like Carne Asada Fries but it had no resemble to it at all! Very good. That was about $9! I thought it was going to be more expensive!   Vietnamese Donkey-- This is their touch of Moscow Mules. & we all know I order that everywhere I go. This one was a lot sweeter than most moscow mules I've tasted. They used a Lycee alcohol and you can defiantly taste it. It even comes out with an actual Lycee fruit that I appreciated very much. This was $12, which I thought was on the pricer side but hey, its alcohol!   Besides my rant in the beginning of the review.. service was pretty decent. Our waiter was very informative when asked questions about the menu. It seemed that he knew I was getting upset about the long wait for my food so I felt he was avoiding my eye contact but other than that.. SEE YOU AGAIN SOON DISTRICT ONE!

tJ74QkO1_PAQLJWLInntbQ.text: As good as it gets. Ordered the Ox Tail Pho, Ox Tail fried rice, and whole fish. All were great. This place has the best pho broth I've ever tasted. It's a bowl big enough to share but it's so good you'll want your own. I could tell the fish was fresh and came out perfectly cooked. There's a sauce on the plate that was also great. I love a good fried rice and there are few places that do it well...district one does a great fried rice. It tasted like there might have been just a little too much msg/salt for my wife, but I loved it. Phenomenal.

7gEv4d-gncKLWTNs2TAKlg.text: Awesome food and even better service!   The wait was a bit long due to a very busy Vegas weekend, but well worth it. Price point is on the higher end of Vietnamese food, but the quality is obvious. We had the double down rice dish, oxtail pho, oxtail fries, and oxtail fried rice. All delicious.   The cherry on top is how warm and friendly the staff is!

JA2cAj5eEWKy5acKNOmcBA.text: Awesome place. Awesome service and of course awesome food. Had the special Lobster fried rice.  OMG. Need to come me back again

wauU62gWMYC9kLw856KY1w.text: This is a quick update on their veggie pho. I'm still a fan of District One, but I didn't get a chance to eat their oxtail fried rice again, but it sure still looks amazing!   As I continue my journey on slowly becoming a vegetarian, I went with the veggie pho. The broth was hearty, light as it's *crosses fingers* made with vegetable broth. I did wish that there was some more in the mix though. It only came with the rice noodles, broccoli, and carrots. I was hoping for some tofu or something that made the pho more complete.   Overall, the pho wasn't bad, but I just wished there was more to it.

Also I have noticed their food are away more salty than before. Hopefully they will change back to the original setting!:)

TeqDH1S67pkdFrEoZVYnHw.text: Outstanding Food, and Drinks, Great Service, Noisy  We really enjoy the food and the people who work here.  The food is amazing and fun to try.

OVNOjth6eYSeghkECKLfTQ.text: This place is soOo overrated! No seriously. Food comes out at different times...service is horrible, like literally horrible. I mean I seen the servers tends to other people's needs but I guess we weren't important enough even when we came with a large group. So after we all are done eating...the bone marrow noodle soup came out. It's my sister in laws order however we shared our food with her because her food did not came out yet and she was starving. Terrible, terrible, terrible. Overall the food was okay to great. Tasted better Pho and braised pork.

Mb7s__Om2ClLtnKqAR9PcA.text: Went for lunch in the middle of the week.  It was just a bit crowded but I didn't have to wait long for a table.  The decor/vibe was a nice surprise and though it looks smaller from the outside, there are plenty of tables and a decent sized bar. They could turn the music down a bit so people could hear each other better though.  The issue was with some of the waitstaff and time for meals to come. Twice they poured water in my club soda and completely forgot to bring the drinks ordered by the others at the table. They brought my food (which was very good) and the other person w/us waited almost 15 minutes for his meal.  The staff seemed absent-minded and scattered.  Nonetheless, the place has a good atmosphere and I may have just been there on an "off day".  I'll go back and see if I have a better experience.

mnoS-9Czc--WdqpyPUfD2w.text: I been here couples of times when I was in Vegas with friends. When I got here I didn't think this place was a Vietnamese place since it looked more Americanize. There was no line or waiting when we got here and was seated right away, When I looked at menu there was so many choices to pick. I noticed that people were ordering the ox tail pho or lobster pho. I ordered Bun Bo hue since it my favorite noodle. I also ordered Vietnamese coffee since I was tired from the long drive to Vegas. The coffee was good that it help me stay wide awake the whole day lol. While the girls all ordered their District famous ox tail pho,  I had to be the "Unique" out of the group lol.  The portions of the bun bo hue and pho was big. It was very good. I got to taste of some of pho since my friend shared with me. I was impress with their pho so next time I will order the Ox tail Pho or maybe the lobster pho. The servers were very attentive and checked on us often . They refills our water often. I will definitely will be back when I'm in the Chinatown Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c55W5frZjgZxSZKHvjKnMA.text: Come here for the Pho and the cocktails. They have a lobster Pho that is off the chain! Emily is an excellent bar tender who has a real talent for craft cocktails. Great spot for a casual night out.

M-qi4hlw5q5_a2Xa8EDJ5Q.text: I heard about this place from a coworker of mine that claimed it had the best and most authentic Vietnamese food in the Las Vegas area. I knew I had to try it after hearing him talk so highly of it. Without looking at any of the pictures, I came here on a whim.  Immediately seeing the doors, I could already tell this was going to be far from authentic. It has the American western spin and style on the decor, the the atmosphere, and the food itself. There was not a speck of Vietnamese on the menu. Everything was in English. I'm not saying that this is a bad thing. I was just expecting full blown Vietnam when he told me authentic.  My gf and I ordered the oxtail fries, pho Bo vien, and I got the steak and eggs.  The oxtail fries came out at the same time as my steak and eggs, leaving no gap between appetizer and entree.  The oxtail fries were a 1/10 for me. The attempt to blend fries with a soupy oxtail gravy broth results in a soggy mess of flavors that do not complement each other. It actually became worse as I ate more and more. Initially I thought it would garner a 3/10 but as I said the flavors were fighting each other in my mouth, and maybe even my stomach.  My entree was the steak and eggs but should be called steak and egg. The shaky beef was delicious and pretty amazing. The rice itself was bland in my opinion but it might have been part of the experience to emphasize the shaky beef flavoring.  My girlfriend got the pho meatballs and told me they were between a four and a six. So I'll say five.  All in all this meal was mediocre for way too much. And I still have the aftertaste of the oxtail fries in my mouth hours later.

Z6lgt90tajetUBS5uxGS1w.text: Been here a few times when I visit Vegas. Came in oct 4 with my old lady for an early dinner at 5pm. She's never tried it, but heard about the lobster pho. We got the half portion along with the carpaccio, papaya salad, ox fries, and the oysters. The oysters were pretty fresh. My old lady thought the papaya salad and carpaccio were salty, I thought it was good. I guess my tolerance is higher. The pho, however, was super salty. We both agreed the pho was very salty. She drank 3 cups of iced water, I had 4 myself.  I asked the waitress if We could have some hot water, broth, or something bland to add to the pho because it was so salty. The waitress agreed and 10 mins later some pho broth came out. We tasted the broth before adding to the lobster pho. We both could not believe it. The broth was just as salty. I took a few more sips, because I thought my taste buds were off. I drank more water waited and tried again. It was really salty. So we ate the meats in the pho (which were pretty good, by the way). The waitress came back and asked us how everything was, I told her the broth she gave was just as salty. We only took a few sips of the hot broth. She took it away and apologized.  When the bill came, I was shocked to see they have added 3$ to our bill for the extra broth. I told the waitress I don't mid paying for the Lobster pho, but told her I thought it wasn't fair to charge me for the side of broth. She apologized and removed it.  Summary: the waitress was respectful. She was never rude. Maybe my communication was off? I would say the service is good on behalf of the waitress, but why did any body not ask us about the broth or lobster or why we thought the pho was salty? They never offered to fix it period. So my conclusion is the management wasn't present, was not aware, or doesn't care. It's a shame because the other dishes were pretty decent. My old lady didn't like the papaya salad because that's not what she was used to, but I thought it was great.

PiJa2kkxjtUnrxba6R7Twg.text: Did I really just paid $50 for a bowl of pho!?!?   If you're from the OC, that's definitely not your typical 50% off beef/chicken pho for $5.  Lobster pho MP - good and worth the experience! The portions are huge and the lobster overflows the bowl. I'd probably won't get it again but you should try at least once. Good to share between two people  Pork buns $8 - very juicy and tender

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho lobster. Market price

2P3Dr3csx9u_EiziYvofzw.text: Overpriced! Extremely small portions, pretty much a childs size, slow staff. Better off going to a whole in the wall than this joint.

X_0PZQRtxff1S8cVa7zLkw.text: Very nice professional service. Ordered the shaken beef rice plate entree and short ribs rice plate entree, both are delicious. The flavor is bold and flavorful. Would recommend anyone visiting Vegas and craved for a good rice plate meal. They also have a full bar here.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VEuh4Rcbfx-apl8tZzDp-w.text: Pleasantly surprised! It was my first time venturing off the strip for some Asian food, and boy do I wish I did this earlier! I heard great things about District One from my roommate who recommended their pho and carpaccio. I didn't know about carpaccio at a non-Italian restaurant, so we passed on that, but we got a side of egg rolls and shared a ox bone soup with a side of extra noodles. A pho + side of noodles is plenty enough food for two! My only disappointment was that I expected the soup broth to be milkier since it was "ox bone" soup (I'm familiar with this type of soup being boiled for hoursssss), but it just felt like regular pho soup with boiled ox bone meat put into the soup. The meat wasn't melting off the bone like I expected it to, but still a great serving of pho nonetheless. Will definitely come back when visiting Vegas along with all the other great eats in Chinatown!

fwXUdBLFQHawa-Zvr3bpRw.text: Called on 1/12 to make reservations for 1/15. I was informed that they were not taking reservations for 1/15 because there was a private party. I SPECIFICALLY ASKED IF THEY WOULD BE CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC. The associate informed me that the they would NOT be closed to the public and that they'd be open to walk-in guests. I arrive there on 1/15 at 4:45 with my party of 6 and low and behold...THEY'RE CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC! It appears that communication with staff is an issue as this particular associate was uniformed on their hours of operation giving out misinformation creating a customer service situation.

Sh6uaY2N-gkOr-NMYWTyHA.text: We tried to get in a popular Korean place and found that they had a huge line of people waiting outside. We found this place after being dropped off with Uber and were pleasantly surprised how great the food and service was.  The Pho broth had full flavor and was amazing, so was the ox tail fried rice. First time having that. The pork belly buns were fantastic! Couldn't get over how well things were prepared and how awesome the service was.  Can't wait to go back when in town.

8QeoPIY141Cu0vUX93F9dQ.text: Located just a short ride off the strip but so worth the extra effort to get there. We had the Lobster Pho and the Black Pepper Lobster and both were fantastic. We also ordered the Garlic Serrano wings as an appetizer but they arrived after our main which was unfortunate (I think the waitress forgot but not a big deal). The wings had a nice kick to them and tasted incredible. Might of been just a little to much food but we managed. No room for dessert though.  They have a nice beer and cocktail selection and an attentive staff. I liked the multiple wash basins outside the entrance to the bathrooms to allow for a quick clean up before but especially after eating, nice touch.  Looking forward to returning.

Q1oP3h4llpi7uFXv5ffGSQ.text: I've been here a few times and it's always amazing. I get the fresh coconut drink, grilled squid, and ox fried rice as well as a main course every time. The pho was good but nothing super special to me, I got the surf and turf last time but I think I'll stick to their not soup options going forward.

I_ls-qzQLb5CaXGg-DpSyg.text: Where do I even begin? First off, I went in to order something to-go ... thought to my self why don't I get a drink while I look over the menu  I was greeted so kindly! When I got to the bar I was greeted once again so amazingly kind by Jair the bartender. He made me hands down the best Old Fashioned cocktail.  He also helped me choose a few items off the menu, and everything was definitely super delicious! Highly recommend the tacos  can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FRnHaMIsgOrcXDpMwVoUoQ.text: Oyster specials were good and meaty for $2.50 each.  I came here to try the Live Lobster pho that everyone was raving about. Our server informed us before hand that it was not the season for lobster since they were less than a pound each. So they will be using frozen lobster for the pho. I had to re-evaluate if I still wanted to order this, so I asked them that will the broth be as sweet as if it was made with live lobster. Our server answered yes. So, I went on and ordered it.  IT WAS NOT WORTH IT! $49 for pho made with frozen lobster. It was tasteless and the noodles itself was soggy. I will not recommend ordering this. Also, my friend ordered the Lobster garlic noodles, which was SUPER salty. I will not be back.

Km34r9MLNOBltHiZ0-QCHA.text: I like this place! Actually came here twice in like 4 days! It's great for groups since it's a decent sized place. First time was with like 20 family members including a bunch of little nieces and nephews who were running around the restaurant like newly minted 21 year olds on the strip. Just crazy. Staff was super cool about it. Interior is trendy, the food is like homestyle Asian/Vietnamese fusion, service was great, everyone had a great time. Favorite dishes - - Big Bone Soup - $15 (4/5) - Strait up #foodporn since you get this huuuuge crazy looking bowl full of marrow bones in this pho type broth. Kinda have to dig for the meat but I thought it was fun to eat. (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) - Viet-chelada! - Easy to drink, they use a Vietnamese lager instead. - Beef carpaccio with citrus soy, truffle and sesame oil, and peanut. $13 - solid. - Garlic noodles - solid rendition, Thanh Long/Crustacean is still the best tho. - Oxtail fried rice - $13 (4/5) - a decent amount of parted oxtail. Good - Chicken wings with the garlic and serrano peppers. $8. Always a hit - Belly buns $8 - pork belly bao's with jalapeno, cilantro, and peanut. Classic combo, they could get a little creative here and borrow from the Chairman Bao truck. - Grilled whole squid - huge. - Five spice roasted cornish game hen $13 - overcooked and little skimpy with meat. - Hue style beef noodle soup $10 - cha, pork blood cubes, the broth wasn't as deep as I've had. More fusion style. I'd come back. I'll try their lobster pho next.

STCSQiu6IIHShnBU6ITCCA.text: This place actually has good food but rude ass waitresses. I came in today with hella kids and fam from outta town. The waitress that seated us gave us attitude right away and looked hella annoyed. She even told other workers there about us cuz I seen her rolling her eyes and was kinda laughing and they kept looking at our table. I felt hella uncomfortable and had a feeling that they were going to spit in our food so I gathered up the kids and left before ordering. Like I said they do have good food here but since this incident happened I would never step back into this establishment or even recommend this place to people.

mKW9C1JSa1k1seTRgmfWTw.text: Pho is the best recovery food when you're all partied out from what vegas has to offer. From what I can tell, I would not exactly call them authentic. I tried the oxtail pho which was huge and offered so much meat that I couldn't finish it.   One of my friends got the bone marrow pho and it was amazing. There was loads of meat and the MARROW was so delicious and rich. Definitely recommend these two. I sampled the surf and turf pho and I don't think its that amazing for the price tag ($35).   They also have an amazing coconut drink that IS TO DIE FOR. Please try it if you have the chance (even though they don't say it, you can ask to have it spiked).

Z9buh4FiQjmgRqtBFCEzCw.text: Had the Ox tail fried rice, Spicy Hue, Belly Buns. It was all very exceptional, couldn't ask for anything else besides more spicy!!

H3lLmz25Azidtl_cru9WkA.text: I wanted to go to Chubby Cattle, but they weren't ready yet. I always wanted to try distrct so here I am. Lady at the front seemed not in the best mood. I hope for better days. The lead server took my order I got some ox tail fried rice and the Viet coffee w henny. Everyone else was on break and he still got me water while taking care of other guests. Ambience is awesome since it's a sports bar with Viet culture. They played amazing throwback music from all types of genre. I'd definitely come back for the lobster pho I've seen on YouTube.

MgLm1ad_TZ4fbgiX91mTxQ.text: Spot on!! Than you TK.  Greeted as we entered, and seated after 10 minutes of walking into the establishment. It has the seafood/crab shack feeling, with wood top tables with an urban feel.   After being seated, TK gave us the rundown of what the specials of the day was. Quite a few interesting choices, but eventually went with the Dungen. Very friendly staff, well except for one young female who collected our food to pack to go. She seemed irritated, mad, frustrated. Whatever it was, lucky it came at the end of the meal, cause we were quite happy with the food. Where's the smile at girl!?   What ordered: Ox tail fries Spring rolls Whole Dungeness special with garlic noodles. Pho Oxtail Pho Tai Nam Pho Tom  Record time food service. From live to stirfried, the dungeness came out in a fairly quick and reasonable time limit. Everyone's food came all together and presented very well. Too bad they didn't have the bone maroc soup, but that just gives us a reason why we should be back.   There is a full bar for those who want to have a drink with their meal. The atmosphere is casual and inviting. The parking gets crowded because of competing businesses, but not scarce.   Definitely will come back. Hopefully by then, their busser/server will have a smile then. Otherwise check out TK and the rest of the staff at District One.

7zttEEA6pcbuaNN-TxtUiQ.text: Had the lobster pho last time and even though it tasted pretty good it wasn't worth the $50 in Vegas.   Ordered the shrimp pho, grilled squid, pork belly clay pot and fresh coconut water.   Pork belly was braised so well and flavorful, delicious! Grilled squid was a good snack with a nice dipping sauce on the side and the shrimp pho was what I need from the long week. Clear broth yet so tasty with everything added in, I like how much lime they gave. Shrimps were the prepackaged supermarket shrimps though. Still good! Gave like 10 shrimps :) .   Coconut water was great! Hydrate yourself in that 116 degree weather. Will come back on my next visit to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised pork belly
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pho and grilled squid

v2SR4mAv9rxrsMrg7j1JUQ.text: Of all the reviews we read, the bad ones about service turned to be accurate. We didnt get to order, so i'm not sure if the food is good. We sat down. After a while we had to call someones attention. He said he only serve drinks but he will call our server. We got water... I could see three servers around but another 8 minutes passed and we left. Total of 15 minutes, 5 tables occupied 6-7 servers/ drink servers around. Am I wrong here?

LaRYVWd6Ac-NJumEcSwL8Q.text: 30 mins and counting... I still don't have my food. The restaurant is half filled. What happens if it was a fully packed?

esWjIoKM5iqVEAckTnLwtg.text: Consistently delicious food, friendly staff, love the daily special menu, often with great new items.  Non traditional Vietnamese restaurant so don't expect some of the usual dishes like banh xeo, special pho, chao tom, etc.  The oxtail pho, fried pork buns, beef tartar never disappoint.  Best green mango salad ever; perfectly flavored, with octopus (if it's available)!   Wish it's a regular on the menu and not a special item!  Delish sea snails, a must try; another perfectly prepared dish served in a lemon grass broth with ginger prepared fish sauce: the flavor of the snails really come through.

sPM3_aYcctJOSWzbi2Geug.text: The chicken pho was great! Huge portion. Unfortunately not very vegetarian friendly. My friend had a hard time finding anything on the menu he would eat. They did prepare vegetarian spring rolls and garlic noodles which he enjoyed very much. Unfortunately no vegetarian broth for the pho which was disappointing. Cool atmosphere and great bar!

prukrQJzuC916D7F7RYxxA.text: What the pho? Lobster pho! Had to try this place out when I was in Vegas for the weekend. When I came here I was a little lost getting to the restaurant. I weren't familiar with the area because I was from California. When getting to the right spot looking from the outside it wasn't the greatest place to be at because it was outside Las Vegas strip, but walking in the restaurant was something different. I love there decoration. And I full bar! A plus for me in my book. Never seen a pho restaurant that had a bar. Going back to my Bowl of Lobster! I order the pho lobster even though they had some other choice I wanted to try but I came here for lobster so I had to try that first. Warning the lobster pho had a market price. So ask for the price before ordering! When I recently went there I guess it was $50 a bowl which was outrageous. But I had to just try it out. When they brought it out the plating was really nice. They actually peel the lobster before hand for you and lay it back out. Wow.. Less work for me so I can enjoy my food. The broth was really good, overall the whole dish was really good but it wasn't worth what I was paying. Will be back next time if I come back to LV! A must try place if your traveling to Vegas or your living there..

AaKEhEbaH66t8TiUZLfU-g.text: We sat at the bar for happy hour and they didn't have the fries we wanted. Our bartender was super friendly and apologetic about it. When we got our beers we loved the glassware and asked if we could buy a couple of the glasses. She came back and told us they were on the house! Wonderful service,  made us very happy.

AvhDoPWYZgj29xa60lTnhQ.text: This dining venue is absolutely yummy, and one of my favorite places. They're also open late which is a convenience.  I recommend their special scallops sashimi,  hamachi tacos, steak and eggs, or the kalbi! All of those items are pure satisfaction to my little taste buds.

zfoLL21SYF1dFsA_RLMHnQ.text: We went to District One last night based on the recommendation of a few friends, and they were right on! The food was excellent and service was great! I wish I could remember our waitress's name because she was awesome and funny!  Our party of 10 had pork belly buns, oxtail loco Moco, oxtail fried rice, shaken beef salad, and steak & eggs. My family also surprised me with the coconut ice cream as a birthday treat. EVERYTHING was delicious. We'll definitely be back when we're in town!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Ice Cream

Snn7mw-LoIusxDKKZKHL5w.text: Love this place. Been here a few times and every time i'm NEVER disappointed. Easy to find location, tons of parking, super friendly staff and knowledgeable about the menu.  The drinks here are also good.  From the ox tail loco moco, the lobster pho, and the other items on the menu you just cant go wrong! Good for groups and even just yourself and have a seat at the bar. This is a must try place. For dessert top it off with the coconut ice cream!

cLovqOloJPKk3nBGa0dydQ.text: Great Bun Bo Hue, better than most places  in LA.  Seafood was also very fresh.  Great place to eat.  Friendly staff and excellent service.  Will definitely stop by next time I'm in vegas again!

r0GKZsMT1iof1tgvfp4r_g.text: Im a sucker for good pho !! The broth, clean and hearty! The noodles were fresh, the meat was tender and wonderful. The staff were all smiles with cheerful conversation. Everyone there was happy and enjoying their time, customers and employees alike! I don't know if it was the warm atmosphere, the aromatic tea I had or the Wealth of brothy deliciousness from the kitchen but I left with a full belly and a fuller heart. Thanks so much D1, I'll be back

XKIeTt73wI5_rC-QWKM8YA.text: I love everything about this place, from thecool decor to the food...THE FOOD is amazing, we got pork belly buns...to DIE FOR! Fried rice was amazing...and the drinks are so tasty and refreshing! I'll definitely be back!

a-08Q0Et4tShmBz0S25zNw.text: First visit wasn't a great experience. I've given them a second chance and glad I did. Been back several times and haven't had any other bad experiences. People have bad nights once in awhile. It's not a common thing here. Food is delicious. Staff is very friendly.

Szmmiw-YP3w4vnEeZvPSZg.text: Was there last Sunday really good food environment was great and the service was awesome

8xdY-3PmNARV4cKcv1M_vQ.text: Great food and service.  The ox tail fried rice and beef carpaccio was amazing.  Definitely will be on my visit hit list for vegas.

QUHipJUlA0RZAVlLdP1z9g.text: First time here and service was amazing. Everyone check on us occasionally even the chef. Had beef Pho and was tasty. My friend had the steak and egg plate. Interesting twist. The steak was cut up in bite size pieces and dredged in a thick sauce was very tasty as well. We ended the meal with the best part of the experience... Vietnamese coffee!!!! It was amazing and truly the best tasting coffee I've had. I'll definitely be going back again

kaXmZ5G1u8KQdm-lVKp82Q.text: If you're a fan of lobster and pho. This is the place to be. Order the lobster pho! If not their pho ribeye was on point as well. On top of fast service.

thZPzIYy2WGEl1Sw6RBp3A.text: Great place to eat! The fresh spring rolls are amazing and they have amazing service.

Ocqiv_KWWo_1VsULZCTzww.text: Even though we waited for 30mins while there were so many empty tables. I still like their lobster pho so bad. The lobster is fresh and so big which worth the price of 39.99, the most expensive pho I ever had, lol. The hostess was very thoughtful to bring us water and let us seat in before we order cos we have a pregnant lady with us. The kitchen was really slow so we waited another 15 at the table before we can take the order.

HEvhEGvnRkUVVE9OWh51zg.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas. The service is always great (Adrienne and Thomas are wonderful). The food is just... INCREDIBLE. My favorite is the big bone soup and the pork belly buns. Happy hour starts at midnight, and they have $1 bluepoint oysters. I love this place. Also, don't forget to try the beef carpaccio. It's made with truffle oil and its to die for!

yrAsSwHrVHMpAvfaObuOZw.text: Amazing!  The atmosphere was upbeat and fun.  We were greeted with a smile and promptly seated.  We both had the iced tea which was good.  We ordered the garlic serrano wings. They were crispy, hot, savory and wonderful. I cant say that I have had a better prepared wing.  We also had the crispy egg rolls which came with an assortment of greens including basil.  The sauce with the egg rolls was a traditional sweet dipping sauce.  We had the house oysters (6) which were recommended by our server and they were out of this world.  I ordered the whole fish and she ordered the lobster pho, both were exceptional.  The lobster pho was amazing with the broth perfectly seasoned and the lobster amazingly fresh.  My fish was wonderful, the sweet and sour sauce was vastly improved by a large amount of garlic and the meat was crunchy and flavorful.  We had the bok choy as a side and it was perfectly prepared.  All in all we were elated with this restaurant and we will surely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House oysters.  MMMM
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho, what could be better?
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The greens were a special touch.

bkBn8CY5e7rLXFmcAzURaw.text: The first time visit here , I tried the pork belly buns and it was just alright. Nothing special.  Second visit here I had the Thai Style & lemon grass Sea Snails on their Special Menu and it did not disappoint. It was so good !! Reminded me of the snail cuisines I had when I was in Vietnam !   The jalapeno chicken wings reminds me of calamari - pretty good

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1. Serrano wings 2. Thai style &amp; lemon grass sea snails 3. Rice plate w/short ribs

ZJPWJdkic70MxiCQ5MMgrg.text: a great place to get food other than pho. I didn't get pho this time but next time I will. I had a sample of the broth and it was really good.  Must haves.....oxtail fried rice and the pepper garlic lobster! The oxtail fries was hella good too. They put a good amount of oxtail in both to make it better than other places.  I'll be here on my next visit to vegas after a night of drinking of get some pho.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepper lobster garlic! You must have!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries! More oxtail then you can eat.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice! It&#39;s a must!

ccloAJXj9LkWTLg26nsplg.text: Food is alright and nothing to rave about. I guess it might be ok considering the area it's located in. However, beware the prices are high and the day I went service was non existent

lh4jY8vlqeEuHBn6GKtiMw.text: We had the lobster pho $49, oysters, pork chop with rice, beef pho, and ox tail fried rice. The only thing I was disappointed in, was the ox tail fried rice. It was not cooked evenly and the taste was bland. Otherwise, everything else was good. Service sucked. We didn't like our server, she was not pleasant.

Ho2C0Nyivf2qHX8CRt4gOA.text: Delicious food and great service.  My favorite is the ox tail fried rice and the beef carpaccio.  I've had pretty much everything on the menu and there was not anything that I did not like.  Their drinks are great too.  Looking forward to coming back next time we're in Vegas. Also Congratulations on the new location!

LDfzEEsRzIFXfyYfgxAEmQ.text: I love the food here but the one favorite dish I always order is the big bone soup. It's so amazing to eat all the marrow and cartilage in delicious beef pho broth. The best part is that they do it tableside. It is perfect for two people to share and you can add a side of pho noodles. It's the best thing on the menu for everyone that I have brought to try.  The beef carpaccio is also amazing. The truffle oil and peanuts on top provide a nice dressing and it's light and fresh. It's a must order.  The other favorite is the grilled whole squid. The dipping sauce is a spicy aioli which is cool and sharp.  The garlic noodles are also good but I would always say remind them more al dente as sometimes it is too mushy for my taste.  I know a lot of other reviewers like the pork belly buns but I didn't like the sauce and would pass. I am more of a purist where I don't like sauce but that is personal preference.  My hubs loves their lobster pho with egg noodles. The lobster comes pre cracked so you can eat it easily without being messy. It is his favorite cheat meal.  The only disappointment is the big bone broth. We have called to reserve but have shown up and it is not available. Or called to see if they even have it available and were told yes of course and shown up and our waitress has said they were already out for the day.  Today, on our honeymoon in Vegas there was no bone broth. Instead we settled for the oxtail pho with no noodles. I thought they would give us 4 oxtails to share since we went sans noodles but we got 3 tiny pieces, how are two people supposed to share that esp after expecting a hearty bone broth soup? Sad face. Hopefully next time or take it off the regular menu!

50htHJMbjNbAGZdNgWYrNg.text: Don't make reservations from Yelp. They won't accommodate your reservations through this app. Wanted to try this place for sometime but end up leaving due to they already had reservations. They told us it will be an hour wait.

nqFO_MyWdg4BNkLuNGbNaA.text: Waited a long time to be seated and the food was worth the wait. We had OXTAIL FRIED RICE, that was awesome !  BELLY BUNS  BLUE POINT OYSTERS All were exceptional ! Highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qMrSUhAZR0KwUib0n5YcVA.text: This is a super modern and trendy place to go to. Don't be fooled by the Americanized Vietnamese flair, it's actually quite good I was very surprised myself. I was expecting it to just be mediocre. The flavors are very similar to the traditional Vietnamese cuisine you would expect.   The reason I gave it four stars is my entree the 'double down' I got it with short ribs, was very burnt and all of one side was completely black I could barely taste the meat. I would recommend sticking with the Noodles.   However some delicious dishes I like are:  The Spicy Hue Noodle soup: a bit spicy but very delicious  The Mekong River Noodle soup: very similar to traditional Vietnamese soup   The Pho Tai Rib eye: the meat is much better quality than regular pho stores

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The double down with short rib

ycQ4imgeEiuJ7kL28QB_-w.text: I heard good things about this place!   I loved how this place looked. It was def. my first time seeing an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant! They did a great job with the decor and our server helped us with all of our questions about the menu. They had crazy food mixtures I've never heard before such as lobster pho, oxtail fries, etc.   My best friend and I ordered the pork belly, house special oysters and the oxtail fries! All was delicious!!!

t7rvOJYuza1kjQUMiqNO8Q.text: i came here with high expectations because of the reviews. wasn't too amazed . i order the oxtail fries and they were okay.

9K8Yfqk8JqQsX7_38bCVBg.text: Cool laid back spot to catch some game with Vietnamese fusion food. Parking is decent but manageable. Will return for good food and cold beer.

8CwpWxQylLdI1uBtTk8WSg.text: Today was the first time I tried this place and I must say that I'll definitely be back real soon! I ordered the oxtail pho and the garlic edamame. The pho came out better than what I expected. Usually, I add soy sauce or chili paste to my pho for more flavor but no need for this one. It's prefect just the way it came out! On the other hand, the edamame could of been cooked a bit more. It didn't have enough flavor and had too much oil. Hence the 4/5 stars.

H4LPtJ88MjmNodfqlOLNpw.text: If you're coming for the bone marrow pho, come earlier rather than later. Had one person in my party disappointed to find out they ran out at 2:30pm. Then he finds out his second good choice of deep fried crab was no longer on the menu, so caution!  We had a party of 10. We thought appetizers took a few minutes too long to come out. The oysters on the specials of the day menu were 3.50 each and they were very small. I thought they were good, but I would rather not have the caviar texture on it. The thinly sliced meat with oil was interesting. It was good, but food at room temperature doesn't really appeal to me. Most of the family got the oxtail soup since the bone marrow pho was sold out. They thought it was good, the noodles are thicker than we are used to.   The most negative part of our experience was that our food came out at very different times. Half of the party who ordered rice dishes ended up finishing eating as the soups made their way out. We came here to eat together not watch each other eat. That's a little mean, but it really did suck.   Other than that, the food that we did get to order was decent. Buy personally, I'm not a fan of Asian fusion. I like my Asian food as is. (: (for example, their papaya salad is not how I like my Thai papaya salad :(.....)   But I would still give it another chance to try their bone marrow pho and lobster pho!   Enjoy (;

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of papaya salad. Not spicy. Just pickled.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu on January 1, 2016. Cross out the deep fried soft shell crab
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special of the day oysters for 3.50 each

LPCrrQVrGf5IJT9NsnLLLQ.text: Without a doubt one of the best restaurants I have ever had the pleasure eating at. The flavors were nothing short of amazing with each plate that was served. We were a big group, 7 of us, but they were able to sit us down immediately. We started with apps, which were amazing. If you're a drinker I would recommend trying the Vietnamese Donkey, their version of a Russian Mule. The twist was fantastic, I ordered a few. For dinner I had the king crab which was just enough to satisfy my hunger without making me too full.   When I go back I will absolutely try the lobster pho - a friend of mine ordered it and said it was out of this world. I've been to many Vietnamese restaurants but have never seen anything like that. Very impressive.   The ambience was incredible, very cool and laid back. Music was on point. If I lived in Vegas we would be regulars. When I go back to Vegas it will be the first place I dine at. Can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y0sXfeVbCyVLmd6bE3Tlyg.text: Came here for the Ox Tail Pho and bone marrow soup. Everything was good! Great service and food. Not much you can ask for.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox Tail Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Bone Soup
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox Tail Pho and Big Bone Soup

WkWsID8uhl1BKh29bHxTQw.text: Great clean spot for Vietnamese and Viet fusion food.   Looks like they had a full bar, but that's about the last thing I could look at early today... The place looks clean, and modern and is a cool spot to hang out, have some food and drinks, and chit chat.    The pho is pretty delicious and hits the spot. Broth is tasty. Bean sprouts and leaves were crisp bright and fresh.  They've got the usual types of pho (Tai, chicken) and even shrimp pho.   The lemongrass beef was also nicely grilled.  Looked a little charred but couldn't taste any bitterness on it.

l1pb_zPrNhOhJOpf3_eE8Q.text: Over 800 reviews can't be wrong -- District One delivers a delightful, upscale spin on Vietnamese food. I'm Vietnamese, so I like to think of myself as half expert, half hater when it comes to Vietnamese food. My parents rarely took us out to eat growing up and when they did, they were always complaining about how nothing tasted as good as my mom's home cooking. Well, that was largely True... until I came to District One.  The food tastes as good as my mom's, but with much fancier ingredients! I can't make a trip out to Vegas without stopping here for the oxtail fried rice, oysters, or coconut ice cream. Most recently, we tried the black pepper lobster and it's the best Chinese lobster I've had outside of So Cal. Everyone I've sent or brought here (including my hater ass brother, we have it in our blood) vouches for this place. If I ever bring my mom, I'll be sure to update this review.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black pepper lobster
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries

Yu4xL-fzvTGb93JSWdsc7g.text: I love love this place! I don't go anywhere else for my Pho! The fried belly buns and the sake flights are to die for! Anytime family comes to town I bring them here! They have the best Pho in town and the servers are always so nice and friendly!

AL5HCNOTM0RgyiqIEefPuA.text: I wish there was a 3.5 star rating.   The food is decent. Price is a bit high compared to other vietnamese pho places. But this place is more modern, so I guess the price jump is expected.   Some of the wait staff were really friendly.  The coconut dessert seemed too pricey for what you get.  Pho flavor rating = 7.5/10 Rice and meat (i think it was com thit nuong) = 8.5/10  My friend had the ox tail pho and really liked it. But I didn't taste it, so I can't rate it.

vUojEzSF5gXbCWcvfNA97w.text: Was my first time here while in Vegas and I was absolutely blown away.. Everything was delicious.. Wish i would have ordered more.. Can't wait to visit again next time we're in town!!! Definitely a must have!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy noodles or birds nest.. I forget.. But was yummy
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow soup.. Mouth watering
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano wings

PHaSCvmSuv6JfMQ6NZWjyg.text: This place was delicious. We ordered king crab legs (D1 special), steamed clams with lemongrass basil sauce, scallops, fried rice, soft shell crab, short ribs, escargo and yellowtail tacos. All were amazing and not salty like most Asian restaurants. Cute place good staff!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs with egg
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargo

h8yUCIo68G6zBgFGHWLwcg.text: The food was really good! Everything was seasoned just right, nothing was under seasoned or over seasoned. Me and my wife ordered the 5 spice Cornish hen which we shared and a pandan creme brulee for dessert. The Cornish hen was served with tomatoe fried rice which was plenty for two people and the creme brulee was on point, because the sugar shattered when tapped with A spoon which means it was done properly. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it took FOREVER just to get our check, and it wasn't even busy. Overall service was pretty good and food was really good. I'll definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 spice Cornish hen

mEwhC_4wTtahQnonzcMHWA.text: Me and the bf have been wanting to try this place for a while now and take the fam here, so I thought why not try it out first before bringing the whole clan over.   The atmosphere is really great when you walk in. Cute decoration and definitely brings a modern look to a Pho restaurant! Big plus because it doesn't terribly smell like Pho and have you worrying about your clothes when you walk out! They give you the option to either sit at a booth, open tables, bar or in a section somewhat closed off for tables.  The first time we came we asked for some recommendations and were encouraged to try out the lobster pho at $27.99 and yellowtail ahi tacos at $8.99, so we went ahead and did that. The tacos were soooo good. However, it was pricy for only only three small tacos. So I guess it really depends on what you are looking for: quality vs. quantity. The lobster pho was ok as far as taste (didn't wow me like I would expect) but the idea and look of the plate was cool. as far as the service, our waiters were great and very informational on the menu. I was a little distraught with. who I think, was the owner or manager. Both times I came to the restaurant, she spent more time trying to impress the "big buyers" and didn't stop to see how the other tables were doing even though those customers were right next to them. So that docks my service review a little. I also mentioned it to a friend of mine and she mentioned she noticed it the few times she went of the selective service. So for my review the first time around, I give the restaurant a 3 for food and 4 for service!  My second time later that week I brought my family and ordered the oxtail soup and hue spicy beef noodle soup for me and the BF. Defffff redeemed themselves this second time around. I loved both soups and the oxtail was so soft it basically just came off the bone easily (I'm sorry no pictures for the second time around tho!). The service was all around the same as the first - good waiters, manager tended or paid notice only to other higher paying customers. But all in all, second time rating is a 5 for food and 4 for service!  Definitely coming back again and again... But It won't be for the lobster pho! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail ahi tacos
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho

l7UNpaxMNasjgUwMXcBZLQ.text: This place should be the benchmark for Pho restaurants. The service has always been good, the food is tasty and flavorful, and the price is awesome. I'd pay more for that quality but I won't complain if you keep the prices the same.

RdGOQSMcVHvEJY9p5O1D_w.text: The food is balanced and flavorful!  Alan is attentive to my needs, and anticipates my wants. He suggests the most wonderful dishes that I am craving, but cannot pronounce or have any idea what they are. The coffee is fresh, and the chips are warm. The salsa is consistently beyond perfect! Dear God, it's good. I have Mexican relatives who make delicious salsa, however, theirs puts my relatives to shame. Shhhhhh. ;) One more thing, a picky person I know well, told me his boss eats there 3 times a week. For this reason, I had to see what the fuss was all about. Thank you to everyone!  Oh, I am craving it again.  Wow!

7mhu-WpKojSLkI1LcCyPfw.text: Live down the road and last night was my first time in.... WoW! Bartender Seth amazing the ox tail was out of this world!   ~Hands down, one word DELICIOUS!!

TsBGtGeUzbK_GCf08O5-1w.text: Great Pho. Everything else was mediocre. Came in group of 6 and no one was overly satisfied. The service was great and the atmosphere was busy. Would come back strictly for happy hour and pho.

aNK5qHfQzUSeT7SvnKdGew.text: I'm a recent Las Vegas transplant and I was looking for a good place for Pho. I came to Yelp since I'm not familiar with restaurants yet and saw all the good reviews and comments about District One, so I decided to try this place. I was greeted warmly and was given the option of booth, table or bar since it was just myself. The waitress asked if I wanted to see the specials and took my drink order. The specials were actually on a small chalkboard which she kept propt up on the seat at the next table for me.  Since I did come for Pho, I got the Pho Tai (ribeye) and the Surf Clams which were a daily special.  The Pho came out first, and in a much larger bowl than I've had in the past. You do get your money's worth for 7.99! No limes available, but the lemon gave it its own interesting flavor. I've only known Pho from the East Coast, and it pales in comparison to this bowl of heaven. Even the noodles were far better. The surf clam came out on its shell, with some garnishes and hot sauce. I'm not certain of the spice because I didn't ask, but it certainly packs a whallop. If you do not deal with spicy foods, I would suggest avoiding this (unfortunately.)  During dinner, three people came over to help. I'm not sure if it's an LV thing or not, but it felt like there isn't one person assigned to a table but rather everyone helps out. That's why I have the place 5 instead of just 4 stars. You help each other out, you help the customer out. Cheers.

rN-sDuRMTYxm5bfgw5NCuw.text: Unique fusion dishes were OK. The fried chicken that's supposed to be stellar was just fried chicken, needed sauce or something. Service was really slow. If they want to accommodate more patrons, they should pay attention to when the customers are trying to flag down the wait staff for 30 minutes to get more water, receive the bill, etc.. And one of our dishes never came out; we had to ask about it when we were done eating everything else. Not sure if I would come back.

eqJsxVsZt1aqFYtOs8NCWA.text: I'm a newly converted pho lover and have only enjoyed it when my friend's mom makes it from an oxtail soup base, so I can't say I have too much experience judging tastiness, but it was good enough for me lol.  From what I heard this place is owned or co-owned by my friend's cousin Nelson (Hi Nelson)..correct me if I'm wrong...which is a cool little addition to have found out.  The layout of the place reminds me of Boiling Crab back home, but the decor is very modern while the ambiance is relaxing/casual.  Food wise we tried the tacos which were a hit for everyone and the pork belly buns that were also bomb dot com.  My friend had the rice dish with pork belly and kind of wished that it was larger portion, but luckily his brother ordered pho so that compensated for him not being full.  Other than that we all ordered the oxtail pho and no one had any complaints about it not fulfilling their expectations.  Service was good in terms of refilling water and taking our orders, but it took a while for them to grab our bill so we had to walk up to the front cashier and wait for someone to notice us.  Other than that minor minor hindrance, the visit itself was worth the drive and this has become a new addition to my must-go's whenever I'm in town.

LDJKzc3-yKhFkpWj0bNDVA.text: This is one of the best restaurants I've been to. The service was amazing! TK was our server and he's absolutely awesome. The food fantastic. Their pork belly is one of my favorites. They also have an awesome drink selection and really good whiskey. I will definitive be a regular here

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k9dhJN3ZiHTBxGC9JNWvfg.text: This s*** was bomb!!!!!!! Best Vietnamese restaurant I've been too. Lobster pho was amazing. Everything I thought it would be. Bone marrow soup was delicious. Can't wait to come back to Vegas again

uPLgraPWbQaQ5vZkfPlVIA.text: Love the interior of this place. Place to just chill with your boyz. I had the "District One Combo Platter" you can ask for both short rib n pork chop for extra $3. Love the house kimchi that came with the platter as well as Chinese sausage. My wife had the "Pho Ox Tail" Ox tail was just cook perfectly! We ordered coconut ice cream in coconut as dessert. We asked our server if we can have the coconut juice from the coconut n he bought us cup of coconut juice. Thanx Aaron!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ox Tail.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. District One Rice Combo Platter.

rr2ecZIRfGvDh8mLHrzUyg.text: This place is a gem here in Vegas. Best food and amazingly priced! My nail guy, Harry (who works and owns the amazing Exquisite Nails) recommended this place because his friend, Nelson owns the joint. Not only did Nelson take care of us but (again) the food and service was out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pimLlDhqH6eJXA5qL69lSg.text: This is our second visit, highly disappointing. The quality of the food was definitely not there. We ordered the double down, rice came out extremely dry and hard, the same goes for the Chinese sausage. Both the pho and spicy noodle came out hot which was nice but the side garnishes were obviously old. Our server forgot our two appetizers and when we asked about it, went about about it as if "okay..whatever." Would not return.

a8a7GqGfCzzFEoEtKtXC0g.text: Been coming here for quite some time and normally love it.  However we were there tonight and ordered the house special oysters like we normally do and we were upcharged on our oysters without even being told.  The server had told us about some kind of oysters and I asked if it was more and he said yes, so I told him no.  All we wanted was the regular house special and we were charged double the price.. apparently management can't do anything about either according to our server even though it was their mistake.  So make sure you're very clear on which oysters you want and clarify it a couple of times(never had to do it before but if I ever go back I guess I'll have to)

aUsPOkR5nvxHjWVDFpsyGw.text: District One is a great addition to the plethora of Asian restaurants in Las Vegas.   The dishes are always fresh and the attention to detail is not what you expect in a restaurant the Chinatown district.

EJy26-RQgylqKF6IazIrMA.text: This will be my go-to pho place. Broth is made in house and yummy. Lots of basil, asked for more bean sprouts. Didn't care for the ribeye, but I'm willing to bet that was just my preference and it was fine. Decor is trendy, and the place had numerous TVs with ESPN playing. They closed at 3:00, which means they will be open late enough for when I finish my swing shifts.   The booth was pretty uncomfortable, but not to the point of dinging them a star.

orQcImqXuueTXiP1QFNB6w.text: Love this place and the concept! Great restaurant to go to for lunch and dinner with large parties. The food here for sure does not disappoint. The service is great and everytime I come here the waiter/waitress always has awesome recommendations. My favorite drink to order here is the Vietnamese Donkey. It has lychee in it which makes it a little different from a Moscow Mule. This place is great for sharing, I suggest that each person order something different that way everyone can get a little taste of the entrees. They make the food as you order so don't be shy to order something that you want to try even if it's later in your meal. My favorites here are the serrano chicken, oxtail fried rice, and squid. Will come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice, super yummy!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano chicken, spice level is on point.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho, delicious even on a hot day

Kg6Rmt0spUwU_iC1bcaa1A.text: Was in Vegas for edc weekend and heard amazing things about this place! As we entered we were greeted immediately and asked if we wanted to sit at the bar for faster service since there were three of us. When we sat at the bar the gentleman was so nice and got us our drinks right away. We ordered the grilled squid, lobster pho, and oxtail pho. The oxtail pho was mine and did not disappoint!the prices were a bit higher than what I would expect tho so be prepared to spend about $15 for the oxtail pho and $50 for the lobster pho. This place is was off the strip about 15-20 away but well worth it!

pJVlVcaPbVztngUlGJ5TnA.text: My sister suggested we meet up with my large family at D.O. for early dinner. Honestly, I have been to  only one other Vietnamese restaurant up in Seattle. Beyond the ubiquitous  Vietnamese spring roll, my knowledge of Vietnamese cuisine is extremely lacking to nil. I was in the mood for some type of Asian noodle dish, so why not try this spot.   D.O. is a large eatery which looks to be a cross between an industrial warehouse style cantina bar (think lots of metal siding) with hints of decor from a  pier-side restaurant. There are lots of booths and bench style tables. Since we were a large party of 11, three large tables were connected  together on their slightly raised platform. Our server did a nice job taking our orders and getting the meals to us in a prompt manner.   Besides Vietnamese cuisine or fusion, D.O. has dishes inspired from the other three heavyweights of Asian cuisine (China, Japan & Thailand). This place looks like it has a happening bar scene too. There is a long white granite top bar which is the focal point at the rear of the restaurant.   My family seemed to really enjoy their meals. This is my eldest sister's fav place when she hungers for Vietnamese food. As for me, I ordered up the spring roll appetizer for starters. The spring roll tasted fresh and filled with chicken, pork, lettuce, peanut sauce & vermicelli. I dab a little bit of chili sauce on the vegetable roll to give it a kick.  For my entree, I enjoyed the unique crispy bird's nest soup. The dish was of generous proportion. The dish contained fish balls, whole shrimp, and chicken. I nixed the beef off my dish. The veggies added texture and color to the plate. I sprinkle chili sauce to give it a kick. Warning: If you have a below average appetite; this dish is not for you. You may have to bring a friend to share this dish.   I recommend this place if you like Asian cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crispy birdnest noodles. A unique noodle dish.

JZIONkXrr4eVlFMplGh_cA.text: I finally got around to experiencing one of the most talked about pho spots in Vegas.  Initially when I first discovered District One through Instagram, I thought they were just riding the gimmicky foodie wave with their lobster pho. I can't speak for their lobster because I didn't order it. However, this review is based on what I *did* order and it was easily some of the best pho I've eaten.  For starters, the pho here is pretty expensive. Pho itself is pretty cheap to make, meat aside. It is, however, a very time consuming process to produce quality broth that's deep in flavor and comforting throughout the entire meal. Thankfully District One does just that and while it may not justify paying $16 for a bowl of pho, it doesn't hurt treating yourself to a quality bowl of pho every now and then.  I ordered their oxtail pho which ran me $16. It was a hearty portion with some very tender and delicious oxtail. The noodles were boiled perfectly and the broth was rich in flavor.  I've steered away from adding lime and sriracha to my pho these days, as I want to enjoy what the dish is naturally supposed to be. Usually at average pho spots, I find myself needing to add some excitement halfway through my meal, and that's where the sriracha and lime comes in. This wasn't the case with District One. In fact, I basically forgot about doing all that extra stuff because it was so good. I was too busy trying to get every scrap of meat off the oxtail.  I left District One feeling very satisfied with my meal. The only downside was that we didn't get basil or culantro. Other than that, everything was pretty much spot on. I'm looking forward to trying a lot of the other items they have to offer next time I'm around.

uEvZnLgVtSGsubK6kLD4Mg.text: Nice place off the strip in the Chinatown area....   Parking here is god awful, so say screw it and park in the plaza across the street and walk!  If you come here late, service can be slow because they're understaffed, so I feel for ya!  I tried the yellow tail fish tacos, love the sauce.  Also got to eat some of the oxtail fried rice which was excellent.  Nice simple late night meal!

1U2cj4INeuVSNDECNPWOaw.text: Cory is such a great bartender! He was so nice and fun!We had a huge group of 26 and he was patient with us and our orders.   We got free frose for Mother's Day! Every single person in our group of 26 agreed that the food here is delicious! The oxtail fried rice is the best! Hands down! The spicy hue noodle was pretty spicy for me, but my BF' family is from Hue so they can eat all kinds of spicy! They were very content with their spicy hue noodle. The beef bone broth was massive and satisfying! The meat and cartilage on the bones were grade A! I also like the pork belly fried buns.   Service was fast and on point! Imagine a group of 26 getting great service! The staff was very accommodating! Thank you, Blanca, for your awesome service!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everyone satisfied!

DbZhvhZ6LRdgeGt1hnJxAQ.text: Came back to District One after having come last a few years ago.. I was really really really looking forward to my coconut ice cream with toasted peanuts--the waiter joked that they were out, and then came back and said they were *really* out.  Sad times.  We got the oxtail fries as an appetizer, really rich.. really good.  It comes with an egg on top as well.  I also got the surf and turf--this is the perfect amount of beef and seafood and noodles that isn't "too much" food or "too little."  I also tried my friend's sea shells in the lemongrass/thai broth--yum!  A little spicy so I didn't have much broth, but definitely delish.  BF got the oxtail soup.. but one of his last pieces was a big piece of oxtail and the oxtail was not cooked enough.  The meat was chewy and would not come off the bone, he couldn't bite gnaw or pull it off with a fork.  This was not cooked long enough so I told him to give up and just ditch it... this was disappointing.  This is one of my friend's fave spots so we will probably be back again for pho.. but maybe avoid the oxtail soup next time and stick to the surf and turf.. and hopefully they'll redeem themselves and have my coconut ice cream next time!

wq-gdpCeZD2ggnLFslm3AA.text: This place use to be good. We are not local here and was totally looking forward to this place.   I took more stars because when we got there, we were the first to be on the wait list and was told there a 15 min wait. That's fine, we'll wait. A party of 6 left 5 mins later, tables clean and empty. We are now waiting for 20 mins, so I asked the host when will be seated and it's that our table? She said no, that table is reserved and we'll have to wait another 20 mins. Umm what now?? So, I asked if we could be seated at the empty tables on the stage. She said No, that's the Red Zone. No one is to be seated there. Really WTF!!  Hesitated, she went and talked to the manager and 30 mins later we were seated.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Zone! We can&#39;t seat you here?!?! Sorry Not Sorry.

DwfYr0xL6EU-L8g9ica0Jg.text: District one, meaning "Quan 1" in Vietnamese. District 1 is the first district in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam or otherwise known as "Saigon City, Vietnam." District 1 is an affluent part of the city and it is where all the tourists are. I didn't recognize this until I sat down and look at the menu realizing that it is a Vietnamese restaurant naming it after a district in Saigon.   Prices are definitely high! Not worth it, if you are a tourist! Service was great as they are attentive but then they are too busy counting money to see that you are waving for the check!  Bo Luc Lac: About $15-$16. It was way salty. I did not like it. It should be served with White Rice, not with "Soi" kind of rice, which is a tougher texter and requires more chewing. The Beef should be cut into nice square cubes. The other pieces of the beef looked too shredded and were as if it is the leftovers. The juice sauce was way too salty for me. They should drain it out instead of including it on the plate. The eggs were yummy. No, I do not think it was worth $15-$16. Way overpriced.   Shredded Chicken Salad: About $12. The shredded pieces of chicken are way too large. For this dish, it needs to be thin out. It definitely was the lazy shredding or this is the way they had always served it. But it should be thinly shredded. Not as much cabbage, there should be more cabbage in proportion with the fish sauce.   Fried Rice Ox Tail: About $15-$16. This is actually decent as it is very buttery and included a decent amount of oxtail meat.   It is definitely expected as there are not a lot of competitions here for Vietnamese restaurants, they are able to manipulate the prices as they like. In Orange County, $12 could get us duck salad with a large bowl of soup with bamboo shoots.   When I eat here, I miss Orange County due to the variety and the prices. I love the booths, they are very long and a wide that accommodates large groups. Plenty of T.V.s as it is a bar atmosphere. The decorations remind me of a seafood restaurant with its bare minimal on the ceiling and the wooden fixtures.   We are not Las Vegas locals, perhaps this is the most legit eatery around and it attracts a lot of people. Especially the large family. Or maybe just the lack of Vietnamese restaurants around this area.   We did not drive here, therefore no comment on the parking spaces. And I did not use their bathroom so no comment.

ky4VMFpq8oG68BEXKww-KQ.text: Okay so I decided on this place for date night after searching for 'ox tail' (random but serious craving). I was no joke going to order the Ox Tail Fries, Ox Tail Fried Rice and Oxtail Pho but my boyfriend told me to simmer down.   We decided on the Serrano Wings, Ribeye Pho, and drumroll please Oxtail Fried Rice.   First impression : the atmosphere is fun and I totally loved that they were playing jams from 2005-2008. Love knowing every single word to the music playing. The service was really good and everyone was very friendly but not overly fake and annoying. Very lively place!   Onto the food:   Serrano Wings were kick ass good! They were crispy and the serranos were easy to avoid if you don't like fire burning heat.   Here's where it gets bad:   Rib Eye Pho was mediocre. The broth was pretty bland and underdeveloped. I don't like pouring globs of Siracha and Hoisin sauce into my pho because I actually want to enjoy the broths flavor but I mean I HAD to add something to this one. Really disappointing. Every single other place in town that I've had pho at has been better than this place.   The oxtail fried rice: oh man! I really really really wanted to LOVE this but it wasn't good!!! Huge NO from me. I was expecting chunks of oxtail in it but I swear there were only the tiniest slivers of meat in it. So bizarre! It was super greasy too. I felt absolutely ROBBED paying $16 dollars for greasy ass fried rice with a dusting of ox tail meat on it. How dare you District One????  So we totally won't be back to this place. 2 stars for the wings and sweet playlist.

KpmaKzb-dyw_nud6gE8P3w.text: This is a pretty good Vietnamese fusion restaurant. Their spicy hue soup is my favorite. It has the right amount of spiciness; I even finish the soup. I also get their Pho Tai Nam. The food is pretty good compared to their sister restaurants Pho So 1 and the Viet Noodle Bar. It's cleaner, the fusion adds more kick and the customer service is better. But there was one time I got the Big Bone Soup; it was tasty but there was so much meat I had to take a big bone home lol. Besides the flavorful food, the parking can be a hassle as it fills up by 6pm. Other than that, it's a perfect spot for a friends gathering, a quick drink (they have a bar) or if you like Vietnamese food with a spin/kick. On a side note, I personally don't like their happy hour because the prices are kind of high considering what you get.

60UG8jnOHkqtmKAeVo9RFg.text: The happy hour specials are great . the pho is divine  But would love to see different items on the menu .

rjYPEUSTeTtKNE2qnBwvqw.text: This place is a must try! The service here is incredible- our cups of water were never empty, the server was super friendly, and we were checked on multiple times. The entire vibe is pretty relaxed and friendly.   We got the big bone soup, whole squid, garlic noodles, and an iced Vietnamese coffee. The soup comes with massive chunks of bone marrow and a tasty, flavourful broth. You have to add noodles to it but we just had the soup itself and it was plenty. The whole squid is at an unbelievable price - you get the entire squid for under 15$ and it's charred to perfection. The garlic noodles were tasty too, and you have the options to add protein to it but we were so stuffed with the bone marrow that we were proteined-out!   I didn't have much of the iced coffee but my boyfriend, who gets it very often, says it's pretty authentic and strong.

YFvMrsJLodis3w9FdYh0Iw.text: My friends and I were craving pho and we came upon this place. What mostly drew our eye was  the lobster pho, but when we got there and found out that it was $35 for half lobster and half beef, we decided to pass.. we just ended up getting the huge bone marrow pho which was also pricey ($17) I think. And chicken pho.   The bone marrow was huge! The largest bone marrow I've had, but I only thought that the bone marrow pho was just OK. It wasn't as amazing as I hoped it to be. The chicken pho wasn't my favorite either. I feel like I should have stuck with beef ball or regular pho. The chicken pho did not taste like chicken broth and the chicken pieces weren't very tender or flavorful. I also felt like the broth was a bit oily. But overall, it did its job since we were craving pho and desperately needed it after a night of drinking. Kinda sad that I didn't get to try the lobster pho, but it is unfortunately a bit too pricey for me to try.

nsjVgK_7FsevIKzvBblHpA.text: This place has awesome reviews but for me it was just okay . I tried a few plates from the ox tail fried , crispy noodle , and me and my brother were a bit disappointed . For the cost and quality it didn't hit the a lot for me . I would recommend you come here to try the food as that was jut my opinion and I want this business to do well . Maybe it was my taste buds ...

zeBpC9Dn3HYCkQlrgJr_9A.text: This is one of my favorite hang out spots in Las Vegas. Chef Khai Vu did an amazing job with the restaurant. I find myself hanging out here on Sunday afternoons. The bartenders and staff are truly amazing. I would definitely recommend this to anyone for a quick bite, first date, Sunday Funday or if you just want to get completely blacked out =)

QcA5UInfceXWkO-uI7w_dg.text: That ox tail fried rice is delicious, it's a bit on the sweeter side. The oxtail pho is ginormous and delicious as well! SrzB_JQzI9w_cZ1DKJrcew.text: I don't think we have many Lobster pho spots in NorCal so had to check this place out. It's in a outdoor plaza (free parking) with a boba spot and some other stores. Came with a party of 4 on a Thursday night (we had a reservation). It wasn't too busy when we got there, maybe like 15 people or so inside.   We ordered 2 lobster phos, an oxtail pho and a dozen oysters (think they were Blue Point). When the oysters came out, we actually asked our waitress to replace one of em' because it looked like someone picked at it; was super flat n not plump. Normally we don't make a huge deal about stuff like that but it looked weird lol. Anyway, they tasted alright; feel like I've had fresher tasting ones before. The pho... it totally made up for it tho! I got to try the broth from both the oxtail and lobster phos. They were really flavorful and the oxtail meat was tender. With seafood, it's always at market price so it was like $50! Pretty pricey bowls of pho but it's cool to try something new.

nML3cl8VEy6DUks9MsKEgA.text: Oh man this place is worth all the hype and good reviews I've seen and heard. Called in first before I came just in case here was a wait. I came in with my luggage and backpack and they were very accommodating to let me keep my belongings next to my table. I got the yellowtail fish tacos and the black pepper lobster noodles with the matcha thai tea. Everything was delicious! Fish tacos was fresh and all the ingredients complimented each other. The black pepper lobster noodle I originally thought it was going to be in a pho bowl like the whole lobster pho but with more flavor, so initially I was disappointed but the way it came it was still great and the matcha thai tea have been one of my favorite drinks as of late since I first discovered it at a Thai restaurant in Elk Grove, CA a must try when in Vegas
