-V7dR-ednUZDw-5y89JSnw.text: Two words: LOBSTER PHO. Wowwwza!  Brought here for a cute little date night, the mister ordered for us (since he had been here before). We didn't really do our usual his/hers order, but shared everything:  We ordered: - CRISPY EGG ROLLS: Four fried eggrolls cooked to perfection served with large lettuce leaves with all the fixins like pickled carrot and mint leaves. Wrap an eggroll with the lettuce, sprinkle some of the garish and dip in the side sauce. The perfect appetizer! - THE ORIGINAL WHOLE MAINE LOBSTER PHO: This is listed as market price and was about 50$, but so worth it if you are a lobster lover! A generous 1.5 lbs whole maine lobster in a yummy lobster pho broth with rice noodles. A foodie must try! - CRISPY BIRD'S NEST NOODLE: Chicken, beef, shrimp, fishballs and assorted vegetables on top of a full plate bed of crispy noodles, softened by a delicious gravy. This was so good and filling, and only 14.99!  Everything was not only presented well, but was extremely full of flavor. We left full and satisfied for sure! Service was good as well... And would we return again? Oh, absolutely!   Maybe the only downfall was we waited for seating for a good 20 minutes despite there being a lot of seating. I originally asked if a booth was available and the hostess told me she would let me know. 5 minutes later she asked if we still wanted to wait for a booth or were okay with a table, as there still were none. I said, "Oh okay, a table is fine!" She comes back another 15 minutes later and asks us the same question. -___-

I ordered pork belly with white rice and green tea thai tea and water.  The water arrived placed on a plastic cup, the moment i took a sip of the water i saw a long hair from the plastic cup going inside my water. I did not call my server cause i don't really wanna cause any attention to me its just water.  Food arrived placed on a bowl , pork belly with soup. To me the dish is too plain nothing special. (Still had to pay for the pork belly)  I feel like the management needs to do something about their employees appearance/uniform. Girls need to be in a bun not flying around.

C_vp06dNVxYODTnZuQb0qw.text: You would not expect this place to be a Vietnamese restaurant when you walk in. The restaurant vibe and decor was hip and trendy.. not a usual viet restaurant style. The decor was "American-ized". Haha and even more I didn't expect to eat really good viet food at a place like this. I thought it would be very "fusion" from the vibe and decor is the restaurant but it def exceeded my expectations. Came here as our last meal of my friends bach party before heading back to LA. All together we ordered different pho bowls and fried rice. I got their oxtail pho and wow... soup was so clean and not too oily, meat was high quality. It was really good. No really. Their fried rice was simple but very tasty and went perfect with the pho broth. Definitely will be back next time to try their lobster pho and other dishes.   Service was really good too. All the servers were nice and didn't get our orders wrong, filled up our waters without us asking.  *you need to try their coconut ice cream. Omggggg so gooood. Don't forget to scrape the meat of the baby coconut once you're done with the ice cream.

BoN9ut8E4KO7IqDsxPHkiA.text: Amazing food, atmosphere, drinks, and service! This is not an area I normally explore in Vegas, but it was well worth the excursion! Loved the atmosphere as soon as we walked in, and we were greeted promptly and given menus. We tried almost everything on the appetizer list: belly buns, shrimp eggrolls, spicy edamame, spring rolls ... Everything was top notch, very tasty, spic appropriately spicy, VERY enjoyable! Selena was super friendly and timely with drinks and plates. We will definitely be back with more friends!

wBDLzY3FxgLH3TnzvCPJQQ.text: First time here- we will definitely be back!   The food is AMAZING. The pork belly buns and spring rolls were especially delicious.    The cocktails were handcrafted and delightful! Ask for Selena behind the bar- she makes some great drinks and her service is wonderful.    Good place to grab a quick lunch, watch the game, or relax and have a drink with friends.  Perfect atmosphere.

NgufIi4-YIVtQTsOIEEUCw.text: Omg where do I begin?! We sat at the bar and Selena took amazing care of us from drinks to dessert.  I cannot recommend this place enough. Chinatown can be so overwhelming to decide where to eat, look no further!!! You found it!

n86on5bGjATAZ7St_-XOxQ.text: Amazing! I love their lobster pho, the meat is ready to eat as they cut it all up for you. The broth is very comforting as well. In addition, the wings and the house oysters are always a must. If you still have room, you must try their coconut ice cream. It comes with a very light coconut ice cream in half of a coconut with spoon coconut at the bottom. It is so Delish! I'll be back again and again.

pPjqG_5wXacPQGwslxCwWQ.text: Love the higher end asian cuisine feel. Slowly became a must go destination for Vegas visitors. Had the lobster pho, could use more of a seafood kick to it but lobster really isn't too fishy which is understandable. The bone marrow soup was my favorite especially with a hangover. Lastly try the ca for sua da with Hennessy you'll thank me later

HDHxLABlvfVMtxxTMY_p-w.text: I'm giving this restaurant 3 stars because the items I ordered weren't very pleasing in any way. I understand that everybody has different taste pallets and that's why I want to go back and order something different. The atmosphere is welcoming and the staff are very nice.  I ordered the Garlic Serrano Wings and a Viet Michelada. The wings had no flavor or spice and tasted like regular fried chicken. The Viet michelada wasn't that bad, it just kind of tasted like they added fish sauce to it, which might be the "Viet" way but I didn't really like it. My friends ordered Pho (which I do want to go back and try) and my other friend ordered steak and eggs with rice. I didn't try either of their meals but they both looked like they tasted better than the wings. Also, I did get to try the Mango Spritzer and that was really good, it's sweet with a hint of tartness to it, sort of like lemonade. I also got to try the Matcha Thai Tea and that was good as well. Not too much matcha with the perfect ratios of each flavor.  Like I said, I am willing to go back to try this place again because everybody was very welcoming and the other plates of food looked very appetizing!

H7XKB1rH3HQ01mOGqpR0hw.text: After seeing this place all over social media, I finally got to try it out myself with a couple of my friends on a Thursday night.   Omg where do I start.... the food was so delicious. My personal favorite was the oxtail fried rice & oxtail fries. It was so tasty and yummy. Every bite was delicious. I was so full from dinner I didn't get to try any deserts :(  I really like the vibe in here. It's a great place for a first date, family dinner or just to come and have a drink at the bar.   The prices are very reasonable and customer services was great.    Tips:  *Parking is tough on the weekends because this shopping center is full of great stores.  *Pretty chilly in here so bring a light sweater.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9/7/2017

innf95q5akBlnV4CUuJnqA.text: Where do I begin... just a bunch of girls hungover and hangry and our stomachs led us to District One. To our surprise this place was open on Labor Day... YES! It's meant to be.   Traditional Asian dishes with a twist... here's what we had on our table (for 3 girls) Garlic Serrano Wings - oh my word. Crispy & garlicky and just the right amount of spice. This one is delicious. Coconut Pork Belly - comes with an egg, rice, and some pickled veggies. There was about 3 pork belly cubes per order, this one was good but reminded me of just your regular adobo. Garlic noodles (added shrimp) - YES! Chowed this down in less than 5 minutes. Oxtail Fried Rice - GET THIS! They don't skimp on the oxtail meat, so flavorful, and it's a huge serving, they top it off with an egg and everything is perfection. The Big Bone Soup - huge bones with bone marrow in a pho broth, so overwhelming in size, but so comforting and good.   Customer service is on point. The workers are helpful and happy. I really like the vibe here. The restaurant is clean, the food is served at a timely manner. It's worth the wait definitely.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zGloDto_32bXV_rlOm7cTQ.text: Was visiting Vegas for the weekend and decided to check this place out on our drive back to Cali. Came here for Sunday lunch around 1:30 p.m. Place was packed but our wait wasn't that long, a little less than 15 minutes. We got seated in one of the large booths by the window. Since it was 105 deg outside, we weren't in the mood for pho. Instead, we tried two of their rice dishes - the rice combo platter that came with short ribs, fried egg & Chinese sausage and the pork belly with boiled egg & pickled veggies. Both were good but nothing special. We also had the coconut ice cream for dessert, which was served in a coconut shell. You can scoop up pieces of coconut and mix it with the ice cream...delish! Service was excellent, and we'll definitely come back here on our next trip to LV...and maybe try one of their pho.

qAhYScwGJIX5O1k94IQ9ew.text: YES! I am a fan. Hubby and I tried to dine here once almost a year ago but was closed at the time we arrived.   After dining here a few times within the past couple months, I am still eager to try more from their menu.   Their modernized southeast asian cuisine has something almost anyone can enjoy. Every dish I've tried was delicious.   They do have a weekly menu along with daily specials.   must try: oxtail fried rice, pork belly buns ( fried), viet beef carpaccio  Can't forget the staff, each visit was served with an attentive and informative waiter. They knew the menu so well and even helped pack up my left over bone marrow soup.   Great job  District one!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jasmine tea

7E9g7HDkhrZHuPzmaQrnmw.text: Finally got to check this place out and will definitely be back.  The ambiance is nice and a pleasant change from all the other Vietnamese places in town.  I had the rib eye pho and what the broth was lacking in flavor, the meat made up for.  This was by far the best quality of meat I've ever had in pho that I've had in a restaurant.  Not only was it excellent quality but they gave you a good amount unlike a lot of places that are stingy.  Also got the Matcha Thai green tea which was delicious and a nice alternative to most Thai tea's.  Will definitely be back with friends to try out some other things on the menu.

p1MADFObvc_SrB5U90vacw.text: Pricey place. However, the food is awesome. I had pho 3 ways. Beef pho, then beef stock with lobster, and then finally lobster stock with lobster. Haha. All 3 were great. The sea snails were is nostalgic from when I was younger with the ginger mixed fish sauce. Again pricey but good.

gha3NnSKwU44hXfyyVkaBw.text: Of course we are back again to District One....every time we are in town. We were starving so ordered too much food! Once again the food was great!! The services was awesome! The lobster pho was delicious! Lots of flavor. My husband loved his rice, steak and eggs. The steak cooked just perfect. The grilled squid was not chewy and so fresh! Wish they had this restaurant in San Diego. Till next time...

p6voTSGn_IJ-Lygjf0yz-Q.text: I just can't get enougho!  You would think...pho in a bar? Hmmm...Better scrutinize the broth, it may be blahhh, right? WRONG! So wrong! They know how to do it right, right here at District One! So good! We were pleasantly impressed! We've been here, I would say, more than a couple dozen times in the past 2 years now? It is the perfect place for our Vietnamese comfort food!  My mom, who is Vietnamese, would make the family a dish she basically called "PORK & EGG!" Well, we didn't believe our eyes when we saw it on their menu, Thit Heo Kho. They put their spin on it, but we still fell in love with it. If that's not your thing, something like their amazing Garlic Noodles will do the trick for ya! You could ask them to stir fry it with anything really, veggies, chicken, you name it! Perfection!  I cannot say enough praise for their menu! They have so much that we love! And one thing that we love about District One is that it brings Hawaii to us! Yay! Oxtail Loco Moco! No description needed. Winnahz! Next on the oxtail bandwagon, Oxtail Fried Rice, Oxtail Fries, and of course, their Oxtail Pho! So go on and get yours! Must try! ALL! And while you're at it, and speaking of pho again...LOBSTER PHO! Whatttttthaaaapho??? This dish is an absolute memorable dish! A chef has done his job when a patron says his dish is "memorable!" That's their lobster pho! Last, but certainly not least, we had their Big Bone Soup! Massive! Inexplicably, massive! We were at odds trying to figure out how to dig into this dish! Thankfully, our "looks like from Hawaii, but not from Hawaii" server offered to carve it up table-side for us. The marrow. The soup. TO DIE FOR!  Oh, and yes, we mustn't forget the bar. Their cocktails (coconut mojito served in a coconut...mmm!) and beer selections are awesome! And there are TVs everywhere you sit so that you can never miss a game!  THANK YOU, KHAI & DISTRICT ONE! Your place rocks! And it's "traditional Vietnamese mother - approved!"

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobstahhhh Ph-ahhh! Must try!

KoWHlfNr-Jn8Yti7j6OtqQ.text: At my favorite place to eat pho but it doesn't matter what u order here everything is delicious. The service is great and the ambiance is good.

mNOtPKJBoo6gpEuMmb9zuA.text: love the place, chef owner is great too. must try their lobster fu. More chef driven concepts are required in vegas. all he best

o-flRhhSdhLBudQj0XPJJg.text: First time here and it was pretty good. I got the oxtail pho which I really really liked! I added meatballs to mine and I was really surprised that there was a charge and it was $3! I find that a little ridiculous but now you guys know.   The pork buns (fried) were also good. And we also got the fish tacos, and those were delish too!  The Serrano wings and garlic fries thought, not that good... No flavor and pretty plain but we got it during happy hour so at least the price was good.  Overall it was good. I'd probably only go for the pho because the broth was good and flavorful. Decently priced, especially during happy hour (5pm-7pm).

u3LDd7HIhgzVBikfAi5_9g.text: I love this place! !  I used to live on this side of town and never knew that this place existed...what a shame for me.  This place has the best Pho in town.  The portions the flavors of the dish here are big and well worth every penny.   Also, the establishment is fun and full of life.  The staff here is very attentive and friendly.   This is a great place to try out.

oeARUO1-At9VFF7F2HVSHg.text: For a place that charges $50 for lobster pho, they have the worst services ever. I decided to give them a try due to all the hype but I was so disappointed. The broth was okay, there wasn't a lot of noodles. Our waiter only took our order and didn't check on us at all. I didn't receive my bean sprouts or herbs until my friends received their pho. They ordered regular pho and theirs took about forty minutes to come out. We asked for several condiments during our meal and didn't receive it until asked for it again. Same thing happen with our check, we had to ask for it three times. If you're charging $50 for pho, please have better customer service.

ezUQ58JlWOGs0gnEh5MRQw.text: Staff was really knowledgeable of the menu and nice beyond words! We ordered pho all around ans a few appetizers.  If you're ever here, you must try thr beef stew fries.  I could probably eat that everyday and not get sick of it.  The pho really delicious and the broth had lots of flavor.  I managed to finish the whole bowl.   The ambiance of the restaursnt was really nice also.  They also have tvs for those of you into sports.  The next time I'm in vegas, I will most definately stop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef stew fries. Soooo goood!

t8mh0pw2S_iUqmQi41Xt5g.text: Not a 4 star place, slightly underwhelming. The bone marrow soup looked incredible presentation-wise but was extremely difficult to eat and didn't have much flavor to it. The pork belly was rich and tender but wasn't mind blowing. The lobster pho will hit you with sticker shock at ~$45 a bowl and isn't worth the price past the novelty.  They have great Ox tail pho however! The pho broth is likely the best in Vegas and the ingredients are fresh. I'd come back for the Ox tail pho alone.  This place is loud and rowdy. Prepare yourself for the horde of drunk Asians.

THWphhdL31yK4EqfNnu9dw.text: I've always heard great things about this place and finally had a chance to check it out with family tonight. We came during happy hour and ordered some items off that menu--a few cocktails and $5 beers, as well as pork belly buns and egg rolls which were very good. My mom and I split the 18oz ribeye which was amazing! And the boys ordered pho. Staff was in the middle of shift change but a were promptly switched over to another server who accommodated all of our needs. The atmosphere is really cool too. Decorated but not too cluttered. This place is family friendly too :) and background music is great :) :) I will be back!

9w2cy6MCaJZ_B1ePsY-5nQ.text: Came for a party of 2 around 11pm on a Friday night. We were seated right away. I'm surprised they weren't busy, I expected it to be since the lot was pretty full... but I think it's always hard to find parking in this center, especially on weekend nights. People park everywhere and anywhere they can find space lol.   But anyway, we both ended up ordering the steak and eggs + oxtail fries. My steak and eggs ended up having heaps of onions rather than meat, but I suppose it was a good amount to get me full. They give you a lot of rice as well. The sauce they use seems like it's missing a little something, but I give this place props for trying.   The oxtail fries.... I've definitely had better, but my boyfriend seemed to like them since they "weren't as sweet as others." Bachi Burger oxtail fries over District One oxtail fries any. day.  Service: Ok. Always had a full cup of water. That's always good. They check up on you often.   Pricing: Can't remember exact prices or totals, but it was around $46 something for two steak and eggs and the fries.  Just a side note: We didn't come for drinks, just for food, but overheard that they don't do happy hour on Fridays and Saturdays. Just a heads up.

bE0J4qkA3GmiWxaQNREFBg.text: Was brought here by local who was taking us around after a business meeting that ended after midnight! We were so happy this place was open til 2am as we arrived just before 1am.  It was fairly empty when we arrived, and they were kind enough to let us sit at a larger table they had already cleaned for the night. The server was pleasant. All we really wanted was to try the bone marrow soup so we got 3 orders (for 5 ppl- 2 shared as it was 17.99 for 1) I also wanted to try the Oxtail fries so we got an order for the table.  Oxtail fries were great- loaded with an egg on top. Not a huge portion to share, but worked fine with us as there were a couple ppl who were not too hungry. If you're coming starving, I'd say it would be a sufficient appetizer for 3-4 ppl max.  Now, the best part was the bone marrow soup! One- it was HUGE. I quickly saw why it was 17.99 lol.  It was also a fun experience as we put on plastic gloves to really get all the marrow and such off the bones. A server came by to explain how & was really helpful and patient while teaching us how to get the most out of the soup. And YUMM it was amazing. My friend put some hoisin sauce in hers- but I loved it without just fine!   We had to box it to go, even though we shared it! Definitely worth it and will be back. If you're a fan of bone marrow, it will not disappoint!  They even bagged up the bones for me to take home to my doggies. Now my dogs will love it when we go too ;)

CTPSkHc5Q0Zdg7NLfH2gHA.text: This place is more a westernized version of Vietnamese. Double down was good and the Mekong noodle soup had good flavor and generous portons. Do not get the papaya salad. Tasted a d smelled rancid.

dy9iwNtR-plVx06NbX9mXA.text: I don't know you guyssss!!! Maybe I ordered badly, or maybe D1 was having an off night but this place just didn't do it for me, sadly.  I started with the stuffed jalapeno appetizer, which was just, well, kind of boring. Ground seasoned chicken on top of a cut-in-half grilled jalapeno with marinara sauce on top, super basic ya'll.  Next I had the oxtail fried rice and omg that stuff needs to come with a warning label, ox tail tastes like dirt. It's gamey AF and I like gamey, I'm down for lamb any of the week and I order birria tacos now and again, but ox tail is another level. It's also got that sinewy fat situation going on that just makes me gag. I know some folks love it, those who order the tendon at pho places for example, would love ox tail, but not I.   The shining star of the meal was the garlic noodles, they were perfect, dry and packed with flavor! I could eat 10 plates of it. I also really enjoyed my creamy green tea, so there were some hits amongst the misses and for that we go 3 stars.

BMGDE0414y51p9_wBTCQdw.text: I hate being the outlier but I don't get why this place has 4 stars.   The pho broth was bland, the fried rice and rice clay pot were sodium packed (had to eat them with a side bowl of white rice to balance out the sodium so we don't shrivel up like raisins at the end). The saving grace was the escargot appetizer.  Maybe they are known for their "Nhau" items that you eat with beer with fun company.

SCaMe5uTtAjVpNu-tWtpOQ.text: Our party tried three appetizers and three entrees. We started with the Vietnamese Eggrolls, Fish Tacos, and Pork Belly Buns. These were all great tasting and beautifully prepared. The eggrolls were made with taro which gave it a unique taste. The fish tacos were our favorite. Although on the pricier side (approx. $10 for three baby tacos), the fish was fresh and tasted awesome with all its taco components. Pork belly was tender. Highly recommend.  Entrees were Mi Sate, Oxtail Pho, and Steak & Eggs.  Mi Sate was OK. We all agreed it was our least favorite dish. Very super thick, peanut flavored sauce-like broth with skinny egg noodles. There is a small spicy kick, but I couldn't get over the peanut butter thickness. Maybe it just had a bad night?  The real hero of the night was the Oxtail Pho. Leave it to District One to bring this one all the way home. Very aromatic, tender (and plentiful servings of) oxtail, a truly original tasting broth. Steak & Eggs was a good decision too. Steak was tender and expertly cooked, tomato rice was flavorful, overall good decision for anyone.   Impeccable guest service. We were diligently waited on by an attentive team and the food came out in a timely manner.  Overall good food, good ambiance. I will return with friends. Next time I'd really like to try their crawfish, lobster pho, 5 spice roasted hen, clay pot pork belly, and ca phe sua da! Awesome first impression! See you again, District one!

r_EWb99DN8OjDqz9_gRlbA.text: Lobster pho had no or very little flavor of lobster. I got the surf and turf pho with half a lobster , more like 1 claw and pure shells for garnish and 5 slices of rib eye. Not worth it, Service was alright. Other things on the menu looked good.

qGmUAhu6eaa8J3GItEbQmw.text: I'm glad we tried this place.. we had the big bone soup and the double down plate... both dishes were great.. then we had the ice cream in a coconut.. and that was awesome!

ucdWC-sBUZ6sMYUvGc670w.text: So here I am, at the soft opening of this new restaurant in town called District One. I'm here with 6 friends, so I didn't actually order ALL this food.   Decor: Love this Asian fusion restaurant. The decor is so cute. Especialy love the wallpaper and the "let's nhau" quote (vietnamese for let's party/drink) in the corner of the room. There's also a huge bar that greets you and FOURTEEN flat screen tv's all over the place. It's totally set up for some good eating, drinking, and sport gatherings.  The CAFE SUA DA (Vietnamese iced coffee) was perfect. I am a coffee lover, and I'm extra critical. But they nailed the coffee here. Strong and sweet.  Appetizers: the GARLIC AND SERRANO PEPPER WINGS are good. Comes out hot, crispy, and moist on the inside. The serrano pepper definitely gives it a kick. And the side of pickled radish adds a nice touch too. The SHAKEN BEEF SALAD comes out on a huge bed of lettuce and tomatoes. The beef is sweet, salty, and savory at the same time. The beef could be more tender, but flavor wise, it was exellent. We also asked for a side of lemon, salt and pepper to dip the meat which really enhanced everything.  Entree: the STEAK AND EGG is where some of the asian fusion comes out. It's not the traditional t-bone steak you might expect. It's actually more like the shaken beef appetizer.  But the flavor is more sweet. This beef actually is more tender though. And the fried egg, which was over easy, was actually over easy!! *clap clap. The SLOW BRAISED PORK BELLY IN YOUNG COCONUT JUICE was a little on the smaller side for an entree. Also, the flavor was not as intense as I would have anticipated. It needed more bang, more salt. The OX TAIL PHO came with two big pieces of tender ox tail. It was so tasty and actually fell off the bone. Curiously, the pho tasted like Pho So 1. Which is also a restaurant in chinatown that does very well for itself.  Overall, this place has the potential to be great. I can imagine coming here to watch the game and grabbing a few drinks after work. The staff is young and friendly. And occasionally, the chef comes out to see how everyone is doing. That's so cool. It definitely feels like a family friendly environment. The waiters and waitresses come around and they always ask if everything is okay, and ready for refills.   Decor/Ambience: ***** Food: ****1/2  Service: ***** Drinks/Bar: TBD Overall: *****

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome place to eat, drink, and watch some games!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

krUlaJ1gM4QSKxYv-qmltQ.text: Wanting a quick bite and decided to try something new. Never been here before and was wow'd the first time walking in. Never expect this contemporary decor when enjoying Asian/ Vietnamese food.  The wood all around the restaurant, multi leveled, and the beautiful 10-12 seat bar was warm and welcoming,  the aroma around the restaurant made us hungry, I was very excited to see what they had to offer.  After still talking about the decor, the server arrived promptly with menus and the specials of the day.  I was excited to try the entire menu, but settled on Pho Tai Nam. Yes, it's about 98 degrees that day and I decide I wanted hot soup, don't judge!! My friend ordered the Belly Buns. Although, I did not get a chance to try her dish, she couldn't stop talking about how good it was.  My soup was awesome, what was great about the dish was the after part.  After having Pho, at some places, I become growingly thirsty, not so much with District One's pho.  It was full of flavor, right about of onions, and did not have whatever component that makes you thirsty. Kuddos!!  I am excited to see this place make it big, very different concept. The food was definitely fusion, I mean where can you get fish tacos and chicken wings at any other Vietnamese restaurants.   I love the marrying of different flavors, cultures, and ingredients;  the unpretentiousness, that is what food is all about.  Sure, this visit was brief, but I will definitely be back to try it out again and again.  Next time, I'll bring more reinforcements and will venture into the King Crab, Oysters, and the Down and Dirty options! Can't wait! Great job, great first impression!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu anyone?!? You&#39;re welcome!!

G4i1qVK_OFninw5C6pzjFA.text: I've always driven by this place, consistently drawn to their unique sign, and finally decided to give it a try. My friends and I decided to stop by during happy hour on a Friday. To start, the restaurant was clean and nicely decorated, though nothing was as eye-catching as the sign outside.   We were seated immediately which was also nice, however, their happy hour options were pretty limited and to be honest the food and drinks overall seemed a bit overpriced. I had a red lantern cocktail which was pretty delicious, but kind of small given the price (I believe it was $13-$15). I ordered oxtail fried rice which was a little greasy, but good.  One of my four friends didn't receive his order until the rest of us had already finished our food, perhaps an hour or so after we were all seated. It pretty much ruined our experience there since they had cleaned off our table by the time my friend received his food, which he said was only decent (he ordered the claypot chicken).   Overall, the food and drinks were decent but definitely overpriced. I spent $35 dollars for one plate of fried rice and one drink, didn't seem worth it to me. Service wasn't terrible but the food arrived very late. We would probably not eat here again for these reasons.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dXe6k_P41G3KB9cx5lokxw.text: The only thing i'd watch out for are prices... very easily can you rack up a $60+ bill on very little!  Steak and Eggs are delicious!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y1KKsesW8IJQ76-KOXFqXw.text: I've had home made pho my whole life and no restaurant could get this food right until this place! One of the best places to eat pho in Vegas also has an American bar lounge atmosphere

M8INioavtX0IRoq8vrukgA.text: New fave place! I am Viet and was skeptical about spending more money on Viet fusion food but this place was awesome! Went here twice in the same weekend. Once at 1:30am in the morning and again during regular lunch hours. Love that its unlike most Viet restaurants where you just eat and leave. Here you can linger. Both visits food was solid.   Eats: - lobster pho: $29.99 for a approx. 1.5lbs of fresh lobster in a bowl/platter of pho. This is a steal! - bone marrow soup: flintstone-size bones in broth. More than one person can eat so share! - steak and eggs: hubby gulped this down before i could taste but looked yummy - beef carpaccio: awesome flavor and texture. Eat! - scallop sashimi: fresh and amazing flavor served w/ crunchy scallop skin. Woah! - pho tai rib eye: awesome broth really developed.  - rice combo platter w/ pork chop, short ribs, and chinese sausage w/ kimchi and fried egg. Loved the kimchi variant and that my egg oozed yolk  Aside from the food, whats best about this place is that you can lounge since its set up to rival any sports bar w/ comfortable seating and enough tvs to watch all the games at once. Take your sports bar loving hubby!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop sashimi! Heaven!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio! Great texture and taste!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho! Approx 1.5lb of really fresh and tender lobster on top of pho!

iMVIYe0Barjjg73g8bsf_A.text: Wow a great place to come for tummy treats.  The main reason to come is the ox tail fries are the best ever, ox tail in a great gravy with fries and an egg. Omg sooo yummy. Would even take it home and add a big bowl of rice to suck up all that sauce. Oysters are spot on delish and the other plates were fulfilling.  3 adults 2 kids about one bill. Not bad considering we had beer and shots too.   Bottom line I'll be back.

lNfRAIEDHFIW_B1FOKaX9Q.text: Came yesterday for dinner.  Decided to come again today with more friends.  Tried more dishes.  Delicious food!  We will come again next year when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NFsUPbJogIKtCl0PBHnHSg.text: Such a cool place. You can sit at the bar and have amazing food or have the full restaurant experience and sit at their tables. I drive by the place all the time and never knew it was here. This is the theme for Vegas restaurants. In no other city would I eat in a strip mall except Vegas. That's where all the hidden jewels are! I ordered the pork belly buns and they are delicious! Pork belly seems to be hard for people to get right but they did. I also got the shaken beef salad. I really only got these two things because my favorite yelper Phil said they were good and he hasn't lead me wrong yet. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Buns! Yummmmmmm
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a cool place!

TfOAsHnyXhTzJRA0LSj8BA.text: From pho to tacos to cajun style seafood theres something for everyones taste when you can't decide where to eat. Had a great experience eating at this place. It has  really cool design about it. Real urban-ish. Our waiter was good too! Because it was our first time, he was showing us the popular dishes that other people ordered. But since we already ordered ours we didnt want to over do it.  Next time we come here I'm defiantly going to try some of there other stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The light above our table.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Beef Phó
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggrolls (supposed to be 4 but I couldnt take the picture in time)

ONKC_qS2WhUzQ0kN8kOxPQ.text: Been wanting to check out this place for a couple of weeks and glad I did. The scene is hip for a pho place and they don't offer the norm that you would see on the menu. Music is good and decor is pretty modern.   We tried the Oxtail Pho, Steak and Eggs, and Braised Pork Belly. I love oxtail with a passion so you really can't go wrong with me when oxtail is on the menu. It fell off the bones and they were gracious with the amount of meat they had in the pho. They put a little spin on the steak and eggs and added tomato rice which I also love (reminds me of the Asian cafe style food that you find in California if you know what I mean).  Steak was already cut up into small pieces and had an Asian flare to it.  The pork belly was pretty typical but also good.   I definitely want to go back to try some other things on the menu. Also found out the owner is a friend of a friend so I definitely want them to do well. My only complaint was my tiny coconut hole. How do you scrape all that yummy goodness when you can barely fit the spoon in the hole. But I got her done :)

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If only the hole was bigger :)

Qjo_22yiaRDMQ5Tfb1X67w.text: What a great first time experience. Not your typical Chinatown restaurant. Definitely more on the American modern style setting. Kinda gives a feel for a wing house dining setting especially with all the large flat screen TVs located all around the restaurant. Food was delicious. Service was a little bit slow. I felt like the server could have checked on us more often.   We order two appetizers: the fish tacos and pork belly buns. Our tacos came out first, and the buns were still missing. I had to ask the server if it was still coming out because she came to bring our entrees which was the pork chop combination rice plate and I had the shaken steak and egg with tomato rice. So I was a little disappointed the belly buns came out last considering I ordered it as an appetizer. Why is it even an appetizer of it's gonna come out AFTER my entree? that why I'm giving it 4stars verses the 5. Feel like the ball was dropped there.  Out of all the items we ordered... All though my shaken steak was great, it wasn't phenomenal. It was a little too oily, although the flavor and taste was great. Even though I will be back for it. I think the one that really stuck out for me... Flavor and taste wise was the fish tacos. I must say it was to be one of the best fish tacos I've had.   It was all good but it was missing a bit of a wow factor for me to give it 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Bone Noodle Soup
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib combo plate
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee fever ginger beer

rEyOPTe9_rLeYDCe2FZfTQ.text: The food was amazing but on my second visit, the service was EMBARRASSING. We had to eat our appetizers on our napkins because they never brought us plates or utensils. We waited forever to even be greeted after we sat down. Ill be back but maybe around a time when they are less busy. They seem to be understaffed and lacking bartenders with drink knowledge.

IaN_w16ozTWPvTom8Cl6sA.text: Lively, wonderfully decorated, amazing authentic Asian food with a modern vibe.   Love the oxtail fries!

8-2iNxy7VIf9F_EhL4MX4A.text: The decor and atmosphere is great! The service is good but not exceptional. The variety of different Pho is awesome and their portions are pretty big. Each time I visit Vegas, district one is always on my list!

7HRlZYTSFfhGuHwuHceFxA.text: One of my favorite spots to eat at when I'm in Las Vegas. first off the servers here are friendly as it can get and the vibe is just great there.   Now with the food....Let me tell you that the ox tail fried rice, man I can eat that all day every day. Everything else I have ordered was also delicious so all I can say is you better come here when you're in vegas!

3nQmwT-41Vu9II8_cc3G6Q.text: This place is unbelievable amazing! Very friendly staff with good customer service. The food was excellent. The oxtail fried rice, fresh oysters, garlic wings, steak & egg over rice, and the Vietnamese beef carpaccio were scrumptious!

MBGBQzpU2jMe_kpJM98k2Q.text: Came here to try their Bone Marrow Soup. Broth was delicious and HUGE, but only came with broth and no noodles. I had to pay extra for a tiny portion of noodles that took 30 minutes to arrive at the table. My boyfriend order the grilled king crab at MP. He received one leg cut up in 5 pieces for $36. So not worth the money. It was overcooked and rubbery and left him hungry. He order a side of garlic noodles because the crab comes a la carte. He said they tasted good but cold by the time he got them. The staff ignored the table for most of the time. For a party of 8 it took an hour to bring our dishes one at a time. Some of the people were done eating by the time the last dish came to the table. Entree dishes were brought as appetizers and were cold by the time the actual entrees came out.  Just poor kitchen management. The only thing the table enjoyed was the coconut ice cream in the coconut shell. I won't be returning or recommending this place. Just mediocre Asian fusion dishes for higher prices.

LmDLyGEXec034EUxxE5Tcg.text: Ordered the Specialty House Oysters which were pretty darn good. Liked the citrus mixed with jalapeno (and I added a little Tabasco to each to give it an ever more vinegar-y kick). It was a refreshing starter. The Pork Belly Steamed buns were  tasty too. Then I ordered the Pork Belly bowl, which was even better! Best Pork Belly bowl hands down. Served with a soft boiled egg in the broth, and just enough fat to melt in your mouth. Yum!  My boyfriend ordered the Spicy Beef ramen, which he wasn't too impressed with and said it was way too spicy (and he likes spicy stuff). However this isn't Monta, so he should've known better.  Overall, I thought the food was great!

uF6cTPtMhTIax9bO60Zoww.text: Nice place. Great service. Food was good. Only three stars because I was hoping for better tasting food. We had the short ribs with rice- needed more flavor. Oxtail pho was good. The grilled squid could've been better.

NkRezzPdRVqLvp6d7NY6GA.text: Hands down my new favorite spot to bring friends and family . The live  scallops n oysters were amazing !

pqexo-ly-ktekuM-f12bHQ.text: We ordered the pho oxtail soup, beef lemon grass in betel leaves, fish tacos, beef carpaccio, pork belly buns and pork belly slow braised soup w poached eggs. I enjoyed the pho oxtail soup and carpaccio. Will come back to try more of their soups and entrees though.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised pork belly with poached eggs
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos (yellowtail)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef lemon grass with betel leaves

fuC0ZuBhS2hkGGbcr2IDFQ.text: Incredible food to say the least. This is my first time here and what makes it a home run for me is the atmosphere. It's a different type of Vietnamese restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another one of my favorite - tht kho trng. I love how the eggs are cooked. It&#39;s a good twist to this traditional dish
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I have to try the lobster pho. While the pho is just Ok, the lobster is incredible. Overall it&#39;s a good dish!

WM68kB9VOvH987UqLlDBqA.text: I came here a month ago with some friends visiting from San Jose. Honestly, I came here because TimothyDeLaGhetto came here so I decided to see what the hype was about.   Vibe: 5/5 I really liked how the restaurant was laid out and designed. It felt like a very hip Asian lounge that had good food and drinks. The walls had interesting pictures and designs definitely were something to look at. I come from San Jose so I definitely liked the Vietnamese fusion vibe they got going on. Service: 5/5 Service was wonderful, we were seated right away and the staff answered any questions that we had. One of my friends is almost deathly lactose intolerant so the waiter was very thorough and explained what everything was made of, so we really appreciated that. Well done. Food: 5/5 I wanted to order the Lobster Pho, however, I had just eaten right before so my stomach wasn't up for it. Instead, I ordered the Ahi Fish Tacos and Mekong Boat Noodles. The Ahi Tacos were simply delightful. The ahi tuna mixed with the fusion of vietnamese herbs were perfect. A great mix of Mexican, Japanese, and Vietnamese dishes. I loved it. The Mekong Boat Noodles were on point as well. Not the best I've ever had but it definitely hit the spot.  I highly recommend this place for the creativity and boldness that they are wiling to experiment with foods from different cultures.

d543CDchI5h0PqRq5IlOwQ.text: Best service in Chinatown. The ingredients are of the highest quality and it comes out in the end product.  You have to try the lobster pho!

TRsF5207F6HYUtw7g1NObg.text: Thank you District One for not acknowledging your potential customers.  Was there today and waited to be seated. Place was not busy at all.  Two employees looked at me and went on their merry way. No one said "we'll be right with you". Nothing. We were looking forward to try this place for our Vegas vacation. Thank you for not giving two sh**ts.  Kai the owner,  we loved your Pho So 1.  Please talk to your employees on being more welcoming your customers.  Very DISAPPOINTED.

sswJ1hZ8vHUBrn8nh1SVQQ.text: Just goes to show you gotta go to Chinatown area to get great Asian food. I do not usually care for pho but I loved it here. I ordered the mi wonton which was a huge bowl of goodness. Sampled my friends beef pho. I also had the pork buns which was delicious. The service here was perfectly attentive and the bartenders were so friendly. I came here for a night out with a group of friends and they accommodated our party without a glitch. Even separated the bill for us easily. Kudos to this place. I will definitely come back soon.

CkeqRR-90UwVuGvMRJNtvQ.text: I have only been to District One twice. The food is nothing special. I have tried the Five spiced hen over tomato rice and pickled veggies. I thought there was no point in adding the pickled veggies in the menu since you barely get anything. I love that the tomato rice had a lot of flavor and also the hen. Tomato rice and hen were perfect. I have also tried their Oxtail Pho. I honestly think there is nothing special about that. The broth is just a regular Pho broth and the Oxtail seemed a little overcooked.   The menu is small compared to other pho places. I think District one is a Viet Fusion restaurant. They don't have everything a usual pho place would have. They don't offer many rice dishes or the drink desserts. So if you're looking for your typical Viet food, I wouldn't come here.   I would probably go to District One once in awhile for the Five Spiced Hen over Tomato Rice only. The prices at District One are higher compared to any other pho places in Las Vegas.  The environment is more hip and clean compared to other pho places though. It is very modern I would say. There is a bar and seating is very nice.   The service was good. I have only gone to District One once during lunch and early dinner (4AM). There were only 3-4 other parties the times that I have gone there.

kDbUYf9M4KcEQvhCkHNZ8w.text: Really nice concept of decorating the restaurant! Clean and cool! Those staff are nice! Food is perfect

J4vHI5rLbUybK7wsPAXU-w.text: The best Oc tail pho in town, love the decor and the best customer service. The owner is really nice. I'm very happy to see what he put together here. He really bring the Vietnamese food to another level. I will come back here and referral my friends here. :)

mhbquiGmu_hqbyLYbz476A.text: This place is amazing! Their selection is service is great and after visiting for the first time (drive by) with my husband, I ended up bringing a group of friends yesterday for lunch. As I was given credit for picking a great restaurant, I can honestly say I would continue to bring people over, especially the oyster lovers!  Pho is great, specials are GREAT (my husband had the red snapper with papaya salad, which was beautiful presented and great tasting), but I'm a sucker for fresh oysters and both visits, I had 2 dozen of their oysters as my entree. They server Blue Point as their house special and I enjoyed the Fanny Bays. Topped with tobiko and done just right!   Wonderful selection of drinks too. I definitely enjoyed Yamazaki which are quite hard to find at any restaurant. I only wish they had Hitachino Red Rice stocked yesterday.   Nicole coincidentally was our server both times and she was not only helpful but was knowledgeable with both food and drink menus and couldn't have made our experience any better. Our table of 6 was bused frequently was checked up on several times. However another server who came over to check on us informing she will be taking over the section when I asked for our server so we could order additional items. This is when I ordered the Hitachino Red Rice and after she took the order she came back letting me know they were out. I asked what other ones they have as I was naming off the other types as she couldn't remember which one and brought us a drink menu (finds out it was IPA). I totally understand any restaurant will have certain items low/out but would be lovely if the servers could check the 86 list prior to greeting their guests. Not to mention, Nicole never informed us that Juliet will be taking over. However, she did have a very lovely attitude with a beautiful smile and I'd love to have her as our server one of these days! Long story short, everything was great! I am looking forward to trying your black pepper lobster. You will be seeing me again very soon!! Thanks again District One!

bk6a4XPeffnibvAcqcDdhw.text: Love the oxtail fried rice..I ordered vietnamese regular ice cofee and Vy recommended the Hennessey Vietnamese ice coffee...Soooo good..Jason C. our waiter was awesome. They have happy our too.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must try Hennessey vietnamese ice coffee.

lH7jRsg0I6uJXpjWd_t6uA.text: I like District One for its unique atmosphere. The food is great, the menu is extensive with plenty of options to choose from & the service is pleasant. The restaurant has an upgraded modern urban touch to it. Everything catches your eye! From the cocktails to the pho soups & other food items, to the decor. It's not your ordinary restaurant. It's Vietnamese food with a modern twist. Definitely recommend it for anybody who wants to try something new & different!

JjZr3-uixBLyrkh7vLnkrA.text: BIG BONE SOUP. Hands down the best thing to get here (with a side of rice of course). I mean, who can say no to the succulent taste of bone morrow?! But ahhhh!!! It's so popular that sometimes, they're out of it (hence my one star deduction). Don't you fret though! They have a TON of other great dishes! If they're out of bone morrow (like tonight), then I order the oxtail pho with rice instead of noodles. If you're not feeling like soup, try the oxtail fried rice. So rich in flavor!!! Those are the top 3 we like to order, but tonight we decided to go with one of their specials: 18oz ribeye! A little on the pricy side but it was so juicy and seasoned to perfection! In all, you really can't go wrong with anything you order here. Service is great and food comes out pretty fast. Oh and if you're over 21, try the coconut mojito. It's amazing and comes inside a coconut! And if you're any age, try their coconut dessert. (Can't you tell I love coconuts lol). But really... You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut mojito comes inside a young coconut. You can scrape the meat off after you drink it. Yum!!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 18oz ribeye - so juicy!!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho. Meat falls right off the bone!

MqNsTMEfVQZ2d4ftDEx0Yw.text: OMG!  I love their Oxtail fries and Loco Moco.  Enough said.

BxlSn-KMMaXk1Z4ngMIwFg.text: Really love this place. It's concept is nice and it has a really cool, modern look to it. I've only come for the pho so I can only speak on that. The veggie one is still beef based so beware. Other then that, the veggies are cool to perfection and the noodles are well done. The beef pho is amazing and the meat is thin and nicely cooked as well. The only reason I knocked it off a star is that, although the staff is nice and helpful, they come by your table too often and I have a hard time enjoying my food. Other than that, it's a great place and I still come to it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie pho!

wDtvkpeR99LOXFYbgBM6Qw.text: Wow this restaurant was incredible! From the moment you walk in great music, the interior design was spot on with natural wood elements, metal, and painted phrases on the walls. The staff immediately greets you and seats you gets refreshments started and helps guide you through the menu. We ordered more than we should've we just couldn't resist with such a delicious and unique sounding menu. The fried egg rolls were perfectly golden brown and utterly delicious paired with a homemade dipping sauce and a ton of fresh unique herbs. The chicken wings were also fried perfect still juicy inside, by far one of the most unique wings I've ever enjoyed. The house oysters were delicately prepared and tasted like you were at the beach and not in Las Vegas. Now for the star of the show their popular lobster Pho.... the flavors were incredible it was like a symphony of flavors in your mouth! The lobster was fresh and cooked perfectly. All the ingredients just melted in your mouth along with the fresh herbs, onions, and noodles. Jason was our server he was truly a delight with a warm smile and great advice guiding us through our decadent lunch. I will definitely be back and recommend this fantastic Vegas gem to everyone I know! Thank you District One and Jason you were the highlight of my week!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano Chicken Wings
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Oysters
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggrolls

PZAPDyggAfREQXoFcMK2wQ.text: Great food ("Vietnamese/Asian Fusion" is technically correct, but doesn't really adequately describe it), friendly service, in a shopping center full of great restaurants.  I had Vietnamese beef carpaccio, a coconut mojito served in a coconut, a cucumber gimlet, a great bowl of oxtail Pho, and 2 hours of relaxation, for less than a mediocre room service or cafe meal on the Strip.  I'd definitely recommend this place (open until 2am), especially for for drinks and lively groups.

IY03_gFoXjCVH4cdRDcwTw.text: Make sure you try to the ox tail fried rice. Great food and drinks. Interior set up was nice, however, parking lot is kinda sketch. Wannabe Asian thugs with their ugly cars typically loiter and take up parking spots.

R5jsimne4BMf6pTWFwVW9Q.text: I don't love it, but I like it. I'm not a fan of Vietnamese food but this place is not your typical Vietnamese restaurant. It's in a busy plaza of Chinatown and parking can be a struggle.   ATMOSPHERE District One has this urban feel to it. Place is spacious and loud, with three sections. The sports bar, main floor and booth.   SERVICE Courteous, friendly service. My server suggested some of her favorite dishes and was attentive the entire time.   FOOD Not too much of a selection. Menu consist of appetizer, rice, noodle soup and seafood. My friendly server told me that anything with oxtail is popular, and suggested me Oxtail Loco Moco which is not on the menu. Along with that, she also suggested Rice Combo Platter (choice of short ribs or pork chop but you can get both for $4 extra) and Oxtail Fried Rice.   Oxtail loco moco was good! Not like the Hawaiian loco moco that I imagined it to be with the buttery gravery. Gravy itself had a vietnamese twist with pieces of cilantro. There were plenty of oxtail inside which was super tender. All of this deliciousness with sunny side up egg....perfection.   CONCLUSION Obviously one item is not enough to give this place the accurate rating but I will be back to try more and adjust my rating/review.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Loco Moco

ddINnIVcFGDv8jDg_Ap0cw.text: Food tasted awesome...happy hour is the time to go....the flavor of the papaya salad was on point but could be spicier.springs rolls were really good I loved the crunch in the middle!!orange cream cocktail was very good too...I would highly recommend this place

fnw9EYLlZPNU9VoZa2-ixw.text: Service from start to finish was horrendous. No eye contact from anyone for the first 5 minutes and we have currently been done eating for well over 10 minutes with no one checking on us since our food was delivered. My card is on the edge of the table. I get it. Vegas is for vacation. Maybe I should have more patience or maybe someone could have a little sense of urgency and take my money so I can leave.......food was okay pho was great.

wNpcCwYfqlEKhiHhJ41oyQ.text: Beef carpaccio is THE thing to come for.   Lobster pho is eh, I think personal preference is beef and chicken pho. The lobster was fresh and soup had lobster flavor but didnt blow me out of the water. They also didn't offer the basic beansprouts and jalapenos toppings in the beginning.   Serrano chicken wings is also eh. Some wings tasted really spicy and some were just mild spice, hit and miss depending on where they sat on the jalapenos, I guess.   Parking is pretty crazy on a Saturday night since they share the lot with a lot of other businesses.   TLDR- get beef carpaccio 8) worth the 4 stars for me!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio

WohywM0dC91ZVtmoroczcQ.text: I have heard many good things about this place and I am glad I came! I am a fan now because all the raves are all so True!! The restaurant is a huge location and can seat large parties. This place is quite popular during happy hour, weekend, and watching sports! Parking can be a struggle but it's all good. The food is worth fighting for a parking space.    This is a good place for Vietnamese fusion and are well known for serving lobster PHO!! Presentation makes me drool but I heard it's doesn't taste as good as it looks after finding out you are paying lobster the market place between  $35-45!! Lol... Don't get me wrong.. The pho they serve is better than most pho places in Vegas. Just be prepare for the bill.  Other popular dishes are the bone soup, oxtail fried rice, and the oxtail pho. The serving size is enough to feed 2 ppl. Soup is very rich and flavorful!! They are generous with the noodles too. The best part is that the meat is so tender that it easily falls off the bone. Yum!!   I love the atmosphere here. Servers always check on you and they aim to please. I plan to come back here again!! I'm looking forward to another bowl of pho!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. happy hour oysters!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail friend rice!!!! Another must try!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho noodles!!! Soo good!! You gotta try!!

iywbOLeD-3v2rgzc7vzLRw.text: We were on our way home to LA and this place was on the way and we wanted something comforting before we left. They definitely have some big servings here and I underestimated it and over ordered as always (LOL). We got the oxtail fries (5/5 - great for sharing, probably enough for 3-4 if shared because there's 2 of us and we didn't finish it), spicy hue soup (5/5 - love the level of spiciness on this one and very meaty) and my bf got the lobster garlic noodles (5/5 - worth the $50 price because they serve it with the whole lobster and very well seasoned noodles). This place is great for family and friends because it's great for sharing!

4sn1H-_dY0nS6kGyU-7v8Q.text: Came here on a Saturday afternoon, and had to wait about an hour for a party of 6. I am told the wait is usually much less than this, but there typically is always a wait on the weekends. It was 110F outside, and the staff provided cups and pitchers of ice water for everyone waiting, which I thought was a very nice gesture.   For food we had the pho, oxtail fries, which were delicious! Good for sharing. We also had the fish sauce glazed wings to share as well. It was very heavy on the fish sauce, which is great if you like it, terrible if not. The batter is very crunchy, really enjoyed these. The pho was also very good, generous portions of meat (ribeye). Overall, the food was very good, service was friendly. Prices are on the high side for pho, and for off strip, but they've definitely got the demand to maintain it, so why not? Overall, this place was good, but it didn't blow my socks off. I would probably come here again if someone suggested it, and I didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes. Otherwise, I think Vegas has plenty of other great food options for the price.

UWKWyf5maAUJ9kjEhhr1Lw.text: Here I am with my random "You motivated me to do a Yelp review". I'm usually "you're really good" or "you're really bad". This place is really good. We weren't expecting this gem on the outskirts of Chinatown. But we got way more than what we bargained for...great drinks, great vibe, awesome service (Janelle) and amazing food. I guarantee you'll find something for your palette. District One was definitely a diamond in the rough. We live 25 mins away and we are definitely okay with becoming regulars. Highly recommend.

xAGWBopGbsBZzDDmEPWb-Q.text: I haven't ate the food here yet, so I will update later.......if I do end up going one of these days.  So, why the 2-star review?  I made reservations through Yelp on Christmas day for 9 people.  Well, 1 person couldn't make it that day, so I called to change it to 8 people.  When I called, they said they didn't take reservations for that day.  They why did they take the reservation in the first place?!?  With that being said, maybe it was a Yelp mistake (although, they should have worked with Yelp on that).  Even if it was, couldn't they at least make an effort to try to accommodate me?  Even after I explained it to 2 different people, they basically told me they couldn't do anything.  Can you imagine not having dinner reservation on Christmas?  How embarrassed was I?!?    Luckily, Vegas is filled with many other options, so we went some place else.  But, nonetheless.......

ATIapGSfw7Rrmcf1J3zpkg.text: I love how District One isn't just a pho/Vietnamese restaurant. Very extensive menu that will suit anyone's craving. They also got a long list of specials too.   Parking, like most plazas in Chinatown is small and compact. We kinda had to stalk a few people to find spots. My friends and I were here on a Saturday evening...pretty close to prime time dinner hours and didn't have to wait for a table. Place was busy too. Our waitress was attentive and kept our drinks filled. I wouldn't say the food were over-priced but it's definitely not your typical "Asian prices." Visitors from So Cal MIGHT get a sticker shock since we are so used to $6.50 pho and $8.99 HK cafe rice plates.   We ordered egg rolls ($6.99), two bowls of chicken pho ($9.99 each) and one of their specials; oxtail loco moco ($9.99 I think.). Everyone was pleased with their dish. Food came out pippin hot....that's always important to me. I would love to come back again and try other entrees.

Jb_FfUngGlH6S8AIC1EmIg.text: #19  I recommend eating at District 1 because it has great service And really good food, and drinks!   District 1  has great service because the waiters are patient and they cook their food fast.  Their drinks are also nice and cold and refreshing. But the bad thing about their can be some bad parking sometimes.  The food is really good and their fresh like their, unions, bean sprout, limes, and their leaves. Also their pho is really good like the pho Lobster and other types they have.

BwLWEmJ4su9o9snrZYexgw.text: Pho, pho, pho...  I'm big on soups or stews so anywhere that's serving some kind of variation of it will be on my hit list. Broth 4/5 I've been to Dist 1 a few times and one time I'm thinking the salt slipped from the cooks hands but most of the time the broth is solid. Meat always taste fresh and tender though... Appetizers ehhh... haven't been blown away by the calamri grilled nor fried. Chicken wings LOOKED better than they tasted. Drinks... yes! I love their drink menu. The drinks here are the unsung heroes! I've tried the coconut mojito which comes in a fresh coconut, big deal to me...if you like fresh coconut get it! The good morning aVietnam was amazing as well.  Last but not least, the staff is kind and interior is very spacious which I love, definitely recommend trying this spot. Love the bar here! Easily one of the best off the strip, huge selection of whiskeys and cognacs.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NQwwZeEBPGIh9vy6DdjJ2g.text: First time here and gotta say I was impressed! For a place located in Chinatown the place is quite big, modern, clean, and just different from the rest of Chinatown. My mom came here with her friends before and she wanted to come back for Mother's Day lunch.   We came in around 11am and was seated immediately, our drinks were taken quickly and the server came over to greet Happy Mother's Day and told us about their specials for the day.   We got a bunch of stuff to share and pretty much liked everything we ordered, some were more impressive than others but not a single bad tasting dish. First of all I was so impressed with how quick the food came out, we literally did not even wait 10 minutes after putting in our order before the food started coming out.   We got half dozen oysters just plain and half with their special sauce, oysters were cold and delicious, sweet and their homemade sauce was really good, not too strong to where it over powered the freshness of the oysters. We got the Vietnamese beef carpaccio and WOW that was so good!! I'm usually not a fan of raw beef but this was sliced super thing, the sauce was sour and salty, the fried onions on top, everything just worked! We got oxtail fries and oh boy was that good! Drowned in delicious gravy with lots of oxtail meat and an egg on top, probably the best oxtail fries I have ever had (better than the one at Bachi). We also got sea snails which my dad really liked.   My sister go the Lobster Pho and said the broth was a little too salty, she added limes and stuff and its as ok. Everyone came to try the lobster pho but for $50 I don't think it was worth it. It didn't taste bad by any means but the only special thing about the pho was the lobster. Their special for Mother's Day was lobster fried rice, now this was worth it! The fried rice obviously had lobster, eggs, fish eggs, the sauce was amazing, it looked amazing, smelled amazing and tasted amazing!! Everyone enjoyed this dish.   My brother got oxtail fried rice and this was really good, a little bland compared to the lobster fried rice but I like it, a healthier and lighter option. I got the bird's nest crispy noodles, I love the way they fried the noodles, so crispy and delicious. I also liked that they did not drown the noodles in too much sauce, the noodles was still crispy towards the end of the meal. I do think their sauce was a little too salty for my taste, but overall still good.   Overall I really liked the food, they have some unique dishes that really caught my attention. Service was great, drinks were constantly re-filled, they picked up dirty plates and offered to switch out our dirty plates during the meal, everyone was very friendly and attentive. Price point is not crazy either, the whole meal was only pricy because of the lobster pho and lobster fried rice, without those two dishes the check would have been a little over $100 for 5 or 6 dishes! Will definitely come back to try other dishes and re-order a few!!

v6JSD0jaDfuKu5HenMeY3Q.text: Fucking amazballs! Drinks are great, the food was just as good! Oxtail pho was just what I needed the next guy I came in, and my son ordered the oxtail fried rice. That egg on top was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6FPZwPFmdlDTsuq4mGvHCg.text: It is often a game for me to find a place to eat when I'm in town and since I'm here once a month I make it a point to eat at different restaurants, you know, to get the most out of my corporate credit card account (wink wink).    Today is Vietnamese fusion food day.  This place has good reviews on Yelp and I love Vietnamese food so in I came.  I came in for lunch and felt like having a traditional Vietnamese salad, and lo and behold, they have the Goi Ga chicken salad (1 of my favs) and they also have the Imperial Stout oatmeal beer on tap, even better.  My afternoon was looking grander by the minute.   The salad did not disappoint and the beer was perfect.  Lunch really hit the spot.  Service was good.  Overall, I left happy and full.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6nM-aZEWEe8OmDLgWlSInQ.text: Definitely a must TRY!   Came in with friends and have been coming back ever since.    Great atmosphere, with an exceptional menu.  Good service and clever dishes.  Whole lot of flavor.    My favorite dishes are the oxtail frird rice, chicken pho, and the specialized desserts.  Oh my goodness.  Lol.   I loVe this restaurant.

VVPbg1GxyWz148fnqzPrVw.text: I came here for lunch with a bunch of friends. Since it's fusion Asian food, you can expect higher prices. There are some more interesting things like lobster pho and oxtail fried rice on the menu.   I ordered the chicken pho which was nice I guess. Tasted basic with chunks of chicken. Pork belly seemed very tender.

VBjhXI775TvjiXvG461ZvA.text: The food here is pretty good. I wish the oxtail pho was more flavorful than what it was. It tasted like regular pho but they added the oxtail to it. It didn't taste like they made the broth of ox tail.  The ox tail fried rice was okay. The pieces of oxtail were delicious, but the rice itself was way too garlicky for my liking. It seriously over powered everything and you were left with the garlic residue in your mouth for the rest of the night. And don't even get my started on your burps.   The service was good, but the night I came there was a 50th birthday, so I think there was more staff working that night.   I really like the decor in the restaurant it's really cozy and cute. It kind of reminds me of boiling crab.  I definitely want to come back and try those baos! They looked so good!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail pho and ox tail fried rice.

E1St8JRwNgMPuBDeqPZghA.text: YA'LL THE PHO HERE IS BOMB.   I have been sleeping on District One and so happy I am awoken now. After dying in Vegas and not getting out of bed until 5PM my friends and I decided to revive our lives with some pho, the ultimate hangover cure...   My friends were saying they went before and had to wait 45 minutes so I was a little hesitate to give this place a shot. However, when we went inside there was no wait. BLESS UP.   The broth flavor is indescribable. But what really makes their bowls of pho so great is the meat to noodle ratio. They be stackin' & packin' their meats!!! So happy I did not let the wait time or the 110 degree whether from stopping me from coming here. This will definitely be a stable for whenever I am in Vegas. Until next time District One!

DgEP5qN-enByLDjprzL1QQ.text: Just to be clear,  I have been waiting weeks to try the notorious lobster pho ~ so after the four hour drive I couldn't wait to taste such a unique and different dish from my normal traditional pho. For presentation I would give it 4! :) however if I'm paying $50 for a bowl pho - I'm expecting every part of it to be the best ever. According to the server , the broth was cooked 5 hours with the lobster; but when I tasted the broth, I couldn't get a taste of lobster at all! The broth was not has tasteful as I expected and lacked some flavor. My other complaint would be the noodles weren't as fresh as I expected. For a $50 bowl every bite should be exquisite - and the best is exactly what I was expecting but did not get. Given , I know we were paying for the price of the lobster - everything else still should have been amazing. Lastly , the lobster was actually cooked very well but I just felt like the overall experience was not as I expected. It was not at all worth the price.   Noted , if I were to come back I would most defiantly  get the pork bun baos again!!!! They were amazing & for an amazing price $4 on happy hour :) the pork bun was well cooked !

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tGSyqYRN--nccxlVQZOEJQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for ages but never got around to it since there are so many great food options in Vegas. Finally came on 6/16/17 and ordered as much as I could since I came with a couple friends.   Let me first start off by saying that the Oxtail Pho actually tasted pretty good at first..... until later that night...   I got FOOD POISONING FROM HERE AND IT WAS ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. IT LASTED FOR NEARLY 4 DAYS!!!!!!!!!!!!  District One was the only thing I ate that day, and honestly, I didn't know what happened to me. But starting at 8:00pm on Friday, 6/16, I started to feel very, very sluggish. I was playing in a poker tournament and I just could not keep my head up in the game. I was very light-headed and had to put my head down many times. Little did I know that it was the beginning to a disaster. I busted from the tournament that I no longer cared for and went straight to my room.  The next day, I start getting cold chills, body aches, high fever, and many trips to the bathroom that was just complete diarrhea every time, and it was awful. I lost my appetite, I was weak, and I didn't know what was going on. It wasn't until I texted my friend who came with me to District One, that he was experiencing the SAME THING. Fortunately for him, his only lasted 2 days. Said he took Pepto Bismol and sat on the toilet for 2 hours. I, took everything imaginably possible because I was getting desperate. I took Pepto, charcoal pills, ibuprofen, tylenol, many over priced juices, gatorade, drinking plenty of water, and NOTHING was working. My friend probably spent nearly $100 on all the items he had to get for me.  3rd day, Sunday 6/18, I felt like I was dying. Thankfully my friend stayed with me in the hotel at the Venetian on Saturday night to make sure I was okay, but this day was the WORST. My friend went to go have lunch with his other friend while I stayed in the room all day. Of course I woke up early at 8am to take my ritual diarrhea (this was about my 10th trip to the bathroom in the past 3 days) The minutes seemed to last forever, and when I looked at my watch to notice it was only 11am after what felt like hours on end, I didn't know what to do. My body aches and body chills were getting WORSE. My fever in my head just kept getting higher and higher, to the point where I thought my head was going to explode. My bed was soaked because of the cold sweat I had all night. I was too weak to open up the cap for the Tylenol that I bought, so I was stuck. I told my friend to cut his lunch early to take me to the ER. We had to call numerous places since there was such limited availability on a Sunday but we finally found a spot 20 mins away. We went there and thankfully my gf is a doctor and I told her my symptoms and asked her if it was a good idea, since I was about to walk in. I didn't feel like spending an additional $1200+ for the emergency room fee so she just told me to just go through it and not check in to the ER. I was also feeling a little better getting to move around and go outside so that helped as well.   4th Day, Monday 6/19, I start to feel much better and my poop starts solidifying (sorry for all the gruesome details but it was really that bad). I finally had my first real meal at dinner and by Tuesday, 6/20, I was better.   District One, you wasted 4 days of my Vegas trip because of your Oxtail Pho. 4 of us ordered Oxtail Pho, and the first two bowls you gave out to my other two friends were fine. The next batch of bowls that came out that came to my friend and me was the really bad batch. We both got food poisoning but thankfully his only lasted 1.5-2 days while mine lasted nearly 4 days. You also made me spend ridiculous amounts of money on over-the-counter items and supplies and I couldn't even focus in the poker tournament that I spent $1500 to enter that I was looking forward to the most the entire year. Thank you for ruining part of my Vegas Trip. This was probably my most expensive lunch I've ever had.  Also, I felt really, really bad for the other people who had the bad batch of Oxtail Pho that day. It was the first day of EDC weekend and I can't imagine what they were going through in the middle of the dessert after getting food poisoning as well. They probably thought it was the heat and the music or drugs getting to them, when really, it was the lunch they ate earlier that day.

dPjeP2U_Sy232sCTGwEU9w.text: How the hell is this place only four stars?  This is proof that some reviewer/humans have absolutely zero neuro capacity to make a sound judgement.  I have liquid dreams about this place.  I drive up from San Diego, 300+ miles to experience authentic Vietnamese on steroids.  District One, thank you for bringing True happiness into my life.

8G46uz6hxuSMkL7qg4k6Pw.text: Where do I even begin???? First of all, the Staff is so friendly, nice, and on top of their game! Our server who was not Vietnamese was pronouncing the dishes like a pro. I complimented her pronunciation and she said that she learned how to say the dishes correctly to communicate with the kitchen. How awesome is that?!   The wait is hefty when you are hungover, but everything worth having is worth waiting for!   I had oxtail pho. It was soooooooo good. It could maybe use another hour in the pot for that fall off the bone meat, but the broth and flavor was super tasty. I washed it down with a vietchelada.  My table also had bun bo hue and they really liked the flavor.   The coconut ice cream dessert is a must!   Thanks District one for putting the cherry on top of a great weekend!

6UZ5ksXvHgkrz2EBuANC3w.text: Customer service is excellent. Keeping water refilled and also food was delivered piping hot and fresh. The highlights were the: Two bone marrow, Grilled Squid, Oysters, Oxtail Fried rice, Pork Belly buns. The other dishes were OK, including the lemon grass snail, beef carpaccio and Chinese clay pot.   I'm not usually a big fan of fusion, but when it's done right - it's pretty cool and this restaurant hands down does it extremely well. I was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant is bright, large, clean and has a fully stocked bar with a bunch of screens for watching sports. I will definitely be back if I return to Vegas.
