Re1dtXR0k9dZ643l2hqDaw.text: Absolutely fantastic service and phenomenal best soup ever I ordered the Pho Ga chicken with broccoli and bok choy added!  Super cool atmosphere with good music and comfortable seating.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iDE9Bx_fGbPmDMbOF_xubQ.text: I have heard of this place for a long time. Nice decor. Service was good. Their Lobster Pho is something worth a try. But all the credit goes to the Lobster, good size, great meat and well cooked but the Pho soup was just ok. There is no taste of star anise nor cinnamon as the regular Pho always has. Try it out for your curiosity.

M7iY46wOGYgcg8TlKaD5xw.text: Heard good things about this place so me and the wifey with a couple friends decided on a whim to come here at 10 pm on a tuesday night. Good to know they are open everyday from 11 am to 3 am.   After going over the menu, everything looked good on paper. I went with the Oxtail Fried Rice and Edamame. Wifey went with the Grilled Squid. Our friends got the Fish Tacos and Bone Marrow soup.  For the appetizers the Edamame was lightly grilled and sprinkled with sea salt. Taste was just ordinary. As for the Fish Tacos they give 3 little taco shells that look and taste kind of like deep fried won tons. The actual fish (which was not much) was yellow tail.  The Oxtail Fried Rice was very salty. I think they put too much soy sauce. I could only eat about 3 spoonfuls. That's too bad because tastewise, I dont think it needed that much salt.  The Grilled Squid was on point. Nicely seasoned and grilled. The spicy garlic aioli sauce that it comes with complemented it very well.  The Bone Marrow soup comes with a huge bone. Literally. Im not into that so I cant really say if I liked it or not.  Service was great. We never had to ask for refills on our waters especially me because of the excess salt that I had eaten.  Overall, the total tab was around 70 bucks including tip. In my opinion, the food is great with the exception of the Oxtail Fried Rice. I think the pricing is bit much based on the portions you get. The Beef Carpaccio was recommended by my Yelp friends after seeing my check-in here. Im sure I will find myself in the area next time so a second visit will be pending.  Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #190

Marinade was on point, with enough sweetness and just the right amount of saltiness. my only complaint is why there's wasn't more.   I didn't like the Chinese sausage too much.   I must say that everything I've had so far minus the Serrano wings and Cajun fries has been a 5 star for me.

0gziBbA_I6glkKGctkHhRQ.text: Been here before and service was great. Food even better. HOWEVER, this time around the lady at the counter skipped us on the list of waiting parties. She didn't even call our parties name, instead she crossed it out without our knowledge. We tried to ask her about it and she was rude. She completely ignored us until I had to yell at her. She then changed her attitude, acknowledged her mistake, and sat us.   Aside from that, service at the table was great.

tOSXNMVX9nAn_ocjLigTbw.text: Been here a few times. It's not the typical Vietnamese food, it has it's own twist to it and I love it! The decor is more American/Asian inspired put together.   I first fell in love with their garlic noodles, chicken wings with fish sauce, grilled squid and so on and so forth. And you have to have their coconut ice cream.   One thing though, when they get busy or late at night, parking here it's hard to find.

WYwGA3xC-Q75nJhqoF59gw.text: The best oxtail fried rice in town , usually I asked them to add fresh chilly when they cooked it to add more spicy to it  and also their chicken wings are so good .

2Zina0hckMyJF1i10bQW_A.text: After being ever-so-rudely blown off by the host at Chada, we found ourselves here for dinner at the bar with football and an awesomely knowledgeable bartender who guided our dining choices.  PORK BELLY BUNS: Simple, tasty, perfect. Inhaled the trio. VIETNAMESE BEEF CARPACCIO: Highlight of the meal, large portion for an appetizer with great mix of flavors and textures. This dish is what brought my overall rating up from three stars to four. OXTAIL PHO: Dish that brought me in here. Simple ingredients, tasty broth, enjoyable but not a dish I feel that I have to have again. Ample meat portion! RAZOR CLAMS: Chef special, stir fried razor clams in garlic and peppers with a kick of spice to them. Cool presentation, but wouldn't get again.   Dinner for two with two beers (Boston Brown Ale, so good!) came to $60 before tip, largely due to the razor clam special which was unexpectedly $18. Would have rather had two different appetizers instead. Good place to watch the game in a low-key setting with tasty food.  EDIT: Dropping a star due to inconsistency. Came back a couple of times and dishes always seem to be hit or miss. Recently, their porkbelly rice dish was 99% fat and none in our group cared for their take on papaya salad. The buns are always good, garlic noodles are chewy and fragrant, and the fish tacos are a HH-only item for me because they're good but tiny... but I feel like ordering outside of my few go-to dishes is risky.

FittFpG3XPS2VV49uMIpqg.text: A friend suggested that we go to this place being the foodie that we are, me and my husband. The friend said their best seller is the big bone soup which is good for 3 people at the very least. So we went one night after 9pm. To our dismay, the receptionist told us there is 10 minute wait...it is ok. But it wqs already pushing to 20 when we were seated. Furthermore, she said a COUPLE OF MINUTES for the server is but waited 5 minutes. And to make the night worst...they were out of the big bone soup. You decide

1wZXqvt01CpmGk1OxvrF6A.text: Service was very friendly and food was fresh tasting.  My friend and I shared 4 plates and we both really liked 2 of them, then thought the other 2 were just "OK". Possibly my favorite was the pork belly slow cooked in coconut juice, but the crispy egg rolls were also a winner. The wok tossed clams and beef wrapped in betel leaves were the dishes that I would pass on.  The broth on the clams could have used more flavor and the beef rolls were slightly dry inside.   The portion sizes were good

mQZBxXAu5qcj9uHW3M7rQw.text: Yummy fusion food! I was sad that they were 86ed on calamari!! But we will definitely be back to get it! Out coconut water was amazing! Special my coconut Mojito!! The food was inconsistent though! We ordered papaya twice because it was so good! The first one disappeared fast! The second one was dry and tasteless we ended up sending it back and getting it to go. It took so long! The other food is definitely worth coming back for! Until next time!!

ENyNnJ3ky9fM-krbMQtptw.text: Legit Oxtail Pho for Vegas and the salt and pepper wings is super bomb! Great vibe for drinks and a good break from your typical Vietnamese spots on Spring Mountain (and the strip) if you want an hour of normalcy.

nFgzsw32h-8nISmjr2MuzQ.text: Best local destination hands down in Las Vegas. Great food, great atmosphere, great service, and the best great drinks! From the staple lobster pho to the dinosaur bone barrow soup dish this place has it all. Don't think this is your regular pho destination! This place has so many more to offer! Chef Khai's cooking and presentations are one of the most creative I've seen here in Las Vegas. Also great place to watch your favorite NBA, Football, baseball, or basketball games! Stop on in...You won't be disappointed!

EZt8_5M6vZWbYeCPjFHxmQ.text: The ambiance, the presentation, the service and of course food was THE BEST. Each entree was unique and definitely coming back!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh lobster special with black bean sauce. Sooo good.

APc253AL2BhKVDHyqyQjLg.text: I can't get enough of this place! Everything we ordered was amazing! Renee D was also exceptional! Sea snail appetizer, braised pork belly, oxtail pho, and the house special oysters! Broke da mouth!

nFkxEPdfAUCUgNM1QiATzQ.text: So we go for Happy Hour, order 3 different things. First item comes out fish tacos not bad we finish this and wait for a couple of minutes then our next item comes out, chicken Wings which is good. Then we wait and wait and wait. Ask the server where our garlic fries are? He says it will be a minute.  Wait 5 more minutes and catch another server ask for him to check on our order of fries and wait. We are deciding if we want to order more items. 30 minutes pass and hooray we finally get our fries. NO APOLOGY nothing just here is your order of fries. Kinda of irritated now especially as the fries are not even HOT!   Bill comes and they charge us for 2 orders of garlic fries. After telling them again NO APOLOGY! Guess that equal NEVER COMING BACK!!!!!   2 stars cause tacos & wings weren't bad

5zzjDDIzCoHMtyxD582bqw.text: Ambiance was much better than the actual food here. Service was good-attentive & quick. I really wanted to like this place, but overall, wasn't impressed!   1.) Chicken pho was not made w chicken broth! I order chicken pho specifically for that reason. Instead, they use beef broth. I know this isn't a 'strictly pho' joint, so they probably use the same broth for all of their phos.   2.) Oxtail fried rice was too mushy & wet for my liking. I like my fried rice drier in texture & this seemed almost porridge like..something was missing in flavor too. There was a good amount of oxtail meat though!  3.) Whole grilled squid-probably the best out of the 3 dishes we (bf & I) tried. The spicy aioli was okay, but I would have preferred this dish w ponzu.   There are probably dishes here that are good/better, but I don't think I will be running back here anytime soon to find out.   P.S. I have used Yelp for yrs but never wrote my own reviews..decided to start tonight...proud to say this is my first review on here-woot :)

ivEasfzH2nnCIS0M8-rkcQ.text: This was a very trendy Vietnamese fusion place. I loved the interior design and the atmosphere. I got the deep fried pork bun and the garlic noodles with chicken.  I also tasted the fish sauce wings. DONT LET THE SMELL FOOL YOU! The wings were the highlight of the meal. The deep fried buns were ok not really special, and the garlic noodles were too overpowering. Overall it was ok, but not the best

e9IV6FFPJyzGra-onFQ-eQ.text: This place is flippin' fantastic!! Food is amazing-- had the Oxtail Rice and Beef Carpaccio-- wow!

cwc67FPa1sNopk3d7Vkzdg.text: Absolutely amazing! The lobster ph is incredible. I plan to come here every time I'm in Las Vegas. The bone marrow soup is awesome too. And the coconut mojito is great!

oSho9UZoHg7J6AG28BSvUA.text: This is one of my regular spots to go to. Love the Oxtail Pho plus their broth is delicious and rich.  They always have seating and have good hours. Their happy hour menu isn't too bad either.

iJq0s9BPCclaqEJXlEFjwA.text: Came here for a weekend lunch around 2pm. Took a couple minutes to get seated but I liked the atmosphere and the two waiters that took care of us. Our crew started off with the Oxtail Fries (Oxtail gravy, fries, fried egg). It was a different kind of bomb since it was wet due to the gravy. I got the Oxtail Fried Rice which was cooked to perfection. My friend got the Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. My other friend got the District One combo platter. I was super hungry since I just finished hiking at Red Rock so I felt the food was so good! Tried a bit of each meal and loved it. Food wise I'd give them a 5 star. My only complaint would be the men's restroom didn't have a holder for the toilet paper and was confused as to why there were 3 sinks outside the men's and females restroom hallway. Probably helps not to slow traffic when their busy so some people can just wash their hands instead of going into the restrooms. Other than that, not a bad spot indeed. You gotta end with the coconut ice cream!

BtgGVNhHC0ef4HEf-0AUyA.text: Great customer service. I highly recommend the xo tail pho and grill whole squid.  We also ordered the ox tail due to the great reviews but I found it to be average.

1UW6cWHzTcEZrkFPjCrKbw.text: Had a chance to visit this place since many friends talk about their Pho Lobster. No kidding, a real 1 1/4 lbs.Maine lobster and the broth taste so original; cost  $45 for a bowl of Pho Lobster. But their house special Oysters are the talk of the town. Full bar and large TVs. This place is definitely better than Rio Seafood buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For real, Main lobster 1 1/4 lbs.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For group of 8.

xPCuAQf3qEVFZmaA3sDRJQ.text: Unless you are going for one of their signature dishes (e.g. Lobster Pho), District One Kitchen & Bar is nothing special.  The appetizers we ordered (Pork Belly Bun and Egg Rolls) were mediocre.  I had the Oxtail Loco Moco special, which had too much fresh onions/cilantro for my taste, but was overall pretty good.  The pho-infused gravy was ingenious and the oxtail itself was SO tender!  My friend had one of the standard pho and he seemed satisfied.  The atmosphere is more modern here than your typical pho restaurant, which was cool.  It is also a bar, including overpriced alcohol/beer, but it supposedly has a pretty good happy hour.  The service could use a little work, as most of the dishes were served without the server even speaking to us.    In my opinion, unless you are going for one of their signature dishes, you may as well go to one of the many cheap, authentic pho restaurants around every corner in Spring Mountain.

Oz3-d4Q7-vWyS9qvr7kUgQ.text: This place took over for some Cajun seafood  restaurant and had the same feel to it. All was well at first. I ordered the coconut mojito which took forever to come out. I think because they were car I up a fresh coconut to serve it in. I hope. The food took a while to come and when it did, it was just ok. I ordered the pork belly rice bowl and my wife ordered the pork chop. Her pork chop was overcooked and dried out. My pork belly came with an undercooked egg and in a dish separate from what is anticipated. Despite this I hoped initially that the food would be ok. At the end of the meal I felt unwell. Ended up getting sick. Wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend, although the servers were nice-ish.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut mojito. Looks better than it tasted.

3nK-US5Fx18zJyeRSeLkBw.text: I love eating here!  The oxtail fries are amazing, the place looks great, every time I've come here the service was quick. Overall great food & staff. Jason was very helpful! He sets a very good example on how staff should be.  Five stars! :)

VnFa9HK5br1hsUA7OVRuJw.text: The first place I want to go to when I'm craving some good pho.. Not even just any pho..  oxtail and lobster pho for very reasonable prices! The oysters and pork belly are also amazing.  I also love how spacious and clean  the restaurant is..   District is now my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas!!

4DU6hd1COMGDBx-HfROOVA.text: This place is bomb! The appetizers are perfect portions. The food is well seasoned and tastes amazing. I got the beef carpaccio and papaya salad, both were so good.  My friend got the rice combo rice platter. The short ribs were to die for!!!  The place is clean the staff is attentive and the menu is small, but offers everything u need. I'll definitely be coming back.

Iq3BUpenDnU-nj0GjR8jmA.text: Ok where else can you get Lobster Pho??? This was one of my clients Resturant and I was excited to try it because the menu is too cool for school.   Being a foodie and with family and friends visiting from out of town it was fun bringing them to a spot that is jealous worthy.   The Resturant is a trendy joint with a cool bar. Great place to hang out on a Friday night or anytime. The lobster pho is awesome with or with out beef, the oxtail fried rice is super good and the happy ending coconut ice cream was a perfect sweet treat. I would have it without peanuts though because it wasn't sweeten or salty just raw crumble peanuts.   Can't wait to go back to try all things oxtail. Prices are ok not so crazy food is awesome and place is cool. My new favorite pho place!

hhVMPQeHYKcFhuHnTr6QQA.text: For all my Vegas friends (and those visiting), this place is great. We went there last night to get my friend Tiffanie away from the strip and I found this little spot on some random website...it got good reviews on Yelp so we decided to give it a try. Three of us split the Belly Buns, Carpaccio, Oxtail Fried Rice, and the 8 Treasures (not on the menu, a special since new years eve...had fried shrimp, tofu, and some other amazing stuff). Everything was awesome...I recommend this exact order to any of you, if you have a 4th, the oxtail fries look ridiculously tasty. The drinks were a little pricey, but they are all custom made and unique...watching Tiffanie drink a mojito from a coconut was well worth it. The ambiance with the music was perfect and the wait staff was surprisingly not in your face every second asking if you liked it. I'm definitely taking the crew from work here...  Happy Hour : Mon. - Fri. 5pm - 7pm Reverse Happy Hour Sunday Only : 12am - 2am

yBzHvWAKvxVEbUb7mSBJaA.text: Yes this place is worthy of Yelp's five star; I only visited it three times during my last vegas vacay which was also three days long.  On my first visit, my party came in to specifically try their pandan creme brulee which we did not end up getting because it was too early in the morning for dessert and we got full off of all the other items we ordered.  We ordered the spring rolls, fish tacos, belly buns, chicken wings, and oxtail pho.  We originally had our eyes on the lobster pho, however, being that it was forth of July weekend they were out at the moment.   The spring rolls and chicken wings were very traditional to the Vietnamese root.  However, the fish tacos and belly buns definitely have the Asian fusion flare to it.  The fish tacos came in three and was made with yellowtail (my all time favorite fish).  It was tasty and nice to look at.  The belly buns are a bit greasy, but then again it is made with pork belly.  It had a nice peanut butter taste and the buns were really good.  As for the oxtail pho, we were all surprised that it smelt and tasted great.  Sorry, but not sorry, Vegas is not known for their pho.  This one, however, had all the right flavors.  On our second visit, we went big and ordered a round of lobster pho.  It was pricey, but so very worth it.  I never had lobster pho before and now I never want to go without it.  Seriously, the food here is phenomenal.  Also, staff are super friendly and attentive.  Decor of the place is very modern, but the best part is their sinks.  I know it is crazy, however, they have sinks outside the restrooms.  It makes it so convenient when you want to wash your hands, but don't want to touch dirty bathroom doors!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. belly buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos

-uK6crqPl_kpeRHwxmPb-g.text: Ordered the lobster pho and bun bo hue. Both were super tasty. Service was excellent. Will definitely revisit the next time i'm in vegas!

L6CsVOtj-kXf-XcMzywQmg.text: One of my favorite restaurants! Known for their lobster and oxtail phos.... i usually go for the steak and eggs if I don't feel like eating pho that day. Their spring rolls are so good! Place is super cool and has a bar. Staff are super friendly and attentive!

1i4RmjOK25pINwxXeQemsw.text: Oxtail fried rice with garlic noodle sub. On point. And I don't know where else you can get oxtail pho.

aXiyn1B3jQPwD6-bAgNsdA.text: It was ok. Had the brontosaurus bone soup aka Bone soup on the meno. Literally two big bones, no meat on them by the way just for looks, and two pieces of oxtail. It was tasty but for 17.99 not really worth it. Food overall good but it's high prices Vietnamese food. House Moscow Mule was good tho, nice touch of lychee.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YqUDOhRLQ5ZmY3VOVt9rVg.text: 2 1/2 stars. Came in on a Sunday evening and the place was so busy they were overwhelmed with crowds from the EDC - Electronic Daisy Carnival. I'm not sure if management was unprepared but the service and quality was totally absent this second time dinning here.  I ordered the Mekong River Noodle soup, pork belly with coconut juice appetizer and Garlic noodles with shaken beef & egg. I asked for the Noodle soup to be served first and balance of entrees to follow. Unfortunately the waitress brought  Won ton noodle soup which was incorrect,  after telling a different waiter who apologized BC they were busy and redelivered the wonton noodle soup to the table next store. When my correct soup arrived the noodles were flavorful and tasty and consisted of shrimp, quail eggs, sliced pork, chives and yummy broth.  The pork belly arrived secondly and it was tasty over the steam rice. Lastly the garlic noodles were totally a miss - horribly greasy and overpriced at $13.95! The waiter apologized for the poor service and offered me complimentary coconut ice cream dessert which took some time to receive since he never advised the waitress who only showed up once after bringing the wrong soup so she had to confirm the complimentary ice cream with the mangager!  I don't know if I'll return here again or if they're busy....I would avoid this place. I Hope they get their service together and hope this was a fluke incident.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mekong noodles

QT19INoJX-iVzHtUf5X1ow.text: Food is pretty good. Restaurant stays pretty busy regardless of the time. We ordered the pho and it was very flavorful. Portions are pretty good for 2 people. So we ended up sharing and ordering an appetizer too.

8bXNsqrvKrays3EAdtQ_0Q.text: This restaurant has bomb oxtail fried rice! Their pho is also good but the main thing I usually go to district one is for their oxtail fried rice. They have nice servers, they're younger so people should come them some slack. They're always nice and see them working hard. Anyway, they have a good bar as well. And this decor is hipster style so it's definitely trendy. Come check this place out, definitely won't be disappointed

mIoUCNkmqRgRR7c_X0tf0A.text: Food and service is amazing! The oxtail fried rice is definitely in my top three best fried rice in vegas if not number one. This is a must checkout if you are around the area.

dSjERF1NogP3fR-usbJZgg.text: Holy my Moly. This is another restaurant that gets me hard.  District One is a hidden gem. I typically visit this establishment at least once for all my trips to vegas. In fact, its the first place that I stop by when I drive to Vegas from Cali. Food/Eating taking priority over Partying/Drinking...what is going on?? Yah its that guud! Its known as the "new Go-To spot" for all people of Las Vegas. I love PHO. I REALLY DO LOVE PHO. Simple, light, and delicious. What originally caught my attention about this restaurant was that they had OXTAIL pho and BONE MARROW pho. WHAT?? Yes...an oxtail where the meat falls right off the bone like butter and a delicious bone marrow with TONS and TONS of tendon. The sight of the bone marrow and oxtail makes all foodies say the 3 magic letters: O, M, G.  The protein and meats were absolutely delicious. The noodles were perfect and weren't too soggy and the basil and leaves were fresh to perfection.  (Fun Fact: Tendon is high in protein and low in fat)  Anywho...  When Im intoxicated beyond belief, or when I have any sort of alcohol in my system, the number 1 thing I crave is Soup and Noodles, in particular: PHO. And when Im hungover as hell the next morning, my number 1 cure is PHO. Being drunk in Las Vegas is fun, but being drunk w/o any delicious food to be consumed sucks. I wish there was a 24/7 buffet. Tacos El Gordos isn't as great as the original location in SD. Steak and Eggs for some cheap price just doesn't cut it. Earl of Sandwich gets boring. And who wants to pay for overpriced room service??   PHO is my answer! Another cool thing about this place is that its open till 3 AM. And another cool thing about this location is that they serve lots and lots of craft Beers. I had a Soba Ale created by Chef Morimoto...this is an ABSOLUTE MUST TRY!  If your drunk, or if your looking for a place with great Vietnamese food, come out to District One. This place has a 4.5 star rating for a reason! This is a must-visit for all foodies, especially those people (*cough asians) who love to take pictures of their own food. This Bone Marrow is a must-see-in-person type of deal! This place gets me hard, and I love everything about this restaurant, everything from the customer service, to meeting the managers, to the decor, and the plating.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!   UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jgRL_ucB-7BSRzOYHsH0hw.text: A friend of mine who is a Vegas resident recommended this place to me.  So good he comes multiple times a week. And he did not steer me wrong.    Oxtail pho ($11.95): gigantic portion... 3 girls each ordered one and we could have shared one. Plenty of oxtail and meat fell right off the bone. Broth was good and noodles had a food bite. Overall wonderful.  Lobster pho (market price ~$29.95): for the price, it actually wasn't that bad. Definitely something to share. I would say it's something you order once, but probably won't order again. Good, but not great.   Oxtail fried rice ($9.95): my favorite menu item. Plentiful chunks of oxtail mixed on well with buttery rice topped with an egg.   Oxtail fries (can't remember price, it was a special of the day): my least favorite item. Mediocre and lacked the sparkle I found in the others dishes

GujDdcxU8vFyQ5qAPw8Fuw.text: Unfortunately this 400th review of mine is about my not so great food experience here.  Maybe because this establishment was rated so high and all the hype about the Lobster Pho...but anywho, here it is.  We ordered: Lobster Pho (MP - today was $30): Sure there is a lobster presented in this bowl, but seriously, it's just the typical beef broth, and a broken down lobster where the meat is pretty tough to chew.  It probably would have been better if the broth itself is made of a seafood broth?  Pretty disappointed.   Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice ($9): Few pieces of cubed pork belly, one egg (halved), served with a bowl of rice, and a bowl of pickled cabbage and carrots.  Earl enjoyed the pickled cabbage.  This was an ok dish.  Nothing that will warrant us to order it again.  House Special Oysters ($10): We ordered the smaller portion (consisted of 6 oysters).  They were topped with soy sauce, tobiko, slice of jalepeno and something else.  The oysters were small and not sweet.    Sculpin ($8): Earl was pretty excited that they have Sculpin here. Overall, food was mediocre at best, based on the items we ate.  Taste does not justify the cost.  The ambience, however, was great.  There was a bar, and many tvs to watch sports, news, and whatever else.  Earl said he would come back for happy hour.  I don't care for drinks so I will pass.

BA1PK7XrpGBPQu_FsXTVPw.text: Ordered their oxtail fried rice... It was FULL of oil and msg for 16 bux... FYI... Ur not suppose to see spoonful of oil with REAL fried rice in Asian countries... Literally felt my blood vessels are clotted after this... Waste of money!!!

hRNsU8WiDN5lTRUES5cV_w.text: Came here with a couple friends for dinner, no wait and the food was delicious. We ordered the Vietnamese beef carpaccio, oxtail fried rice, and chicken wings. All which were amazing full of flavor. Probably one of my favorite Vietnamese fusion restaurant in Vegas so far. The staff was really friendly and awesome with food recommendations! Awesome experience.

iRqpg33kMIbwLCJcSAEIKg.text: If you come here, order the lobster pho...a must try!!  Yes, it is the most expenisve thing on the menu, but it was well worth it.  I am usually not a big lobster fan, I prefer shrimp over lobster, but the pho and the broth made the lobster stay juicy.  It was a dish to share!!  The pho and broth were very good, clean and the noodles melted with ease.   I would come back to order this again.  We also order the fish tacos, which I thought was okay.  The shell overpowered the fish alittle bit so was hard to taste the fish iteself.  We also got the oxtail fried rice which was good but alittle too greasy for me.    The service was on point - they were friendly and checked back here and there.  They also changed the TV station for us without hesitation - wanted to watch the basketball playoffs.  The noise level is alittle high due to the TV and more of a sports bar atmosphere.

M8wQ5fb2QutohgbhBFTiAg.text: Just found out about this spot so decided to check it out, actually have been here twice this week and this is what I think.   Pho tai - one of the better bowls of pho that I've had. Nice quality meat nice flavor too the broth.   Calamari - seemed like the frying oil needed to be replaced, spicy aioli sauce was awesome not bad.   Garlic Serrano pepper wings - I'm actually a huge fan of these one of my favorite things on the menu. Really tender and juicy with a nice spicy kick to it   Beef carpaccio - it had been sitting under a heat lamp so the exposed meat was a little cooked, also not bad.   Combo rice plate (pork chop, kalbi, Chinese sausage) pork chop was way over cooked, short robs were decent couple of the cuts were completely fat, Chinese sausage was good.   1lb of shrimp - kind of like the hot n juicy style boiling crab ish shrimp boils. The "d1 house season" was pretty good shrimps were a nice decent size. Over all pretty good for a 1lb of shrimp.   Overall this place is a wicked little spot. The food quality could be improved a little bit, but definitely will be back!

RwRJlp1OaqJTfMt2i7krwg.text: We saw this place open up and bookmarked it immediately. I'm always excited when a new Asian Cuisine place opens up in town!  We came here on Friday night to try out this new lovely place. It wasn't busy and we were immediately seated.  The waitress was very attentive and took our orders quickly.   We ordered -   Fish Tacos Very good. I wish they made a larger size so you can have it as an entree. Who wants little bitty tacos?!? Shaken Beef Salad Very good. It was a good mix of sweet and spicy, very flavorful! Garlic Serrano Wings - Not very spicy in our opinion, but still very good. It had a very good flavor and the wings were cooked perfectly. They were SUPER garlicy though. So much you can taste that shit the next day. The short rib combo plate - The ribs were very good, it's the only thing on the plate that has flavor besides the bowlful of garlic kimchi which I stayed away from.   Overall, the food, was very good. They have a good alcohol selection and they have TV's up everywhere playing sports as well. It's very clean and "hip" inside. Definitely will try out again and try out some more food!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Tacos! (Delectable)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Combo Plate

QVwDvFOERpP9c2EKC_rDNg.text: Been here many times before and haven't been here in awhile...and man did they raise the menu prices and lower the service quality. The many previous times I've been here I was happy with both the food and service. But now at my most recent visit I was disappointed. The wait for our server to acknowledge us was longer than our wait for food. I had to let the hostess know we were ready to order and no one even came by to get our drink order. Got the big bone soup and it was $18 compared to the $10 it was before, same serving size and taste. Also got the oxtail fried rice for $15!!!! Nothing special worth $15. Too little meat, too many raw onions, and found a whole bulb of garlic in it. Most likely will not be coming back.

ZdaoXuVQ2j7-NGhpdHBy3w.text: This is one of my favorite Pho place in town. The parking is always hard to find due to other outlets in the area but worth it. When i enter, im Always looking for Julie, she is great and always taking care of me and my family or friends. Must have appetizer is the the grilled squid, Julie knows to bring extra sauce cause my wife is always asking for more. For me, the Big Bone Marrow Pho is a must. The atmosphere and music is easy going to have a nice family dinner. Not your typical Pho restaurant where the pho comes out within 1 minute once ordered, but still in a timely manner. The only down fall is the dessert menu, they only have 2 options but I don't care for desserts. Just my honest opinion. Always coming back.

oZTDDmu_WGoGrij0JkK5RA.text: A trendy higher-priced Vietnamese spot close to Chinatown? Okay, I can dig that. I first heard of District One when another Yelp friend posted some delicious looking food on her FB. I had some friends in town who LOVE new Asian spots, so I took them here.  Our server was really friendly and seemed knowledgeable of the menu. It was a bit strange that they read the specials literally off of the specials board, so that if you want to see it again you have to get up and go look at the board by the entrance. We ordered apps, but they came out with the regular food - this seems to be consistent with all Vietnamese restaurants, no such thing as coursing. However edamame never showed up so we had to ask for it. She must have forgotten to ring it in, but it was our very LEAST favorite thing so maybe she was trying to do us a favor.  Onto the food!  Edamame - it's covered in this very fishy sauce. I love fish sauce but I couldn't eat more than a couple of these. Server said you can order them naked, so next time for sure. 2/5  District One combo platter - this is short ribs and a sweet sausage with rice and over easy egg on top. The short ribs were lean, which was good. 3.5/5  Oxtail friend rice - This was my favorite. We ordered with scrambled eggs though since someone in our party doesn't like runny yoke. Next time though, I would try with the over easy egg. 5/5  Lobster special - This was served cut into sections but rearranged as a whole. The flavor was awesome, but you get about 4 bites of lobster. I guess if you like the stuff in the head, might be worth it, but none of us touched that. Ugh. 3/5  Mango salad - This seriously tasted exactly like Thai or Lao papaya salad. It was good. 4/5  Pork belly buns - These were delicious! Really awesome flavor, and I loved the crunchiness of the peanuts. 5/5   Vietnamese Donkey cocktail - this is their version of Moscow Mule, but they incorporate lychee. It's simply BRILLIANT. I could've drank 10 of these if one didn't already leave me with a slight buzz in my head. 5/5  This is a fun spot to bring friends, but keep in mind it's a bit pricey. The ambiance is great though and I'd love to go back soon.  A lot of things on the menu that I still want to try.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. District one combo platter
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster special
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork buns

iAGprDT_RYtZTSYMB4DtNQ.text: District One is amazing! I've been twice and about 2 months between visits. I was greeted with a "Welcome back!" He said the whole restaurant remembered me because of all silliness my friends and I were having and the jokes I was making. My friends and I were calling it PhOlympics and Phoci. We're full of punny! This unusually cool weather in late May and crazy allergies, Pho is what the doctor ordered.  On this visit we ordered Spring Rolls, the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio, and a bowl of the Beef & Flank Pho. I also ordered a Vietnamese Iced Coffee (which is a poor decision on a Wednesday night at 7 PM, I was so jacked) because when in Rome...  First out was the Beef Carpaccio, which was a little too salty for my taste, but it was tasty nonetheless. A huge portion and I had a lot of fun eating it with chopsticks. It was peanut, garlicky, citrusy goodness, just tone down the salt!  Next up was the Spring Rolls. These were nothing special and were straight to the point. Tasted fresh and the peanut-fish sauce was delicious and fresh.  Next up was the Beef & Flank Pho which was delicious. The broth is perfection, top it with some sprouts, jalapenos, a squeeze of lime, and sprig of mint. I also add a bit of Sriracha because I like the hot, hot, heat! Seriously, savor the rich complexity of the broth.   At this point we were stuffed and happily fed. We were thanked for dining there and happily on our way.   District One has a lot of seating, booths and long tables. There's a bar and TVs everywhere. Service is prompt and friendly. Food is fresh and tasty. They also have a bunch of fresh seafood that's delivered daily as well as a Lobster Pho that will happen at the next PhOlympics.   Solid Asian Fusion. Definitely a fan!

ADLD3ueXiEWG-uJghYYa8A.text: Really enjoyed this place!  Hip comfortable place for some seafood and appetizers.  Sake and happy hour makes this place worthwhile.  We had the pork belly buns and they were warm and soft and delicious!

P-GVR-uX583uFmagBCizoQ.text: Say yes to Vietnamese food!! It's not your average pho place. This is the place you would want to go if you really want some good, real Vietnamese food.   First, lets talk about the oxtail pho. It's packed with so many flavors of the bone! You would only find something like this if you walked into a Vietnamese or Chinese household and they've been cooking that bone for hours! Very generous of the oxtail as well. The Five Spiced Roasted Cornish Hen was different. It was like a twist of vietnamese com tam thit nuong with all the sides and sauce but no porkchops or grilled pork but with a chicken. Two huge chicken thighs. The portion of the bone marrow soup and the chicken rice dish was big enough to share. Oh, I forgot about the appetizers! We got the belly buns which were okay.

Definitely check it out if you want to treat yourself to a classier vibe/sit down Asian fusion place.

XvuOvL57Yt1ZibVJg8BnLQ.text: Went here craving pho and it was amazing. We got the prime rib and the shrimp noodles and both were beyond amazing and satisfying.  The atmosphere is really nice and the prices are extremely reasonable. I'll definitely be back with my family many times over.

lwi95CWPHIU00xmNm_AWqQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here because I had this place bookmarked for the longest and it also has high reviews. So we decided to finally try this place out.   We ordered the pork buns and "large" shrimp skewer for appetizers. For the entree, we ordered the bun bo hue and pho tai nam.   Pros- food tasted good   Cons- the waitress was unattentive and slow No urgency  Service was suuuuuper slow  Portions are small   Overall the experience at District One with its service and small portions overshadowed its food and quality. I think I'll stick to the traditional pho restaurants.

ofkmVf0KtzWFv8IM-nGJ6A.text: The pho tai rib eye was very satisfying and not too overwhelmingly salty!  Very deliciousssssss! Thanks for having us district 1

A0-28YURrnOOzGTluKdB7g.text: The garlic fries were good; chicken wings---just ok; our meals werent bad for short ribs.  The chinese sausage { that accompanied the ribs} was way over dried. It was like eating beef jerky.  They gave us complimentary shrimp cocktails ; that was delicious.

NKvm_zHiOdPrrjZGg2w8Iw.text: Hipster Vietnamese fusion...  I like, I don't like it, then I like it again. This is pretty much the feelings I had when visiting District one. If a place projects itself as hipster, does that mean really they are no longer hipster? I got some googling to do.  After a cool yelp night at the Mirage, we decided a late night snack was required and after seeing some nice reviews of District One and throwing it up on my bookmarked places we decided to venture here.  Thursday night, the car park is packed, I have no idea why, maybe something was going on in another business that I didn't see or hear, so make sure you be patient.   Walking into a near empty restaurant we were seated in a nice booth with a nice window view of some cool cars and neon lights. The layout is actually quite nice, with a nice long bar at the rear of house and nice big Tv's. The centre has 4 tabled chairs with a few booths closer to front of house. This place is a hipster bar, it doesn't seem like a restaurant in china or Asian town.  We were greeted by an extremely nice sever who went through a bit of the menu and made a few recommendations. All prices were very very reasonable, and dishes were quite large.  After looking at a few reviews on yelp we went with the Pork Belly Buns. And I'd like to pass on they were great!! As a main I grabbed the 5 Spice Hen. Little disappointed in this dish, very very dry and a little bland. I tried the Oxtail Soup which was a little difficult to eat but I will say to give it a try!  I like District One, I'm a little unsure how successful it has been, but I do believe the location might hurt them a little. This market would serve better on the strip or in a Green Valley or even in the heart of Summerlin with less Asian restaurant competition.  Overall Price: $$ Drink: 3-5 Food: 3-5 Service: 4-5 Come back: Maybe

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hen
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly buns

wiocDaCsBYWmborg49C-xg.text: Such a good cocktail , food and service was very good. The restaurant is clean , staff were nice and we got a free ice cream:) , I recommend it , try the Vietnamese donkey cocktail!

2GAoIAJ2WHiAstb4qhq8Lw.text: The Hennessy Vietnamese Coffee was decent. Either Viet coffee is the best chaser in the world or there was no alcohol in there. It's Vegas, we're here to get a little twisted, wish there was a little more Henny and a little less coffee. Sereno wings packed some nice heat and flavor, cooked perfectly. Oxtail Fried Rice was delicious. Fried runny egg on top gives it nice presentation before you gobble down the whole thing.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hennessy Vietnamese Coffee. Needs a lot more Hennessy.

jxN241p4sOWMCT2TiUxe4A.text: Came here last night with my family as recommended by my parents. The parking lot in ehich the area was located was a little packed, but we found a spot within minutes. A little quiet for a Saturday night, a few people at the bar and some tables filled so we were seated right away. The menu had variety of choices, as far as the drink goes. I had the Coconut Mojito, my brother got the Donkey (i think? it's a Russian Mule type of drink) and my mom got the Mango Daquiri. According to them, their drinks was nice and strong. The presentation that came with my Coconut Mojito was impressive. It came with actual coconut and they even brought me the left over coconut milk.   Appetizer: We ordered the Oxtail Fries and calamari. I'd give that a 4.5/5. The fries were nice and crispy. It came with oxtail meat and fried egg. I never would've guessed how good this combination was, but man it was delicious! The calamari was good, but it wasn't anything special.   Main Course: I ordered the Bird nest crispy noodles. I was a little bit iffy with the price ($14.99) but when they served it, I was blown away with how big it was. It could easily serve 3-4. The sauce was really good, they went quite a bit overboard so I give that a 3.5/5. My fiance ordered the Steaks and Egg. The tomato rice it came with was tasty and the steak was a bit sweet, but full of flavor. Needless to say, he licked his plate clean.

E5vMJgS0ErDPEdtWNCvhdw.text: I really love that there is such a good atmosphere for friends and family's to enjoy good Vietnamese dishes. The staff is always very attentive and so personable.  There's free Wifi for my kids to play on their iPads and have the best Oxtail Pho in town! Broth is clear and tasty, amongst other plates on the menu, this is by far my go to order.   PLEASE expand another restaurant in Henderson!!!   I would drive here every week if I could !

K5p7ehjNWHPbuQcaL5_Elw.text: Amazing staff... amazing food.. amazing atmosphere! Owners are so humble and welcoming.. had my bachelorette dinner here and the staff took great care of us!

guedXOQSJ-ZPsk_TaPnf8g.text: Presentation and plating 3 stars plus location and restaurant made it to four stars. Food? Aiggghht! Too greasy and too much fish sauce. Don't get me wrong, I'm Asian and I can appreciate grease and fish sauce, but not heart attack grease tho' . But all in all food is good if your up to what we call " comfort food".

5-WwXS6LQ5gqTpY1ZF9tSQ.text: This place is a real deal. I had the oxtail fried rice. Everyone loved their food. Great service, clean bathroom and the place are nice. Lobster Pho and Fried Rice is what my friends recommend.

_WCeRZlQByqXgYzUDKPpzw.text: Excellent food and excellent service. I came in on a busy Friday with a group of 9. Initially they told us the wait was going to be 30 minutes but we were able to be seated within 15. The hostess was very accommodating and even gave us waters while we waited. We ordered a lot of food, I think maybe more than half the menu LOL everything was DELICIOUS! There wasn't one thing that I tried that I didn't like! The only downside was that they were out of the lobster pho so I ended up getting the hue spicy beef noodle soup which was still delicious. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to stop here again and let's hope they don't run out of the lobster pho again!

KF-_XI_gWvp6pZ1e1DXTxA.text: Items Selected:  District One Kitchen & Bar Tamarind Chicken Wings Green Papaya Salad - Shrimp, Pork, Mint, Crushed Roasted Peanut Fish Tacos - Yellowtail, Avocado, Cilantro, Cherry Tomato Oxtail Pho The Big Bone Soup - Bone and Marrow Soup Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice - Boiled Egg, Steamed Jasmine Rice 1lb Shrimp D1 Goodness, Medium Heat  Occupying the former home of Cravin' Cajun and serving up modern Vietnamese cuisine in a room one part hipster-industrial and one part sports bar it was with a group of five that I sat down at District One Kitchen & Bar just minutes after noon and focusing our order on variety the results proved 'variable' at best.  Clearly untrained and understaffed to handle a restaurant nearly 3/4 full by 12:30 it was with a trio of appetizers that our meal began and with beverage refills scarce as servers ran in circles perhaps it was fortuitous that none of the first round proved remotely spicy, the hamachi tacos bright and crisp at $3 each while dull, limp wings and the vinegar tinged salad proved entirely forgettable...and not particularly 'Vietnamese' at all.  Moving next to larger scale items, a duo of pho dishes would prove respectable if not particularly well presented; the supple oxtail imbuing long rice noodles with a meaty sapor while an enormous proximal femur laced its broth with fat to balance ample scallions, though heat remained mute even in the presence of sliced jalapenos.  Moving finally to the items that showed the kitchen's promise, suffice it to say that tender pork belly first braised then rendered soft in coconut milk proved by far the most complex option of the afternoon despite its unexpected sweetness and although a seemingly odd choice, the throwback 'get down n' dirty' shrimp finally delivered in the spice department, a pound of the snappy shell-ons again leaving my water-glass empty while wondering why we hadn't just gone to Crab Corner or Hot n' Juicy instead.

Ss8rYxka5Fdd5X4ZJ-mglA.text: Made reservations for 8. We all ordered the pork belly buns, egg rolls beef carpaccio, and wings. The pork belly buns, egg rolls, and wings were good, but the carpaccio was amazing. It was like a magical plate of juicy goodness. Druglike since it seemed everyone's eyes kept involuntarily darting back to the plate. For the entrees, we ordered the oxtail fried rice, pork belly with coconut juicez Cornish hen with garlic noodles, and steak and eggs. The hen was a bit dry bit easily fixed with an ample squirt of sriracha. The oxtail fried rice was to die for. A bit of everything in each and every bite. Garlic noodles were great in taste and texture. The steak and eggs were surprisingly good. Reminiscent of a pepper steak from the Chinese restaurants. The showstopper was the pork belly. Melt in your mouth good. I can't wait for the weather to get colder so I can stop in for some pho.  The waitress was on top of things. Topped our drinks off constantly. Always attentive and quick to serve.

5AX0kpNWrQAP5TRTj7D1Bw.text: Went here with a couple friends, and we enjoyed our dinner at District One!  I had the Oxtail Fried Rice and the Chicken Wings.  They also got the wings as well as the Steak and Eggs.  Everything taste great so far.  Can't wait to try out more of the menu.  The restaurant is big and they have a full bar.  They decor is nice and modern.  Service was great, as there was a moderate amount of people and didn't have any missed orders.   Hope I can make it to happy hour on the next visit.  Definitely want to try the Oxtail Loco Moco :-)

mSGpgO5uNWysvyTpdqSUcQ.text: I'm giving these folks 5 stars not due to the food (it's good, but IMHO only 4 stars), or the service (again, good, but IMHO only 4 stars), but because of their honesty.  I ate there on Saturday.  Sunday morning I discovered that my credit card wasn't in my wallet.  I called District One and they had found it (I was a tard and had left it at my table).  I was able to get over there rather quickly and they had it ready for me (it turns out I'm not the only idiot who's left cards there - one guy from Texas even left his drivers license).  I checked with my card company and no other charges after my meal's were on the card. The folks at District One were awesome and I thank them for their honesty.  There are too many places in this town where a situation like this would have ended much differently.

r3Fn-bGzug00_YaIL_LoHg.text: Had a late dinner here a coupla weeks ago: - Nice place with an eclectic menu, including even fish(?) tacos. - Rene(?), my waitress, forgot to take my order or was busy, but she was really apologetic and made up for it. - I enjoyed the oxtail pho.  Will definitely try this place again.

K80wc0fFAnszj5LdTrbHsA.text: I was skeptical about paying for expensive pho but I was pleasantly surprised! This place is very accommodating for large groups. Everyone enjoyed their food. The shaken beef salad and fried birds nest noodles was really good. My friend had the lobster garlic noodles and said it tasted really good. I had their Viet chalada and I loved it. Their bar has a lot of options.  Will definitely come back!

02CyT-L9-0GEGWq8teluvA.text: What can it be better then a whole lobster in a Pho? It's off the strip but still always busy. A hot noodle soup after drinking is always nice.

hFtX8FOFNmfsfkHiT15cdw.text: Saw the rave reviews and wanted to like this place but was quite disappointed in the atmosphere and the food.  This place is a bit dark inside, maybe some folks like that but I like to see where I am walking.  The staff was nice, but I did have to flag down a waiter to refill my water.  As for the food..  1. Egg rolls were good, dipping sauce was great and they give you a lot of herbs.  2. Oxtail Fried rice was a bit oily 3. Garlic noodles - I love garlic, but this was soooo intense, felt like I was eating all garlic and barely any noodles.  Honestly, I don't think they used fresh garlic, tasted a bit like precut garlic you buy from the jar. 4. Coconut pork belly - you need to remove this from the menu - so bad.  This dish should have color and be braised with loads of flavor, but it wasn't. It was definitely the most disappointing one of all the dishes.  So bland!!!

ZPpaKY8-JQGGcOvTfJ37IA.text: Found this gem on a food blog. Glad we took the blog's advice. The pho was excellent. I've had a lot of good pho in my life living close to Little Saigon in Westminster. This place was on par with what I've sampled in the past. Have to say an incredible "thank you" to our server, Cory. I cut my foot in the Uber we had taken to the restaurant. I asked if they had a bandage and he happily obliged. Great service! Great food! And what a whiskey selection!

ippbO7X5lc8cu4aHcivrjA.text: Came back here recently with a friend after a pool party and their food brought us back to life. We ordered the beef pho, spicy beef noodle soup (bun bo hue), and oxtail fried rice to share. Everything was really flavorful, but I thought the bbh was a bit too salty. I think the pho is better if you're looking for more a light broth because the bbh definitely has a kick. We also ordered their fresh coconut juice and felt everything was good. It's a bit expensive for Vietnamese food (our bill came out to nearly $50) and I feel like you can get a decent bowl of pho in that area for a bit less. However, I like the ambience, their unique menu, and customer service was really good so it makes it worth it.

8mOBj4ZEH3Ie1eYupBewXg.text: So I've been here maybe four times? Once was for lunch and the other three times was for dinner. One of the dinners, it was during happy hour so we got to try some of the happy hour items.   District One has a very modern feel to it. They have a bar at the back, booths in the front, and tables in the middle. Their menu consists of Asian fusion with a few traditional Vietnamese dishes, such as pho and bun bue hue.   On my most recent visit, I got to try a few things on the happy hour menu. The Serrano pepper wings were pretty good. It was deep fried nice and crispy on the outside yet very juicy on the inside. The flavor of the Serrano pepper doesn't necessarily soak through as much because the peppers were way spicier than the wings, but I suppose that's expected for something that's deep fried. We also got a dozen of their happy hour oysters, which at the time were blue points. I can't say they do their oysters very well because it was dry. There was no brine to accompany it; therefore, you HAVE to squeeze lemon on it AND use cocktail sauce. I typically just eat it with lemon but that was not a choice here. I probably wouldn't get oysters here again. My friends LOVE their Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio but I don't mirror their feelings for the dish. They doused the beef in so much oil that I feel like that's the only thing I can taste! My friends also got their Cajun garlic fries, which had really good flavor. The only problem was that one batch had more garlic flavor than the second batch so the inconsistency surely shines through.   For their pho, I have tried their oxtail pho and rib eye pho. I must say, District One is possibly my favorite place for pho. It is not the cheapest pho in town but it's got the best flavor to their broth. I didn't care for the oxtail though -- it was just three oxtail bones in there. I'd rather have the oxtail a different way but it was good nonetheless. I've also tried their Mekong River Style Noodle Soup, which was only so-so for me. They put a ton of stuff in there and perhaps some people like that. It's just not my thing though. They filled it with bean sprouts and a ton of meat. I prefer to control the bean sprouts on my own like I do with pho ;P Their garlic noodles, however, were very delicious. It's got good flavor and it's simple.   Their oxtail fried rice is so popular. It's one of the dishes that you have got to try and, well, I didn't care for it. That was the first thing I tried when I first went to District One and I gotta say, I can't even remember it. I love clay pot rice so I had to try theirs. It's slightly different from the Chinese version because they mixed in the soy sauce for you already into the rice and frankly, they put too much. The dish was a tad too salty for me. I liked how they would put whole cloves of garlic in there though :)   Their grilled squid is pretty good though. It was very soft and not chewy at all! I'm not a huge fan of squid but I would definitely order it again when I go.   The service was decent. I wouldn't say that it was amazing service but it wasn't absolute garbage either.   Overall, I would justify District One with a 3 star rating. Don't get me wrong -- it's not a BAD rating. It's good. But out of allllll the stuff I've tried, only like three dishes stuck out for me: pho, garlic noodles, and grilled squid. I would definitely come back for those three dishes haha!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken clay pot rice
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic noodles with rib eye

k-XVxpu6jPPQh1bGxIRrag.text: I had this bookmarked for a while and now I can happily say I can cross it off my list.  I dragged my friends along and we had a meal of epic proportions.  Oxtail fries were soso, it tasted good but were real soggy.  Serrano wings were damn good. Who doesnt like crispy wings with a touch of heat that slightly lingers on your palate.  I had the big bone soup and a bowl of pho on the side. The broths tastes real flavorful. It was a lil effort to get all the meat off the bones but it was so worth it. I ate every tendon and meat strand there was then all the marrow inside them bones.  My friends got the lobster pho which looked so freaking delicious, ( unfortunately I'm allergic to shellfish) I have learned to live vicariously through others so I was reading his face after each bite and it was of shear delight.  My cousin got the steak and eggs, which he loved. The rice was tomato rice and the "steak" was their shaken beef.  He liked his dish  very much aswell   We had a great time, the food, the servers and we came at a great time as there was a lot of tables open.

ZuYdMVh9YXdJ6u2piPyBCg.text: The lobster pho is delicious! I was expecting it to be overhyped and similar tasting to regular pho, but it actually was unique. The lobster was cooked perfect and paired well with their broth. I really enjoyed it and would come back for it again, even if it's pricey ($50).  We also ordered the sea snails with a Tom Yum soup base. It was extremely delicious! I would definitely recommend this dish.   I want to give this establishment 5 stars but there was a lot of miscommunication involved that forces me to give it 4 stars. We had to come here three times in the span of 2 days in order to finally be able to try the lobster pho before heading back to LA. The first night we came here on a Saturday night at 9 pm and the restaurant was pretty empty. Even though there seemed to be a lot of seating, the hostess was really slow at seating guests. Finally, it was our turn to be seated and we overhead that they had run out of lobster for the day, so the lobster pho was unavailable. The hostess suggested we call back tomorrow morning to see if they would have a shipment the next day. So we took her advice and called to question if they would another shipment. When we called at 11 am on a Sunday, the  person on the phone assured us that they had lobster. So we made the drive off the strip expecting to try the lobster pho, and the waiter tells us the shipment didn't come yet. It was really inconvenient that the person on the phone gave us False information and had us drive all the way to the restaurant. Finally, towards the end of our day, we decided to call and ask again. They assured us they really had a shipment of lobster. Because it was delicious and worth the wait, I got over the fact that we had to make three attempts. I have the impression that they must run out of things quite often because I wanted to order a fresh coconut drink and they explained that they ran out of that too.  Despite  the misinformation, I would come back here for the sea snails and lobster pho.

70zynqFEv6OOlayX_952Pw.text: Never had Pho before. Why not try it at a restaurant that's been featured on food network for their lobster pho? Because it's not my thing, that's why! I feel I can't offer a fair review because I took one bite and was done. We had 3 plates. Plate of 2 skewers, lobster pho another plate, think it was wings. A mule and beer we paid 98$.

cAgBHjExn2QZ5xjrL8bizA.text: Flavor of the pho broth is by far the best I've ever had. Waitresses are really nice too.

OrxfB3cXbjtPB8BCuq5dbw.text: District One is a really fun, tasty place. It's unpretentious and crazy inexpensive if you've been conditioned to eating on the strip.  The chicken wings and belly buns are highlights. The oxtail fried rice was decent but it hardly blew me out of the water.  Protip - skip the lobster pho. It looks nice and is interesting, but isn't worth the cash.

54nZeNIonovB_XWECFPoLQ.text: Is there a better place to eat at midnight? Vegan pho on the menu with a drink when I have a craving after a concert on my way home. I cannot think of a better place for me to go. District one is the bomb!

EjmoDXnTt5oPkztgRQxB6g.text: District one has a great atmosphere and even greater food. The only downside to this place is the parking. It took my husband and I almost 20 minutes to find a parking space due to the limited amount of spaces shared between District One and about ten other resturants. Needless to say once we finally parked and made our way inside we were slightly on edge. Once inside headed to the bar to calm our parking headache. The bar has an impressive menu of speciality mixed drinks, beer, and wine. Once our table was ready we ordered the oxtail fries and beef pho. The oxtail was so tender and flavorful that it almost melted in my mouth. However, I wish the fries were fried slightly longer so that they would be a little more crispy to hold up to all of the oxtail gravy. The beef pho was great, the broth was flavorful and not too salty and there was a good ratio of meat and noodles. Delicious food but next time I come I will make sure to ask for extra crispy fries.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pho was tasty and had a nice portion of beef in it
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries were great! Just ask for extra crispy fries so that they can hold up to all of the oxtail gravy.

RMTI1NIZs8w3fXaftV2hEA.text: I was lucky that this place was open so late on a Monday night and even more lucky to discover their unique menu.  They have a great selection of pho, soups and Vietnamese fusion based dishes - not to forget a great drink menu as well.  Rib Eye Pho which was great.  Serving size was huge, enough for two people. The broth was extremely rich and flavorful. They're very generous with the amount of rib eye as well as mint on the side to add yourself.  Big Bone Soup was filling, as well as tiring.  They give you at least two large knuckles full of bone marrow for you to dig out yourself.  I couldn't tell what kind of broth they used, but it was different than the pho. Highly recommend if you're a bone marrow fan at all.  Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio, I highly recommend as an appetizer to share.  The warm oil they drench it in is so rich and it's all topped with crunchy garlic chips to wrap the beef slices in.  Vietnamese Donkey - their version of a Moscow Mule with lychee vodka.  Wasn't too strong, maybe not strong enough but easy to drink.  Overall the service was great and the food was even better. I would definitely hope to visit this place again and recommend it to my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef carpaccio appetizer
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese donkey (lychee Moscow mule)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. big bone soup comes w/ lots of bone marrow

1XhBGhbGloVO_FkQe-CGDw.text: I loved how this place looked! It definitely didn't look like a typical Asian restaurant with upbeat music. For appetizer, we ordered the "belly buns" and it was so good! Very flavorful. I got the "double down" pork chop for my main entree. The pork chop was very tasty and the egg was cooked perfectly.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uBBcM6YSYDsenW7DqBgsKw.text: Vietnamese/Asian fusion. Varieties of Viet food and other Asian mixed.  Good food,  decent price

9q70aPMvsL-m8UGStfVGyQ.text: My new favorite place for pho!  The place is clean, service was great, good ambiance, and of course great food! The decorations are really nice too~ They have a bar with plenty selection of craft cocktails and beer.

S8YLo1_XPnE2d_71dyzz7w.text: A lot of the food here has a good wow factor--the food itself was ok. Though the food wasn't generally our favorite, I can see how some people would enjoy this meal. Still it was generally a good experience especially since the service there was cordial and the setup of the place was pretty nice.

ZVlagnDOkwRbLhyWEfV-qA.text: you can't miss the bun bo hue,it is excellent to me.the broth is amazing.The restaurant is kind a modernize,don't look like a regular Vietnamese restaurant.I like it so much and keep come back for more.The sad part is they open at 11:00 am,kind a late for me.

mewUmy03DPJ-SzGPwuk9GA.text: Wow,  the best pho I've ever had.  We had the bone marrow soup.  The broth was clear and so flavorful.  And the staff are super friendly.  We were undecided between the chicken wings or spring rolls.  We settled on the wings but the bartender/waitress got us the spring rolls complementary.  Both were really good.  Will definitely come back again.

0iXSJ_eWHkZg1NHQsFGDuw.text: We walked in for date night around 9:30pm on a Sunday night. We were greeted by one of the waiters and seated immediately, they were at about half capacity.   The waiter was very friendly and prompt.  We ordered some Garlic Edamame and a Pho Oxtail.   The food arrived in a timely manner. The oxtail was so good - literally falling off the bone. It gave the pho a great flavor.   My only complaint is having to ask for everything we needed.. Anticipate your guests' needs. It's soup to share, I'll need an extra bowl, a spoon, a straw for my beverage.. little things, wasn't a deal breaker...but I feel like those are necessities when eating a meal, period.   Overall we had a great experience and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho oxtail and garlic edemame!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8X4pQQwndoCjZufBtFn70Q.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while, and I came here with a group of friends. We ordered the oxtail pho, lobster pho, oxtail fried rice, and pork belly buns. The pork belly was so juicy and the bun was perfectly soft! I also loved the oxtail fried rice, and the portion was so large that I took half of it to go. The service was quick and the food was bomb! I can't wait to come back during happy hour!!

eXUVUJsmdrpNG2DOaaALtQ.text: Never tried lobster pho but heard this place was famous for the dish... of course, we had to try it. Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted by a server. We only had to wait 5 minutes on a Friday night. The decor was trendy/hipster of Vietnamese-American fusion theme. Service was great. The server took orders without needing to write it down on a notepad for a table of 6, which was quite impressive when she recited the orders. Food arrived slowly one by one. The cocktail took a little long to arrive and the lobster pho was the last to arrive (that's why I took away the 1 star). Everyone finished their meal by the time lobster pho got to the table but it was definitely a surprise. The flavor profile of the broth and the amount of lobster in the bowl was amazing! We also ordered fish tacos, calamari, and king crab. All were delicious. Note: fish tacos had raw fish so it was very light and almost like a ceviche. The taco shell was lightly crunchy which made it a great appetizer. Happy to have lobster pho checked off my bucket list

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great presentation on the lobster pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho

WeTqTG2xfzpSV14TvrYBgg.text: This is my 2nd time at District One and this time I brought the whole family. Get here early if you want to snag some of the more popular dishes, they had already run out of the big bone Pho and matcha green tea by 7PM.  Appetizers: Oxtail Fries 7/10 (good but wouldn't order again) Grilled Octopus 10/10 (aoli on point)  Drinks: Young Coconut 10/10 Shrubs (tastes like kombucha) 10/10 but an acquired taste  Entree: Oxtail Pho 10/10 Chicken Pho 10/10 Steak and Eggs (basically Bo Luc Lac for the Vietnamese food lovers) 10/10  The Pho broth was clean. I wasn't gulping down water from MSG like at other places. Oxtail meat was tender, falling off the bone and easy to eat. My favorite meal was the Steak and Eggs. Meat was just the right amount of crispy on the outside yet tender on the inside. The steak was marinated so well and the rice.. the rice was cooked perfectly with the right amount of flavor. Will be making this my go to Pho restaurant every time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tx5mQdWCEjs24Vm7Mx2HJw.text: BUN BO HUE!!  If you're looking for the best place for BBH, I highly recommend trying District One.   District One is more upscale than your normal Vietnamese restaurants.  Love the ambiance and how spacious it is!  The booths are huge! Big enough to fit 3-4 people on each end.  They also have plenty of tables to accommodate bigger parties.  This has always been a favorite when planning big party dinners.    I've tried a number of appetizers here, but I've stayed True to ordering one entree off the menu, and that's Bun Bo Hue.  On the menu, it's listed as, "Hue Spicy Beef Noodle," and it comes with beef shank, pork loin, and hue pork roll.  It's soo good!  It's unique in the way that it doesn't come off as oily and you don't have to sift through the spices to get to the broth.  Add some lime, cabbage, herbs, and you're good to go!  I rarely ever finish a bowl of pho, but time and time again, i see the bottom of the bowl whenever I'm here.    They also have good appetizers as well!  I enjoy getting the chicken wings, oysters, and spring rolls.  They offer Vietnamese beer and fresh coconut juice!  They also have different specials each night.  The last time I was there, they offered shigoku oysters for $3.50 each.  And also, Happy Hour is from 5-7pm and 12p-2am!  It's a great place to come for late night eats and being able to enjoy everyone's company!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream with fresh coconut on the bottom and coconut jelly inside the ice cream
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea creme brulee
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho

AzJ6zJVqUnB3qRtlZhSr2g.text: This place is a fun bar. With a great happy hour menu.   This time we I tried the wings sans flour, delish , they come with serrano chilies. Also had the coconut pork belly, fragrant tender and juicy it came with a medium soft boiled egg, it was so perfect. Also ordered the flank pho dry , didn't wanna fill up on broth . Anyway it was perfect, I added the veggies and lime and got my fill of pho.  Love this place,  fun food , fun atmosphere, will be coming back.

lh4_fWRI-FPj6hqq_J2pMQ.text: Jair was our bartender/server and I cant rave enough about him! He made it such a memorable and fun experience. I throughly enjoyed the Double Down with the short ribs! It was such a big plate so it was perfect to take the rest home for dinner!  Do not leave without getting the coconut ice cream. My girlfriends and I devoured it. Will definitely come back here whenever I'm in town!

yGTFWTPMi2sFxcf4B3rVPw.text: This restaurant was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. Service was great! I got the surf and turf pho with the eye round steak raw on the side ($35) and my bf got the ox tail pho. Prices are on the higher end of course because its lobster and ox tail --- but I was very pleased with the portions. The ox tail broth was better in my opinion because its more similar to the traditional pho broth that I'm use to however I thoroughly enjoyed what I got. Next time I want to try the bone marrow broth -- also I highly recommend coming early when they open to skip the wait and have access to every item on the menu. A few of my friends came later after 1pmish and tried to order the bone marrow but they ran out so something to keep in mind!
