SprJbcvkJdRJfXP9eqWgFQ.text: First time trying here. We ordered some of the items on the happy hour menu. Some of the food came out pretty fast but the service is a bit slow. Maybe because they are busy but I feel like they hardly check on us if we need anything once the food is out. Overall, my favorite item on the menu is the beef carpaccio. Its pretty good. The atmosphere is a little bit loud. More of like hanging out place with friends instead of family type of a seatings. The parking area are spacious and the presentation on the food looks good.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q-LlYwdtcijYirviX9r1bg.text: The spring rolls are SO addictive! Perfect flavor, great amount of crunch, love that they aren't afraid to use the fresh herbs in the roll! That's my favorite part! The peanut sauce is a good compliment to the roll!

eJwyFxCNX43EGvQ5OLKwMg.text: Yum, this is my favorite pho place in Vegas, actually even in SoCal...as far as flavor goes. The oxail pho is what me and my hubby got. The broth is so so flavorful. The little specks of fat floating around from the oxtail /drooool. So you might be wondering why I gave it  2 stars instead of the 4 or 5 for places I typically love. Service was bad, my hubs had to get up multiple times to ask for things we needed AND the oxtail wasn't as tender as it should've been. The oxtail meat did not fall off the bone, so in the end a lot of the meat was left on the bone. $16 for a bowl of pho, so it felt pretty wasted since most meat got left behind. I tried to gnaw the meat off, but it just wasn't tender enough to slip off easily. So my husband had to go ask for knife and fork so I could cut some of the meat off.   The servers never came by to check on us or to see if we needed anything. If so, they would've known that our garnish plates never came out. We sat around trying to remove meat from bone in our soup bowls for 5 minutes and still no garnish plates. I wasn't sure if maybe this pho is so haute that they don't let you add anything to it because it will ruin the flavor somehow. I started to look around and saw plates of sprouts, basil, and lime though on other tables. That's when my husband got up to ask for garnish plates. Also, they don't refill water. Middle of the meal, I had drank a good portion and needed MOAR! Again, my husband had to get up to ask for a water refill. The other time he got up was to ask for the knife to cut meat, because they simply did not come around to ask us if we needed anything.   Again, amazing flavor in the broth but the meat texture and service could use a lot of improvement. At the price level they're selling, they should really step up their service game. The flavor here is definitely next level, and if you can overlook the price, service, and oxtail texture, you're good to go! I think I will come back though to give them another chance. Plus, it was the Monday after EDC that we went, maybe the servers attended EDC and were dragging ass from it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho. Great broth, but meat bones could use longer stewing. See how much stubborn meat was left that wouldn&#39;t come off the bone.

PJyIQHr0xb2kioct0y9lUA.text: District one is trendy and different, both in their decor and menu offerings. I tried the Big Bone Soup which is a soup with bone marrow and it's super filling! My friends tried the oxtail pho and we all agreed it's a healthier tasting pho, it was good but didn't make you feel bloated and sick. The oxtail fries are a must try; it's like poutine with pieces of shredded beef. The baos are also good so give them a try too!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The big bone soup

_k_OsUKd-h-OVHh-2Srliw.text: Three words.  Phenomenal Ox Tails!!   I and my friends were stopping by Vegas after a short visit to the seven magic mountains. I and my buddies were looking for a place to grab a bite and stumbled across of District one.  This venue looks pretty modern and urban on the inside. The layout and designs of the walls felt identical to how the boiling point franchise in southern California look like. There's a bar with a menu full of many different assorted alcoholic drinks and a lot of seating areas for customers.  When we looked at the menu, we noticed that there are assorted dishes that consist of Oxtail. It's not common for a restaurant to serve Ox tail dishes, so we figured that we would try some. We ordered the Ox tail pho, Ox tail fried rice, and Ox tail fries. These dishes were amazing! Each bite into the oxtail was extremely delicious and juicy. The meat of the Oxtail was perfectly balanced between chewy and tender in all three dishes. Although if i were to pick a favorite out of the three, Oxtail pho was by far the best. I want to say that it's better than the restaurants in the bay area that serve Oxtail.  Would definitely recommend for anyone who likes to explore food dishes to try this place if they are in the area!

OWL-PFeo11jrDsS_F0oxfg.text: Yay! I'm a fan of this hipster spot! There's lots of space for seating and the tables weren;t sticky. I like the dark decor and all the lighting accents. Our server was sufficient, not bad not amazing. Now, the food was delicious. I ordered chicken as a appetizer and man I devoured those things. I ordered shrimp pho and the broth wasn't salty. It tasted smooth and the noodles were soft when they came out, which I liked because I didn't need to stare at her while waiting for the noodles to soften. Did not want to awkwardly stare at her while she eats, haha. Now, the atmosphere felt relaxed like a bar although comforting like eating at your own dining set in your home. Overall I enjoyed my experience here and my meal was inexpensive. Next time I'm ordering the lobster pho to see what all this fuss is about!  Pros: lots of seating space, appealing decor, clean, bathroom, delicious food, great presentation, lots of parking spaces  Cons: Customer service was below adequate  Overall: Coming back shortly! Maybe I'll order something new and enjoy the good music again! I like this spot for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On a Monday

xelGXKrh6cr961p-ff3Tzg.text: I love this spot!  My go to when I want pho. Their super model is the lobster pho... Everyone get your cameras out. My serious guilty pleasure... Hands down the big bone soup.  I am addicted to bone marrow.  As bad as that is I could eat it 3 times a week if I had it my way.  By big it's colossal!  The large amounts of marrow is so gratifying. If you are too shy to get your hands on this dish they will help you out.  The server threw on some gloves and went to work.  She scooped out the marrow, cut the meat and tendon, you are good to go!  Pair that with a side of rice, SO BOMB!  I have been plenty times where the big bone soup is not ready yet, or sold out.  At times I'll call in advance.   However, when all else fails there's the ox tail pho.  The meat is so tender. This dish is also delicious and satisfying.  I take mine no noodles side of rice.   The oysters are always so good here with the tobiko. Pork belly is bomb too.  I think everything on the menu is worth trying. The only thing was the snails I didn't care for, too large and chewy.   I appreciate everyone who works here. Shout out to Tony and Christina!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho

azKI6pT4b_ehvs8mQrOxIA.text: The interior and exterior of this restaurant is beautiful. Everything looks fancy, classy, and very modern. The inside is very spacious with lots of seating and big windows to light up the whole place with the sun when it's out.   The menu is small but has most of the popular Vietnamese dishes. Their specialty is lobster Pho, and variations of that, which is unique and different but usually when I go for Pho, I am looking for the beefy broth and the rare steak. So I didn't end up trying this.   I ordered the ribeye Pho which is $9.99. The Noodles were so soggy. I can not stand super soft Noodles like this in my pho! The beef was good and they gave me a good amount for my Noodles but I barely ate any of my noodles. The broth was okay, it was plain but livened up just a little with extra hoisin sauce and sriracha but still didn't have the strong beefy flavor I crave for when eating pho.   We also ordered the spring rolls which were $7.99, I have never paid such a high amount for spring rolls before. I expected that we'd be getting more than the other restaurants that have egg rolls for half the price. It was only two spring rolls, just like everywhere else. They did use larger wraps, though, there are still cheaper places that use the larger wraps as well. The spring roll sauce was good. The veggies were super fresh and crispy. The pork was a little tough and the wrap had hardened already before it came to our table.   Our order was taken quickly and food came out right away but after that we were forgotten about. We had to ask a different waiter for our check and a water refill that was needed long before we asked.   There are many other pho places to try before I'd go back to this one.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring Rolls

FgTxH8gme_q20se5LHq84g.text: A group of 8 of us came here for lunch based on all the great reviews on Yelp and Eater 38, and were not disappointed. Off the beaten path, but very cool ambiance and friendly service.  We got a bunch of small plates and dishes to share. The pho and wonton soup were both excellent; broth was really tasty. The oxtail fries were a favorite. Also enjoyed the chicken salad and spring rolls. The pork belly buns were just ok, and chicken wings were crispy, but a little dry (could use some sauce), and are really spicy. But overall, a wonderful meal.  Hand-crafted cocktails - favorite was the Vietnamese Donkey (a mule with lychee vodka); coconut mojito in fresh coconut was also very good, and lots of craft beers. Great pick!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut mojito - very fancy!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye pho - so good!

ESkE1j_B1_XNHVIHIHo3vA.text: Really good food! We ordered the pork belly buns and pho lobster.  3 pork belly buns for  $8, the meat was really soft with a good amount of hoison sauce.  Pho lobster $49! It is market price so the price changes. Expensive but been eyeing it for a while so I had to try it. The bowl is huge and big enough for two people.   The soup broth was really good! The lobster tasted fresh as well, I was definitely satisfied. Definitely good, but for  $49, I wouldn't order again.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho lobster market price, $49 :(, good but not worth $49

AW-X-XISXAYHb8V0CK8FhQ.text: Great service. The grilled pork chops was good but i found the oysters shells werent cleaned very well so i was getting grit in my mouth. Carpaccio dish was good.

VIoQzLGU4XX26sXyELPQiQ.text: Great food and service. We came here for the first time and came in right before they get full. We ordered garlic noodle, pork belly buns, oxtail fried rice. i loved fried rice and not too much saltiness and liked buns but these were a bit too much taste. Garlic noodle was ok not so special. I want to come back here if I come back to Vegas for sure and would order something different next time.

XWknP7SzemHfWISM1bUl5A.text: The food here is really good. Servers were nice. If you are ever in town, you got to try their lobster pho.

em4-pqKM93Bw0LUjI-oPpg.text: Two dishes that I always order when I'm with my man:  vietnamese beef carapaccio and goi ga :9 Never fails to make me happy

j9b-jyG-ZM8OaK8v1vTuFA.text: This place is phenomenal. The food is spot on and the atmosphere is really cool. Also, excellent service. Highly recommended if you're looking for good Vietnamese food in Vegas.

Gr9vy1KaLFFLP9Nc3K-hMA.text: Service is impeccable! Oxtail fried are delicious. Oxtail pho is absolutely amazing. Oysters on the half shell are fresh tasting and meaty. I love this place and am happy it is so nearby. Will be a frequent customer for sure!

VIBe1HvwmCBrQbAZNn4YsQ.text: My first time here. We ordered the lobster pho. The lobster really big but I felt nothing special. The papaya salad was okay. May not come back.

XVUo1uUCyiAa5d7A3jDwSA.text: Sooooooo good I got the short rib combo so yummy there meat is so good the ribs are even better the egg rice so good I didn't get to try there famous coconut mojito but I bet it will be just as good!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooooo good yum

LRXCc_daqpZ1_2MlwSNpcQ.text: My husband talks about coming to District One every time we are in Vegas but we never make it out since it is a little further from the strip. It is well worth the drive during rush hour!  The food is fantastic as you can see from all of the pictures posted. We ordered the oxtail fries, five spice Cornish hen, coconut pork belly and garlic noodles. We had to take some food to go but our suite has a kitchenette so it worked out perfectly. The only problem here is the parking. We arrived at 6:00 pm and was seated right away but it took 15 minutes just to get a parking spot. We will definitely return, though!

Ky4DsuIS6cLfOVCjXYFyRw.text: This place is absolutely great. From the Oxtail Pho to the pork belly buns, the food is scrumptious. I try to bring my parents here at least every two weeks or so. Their Big Bone dish... wow.  The staff are always on point. This place rocks!

Yv2mRhpkd7NTO9yY-uaa-Q.text: Great place to eat. Foods amazing. Service is amazing. Awesome food, service, and open late, what else do u want?  Kai's the man!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Japanese whiskey

cVvviH37SD0L9JojLXLQ7Q.text: The food is exceptionally delicious! Creative food choices/ selections, good liquor options and beer is cold when served, and prices are affordable with the Asian Fusion cuisine. The portions are generous and the staff are friendly but service lacks attentiveness. The few times I've been there we had to flag someone to get our order. I have yet to try half of the rest of the menu but I definitely recommend everyone to try it out! Will post a couple photos that I enjoyed! :)

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birds Nest Noodles
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kumamoto Oysters

UMoL-0aDBM5Qv6T9T_-bjA.text: District One is not your typical Asian restaurant. It is cool without looking or feeling like it's trying hard.  The food is amazing and the drinks are strong. We love our server who remembers us by names.  Will definitely come back!

_6YyBSu-__VLu--VB3bRGA.text: Great food! Great service all friendly and helpful. Good atmosphere. Spring rolls and egg rolls to die for!!!

D_mTs3OqruD3lMn5OSNj3A.text: The oxtail fries are to die for. Although, I would personally add another fried egg to it. I also got the grilled whole squid, which was alright. Nothing to write home about. Definitely gonna try the lobster pho next time.

aVEjF_anpMAvTdEis4ytnQ.text: Had the best lobster pho ever! This place is pretty amazing. It's a bit off the strip but totally worth it. I love that this was so unique. The ox tail broth was also very good. It is not ur typical pho ladies and gentleman. You will really like this place!

iGYB7qLACjvdcBDKGNSGMw.text: Food was delicious. Pho broth was good. Lobster tasted freshand delicious. The rice chicken had good presentation and tasted delicious. Portions are very fulfilling. Would definitely come back when we go to Vegas again.

pyiTir2wm-diMVCc93L4cw.text: Service sucks... The server we had seems like he was having a bad day. But whatever moods he was in, I am not coming here to see it. The server wouldn't have gotten any tip from me, if it was me who is paying.

EqKSdEG_D2Nt52j1fkRbpw.text: The food is incredibly fresh and delicious, the atmosphere is fantastic, and the staff is all very friendly and accommodating. This is a must-go destination of Vegas.

vJWiu3tZ6rmFXe2pKV-mcw.text: Try this place.... great atmosphere. Upbeat and clean. Staff is super friendly. Food is really good.  I had a bowl of Ox Tail Pho. Prices are friendly also. This is a must do again !

wj4rR4UTHzhsAmc6q3EJ3g.text: Came here on a Thursday night, 7/9/15. Place wasn't crowded which was a plus for us because we were starving. We had the oxtail pho 9/10, prime rib pho 9/10, meekrong soup 9/10, and steak & egg dish +9/10. Enjoyed the slow drip Thai ice coffee. My parents loved their food with no complaints and they can be picky. Overall great service and yummy food.  Will try the lobster pho next time we are in Vegas. Wish we had a District One here in East San Gabriel Valley (So. Cal).

0YeUamiYktInVv96QAZbVA.text: If you love asian food or seafood this is the place to go!   The Decor is sleek, the ambience is welcoming, the service is seriously one of the best, and the food is exquisite!   I am big on service and District One definitely has one of the best service I've had at a restaurant. The servers are extremely knowledgable and always attentive. Drinks are always refilled without even having to ask. When you need someone to help you out they are always there to tend to your needs!   There is definitely no cutting corners on flavor in all the dishes. Every dish I've tried has been extremely impeccable! If you are into buying seafood by the pound this place is for you!   I recommend the Shrimp with house special sauce. The shrimp are always cooked perfectly and the size of them are crazy! Only the best!  I also would recommend the Vietnamese egg rolls. Best in town!   This place seriously is a must go no questions asked!!

zKQ6rgRkUR7Wy6253QcqWg.text: Really good fried rice. Try the oxtail fried rice. The pork belly buns are absolutely delicious. The coconut ice cream and fries with eggs is a must.

baW5vEtwuJrfs299SRg4JQ.text: I was hungry for a nice salad & based upon the reviews of District ONE I thought I should check it out.  When I arrived they were quite busy during lunch but I was able to score a seat at the bar.  Service was efficient & the staff I engaged conversation with were super friendly & nice.  The full flavors from my green papaya salad with shrimp danced around my mouth long after I finished - it was delicious!! Thank you for making this such a wonderful dining experience for even a simple salad.  I will definitely be back to try new items next time!

weylsdt-jKgueqqUdP0a_w.text: Been here several times.  I really like their Oxtail fried rice & their matcha smoothie.

H7iE94g-3GK2sAiGJs5YFA.text: Lately I've been feeling more like a Las Vegas resident with all the temporary work assignments out here. Naturally, like any kamaaina being away from home, my gills started drying from being in the desert and I missed our melting pot of amazing food.  This day was no different. I was fiending for some amazing, Chinatown-like pho tai. Surely, most places on the 9th island would disappoint. I searched Yelp for hours, meticulously going through review after review, photo after photo and eyeing up each restaurants website. I felt like a crazed person. But I NEEDED some good pho...I needed something familiar and reminiscent of home.  Finally came across District One which was about 15 minutes from my workplace, great reviews, pics looked promising... Skeptical, I ordered take away from them anyway. Got the pho tai and egg rolls.  Food was ready when I got there, the server helping me was friendly and trying to sell me on the happy hour but not in a pushy, salesman type of way. Got back to work, spread all this vietnamese goodness across an entire lunch table, and to my surprise...they packaged the meat separately and uncooked! HALLELUJAH!!!! I like my meat still kicking because that's where all the flavor is so I really enjoy dipping the beef in for 5-7 seconds, taking it out and eating it. There's nothing I hate more than precooked, overcooked, flavorless meat. Added my sprouts, peppers, lime, basil, hot sauce, hoisin sauce, noodles. Then started rolling my egg rolls in the lettuce, filling it with the shredded carrots & daikon, mint etc. This take out experience was HEAVEN!! The beast was tamed.  Needless to say, my colleagues and I come here quite a bit now and there's a take out menu posted in the office.

31FtHvRzLxoWP3llNNqiNg.text: First of all the food was great we had the pork belly cooked in young coconut juice, crispy eggroll, combination plate w/short ribs and a fried egg on top of rice, raw oysters...prepared with a thin slice of jalapeno and caviar on top. I did not like the flavor of the oysters even though they were prepared fresh. But all our other dishes were delicious! I would eat here again. We also had a 2 yr old that they tolerated...which is always nice.

39e2ZoCcLUJ3J4syC4kxSw.text: Came here with some friends who live in vegas. They had some unique dishes. We got lobster fried rice and oxtail fried rice. Oxtail fried rice was bomb. Prices are pretty reasonable.

ZXtjWgeEfY2uL-XHBDnjTg.text: Ever since coming back from Spain, my husband and I have been on the hunt for razor clams! We were able to find this restaurant in Vegas that actually serves razor clams, and decided to visit. :) It's Asian-fusion...and serves dishes ranging from pho, to bone marrow, to pork belly, etc.  We ordered the following: (1) bone marrow soup - huge portion, primarily consists of 2 large bones, they were huge! once you suck out all the marrow, there's not much left other than the soup to drink. you should probably order some rice or noodle to go w/ this soup, since it doesn't come with. my husband ordered this and thought it was OK, i personally wouldn't order it again. (2) oxtail pho - i didn't have this dish, but apparently this pho is suppose to be one of their specialties, especially if you like oxtail! (3) bun bo hue - my sister in law had this dish and thought it was good; spicy though (4) braised pork belly w/ rice and egg - i ordered this dish because i'm a fan of pork belly and it was yummy! flavors were great, broth was yum, and i gobbled up my dish (but had 1 pork belly left over which my husband helped to finish up). (5) 4 orders of razor clams -- 2 orders of the grilled w/ scallions, 2 orders of the black bean sauce; YES MUST GET ! it's not on their regular menu, but only available on their "special menu, which they write on chalkboard" -- each order only comes with 2 razor clams, so that's a bummer. each order is $8.95 too, so very expensive! I personally liked the black bean sauce once better, because it comes out sizzling on a platter. the grilled one is not as flavorful , and less salty, but some people like that version.  (6) belly buns -- pork belly buns (each order comes with 3 buns); these were delicious, kinda wish we got more, but if you like pork belly buns, then order this! you won't regret it :) (7) fish tacos -- i didn't eat this so i'm not sure how it tastes, but the folks who ate them said it was delicious. the taco itself was very tiny though, so don't expect a full size taco! they are petite.  Service was friendly and our food came out on a timely basis. We were happy with our feast, and wouldn't mind coming back just for the razor clams! :)

jo0S5-dcoasvmbmk6lznoQ.text: I have been to this restaurant several times and really enjoy it.  The food is really good.  The only negative is the parking because of all the restaurants that have opened up in this mall in the last 2 years.  My favorite menu items at District One:  Fresh coconut juice, vegetarian spring rolls, fabulous chicken wings. Pho veggie (very tasty) with lots of vegetables.

akIQ9crgQzVNi0Cu2dG_Ow.text: Came at 10:55pm. Seemingly not too busy. Currently everyone already had their food. Ordered 2 bowls of pho rare beef. Waited for half an hour and still no signs of our pho bowls. This is NOT the first time this happened. We were patient most of the time. This time we just walked out. Now writing this as we are driving to Pho Kim Long. Better wait time and better service. Will never come back.

carvv9aEYu4_w1tJqpmNUQ.text: Took my grandma and Uncle who were visiting from Hawaii.  We drove from CA to meet them and I heard about this place.  Took a chance and we tried their pork belly buns and pho soups.  My Grandma them had the ribeye pho and I got the Ox-tail soup.  Both great dishes!  It is really big so be hungry or split the soups.  The pork belly buns were awesome!  I would definitely order those again.  We will be visiting them soon.

WTkNfWCid5Dh-yK1w3-W7g.text: Awesome food and service !  I'm from NYC and this is the best viet fusion I ever had.

bBUdG8MldggNU5SjJmkBkw.text: Everything was great! Especially the food! After hearing all the hype about this place we decided to give it a try. We left completely satisfied.   Oxtail Fried Rice- $12.95 Belly Buns- $7.95 Crispy Bird Nest Noodle- $13.95 Vietnamese Coffee  Everything was worth it! Great service from the hostess to the servers the only reason why I am giving 4 stars is because our hostess told us that our server would come by and share the daily specials with us. We where never informed on any specials but we did over hear another server inform the table next to us about the deals they had on our way out. If I had heard the deals prior to us ordering we would have ordered more!!

Dvx8ppCDsyKJBxIdD5Rz6g.text: We had lobster pho (MP was $49.99) and Oxtail pho with ice viet coffee. soup base is good, except the 1.5lb lobster was abit expensive. if you dont mind the $$$, you would enjoy the lobster pho. I would go back again for oxtail pho. Nice atmosphere.

UhyUGfawxOyUNK9-UG0i1Q.text: I wish Yelp would allow me to rate 3.5 stars.  I don't want to put 4 because price keeps it from being 4 stars.            We had: Oxtail fried rice (excellent) House oysters (good, small) Garlic serrano wings (very good) Pork belly bao (very good) Fish tacos (good, very small)    The decor is very nice inside and they have a very cool bar setup.   I will definitely come again.       ****Went again today and added Oxtail Pho to the list of things tried.***** Oxtail Pho (excellent) Oxtail fried rice, again (superb, hard to believe better than the first time!)  Am bumping to 4 because the food is that good and everyone who has gone with me has enjoyed the decor/service.   They even split the Pho for us, no problem.  ******* So much for customer service.  They decline to split the Pho anymore, switching gears and trying to tell me they never did that in the past.  ********

40Vi2WtLiHWp4TMmnNcpEQ.text: We were dropped off in Chinatown in search of a place for dinner w friends we walked into 3 place before saw this place. We went in and we're instantly in love w atmosphere and then we saw the menu...yum! There were five of us and everyone loved their choices. I had shrimp fried rice w garlic noodles, it was amazing. They also had a really cool drink menu, ones we had never had. WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!

sHKDSI9uthCUyBuaVMyQdg.text: Not impressed. Over-priced, mediocre food. Big Bone Soup for $18?(That's what you get, lots of bones . . . hardly any meat and veggies)  Lobster Noodle Soup for $50? What????? (1 medium sized lobster over-cooked and tough) Extra bowl of noodle soup for $5? What?????  Garlic Baby Bok Choy dish for $9???? Coconut Ice Cream for $8? (and you can't eat the hard coconut meat). And finally, $35 buys you a well-decorated/garnished Red Snapper deep fried. WTF. We had 4 couples and paid $312 including $36 tip and still had room to eat more.!!!!!!!!. We would have spent less and had a better meal someplace else. Well, live and learn. Not going back. Not recommending.

fFIUZw3pUiTjfXD0bcCCAg.text: They told me I couldn't order to go via phone because it's a busy week. The employee suggested I come in, order, and wait for the food to come out. How is having another body filling a packed restaurant better for them than just taking my order over the phone? Not a good way to retain customers.

xC2g9nhgt3HYdyv4RdodyA.text: Food was good as usual... Finally got to try the Bog Bone soup.   Today our server was a super fail!

R8sA97oja4W7Uli6qZEB6w.text: So I've been here twice I still don't understand the hype the food is mediocre tasting and well overpriced. I ordered the fish tacos on both occasions, the first time they were... Ok the second time I think they forgot the fish. Some of the bowls of pho looked pretty good they must have been the $29 bowls. The service and atmosphere I would give a solid 4,everything else gets a weak 3

-mmMN4Z9VL-lLFJ-hl-WVg.text: Visit was 6/19/2016   Came in and was able to get seated right away for a group of 4.   Ordered dozen oysters, Lobster pho- of course (do it for the IG), oxtail fried rice, Belly Bun, Garlic Noodles.   Dozen oysters were pretty yummy and fresh!  Lobster Pho is Market Price! Ours came out to 50 dollars. Broth was on point, lobster is already opened for you, and was pretty meaty but I would not come back to order it again. Like I said, its for the gram. ANYWAYS. oxtail fried rice was super flavorful but not too salty, garlic noodles were perfect. Would recommend.   Lastly, that belly bun, a bit too dry, and simply tasted like soy sauce to me. I have had better. But other than that, it was all really great!

RDj4upSIpfZ5j5vxS9qxsw.text: This is where the old Cravin Cajun used to be.  Plenty of seating.  Very unique menu, but primarily Vietnamese cuisine.  Had the oxtail fries and the bone marrow soup.  The bone marrow soup is picture worthy only because it is something you don't see everyday.  Two gigantic bones on a shallow bowl.  It was kind of difficult to eat because the bowl was so shallow, but the flavor was great.  Bone marrow tastes like butter to me.  The broth is beef/pho.    The oxtail fries were okay.  I'm used to Bachi Burger's oxtail chilli cheese fries.  Here, it's just oxtail marinated in sauce minus the chilli.  Includes an over easy egg.    I would say it is an experience to eat here, but overall I think it was just okay.

PDlVsq6JeEJMDbKvqSKvIQ.text: Terrible chicken pho!  Most of the chicken was a greyish color and the texture was terrible. They forgot to pack basil, sprouts, lime, or jalapenos, so it was boring and bland.  Will not be ordering from here again

daz9r3I92uLHbnGZEN8VGg.text: Good service, and a chill atmosphere, but meh, just not feeling it.   The food is pretty subpar. All the "fusion" items are generally overpriced and/or not that tasty. Oxtail fries, for example, were hilariously bad at $12. Literally one mouthful of meat, ghetto gravy from a packet, one a tiny fried egg, a couple handfuls of fries tossed haphazardly on a longish plate. The more "traditional" items are a bit tastier, but with all the Asian food joints in the area, why would you come here to pay more for those?  The drinks, which should have been a good backup, simply weren't that great either. It's interesting that they have so many random Asian beers aside from the usual piss-in-a-cup suspects, but most weren't particularly good so it's a moot point. And what's with the warm pint glasses...?  If you absolutely must have Asian fusion, go to Bachi instead. Sure, their menu is a bit more burger-centric, but it's far better anyway.

4juUxXoWOUKvXcFDrfBg8w.text: Food and service always great at this place! Parking & wait to be seated is probablymy only complain.    Overall, I will always come back to this place

vJTbmzI36IjyD9zmF9_GGg.text: They have a really good selection of Japenese whiskeys. I tried two different kinds and I wish I could remember which ones. This got me in the mood for the meal--unfortunately it took 30 mins for appetizers and nearly an hour for food to come out. What we ordered ended up being small dishes, and it was surprising because the menu's didn't make them sound that way. The food was good over all. We sat in some weird corner with a bunch of empty cardboard boxes behind our table, so it wasn't a very classy experience. I'd suggest looking at pics of other people's dishes here on yelp to get an idea of the size of the plate before you order it.

d2PUhkzs5JlbBgdfMQ3jKA.text: Mediocre food, service was great. Unfortunately I don't come for the service, but for the food.

NRr0PsJT5G0WIxNW9cpueQ.text: Ambiance - typical commercialized modern bar scene. This place is attractive to barbies and Bros. Good thing I only come here for the food.   Fresh Spring Rolls - Distinct for its fried egg roll skin that's within the spring roll and for its generous portions of shrimp. The peanut sauce contains freshly roasted peanuts and is mixed in a combination of hoisin sauce and peanut butter.  Pork Belly Bun - the sliced cucumbers and carrots are not enough to cut the fattyness of the pork. However, I'm sure others would disagree.  Fish Tacos - typical Mexican style fish tacos. Therr was not an Asian or Vietnamese twist to these standard mexican fish tacos. Not sure why these are even on the menu to begin with.  Beef Carpaccio - everytime me and my bro come here we order this. This is our favorite dish here and we highly recommend it. I just wished they would use wagyu :(  House special oysters - fresh, bright, sweet and sour flavors. Topped off with flying fish roe, ponzu sauce, and green garnishes.   Oxtail Fried Rice - the texture of the chewy oxtail meat blends well with the garlicy fried rice. Medium portion size, enough to share with another person. The texture, more so than the flavor of this dish, is what stood out for me.  Also, I think I saw a Chinese porn star here. Possibly another reason to come?

aBjEUa2LPBwPhGRhQ9j7aQ.text: Decided to check this place out with some friends and I'm so glad we did.  The service was Great! But the food was even better.  We all shared: big bone soup, oxtail pho, coconut pork belly, oysters, spicy edamame, ribeye eye and lobster pho.  My favorite was the coconut pork belly with a soft boiled egg.  The big bone soup with with bone marrow broth is my 2nd.  The presentation was definitely a mouth opener.  And the fact that they gave us gloves if we wanted to grab the bone and chomp down like cave woman was hilarious. Luckily, the waiter did all the hard work for us and even took out the meat in the bone. The fresh coconut mojito is a must try! They also cracked it open so we can enjoy the coconut meat! Yummmm.. I'm definitely coming back!

WH1wMOyCML_QGDisFPIkVw.text: District One has been a late night eat for my friends & myself on occasions. They have some good oxtail fries, oysters, & oxtail soup in addition to a pretty decent alcohol selection. Everything else I have tried so far is okay. Their service isn't horrible. The only trend I've noticed is that they can get slow when it comes to refills, especially during late nights. One thing I see others are a fan of is their infamous lobster pho. Maybe next time?!

fEIbox31wPy06fyxi25p5Q.text: Some good eat here, personal favorites pho Tom and fried pork belly buns. Everything I've had here is very tasty, portions are generous and prices are just right. Fish tacos (sashimi) you'll find them on the appetizer menu ... They are tiny so don't expect full tacos. Happy hour is a good time to try the appetizers.

1_cGqW_TyQdlIrOw7iAWjQ.text: My son is vegetarian and this place had great pho. Wasn't thrilled about the egg rolls but that's just me, too meaty.  Everything else was excellent, including the service.  Our waiter was helpful and full of positive energy.

gx8l9iCgsMnxh4WbtvQj-w.text: I have a new favorite. I get new favorites often but I'm pretty sure this one will last a while. This joint has a chill decor that makes you want to hang out. The staff is knowledgeable and on the ball. The menu is creative and so freakin full of tasty offerings. The bar menu is the best I've ever seen. I have had their house special oysters which are now my fave of all time. Try those wings. Dank. Green papaya salad was refreshing and spicy at the same time. Omg. The oxtail fried rice is legit! 8 treasure noodles were exploding with flavor. I will be here OFTEN! BONUS HAPPY HOUR MENU! Can't wait to try that out. Don't pass this place up. Oh and CLEAN! Just do yourself a favor and go.

aNxBf0InGf07rQ_gJdPQkQ.text: First off let me say that the service is great. Our hostess and waiter were very friendly and attentive. We ordered a dozen of the oysters which were delicious. Their cocktail sauce was fantastic.   The bf got the oxtail pho which he really enjoyed. I ordered the pho ga which actually wasn't very good. The chicken had an odd texture and didn't taste fresh. The broth and noodles however were very good. With tip the bill was around $53.

0Zc8phhjiX1jBJklW4aTbg.text: Spacious restaurant! I've been wanting to go here every time I'm in Vegas because of all the lobster pho posts on IG, but it's off the strip and no one wants to go. However, this time around, we made it!! And I'm soooo happy I finally tried the lobster pho! Of course it's pricy: $50, but it was amazing!! I loved how the broth was beefy and not seafoody, the lobster was delicious! We also tried the carpaccio, which was okay. The egg roll was good, and they're regular beef pho was phonomenal! I believe their late night HH included Jameson shots for just $5/shot! What a steal!!! I'd definitely come back.

0aXUbOyP7LfGCiRHixaMow.text: Decor is great. Upscale-ish bar.  Many original pho takes such as lobster and oxtail. Staff are all very friendly, nice, and professional.  Paying is easy with the tablet device that you swipe your card on, so there's no usual extra waiting around back and forth to pick up the payment.  Reasonably priced. Excellent stuff. A go-to

HgaB4dM2OLs20a3Qs8E_yQ.text: Pretty good options and atmosphere, but for the price I'll probably look for something new or stick with others.

zUkWca_hqrLCe7_Mm25Q5w.text: I came here for lunch with a friend based on fellow yelper reviews.  The place was quite nice, and service was good. We had the belly buns, pho, and the oxtail fries. The food was great and reasonably priced. I would come back for sure.

m6NAj8vAzMW9AemYxzhuWQ.text: The cuisine is amazing. Everything is delicious and all the plates well thought out. But the value you're getting is seriously lacking. I ordered the lobster pho of course and for the most part, it was good. It could have been better if they actually cooked lobsters in the broth. You can tell they only put in scraps or maybe just the shells to flavor it quickly instead of leeching out the juices from a whole lobster. The broth was no where near close to being seafood-ish. As for the portion of lobster you're getting, it'll be a half. Looking back, I think I only got a third actually. For $50, you would think you'll be served an entire lobster. I felt totally cheated. We also had a lobster fried rice. That dish was much better, but again..... half a lobster. Wtf?!  If you're looking for an experience, then by all means try the place. Most of the items are amazing.  But if you're looking for all around value, you're better off going to a fancy buffet where the lobster is all you can eat and you won't leave hungry.

6zTuvHf09Y-H5idgqx0KuA.text: I honestly did not know what to expect coming here; it could either be ridiculously overrated (I'm sure they've gone up in popularity since it was on a little video clip) or it could be amazing. There was still a wait around 11pm, but luckily we went right to the bar. The bartender was really nice and chatty, and they had a pretty good alcohol selection (sake flight yay!) The lobster pho was a whopping $50, which for that price I could get over 5 bowls of combo pho, so I had to skip. However, we still splurged and got:  Oxtail pho: The broth was very flavorful, and had definitely been simmering for hours to get that type of flavor. They put a good amount of lime in there when I got it, though I think I like the broth without the lime (or less?) There was a good amount of oxtail, though just a tiny bit of pho noodles. Comparing this to actual pho joints, you're really not going to enjoy the pho noodles, as there really isn't much, but definitely savor all that oxtail.  Bone marrow soup: At first I was thinking, "nah, it's just a big ol' bone and soup!" But no! There was plenty of meat still clinging to the bone, and the broth was ultra flavorful and yummy--it was the same as my oxtail pho broth, but without the lime. My husband was so happy to get this dish, as his tummy had not been feeling well and what better than a giant bowl of bone broth? This is definitely something I would get again.  Overall, we both left satisfied and full from all the yummy broth and goodies. I would definitely come again to try the non-broth dishes, but man, that bone marrow is just so tempting. This place is worth a try and worth all the hype, so give it a go!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow soup
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake flight

cGmrhTHy9BwF4xT6g9bRRw.text: Almost two years ago, a foodie friend who frequents Las Vegas, introduced me to District One.  At first I didn't want to go, we can get good pho here, right?  I'm definitely glad I went!  During our most recent trip there, we took our other 4 friends there to introduce them to District One's yumminess.  They liked it so much, we went back a second time during our week-long Vegas stay!!    A restaurant in a strip mall (like so many Vegas eateries), District One has about 8 long booths outlining two walls of the restaurant.  There's a large table to the side that's great for a semi private event.  One of the days we were there, a group of guys looked like they were set up for their fantasy football draft.  Regular tables and chairs line the middle of the restaurant and on the far wall there is a cool bar with hard to get Japan Whiskeys.  A casual setting with friendly staff, help to top off this great spot!   Items I've eaten there: * Edamame - It was ok, nothing special.  I'd skip this item and save the space in your tummy for their more flavorful menu items. * Crispy Egg Rolls - Typically what we call Spring Rolls here, these crisp rolls filled with pork, mushrooms and taro (don't remember tasting the taro) came with lettuce, fish sauce and pickled veggies. Wish it came with vermicelli noodles too but I still enjoyed it.   * Spring Rolls - What we call Summer Rolls here, were filled with shrimp, pork, vermicelli noodles, lettuce and their peanut sauce.   * Belly Buns - braised pork belly, cilantro, peanuts and hoisin sauce.  Although I'm not a fan of pork belly (don't like to chew on pieces of fat), I enjoyed these.  Once there were fried ones too but I think we enjoyed the regular ones more.   * Oxtail fries - French fries topped with oxtail gravy and an easy over egg.  I just had a few fries with the gravy and that was good.  But if you're like me and enjoy crispy fries, you'll need to eat these quickly and when they're hot.   * Shaken Beef Salad - beef tenderloin tossed over a bed of lettuce and their house dressing.  I probably wouldn't order this if I were there by myself but my friend really enjoys this.  * Aioli King Crab Legs - I've never had grilled crab legs before but these were slices of grilled crab with a spicy aioli.  It was a little too spicy for me so I'm glad I shared this dish with one of my friends but I enjoyed the grilled flavor of the crab legs.  * Pho Tai Rib Eye - featured thin slices of ribeye and flank steak in their pho broth and rice noodles.   * Pho Ga - lots of chicken in their pho broth and rice noodles.  I never thought that I would say this but there was actually too much chicken in there compared to the amount of noodles.  I like a nice balance and I had a lot of chicken left and not enough noodles.  The broth was delicious and prefer this pho to the Ribeye one.    The first time I went 2 years ago, we were quickly seated but I guess as the restaurant's popularity increased (lots of 20-30 somethings eating there this time) we had to wait about 30 minutes each visit to get seated.    On a side note, my friend had the oxtail pho and another friend had the lobster/seafood pho and both said that was the best pho they ever had!!  Guess I'll need to try one the next time I go.

2WnzUp9LUrdLxmTZ3tovBw.text: District One is probably one of the trendiest places that you can order pho from. Almost everywhere you look has a TV screen that shows live games. A huge plus for me was that they had NBATV. The music is also nice, setting a "hip" atmosphere.  District One has an impressive bar selection. Usually, I would order a Blue Moon. Enter: Kronenbourg Blanc. I was introduced to Kronenbourg Blanc at District One, and I am glad that I have stumbled upon it. I haven't found many restaurants that offer it, but it's better than Blue Moon!  I ordered the steak and eggs. It contained small cut pieces of steak, tossed around in some sauce, tomato rice, and a fried egg. Not your typical steak and eggs, but this tasted pretty good.  They have pho oxtail as well here too, which I recommend. Their broth is better than most in Vegas which are bland. Another famous dish they have is the lobster pho, which is great for pictures. Not to also mention their Big Bone soup, which consists of a huge bone where you can stick a long spoon in and get all of the bone marrow goodness!   Great atmosphere, place to watch the games, and grub!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and egg and beer!

IaIuAAWbmGtEURtpWELnpw.text: "LIke"  yes I do. I love the food, ambience and service. They are sometimes busy but will attend to you and won't forget you.   What we ordered here was oxtail soup, oxtail fried rice, oxtail fries, steak and eggs, Serrano wings, garlic noodles and belly buns. All the oxtail were delish. I love oxtail and they did it justice. The crispy wings had a little heat but it's one you should try. The garlic noodles was OK but I've had better. The pork buns was delish and really good. It had nice price of pork/fat pork which yeah gross I love the fat part of the pork bun.    We didn't wait to long to be seated maybe cause dinner rush was over. We were seated in the big table. Had a good view of the bar/TV and say for us to get the waitress attention if needed.   Parking ugh now that's another story. It's hate it. No street parking but I've parked across the street in the other plaza. Luckily I haven't gotten towed..

XZFVspTW3LYhHLsDBETt4A.text: We met up with some local friends here for a later dinner when we hit town.  It wasn't so busy when we walked in so we were easily able to get a table for 6.  I really hoped to like this place but I felt the food was hit or miss.  The service was average with a few instances where we were unable to find someone to help us.  But really, the food was sort of a disappointment given the price tags.  So here's the rundown: - Snails:  The price on these were "MP".  I believe they were $14 that day.  We got a small bowl of anemic snails (6) in a lemongrass broth.  The broth was good.  The snails were not my cup o'tea. - Black Pepper Lobster:  MP...Good flavor, waaayyyy too salty and oversauced.  The noodles underneath also became too salty. Lobster must have also been dieting. - Shrimp Skewers: Also MP...they were just regular big shrimp. Unfortunately, these came a skosh overcooked. - Oxtail fried rice:  Probably my favorite dish that evening, especially since they left in all the tender fat and gristle from the oxtail itself. - Oxtail fries:  Nicely done fries, topping was also great. - Garlic Chicken Wings:  You got the garlic but it was sorely unsalted. - Cornish Hen - Bird itself was moist and well-seasoned; accompanying rice was meh - Calamari - Forgettable except for the spicy sauce that came with it. - Rib Eye Pho - Average  Cocktails were pretty tasty but nothing revolutionary or out of this world.  All in all, a decent meal but a little on the pricey side for what you get.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black pepper lobster
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cornish hen

YfGTPpl1efe71FcfgtTGvA.text: In town for the weekend, originally hoping to get Asian BBQ & Noodles in the same plaza, and didn't realize they were closed on Fridays. Luckily District One was right there!  What I ate: - HH oysters: Honestly, not the best oysters in the world, but pretty decent for HH price.  - HH Garlic Fries: skinny fries. For some reason these came out kind of late. I was hoping to have them with the oysters. After some time they got soggy. I would pass on these fries unless this is all you plan on getting - Oxtail Fried Rice: My friend who had been to District One before highly recommended this, and I'm so glad we ordered it. The oxtail was super tender and delicious, a great addition classic fried rice. Over easy fried egg on top just pushed it to the next level of decadence. Please order this to share with the table!  - Beef Pho: This was good. I'm not a huge fan of pho, so I can't really tell you much - Wonton Noodle Soup: This was a good wonton noodle soup. Shrimp wontons were tasty. This would be great to warm up with if you're craving noodle soup  Pros: - Not much of a wait on a Friday night.  - Happy hour until 7pm!  - Friendly staff - That oxtail fried rice! seriously, so good  Cons: - Very cold. I think we were sitting under a vent, but it was freezing cold. I get it, it's the desert, but it made my friends and I crave warm noodle soup, which is why I think we ended up ordering noodle soups - Asian parking lot. You know how it goes - spots are tight, horrible Asian drivers, very very busy and full parking lot.   Would I come again? While food was good, I think I'd rather try something new next time I'm in Vegas.

EJ5YyFFmQW-NLuXsO1AyQA.text: It was really hard to park in this plaza, but I guess that the difficulty for the parking spot is almost worth the food. District One is a modern Vietnamese fusion cuisine that offers traditional plates like pho with a twist. There are a bunch of TVs in the restaurant and seating for tables, booths, and a bar.  Their alcohol and wine list is pretty detailed. I usually try different beers when I'm in here. They all taste yummy.  I had the steak and eggs. I opted for the normal steamed rice because I tried the tomato rice before and was not really a fan. The meat was good and the taste had a lot of flavor. No complaints at all!  The reason I can't make this place a normal go to is because the price is a tad bit expensive compared to other pho restaurants. Yes, they offer an amazing lobster pho and/or surf and turf pho, but that will cost you $30 for essentially what is still pho. If I want a normal pho bowl, I can think of a lot of places where I would pay less and probably pay as much as I would here but already have gratuity included.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at all that whiskey!! And tv screens!!

TFljHex9MEphOh9IIUyM9Q.text: I love their pho soup. Every time I am here I always order the ribeye pho. My girlfriend orders their humongous bone barrow soup. It is good for like 2-3 people. Oxtail fries is amazing. Excellent customer service ever time I am there. They also serve alcohol.

-k8fwVm90JtScCP3xQzJRA.text: Knocked this bad boy of a place off my bucket list and did it all for the gram! Lmao. Of course I had to order the infamous bone marrow pho to accomplish that task.. This thing is friggin huge AF. The bones are literally the size of my head. I was surprised that I was able to finish too but it was that good. Also ordered the oxtail fried rice which agrees with a lot of other reviews as a go to dish.   I don't know if I'd order the bone marrow again but I still have no regrets. That was quite an experience in itself. *pats self on back*   Great place. Clean and the vibe is pretty chill. Service was top notch as well.  Keep it up!

yqLXb5w2PAk7goQzEpbaCA.text: Came to Las Vegas for a 3 day weekend trip. District One was one of the place that I needed to try.  They were on the food channel network. We order Oxtail Fries, this was ok and kinda different. I did not like the Sea Snails. However, my friend loved it. As for, there famous Pho Lobster. It's a big portion, enough for 2 people. Bone marrow wasn't my favorite and it didn't come with noodles, so if I were to return, I would get a different special pho, and the oxtail fried rice again ;)   And definitely don't skip out on their dessert! bqnCuOHsx6UkNcJrJikrgw.text: Came for dinner one night and enjoyed the spring rolls, oxtail fried rice and the double down. They also have a variety of pho and seafood dishes. The atmosphere is casual, young and good for groups. The service was average. I just wish we had more choices on the menu, but overall the food we did have so far was flavorful and satisfying.

S_reWES3-3kk2F_zX6I3jA.text: My family and I had watched an episode of "Worth It," where they went around trying pho and we immediately bookmarked District One for any future Las Vegas trips. Today it happened, we wanted my husband to try the surf and turf pho for his Father's Day meal and we all ended up having a bite or two of it. The broth was delicious and complimentary to the vegetables and proteins. We also ordered the garlic noodles, spicy pork green beans and ox tail fries. Had we all not filled up on broth we wouldn't have had any left overs. Since it was Father's Day my husband was given a complimentary beer which was greatly appreciated. I enjoyed a coconut mojito that is served in a tender coconut with fresh mint in it. It was delicious and refreshing, I couldn't get enough of it. It felt never ending!! All in all we had an amazing meal and experience, if you're in the area give it a whirl.

TfXnAvfp-giKvKlKbzZRjg.text: Very delicious food! I've been here several times during our recent visits to the Vegas area. Good quality food and flavors are consistent. These have been our go-to's there: crispy garlic wings (it's not spicy), beef carpacio, oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice, pho, and their thit kho (coconut pork belly).    It's a great place to come hang out with friends, eat and have a good drink (or three...) They have a great selection of creative cocktails and your typical asian beers/liquor. You can't go wrong with their Henny cafe sua da! If you're not feeling like drinking alcohol, their matcha thai tea was super delicious!   Parking can be a bitch some times so be prepared to park across the street later in the evenings/weekends. While there's a decent size parking lot, it is shared amongst other restaurants and lounges so space runs out fast.

bFS7NizJvFbZ6u5sLYF4Cg.text: Family recommended this place. They where excited about the oxtail pho and kept telling us we should try it! So husband, brother in law and wife popped in for lunch and it was not a disappointment.   We ordered the oxtail fries, lemon grass beef, fried whole fish, the big bone soup, spicy hue noodle soup, pho oxtail, and garlic noodles. It was a table full and it all looked and was very delicious.  The oxtail fries came out crispy, smothered in shredded oxtail 'gravy' and of coarse the fried egg, the fries stayed crispy for the most part and the meat/gravy was well saturated with pieces of meat, soft and tender.   Lemon grass beef came out as little bundles of meat wrapped  with betel leaves. This dish was just blah, cannot say much about it.   The fried whole fish was a beautiful dish, the fish was rather large and had a good deal of meat, two at the table really enjoyed picking the bones clean, even feasting on the fish eyes.   The spicy hue noodle soup had just enough spice to make my lips numb but wasn't too overwhelming. And the big bone soup had the biggest pieces.   The garlic noodles where also a big hit for the entire table. All in all the food was great, service was excellent. Good place for a great meal especially with a large group!

fjLzj3OGEd6mxcVm5aRotg.text: Brand new restaurant (6 weeks they said)... Found it on Yelp because my cousin's gf wanted Asian for her bday dinner.   Hands down, best birthday dinner I've ever been to.  There were 6 of us in the group, and we decided to do everything family style. We ordered 5 appetizers and 4 entrees. The place was about 3/4 full, but our waters were always refilled by the time they hit half full. The food all came out hot, and in a perfect progression just as we were finishing up what had been brought out first.   Everything was delicious, and I'll definitely be bringing other friends here when they come to town.

XEIBBuXhD-V-MJ_KyTlL-g.text: Stopped by this place for lunch with a friend and was pleased.  The inside of the restaurant has a clean, down to earth bar decor that's casual and relaxing.  The menu is simple offering classic Vietnamese dishes.  Our server was great,  friendly and helpful. We ordered the oxtail fried rice (their popular choice) and shaken beef with sides of pho broth.  The oxtail fried rice was superb!! The shaken beef was good too. The pho broth was one of the best in Vegas. Great food and service,  reasonably priced.  Highly recommended.

FuBnvdXaGsxzXnEEbclQeg.text: My BF and I were in Las Vegas for the weekend and decided to try this place out! When we got to the restaurant, we were seated right away. We looked over the menu and figured out what we wanted fairly quick.  We waited a little long to get our orders taken, which was odd, because it seemed like there were more workers than customers! When we looked around seriously each table had a worker tending to them!! One of the managers (I assume) went up to us to apologize about someone not helping us and got someone to take our orders right away. I appreciated that. The service was great after that!   On to the food, we had the pork belly buns and the fish tacos for our appetizers. Both were delicious. Just wished they were bigger or served more in a dish, but that's my inner fatty talking! My boyfriend had one of their steak dishes which he said he enjoyed! I had the slow braised pork belly in young coconut juice. That dish was soooo good! I love pork belly and that meat was so flavorful and melted in my mouth!! It was on point!!!   I would definitely check this spot again and try their other dishes!!

brvb25qrAqNwzpM9E0AlGg.text: Very hip vietnamese restaurant that is different from other typical pho joints that you see in Vegas. Great vibe and service is excellent! We were not abandoned by the waitress after we put the order in. They keep coming back asking if everything was ok, clearing up the empty plates and bowl and refilling hot water for my tea. We ordered pho, combo pork chop rice, egg rolls, grilled squid, surf clams and ox tail fried rice. Food quality is definitely better than other pho restaurants around here. I love the idea of having the sinks outside of the restroom in the hall way for the guests' convenience. The only problem why I knocked down a star is because it took quite a bit of time for food to come out. Other than that everything is great. Will definitely come back next time we are here in Vegas again!

R_WJLSVDjIzR63ujKWuS_g.text: Good food, nice ambience, reasonable price, ample food serving, attentive server. Will come back if in the area.

dGZZF-wYHzwvNanXUpxS3Q.text: I got referred here by a friend who has been raving about it since it opened. Decided to give it a try today and was very impressed. I am no stranger to pho and this place has now taken the title of my favorite Vietnamese joint in town. I got amazing, timely service and the food was to die for. Ox tail pho was incredible and so were the tamarind chicken wings. Atmosphere is nice too. Great restaurant. I can't wait to bring my friends and family back here! Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ox tail phò was delicious!

ghysIUq63xvmrtAa3vgv2A.text: Absolutely love this place! The service was excellent and the food was delicious. The hubby and I have been here a handful of times. My favorite dishes would have to be the bun bo hue, pho ox tail, and shaken beef salad. They are quite generous with the meat and the flavor is simply delish. Hubby went on and on about how great the razor clams were. We've also had their pork belly buns, crispy egg rolls, and garlic serano pepper wings. All were extremely tasty. I can honestly say that I've never been to a restaurant where I enjoyed every single item that we ordered ... until now. :) Their bar is now open as well, and I have every intention of visiting it.

T7NFqr2asLfXTBDGj_FhPQ.text: Been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally made it here. I loved everything that was ordered. I tried the oxtail fried rice, oxtail soup, and the pork belly appetizers. They are like mini sandwiches or sliders. You get three in an order. Loved it and will be back again!

fv1q0lLBoz3QieZtVjQMkw.text: My friend sent me a picture of his lobster pho and I immediately knew I had to come eat here. So the next time I went to Vegas, I made the trip out to District One!   Unfortunately, my boyfriend and I didn't have too much of an appetite so we ended up sharing a lobster pho and dessert. We also ordered an extra dish to go, fried rice with chicken, I think. It was decent, but there wasn't really anything special about it. The rice was also just a tiny bit dry. That lobster pho was an all star, though! I really enjoyed the soup, which was full of flavor, and of course the lobster itself. It also came with a decent amount of noodles. It was a $40 pho, so probably not going to be a regular meal for me, but the novelty of it was fun. And getting to post a picture of it on IG.  For dessert, we got the coconut ice cream, which came in an actual coconut. It was delicious and worth every penny.   The service and ambiance was great and I would definitely come back again for that pho.

ANnJ0zEKbRruVrmkIYavCA.text: First time try out the Lobster pho noodle, whole lobster served, pretty good. Nice and friendly service. Try it out if in Vegas.

AnqCDLi05_JFTrFM4JtgIA.text: To start with.  The spring Rolls are pre made.  That's why I'm giving them 3 stars.  They should be made to order.  The menu is very good and all the dishes are fresh, hot and taste good.  Presentation is good, service was above average.  The Happy Hour oysters are a great deal.

ejsolYrRDySTtMltRirIlQ.text: Overrated and over priced!! They ran out of everything and didn't notify us until 30 minutes later. Okay service but bland food

BdL4GO7SJ5HUTJJH7DnShQ.text: Where to begin?  The vietnamese fusion idea was not appealing at first but then my drink came.  Vietnamese donkey drink (I think thats what it was called) was delicious and refreshing.  A lychee vodka mix it was by far my favorite drink. Then the food came.  Their take on the papaya salad was incredible.  The oysters were also incredibly delectable.  The lobster pho was eaten by a friend and he said it was awesome.  A whole lobster was put into the pho making it a complete lobster dish.  I will be getting that next time.  All in all a great place with great service.

3JWqfz-j7ajG2Yy4oQroNA.text: Wow. I am impressed. Seriously delicious food. The house special oysters were incredible good and very very fresh. The grilled whole squid was fantastic and the best that I have ever had in a restaurant. Tasty and tender. The beef carpaccio was very good, too. Their pho is one of the best that I have tasted. I am very picky when it comes to pho and I have tried a lot of pho in the US and in France. Service was very good and friendly, too. I cannot wait to get back again.

xi4bnIn5uCuuCNofNkHdZg.text: Four stars because...  Tamarind Wings were a bit bland. You got the tang when you first bite into it, but after that, nothing special really.   The Crispy Noodle Nest was superb! This place made it with the light brown sauce rather than the thick white one & didn't have as much seafood, but it was still excellent!  The beef sausage I believe wrapped in the betel leaves were soooo good!   Service was great & they're very clean, always cleans up the plates and trash that are sitting on the table.

Tef7Pxo9353KS9UEFtWqbQ.text: Had the shrimp today AMAZING! Again with the Ox Tail Pho! Starting Friday they are open till 4am!

0156qcS0Rz3V0BOY1GSOLg.text: Damn! This is my new favorite Pho restaurant in Vegas! I got the Lobster pho and the Oxtail pho. Both bangin as fuck and it didn't give me diarrhea so that's a Nguyen Nguyen Nguyen!

W0DXXdB4HK0uiCNMq6MpDw.text: This place is a solid 4.5 stars.  I round up for family owned places and down for chains...so they get 5!  The deduction of .5 stars would be for the lack of parking (which I know they can't help) and for a little pet peeve of mine, not listing the market prices.  If you are going to have things on the menu that are at market price, list the prices on the chalk board or have the servers mention them without having to be asked.    Now to the good stuff.  The oxtail pho was very good.  Large pieces of oxtail that were falling off the bone.  Also, the spicy beef soup was the kind of soup one would love to have on a cold winter night.  We wanted to try the big bone soup, but it was sold out.  The pork belly buns were good, but not great.

c60PLUYTthLf3ikEJxELFQ.text: Went here for early dinner with a girl friend because we heard good things about this place. We ordered the wings, chicken with noodles and pho. Food was good and we did enjoy the Pho but we can't say the same for the service. It was pretty bad and the Pho took around 50 minutes to come out even after a follow up with the waitress. We asked for the Pho for a second time after another long wait and the waitress was surprised that it still wasn't there. The wait staff should at least take the initiative to check if the orders are complete. It wasn't even that busy at that time so we couldn't understand why it took so long for our orders to come out. Wish the wait staff were more friendly too.

nvG6TRp_drhSR8H-NyzvTw.text: First time here, and my impression was it was okay. The hubby and I ordered the wings and fish tacos for appetizer, no real wow factor. Dinner I had the steak and eggs with garlic noodles. The steak was real tender but became a little salty after continuous eating. The garlic noodles were, meh. The hubby ordered the cornish hen which he enjoyed, it seemed to have a nice crisp to it and flavor was there. If I return I may try the pho since they have a selection of flavors. Their version of the moscow mule the Vietnamese something was good. Refreshing with the lime taste and lychee.

gOcrrNrEP9XUqxqDe4q9DA.text: I got the big bone broth and it was delicious and super unique but then my acid kicked in and I got freaked out that I was chewing on a large bone and then had to go throw up in the bathroom but great experience otherwise would def come back

z56ISLaud7grxy4BNcUufg.text: Visiting relatives and I wondered how the food life was like in Sin City. Saw the famous lobster pho, so I had to check it out. Here was our experience on a Friday evening.  AMBIANCE: Parking: Plaza parking. It's a shop full of eateries so it gets pretty packed. Sooo good luck.  Seating: All inside with seats for about 15 groups that can either accommodate 4-6 people.   Feels:  It's a popping plaza so you have choices of where to go. As for the space itself, it's pretty cool. You enter a lighlty dimmed spot with a much decorated space with random words, pictures of people, and art. They have the tv playing sports if you're into that. Great place to organize a family size social, date night, or solo food adventure.  FOOD: Pho Lobster - (Recommend) We got it for the cost of about 50. The presentation is as it was hyped. A decent bowl size with the actual lobster. The broth was delicious, the noodles were sogged and lobster was well cooked. I did lowkey wish there was more lobster and a little more of everything but still pretty fulfilling.  CUSTOMER SERVICE:  Great! Friendly and quick service.  TL; DR OVERALL: 4 Stars. I liked this spot. It has a unique menu, food was delicious, and the experience was pleasant. I'd come back here again because it does have a menu like no other. Must come back to try their oxtail and bone marrow stuff.  TIPS: * There are a lot of great selections, come with someone to split orders for more choices! * On the safe side, I'd call to RSVP.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho!

IjhB2u9W6DgFW0XLn7SU_Q.text: After many years of hearing about District One, I finally made the trek out to it and was fulfilled for my Vietnamese fusion cravings.  I got the surf & turf pho which was about $30ish (market price so prices may vary). It really is quality lobster and the beef used is pretty good. The lobster definitely gives the broth a different and interesting taste. I do love the presentation as well overall. Just a random thought but do wish there was a bit more done with the noodles. Other dishes (which I didn't get) include similar takes on Vietnamese items.   I also got their version of an old fashioned which was okay. They do have a pretty robust list of cocktails and drinks here including various Japanese liquor/whiskey. Definitely worth exploring.   This attention to detail extends to the restaurant itself - definitely an interesting restaurant aesthetic that feels both modern and a bit rustic. The bartender that served me was good and friendly as well. On a Monday night, the restaurant wasn't super crowded and parking wasn't a big problem. It's not too far from the main strip as well.   Do note it is pricier than a standard Vietnamese restaurant. Overall, definitely interesting to try.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashioned
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf &amp; turf pho

XcsiTZN4WbqzNaSrbFa8DQ.text: The food here is really a hit or miss.  We ordered a bunch of dishes and the oxtail fried rice and pork belly buns stood out as possible repeat orders.  The bread on those pork belly buns were so good!  It was kind of sweet.  Anyway it's like crack.  Took everything I had to put it down after eat half (sharing with a friend).  The oxtail rice is so unique.  I've never seen that at an Asian restaurant before.  It may be that I'm not used to ordering fried rice but it was really good.    Other dishes like oxtail fries, calamari, and the pho are probably a pass.  Definitely can be overpriced for what you get.  The calamari was especially disappointing, it was half fried peppers.  More than a few times I'd bite into a fried ring expecting calamari and it turned out to be a spicy pepper.  My friend said the pho was mediocre.  And the oxtail fries was just gravy drenched fries with a few tiny pieces of oxtail in it.  Not worth it unless you like soggy fries.

gr_GBuOmV4GBouJzbDpBMg.text: I come here for the pho, but today I got the belly buns. It's seared pork belly topped with cilantro and this delicious sauce.   The pho, well I usually get the Pho tai nam, it's rib eye and flank steak over broth and rice noodles. It hits the spot every time.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belly Buns

tAXf1J2xyXfhUtq1_ISSXQ.text: This place is really all the hype in terms of food! We got a variety of food from the Big Bone Soup to Garlic Noodles to Oxtail Fries to Oxtail Fried Rice. The only reason I gave -1 Star was because it took a while for us to get seated. It looked like they were short staff for Saturday afternoon. We saw a table that still had dishes and wasn't cleaned off until we were seated. Mind you, it was a 40 minute wait. Lol Now let's get to the good stuff, which is the food! The Big bone soup was huge! It looked like a giant's soup bowl. My dad loved every bit of it. If you're a fan of bone marrow, cartilage, and bits of meat. Then this is the soup for you. Everything Oxtail is so good, just try them all, you won't be disappointed if you love meat!  Will I come back here? Most definitely if I'm ever in Vegas!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fried Rice with Fried Egg
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries

K4cY5yzCHpeCyW4hbq8xZg.text: My large family made reservations for Friday night at 7pm. We were given our own section off to the side of the restaurant.  Our waitress was very patient and attentive, even with the 5 children under 6 that were in our party.  NOTE: No kids menu so if you have picky kid eaters that only want chicken strips, leave them at home!  My husband and I ordered the following: LOBSTER PHO - The presentation was awesome a d they remove the claw meat and lobster meat for you so you don't have to do it yourself.  The broth had a subtle pho taste and I didnt have to add any sriracha or brown sauce.  Overall very good but with market pricing, one time is good enough.  Garlic Serrano Wings - VERY SPICY! Both the skin and meat were pretty spicy but very tasty.   Oxtail Fried Rice - I liked the meaty flavor from the oxtail and they were very generous with the meat.  I would order again.  Garlic Noodles - could have used more garlic flavor.  Overall a good experience but probably wont revisit.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Serrano Wings - SPICY!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho

JudCTV80vQGwbG3Uaq556Q.text: 3.5 STARS  After pulling an almost all nighter, we were starving! Decided to try District One as I've always wanted their giant bone soup. Our group of seven stopped by on Friday, January 25th around 12pm for lunch. It wasn't too busy, so we easily grabbed a table.  *Garlic Serrano Wings: twice cooked, crispy ($8.99) *Crispy Egg Rolls: pork, mushroom, taro ($8.99) *Sea Snails: lemon grass, chili, basil, ginger dipping sauce ($14.99) *The Big Bone Soup: bone marrow, pho broth ($24.99) *Pho Oxtail: ox tail, pho broth, rice noodles ($15.99) *Pho Tai Rib Eye: thin slices of ribeye, pho broth, rice noodles ($10.99) *Pho Ga: chicken, pho broth, rice noodles ($9.99) x2 *Spicy Hue Noodle Soup: beef shank, pork loin, pork roll, rice vermicelli ($11.99) x2 *Garlic Noodles: egg noodles, wok fried garlic ($7.99) *The Whistling Hemingway: whistling andy hibiscus rum, fresh lime juice, grapefruit, angostura bitters ($12) *Good Morning Vietnam: bloody mary enhanced with uv sriracha & togarashi pepper & truffle salt rim ($14) *Vietnamese Coffee ($4) *Hot Tea ($3) x2  So the soup is huge! I basically only got through one bone. Had to recruit some friends for help. The soup itself was okay. A little bland for my tastes, but nothing a bunch of hot sauce couldn't fix. I really liked the snails. That broth was so tasty. The chicken wings were good. Meaty and crunchy.  Service was good. Half of us got here first, so we waited a bit for the rest of our party. The staff never made us feel rushed which I appreciated. The only thing is that did take a while for them to notice we needed more hot tea. Other than that, everyone was nice and super sweet.  Fun to stop by once for their big bone soup. Otherwise, I think their pho is pretty average.

dAan-mGQtmzT7UlSX8wHfg.text: I used to come here a lots , late at night usually ! I literally order a tons of stuffs but today for lunch I only order a few dishes only   I always order chicken wings they are amazing crunchy but a little spicy for me but I always love it even I cried a little every time I eat them wings lol    Ox tails pho always good because the ox tails super soft so you can just literally get all the meats off of the ox tails ! The big bone soup contains a tons of bones some with marrows , some with meats  ,some with  tendons ! Sometimes I just order it because it's so cool and bad ass haha I can't eat them all lmao ! It was the time when they had chrome large bowls.   I came back for a second time and no longer was it the same taste or quantity.   3rd time I never got the steak pho bowl, instead I ordered the ox tail fried rice with an sunny side up egg on top. 3.5/5. It used to be better.    Suggestion is to bring back its old flavors and style. It's not the same as it used to be.
