txybHgjl6QnKnmx6P8Oxew.text: Keto or low carb friendly? (I'm not a dietician)  Yes stick to grilled meats plate and avoid rice.  This is a refreshing place after older and dirty pho establishments...  Server, Jason, was very patient and nice.  We had a party of 11. Place is big enough to accommodate large parties.  Oxtail pho is good. Didn't order lobster pho...Oxtail fries for group sharing is ------  Back in Vegas July 2019.    Had the Ox Tail Pho, hold the vermicelli and $1.50 for veggies add on!  Drank all the soup to satisfy hunger.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox Tail Pho, hole the vermicelli and $1.50 extra for added veggies!

zMh_f1U8l_S6oogmP35UMw.text: Got to try this place out during happy hour on a Friday and the place was a bit slower. By the time we left people was starting to come in. We got to try the oxtail fried rice which was just ok. Not too many flavors there. Fried fish was ok and not worth the MP price. I don't know what fish it was but it was crispy. Grilled squid was good and you could tell it was fresher than most places it was a large piece and it was worth the price. Server was seen only when she took the order and when she gave our check.  Glad there was two other servers helping us out as we ran out of water twice.

6K4pHkkWmZ1DQWiHkK-IEA.text: In addition to great food, D1 serves quality service!  We came in for a late lunch because I wanted to try this place, but coming for dinner hours is a challenge: large crowds and impossible parking. Around 2pm there were quite a number of customers all around and yet, we were lucky enough to be seated at a booth. These booths, by the way, seat six or maybe more. There's also a huge bar with several stool seatings - great for groups of any size.   For food we went with the Oxtail Fried Rice ($15.99) and Steak and Eggs ($15.99). The latter, was more like Steak and Egg as it had just a single egg, but that wasn't my issue... The steak turned out to be wildly chewy. It very much seemed like we were chomping on cartilage or something, so I did what I almost never do: sent it back to the kitchen and asked for something else. I was too worried that it was what they intended it to taste like. This place is so popular I assumed they wouldn't overlook something like this.   In place of the dish, I asked for the Pho Tai Rib Eye ($10.99). I love pho and I know this'll be bomb, and it was!  While the pho was being prepared in the back, the manager came out to apologize for the steak and even confirmed that the meat was cut improperly. Not only did she remove it from our bill, but also threw in a creme brulee dessert. Talk about service!  Overall it was a great experience, and where I may have not returned to a restaurant so soon from a bad dish, D1 totally redeemed itself and I hope to return again soon for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Egg ($15.99)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée

zAJ7_px4zBeDsCBYCP6Q7w.text: I heard District One's five year anniversary is coming up, after numerous visits, this review is long overdue...  D1 Service & Ambiance: They get busy because they're popular but the staff is always friendly and inviting.  The kitchen gets the entrees out quickly and they're good with turning tables quickly. The industrial decor is attractive with lots of wood and word murals on the wall.  There's full bar with multiple flat screens.  There's plenty of full size booths and the tables in the middle of the dining area are mobile to accommodate large parties.  D1 Cuisine:  Fusion dishes or traditional pho is what I've sampled, these are my D1 favs: The Oxtail fried rice is a rice dish that eats like a meal.  The Double down with pork chops works well with the Chinese sausage and rice topped with a fried egg.  The grilled squid is delish and big enough to share for the table or get you full as your main entree.  The spring rolls are always fresh and flavorful.  For dessert, grab the coconut ice cream served in a coconut shell that has fresh coconut ready for you to scoop out and eat.  District One is exhibit A of how Vegas has become a primo foodie city.  The Vegas restos owned by locals know what works for the city and offers a great foodie experience for a price that provides value.  We'll continue to swing by District One because they've always delivered.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Down
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WQMReiF_612s7Eheh9qMpQ.text: District One was alright. I wanted to like it so much more than I did. We came for the lobster pho and lobster pho we got (well, the surf-and-turf at least). Strangely, they serve drinks in plastic, party/bar cups. Not a deal breaker, but strange. We started with the Serrano garlic wings was a great choice. They were super crispy and garlicky. The Serranos were copped and placed on top so you could choose how much spice you devoured.   To the pho . . . First, the lobster broth was super savory. I've never tasted something so fishy, pho-y, and tasty all at the same time; however, it was a little too salty. Ever so slightly too salty. Also, the bowl they serve the lobster pho in severely messes up my preferred noodle to broth ratio. We ended up with half of the broth and no noodles about 20 min in, so we shared an extra bowl of noodles to finish off the broth. The lobster itself was good. The Tai (beef) that came with it was a good portion and tender. I just wish it have lived up to the hype of everything I had read.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano garlic wings

O419f8jyArDZ1bwZErUHBA.text: The place has an open ceiling, industrial look,  but decor of a fisherman's wharf.  There are booth seating along the walls on a lifted level of the restaurant,  with tables on entry level.  There's a bar and what appears to be some beer on tap. This place seems trendy with curious options on the menu and noise level conducive to lunch meetings.   Battling between oxtail fried rice,  I decided on the oxtail pho while my husband had the steak pho.  First impression,  the pho came out promptly and it was hot and steamy.  Only served in one size, the two pieces of oxtail was tender, not too fatty and it tasted great.  For me, the broth was just okay with subtle flavors.  My husband said his pho was standard,  so not much to rave over.    This is a further drive than what I would like to trek. We came,  we tried,  we don't get the hype.

IHmiUuVZJV9FyXiAtkMNmw.text: Back again! This place is not as busy on a Sunday night and my favorite spot would always be the booth.   We got seated right away. The staff are definitely friendly. What I like most is that our food came out pretty quick.   Our staples are the coconut pork belly and spicy pork string beans. Although this time, I don't see much of the pork on the string beans.  Drinks are highly recommended as well especially the fresh coconut mojito which is around $14. They have a booklet of wines/cocktails and spirits for options.  We would have ordered a dessert but our server picked up few more tables that I think she forgot us. Oh well.

2i4tCM3stOcYGruHkyyJEg.text: Very good photo place , the pho is good and as well the appetizers and the rest of the dishes.  Creme brulee is also very recommended.  The staff is very helpful and nice. Very good experience every single time that me and my wife go to eat at district one.

UZmDNPjFS3JupNyG_ntG6w.text: A fun and modern pho place to grab a bit for lunch and dinner. rohXRr-vRJg3xmqUg3Qy4w.text: My boyfriend and I wanted to try a new place close to home(89102) and as were going down the list, this restaurant caught our attention. We called, no need to reserve a table for two around 9:30pm on a Saturday so we show up and sit at the bar. Immediately greeted, given water and menus. The rest of the visit is why we will definitely recommend to our friends and others. The bartenders Janelle and Aaron were amazing! We trusted their recommendations and drinks and left so satisfied with our choice of going there we can't wait to go back.

HuFn2UFncD6krQ6LE4EykA.text: Lobster pho!!!! Incredible!!! And the oysters!!! Amazing!!! Already looking forward to my next Vegas trip to have these dishes again. So glad I found this place. Leave the strip guys and try this place you'll love it too.

U0mvtiSm-h4D7sFNtqfnoA.text: I got the rib eye pho which was VERY needed after NYE clubbing. It really helped with my hangover lol. The broth was pretty good with good flavor. The service was a little slow though. Overall I liked it and would go again when I'm in town

cDafEL0ragkjPc_1AZOz4A.text: Oh my god! This place is so delicious! I heard of this place on Facebook and since I was going to be in town, I had to try this place out. Its such a great vibe and the customer service was amazing.  Customer service: even though we came before it opened, our server Jason C. greet us and served us. Jason was a great server. He was very friendly and a cool guy to talk to.   Food: Where do I even begin. The bone marrow soup was off the chain! Not only that I also got the lobster pho and it was amazing. The broth was so Delicious!  Eating here felt like my moms home cooking. Every pho spot I go to, does not compare to my moms home cooking but district one has exceeded my expectations.  I would highly recommend this place! I'm definitely coming back when I'm back in town.

GPcXxtc0fNIr2wueJzrBBw.text: Out with my date she wanted to eat here... Good food for me but salty soup for her unfortunately yikes but we let the server Tk knows about it and the rest is history other than that this place is pretty chill relaxing and dope music

ANClGHQzeUqHOLXmXzVLGQ.text: Had such a great experience at District One. We were lucky to get the best server, her name was Tootie, District One she needs a raise for her fantastic customer service! We initially went there for the Lobster Pho but with Tootie's recommendation we tried the ox tail pho and it was full of flavor. We also had raw oysters, snails, ox tail fried rice. Everything was delish! Maybe next time we can really try the lobster pho.

W9GuDSJlh9C3STHHaiqHow.text: You know Chef Kai knows whats up when you see the whole lobster in the pho!!!!  All that flavor from the lobster shell makes the broth even more rich and flavorful!  Our friends came to town so we brought them in for the lobster pho, big bone soup, and the coconut ice cream.  They have never been to a pho restaurant with such a hip concept nor a full bar! Hennessy with your pho?? WHY NOT??? when in Vegas... don't miss out!!

MZmsGeRYcL8T0HcfRLOl8Q.text: You never really see Vietnamese Asian fusion places, but with the 2nd generation of Vietnamese Americans growing up, you'll probably see more.  This place does a nice job of making classic Vietnamese dishes current. They've created a place that caters to the yuppy community in a cool and sleek place with also a gastropub vibe.   I wouldn't come here though for the pho straight up though. Like the pho was good, but I feel like this place is more palatable to introduce pho to Americans than it is as your go-to pho spot if you're a pho connosseiour like cough cough...I didn't spell connesousiour right and my spell check won't help because it's so off.   But this place is cousin's with one of the regular Pho spots so that makes it authentic right? And did you know restaurants can be related?   We got oxtail pho which was good. The oxtail was tender like it should be. The soup was good.  We also had the pork belly, which my sister really liked. And a steak salad which was good but awkward because the steak was flavorful and sauced and it seemed like it was just plopped onto some lettuce. I think they could refine that a bit more. Maybe less greasy for the steak?  I got the pork chop and short ribs plate with chinese sausage. That was my favorite obvi cause I ordered it. But sometimes at Viet places the pork chop is dry. This was not the case. For four bucks extra you can get pork chop and ribs and because i'm a baller (BALLA!) i got both. Well my parents paid that's why I got both. But the short ribs were great just like Koreans make. The chinese sausage was good.   So in my opinion I think come here for the other dishes besides the Pho.   A lot of people talk about this place and it has a "buzz" going on. Whatever that means. But my other friend from LA was there and took her co-workers from CES there. So it MUST be good. Nah but it is.

leba7nWndk4Na5LO1cnafg.text: Not a good choice for pescatarians. I wanted to try this place out because of the other great reviews but my choices were extremely limited.    PROS The service was great. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and sat immediately.  I liked the ambiance as well, nice dim lighting and a relaxing vibe.   CONS I was very limited on what I could eat but if you like red meats and oxtail dishes you may like this place.  My only options were pretty much the papaya salad and the fish tacos.  Fish tacos were super tiny and both were pretty forgettable, unfortunately.    This wasn't the worst place I've ever been because the service was great but would I go back again? Easy answer, no thanks!

xJuMUYfKtLr3XyOk28X7MA.text: The surf and turf pho is really good. As is the birds nest noodles.  The wings have really good flavor but they appeared to have some sort of batter on them which I don't prefer.  The garlic noodles are really good. Maybe a little oily but I added some of the fresh herbs that came with the crispy egg rolls and that was great. I was asked if I wanted to add anything to these. I added shrimp, I should have put vegetable too but they were really flavorful and chewy in the right way.

hwBg-BZ9vp294nrk9TKweA.text: I've been here twice! Love this place! Wish it was on the strip instead. My friends and I make a trip to Las Vegas about 2-3 times a year, we obviously stay on the strip and don't rent cars so we have to uber here. I'm docking one star for the slow service, it's been slow each time. But the food makes up for it for sure!   My faves: -Shaking beef with tomato rice (really flavorful) -Garlic noodle (so simple but so good, love all the garlic-ness) -Oxtail fried rice (order mine without onions)  Recently had their pho for the first time, tried the broth before seasoning it with your typical sriracha and housin sauce, it was yummy!  Going to have to say. . . Their lobster pho price is a bit steep. I know it says "Market Price", we definitely didn't ask how much it would be (assuming it would be like $28-$35) but when we got the bill, we were taken back and couldn't stop laughing. $49 for a bowl of lobster pho! Yes, the lobster was huge but I do think that's over priced. Maybe it's because lobster doesn't cost that much in WA (even the big ones), lolol. That was our first L (lose/loss) of the new year, hahaha. First and last time we order lobster pho, but will definitely order the ribeye pho and perhaps try the oxtail pho next time!

Y6iSNGnS3Knk5ApABpA1yA.text: Fantastic ox tail pho soup and ox tail fried rice! The ice cream in the freshly cut coconut was a delicious ending to an all around great dining experience! Quality ingredients. Atmosphere and service were spot on as well. As a lover of non-pretentious quality cuisine, District One gets two solid thumbs up!

LGu282mr-UIEXyR4nRLJBw.text: I have to say that place is great  There food is #1 IN LAS VEGAS  Will keep come over  And will recommend them always

tZuufUKH9h0Mqlese1mFuQ.text: Coming to Vegas on a business trip and my partner brought us to this unique restaurant. The servers were very attentive, the food was delicious, the price is very reasonable. I will be back.

vICleupMe8IffY0nnS5U0g.text: 5/28/17: DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU HAVE A BIG PARTY.  We had a party of 14 people.  The manager told us it would be a 45 minute wait.  We waited the 45 minutes and the manager told us it would be another 30 minutes if we wanted to be seated altogether.  He then seated half of our party and proceeded to tell us it would be another 30 minutes for the other half of our party.    The manager  blamed us and said that we should have been waiting inside (even though we were inside) to talk to him and that if we wanted to split our party WE should have told him, however, he did not give us this option when we first put our name down.  All while this was happening, the hostess was seating other parties that had come after us.    However this is all beside the point.  We were quoted a wait time of 45 minutes and there was no communication from the manager about the extended wait time.  The manager also did not even attempt to try to accommodate for our party.    Very disappointed in the lack of communication from the manager, as well as, how rudely the manager treated us.

j2fgsOxBgx15epoXxVY7_Q.text: Excellent food! If you like spicy this is your spot! The dessert were amazing...love the pandan creme brulee.

ioTYTfFF8TQKbk7C-jOWvA.text: Apparently, the menu changes because everything i wanted to order was no longer in the menu (razor clam, shrimp like hot n juicy). That's okay, bc it gives me a chance to try the daily special.  Tai snapper $20/lb: it was the fried snapper with papaya salad. The fish was flash fried and the flesh was sweet and juicy atop with house special sauce (similar to sweet and sour sauce).   Oxtail pho: Good job! It came with 2 generous oxtail which was well seasoned and tasty. It's amazing that the broth was not oily. The pho was hearty.   Fish taco: it was a bit fishy this time. It was better last time...  Coconut ice cream: 3 large scoops of coconut ice cream(infused with jelly and coconut flesh) display in a coconut. OMG, i looove this ice cream that i ate all 3 scoops. Seriously, cut it down to 2 scoops to make it more manageable to eat!  Redbean chocolate mouse: it's more of a dark chocolate mousse and it was really good. i didnt taste much of the red bean.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red bean and chocolate mousse
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. house special coconut ice cream with jelly and coconut flesh - 3 scoops!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 large oxtail with pho

oBm2XAF-BWfNcjKCVpHTPg.text: Everything was amazing.  Service, food, drinks.  Ok tail rice to die for.  The onions are chopped too big, but it's ok.  Soup, Carpaccio, and everything else was amazing.  Thank you

mMuJcAgLd7ppXLUFFIraEw.text: Ordered the lobster pho. It was not worth it for $50. Hells nah. It was like a kids meal size pho with a lobster. Don't fall for the lobster hype. Their oxtail is good tho.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t fall for the hype. This $49 lobster pho isn&#39;t worth it. Get the oxtail if you&#39;re cravin pho. It&#39;s the size of a kids meal pho

Dh4KKGRxK12IBVG3pBgFqA.text: Amazing!!! Foood was so good, my husband and I did not know where to go for our typical date night so we decided for a new place. Great place tobcheck out. Atmosphere is mellow, food delicious,  pho was to die for especially on a chilly night. Check it out

MT_iLKuln4KSZEV4F86-kA.text: - very good and quick service - depending on what you order the portions can be a good size. - ordered a few different items with my group and everything tasted very good.  - prices are fair

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DKA-Tz4LadnJsU_bDSO_Fg.text: We went yesterday for lunch. The vibe was great, reminded me a little of the boiling crab. The food was so and so. There's certain things that tasted better than others. We had both the steamed and fried pork belly buns, good... But I've had better. Their garlic noodles smelled so great but lacked a little flavor. My favorite dishes were definitely the fish tacos! Add a little hot sauce and it was amazing. They also stir fried crab in a black bean sauce for us, it wasn't on the menu but we had seen something similiar on their Yelp and had asked for it, nonetheless they delivered. A+ for accommodation! Great service, friendly, clean, and food came out in a timely matter.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly buns! We ordered steamed and fried.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos, on the appetizer menu. Loved it.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Noodles, has the garlic scent but lacks a little flavor.

wdU4lehZAQxhUY9hY1eFHg.text: I don't normally write reviews but it was really good that I felt compelled to write one. We got here around 2 pm on Labor Day weekend and it was packed; however, my bf and I were 7th on the list but since there were only 2 of us they asked if we could sit at the bar. It was completely fine with me since we were only intending to have a light meal.   Once we got seated at the bar, we were promptly greeted by 3 different bartenders and asked if they could bring us water. A couple minutes later, they asked if we would like some drinks. I wasn't going to drink so early, but their cocktail menu was so tempting I couldn't resist! I ended up getting the Vietnamese donkey which was their version of a Moscow Mule. Ugh! So delicious! Would come back here just for their drinks as all the other ones looked so enticing.   We ordered the Oxtail pho, spring rolls, and steak and eggs. Although the food took a little longer than expected, I understand it was a busy weekend and the restaurant was packed. The service, the quality of the food and drinks, as well as great atmosphere well made up for the slight wait.   Thank you District One! Will be back!

bU8JtYPn2gr1ArDbY9M8eA.text: Food you won't have anywhere else... whole snapper spring rolls?!?!  Where have you had that?  Not only that, they gave us a quick lesson on assembly.  Dip the rice wrapper in hot water, and start filling! I love customizing and fixing my own meals to my tastes.... so this dish worked for me. I've had a lot of wings in my life, but I like the way they fry and season theirs.   If you are into any sport, there are plenty of tv's and probably atleast one that you can request the "game" of your choice.  The drinks and bar area is nice, especially if you are solo or just a couple.   Another positive is they were very flexible with my reservation, which had 3 revisions.  I hate doing that, but they gladly accommodated.    Probably the best part is that our 8 other guests, who have never been here, completely loved the food too!

ZTocHtWl55OeTLvVeFTiNg.text: Asian Fusion with Vietnamese pho!! They serve very good pho with full bar!  Very lively atmosphere.  We went there on a Friday night.  It's a happening place.  They have many screens around the restaurant I'm sure we can request to watch any sport if we choose to.  Besides good pho there were many items that we shall try next visit.  We did order oxtail pho, mixed fried rice, raw oysters and other items with a glass of wine.  Pandan creme brulee for dessert. Loved everything about this place.  Check out their hand sink too.  You don't need to go inside the restroom to wash your hands .

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pandan crème brûlée
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw oysters serve on ice!

q4BEC7XFvhwK11eeqf5k0g.text: Been here twice now and I haven't been let down.  Do yourself a favor and order the wings and the belly buns. Hands down the most amazing iterations of these plates that I've ever had.  The Vietnamese Donkey is an amazing cocktail.  Service is on point, the staff is friendly, and they love to give you clean plates.  My kind of spot.  Also try the wok tossed clams. Be prepared for garlic overload but it's truly worth it.  Bathrooms are clean and the sinks to wash your hands are out of the bathroom. Much more sanitary.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wok tossed clams
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belly Buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass beef skewers and the Vietnamese Donkey

UNqSWiDkjDQk-tFCH9ZHXQ.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.  District One is one of those places where it's hit or miss depending on the wait staff, time of day, and luck.  The restaurant itself is very hip when you walk in and doesn't give off that usual Asian sit-down vibe like the other restaurants in the area.  District One has a feeling of hanging out, and should be a go-to Happy Hour spot for some of the food.  Drinks aren't cheap though, so keep that in mind.  I had the meatball pho, pork buns, and chicken wings.  Meatball pho was just ok.  I know I should have gone for one of their flagship oxtail or bone marrow phos, but I messed up - shame on me.  The chicken wings had a nice kick but were all in all ordinary Asian wings.  The pork buns were amazing.  The bun, the meat, the filling, all top notch.  Come during Happy Hour for a great deal and get a few orders of them.  The complaints are long; if it wasn't for the solid food and the ultimate finale of our situation, I would have given 2 stars for sure.  First off, after being immediately seated in an almost empty restaurant at about 5pm, the waiter took 10 minutes just to take our order.  He brought over a different beer than what we asked for and then when we placed our order, it took 40 minutes to come out, all at the same time, not staggered as appetizers and mains should be.  Apparently the kitchen gave our order to another table which just blows my mind because no way somebody ordered our exact dishes.  But the worst part was that no waiter came by to check up on us during this 40 minutes without food, even with empty beer up to that point.  We ultimately just packed our appetizers in to-go boxes straight away and only ate the pho at the restaurant because we were in a hurry.  The waitress comped both appetizers, which is nice, but still doesn't make up for the previous 45 minute meal experience.

Ig7csOOajJVR1PHtdgFh5A.text: We will most definately be back!!   Tonight was our 1st time dining @ District One. First off, the staff was polite and attentive, so they get an A on service! Now let's get to the food, oh man the food.. We had the wings to start, and that's some sweet and spicy yumminess right there. We would of gotten a 2nd order, but had to leave room for some of that good good, the pho! Now the broth was aromatic and flavorful.  Next time we're definitely going to try the lobster pho and pork belly buns! And the visit after that we'll try the snails. Lol I love lemon grass snails, yum yum in my tum!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JgiLTqZAMuVYOJG5aCCYcg.text: I was sad to learn that Cravin' Cajun had shut down and vowed to boycott District One right off the bat, like a pouty child actin a fool in my high chair.  Yet, after checking out the reviews and pictures on Yelp, I couldn't resist but to see what all the hubbub was about.    The dining set up is generally the same with minor accented tweaks here and there.  I was lured to this place initially because it didn't look like they took their "V" grade, turned it upside down and drew a line threw it for a fictitious "A" grade, unlike other Louisiana style seafood dumps.  Problem is, "the mob is fickled," and sad to say people sometimes are quick to jump on the bandwagon.  But enough about the old joint, it is obvious the new owners wanted to create their own niche.  Nevertheless, the hip doctor undoubtedly paid a visit to this place and modernized it with an industrial/urbanish twist with the decor, ambiance and music genre playlist.  Even much of the old staff is still here, although, I bird told me that the new owners include those from Pho Kim Long amongst other unknown benefactors.  I was hungry and was recommended to try the Mi Sate, as it looked quite filling considering that it is primarily peanut butter based.  It was sort of like Mi Quang, Kare Kare and sate stew had menage, producing a love child of savory goodness.  I added the grape leaf wrapped beef appetizers to switch things up as well.  I gotta say, the dishes are unique, bold and a nice eccentric version on Vietnamese cuisine that is practically absent through the entire city and I only hope for their success.    Best of all, Vy, who looks to be one of the head honcho-ess (?), gave word that they will be offering Nikka, Hibiki and Yamazaki Japanese whiskey along with other unique refreshments.  It is now a must that I come back with like minds.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What does the ox say?
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neo Bun bo hue
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef wrapped in leaves

BZMaufzeynhxOukrMhxZ5Q.text: The Oxtail Pho was wonderful!  At a reasonable price, the Oxtail Pho ($11.95) is LOADED with Oxtail bones in an oily, flavorful pho broth.  VERY GOOD!    Portion size was very fair as well!  And the meat was much more tender than most....this would be my favorite rendition to date!  I really wanted to try the Lobster Pho for around $27 (market price), but I am VERY happy I was able to try their Oxtail here!  Just gives me a reason to come back again :)  Service was quick and efficient, and the restaurant itself looked clean and inviting.  I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Papaya Salad ($7.95): Shrimp, Pork, Mint &amp; Roasted Peanut. Delicious! Loved the flavors here esp w/ the large shrimp!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow Braised Pork Belly in Coconut Juice ($8.95). This had lots of flavor and was fall apart tender.  Good!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Bone Soup ($9.95): Bone &amp; Marrow Soup. Also disappointing...broth didn&#39;t have much flavor by itself &amp; little marrow inside.

_c4pOhgVuORS9LQC9PvZsw.text: Went for the first time with my friend and daughter. I liked the layout and modernness of the restaurant. It was around lunch time when we stopped by, and even for edc weekend we were seated right away. Our host/server were both very nice, they smiled and were very friendly and was able to suggest. Went to wash my hands and it was interesting how there were sinks outside of the bathrooms. For myself I just wanted to wash my hands and my daughter needed to use the restrooms. Which were very clean and they didn't smell.  I had ordered the lobster pho, Spring rolls for my daughter. And oysters to share with my friend. He had ordered for himself the cube chopped beef with I believe garlic noodles and an egg on top. Also an appetizer of fried chicken. two Vietnamese coffees. And for desert, coconut ice cream. I think that's their only desert for now.  Lobster pho- the broth was good, but not great. I felt like it lacked flavor. The lobster was good too, I liked how they pick out the tail and claws for you. The noodles taste like any other pho noodle, it was not too soggy. However, that was it. It was just a boring bowl of lobster pho. the thought of it was like "Ooh..." and the taste was like "eh..", Nothing wow.  Spring rolls- I enjoyed the crunch they added in the Spring roll.  But I wish there were more meat and noodles, the greens took up more then half of what was inside. The sauce was ok. My daughter normally loves Spring rolls but this one she only ate half.  Beef w/ garlice noodles- noodles and beef were plain, barely much flavor. I felt so bad for my friend that ordered this, since he was from east coast and I wanted to take him to a restaurant that he would love. This dish didn't do it.   Oysters- yummy! I really enjoyed this and the sauces and flavors they added to the oysters. Would definitely order this again. Pretty small ones though.  Coconut ice cream inside fresh real coconuts. AMAZING. Never had anything like this before! coconut ice cream with I think green jello on the bottom! very creamy yumminess on top and nuts sprinkled as well. I very much enjoyed this desert and would come back for more. It was not too sweet for me and my friend and I thought it was just enough sweetness. Must try!  Disappointed in our main dishes, desert and oysters were great. I will come back because I want to try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved this!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and garlic noodles I think. Not worth trying
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho

7AEKN5C-JOlPGzPbRURzUw.text: Asian Fusion is putting it mildly at this fabulous Vietnamese out of the way restaurant.  Each food ordered had an unusual flavor of its own like no other. The grilled crab legs was so delicious that we ordered it again. The Oxtail Soup (Pho)with beef bones was full of rich flavor served with bean sprouts and Thai Basil toppings. Egg Rolls and Belly Buns which was braised Pork belly were excellent as well. Happy Hour is a great time to visit because that way you can sample more items. The wait staff was beyond exceptional. We will definitely be back when visiting again!

Y493NVF40b7gMEjZoLODjg.text: Went to try the lobster pho and oxtail pho. Both were a complete disappointment. Broth is super plain and bland. I world NOT recommend going there for the pho especially for the price. Not worth it.... Small hole in the wall joints are better!

r7iRhVKfBU6nOR3FM006zA.text: Awesome service and the oxtail fried rice! Delicious!!  Will be back for that lobster pho

bYfbpYL0oacbWVpVes4bJw.text: Vietnamese food with a twist !  SETTING:  Very modern restaurant.  Nice large wooden tables and booths. The decorations on the walls reminds me of seafood restaurants like boiling crab or crab hut, etc.  The waitress here is nice and very informative.  FOOD:  Vietnamese Iced Coffee $3.25 This is authentic Vietnamese iced coffee. The one where you have your coffee beans pressed on top in a metal filter that is placed on top of a cup. Then you mix it yourself with condensed milk. The flavor is a little bit stronger but it is delicious!  Oxtail Fries $11.95 HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!! I thought I wouldn't like the gravy because it looked very gelatinous, but it was actually very creamy and tasted like oxtail infused. There are bits and pieces of oxtail, but I do think that they need more meat. Otherwise, the fries are delicious!!  Pho Lobster $35 Never would I have thought that I would find a bowl of Pho costing $35 !! But it was pretty much worth the price. They give you a whole lobster! They even cut up all the meat for you so it's easier for you to eat and it won't get messy! The pho broth soup is good, but other then the lobster, its pretty plain. BUT the lobster tastes fresh and chunky.  Hue Spicy Beef Noodles $9.95  This is basically Bun Bo Hue, but named slightly differently by the way. The soup broth here has a strong distinct flavor... kind of like strong mint leaves. The broth wasn't spicy at all. This soup was ok. I've had a lot better elsewhere.  Overall, food here is good but there are not many options to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho $35
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries $11.95
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hue Spicy Beef Noodles $9.95

5z_RvFKB9bNh6YL64ABrqQ.text: My first attempt at District One Kitchen and Bar came after a somewhat drunken night when someone in our party became sick. So entirely that experience could not do the place justice. After the rave reviews I heard from this multi-Asian fused gem, I had to go back a few nights later to find out for myself. I'm sorry to say that I was totally disappointed.   The atmosphere of the restaurant was very dark, even early in the evening. Dark enough that some patrons needed their phone flashlights to see the menu. The overall feel is very hip, with age ranges between the late teens to early 30's, with decent but loud music playing in the background. There are a good number of raised booths surrounding the middle table areas. Parking can be difficult outside with a smaller sized lot and a good number of restaurants side by side. Table service is very slow, with the water always running empty.  Now to the food. The heavily raved oxtail fried rice was nothing spectacular. Rather, I caught myself grabbing whatever water was left and fried rice from another plate to combat how oily it was. I really wanted it to be good, but the flavor was uneventful. Our party had a couple variations of Pho, one more disappointing than the next. The rib eye steak was decent, but it cannot explain why the lobster pho was an absolute failure. The $40 pho was bland, with the lobster meat being tough and overcooked. Although it was visually pleasing, it was not good value at all. The best dish was their rice combo platter with short rib, pork chops, and Chinese sausage. Portions notwithstanding, a pretty solid dish overall with a good mix of robust spices and flavors. Do yourself a favor, keep the fried rice and skip the garlic noodles. We did not order anything from the bar.  This unfulfilling experience will keep me from venturing into District One Kitchen and Bar again.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho. Looks better than it tastes.

aaHgxw6r8gD2BToB13AWng.text: The menu has so many good options. I went with the pho oxtail, which consists of two big chunks of oxtail, noodles and broth.  The oxtail falls off the bone and is kind of delectable. The noodles are okay. The broth is very light and complemented with green onions and herbs. I would've liked it to have more complexity but it ultimately was satisfying.  The grilled Bok choi on the side was a great complement.  If I return, I would get the oxtail fried rice.  Service was great. There was no consistency to who served us but everyone was inviting, attentive and gracious. Can't ask for more from that standpoint.  There are a lot of TV's in this place so it's a sneaky good place to watch sports. Beware the TV's are small (seems like 40" or less).

fH2CEITRkcDbf5sCzKbiyA.text: Spot on service and extremely friendly staff. Very good quality food. The beef steak and eggs are yummy! Fast seating for lunch. All the staff were polite and smiles. We are very pleased with the food here. Clean and well kept. Casual atmosphere. Definitely returning next time for more. Thank you District One!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their signature dish :)

OsnvNfvVnpjnFklon1s-vg.text: randomly saw someone ig this place and since I was going to Vegas anyways, might as well try it!  good thing we came here during happy hour! I love cheaper food :)   - ox tail pho - the ox tail was pretty tender. pho was ok - serrano pepper wings - 50 cents during hh.  I thought these were okayy. not bad but kind of plain. the pepper wasn't too spicy so that was cool - oysters - $1 each during happy hour.  I think they were pretty good. fresh so that's good - yellowtail tacos - I like these!  I love the crunchy hard shell.  the fish was in this green sauce which I think went really well with it.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. serrano pepper wings. they&#39;re okayyy

_x8sBFY09lk1Dr_8mdXWJA.text: I travel enough that I try to eat at anywhere OTHER than where the tourists eat but, when local friends recommended what seemed like a Pho restaurant in a strip mall, I'll admit that I was skeptical.   The only thing that's "strip mall" about District One is the parking lot. The decor is modern, witty, fun. The music playlist is an eclectic mix of indie bands and classics. And the food tastes like it should be hand-served by a top-tier chef in a restaurant on the Vegas strip.  My wife ordered the Lobster Pho. She almost cancelled her order after finding out that it was served to look like a whole lobster (with head and tail on either side of the chopped lobster meat), but our server assured her that the head and tail would be discarded. Sans extremities, the pho was delicious.  My Steak and Eggs was amazing! Fried rice, white onion, over-easy egg. The only thing that distracted from the savory flavor of the bits of medium-rare beef was that my wife kept asking me to share.  We loved the sake flight and the extensive wine/beer/liquor list.  Though comfortably full, we felt compelled to taste the creme brulee and the coconut ice cream. Both were fantastic.   A whole wedding-party-full of folks arrive tomorrow night. We'll be recommending District One to every one of them.

F_15XCxBcCzR2Vox7361fw.text: Favourite Pho place in Vegas! My husband and I go here every time we come visit.  We have never been disappointed.  We always get the Oxtail Pho and the Big Bone.  These are both a must try dishes! The Big Bone makes the pho broth very rich and flavourful.  We also order a side of rice noodle with the Big Bone.  I have ordered the Lobster Pho and this was also very delicious.  It's about $35 .. Worth it to try.  Happy hour and reverse happy hour is our favourite time to go for the oysters!! How can you can beat half price oysters? Service is also very friendly and fast!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Bone! They look like dinosaur bones! So yummy
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho!! Devoured the whole thing!

b4iE971jikuPZCi0axPaAQ.text: This is just based off of what we've ordered on Nov 12th 2016. We've watched Munchies and thought, we gotta try this place out one day. Friends raved that this place is a must try, so we finally went.  Ordered one of their specials -Rice Rice Baby! = Lobster Fried Rice MP $50 - tasty, but we tasted the fried shrimp more than the lobster.  Overpriced.  I wouldn't order again. -Craving For Seafood? = House Special Oysters (12 pc) $21.99 - worth the price and very fresh and Ono!  I would order again. -Appetizers = District One Beef Carpaccio $12.99 - not bad.  I might order again. -Special for the day = snails (forgot price) - very gamy, gritty.  NOT A FAVORITE.  Not like escargot elsewhere.  Never order. -Appetizers = Belly Bun $7.99.  Okay.  We weren't suppose to order something we can get elsewhere, but i like braised pork belly and we can make better at home.  I wouldn't order again.  Nice workers.  We had two servers.  Younger guy and a little bit order gentlemen.  Never got asked for refills on our drinks, like the people that came after us.  But overall, this place is okay.  Not such a hype.  But they are apparently famous for their Pho.  So next time, if we get a chance to want to go back again, we will try their Pho.

NxlALPcOdL15LkdSq4ejfQ.text: I usually come here late at night for some grub.  The garlic serrano wings and garlic noodles are my usual order.  The lobster pho is excellent also, flavor as well as presentation.  I've taken numerous people here and we've ordered across the menu...everyone wants to come back and says why have you been holding out on me...definite Grub!

tXQxRq7PMXyimFmmqXthsQ.text: I might have accidentally found my favorite pho place here by pure chance! D1 has taken over Nem Nuong as my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  It looks like, food wise, a lot of the kinks have been ironed out since opening. Fortunately, I was able to come here during HH, and I can proclaim that D1 has one of the best food HH in town. I agree that the .50 cent chicken wings are a bit on the smaller size, but they are tossed in this awesome asian glaze that's loaded with these delicious roasted Serrano peppers. And DO get the beef carpaccio! It's all that and a bag of chips! Tender, meaty slices of raw beef tossed in this sweet and sour soy marinade..  Can you say heaven? I liked the mango salad, it was extremely bold with garlic and fish sauce that complimented the delicate ness of the mango and vegetables. Oh, and the oxtail fries? Better than Bachi. Game over.  Let's talk about the pho. Now, it's hard to find a good pho in Vegas. Let's keep it real. But D1 has the best one in town. The broth is very beefy, which I like. The rare beef is amazing, as well as the brisket. The bean sprouts were fresh and crisp, as well as the lime and thai basil. The best part about it was they substituted Serrano peppers instead of using jalepeno. Brilliant!  The food here is 5 stars in my opinion. What killed it for me was the service. Where was everyone? I know we came in a big group, but the place was empty, and they had 3 servers, and a couple bussers. Our water was rarely refilled, and we saw the servers just standing in a corner just goofing off with each other. Such a shame..,  This place has a talented kitchen, no doubts about that. But, they need better training and management in the front of the house. I was thinking about dropping this to 3 stars because of the bad service. The food is extraordinary... So I'll give em a pass. But fix it!! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai nam
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano wangs
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango salad

nMlKIRcjUoWA7_dnjNKDjA.text: Very interesting concept. Service was really fast. They really transform the Viet cuisine to the next level. Lots of options for you to share among a group if friends. I'll definitely come back!

0qmIWRKkL37zIgJqW4vKDw.text: Not your typical Vietnamese "pho" restaurant. This was a great place to relax, have a drink, watch a football game and eat good food. Parking was tricky as the lot was full when went for dinner around 7:00. Also, we opted for sitting at the bar since there was a wait for a table. The portions were on the larger side so a good deal for your $$.

_BYNKNfpbrGlmhyYR7Y-Ww.text: Food was 5 stars. Service was 4 stars but the food stole the show. Not one dish was bad.  If you want the bone broth soup, go early. We dined at 7 and they were out. But watching the diners lucky enough to get it, i can see why it is so popular! What a find! I would definitely come back to explore more of the menu.

e36abWwQ2O3gVn5jg7LPRA.text: My friends and I went to District One for the first time last week while in Vegas.  I was the one that suggested it but all my friends loved it after trying the food. I could not get over how delicious the oxtail fries were. And for my entree I ordered the lobster pho that yelpers were raving about, the lobster was cooked just perfect.  We all ordered something different to share and everything was phenomenal.  I am not a dessert person but the coconut dessert was amazing. It wasn't too sweet, but sweet enough to cure your sweet tooth. Something about that coconut dessert, once you start you can't stop.... Until you realize it's gone!

z-R-2E0msFcPhltkDE8Bog.text: Worth it! Food was amazing, flavors were great, portion sizes was just right. Had the Oxtail Pho. Daughter had Rice Combo Platter w/ Short Ribs. Fiancee had Claypot Chicken.  Oxtail: meat was so soft and tender,  you could suck the meat & gelatinous goodness off the bone easily. broth was flavorful and def fresh tasting.  Claypot: I was a little apprehensive that it would taste just like one thing.  But, it was done well, you can taste the components separately. Sauce wasn't over bearing to the rest of it. Although it doesn't say it on the menu, this does come with rice. Rice Combo: was tasty! Love eggs with Asian food. When you layer your bite with meat the Viet pickled carrot n daikon to use as a sponge for the fish sauce - yummy!  Definitely will visit this place again.... For sure will try the oxtail fries next time.

Nuv99wwlI7zR-Efw6owUqw.text: This was my second time coming to District One during the holidays.  I still really enjoy the Vietnamese beef carpaccio, the toppings and fresh flowers really make the dish.  The garlic serrano wings have a good after burn to them, just spicy enough to satisfy any cravings.  The garlic noodles are great, but beware you will definitely have garlic breath after enjoying these!

asFFTv-C3nm2x_wVQUL0_g.text: After a flight from Honolulu to L.A., then a 5  1/2 hour drive through L.A. afternoon traffic, I arrived in Las Vegas a little tired and a lot HUNGRY!  With only airline food and some on the road snacks (Cheetos and Jerky), I wanted something satisfying.  My long time friend who lived in Vegas 8 years ago met up with me and suggested we go to District 1.  It's in a strip mall on Jones Blvd. about 10 minutes west of the Las Vegas Strip.  The exterior is nice and the interior is comfortable and hip.  Large floor with a lot of seating and good friendly service greeted us.  They have a late happy hour and we were there at the right time.  On the menu, the Ox Tail Fried Rice caught my eye and I also decided to indulge a little with the happy hour special of a dozen Blue Point Oysters.  The Ox Tail Fried Rice was really good with lots or tender tasty shredded oxtail meat and the Blue Point Oysters were fresh, clean and got gulped down quicker than I could finish my beer.  The chill atmosphere and friendly service really stuck out for me here and I'm glad my Vegas guide made the suggestion (Thanks Trisha!!).  I'll definitely be back ... maybe even before I leave Las Vegas in a week.

9B0vRFFkvAnE-7LlU0-3RQ.text: What attracted me to District One and avoided District 9's drama altogether with Katniss? Lobster pho... duh.  Did we end up actually ordering this $60 sucker? Nope, but we did end up feasting on some pretty good New-American/bougie Vietnamese at this trendy restaurant off the Strip. It's a sports bar vs. Asian restaurant that is sure to satisfy your hunger needs.  My friends and I came during our recent Vegas trip since everyone was raving about how great the food is even if it's a bit pricier than other spots. My large group of eight ended up ordering a bunch of appetizers and mains for ourselves that were quite delicious.  Warning: their portion sizes here are fairly generous and you can really get full off an appetizer and maybe half a main!  We started off with their oxtail fries ($12) which came in a huge bowl with plenty of oxtail meat and a fried egg on top. You have to mix and mash all the ingredients in the bowl together to get the best effect. We ended up taking some home because there was no way we were finishing that bowl. We also got some wings to share and they were decent hot wings. Crispy and tender, and definitely curbed our cravings.  As for me, I went for the big boy bowl and got the "Big Bone Soup," ($18) which was essentially a large chunk of meaty bones with bone marrow. They do not play when it comes to the name- for the bowl is simply big. You cut off slices of flank from the bone and dig out the delicious bone marrow hidden inside. Simply amazing and incredibly filling.  The waitress convinced me to get a side bowl of pho noodles for $5 which you honestly don't need given how much food is in the soup.  District One was able to satisfy all of us and we left with big tummies ready to take on the rest of the day. If you want some good Asian with bomb portions, definitely check this spot out. As my friend would say though if you're considering just the pho: "get something you wouldn't find anywhere else, and would you really pay thaaat much for a bowl of pho?"  The choice is yours.

Pho wise, I had the pho tai nam with added meat balls. The balls were a fav and had a good amount of chew. Portion sizes were generous and there was so much meat!   Bonus - this place is perfect if R&B is your jam. Their playlist was on point.

vGI7k_69R4H7zCFPTUzCjw.text: Useful Tip: Walk-In Sign In Ask Questions Later  After waiting fifteen minutes a hostess inquired if I signed in!  Of course I didn't which resulted in an additional 10 minutes wait.   Food: Baby Bok Choi $8.99 -The wok fried bok choi with garlic was a nice size portion and I scarfed down the entire bowl. If your into greens you will not be disappointed. YellowTail Tacos $10.99 -SMALL PLATE The yellow tail sashimi tacos are small but full of flavor and extremely delicious. I highly recommend ordering your own portion you will not want to share! Garlic Noodle $7.99 + $3 Shrimp -The garlic noddle was a bit on the oily side but tolerable. The additional shrimp were nicely sized. Another great dish if your about that noods life! Shrub Beverage $5 -This vinegar based drink was terrible after waiting nearly 20 minutes for it.  Creme Brulee $7.99 COMP  - This green tea dessert was nice and light. Our server voluntarily compd our dessert due to the slow service without us mentioning anything and I appreciated the goodwill gesture.  I love asian food and I'll definitely return to this hip little spot with a reservation.  Bill $42+ Tip

acKGLboUGbtjkmW79srYLg.text: The food here is a bit hit or miss sometimes, but in general, it's decent enough that I'd definitely come back. People have told me that the lobster pho is not very great and wasn't worth the price at all. So I haven't personally tried it yet, but I definitely will some time in the future because curiosity kills the cat and why not!   We've had oxtail fries which not only smelled amazing but also tasted delicious between the crunch on the fries and the flavorful meat. Oxtail fried rice was also delicious but it wasn't particularly memorable. I personally did not find the coconut pork belly flavor to be good, but that's just personal preference. The meat is very juicy though!  With pho options, rib eye meat was absolutely tender and I love that they give a mountain of meat in each bowl, but the flank steak meat was horrible. I thought my jaws were going to snap with those tough meats. And if you're up for tearing through bones and carving out all the meat and meat juices from those bones, I think the big bone soup makes a great meal where I enjoy my delicious struggles by the corner of the table.

pM2F8T_FeG9w4p_wgIojSQ.text: Absolutely delicious! The surf and turf pho--who would have thought those flavors went so well together???  Everything we got was great and not too overpriced. Worth the drive

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1f2LXoXpR84JiQG9g3RA9A.text: After seeing this place all over the place, I had to go and try it out! I went on a Sunday, around lunchtime and did not wait more than 20 minutes. My first impression of the restaurant is that it looked like a modern, hip joint-almost looks like all the cajun restaurants in the bay area. lol  We mainly came for the lobster pho but noticed the garlic lobster noodle on the menu and of course had to order that as well.   For refreshments, Matcha Thai Tea. Let me tell you-I never knew matcha and thai tea would make such a great combination. At first sip, it was just the tastiest, milk tea type of drink I EVER had. I was torn between gulfing it down in one sip, or slow, small sips to make it last. Definitely a must-try if you visit this place.  The Lobster Garlic noodles came first and OH EM GEE. Presentation wise, it didnt look as pretty as the lobster pho, with the lobster nicely layed out to retain its "body shape" it looked like it was tossed together with the garlic noodles-therefore, the pic did not do this plate justice.  It was absolutely the best garlic noodle I've ever had, and to add lobster??? Exquisite!   The Lobster to noodle, to garlic ratio, was just on point. It was full of flavor with the right chewy noodle bounce that I prefer my noodles to taste. In all honesty, I probably scarfed it down in less than 5 minutes.   Lets talk about the Lobster Pho. I was really excited to try it because one, I love pho, and two, I love lobster. GREAT combination in my opinion lol. Sadly, it didnt do it for me. The broth was great, but it was just that, it tasted as if you are eating a regular bowl of pho, and some lobster was thrown in. I didnt taste any lobster flavor in the broth, nor did the lobster have any distinguishable flavor. I wouldnt order if I came back.  And maybe I shouldn't have had the garlic noodle before the pho. The garlic noodle was just bursting with flavor and I was expecting the same for the pho.   I would give the pho a second try, but I am so disgustingly in love with the garlic noodle pho, that I would honestly just order that when I come back.

9AQnzmnM032a-PoQt8cztg.text: Came here on a recommendation.   The location is off the strip, but not too far. I ended up taken the bus.  Sat at the bar and ordered the lobster pho. The broth was good and the portion size was perfect.   There is plenty of seating and if great for groups.  This place has a lot of other interesting items that I'd like to try next time I visit.  Highly recommend if you are looking for something different.

VKV7mSwc1R4ZGCRI_Gvh-Q.text: Oh my good gawd! One of my best meals in Vegas. Came here on a Sunday night. They do take reservations so be sure to make one just in case cause it can get busy.  District One is located in a strip mall. I've dined at neighboring restaurants   and the parking lot gets very busy so be patient. The decor is modern looking and glad the tables are spread apart. Great for larger groups too.   We were a party of 5. Our table was set and ready when we walked in.  Anna was our server and she was very nice and kind. She always made sure we were good.  5 Stars for her service. I believe she is the lead and I can see why. After we ordered our dishes,  I decided to add another order of wings. There was a delay and we never got it which was fine because we had to leave. She took it off of our bill. She handled the mishap very well.   Food: Fish Sauce Chicken Wings Oxtail Fried Rice Whole Fried Red Snapper  Garlic Noodles Grilled Squid Washed down with a glass of Crown Royal.   I will say every dish was amazing except for the grilled squid. The wings were perfectly cooked and if you are sensitive to fish sauce then I wouldn't recommend this dish. But for me it was the best. I've also had my share of garlic noodles and this is by far the best I've ever had.  The oxtail fried rice was also as equally delicious.    Overall, a great redemption meal.  I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are wanting different flavors to add to your palete.

CmuPgLHDR1JXbCySwLGSPQ.text: I've been wanting to check this place out for a while now and being from Orange County where pho places are plenty, I was really curious whether this place would be all hyped or genuinely tasty.   My party of 4 arrived on Sunday at noon and luckily for us we did not have to wait. The restaurant was already mostly filled and during the entire time we dined, it was consistently busy so I can only imagine you will have to wait during rush hours or holidays.   I ordered the oxtail pho for myself and we all shared garlic wings, spring rolls, and house special oysters. I'm happy to announce that the pho is delicious. The oxtail just melts in your mouth and much to my surprise, the broth was tasty as well. The garlic wings had just the right amount of kick and was so crispy- just how I like it. The house special oysters had little bits of caviar and ponzu sauce- delish as well! The spring rolls wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything spectacular. I would pass on that next time. What I really like about this restaurant is they have a great selection of food so there's something for everyone.   Now I have 2 cons for this place. The first is I feel they are understaffed. While our server did his best to be attentive you can tell he was overwhelm as was some of the other servers I saw running around. They were way too busy to have that little amount of workers. The second thing is while the pho was delicious, I believe it is overpriced. A bowl of oxtail pho is $15.99. The bone marrow soup (keep in mind no noodles, just soup) will cost you $24. Bone marrow is actually quite cheap lol.   But all in all I'd still come back to try other stuff they have on their menu. Definitely worth checking out, folks!

Pelep1y4O_zJNOJpYKbg1g.text: My fiance and I ordered papaya salad, ribeye Pho and the chicken wings. I asked the waiter to bring out the food all at once so my fiance and I could share.   The papaya salad was little on the saltier side and needed more acidic flavors. I finished it nonetheless given it was on the pricey side.   Our waiter came back 20 mins later and about to clear our table when we told him we haven't gotten our entrees yet. He seemed surprised and went to check on our food.   My fiance's pho came out 10 mins later and my wings, no where to be found.  30 mins later and still no wings. We asked him to box it up for me and our server was kind enough to take the wings off our tab given the situation.   I tried the wings at my hotel and found it to be spicy but still delicious. The wings had more of a dry rub seasoning. I wouldn't recommend ordering them if you're into saucy wings.   The service was slow during a time when the restaurant wasn't as busy. Food could be better and is slightly overpriced in my opinion.

9QIEJbw-2R9ELy7crNE1jw.text: Okay, so I've been back to district one and last night exceeded my expectations. Our server Indira most likely was the reason we had such a great time. She was quick at seating us, super friendly, helpful with the menu, and also very knowledgeable with answering all of our questions! The food was very delicious this time around and I really enjoyed our dinner!  Blue point oysters and the daily special oysters were excellent. The pho tai very tasty and the meat super soft. The chicken wings were cooked this time and had a spicy kick to them. Oxtail fries were crispy and had a lot of flavor/ meat on them. The pork buns were absolutely delicious. And the coconut ice cream dessert was a treat!  Everything came out pretty quickly and HOT which is great.  Overall I really enjoyed district one and hope that it continues to be that way. We left with full stomachs and happy faces. :-)

czQoxsvyrZnFJdn6RGSFWw.text: 3.5 stars This is one of my friends go to places when visiting Vegas which is what brought us here.  They always get the oxtail Pho and the coconut pork belly.  I'm not really a fan of Pho so i got the ox tail fried rice ($15.99) and the coconut pork belly ($12.99).  We came a little after 6 for happy hour, which used to be until 7 but now is only till 6; They recently changed it.  The ox tail fried rice came with an egg on top, it was good but not overly special that i'd go out of my way for.  My friend says the Coconut pork belly is "Bomb!"  It was very tender from being braised for a long time and comes with a runny soft boiled egg.  I didnt taste any coconut, and honestly i think mine taste better!  But I'm also a good cook.  The soft boiled egg was also kinda cold in the center.  So yes it's very tender, so i could see why he likes it so much.  My friends got the Rib Eye Pho ($10.99) They though it was a good fancy version of Pho but the portion was kinda small.  They also have other fancy Pho creations like alaskan king crab Pho, Lobster, Fried Whole fish, surf and turf Pho and other fancy creations like that.  Service was really friendly and attentive the place is kinda hipsterish, i could see it as a place that chefs and people in the industry would hang out after THEY got off of work.  Its a cool, hip place with good food and service.  A nice modern twist on Vietnamese food.
