7uGRuACg1xnIARimT9M-3w.text: Happy hours review:  We went to district one almost once a week for their happy hours.    They have quite a few delicious items in their happy hours menu.  My fav are their jalapeno wings, papaya salad, beef carpaccio, etc.  My hubby loves their oysters.  Sometimes the wings could be overly fried, but the staffs were very nice about it and they fixed it for us.  I'm ok with the oysters but my hubby loves it.  Depends how picky you are with the oysters.  Honestly I only eat the fresh caught oysters such as San Francisco Bay or Seattle's.  Once u ate the best, it's hard to go back.    My hubby really enjoys their IPA selection beer, sculpin is his fav.  I'm watching my carbs so my new fav drinks is Jameson shot.    We have been taking so many out of town friends to this place, it became their must go place during Las Vegas trip.  They never disappointed us.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour papaya salad
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour fish taco
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bun

y02q9Ssf54sTMuyNowPIcg.text: This has been a spot I've been wanting to try because of their lobster pho. For $49.00 a bowl, I was hoping more of a "pizzazz" with some sort of seafood flavored broth or some sort of butter soy sauce on the side (I'm just making something up), but it was just a steamed lobster carefully broken down for easy eating. The lobster was still delicious to eat and super easy to pick from it. It's an experience I had to try at least once.   The oxtail fries were delicious! It's a cool take on poutine with gravy drenched over the fries and ox tail sprinkled across it. The fried egg completed the dish for me!   My favorite of the night was the calamari! It's huge and the spicy aioli that you dip it in is to DIE for. The tentacles are my favorite, but the body is softer and less chewy.   The spring rolls were great! There's s crunchy and surprising bite inside each roll!   The oxtail fried rice was a little bland, but after a little bit of salt, it tasted better.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo vien (Vietnamese meatball) pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries

FKH6vLnzHrD_mgiKc7kECA.text: TLDR: Good food, spotty service. Good spring rolls with a crispy egg roll inside. Clean veggies.Tendon pho has tiny tendon chunks. Wanting for more noodles.  Got the spring rolls, sea snails and two beef phos. Spring rolls were great. Note that they have a fried egg roll inside which I've never had in California. Maybe it's a Las Vegas thing? Not sure.  Sea snails are HUGE. I was expecting the small ones. Beware acquired taste. It didn't really taste like my memory of periwinkle snails nor escargot. The broth was flavorful though and they give 12 snails, which is PLENTY. Pho broth was deep but a little cloudy. A lot of veggies and they were very clean. They give a lot of beef but the tendon pho I got had little tiny chunks of tendon, not like the big chunks I was used to and expecting. Only wish there was a little more noodles and this is coming from a small bowl eater.   Spotty service - our server was great until she left and left us hanging waiting for the check.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea snails
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp spring rolls

rUFBHS9HGFBwMtWOWB1sNA.text: What are the big bone soup and the oxtail fried rice. The big bone soup is similar to oxtail soup we have in Hawaii except the bones are much larger and there are served with the marrow in them. However I would still be hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big bone soup on the left and oxtail fried rice on the right

PVaJ81apnk40hZHcapfOcw.text: Ok people, this place is pho real legit. Best pho I've ever had...pho-gettaboutit! Had the Vietnamese coffee with Henessey...so good! Ordered green papaya salad to start for our vege quota, belly buns which were delicious, big bone soup, which was huge but the broth was so flavourful, and the star of the meal, the pho ox tail. Broth is simply amazing. Not even going to try to describe it. I normally drink some of the broth when I have pho, but with the ox tail pho I drank every last drop.  Will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone. A good, hot steaming bowl of pho is like a balm to your soul...must try!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green papaya salad
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho ox tail
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belly bao

zISbnRXqbt3IXJWUS7Bzig.text: My party stopped by on a Friday night about a hour before closing. The staff was friendly and attentive. I only was able to try the oxtail fried rice, but it was one of the best fried rice dishes I've ever had. My buddy liked his so much he ordered some to take back to San Diego with him.   I also had an old fashioned which was perfectly balanced. Not too strong, but not too sweet. It was nice getting off the strip and experiencing another side to Las Vegas. I'd highly recommend this place, awesome vibe and the menu looks incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice is sooooo good
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H1yvoYrX45H2_NyP86rdRA.text: Stopped in to this restaurant late at night. Interesting concept it's a Vietnamese fusion and tapas sports bar. Food tasted decent.   We ordered: edamame (spicy garlic add $1.50 more);  crispy egg rolls - yummy  served with greens and lettuce for you to wrap and eat. Rolls had a nice crunch texture.  Lobster  pho - the presentation was full on with the entire . My fiend orders it and they thought it was quite tasty.  Pho tai - decent the meat was tender Pork bone soup - this doesn't come with noodles. If you want noodles you have to add $5. Not sure if it's worth adding for that price.  Fresh young coconut  mojito - never had one of these but it was super refreshing and very  tasty.   Towards the end we were all curious how much the lobster pho was going to price out. We all threw in guesstimate: 1. $31 and under 2. $32 3. Over $36. When the bill came it was $50 market price.   The pricing for all the other food matches to taste and portion. The only one that was steep was the  pho. However I think it's worth to try if you haven't before.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh coconut  mojito
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone  marrow soup

cMoBhSgsDDj1XgX2XoYZcQ.text: I've been on the hunt for a good oxtail pho ever since moving here from Southern California... and I have FINALLY found a place that is comparable!  -Oxtail pho was delish. The broth had good flavor and the meat was super tender. My only complaint would be there wasn't much meat, but what was there was really good! -Lobster fried rice was okay... not worth the $49. The waiter told us there would be 1.5 lbs of lobster in there, and although I know the shell weighs a good chunk of that 1.5 lbs, I still expected there to be more meat for that price. -Egg rolls were suuper crispy, crunchy, and yummy! Smaller than usual, but tasted better than most places. I'm all about a good crunch factor. -Speaking of crunch factor, the beef carpaccio was by far my favorite dish due to the flavors, tenderness, and crunch factor they added to the dish! The meat had a buttery texture from the sauces and melts in your mouth. *drool* -Service was great. -Ambiance was very casual and not that trendy like most places around Chinatown, but still nice for a casual night out with a group of friends or dinner date.  Definitely will be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster fried rice--Not worth your $49. Not that much meat nor rice.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho--VERY good but not much meat! Very tender.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls were yummy

R8cPXijthBl06cC1s7Ugew.text: Alright - wow. The transition at District One from the time it has opened to where it has now is amazing. I have seen the menu evolve over time and I can officially vouch that the menu is now FULL of hitters.  Surf & turf pho - so worth the hype at $35(?) - the soup definitely has that seafood flavor but is not too salty Bun bo hue - spicy but keeps you wanting more. Oxtail pho - honestly... the meat was so tender and I forced my boyfriend to halfway switch with me so I could finish his. Sea snails - I admit - I was a first timer but they are SO GOOD. My dad was also a huge fan and also worth the MP.  I have had so many items here from the squid (spicy & delicious) to the pork belly in coconut (also bomb) and I would say that where District One is at now with their menu is perfect. The food is SO good, it's consistent, and priced extremely reasonably.  I will admit that there was a time that I feel like they were losing their touch but after this last experience, I can truly state that they have reclaimed the throne. Service was great - our server & busser were on it & our water glasses were never empty. The food was fresh & everyone around us seemed just as satisfied as we were.  I highly recommend stopping in for any type of meal whether it's to recover from a hangover or you just want to have a chill dinner. Yes - the price for a surf & turf pho is more expensive but you definitely pay for what you get and what you get is quality & food coma. Can't wait to come back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf &amp; turf pho

xg4zB9mK5WMfYFdQDTBOhQ.text: Ok, I'll start off this review with a warning: when I came here I was drunk off my mind LOL That being said, I had just the regular pho and it was amazing. Flavor was very well balance and simple, exactly how pho should taste like. The service was also very good and attentive. Again, I was very drunk at that time and so I am very willing to go back sober and actually try their menu more. If I find it subpar then I'd edit this review.

688wgZ9muh8hvHLsDwNaWA.text: Our server TK has been GREAT as usual.   Sunday night around 9:40PM I came down to a 60-70% occupied D1 with zero to little seat waiting time with my good friend from high school whom has only been here once which was years ago so I ordered a bit of everything that I thought would savor our tastebuds.   We ordered around 4 appetizers, 2 full entrees, 2 desserts & 2 iced matcha Thai teas which was totally more than what 2 average sized human beings can devour, BUT with ZERO regrets as all the food came out fast, fresh & delicious. I now have some delicious left overs for lunch tomorrow :^)  Our service was consistent as TK, Corey & a female server with glasses continually checked up on our status to make sure we were doing good. All in all, the atmosphere, food & music vibes were great as always!   Til next time D1!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts - Coconut Ice cream - Coconut infused crème brûlée

AnlRsXJVhScwIroW0Hdarw.text: Best fried rice I have ever had! Oxtail fried rice. Really great! The pork belly buns were really good too!

uZQ47Hm-5ZBVvO6Dfjox7Q.text: Incredible Pho joint in the Chinatown district of Las Vegas. This place lifts the level of your everyday Pho. If you go to Vegas get off the strip and try this place. I typically rate Pho by the broth and the broth here is so flavorful. It just takes all the ingredients of whatever soup you order to another dimension. Will come here again on my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open floor plan. Lots of monitors and cool music.

_R1zQVLoJ1C-F7rbHRY_wQ.text: Being Vietnamese myself, this is honestly my new favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  It has a modern look, and nice modern menu to go along with it.  I went here with my wife, 1 year old, and mom.  The service for all of us was superb, even for my child.  We had the Pork Belly Buns, Ox Tail Pho, "Steak and Eggs", and the Slow Braised Pork.  The Ox Tail Pho here is amazing, definitely bang for your buck.  The meat on the tail is perfect, and the amount of noodles they give is the perfect amount.  All Vietnamese places in Vegas usually give a tiny amount.  The Pork Belly Buns were delicious.  The steak and eggs were perfectly made, the steaks were nicely marinated.  The Slow Braised Pork is nice and soft.  The sauce is perfect, and loved the way the egg was cooked.   We will definitely be back!

8m_F0OAAFxyBxggS020x2w.text: Came here two days in a row!  I have a soft spot for the pho with rib eye.  My goodness, melts in your mouth.  The cornish hen, the pork chop, everything I've had is spot on.  You can't go wrong here.  The servers are so nice, the prices are really low, I'm coming back.  Plus they have ice coffee... I'm sold!

DlfgS4GfO1Dh1IMymhZbCg.text: You would think the waitress would let you know the sub par dish you order off the specials is $49 since no price is shown on her dry erase board. You would think! Over priced China town pho & more. There's 6 better spots within a square mile of this place.

n2CFnZb1otWA9A-6SLafDA.text: It isn't regularly on the menu but the sea bass sashimi style with their papaya salad was the best.  Shrimp skewers ok fish tacos good. Read all the reviews about the ox tail pho. It was good but I guess it was the hype. The highlight was the real coconut juice wow. And the coconut ice cream was good too. The quality is good and I want to try it again

rC9rfXTAzuo3IjHeejfBJA.text: I was recommended by some acquaintances for this restaurant and I would have to say it is overall just.... OK.... but not something very specail  You walk in here and it is definitely a modern vietnamese fusion restaurant that attracts mainly the younger crowd with their style and taste of their dining room. I do like it, im 25 years old, but personally its not what I expect when I like some Vietnamese food, would rather have some average spot with no style serv me some good flavorful pho.   For their food, most yelpers here probably will not agree, they probably had an off day but I had the Ox tail pho and it was just mediocre. Some of us has the same thing, and others had some appitizers and other kinds of pho, I forgot which ones.   What I was amazed from my pho was the oxtail itself. two giant pieces of ox tail thats probably enough to feed a lion, fell right off the bone as im picking and eating it. was very easy to eat it. Though the broth with the pho, completely bland to me. When I have Vietnamese food in boston, the broth is usually at its bold flavors in restaurants I go to, but this one was just so disappointing to me.   My mother also had pho, I dont know what its called but its just simple slices of meat, but she didnt eat any because it looked like it was all fat. Im aware prime brisket is 50% fat but this seem to be 75%. meh...  Also had some appitizers, soft shell crab was pretty good, pork belly bun was as well, but we had the leaf wrapped beef, tasted bland as well.   For their service, definitely on point. I was with embarassing asian elders who doesnt know the vibe of respect of talking too loud and sounding rude all the time. the server I had was definitely cooperating and it was great, it didnt seem she was bothered. We got everything we ordered and such.  For the money, its just okay, I can pay $15 for ox tail pho, and I would definitely try lobster because it's defintiely something new. but for now, I would have to give this 3 stars for just being a mediocre place. hope they do something about the broth though

J-eaylKGpMIV8HtHo6sCmQ.text: Its my first time here and like its a good place .. The fresh spring roll has a crunchy thing so kinda taste weird coz I never had that. But the rest of the good we ordered was good, the server was nice and stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xzRft6WyTCRqxkym2HBfRQ.text: People: service is okay.  The staff doesn't anticipate needs very well and it does not feel warm.  Maybe some training and exercises in smiling.   Product: Come here for the appetizers, specifically the belly buns (steamed, avoid the fried) and the egg rolls.  The red rice is bland; tastes like steamed rice with a packet of ketchup.

Q-76h4GFih5cGkujavm3Jg.text: Last month, we saw an article in the local Vegas restaurant review.  It gave it rave reviews.  So, we decided to try it out.  Since that review, we have returned 4 times!  Yes, the place is awesome.  And, we wanted to make sure that we tried all the dishes.  The food is rather unique and quality is great.  Here is our review:  1.  Service - Excellent.  I have no idea why some reviews are negative.  Every time we are there, there are usually 2-3 people waiting on us.  They properly fill our drinks, ensure that our finished plates are removed, and always ask if we need anything else.  In addition, the manager comes around and checks to see how everything is going.  Honestly, usually, services at Viet and/or Chinese restaurants are very subpar.  However, we think District One's staff and service are exceptional.  2.  Atmosphere -- it is a bar.  I think it is laid out quite nicely and not too noisy.  Only issue that I have are the steps going up to the next level.  If people don't watch their step, they can have an awful spill.  Maybe, they can install a little ramp or something... Other than that, it is fine.  3.  Food - absolutely amazing!  Here are our recommendations from our 4 visits:  a.  Appetizers -- usually, we order from the day's special.        Here are the appetizers that we totally enjoyed:  - Razor Clams -- very good, tender, and flavorful (note: this is our favorite appetizer)  - Snails -- surprisingly, this was HUGE!    - Shaken Beef Salad -- is one of my favorite dishes.  Greens checked!  - Taco Talapia  - Roasted Squid       Here are the appetizers that we think are "okay"  - Pork Belly cooked in coconut.. it was a little bit too "fatty".  :)  I enjoyed it, but the wife stayed away due to the amount of fat on the meat.   - Pork Belly Buns (same as above) - Scallops - I was a bit disappointed.  Scallops are usually more plump.  The sauce actually overwhelmed the scallops. - Oxtail loco-moco something... Hawaiian style -- this was not good  b.  Entrees - Lobster Pho -- okay.. so, it is a bit pricey.. think we paid $30.  But, oh my, this was so good and worth it.  We loved this dish.  Pho was very flavorful and one dish could be shared with 3 people!  So, it even out about $10 bucks person.  Love the presentation!! - Lobster with Noodles.  again, this was a bit pricey -- about $70.  I think this was cooked in some tamarind sauce and served over noodles.  Personally, I thought this was good, but not great.  I rather have it served over fried rice.   - 5 Spice Chicken w/ side of yellow rice.   Very good dish.  Love the spices and the chicken! - Oxtail Fried Rice (unlike the Loco Moco), we enjoyed this dish.  Note:  next time, we will try the other pho dishes...    c.  Dessert (there is only one on the menu) Nothing beats the Vanilla ice cream w/ peanuts served on a coconut "meat" shell.  It serves 2; unless, you really have a sweet tooth.  My family love this part of the meal!  Overall, we love this place.  Service is great, food is awesome, and the price is reasonable.  This is definitely now one of our favorite places.    Cheers!

nFLHcYA7RW7Xb-i0A7VQIQ.text: All I have is say is "WOW!!" This place is absolutely amazing. From the service to the cute decor and.. The food! Omg the food. So good! Was not expecting the different types of flavors and dishes that this place had to offer. Definitely not your typical Vietnamese restaurant that you find in china town. I want to say it's more of an Asain fusion with a primary focus on Vietnamese style cooking/flavors. My group and I ended up ordering family style which I felt was the best way to try more of the dishes because the menu had so many options to offer! Everything sounded so tasty!   There wasn't a single dish that we didn't enjoy, but I highly recommend the shaken beef salad, pork belly with boiled egg, beef tacos (my favorite!! Not on the menu), steak and eggs and Ox tail pho. Hands down best pho I've ever had. I usually have to add hoisen sauce to enhance the flavor but this was perfect the way it came. The food was so flavorful and the quality was perfect. The steak was so tender, blew my mind away!  If you're around the area this is definitely a place to check out. You won't be disappointed:) I know my friends and I will be returning a visit real soon

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy bird nest noodle

phOmHD9_rLFomA7soC3Vng.text: This is the only place I know where you can get lobster pho. And it is delicious and large. It's worth the $30  The oxtail loco moco- my husband wanted me to put that it was superb.    Customer service was a 5 star.   my 2 daughters shared a pho. They ate it all in about 5 min. So our lovely waitress asked if we would like to order extra noodles. We said yes. It only came out to an additional 1.50!! So that was awesome

1O9dAt9tF3vpYj-Ba9mQ4g.text: Holy food! Came here because Chada Thai had 30 min wait with 25% occupancy. I guess they had reservations lined up but decide to come here since it was right next door and I was starving. Had a bunch of different things from the steak n eggs to fresh oysters. All were ridiculously good. Server was friendly and had a ton of info.  Loved it all. I'll come here from now on.

qAB7A_s7iixkBNVFdH37ug.text: The pho was lackluster but the spring roll was very interesting. It was fresh and they added fried onions or something in the middle to give it a unique taste.  Also the waitress was very cute, but don't tell my gf I said that.

9PreoOvs-TsmPqbrH3INuw.text: When you eat out enough you know when you have found a gem of a place to eat. And my family have found one that we hate to let others know as we want it all to ourselves. However since I've discover many a place from yelp I can let this one to the public too. District 1 an Vietnamese inspired fusion restaurant located just North East on Jones and Spring mtn.  As soon as you enter the place you realize you will have a pleasant time. Very welcoming atmosphere and not too loud on the decorations. The wait staff are very pleasant and since it's not "grand opening" yet you are bound to be seated pretty soon.  PRO's:: Plenty of TV 's to watch anything.  Music not too loud which is always good  Fast food preparations  Fresh food and moderately priced Crazy Japanese Whisky selection ( a few that you will not find in the States. ) Draft beer selection is pretty impressive for a non gaming establishment  Liquor selection is great , high end alcoholic favorites that I will not able to afford lol and less expensive one for working class. Lol.  They even have a Sake on tap " how ridiculous is that ".  I've spoken to the owner and requested they carry Carlsberg ( now am not a fool and know most times owners don't give a damn unless am spending crazy amounts of money here,... But to my amazement the next time I came here. Guess what. my beer ) I felt the love and it's now my fav place to chill and try their tapas style menu and sip on chilled beer and stare at the expensive liquor. Lol.  Am not much of a sea food person but my wife swears that their selection is fresh and loves the fish tacos / razor clams/ lobster pho/ and Dungeoneous crabs. The list can go on but I'd bore everyone. So go child this gem of a place and you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LLBJvio0Zrp0AST0vsqpEQ.text: This place is D bom!!!! The lobster pho, oxtail fried rice, and coconut ice cream for dessert. It's a "must go to" restaurant in Vegas or you never been to Vegas......  service is excellent and price is inexpensive considering the quality and amount of food you are getting. Love this place. Never missed everything we visit Vegas.

UcBJrncwfqj63u-z1E8Flw.text: So far one of the best customer service I have had in a while. Everyone is pretty friendly and helpful, they make sure you are comfortable. The food is pretty good different compared to other places. Highly recommended especially if you like seafood.    Everything you eat will be flavorful its like a party in your mouth.  The place is big so it is good for big parties. Some of my favorites are the  Oyster  Pork belly bun  Steak and eggs  Oxtail pho  Slow braised pork belly in coconut juice Coconut mojito ( verry good!) must try  Best of all the big bone soup this a must as well   The price is also decent considering how good the food is. Typically don't write reviews  unless the service is really bad or if I had a really good experience. With all that said Kudos to the staff for such wonderful customer service please do keep it up because for sure my friends and I will be a regular. :)  I love that they are open till 4 am on the weekends.

FWVCqeoLdzUZfv2trTE2wQ.text: The yellowtail mini tacos (3) are definitely something to write home about and they have a good mix of Pho and regular entrees.   Very cool vibe inside with bar, table, and booth options.   Reasonably priced at about $9/plate and a unique beer selection.   As a pescetarian, I was disappointed in the lack of veggie options but I should have called ahead to check the menu because I believe that they change it often.  There was a mishap with my Wonton Veggie order but the server and manager comped the soup and offered us a complimentary dessert. ----business done right

VwtTtn1gpG7C5f1kSK00rA.text: omg oxtail pho and lobster pho. the pho broth is so clean tasting.   super friendly staff, casual late night eatery, good selection of alcohol.  if you want asian fusion food, this is the place. excellent seafood choices.  if you want really good pho, this is the place.

0NcdGl6QTCyE4apWTH_fiQ.text: We go out at least three times a week, this place by far has the best and most attentive servers. They were very knowledgeable and so very friendly. Food was creatively executed with perfectly paired flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifully displayed slightly too grilled causing endless chewing.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttery and stewed to perfection.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House oysters skip the 6 and double to 12. Well worth it

Xu1pgnQ2zO_I-ygr--Yvhg.text: Great food....great service...no wait for a table on Valentine Day. The fried red snapper with sweet & sour sauce was so yummy.  Thank you guys!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cakiu8gZP-3cDqrnD8A2zQ.text: Came here on a recommendation from my friend. It was pretty good. Service was great as well.   I ordered the   1. Carpaccio. Not the normal as it seems they use a warm ponzu or type of oil on it. It is different than what I'm use to which is more lemon and being 100% raw. I would not get this again   2. Serrano wings. We were with our daughter so our server said peppers on the side. I thought good. Wrong. It's like a salt and pepper style wing so if it's on the side it has 0 flavor. But the chicken was fried very well. I will get this again but not with the peppers on the side.   3. Ox tail. Big healthy portion of meaty tail. The soup was very flavorful but not thick and heavy. I will get this again.   4. Rice with short rims. The ribs were very very good but the rice itself was hard and reminded me of day old rice you use for fried rice. Maybe it's just a Vegas thing?  Not cheap but it's Vegas, what is?

pHvYCgf21h_XLwlZLvVV_g.text: Came here with friends before a night out. Good prices on food, not too expensive & food was good. We got the wings & crispy spring rolls.

hhUNJ2oShXiUr6n0CRvzag.text: Had some really good food at this asian fusion (heavy on the Vietnamese) gastropub of sorts on Jones Blvd.   Some Vegas locals took me here for a late lunch and I was pleasantly surprised how good the food was. I had heard good things about District One so it was great to finally go there the last time I was in town.  We started off with the oxtail fries ($11.99) which we topped with an over easy egg. The fries were crunchy, the oxtail was tender and delicious in its own gravy. I really liked this dish and recommend that you get it. It was really good. Next we had the beef carpaccio ($12.99). It was excellent. My favorite version of beef carpaccio so far. It was perfectly thin ribeye with sesame and citrus flavors. It was just so very good. Ordering this next time for sure. Next were the pork belly buns (3 for $7.99). They were good with the peanut sauce and the braised pork belly was soft and tender. I could have done without the cilantro but that was just standard on the order. Good dish. We also had the oxtail fried rice ($12.99). SO GOOD. So flavorful... You have to order it. Shredded oxtail with all kinds of delicious seasoning with another over easy egg as a topping. Only thing I would change on this dish is add more oxtail for sure. The pics I took doesnt show too much oxtail in it and it could have used some more. Lastly we had the beef and lemongrass wrapped in betel leaves ($7.99). This was my least favorite of all the dishes we had. The lemongrass flavor was too strong IMO. The beef was tender and there were other seasoning flavors I couldnt make out. I would pass on that next time.   Service was very good. Jeff was excellent. Very personable guy and we appreciated his attentiveness to our party. Kudos to him... Cant wait to eat at District One the next time I'm in town. Heard that whole fried fish dish is the one!  Parking in a shared big lot. Some are 30 min spaces only.

VgyiLfK8aY-iS6uatpV6BQ.text: Great place to experience while in Las Vegas. My wife and I had the privilege of trying this place due to family introducing. Awesome food and great service.   My wife had the Big Bone Soup since she just loves the bone marrow. It was fun to watch her devour into it. I believe her when she says it was an awesome entree. Be ready to get messy but well worth it.   I had the Oxtail Fried Rice which was very different but at the same time pretty damn good. The taste profile was spot on. Not too salty and not too bland.

ZacY-ZdvaxtpfoOUeHVjPQ.text: Good evening, I came in today for first time and Cory and Selena took good care of me as If I'm a regular and come daily. I wanna thank them for the amazing hospitality and treating me as I am family. I will definitely come back and ask for them. I wanna thank the whole team for the amazing service.

gRpAnh7K8QAnXgvQZ36PSw.text: Terrible. So over priced. Bowl of plain bland, not tasty at all vegetables for $10.99. Could have made at home for $1.00. Service bad too. My husbands food came out 20 minutes before mine. The excuse was they have one wok guy and he is busy. Then the other cook shouldn't have started his order when he did. He should have timed it with mine. Which was a bowl of bland boring not flavorful basic veggies. Oh I said that already. If you want to spend a lot of money for bad food this is your place.

nBVeNrtOsxKPmg3Ie6qxLg.text: This place is one of our absolute favorite places to eat and drink. They always have delicious food and their service has been excellent 9 out of 10 times. None of the food we've ever ordered had failed us. It's either phenomenal or at least above average.  Food that we felt were extraordinary: Pho'getti, Steak & Eggs (shaken beef and tomato rice, omg, I never knew it could be so good), their special raw oysters of the day, Garlic Noodles.  Food that my guests felt was extraordinary, but I didn't really feel that way: Live Whole Maine Lobster Pho, Oxtail Fried Rice.  Food that we always order because it goes great with beer and because we trust the food and taste quality here: Garlic Fries, Chicken Wings, Grilled Whole Squid, Fish Tacos.  Other food we tried that were delicious and beyond average, but not something I necessary go back for: All their pho is really good, Fried Calamari.  Their prices are on the pricier side, but it is worth it once in a while.  My only complaint is that no matter how many times I ask, they just don't carry ranch.  I get it, you know.  Vietnamese restaurants don't normally carry ranch condiments, and they probably are a little anal about the way their food should taste and don't want people to ruin it with ranch.  And maybe that's what makes this place so stable and reliable in their food.  I always know what to expect.  But c'mon...  You have fries and chicken wings, why not ranch?  Sometimes all I want is bar food, and that's why I want that ranch.  Well, one time, I brought my own ranch and they were okay with it.  Lol!  When it comes down to it, we really come to this place because we love the atmosphere.  Yes, the amazing food keeps us coming back, but it's the service, the people, and the atmosphere that makes us feel comfortable and right at home.

kbfVevTXUqw9LDV2huSO6A.text: Pho Tom, wings, chicken clay pot and garlic green beans are amazing! We have been here about 10 times. I would like to recommend a change in veggies for Veggie Pho: Snow peas, baby corn and keep bok choy. Current veggies of broccoli, carrots and zucchini end up still being raw even after 5 min in broth.

37REOxUeVxpb5ozc0aZ8nA.text: Damn, I mean Damn! Dat big bone soup is something else! The chicken wings are crispy Good! Come and check this place out, just look at da pics!

5uxCD61iHk0bEaFOyOhPqw.text: Love this place, just wish I lived closer so I can dine more often. All their selections on their menu that I have tried are great.

BlTKXaCR3ir_A2QzO7IzMQ.text: Pretty sure this was the last actual complete meal I had before EDC weekend and it did not disappoint! We went with a party of 20+ and they were able to accommodate us on a short notice. Friendly service and our server were very knowledgeable of the menu/drinks. I had the oxtail pho and the broth itself was delicious. Portions are big too. We also tried the beef carpaccio, wings, and the pork belly buns- all amazing choices.   This is not your typical viet/pho fare and the prices are higher than expected. With that said, I'll be returning next time I'm back in Vegas!

l2C-ttEbiD86E-v-vf2Mxw.text: This place is dope!  Ordered Belly Buns and District One Combination Plate (short ribs) & tried some of my friend's Oxtail Fried Rice.   I absolutely loved it here. Not only were the portions great, the quality of food was A1, the service was pretty spot on and the design and atmosphere was cool.  The restaurant vibe was great. I liked the design and how it was clean. The location is a little hidden in the plaza & I can imagine it being hard to park there late at night, but I was there in the afternoon pretty much right when they opened so I had no problems.   Highly recommended !

eHUs26CIwYqneMhKDJSQlw.text: Its hard to find a hip place with great food, all at a good price. District One hits all the notes and orchestrates the symphony with courteous, attentive service.  I came here, got the calamari, ox tail fried rice, ox tail soup and of course the Big Bone Soup. @___@  i would say i was far from disappointed, hence i had to come back for the famous Ox Tail Fries. This place will always be a destination for all my upcoming Vegas Trips.

otMrurPjOuAP4Infhj-kfg.text: Hubby found this place on Yelp. We usually go to the Cal for his oxtail soup, The Midnight Special... But he wanted to try something new , as the Cal hasn't met his expectations lately...  Came here at midnight. They do have midnight specials, such as the pork belly buns and sashimi fish tacos. The oxtail pho was not one of the specials , but it's reasonably priced especially for the amount of sleep you get, can easily feed two people...  I think he's found a new place to come for his oxtail soup...  Since it was 109 degrees that day, I chose the oxtail fried rice. So good!! Didn't have a chance to try any desserts this time. But I will for sure the next time we're in town!

HFkD2ux_3rnDdJjbRknxwQ.text: Very cool joint in a Chinese Shopping center not too far from Orleans, Gold Coast, or Palms. Went specifically for lobster pho and even at $49 did not disappoint. Impressive looking, tasty, significant amount of lobster. Service very friendly. Also ordered two small plates, crispy egg rolls and yellowtail  rolls. Egg rolls served with basil for a wrap. Decor was supposed to look like a se toon of Vietnam, reminded me of Wilmington Beach NC. Would definitely return-lot if fun. Ubered back to Orleans Casino for $10.

uozxNAtDHffqXO0GtR-dCQ.text: Initially I was going to try Pho Basa last week, however they were closed for the day.  Lucky for me, District One was open and YELP suggested I go there.  Okay!  We arrive and the servers are friendly and seat us fairly quickly.  We're told it's happy hour and that's just awesome.    Being an Asian Fusion restaurant, their menu items all intrigued me.  I tried the Yellowtail fish tacos off their HH menu and OMG these were amazing.    Though appearing quite small when they serve the two tacos to you, the flavor of the yellowtail, avocado, cilantro, cherry tomato, and lime was out of this world.   I wanted to get 2 more orders of these.. but alas, I had to try other things.  The shrimp papaya salad was good.   It would have been great if it came with those flat shrimp chips that I've been used to back in Chicago.   Something to balance out the tanginess of the dish.  They must really know how to make very good pork belly because we ordered it two ways and both dishes were fantastic.  The pork belly in the steamed buns were yummy, bite size treats.  The other dish, Slow-Braised Pork Belly in young coconut juice was just so soft and tender and it came sitting in the sauce w/ a boiled egg as well.    There were plenty more unique offerings to try and they also offered a variety of Pho/Soups on the menu.  One thing I'll come back to try some time is their Lobster Pho.  I keep hearing about it and I want it!  Our experience here was good.  The service was fast.  And the food was delicious!  5/5.

lgCId4z4heFiv-mpp-fA4w.text: First meal in Vegas!  Meh.  Good Morning Vietnam - their rendition of a Bloody Mary.  This was Pinky's drink and he wasn't a fan, well I guess I wasn't too much of a fan either just because I felt like I was drinking super concentrated V8.  A good bartender will make a good Bloody Mary with a perfect balance of flavors, not too strong in alcohol, not overwhelmed in spices, and not too thick and tomatoey.  I have to say, that although I appreciated the shrimp inside the Bloody Mary, it did nothing to tone down the thick consistency of the actual drink.  While the truffle salt I guess gets A for effort to make this drink exciting, but meh.. could have done without it.    Shigoku oysters - was excited for our oysters, but decided to just try 2 before ordering anymore since they said they served it with caviar and some ponzu type sauce.  Nice presentation, but what a waste of a good oyster.  Sorry, but the sauce that they flooded those little shells with totally killed off the natural flavor of the oyster.  I could only feel the texture of the oyster, but the taste was all sauce.  So happy we didn't order anymore.    Scallop sashimi - they served the scallop meat cut into thin slices with the ponzu and caviar with the more heartier, crunchier parts (I think the organs?) in the center.  Like the oysters the delicate flavor of the scallop was overwhelmed by the ponzu, but the crunchy bits actually went well with the sauce.  Pinky appreciated the crunchy bits of scallop and ended up finishing the order.  Green papaya salad - I liked this dish, it wasn't overly sweet like I had thought it would be, but it actually would have been tastier with a little more sweetness.  The salad reminded me of Thai papaya salad minus the strong fermented fish sauce flavor and scent (which I love btw).  the salad was refreshing and light, but I could have used more potent and pungent flavors.  Only downside was that the dish was supposed to come with pork, but when we got it there was only shrimp.  Initially I thought that maybe I had just read the menu wrong, but then our waiter came up with another bowl of salad but with all pork in it to make up for the mistake.  It wasn't a big deal... but just kind of weird how they remedied the situation.  But oh well, it was a win for Pinky bc he packed the pork salad up and ate it as a late night snack later on.     Lobster pho - price is marked as MP, we paid $40 for the bowl.  Noodles were cooked perfectly!  The lobster meat was sweet and the little brain/guts in the head were deliciously enjoyed by yours truly.  The broth itself was on the milder side... Honestly I had low expectations for this dish, but it actually surpassed them.  HOWEVER, I wouldn't order this dish again and $40 for it.  Maybe I'm just not a big enough fan of lobster to do it... but after my bandwagon-y instagram picture post of the dish, I'm over it.    Service was awesome, and the menu items go well with the cool atmosphere of Vegas... Might even do well in LA where theres a bunch of hipsters, scene kids, bandwagonners, and unknowing mi trang.  But as for me, I'll stick to my mom and pop shop, bowls of dank pho broth.

Vb3wSCO6ChnYEAIs4ZGChA.text: Food is decent, but too pricey for pho and fried rice.

IlNC9mbHnIc8hW-JS82S8Q.text: This place is a hungover person's dream come True - Delicious bowls of pho in a room with low lighting and chill music muahahaah.  OXTAIL PHO (5/5) - with a price tag of $15.99, it's definitely the most expensive bowl of pho i've ever had, but am I crazy to say it was WORTH IT? I was a lil reluctant because some reviews here claimed the oxtail meat wasn't tender but mine was FALL OFF THE BONE, easy-peasy-to-eat tender. Abundance of meat! Flavorful broth! No complaints here.  OXTAIL FRIED RICE (5/5) - $15.99 - sampled a bite of my friend's order and it was YUMMMMMY. Very soft chunks of oxtail meat hugged by perfectly fried rice. Hefty portion size! No complaints here either.  THE BIG BONE SOUP - $17.99 - this is THE thing to order if you want something for the 'gram. The bones are RIDICULOUSLY gigantic. Keep in mind it does not include pho noodles, so if you order that on the side, it's an additional $5. Had a taste of my friend's order and it was indeed tasty and would please any bone marrow fan, but it's a dish to avoid if you want something that'd require minimal effort to eat.  VIET-CHELADA (5/5) - $8 - mmmmm tried a sip and it was delicious. Basically it's a Michelada with Vietnamese beer. Whatever they used to rim the glass was nommynommy savory and worth lickin' yo lips for.  VIETNAMESE COFFEE - just as a heads-up, they serve traditional Vietnamese drip coffee. If youza noob, wait for all the water to drip from the filter, then stir the coffee with the condensed milk at the bottom until it's all dissolved, and then pour into your cup of ice.   ! BONUS POINTS ! - the music played during my visit was A1 (mura masa and odesza vibes). - extremely extensive drinks menu, it's crazy. If I was a Vegas local, I'd see myself coming here often to hang out and slurp/munch the night away. - water refills by our server were oooooooooon point.  - surprised they didn't automatically charge gratuity for our party of 8! 18% was well deserved regardless.  OVERALL  - hungover or not, I'd mosdef come back here the next time I'm in Vegas. Their menu has a wide variety of both traditional and modernized Viet food to tickle anyone's fancy!

GslusV_wL0LPK3VxzGfGBA.text: Always awesome the big bone soup is a must try...the service on point the restaurant  cleanliness on point...they have other stuff but nothing compares to big bone soup...you can add meatballs and other meat...the only thing I get mad at...no noodles...you want you have to pay extra....but yeah besides that pinch it's great place

8x8d7Yj34RTthv-cLIr3LA.text: One of the places on my list that I wanted to try. Glad was able to do so. Place wasn't packed at around 11am. The host and servers were nice. The food was great. We got half a dozen house special oysters, belly bun, yellowtail tacos and lobster pho. Oysters were yum. Need to go back during happy hour. The belly buns were also good the pork was very tender. The yellowtail Tacos tastes better with lime and sriracha so better add some. The lobster pho was heaven. The broth was great and the lobster was succulent. If I lived in the area I'd probably visit often.

J1HgVfYMnfBpFbuSrUa1hg.text: This "New Vietnamese" style restaurant is great! Get the beef carpaccio, the Thai style snails, and share the oxtail bone pho! And don't forget the pandang creme brulee/flan with micro marigolds!

yLhN_NiH3s4TgBmcBv6GKA.text: Treat off the strip! My parents and I had dinner here on a Sunday around 5 pm. We ordered their fresh fish (snapper), calamari, and shrimp pho. I took off a star because I thought it was a little pricey. It was all delicious! Our sever, Jason C., really made a positive impact on our experience. He made us feel like we were talking to a friend and was very accommodating.  I really wanted to try the beef bone soup. However, they were out of it by the time we arrived. According to our server, there were a lot of people who stopped by for Sunday lunch.  The fresh fish is charged per pound ($23.00 for our 1 1/4 pound of fish). The snapper we ordered was cooked with a delicious sweet and sour sauce service with white rice.  The calamari was a great sharing size. It comes with a mild spicy mayo sauce. The batter tasted a little heavier compared to other calamari I have tried. Still tasty!  The shrimp pho was fantastic and served in a good amount.  Overall, great experience. I would come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern atmosphere and very roomy!

6_B6YHvHoPvTGcwv_ZeiMw.text: Oxtail fried rice (6/5): so good meat is so soft and tender. DEFINATELY GET THIS!! Who knew fried rice could be so flavorable!  Oxtail pho (5/5): pretty good, has meat that falls off the bone . No need for sriracha or hoisen! The oxtail meat is super flavorable and easy to take off the bone.  Bone marrow soup (4.5/5): its so big! They also offered to help us deconstruct it so its easier to eat, so of course we accepted. It came back as a beautiful tendon marrow soup. The soup is similar to the oxtail pho soup but a little more fatty.  Definately stop here if you are near the area. The service is pretty nice, too. They give you gloves so you won't ger your hands messy but it was unnecessary for our meal.

72D7fJLLHSGRvOWRYuBu_Q.text: Extraordinary is the only word that describes this amazing establishment!  We started out eating two belly buns--yummy delicious jucy oh so flavorful baos with the right balance of flavors. I then had the double down with the short rib Chinese sausage and egg. It comes with this rice that is crispy at the edges the short ribs cooked perfectly with the flavorful burnt edges full of the wonderful barbeque flavors of the sauses cooked into the meat and bones--so good for sucking on!  The added sauce they give you added kick and the egg--of course I ordered it with a runny yolk--adds to the sauce and flavor. I can still taste this dish. It will linger in my food memory for years to come as one of the best dishes of all time. My husband had the pho Tai rib eye which was huge but he loved it!  We were much too full for dessert. But we left feeling like we found a hidden gem--LOVE this place!!!

svLQ84HvQpeTfbAL-BOxqw.text: Amazing amazing amazing. Best Bun Bo Hue I've ever eaten. I've been to District One in the past, and never had anything bad. Everything is super fresh, flavorful and I would highly recommend anything on the menu. Take a larger group, order 1 of everything, and TRY. You won't be disappointed.

27ytEArOG3khqBi9rSq-qA.text: Great food we had the tuna tacos grilled squid and beef carpaccio. I highly recommend the carpaccio it was excellent and definitely stood out from all the apps we had. For the main course we had the surf and turf pho and the oxtail pho both were fantastic extremely flavorful and generous portions. I had a hard time choosing a favorite.

qVPBByR4kzQr1VyZSuDUFg.text: Oxtail fried rice is amazing here  I would come back just for this. The pork buns we ordered was deep fried which was interesting but the flavor was just okay but my boyfriend says " if you get to the cilantro part of the bun then it's good". The lobster pho was good. Some of the yelpers complained that's it bland and not flavorful. Its not bland. The broth compliments the lobster very well. It might not be as flavor packed as beef but that's because it's too different broths and it should be that way. The lobster pho was expensive. About $50. Overall, I would come back.

PsWAlRodEx0eixYr_Hl_SA.text: The Food and Hospitality are always on point! Lobster Pho, crispy spring rolls, oxtail are some of my go to's. Be sure to get the iced coffee.

GBROy7BtSHoR6NQC4wySiw.text: So delicious. Amazing service and you see the owner walking around helping out his staff. The spring rolls were so good. The lobster pho was great and I'd come back on my next visit here.

hK5nmCdckEH0IqciIdOyPg.text: Finding this place at 1 a.m. was pure serendipity... They serve Inventive Vietnamese & Asian fusion dishes.  Upon entering, we asked to be seated im a booth. Though they had already closed the booth section for the night, they accomadated our request. The menu has something for everyone. And I love that they have vegetarian options. My parents had the "five spice cornish game hen' with tomato rice and pickles vegetables. They loved it! My brother had the 'green papaya salad' with shrimp, pork, peanuts and basil. Salad was beautiful. With fresh vegetables and generous portions of shrimp and pork. He loved it! I had the "shrimp skewers" deep fried tagarashi. Bold delicious flavor. Fried to perfection. Huge pieces of shrimp. I also ordered the "pho veggie" with seasonal veggies, pho broth and rice noodles. The broth was so delicious and flavorful. It came out super hot, which I love.  I asked the owner for chili/ hot sauce for my pho. He asked if I wanted something with more heat. I said yes! He went to the kitchen and sliced fresh red chilis for me. They also came around enough to check to see if you need anything else.  I will definitely be back to this establishment when in Las Vegas. They take pride in their food and service. From the ambience to the service to the food, everything was perfect. Perfect ambience. Perfect service. Pefect good quality and taste.

g3L-EjPxUe21nEc23eWLsw.text: I came here on a weekday and it wasn't that busy. We were seated right away.  Service was so slow, took a while to get our orders. And our waters. Halfway thru the meal we asked for more water and the waiter took our cups away and never brought it back!  We ordered what they're famous for. Lobster pho: flavor was really good, had good seafood meets beef flavor. The only issue was it was a sodium bomb! Leaves you thirsty for days! And it was $50 a bowl before tax and tip! At least the lobster was big. Ox tail fried rice: not enough ox tail meat to justify the price. Flavor was good but again with the salt! Super salty! I think the chefs probably smoke too much and have killed their tastebuds.  It's better to have more pure flavor than it is to mask it with salt.  When it came to ask for the check we had to ask three different people and still didn't get our check! So we just paid at the front cashier and left no tip. It was over $70 for two dishes.  Maybe I might come back and try their other dishes if I have a friends visiting that really wanna eat here but I'm not sure, I think it's a lot of salt to eat in one meal.

otRNpVS6_1J6Yf4hAbhsGg.text: Delicious!! My daughter and I came here and we eat Pho quite a bit... the entire time she said " mmm this is yummy". This was my first time having lobster Pho and District One has set a very high bar! They did not skimp on the lobster at all and the broth was very flavorful!   The Restaurant was clean and modern. The bar looked delectable and I will partake on girls night out! The staff were friendly and attentive. I will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ikZHbhf2G0RBQ7HyxN1YjQ.text: After tonight, I'm not sure what the most interesting restaurant in this plaza is.  Mountain View Plaza on Jones between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn is home to other great restaurants such as Asian BBQ & Noodles and Chada Thai and Wine. I finally made a long overdue visit to District One to hang out with old friends. Per their web site, their name is inspired by the old "epicenter for entertainment and dining" in yestercentury Saigon, but their cuisine is a fusion of Vietnamese with other Asian cuisines and American flavors. Still, I was definitely able to spot the Vietnamese influence in a lot of dishes.  "Happiest Hours" are Mon-Fri 5-7pm and Sun-Thu 12am-2am, and we hit the sweet spot of the normal happy hour, so a lot of our dinner consisted of sharing those items:  Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio ($9.99 Happiest Hours / $11.99 regular): beef, citrus soy, sesame & truffle oil, crispy white onion, crushed peanut. The beef pieces are considerably thicker than your average carpaccio, but they weren't too difficult to chew. Fortunately, the truffle oil was used judiciously, so I enjoyed the overall combination of varied flavors and textures.  Belly Buns (2 pc, $3.99 HH / $7.99 reg): braised pork belly, pickled carrot and daikon, cilantro, crushed peanut. Not sold on the supposed presence of cilantro, but the pork belly is prepared a la "xa xiu" (aka char siu, aka BBQ pork). In combination with the slaw, it really evokes the flavor profile of banh mi. Execution was inconsistent in that the meat in the encore order lacked fat and consequently seemed drier, but the first order was bursting with juices, and the happy hour price is stellar.  Cajun Garlic Fries ($2.99 HH, not on reg menu?): french fries, fresh crushed garlic, cajun seasoning. The garlic was far more prominent than the cajun spices, which is fine with me. These seasonings were uneven over the plate, but they were really addictive, and it was feasible to cobble together enough from the spillage. Ketchup can cover for that issue too. Also, it's a very nice portion compared to enhanced french fries at other restaurants.  (An interesting food hack that one friend used was to dip fries in the leftover beef carpaccio sauce. I've got to try that next time.)  House Special Oysters ($19.99 for 12): ponzu, caviar. We got this instead of the fresh oyster, which is $1.25 per oyster HH. For the small increase in average-per-oyster price, the ponzu and caviar put an interesting spin on what could have been mundane lemon and cocktail sauce oysters. A small quibble is that the oysters were a bit on the small side, but that's easily solvable with a second order...  Crispy Egg Rolls (4 pc, $4.99 HH, $6.99 reg): pork, mushroom, taro. The overall flavor was really good, especially with the dipping sauce. However, I'm sure most people will agree that there is far too much taro compared to the other parts of the filling. I barely had a problem on this occasion, but my ideal is a more meat-focused egg roll. I would avoid it as a silent protest of sorts, but you should try it once if you haven't.  Fish Tacos (2 pc, $4.99 HH / $9.99 reg): sashimi yellowtail, avocado, cilantro, cherry tomato, serrano pepper in a crispy shell. One of my favorite bites of the night. This does not remind me of anything in Vietnamese cuisine. It's more like the seafood tostadas offered by Soho Japanese Restaurant, This rendition has a medley of flavors, especially when you squeeze the lime wedge into the taco. I enjoyed the reorder of this dish, so I have to rank it above the Belly Buns.  Serrano Pepper Wings ($0.50 each HH, $7.99 reg for ? pc): deep fried wings, supposedly in serrano pepper sauce... wait, what sauce? Yeah, I'm going to ignore that odd description. These are moist, properly seasoned wings - a welcome relief after the relative disaster at Chow in downtown Las Vegas. The crust and flavors remind me of my dad's delicious recipe. Be prepared for the mild inconvenience of having to scoop up the serrano pepper slices and the green onion pieces to flavor variety.  Oxtail Fried Rice ($12.99): shredded oxtail meat, red onion, soy sauce, fried egg (sunny side up). This dish is fairly tame on its own, but it sings glorious harmonies in your mouth when you add a bit of Sriracha sauce. The sweetness, acidity, and heat in the ever-increasingly popular condiment perfectly complement the flavors of the fried rice. It's puzzling that the flavors aren't already in the fried rice recipe, but I don't care after how delicious it was. The only issue is that the oxtail didn't stand out for me. It could have been subbed out for any other reasonable protein.  I truly enjoyed District One. I was impressed with most of what I tried and the happy hour pricing, and nothing was overly disappointing. Come here for HH and bring friends. Perhaps you can enjoy Monday Night Football on the myriad of TV screens as we did. I can't speak for the rest of the menu just yet, but I'm excited to return to explore it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

yKptu_hm7a3fXe4Fehhm5w.text: Came here after a long day and was seated almost immediately even though a crowd. Once seated we were served drinks and left the menu to look through.   I ordered the oxtail pho and came to realization it was also happy hour so I ordered the porkbelly buns (fried)... needless to say it was amazing. I've always had steamed buns but having it fried was no comparison to the unhealthier version.  The food arrived all together, I immediately tried the oxtail pho and it was so tender and soft to the bite. And also had the very crispy spring rolls which wasn't too hot on the inside so I was able to power through the appetizer.  In the end, I was very satisfied with my decision to eat here and will definitely bring friends and family here because the ambience is great and not too loud even though there's a sports bar. 5 stars all the way

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried porkbelly buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho

2DkMiEqno1THeU-9tx6fqg.text: Ehhh...more misses than hits when I came.  With all the pics from previous Yelpers, I had higher hopes.  Honestly, there are probably better fusion Southeast Asian places in LV.  Hopefully you have a better experience!  ***edit -- service wasn't up to par.  We had to flag down and make requests a couple times for items we needed for our food.  Also, we made reservations for 8:30 and when we got there, we had to wait around 20 minutes before we were seated.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Egg Rolls -- nothing to write home about...
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Buns -- with fried buns. Unflavorful.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail French Fries -- egg was a little runny but overall was yummy

R9IFrHMBwzJ-T5ap1jGwDA.text: I came here back in 2015, just haven't had the chance to write a review.  This is the first time I came here and Im glad I did.   This is like a modern twist on asian cuisine. My boyfriend order the crispy bird nest noodles and I ordered the slow cooked pork belly w/ coconut juice. Both dishes were very tasty. I was surprised the bird nest stayed crispy not soggy when you put the wet ingredient on it.  The pork belly had flavored but i think to overwhelming for me cause the juices tasted like fish sauce to me.  Service was slow. Don't get me wrong it wasn't busy but I would expect to have someone be more attentive if it wasn't busy to check on the table to see how were doing or even give more water without out us waving someone down.Over all food was good, I would come back and try there lobster pho.

WM80xpY9KgU_oOWOxqxgGw.text: Their servings isooo big you will enjoy eating.i love the bone marrow soup.if you're in Vegas dont forget to stop by pretty sure you will love the place with their friendly staff

UlDhcKWwtw4srXZ1JM-kbg.text: We found this spot by luck yesterday as we were waiting for my car to get fixed and MAN, I'm so happy we chose District One. I had a cool vibe, staff was nice, and the food was SO GOOD! I suggest the seasonal Vegetables and the short ribs. Definitely a great place for lunch or dinner, but I'm waiting for it to get a little colder so I can go try out the lobster Pho!

6rSLNNtTsDo0yxpNRKwKgw.text: I am Vietnamese living in Orange County, the largest Vietnamese community in the country, just to put my expectations into perspective.  Hate to be so blunt but If this restaurant were in Orange County, it may last for about 6 months at most.  Ordered the lobster pho. It was totally bland and devoid of any True pho flavor. 50$?! I was totally confused.  The presentation was nice tho. The big bone soup was similarly bland. However the meat and marrow from the bones were tasty. We also ordered the ox tail fries. The fries were loaded with meat and gravy. Good value but again, not much with taste.  The service was good. People were friendly and helpful. The food came out quickly.  the ambience was nice.  Im glad I did try this place as the concept is good and novel.  However, I would not come back I have to wonder if the chef is truly Vietnamese or familiar with how pho should taste. Maybe they had a bad batch of the broth. Having read through some of the other reviews, I see others thought similarly about the blandness of the broth.  Sorry, This place missed the mark.

P3FDlcELTHeKgPKsG0Uwxg.text: Best new place in Vegas!! A must to try and come back for more. Super friendly and knowledgable staff. Vee and Crystina are awesome!! The food is outstanding! The beef carpaccio was full of flavors I didn't think would taste a good as they did. The braised pork belly will leave you filling full good size portions. Worth the wait for this place.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bam!!!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised pork belly

0_GAKxQPoaItVCyMRuMnrg.text: Well the food was good and the atmosphere was cool BUT when the meal came to an end I was incredibly light headed and my gums were numb. I knew immediately it was due to MSG in the food, I'm sensitive to it and can tell almost instantly when I've consumed a decent amount. We stopped the waiter to ask and he admitted that the do use a lot of MSG. I wouldn't mind so much if it was written on the menu so that I would have had the choice to avoid it. I'm sure the reason the food tastes so good is bc it is altered so much with MSG.....if you're sensitive to it, or prefer not to consume it....this place wouldn't be my first choice.

aWJMubk7CERolr-0sz8IDg.text: We went to District one on a tip from a friend and good food and everything was fresh servers are nice place was very nice little pricey but worth it and we plan to come back here when were in Las Vegas yeah

1_4VYm3P7NnAbBulCYRbtw.text: Very good selections of food.  Their hamachi tacos are one of my favorite dishes there.  The Phos are great as well. Not the cheapest place to have pho but their qualities are good enough for the price.

Wy2Ew7PnBC9Bo-pyOF87Vg.text: The food was awesome!  The house oysters were delicious, we ordered a 2nd order.  The bone marrow soup was crazy big and the broth was great to sip on.  The belly buns were a good appetizer.  The carpaccio had a ton of flavor but I thought the slices were too big since it was hard to cut into smaller sizes with just a fork.

gAQOhnLPG3IvF7DAn5JlWg.text: This place is so great! First time trying it here on my trip to Vegas. I got the District One Rice combo plate, didn't think anything of it, just a normal short rib + rice plate but it was awesome. Really liked the short rib sauce, portion was really big too. I'd go back here again if I visit vegas in the future. Haha

XQni71yI1mPRTLokwESk0Q.text: Went here last night for birthday dinner with friends & it was amazing! Super great & friendly service, nice atmosphere & delicious food. We ordered a variety of appetizers & pho soups & it was all delicious. Nicely flavored & seasoned dishes & plates. Will return all the time & bring more friends to check it out!

ScJZAouTGYxFvu8EdUP-dg.text: It's awesome! Great food great drink selection.  They take time their time to be helpful.  Way better than when cravin was here.

HytK79NG74X9A-3GtpoWLA.text: I am very close to 5 star here but can't do it. I think it's because the pho and the bun Bo hue didn't quite blow me away. I am at 4.5 stars though.  The place is immaculate clean and hipster inside.  Bar is a nice added touch and it's always busy. So that's a great sign. I would go back but would try some of the other menu items. Service was 5 star. Try it you won't be disappointed

_kjuu3fS_7E245ECkbSXMg.text: Ate the King Crab with Aioli and a dozen oysters. Highly recommend it!

6QftGT5lDNQz6QlWW539kA.text: I have been there a few times. Often always good.  Nothing was horrible but nothing stood out as delicious.  The great thing it's open late.

m6cyZOqFKCwcWpdAiZoixw.text: My husband, friend and I (party of 3) came into district one to eat lunch. Only 4 tables were occupied and there were 4 servers so to have great customer service shouldn't have been an issue. We were seated by a window and it took about 5 minutes to get a server to help us. When we started looking around for help a gentlemen came to our table with waters, and as he was about to leave I told him we were ready to order. He didn't seem very friendly and as I said thank you he just walked away..  We ordered 2 oxtail loco mocos, one fish taco, and a spring roll. The food was alright. Definitely different, but the taste was just alright. Especially for the small 3 fish tacos with barely any yellowtail, it's bit overpriced.   Maybe I'll come back and give it another try. With a different server and different items on the menu.

To6G1zFQYWLRTkTfA8t17Q.text: Fan of Asian Fusion and that reflects on my rating. Pho's amazing and the place is hipstery. Open on a midnight is what's the best you could ask for.

7VHN1d_OqsvxpVVdJH2jMQ.text: Love the decor, very nice and spacious! Large bar area...Hennessy on tap...say what?!! Tried the fish tacos and on tail fries one day...super yummy! Next day, came back for dinner. Had the pork belly buns...deliciousness! Their coconut ice cream is also satisfies the sweet tooth! Almost forgot, the coconut is quite refreshing! Friendly service. Definitely will be back when I visit Vegas again!

LDSaA8sMYXLObWXvrpaNDA.text: I had a great time eating lunch here.  I was looking for a place to eat that was off the beaten path of the strip and offered something truly different and satisfying.  I found District One and I really loved their twist on common asian and Vietnamese dishes. I ordered the Garlic Noodles with thinly sliced cuts of beef. It was served hot and fresh and it was delicious with just the right blend of garlic flavor and of course, the noodles were perfectly al-dente. They have a Vietnamese Iced Coffee that will bring you right out of a hangover - or perhaps even a coma. The waitresses and staff are all first-rate and extremely professional. I'll be visiting again next time, especially since my party was served fast and the bill was totally reasonable considering the amount of food and alcohol that was ordered. Unfortunately, I was the DD on this trip so I didn't get to enjoy any of the drinks, but everyone said the bar here is top-notch and the Vietnamese Donkey (it's a drink) was awesome.

O7Y5l4Lsc0UGm0HPrqsoDQ.text: They have a great staff here :) all the girls are super sweet. Good vibe. This place is highly recommended. I always have steak and eggs or Pho

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kO3oGNjg4FNnyOokTjsSPQ.text: First time here, saw all the reviews and recommendations and decided to try it out.  Customer service was good but food was kinda blane.  Had the lobster pho everyone has been raving about and to me was not worth the $45 I had to spent for the lobster.  Also has the chicken wings with fish sauce it was a bit salty.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
