1sjXWI1fmd1RkcrIekSi7Q.text: Delicious food. Big portions when it comes to Pho. Fast service. Will be back for more!

PLLEFW3DId62UDS5APJVHQ.text: Love this place awesome time great price even better customer service do yourself a favor and go here if you don't you stupid I have spoken

CBw-bnyYSS7oZ9JbFr_JmQ.text: I came here based on a friend's recommendation. This place is awesome.  Staff is super friendly. Food is flavorful and the meat is well-seasoned and tender.  Best of all the prices are super reasonable.  The shaken salad n rice dish are fantastic... I really can't over state this, the meat was awesome. My wife had the pork buns steamed not fried and they were delicious... They have pork belly.  My friend got the shrimp n pork papaya salad and she loved.   I would visit this establishment every time I visit Vegas.  The drinks are a little pricey at 12 bucks each and the place isn't on the strip but the food and service is well worth the drive.

kiRuAdBTro49HvoVkHvSDA.text: I tried pork belly buns & oxtail pho.  I'd definitely come back here to eat those again & try their other food on menu.  I've tasted better beef carpaccio elsewhere, depending on your wallet, I'd save my $12 for something else.

dNgMIa92oPKZHJPtnR17Xw.text: Love love love their House Special Oysters! Will go to District One just to order those! Good vibe, friendly service, nice take on Asian flavors.

6g8U1Q9A0hXEm8Y0PegE3Q.text: Love this place! Food is amazing. Reminiscent of traditional Vietnamese cuisine, but with an added of a little something. Just enough level of customer service where you can find someone if you need something, but private enough for a good date night. Tonight my fiance and I we're eating and he accidentally drop the nutcracker (for the crab legs) and immediately the owner (who I assume was the owner) came running to our table paper towel at hand to help clean up the phone. Pretty awesome of you ask me! A must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marrow
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster pho&#39;

vmCnUMuFiWcF9Nj-EXIJvg.text: Already open for a year and I just stopped by for the first time about a month ago. Happy hour is the way to go if you're looking to keep spending to a minimum. A slight fishy taste didn't stop me from enjoying the tiny fish tacos. The wonton shell added some great crunch to the sashimi yellowtail. The fanny bay oysters provided a balance of sweetness to the salinity of the oysters and caviar on top, with a touch of heat that trailed at the end. The beef carpaccio was unfortunately drowning in sauce. Half the amount would have been plenty to make the beef, onions and peanuts shine. My favorite item was the pork belly buns. The deep fried buns were a nice contrast to the standard chewy bao buns. And, of course, pork belly never disappoints. No Vietnamese restaurant is complete without pho. Their pho tai rib eye is plenty big enough for two to share, with a wonderfully aromatic broth covering a large mound of noodles and beef.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fanny Bay oysters
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos ($4.99 HH) - sashimi yellowtail, avocado, cilantro, cherry tomato
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese beef carpaccio ($9.99 HH) - beef, citrus soy, sesame and truffle oil, white onion, peanut

1Ns6WbQm_QDcZC-NcoMbFg.text: Love it!  The service is top notch, the restaurant is clean and bright, and the food is awesome.  One thing we were actually quite impressed by was the wine selection.  For a small Asian restaurant they have very good wines on their list at a very reasonable markup.  Their food is definitely a mix of items that are traditional and "new", but everything was prepared really well.  We opted for the special Kauai fried/grilled shrimp was were really tasty head on Santa Barbara prawn sized shrimp with some chili sprinkles.  I had the Hue noodle soup which had a very fragrant and spicy broth that hit the spot for me.  The beef salad was also really good.  I would say the only thing that was just ok were the oysters.  They weren't bad but there was nothing special about them at all.    Another restaurant added to my regular LV Chinatown list!   BTW, this plaza is FILLED with great places.  Another one of my favorite places is Shaanxi Gourmet a few doors down. Q Bistro next door is pretty decent for big portions and food to eat with your beer!

G2F5QLBrutALhRcy6AsP9Q.text: Had a wonderful round of beers and appetizers. Came here with a friend from work to have a few beers and a bite to eat. We ordered a few appetizers to get a feel for the menu. I have to say everything we tried was delicious and executed very well. We ordered the wings, steam pork bun, spring rolls, carpaccio and the oxtail fries.....i really enjoyed it all. This area of town is really doing some exciting things gastronamically. I highly recommend this place and i will definitely return.

ZR8pWxh54Z8V2nAjZNh10A.text: Tried District One because my coworker recommended this place. I had the oxtail pho and my wife had the oxtail loco moco. The pho was ok but the oxtail was not soft enough to fall off the bone which made it hard to eat. The oxtail loco moco was also ok but a little on the salty side. Service was good and the staff was very nice!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail loco moco!!!!

QXGpmyAQvki0-GRTVfB0lQ.text: Its modern asian fusion with a american bar appeal. Its like walking into yardhouse but with a modern asian menu.  Staff is friendly and place isnt dirty or dungy looking. Its bright and lots of tvs and comfortable seating. Did i mention all the paper towels u will ever need? They have oxtail pho, oxtail fries, and havent ordered anything i didnt like. Plus they have a good drink and beer menu that goes well with food and well thought out. A big plus is their desserts..not the mango, strawberry mochi ice cream deal

-2WBhKLf7NU0DffKYL-cTQ.text: Great food, service is quick and food is great! They also have speciality drinks that are awesome at the bar. Very casual, great place to come for even appetizers and drinks. Kid friendly. Desserts are yum!

kMupR948J-D9G2f6hKFb0Q.text: Expensive pho I paid nearly $40 for the lobster pho. Was it worth it? Not really I mean the soup base was good, but I know I won't be going back for a $40 pho it's good for experience I guess. We also got kim chi fried rice now that was good

yS39_F1J91adRRdarBfI0Q.text: It was our first time going there. Everything was so delicious  would love to go back again! If you love asian food this is the spot to go.

MnImjJJWwFYIj7MVer6uIA.text: I came here on the recommendation of a friend and was absolutely blown away with my experience: First and foremost, district one is a Vietnamese-based restaurant with a wonderful variety of traditional dishes but it's also a nice bar with a hip decor suitable for a first date or watching a game with friends.  I tried the four dishes: Vietnamese carpaccio which was melt-in-your-mouth tender and delicious Cabbage and shredded chicken salad - this is one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes and this one was the best I've ever eaten. It was clearly made to order with the mint still being crispy and nothing feeling soggy or stagnant. I'm hungry even thinking about it and I ate it a week ago.  Clay pot - this was a hearty and savory comfort food which was delicious but not as light as the other two Sauteed water spinach with tofu - perfectly cooked, not overly oily, the perfect amount of garlic and delicious.   I would highly recommend this place for locals as a restaurant or as a bar which happens to have fantastic food. I would also recommend it to Las Vegas visitors who want a temporary escape from the strip and it's blinding lights. I think Vegas should have uber by my next visit and I'll make it a point to return to district 1.

IVqKzRoBsvRi_JSyodxmgA.text: I have taken clients to this restaurant on multiple occasions.  The menu is diverse enough in type of food and price to meet the tastes and wallets of most.  If you haven't gone to China Town in Las Vegas, this is a great place for westerners learning about Asian food. The staff is friendly and the menu is in English.  As an attorney who works regularly with Chinese lawyers and clients, I have been to numerous establishments in China Town and I believe this is the best place for Pho, fish, and Fusion foods.

U2Xw3u5at1QqAiHTZ9wgOg.text: Have eaten here three times, last time was a phoned In Carryout.  Dining in the food was excellent and large portions. Oxtail fried rice was delicious , steaming hot and fresh with an over easy fried egg on top.  The spring rolls are also a great appetizer 2 rolls cut in half for 4 total pieces a good value appetizer for $5.99.  Enjoyed several wings next visit during their happy hour along with some tasty beers. Sat at the bar late night, very friendly male bartender and did a great job with our group of four.  Third visit was a phoned in Carryout. Must say I was disappointed.  Portions were smaller than the portions when I had dined in with the fried rice and especially the garlic vegetable blend.  When I opened the to go container, I thought it was a joke, barely half full with veggies . For $11 at a local place like this I find it unacceptable. At Joel Robuchon I would expect it, not here!  I almost wanted to drive back and question the portion,  don't have time for that. Previous two dine in visits were great that's why I had returned.  Come on District One , veggies are the cheapest , in your unfair portion it would have cost me $22 if not more to fill a to go box with sauteed veggies :(   please see photo I posted  I hope you address this and change it accordingly

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $11 Garlic Vegetable , Called in Carryout. Extremely disappointed . Tiny portion for $11. Please see my review

xwoZJeyQMbds9Tk5au7tSg.text: Mediocre at best. I was looking forward to our meal. We came at the tail end of happy hour but the restaurant wasn't overly busy. We ordered from the happy hour menu - egg roll, pork belly steam bau, garlic fries, spicy wings, oysters and carpacio. Fries came cold - we had to send them back. Egg rolls and pork bao weren't much better. Drinks were weak - at one point they wanted the martini glass as they had run out - it was about a third full. Overall the food wasn't that great - we also ordered from the regular menu - pho gau, chicken clay pot (rice undercooked and sauce very salty). The table next to us seemed to be having a better meal - with the owners personally checking in periodically and delivering the food, which looked piping hot and a lot better than what we got. With food options available, I doubt I will come back.

BjgBYG8EDBZK7EdjE6vf6g.text: Group din, Sat night. Awesome venue with awesome selections! The cube steak fried rice was amazing! Friends got the big bone oxtail soup bowl, huge and tasty. Papaya salad was great. Wings were great. Prices are a little high, but it Vegas. Overall a great experience. Will now make Disctrict One a must stop each future Vegas trip!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and egg with fried rice (subbed out the tomato fried rice)

Me7lYeAk6H2T9xVuBL9GAw.text: The food is good. My wife found this place on yelp and it has tons of good food. Especially, their service was amazing, friendly

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Q2wCDIFAnVELkQGR_2Pmg.text: I had really high hopes for this place but I thought it was okay, I was expecting a lot more. Wasn't really feeling the wood walls inside. Upon entry the hostess wasn't very welcoming nor she smiled. Maybe she was just having a bad day. Went there during happy hour to catch some food and drink specials, not a whole lot of selection on HH food really but at least the HH beers were good. It was interesting to see so many servers for such a small place or maybe some of them were bussers? I couldn't really tell, they had the same uniforms. Anyway wasn't sure if they all shared sections because we had at least 4-5 different employees coming to check up on us. It was just weird that when we needed service no one came to us but when we didn't need service they all came around. Hmm maybe just a bad rotation or circulation on the floor. Oh well at least they were friendly. The highlight of the experience was the white buns wrapping the pork belly. Tacos was alright. Papaya salad with the shrimp was okay, great portion for the price but it definitely wasn't fresh. You get what you pay for I guess. I need to come here outside of HH and try other things on the menu and I'm sure my second experience will be better then. Good music btw!!

xfLVAlIkR3w31ok8SOxS-A.text: Tried the bone marrow soup and the Surf+Turf pho. Delicious!  Bone marrow soup was huge but had no noodles or meat other than the bone marrow, so I had to pay extra. The surf and turf was half a lobster and some beef in it. That was very good! I think it was about $35 for surf and turf and around $25 for the bone marrow soup with added noodles. Staff was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow soup and surf and turf
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow soup

IuAF-kQkMyf5RLRzrAO0Fw.text: Service was very fast! We ordered the lobster pho and the surf and turf pho both were fantastic. The fried egg rolls were fantastic as well. Atmosphere was great and establishment was very clean

TJp3gKGFpdGis6lbqn1o2Q.text: I've eaten at District One about 4 times. Each time, it gets a little less impressive...   We ordered the special- escargot. It was tasty but the snails were awfully gritty.  The whole squid. I prefer my squid to be tender, my friend likes the chewiness... District One's rendition was on the very chewy side. I could have gotten over that, but it was also brought out cold. Chewy cold squid is definitely not appetizing. I finished all the little burnt tenticles which the flavor was on point, but definitely a miss.   Oxtail Pho. Thank you for the delicious oxtail pho. This was just how we liked and hoped it would be! They have all the traditional pho toppings and tools on each table, including your own roll of paper towels.  Service was also a bit slow. We will probably continue eating at District One due to their late hours & convenience, but wish they would step their game up a bit.

VNPt-uV0qDrN6NN_rXT5gQ.text: Was excited to try this place after watching buzzfeed and it sadly did not live up to the hype. I ordered the oxtail pho and the bf got the lobster pho. Both soups were extremely salty for my liking (so salty it made ME salty). Go ahead and call me extra but I had to add water... we waited pretty long for both soups too and they didn't even come together at the same time. We came around 3 pm on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. I got mine first and the bf waited an extra ten mins. Both pho had barely any noodles. I purposely didn't order a starter because I assumed I'd be getting a decent amount of noodles. I also ordered a matcha Thai tea because the tap water tasted nasty too. That also didn't impress me. Overall super disappointed but glad I tried it to get it off my mind.

CjCq9a9tXCMSZV0JGDK2IA.text: I went to have lunch here today around 12 noon. There were only about 7 people / customers (3 booths taken) ... so slow day for a restaurant ...yet I waited more than 15 minutes to be seated (ignored by the chit-chatting servers). I almost left, but was craving pho for some odd reason. So I stayed. The pho was okay. Other Viet restaurants in the area have way better pho.  Never coming back here. Servers need to pay more attention to INCOMING customers and NOT ignore them. Otherwise, you lose customers easily!!!

9_TH1kG48dlalN5Wo_NZKA.text: Most of the time I try to avoid fusion places. But this place does it right. Besides the fusion, they do have traditional Vietnamese dishes. They're known for their lobster pho. I have ordered that before and it was great. Do expect to pay a price for it though, because each order comes with a whole lobster.   For appetizers, make sure you get the oxtail fries. This is a great dish especially with the sunny side up egg on top. I will normally order the oxtail pho or the bone marrow pho. The broth here is pretty good. Very clean. They cook the oxtails down until the just fall of the bone.  If you're up for a drink, try the Hennessey Cafe Sua Da. Never would I have thought Hennessey would pair perfectly with Vietnamese coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries w/ sunny side egg

AljDYHXOPOCa9atk-REKmg.text: Best Meechon river soup. And chicken wings. I wish I knew how to cook at least these two items they serve. I would eat them every day for breakfast, lunch and dinner. And they have a bar as well, so if you want to have a drink too, it's the perfect place to stop by on your way from work.

GHLz9_HXvYjuO7Dc4DbOeQ.text: Delicious pork belly bun: fatty, juicy, and steamed bun with delicious sweet peanuts. Perfect execution of this Taiwanese snack.   The spring rolls were also surprisingly fresh. They put mint leaves in there, but it wasn't overbearing. Just gave it a nice refreshing kick. Also they fried a piece of egg roll or wonton skin and rolled it up in the spring roll, so it also gave it a nice crunch. Loved this!   The fish tacos were a miss. Yellowtail sashimi with guacamole, tomatoes. I generally like the taste of sashimi and don't need it doled up with a lot of flavors. But even the flavors they added just covered up whatever flavor the fish had, and the whole thing was just lacking in flavor. Maybe put more like lime in it, or sweet pickled onions.   Pho was good - flavorful broth, good amoun of beef, and noodles cooked well.   Viet iced coffee - delicious!!!   The service was friendly, and prompt. I loved the decor of the restaurant too - kind of like a hip bar, where you can watch sports (lots of tvs), and beer and alcoholic beverages.   My only complaint is that I wish they included more Asian drinks like boba, or viet desserts with the coconut milk and grass jelly.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome iced viet coffee
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fork for scale
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JP3Aou4dvIna14RhRfFLhQ.text: As much as I want to give District One 5-stars....I can't. First let me be clear: this is a 5-star place. The food is amazing and I love the atmosphere. Sadly...the service was disorganized & nonexistent. The servers were very nice & when ours was present he was helpful but we spent more time waiting for him then we did speaking with him. Additionally, our food was run out by different people at different times - I was practically finished with my bowl of Pho when they brought the veg plate out for it. But the biggest disappointment of the evening: PARKING!  There was none. I parked in the shopping center next to it and walked; my friends parked across Jones & played Frogger trying to cross. This isn't the best area at 7pm on a Saturday night. It doesn't change for the better at 9pm.   The menu District One has on their website is wrong. I had my heart set on lobster pho when I arrived but when I found out 1) the menu online is wrong and 2) the price was more than whats online I couldn't justify it.   I really wanted something different so went with the rib eye pho. OMG is was delicious. Lots of noodles, perfect broth & the rib eye melted in my mouth. I hate going to Chinatown but I will just for this.   Spring rolls were disappointing. Bland. Too much mint. Not sure what the crunchy pork was inside the roll. These are traditionally made with the pork and shrimp on the outside of the roll visible through the rice paper. And nowhere near the amount of mint crammed into this. It had absolutely no flavor and the peanut sauce wasn't about to help change it.    Oxtail pho I heard was gorgeous, too.   Shrimp skewers weren't cooked through. My friend is an idiot and doesn't send food back so she literally threw $8 away. ($3.99/each)  Came here for my birthday and overall I was very pleased. Will definitely come back...but not at 7pm on a Saturday night.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lceNVv1dxOQv3dZc17BOQg.text: My Dad's Birthday today family decided to go for District One Kitchen and Bar this is always good place to eat Asian fusion food we had  Pho Tai Rib Eye,  couple of Oxtail fried rice,Pho GA it's chicken, Double Down Ribs and Pork Chop,Belly Buns, Crispy Bird's Nest Noodles. This is what I call dinner awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Bird&#39;s Nest Noodle
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Down pork chop
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Down short ribs

99N8TkGFxYXhK_LFW2skWQ.text: Lobster pho was amazing . I have eaten lots of pho but this ups the bar . Great service . This pho is something you must try I was blown away

j1r01nbafmappPeLeLiHlg.text: My wife and I had our first date here almost 4 years ago.  We love the food and atmosphere.  So, we have a special affinity for District One.  When we have visitors in town, District One is usually on the short list of local spots to recommend and check out.  Last night, the service was just not that good.  I think I had to step out of our booth 4-5 times to ask for assistance throughout our time there.  I'm a pretty patient person, but this wasn't cool.  Kudos to you all on the food last night, but the service last night was a sure thumbs down.

yqJuSxd-abi6HCjrquGvzA.text: Very good! Had to go twice when I was in town! Our group all ordered different items and they all were very good! I order the oxtail pho which I never had and omg it was delicious! They definitely are not cheap about giving you meat! Must go!

WoKagZisHRcMmw5xsp_aTA.text: THE BIG BONE SOUP!!! The lobster pho was tasty too but was a little over cooked and tough. The big bone soup, however, is worth every penny. I ordered a side of noodles to add to it and could not finish. Two people could eat this and be really full. Definitely an experience worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE bowl. I thought I could eat all of it. I thought wrong...
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For size comparison. THIS IS A REALLY BIG BOWL!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eUM7tMAK75CLZlDvsKF-oA.text: Excellent Vietnamese food. I came here on vacation from Los Angeles and decided to give this place try. Definitely was blown away with the quality of the food and the exceptional service they provided. I don't give many five star reviews and I usually critique pretty tough on food restaurants, but this was definitely worth the five stars. If you want awesome food in Vegas definitely come here.

PrGurE7uhM_vWjVjFgSqLA.text: Having heard of this place for years, I was excited to see that it is close to our new home. I love dining at the bar here because of the fun flavorful options and great service. The happy hour offers delicious food options at a great price and allows a great means of sampling new flavors. There is often a seasonal ceviche or creation and the bartenders always mention this in relation to what we order.

aLhmNYllOFcu4jFG8EynzA.text: Must try the oxtail fried rice. So delicious. Can't find food like this anywhere. We must visit every time we are in Vegas. Even though it's not as close to the strip as other places it's definitely worth the trek.

l2SIBypba5AzENBIhIzC3A.text: I don't really understand what the hype is for this place. However, I do appreciate that they open late. The interior of District One is quite interesting. I would say it reminded me of boiling crab but definitely a more upgrade version. The tables were quite spacious which is a huge plus for me. The service was mediocre, I wished they were a little more attentive but I don't blame them since they were getting ready to close.  For appetizer we went with their oxtail fries. The fries were on the salty side. I probably won't recommend them unless you really like salt! As for entrees my friends and I decided to try their pho. Usually when I order pho tai I like my meat on the side because I hate overcooked meat. However, I decided to leave it in my soup. My friend requested to have his meat on the side.  When we got our noodles, I noticed the soup wasn't really hot. My meat was still pink after 8 minutes! It wasn't even medium rare it was RAW. As for my friend his meat was just plain not cooked. We asked if we could have our phos reheated. They gave us a bowl of hot broth instead which was fine with us.  Overall, I never experienced pho like this before. I definitely wouldn't recommend my friends or family to try this place.

hytQIZCx9X94Z4_RDB81jQ.text: I didn't realize that I hadn't updated my review, because my 2nd visit was outstanding. My friend and I had a great meal, sampling several dishes, Service was much better this time around as well.   Ordered: slow braised pork belly in young coconut juice. This was divine! 5/5 the king crab legs in a garlic type sauce. A bit tough because the crab wasn't broken open as much but nevertheless good. 4/5 Beef and lemongrass wrapped in Betel leaves....so much flavor. 4/5 Mekong River Soup - my friend had this and she liked it. I couldn't sample it because she added plenty of peppers.   Overall this was really a fun, delicious meal. We were there around 4pm on a Friday, so it wasn't busy but soon got packed with more people for happy hour. It was quite the improvement from my first time, which is why I felt the need to update this review.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. slow braised pork belly in young coconut sauce

NG37pbTZCbDsZwXYmhhazg.text: This place is still a staple that we visit everytime we come to vegas. The oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice are the top 2 dishes that we order.  The spicy hue noodles is decent as well but sometimes they bring the bowl with a lot of oil floating at the top of the bowl.  Probably best to ask them to try avoid getting so much oil in the bowl

5ykmvu7Xm0ISKgb31aDACQ.text: Garlic Serano Wings were fire! "Viet" michelada was delicious and went perfect with the wings. Atmosphere is chill and they play hip hop throwbacks which made everything even better. Servers were friendly and helpful with explaining things on the menu, definitely worth trying!

exyMB_fxEWGUeeRDtCN-Ig.text: We had the amazing big bone soup, eggrolls, oxtail fried rice, garlic noodles, and the nam pho. Every dish was very tasty, well prepared, and looked appetizing. Service was great! Highly recommended!

NOjcWrvYfmZpE136Cl9BUg.text: Outstanding service by the bartender ! Ate alone at the bar, had a speciality Bloody Mary & took the recommendations of the bartender for food selection. I had pork belly bao & crispy wings for appetizers, wings were outstanding & bao was pretty good. Then I had the oxtail fried rice, very good large portion, full of meat & veggies.  Trendy Asian fusion, good food & excellent service, I recommend.

lHMFSidIDONOqk3tkDKflQ.text: Good vibe. Staff was friendly and attentive.  The oxtail fries was good but bland.  The big bone soup was definitely picture-worthy. Saw lots of other tables ordering it too. Tastes just like bone soup should. FYI- no noodles in the soup. They have an extensive drinks menu. Only got to try the Hennessy cafe sua da. So good. It's a must try.  Would definitely go back and try the other items.

xl8BPla1RKa5WwD0tjDDRA.text: Love the restaurant's cleanliness. Atmosphere is nice too but the food is pretty bad. We ordered spicy hue, double down, fried chicken Serrano, and wonton noodles. Everything was so salty but lacked other important flavors that makes each dish and not truly authentic Vietnamese and a lot more expensive.  So disappointed because the reviews were so great!

gmsArBPCweFW0WY2JSgAaw.text: District One definitely blew past my expectations. Ambience was nice but the food was even better! I come from an area where Vietnamese restaurants, specifically Pho restaurants, are very prominent. In my opinion, District One exceeded all of them, and I can confidently say that I had some of the best Vietnamese food I've ever tried there. We ordered the surf and turf pho (half lobster with beef), the coconut fatty pork with rice, oxtail fries, and pork jowl skewers. The jowl skewers were outta this world good (especially with freshly sprinkled lime juice), oxtail fries were flavorful and smokey, and surf and turf pho featured delicate, fresh lobster, tender beef, and ultra rich broth. Would highly recommend anyone to try this place if they are around the area.

VuR_D35ZRL-JUZlfsc1-MQ.text: I have finally found a Pho restaurant that I can call my favorite. Friendly staff, especially Renz, who was all smiles & friendly for us at 1am. This place looks awesome inside and what was pretty neat to me was on the way to the bathroom, there are about 4 sinks lined up in the hallway!   I normally think Pho is Pho. It's all the same. But I think that with the nice atmosphere and the friendly staff, my food tasted so good. Especially the incredible crispy and delicious chicken wings! At other Pho places I normally order Pho Dat Biet but I never eat the tripe and when I am here, I always order Pho Tai Nam, which is perfect because it's a combination bowl basically, without the tripe. Meant to be!  Their Happiest Hours Monday-Friday are from 5pm-7pm and Sunday-Thursday 12am-2am.  At about 1am there was hardly anyone at the restaurant but when I came here to eat again it was packed at about 8pm! I have yet to figure out a good, reasonable time to go where you don't have to wait for seating, but I do believe this place is worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Why don&#39;t every Pho/Noodle place have these?!?! So convenient!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Nam

t--9gaMg6zuCbjppFI2WLg.text: I wish I could give it a 5 stars. I really like the place. The bird nest chow mein is really good.  Lobster Pho, well the flavor is good, but it's not freshly cook the time I ordered. The lobster is pre cooked :-(  yikes   The lobster head's meat is mushy, the lobster body temperature is not hot, totally two different lobsters , oh no is not freshly made to order and the waitress confirmed it. is it worth $50.00 ...hun  I hope one day the restaurant will consider ... " fresh = cook to order"

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

erYBFasUw7otOwWYAHNDqw.text: Everything is amazing, but the spring roll, snail and surf and turf were out of this world!!

_krPRiNBgybEfZ800tN9jg.text: The food is awesome. Especially the ox tail fried rice! The service is just as great.  A bit a a wait but worth it. We always drop by when we are in town.

TAMwSsKyN0Mg0hUdHYayWg.text: I went to this place 3 times already!  The food is amazing.  The oysters are a bomb!!! Must try the Bloody Mary!! The Bloody Mary is the best one I ever had.  If you take the soup for to go they will get you 2 to go cups and split the soup and the spaghetti so it won't go bad.  Amazing place. Must try it.

kgN5YLAi_63kiCTm_MRFew.text: We had came here because they were famous for the Lobster Pho. We had got here about after mid-night, and they were still serving the Lobter Pho. This place also has a full bar which they ask you when you arrive, if you want a table, booth or bar seating.  I personally did not get it but the I did taste and the broth is very flavorful. For $45 a bowl, I am not sure if it was worth it only because it  seemed very skimp on the noodles. The meat is already out of the shell for you so all you get is the lobster meat and a little bit of noodles.  Yes, it is a must try, but again...no unless you win big at a casino and can afford it and only like a little bit of noodles.   I had the Bun Bo Hue, which I personally thought it lacked flavor. My bowl came out first. Traditionally you wait till everyones food is out before you can start eating. We must have waited another 15 minutes for the lobster pho to come so my bowl sat there luke warm, but the waitress was nice enough to bring me out a bowl of hot steaming broth that was packed full of flavor. Maybe what I got was not the best choice but the pictures and reviews from other looked really good.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

knBuUEVUuCymYd3FLg17kA.text: Really good food and Pho. Their specialty is lobster dishes and their prices are very reasonable. It is located in a strip mall shopping center in the Chinatown portion of town about 15 minutes away from the strip for a $16 cab ride. It is WELL worth the time and energy to get off the strip.

tBf3qBBqUJqbieZnQDFwMA.text: O M Fn G  Ox tail pho is all you really need to order.  We started off with garlic-serrano wings.  Tasty with a kick and fried perfectly.  Moist on the inside.  Also ordered the pork belly buns.  Only thing lacking was the peanut sauce.. a True peanut sauce u get on spring rolls would've made that dish amazing.  Ox tail pho.  Omg.. best thing I've eaten all year.  Pictures don't do it justice.  Just get it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic-serrano wings

osS0PLSpyE0LKcWWYQG9ig.text: Me and my bf went here for our 8 months and the food isn't really as good as the pictures. The calamari tasted like it was just fried and there was no squid in it. They were really small and there's barely any squid. the fish tacos just taste like avocado and lettuce. The pho was alright. I would of enjoyed it more if there weren't 10 guys drinking and being super loud right in front of us. Still have a headache from that. Wouldn't try it again, it kind of reminded me why not to go out to eat. The customer service is very nice tho A+ on that. Other than that I was disappointed to spend our anniversary there.

2xCAgVkfSatN4Z4-yZwqQA.text: Food and service are impressive. Had the savory big bone soup with noodles, pork belly buns, and coconut ice cream. All were delicious full of satisfying flavors. I always make a point to come here when I'm in town. I highly recommend.

XH4Uh9Wm30PM3oC0Ux55pw.text: Based on a Yelper friends review, I had this place in mind since I Love Vietnamese food. I have to say it didn't quite meet all my expectations, but when you consider all the elements: food, ambiance, service, and price, I would agree that District One is not bad.   Loved the ambiance (lots of room, not much waiting, good for large groups). Service was good.   The food had mixed reviews in our group. Me personally, I thought both the chicken pho and lobster pho were delicious - the broth packed in the flavor. I also like the rice combo dish. We choose kalbi, which included a side of lop chong sausage and sunny side up egg. Disliked: not a fan of their papaya salad nor the fresh spring rolls. I also didn't care for the vodka mule drink, nor the coconut cocktail.   Stick to beer or wine, play it safe.   Otherwise not a bad place to meet up with friends.   I still think my little hole in the wall mom n pop Vietnamese place would run circles around this place as far as food goes. But ...this is a better fun hang out choice, in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho!

JGYSKMcL-Y9LFZdV_THgBA.text: A little better than average but for $39.99 ... Ummm not ... I rather go to Boston for twin lobster ! Much cheaper ... Much bigger ...and the broth was ok ... Nothing special in the broth to make it tastier than any other Vietnamese pho place ... The oxtail fried rice was extremely tasty ... It had that wok fragrant flavor which is usually only obtained by an experienced season chef! I'll order that again ... I wish I had a bigger stomach so that I can try some of the specials

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho - a whopping $39.99 ... Worth it? Maybe if you live here ... Not if ur visiting . Lobster is less than 1lb!

I-gAyCxgMK-ZKtNvDkyyvg.text: Great place to grab lunch or dinner ! Parking is hectic in this plaza ! Service is decent. Took a star off because no one came back to refill my drink ! I had to ask numerous of times and it wasn't that busy ... Overall will come back for the food !! Love the pork belly and beef carpaccio yuummmm

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio

Qrki_y_I7hmTW5c7KX4YsA.text: My favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas. Atmosphere is fun, food is yummy, the oxtail pho is awesome, place is clean.

1klgOj9epwvO0kHgxGJqQQ.text: Food was amazing ! Started with 4 appetizers including the delicious oysters. The lobster was A1 quality! First time there but definitely won't be my last.

ViPKiCIfZ31-XJ-0nPmt8Q.text: Good food, Friendly servers but service is a little bit slow even there is a lot of them and not that much people. Double Down porkchop is good. 2 stars for their menu, not so attractibe at all. printed and on the clipboard. hope they could improve on that

bZYNJNwIA3FwohzI9ix8kQ.text: The food is amazing. Everything recommended and ordered was great. My favorites are the oxtail pho, carpaccio, garlic noodle with steak and eggs, and coconut ice cream. Haha I could add more but then it's be the whole menu. I'm not a seafood person but the oysters were to die for. The lobster pho is a whole lobster in your pho.  The service is great too, very attentive and the servers are always making sure we were happy.

vN9f2iq6R2F_3232r6z_iA.text: I wish this place was closer to the strip. It is completely out of the way, a pain in the ass to get there, and yet I can't wait to get to vegas again in a few weeks to go again. The food here is awesome and one fo my favorite vietnamese places in the world. Get the lobster pho and thank me later!  The pork belly buns were fantastic as well as the egg rolls and wings. Im getting so hungry thinking about it again right now!

0Eh5gVNNTHhgR4ey2NGwHA.text: We had trouble finding a place to eat while in town. This place is solid. My GF and I visited this place 2 nights in a row. The menu has a nice variety to enjoy each visit. The staff and their service was great. They will not disappoint. If this place was in San Diego, I would be a regular.  Im now going to eat fish sauce glazed chicken wings with oxtail fried rice.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our 2nd night here.

89Ho_2_Cv6K2Z8zm33jq6w.text: We stumbled on to this place during a business trip. glad we did , clean, Reasonably priced & food was awesome.  We had the steak salad and a shrimp pho. Will definitely will return here . great atmosphere. Staff was very friendly  but a little slow.

vV4QLcR7S5Wv7-bO2R85Gg.text: We ordered 5 spice chicken took a long time to get it and when it came chicken was RAW BLOODY!!service was slow at midnight .paid bill in full.

Zu4aTZNzlfqZVevG4Jds2w.text: I was surprised when I got there that there wasn't that many people because the food was great. I ordered the combo plate with the pork chop and a side of beef. Because I have a very strict diet the restaurant was very accommodating to switching a few things out and replacing it with stuff I was able to eat. The pork chop itself was very juicy. The side of beef was good but I thought it was a little too salty.   The best dish I would recommend would be the beef carpaccio. It was perfectly marinated with the right amount of lime and basil.   If you have dogs I highly recommend the oxtail soup. The soup itself was surprisingly not salty like how I've had in other restaurants. The oxtail was a bit hard to eat but the marination of it was amazing. The meat would just fall off the bone.   FYI. The parking in that center is horrible!

9y7nqTNQK65kEth0mD0AYw.text: We went in around 2pm as a party of 3. The place was not busy. We ordered one beef ball pho, lobster pho, and veggies as appetizer. We sat waiting for an hour all while the server told us it'll be coming out soon. Then she comes over and tells us she's hungover and never put the orders in. Appetizer finally comes out. 30 min later the phos come out, but she brings oxtail pho instead of lobster. Beef ball pho is fine but she doesn't bring any of the topping veggies so we sit for a while again. One member of our group is pescatarian so she can't eat it. After making this many mistakes our server doesn't make eye contact with us anymore. Manager explains that they're busy and doesn't seem to realize the server never put out order in in the first place. The food was good and the manager gave us 2 complimentary desserts, but we're not coming back. 2 hours for pho is beyond ok.

0JJrP9cAPtK-arYCCeqJbQ.text: The Pho is on point, love the Happy Hour Specials, must try the Sashimi Yellow Tail Tacos!!! Service is 5-Star!!!

-t1B3P7Vky7yTqDAYBQwqQ.text: Off the hook...rare beef to the bone finger licking good!! :))  Enjoy all these foods we've tried too. Checkout our yummy eats! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Tacos
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya Salad

9Grn7VWG0YaD1aw8sDJOMQ.text: Their pho bowl is full of flavors.  Husband ordered the big bone bowl he said it was delicious. Will have to cone back and try the turf n surf pho or whole lobster pho.

YwZmQrZ_sBTxX5zX99Fr5Q.text: Very delicious. Good place for big parties. And to chill with friends. Or even go to the bar and get a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 pounds of their specialty shrimp sauce. Very delicious. Good flavor.

hNlCC1D0MSIlKwUlT5gYzA.text: Went with a large group for a birthday celebration.  Waitress and staff were attentive thorughout the night. The restaurant decor was pleasing and soothing, it was lamost like a place you would visit if you were near the beach or coast. The music ambience was modern and enjoyable.  The food menu had a few selections which was good, as too many options at times seems to make things complicated. We ordered the Edemame for appetizers and were not too thrilled with the sauce. The Belly Buns were delicious and so were the Beef Lemongrass Skewers (love that the lemongrass stick was encompassed by the beef in order to enhance the flavor). As for their Pho dishes, I wish they had a lean meat option, I had the vegetable Pho and was happy the veggies were not "frozen" but freshly cut.  Overall experience even with clitches of large parties being able to split checks, it was worth coming here. I recommend it.

MC50O5yUiCn8bFpysmKJtg.text: Good beer selection.   Got the oxtail fries. A little too wet making the fries soggy, but flavor was there. Nothing a few flips in a scorching hot saute pan can't fix.  4 stars for service, bartender and the great variety of beers here!   I hear they have great food here, but didn't get to try much due to eating dinner about 5 minutes before coming here.

cWIvfJujdBpjYo_ulsyLZA.text: Definitely worth the cab ride off the strip for some Vietnamese food.  - Oxtail pho is on point. Good broth that doesn't taste like it's loaded with MSG. Very generous portion of oxtail.  - Oxtail fried rice is also good. Loved the crispy texture.  - Fish sauce wings were OK. A little too fishy for my taste.  Service isn't like your typical Vietnamese restaurant which means no service at all. The staff is very friendly and attentive. They have a bunch of TVs if you don't want to miss a game as well.

l7ZeuzKqYRyPfN4RX7XiqA.text: The food was good with generous portion size. The ambiance was great and enjoyed the look and feel of the restaurant. The food was ok, but there is a lot of competition. The plus is their variety, you might have to go to a few other restaurants if your friends all want different things or you all might agree on this place.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi scallops

BbIpuHX-2lQiMY8I9FELIw.text: Had bomb ass Oxtail Pho..  Best Pho in town.   Atmosphere is trendy and hip.  Friendly staff and real authentic Asian food a twist..

s1--AvlgpapJemurETGUOA.text: The food was below average,  waste of time coming here.  My bff and I were disappointed.

Jj1EvOnmSMySmAPbnFmK2w.text: Delicious, fun, good service. A Trifecta! Came here with my coworkers for a birthday, and had a great experience. Fun and casual place with modern music and smiling staff. Clean and well designed interior with comfortable chairs.  Ordered appetizers and food, and nothing disappointed. The Oxtail fries are to die for, and Belly Buns were awesome. Fresh tasty Spring Rolls have a crunchy flair from a little fried wonton inside. The service was top notch. The server was very helpful in accommodating my diabetes, so I was able to order my Shrimp Pho with 1/2 the noodles and adding fresh vegetables. It was delicious and enough for 3 meals! To round out the birthday, we finished with the most awesome coconut and fruit ice cream sprinkled with peanuts. Wish I knew what it was! I was only going to have one bite, but confess it was so good I snuck a few more. This will be a new favorite dining spot!

A1Yw9jBqr3WJSc5g-dvTnA.text: My Dad, husband and myself all ate here Wednesday evening.  I wish I remembered out servers name as she was very nice.  She pointed out to us that it was happy hour for a bit longer and so we ordered the wings, pork belly buns and egg rolls.  The egg rolls were standard, the wings I expected to be saucy but it was more like fried chicken, and I did enjoy the pork belly bun even though I must warn you it was very fatty and one is more then enough if you don't usually eat foods that rich!  Also, I could only stand to eat one wing because it was so greasy.  I reeeally wished the wings were saucy and not greasy.  I also had the pho which was very good.  The food runners forgot our tables limes, basil and sprouts so we were almost finished when we asked our server if they served limes and she went and got them.  My Dad ordered the bone marrow with noodles and I think he was very happy.  He said not to get them if you are ever on a date because it is so messy!  The server gave him a few wet naps, plastic gloves and I think a bib to help with the mess, but it was still messy.  I think my Dad enjoyed it even though it looked like he was Fred Flintstone eating a Brontosaur.  The server wrapped one of the bones up for my dog and my dog also loved it!  I liked eating here.  It wasn't the best ever but I'm sure I can find more on the menu I would like better.  I saw other people here with coconuts with straws in them and I wanted one but was too full by then!

Gy2HS4VSXPg1_9WvQChE_A.text: My friend and I tried out this restaurant about a week ago.  We both liked the atmosphere, decorations, etc...However...we both were disappointed. The reasoning behind the three stars is that they completely forgot us.  We ordered an appetizer to start off with which we got.  When it was time to order our entree, we were forgotten. It was almost an hour when our waitress came up to us and asked us if we wanted dessert and we told her we didn't even eat yet.  She looked at us like we were joking.  We told we were not and told her we didn't receive our food yet.  Throughout the ordeal, our waitress also failed to tell us that my friend's order ran out.  Why couldn't they have told her that sooner than later when we nearly waited almost an hour for our food.  So my friend had to re-order and ended up getting the Oxtail Pho instead.  The reason we were forgotten, a few large parties had come in and that's why we were forgotten.  It's unacceptable! Just because a large party had come in, you catered to them first when we were already there hours on and haven't eaten yet.  We finally got our food, after nearly going on now for two hours of waiting.  I sent mine back because it was filled with onions.  I had them to take it off.  After all of this mess, it was quite pretty funny how they kept checking up on us every minute and second when the staff nearly forgot us for hours.  My friend and I were not impressed how they handled this mess.  To top it off, we were billed at the end and all we got was a big apology.  So at this point, going back to District One not for awhile until they figure out how to fix a mess like this because it can happen to anyone as well.

OQ-qLNKgthaKY7EprFJjDQ.text: This place hands down is the best pho I have ever tasted! I'm from Northern Virginia and we have a lot of places known for their pho so when I say it was amazing... it truly was amazing. It did not disappoint!!!  My hubby's friend introduced us to this place and he is from Northern Virginia originally as well so we automatically trusted his tastes buds when he said this place was awesome and it really was delicious here lol  To me, Pho is the best hangover cure ever! It is what I look for the day after partying hard and needing some soup in my belly lololz  I loved the oxtail pho here and the portions are just HUGE!  Dont be shy to suck on them bones! It has all that flavor and meat stuck in between em!   I also got the coconut water which comes inside a young coconut with the coconut flesh inside of it too. They give you a long teaspoon to get the flesh out and that coconut water is definitely a hangover remedy for sure as well!  We also got the oxtail fried rice. It was to die for! I was so blown away by the flavor packed into the rice snd the oxtail was seasoned perfectly before being thrown into the pan to fry along side of the rice as well.   The hubs and I came here twice during our Vegas trip! Definitely well worth coming down here from the strip.   Highly recommend the place!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ndKsuUtUtkViJguvxqcpmg.text: Always good, always consistent.  Brought friends here for dinner following a day at a convention and we got the pho ribeye, steak and eggs (shaken beef!), and the pork belly.  I kept talking about the coconut ice cream that comes in a coconut so we got it.  After a disappointing ordeal earlier in the evening this made up for it.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese beef carpaccio

ti7bnDJapuGmcmifhJCbaw.text: Been wanting to try this place since I read great reviews about oxtail fried rice.... Everyone that works here were so friendly! Didn't even know there were 2 happy hours!  We had 30 mins to order before it ends.  Ordered half dozen oysters, papaya salad, eggrolls, bao pork.  Oysters and bao pork were delish and yummy!!!  I would def order more next time in town!  Papaya salad and eggrolls was ok.  Now to the main course:  Infamous Oxtail Fried Rice- yes it was flavorful but way too much fatty meat!  Pho Tai Nam- broth was good.    Overall not bad place.  Would def come back during happy hours and pho!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour half dozen oysters
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour bao pork

3BL6AVwqvxtUJXxYzDLLZA.text: I've been here twice now in the span of three months (to a city I don't live in) and it's just so good, I'm going to make it a goal to come every time I'm in Vegas.   This place is great. Open for THANKSGIVING. Yes, thank you, my fellow hardworking Vietnamese people! I was shocked when they were, but since I had no plans and no family around, here was my opportunity to have a feast on my own.   The dishes I've had: Got the Japanese oysters to start and they were of course very good (not my first rodeo).  Cornish hen rice dish Bun bo hue (I think it was named spicy soup on the menu)  Bird's nest Lobster fried rice Bo luc lac salad  Some veggie dish   Everything is great. The Cornish hen is so crispy and juicy. It's not that dry, but it does lack flavor. I basically used all of my fish sauce that it came with. But the rice is great too - it's not super easy making that rice right.   Spicy soup is great, but don't expect it to taste like traditional bun bo hue.   Bird's nest - fun, crispy noodles with stir fried veggies. Good, but I'd never get again.   Lobster rice: yummmm but it's pricey. I've had better, but this one is solid, though on a bit on the oily side.   The menu is smaller than general viet places but it's good. I don't think a lot can go wrong.   Service is ok - not rude like usual Asian places, but not on the ball either. A full bar is offered, so you can drink away and it's a GREAT place to watch sports. They have a ton of tha everywhere with the latest games, so you can watch the cowboys whip butt. (But more likely be whipped...) Get out of the strip and make it to district one where you'll be able to find a table, get a drink, and enjoy some pretty good eats!

ZLasvnub2TCuUOXfsVzN9Q.text: We had seen a video on the restaurant and it colored the food options we tried. Not surprisingly, it was not the cheap eats. I'll just say ahead of time that the speciality dishes were excellent, but on another trip, there are a lot of other things I'd like to try. There were four of us, and we were hungry. We started with the Belly Buns. I'd have them again. They melted in your mouth, and had great flavor. We got the whole Maine Lobster Pho. Very elegant, and somewhat subtle. There was enough to share around if we were careful. We then shared the Big Bone Broth. This thing is a monster, although there isn't as much as it looks. Once the truly big bones are removed it's reasonably sized. Although, the flavors were outsized, and there was plenty of good marrow. It was a great take on Pho. Finally, we had the Five Spice Cornish Hen. This was perhaps the actual highlight. Complex, good flavors, unlike what I normally associate with a Pho restaurant. The place was noisy with quite a few people watching a football (soccer) game and sharing their their thoughts regularly with cheers and hoots. You really felt you had left Vegas and moved temporarily to Vietnam compared to other places around Chinatown.

kWtYoCc0zYOWCFnWUaYt1Q.text: On the off chance that you need Ox anything, they have it! They are not niggardly with the parts too. So worth the cash and the server was astonishing too!

WP5ZdVdbFz0NG9Xn-HyZPA.text: Great food... real interesting take on some dishes... loved the sea snails I got n the wings were real tasty!!! The friendly staff n great environment was the topping on the cake!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea snails
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish sauce wings
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled calamari

KvY2Zst0YAGppWVWdhwOJw.text: It would have been a five stars for the food. Really delicious and creative. Lobster pho was expensive but surprisingly tasty. However, the 2 stars only is because the waiters need more training. There were many of them but when we asked for some pepper, the first one ignored us completely and gave us one of those nasty look like "why did you bother me?" And no surprise, he did not bring out the pepper. It took three attempts to finally get the peppers, and when that arrived, we finished half the noodle soup already.  The young guys are generally very nice, the older guys look like they did not want to be there. One of the waiter spilled a copious amount of the soup he brought out. They just left it there to dry out on the floor. Is this good practice?

kxgnikkSYsMYXPd2rYY8aQ.text: Their big bone ph broth is amazing. Being Viet legit and knowing how to make authentic ph myself, I was completely impressed by it. The flavors and spices are so rich, I didn't need herbs, lime, or any sauces. The meat just fell off the bones. The Mekong noodle soup and pork belly baos were delicious too. I love grilled calamari but the one served here is a bit too salty and to add sauce to it. The customer service is excellent and restaurant is perfect inside. Lots of old gen Asians there and steadily busy.

Bq_Kcy9bu0XiwjAz8FSfQQ.text: We went here on a recommendation from a friend. Service was excellent they're very attentive. We ordered the surf and turf pho. Definitely unique and had to try it. Broth was very rich and not something you would see every day and presentation was on point. Oxtail marrow fried rice was the best dish and highly recommended. Nice atmosphere for a relaxing dinner so if you're in town check them out.

yOvQM7Ft92MvCgHEBM8_bA.text: Great food ! Good Service!  We tried the Fresh Fried Fish, Oxtail Fried Rice,  Pork Chop and the wings. They were all sooo yummy!

6JWNR9spsM5oXAGK2iNWoA.text: Everyone needs to experience the Big Bone Soup atleast once. Yes, I meant to say "experience". It's definitely a hands on soup and it is worth every bite. The broth was perfect by itself without adding any Sriracha or Hoison Sauce. We had to order the pho noodles separately because the soup doesn't come with any, which was surprising, but definitely great on it's own if you don't do noodles.  I'm craving the soup as we speak!

1Cg77P4UAHDc3l3xYdX-cg.text: I may or may not have gone here twice within 5 days.   The first time we went there we ordered the Oxtail Pho, Coconut Pork Belly and the Double Down with short ribs. This was a mistake on our end because it was a lot of rich food all at once, but it was worth the pain.   This is crazy, but I'm not big om Pho. D1 changed my opinion 100%. The flavors of the broth, the tenderness of the oxtail qnd the freshness of the ingredients was excellent.   I get nervous about pork belly because it is a big piece of fat, but wow. The pork belly tasted like butter, and the broth it was in, when you added the carrots and veggies was phenomenal. You can really tell this is slow cooked to perfection!  The short ribs? I ate these up like a cavewoman. Unreal how good they were. I've never bad short ribs at a restaurant because of my allergy and because most restaurants use normal soy sauce. I could not believe how good they were, and it came with Chinese sausage and pickled veggies which made it all happiness on a plate.   The next time we got the beef carpaccio, and just WOW. I could not believe have indanely good it was. There are no words. No words. Just eat it.   They use a gluten free soy sauce, so basically anything that isn't dusted is gluten free friendly which is great as well!  Great service, very reasonable prices, delicious drinks that aren't too sweet (try the Donkey Mule or 5 Pear), and a fun atmosphere. I will go here as often as I can! Definitely worth every penny and then some!

fxV3ttPalkqhLeIy4jtaIA.text: Alright let me give you a run down of this Viet Rest in Vegas China Town...  + One star for decoration since the theme is kitchen n bar...very hip place to meet up w friends...  We ordered chicken wings glazed with fish sauce (Canh ga nuoc mam).  This might be the only decent dish...  2nd appetizer, papaya salad, so i can taste the 'goi kho bo' sauce but the dish has too much sauce.  There are certain dish that you do not want to Fusion and this is one of them...- one star  I also had the surf n tuff Pho - $35 (fillet beef and lobster).  The broth is not bad but it's on a salty side.  The fillet is just alright...I haven't found any pho place can top Pho Dien in Houston TX yet...- one star  Over all, I can only give this place 3 stars and it's not on my approved list for my friends n family.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DHN3SlwC-h7JaLT1li9p6g.text: One of my favorite casual Viet spots in LV. Gastropub meets Vietnamese, a sure Nguyen. I suggest trying all the dishes cuz they're so good but my personal favorites are the serrano chicken wangs and the oxtail fried rice. Never will I get tired of those dishes. They also have a Henny drink with coffee in it, a must try. Staff is always friendly and the service is good.

XMI6by9qtkrHa3SauNA9IQ.text: My new go-to spot!! Coming here after a hard day at work always hits the spot. Though it's located in a very busy area, it's worth It!! Next door is q karaoke, cafe moda, and all the other fun stuff.  I usually come here at midnight or so when it's not too busy.  The servers are very quick and attentive, also very friendly! The food also comes out quick and always tastes bomb. I usually come here just for the garlic fries because they're that good.    Happy hour is the best time to come.  They have $4 shots (I always order Jameson with sweet tea), $3 garlic fries, tacos, etc.  I always order the oxtail pho and garlic fries.  I also tried the papaya salad, oxtail fried rice, wings, coconut ice cream, matcha drink, and garlic noodles.  They all taste amazing.  Besides the garlic fries being my favorite, I also recommend the coconut ice cream.  So good!!!!!! It's also in a coconut which makes I.t even better.  During happy hour we only spend $40-$60 with alcohol.  Nothing satisfies me more than garlic fries and Jameson.    This joint is really great for late night grub after karaoke, work, whatever it is.  Recommend!!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w5n8F34OCblrLgjBpiiIXQ.text: We love coming here for happy hour. Their grilled squid and oxtail fried rice is our favorite but you definitely can't go wrong with the lobster pho either. I love me some papaya salad but this place was just okay.

M6VCyjuT0t7qHewzs9-Rxw.text: This place was awesome! Food was good and service was excellent.  I had the lobster pho with a Henny iced coffee!!!  Sure it's a little gimmicky.. but it all tasted real good. LOL  A little far from The Strip but will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas!

R_8CpAlvs-9VmnBHBRpjnA.text: I feel like this place is hyped up. The Hennessy cafe (which was the main reason I went) was so-so. I think it's because they use Hennessy Black (which is more bitter). I would have gladly paid more for VSOP.   The food: oxtail fried rice. Just do it. For the price, the taste makes it justifiable. SO flavorful and delicious.   Serrano hot wings were a bit on the salty/fishy side.  Over all it was a nice little place to go to get a pho fix . Like all places in Vegas, it was a little Over priced, but if it isn't over priced it wouldn't be Vegas. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lb56Vw9S1IBjXhqakuVqlA.text: A friend wanted to try here because of the social media buzz. There's nothing really wrong with it, but I think this place is mostly hype.   Free parking lot for the plaza. We didn't have any trouble but we were there right when they opened for lunch.  Service was decent. They were friendly and checked up on us. They forgot 2 requests, but fixed it right away when we asked again.   For the food, my group ordered family style. I got to try some of their pork belly buns (fried and steamed), garlic noodles, and surf and turf pho, and I decided not to touch the other dishes.   We got 2 versions of the pork belly buns, but the star of the dishes was seriously lacking. It was mostly gelatinous fat instead of a nice balance. The surf and turf pho definitely had big pieces of lobster in it. It didn't make me feel like I was getting ripped off by the cost. I wasn't feeling the broth though. The basic garlic noodles were actually pretty good, probably my favorite of what I tried.   I wouldn't choose to come back based on what else Vegas has to offer, but I can see the draw for the Instagram crowd.

jO0xRJsm8dxlPTJL9Ua7RQ.text: My rating would be like a 3.7 so I rounded up. Food is good. We ordered the Pho Oxtail, Vegetarian Spring Rolls, Belly Buns, Chicken Clay Pot, and the Fresh Coconut. Hubby said Oxtail Pho was good, but no wow factor. Belly buns were good, bread was really fluffy. Spring rolls were okay, but a little to minty for my personal taste (vermicelli), although the peanut sauce was amazing! Chicken clay pot was good but again, too strong with herb flavors. The coconut was great, I love coconuts so it was great, nice and cold.  Service was good, never felt forgotten and she was really nice. Atmosphere was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belly buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken clay pot and vegetarian spring rolls.

uxWjClYGA6vUqm0aYTviZQ.text: I love this place , gotta have my good morning Vietnam Bloody Mary when I'm in town. The best I've ever had. Food is delish, it's so flavorful. The staff are friendly. Highly recommended

piKxzOq-IS2s3sV7YYZ0Jg.text: I rarely ever leave the strip when I'm in Vegas. Most of the time, I will eat at the Bacchanal Buffet or Bellagio Buffet because I have a family of picky eaters and we need a large selection of food to accommodate everyone. On my recent visit to Vegas, I was fortunate to accompany some friends to District One for lunch. I live in Orange County and we are surrounded by Asian Fusion food so I had my reservations about District One... However, when we entered the restaurant and met Vi, the Hostess, I immediately knew that I would have an awesome experience. She was passionate about her menu and specialty drinks and she went through the house specials with enthusiasm and confidence.  We found ourselves ordering the Vietnamese Donkey, Mandarin Splash and Vietnamese coffee for drinks. For appetizers and entrees, we had in no particular order, (1) Japanese oysters with house ponzu sauce, (2) jumbo fried shrimp, (3) seasoned squid, (4) fried snapper with papaya salad, (5) oxtail fried rice, (6) garlic noodles with sliced rib eye, (7) coconut ice cream with roasted peanuts on a coconut shell and (8) coconut creme brulee.  OMG, we ate all of this for lunch cause the menu was so enticing!!!  The food was absolutely delicious and I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in Vegas. There were so many more items that I want to taste so I will be back soon!

q1ABRQlW6eNBB2WFL65CCA.text: Nice restaurant . Started with some oysters which were really good. Also had the Vietnamese version of carpaccio or tataki . Was great also ! My friend and I each had pho and was very flavorful . Service was attentive and on point . It was my first time but I will Definitely he back soon .

bbnfafvmApb0movAuS1MLw.text: Must be the food we ordered but I do not know how there are so many 5 star rating. I ordered the wings  and the ribeye pho. Wings was just ok, the pho broth was PLAIN. Also they don't have tendon!! Menu is a little overpriced in my opinion. If you wan some good pho go best to look for another spot

dCKPewTeUH2oqabzVA8Iug.text: Went there during edc week and it's packedddd!! The line was insane but it's worthy to wait. the oxtail pho & oxtail fried rice are sooooo good....  the best I ve ever had. It saved my hungover/ rave day. And people there are so friendly and nice too. Love this place

tA01rjCqOtZgTQUqTEX1zQ.text: Not only is the oxtail fried rice heaven in your mouth, the staff from the hostess to the servers are kind and great conversationalists.  Great food and service without stuffiness you may expect.

4CHnaaxhdXnLBX-snCNlTw.text: This place has a cool vibe to it. The decor is modern. We came with a group of friends last Sunday. We just wanted to check it out cause we heard good things about it. The drinks were delishhhh. Their happy hour deals are hard to beat. I didn't see anyone ordering Lobster Pho. I just wanted to see what it looked like. I will definitely check out the food next time i'm in Vegas.

PMTKOWrHKGlL3eZlZwcQJQ.text: I'm a fan, but there are definitely things that they could improve on, service wise.   Ambiance: 4 - It's small, cute, and clean inside. There's definitely a lot of space during happy hour when I came in, which is always a good thing!   Service: 3 - They were good and attentive, but they are definitely prone to lots of mistakes. The servers should know what orders to put in first or the cooks should know which orders to crank out first. For example, we got our oxtail fries absolutely last at the end of our meal, which was odd. And I understand pho is easy to make, but you have to be smart about which orders you're putting out together. Other than this, service was pretty great!   Food: 3/4 - I would say that some food was a hit or miss. It's definitely a good idea to arrive during their happy hours. I thought the oxtail fries and serrano wings were so-so. Though, I did hear that their pho was good and I had that crispy bird's nest noodle dish, which was also pretty tasty. Probably my favorite thing of the night was the oysters and how much they cost during happy hour--a dollar an oyster! They were super fresh and a good size. Plus, they didn't have that "just picked it from the ocean" taste, which was really nice! I think I'll definitely come back for happy hours ;)

xsOhE_G-wFIuSi2h_YhZ2Q.text: This would be a 5 star review if the price was lower or the portion size was larger. The pho broth and meat were really good. You don't even need to add anything like the hoisin sauce. I usually load up on hoisin but this time I ate it straight up the way it came. Service was great, they greeted and answered our questions. They came by and checked on us, also easy to flag down. It was a good experience. And the best part is the way they set up the sinks out side the bathroom.

uHI_8VZSZR9Ha0SH1Q6tUg.text: Such a good place to try !!!! The Carpaccio Truffle Oil and peanuts it's the best I've ever had ! Pho was real tasty !  Nice music, nice service .... Make it a perfect improvised Date :-) we will be back (soon).

Fo2uKs64GJ87DTjVviJjrg.text: Employee was annoyed because they were closing soon. Other than that the food was amazing. Hats off to the chef!

UYIwDmrI2djt07aTtRhyVg.text: It's really good here. Came with my parents even they are impressed with every dish. Pork belly rice, short ribs, oxtail etc.

K5vtusmdCbycC0j-OjmisA.text: Don't under stand how they sit people and how they heck do they have only big ass tables and if there's only a party of two then your waiting forever for a group to finish eating and then I call to see if I should reserve they said don't need to because it's only a 10 min wait so I get there and nope I am wait for 45 min!! I will say the food was great but I can't say I will be going or recommend!

Lo2SSTzvfJ5RUcGP2T2oXw.text: Super great service. Everything was good except for the pho, our group of 6 tried 3 different ones and the flavors of the broths was off, had a strange aftertaste. Sweet place though and can't say enough about how cool the servers were and how quickly the food and drinks came out.

WnbFM9vdgum3Mu_WlV0ccg.text: Visiting from LA, we met some local friends here.  We had 7 people total which was good because we were able to order many dishes to try and share.  Quite simply, the food is solid.  Oxtail pho is a must.  The shaken beef salad was also very tasty.  Atmosphere is casual and relaxed.  Service is excellent.  Full bar, moderately priced drinks!  This is a huge plus as a vodka drinker.
