Bx0Dq9fOH6WUSLW_jxss4A.text: Their bun bo hue's broth is one of the best I've had. It's a huge portion even though it doesn't have all the other usual meats (pork leg and blood) Price is not crazy like their other dishes. Just 10.99 a bowl. Husband got the oxtail fried rice for 14.99. I'n not a fan of fried rice so definitely think that's over priced. I tasted it and it's a bit on the oily side and nothing great.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue. $11. Yum! Lots of veggies.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fried rice.  $15. Not worth it.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bun. Great flavor. $7

MKGqGUv0Vb-SQaLvpoOc2w.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would! We didn't have to wait at all, we got seated within arriving. The hostess was really nice all the way down to our server. The restaurant is very nice and has a great ambience! They have several tv's and all are not on the same channel which is a goo thing. They have a full bar and great selection of whiskey, American to Japanese... Hibiki!!!!  The food is amazing! We ordered Oxtail Soup  oxtail carpaccio, oxtail fried rice, and chicken wings in fish sauce (smells is very pungent and robust but don't be deceived it's really good). Can't wait to go back and make this a regular spot to go to!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Carpaccio
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fried Rice
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Soup

GJTtwG1Jf-dOnPkrrfIikQ.text: Wow!!! Thank you Aaron for your wonderful service and food suggestion. Aaron was very informative when asked questions about the menu. (09/01/14)  I didn't even know Las Vegas had a China Town in the City of lights. This is a must, place to visit! Take a break from the strip -- sun, drunk people and gambling.   My other half and I love to share our food. This is what we had:  -The wings- (Garlic Serrano Pepper) They were just cooked right and crispy. The sauce at the bottom of the tray was top notch! Very Juicy  -Belly Buns- (Pork Belly, Clintro & Peanut Sauce) The bun was so soft it just melted in my mouth, the peanut flavor was awesome. They didn't have so much fat on the meat! (A+ Plus)   -The 3 pound Garlic Lobster with noodles-- WOW! WOW! This was amazing! At first we thought 3 pound was going to be a lot of food, but at the end we devoured it! The noodles were very fresh and tender. The lobster was cooked just right. The seasoning was great and finger-licking good!   Dessert- O-mg-! The ice cream is to die for! They only have one flavor which is coconut -- served on a coconut shell.   The wait time to get our food was expectational! It took them about 10-15 to bring out the main dish and about 3-5 for the appetizers. I can't wait to go back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peak at their menu
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Serrano wings

X3Wc5qeWm58tpSdlbN5QMg.text: This restaurant had amazing food, but we came with a very large group (about 16) and it was difficult for the service to keep up, which is why I cannot give them a 5.   They had some good prices for happy hour, which we caught an hour of. From the happy hour menu, the wings were good, the fries hot and tasty, the belly buns were very good, the mango salad was very big and refreshing, the eggrolls were my favorite, the carpaccio was an excellent delicious surprise, and the beer was good.   I also got the short ribs smothered fries with an egg on top and they were also very good. It was from their special menu described by the waiter. The portion was huge, but went fast at the table.   Even the cooks struggled, because the first thing I ordered was the garlic fries and they were the last thing to come out.   The waiter really struggled with the bill, but it was finally all worked out in the end. I also explained how disheartening it was to watch three staff standing around talking while our waiter was overwhelmed and we waited so long for refills and service. All the waiter could do was apologize.   Either way, I would definitely come back again. Maybe with a smaller group this time.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy coconut water!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish eggrolls!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries - yum!!

oZeqb9etdSbKfYDwcPnSYw.text: I've had my fair share of pho in Las Vegas and hands down D1 makes the best bowl in town! The broth isn't too oily (like most) and doesn't even need much sauce to amp the flavor. Their appetizers never let me down.. The Vietnamese beef carpaccio is absolutely delicious!!  The restaurant is kept clean and the design is way beyond than your average Vietnamese joint. Two thumbs up guys!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid mango salad &amp; Vietnamese beef carpaccio

Qkgu3sxOsLx79_vD1GLPGg.text: They are located in a plaza on the Southeast corner of Jones and Desert Inn near Icy Juicy (situated in Cravin' Cajun's old spot). The layout hasn't changed, however, it has new flair to suit District One. I really like all the decals on the back wall!  I came with a few Yelpers (The Q's, David V., and Paolo) and it was a new experience for most of us. We shared both of their chicken wings selections; Tamarind Wings ($6.95) and Garlic Serrano Pepper Wings ($6.95). The wings were fried without a batter and tossed/dressed in light sauces of their respective flavors. Both selections were bland, lacking a pinch of salt, however, the Garlic Serrano had great flavor potential. Without a batter, the wings lacked any type of crunch or bite. Additionally, the orders came with pickled vegetables (carrots and daikon) that were good! We also tried the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio ($10.95), served with lime juice, white onion, and peanuts. The sauce (soy sauce and oil base) was very tasty and it made the beef taste amazing.  Everyone ordered their own dishes, like Fish Tacos ($8.95), Tomato Rice (side order; $1.50), and the District One Rice Combo Platter ($11.95). The fish tacos were made with hamachi sashimi, avocado, cilantro, and cherry tomato in fried wonton "shells" and came in a set of three. It was okay, but nothing special. The tomato rice also lacked flavor and warranted a shrug. For the Combo Platter, you can choose between chargrilled short ribs or pork chop and it comes with kimchee, pickled vegetables, lap xuong (Chinese sausage), and a fried egg. The chargrilled short ribs were good and had a nice "char" flavor (no marinade).  I ordered the Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice ($8.95), served with a soft boiled egg, and Jasmine rice. This was really delicious! The meat was soft and tender and the sauce created from the coconut juice and pork belly was fragrant. I threw my whole bowl of rice into the stone pot to utilize every drop of the succulent sauce. Even if there weren't any other successful dishes, I would come back just for pork belly coconut juice! Everyone else seemed to really enjoy it as well.  Service was really nice! We didn't realize that we had stayed almost an hour after their closing time, however, they were really cool about it. I like the menu because of its focus on Vietnamese fusion and obviously, that makes it unique. I don't eat Pho, but the MP Lobster Pho is definitely enticing! Not sure how much the price fluctuates, but it was approximately $27 last week. Anyway, I'm willing to give the other dishes a try and if anything, I'll always have the pork belly as a back-up plan!

NfAB90lzC7d--9OJzesDyA.text: Beef in betel leaves. Oxtail Pho. Pork belly in coconut juice. These are some of our favorite items here.   Owned by the son of the owner of Pho So 1, we knew that we were in for some delicious Vietnamese food. Our high expectations were met the moment we tried the food here. With a small menu, they focused on high quality and innovative Vietnamese dishes. The restaurant itself has a clean, modern and hip look. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes!

oP2-oWZlKOdsEVVICodyqA.text: Delicious! Tried Pho for the first time! Loved the rib eye and flank steak pho. I didn't care for the spring rolls but the pho made up for it. The fresh coconut mojito was also great but lacking a good amount of rum so I would recommend the Vietnamese donkey.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh coconut mojito.....not enough rum
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho

PvCCQxst8oKu7AkoJRnDlQ.text: Talk about another hidden gem in Vegas. I have been meaning too check this place out after hearing the buzz and looking at the pics it all looks really really good. I really am digging the sign/logo of the restaurant. If that doesn't make first impression from the moment you walk into the restaurant be surprise got upscale feeling too the place, even though bar area not that big really like the set up, and for any sports fan love the fact five widescreen all set up just like see at sports book bunch together. The prices are supa reasonable up and down the whole menu. The portion size for tapas style is really good size more so then other tapas style places been too in my experience. Love the diversity of the menu also wide range from cornish hen, bone marrow soup, more tradition pho dishes, or beef salad. Just talking about the entrees.   I no idea best place too start my District One Kitchen & Bar experience but the Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup was on my radar. It the perfect soup too clear my running nose and sinus. Boy did it not disappoint! The broth had nice kick too it. But not over the top that not enjoy the full body of the broth. One of the best things about it is diversity of meats in it. Counted four different ones in the bowl. Really each time dug deep find another different treat in every scoop. It nice hearty Pho dish. Any sign of good Pho is no need too add anything more too the broth. The appetizers was tough but went with the Beef Buns. Talking about Buns in my last review Beef Buns brought back that same urge Bun crazy! They do have peking duck buns too believe but went with the pork buns. Talk about addicting get three per order but popping them down so easy wish order half dozen or hell could have done dozen. Really that good!! The pork is cooked nice crispy outside, moist inside, and glaze or sauce cooked in was fabulous could have ordered plate of pork! The topping of think hoisen or oyster sauce combine with garnish of julienne carrots and couple other things. The steam bun itself was the perfect Steam Bun with the perfect filling.   The service was awesome. I torn between the tacos and beef buns waiter recommending the beef buns. Save the tacos for next time. No doubt be few more times because lot of good stuff on the menu. Just happen ran into fellow yelpers Misti and Bobby. They were kind enough ask if wanted too join them. It was just me doing my yelp diligent checkout out all the ONO spots in Vegas. Lol!! Impromptu UYE with the one and only Misti Y and Bobby Y. Thanks.   Trust me if not checked out District One you need too. It really good food at reasonable price that we al can enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup! Clear up any sinus real fast!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belly Buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

0GRVMdloeBnXd0wZIVSYXA.text: It's a real no-brainer that this will be the best Asian restaurant in town for many years to come. Cleanliness check, service check, decor check, food + drink check. You have everything and anything that your Asian craving desire. On top of that, you have the selection from the old Cravin Cajun menu! Crawfish and shrimp bags! I think that the Chicken Roti dish here should be their signature dish. I've been looking for years to find the equivalent of yelp.com/biz/bale-valley... and finally DOKB delivered. The game hen, so juicy, so crispy, so salty-sweet. It's the ultimate indulgence. Surprisingly it does not come with fish sauce dipping, so don't forget to ask for it. It's a must! It would be like eating egg rolls without the dipping sauce (which by the way this place makes a mean egg roll!!). I can take my whole family here and every single person in the crowd would be pleased. I love the simple yet expansive menu selection. I appreciate not having to choose from 10 difference combination of Vietnamese rice dish when there's really only one. I'm already craving my next meal here.....

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hen!

QK-5pgklHN08NB_wpoa8UQ.text: Alright..on a Sunday night at 2am...how are so many restaurants fully booked! Come on..this is Vegas!! Isn't everything opened until very late?  Sadly, this was a huge disappointment. We were all sober, so this is not a biased review.   With a party of 6, we ordered: 1) Pho oxtail: 3/5 eh, okay 2) Belly buns; 2/5 bleh...the buns were cold... 3) Garlic noodles 3/5 nothing special 4) Oxtail fried rice: 5/5 WOW!!! that was DELICIOUS!!! 5) Fried calamari: 3/5 eh, again, nothing special 6) Green papaya salad: 3.5/5 yum! fresh and refreshing! 7) House special oysters: 3.5/5 fresh! Try it.   Apparently at 2am, it is HH. So make sure to ask their HH menu :)

hKHLZQyRAE-_F4cm5oxb1A.text: In town to celebrate family birthdays, Yelped for an Asian fusion place and District One came in at #1 and it sure was a hit from A to Z!!! If you love soup, their big bone (bulalo) soup and oxtail pho are sure winners! Unlike other places, broth was on point with fresh garnishing items. Equally savory was their garlic fried snapper, steamed bok choy, oxtail loco moco and oxtail fried rice. For dessert, buko ice cream served on fresh coconut was awesome! What completed the great experience was the service #1!!!

RMSqR8B9K3JdwBA-FpiMmA.text: We tried this place since we were in town.  I had the oxtail pho and boy was it delicious.  The meat was so tender that it fell off the bone with ease.  This place is a must try.

nhnc7wviBbmIm3ATAWD29Q.text: Interesting take on Vietnamese fusion...a little on the pricey side.  Servers seems to be in training still so not very attentive...forgetting small things like utensil and water.  Probably would go back.

54R7Rd4mkKUE9kYNScim6A.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Service can be inconsistent depending on the server (some are inattentive while others are amazing). Parking is very limited when whole commercial center is busy.  LIKE  The bar. The modern decor. One of the owners is very friendly and almost always available. Menu doesn't just offer traditional Vietnamese offerings.  LOVE  Shaken beef salad. Lobster pho. Pork belly in coconut juice. Steak and eggs. Open late on the weekends. Location pretty close to home. Mekong River noodle soup.

zdqQs-Mmc57PIo_Pjxb7Pg.text: This is a cool Asian Fusion sports bar that actually serves draft beer, cocktails and wine. We came last night to hopefully get some pork belly baos and watch UFC Fight Night.  We ordered Belly Buns, Papaya Salad, and Serrano Chicken Wings. They have a decent menu with Vietnamese, Chinese and Thai choices. I am being generous with my 4 stars as 1 star each for service, atmosphere, menu selection and concept. The food was not the greatest though. I did not like the Belly Buns as they lacked flavor and the Belly was dry and small. I've had belly bao with a thick tender caramelized pork belly with pickled garnish and these were not good at all. The papaya salad lacked sweetness which would have balanced the sour and salty taste. The wings were crispy and big but they didnt give all flats. The drummette piece tasted dry and horrible. Usually in Asian joints they give you all flats when you order fried wings so that was disappointing. I did see the table next to is ordered a Black Pepper Dungeness Crab that looked pretty good. Maybe some of their other choices might be better than what we ordered. This is a cool place to watch the game and we will give it another try next time. The food is just so-so on our first visit here.

7GZUE85JLNdMFvJoPoyWdg.text: Do you want to hit the jackpot without even going to the casinos in Vegas? Go to District One for a meal! Ten of us went there for the first time to try out their signature oxtail dishes. We happened to met one of the co-owners, Vy, who was very accommodating, explained the menu to help with some of the group with dietary restrictions. The oxtail dishes did not disappoint. Many of us ordered the oxtail pho - enough for two people. I suggest that you split the pho dish and then order other dishes to try out. The oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice, pork belly buns, or short ribs are just some of the tasty, reasonably  priced dishes. If you're not into oxtail, give it a try. You might be converted - they cook it for many hours in a bone marrow broth, seasonings, so it's so tender -- and gluten free to boot.  Aside from the excellent food, there's a full bar, great decor and friendly staff. District One is definitely on our Las Vegas MUST DO list. You won't be disappointed.

KVsL-4l8sQfCPcHSLzkKPA.text: Ate out here last night. food was good and we did not have to wait long, i had pork buns for appetizer and pho as many antree. Out od all the pho restaurants I've been to, this place have the most protein meats, thank you! Service was great, the waitress was very attentive.  4/5 will come back and recommend

--cw3VnL4Foqv3WpsLjd0w.text: My first time here at District One and I must say the food and service are spot on! I ordered the oxtail fries and spring rolls. Looking forward to returning and trying the Lobster Pho!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries! To die for!

JUShsTpoh_TdLkSgTpLB9Q.text: I definitely love the vibe going on at District One. The quality of service their employees offer is superb! And the food, oh lawd I'm tellin' ya, it's to die for! Their chef is definitely doing some magic in the kitchen. District one is the type of place you can go to if you want to enjoy good wine and eat good food while enjoying the ambience without spending a ton of $$$. Give this place a try, you know you want to!  Recommended dishes: Ox tail Fried Rice. Omg omg omg omg! Vietnamese Beef carpaccio - drenched in truffle oil Oysters! Always fresh, go during happy hour for $1 fresh fresh oysters Big Bone Soup - Bone marrow lover? You will die once you see the marrow comes out. Lobster Pho - A bit pricey but c'mon! It's a whole friggin lobster. Garlic Fries - So flavorful!

k6syRUdy0uLADicKQx0AYw.text: Great food! I love the oxtail fried rice! Great service too. They gave my Aunt coconut ice cream for her birthday and its so good. I will come back again.

d1fErmpg86yRPQkdacR2hw.text: I heard about this place mentioned a couple of times by not only my husband but a few of my foodie friends.  They told me that they had Oxtail Pho.  Man was I craving some Oxtail Pho during lent, I gave up noodles for Lent.    So, I finally had the chance to go and eat here with a few other peeps.  You know how it goes when there are more mouths to feed, more chances to try more food on the menu! Yesssssss.  We were greeted by a few of the staff and they began by telling us all the awesome things they had on special that night.  In nice resturant lingo like "Chef has prepared...." Hey District One, nice touch on selling your menu.  District one is the old Cravin Cajun.  They fixed up the restaurant really nice.  Plenty of room if you have a big party.  Ono (delicious) to the grinds.  We had oysters, squid, chicken wings, papaya salad, quail...and that is just to name a few.  Of course, I still managed to get Oxtail Pho.  I still like another Pho place because their Pho broth is bomb, but the price they charge here would actually bring me back because of that.  It wasn't bad pho broth.  They actually gave HUGE oxtails.  By the way, if you still want your crawfish/crab/shrimp boil fix, you can still get it from District One.  Think I will have to try that they next time.   And the pork belly seems to be a hit so I better try that too.    My hubs liked it because they had a lot of his favorite Asian Whiskeys.  See Jesse N :)  Well they made me a fan. As you can tell from my review I will be back.  I hope the hype stays good since I've seen this place change up a few times.  The variety they offer is awesome because everyone at the table should get different Asian fixes here...Yup, I said that.  Lil' asian me.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got to try a variety of things.  Very excited for the oxtail pho

NE58Qr4fiHjSz_beX0bthw.text: Must try the razor clam with saute green onion & peanut Must try the oxtails pho with extra side of meat balls or raw beef in hot broth. i took a star back because the lemongrass clam was so salty and over cooked!!! Service was very attentive and friendly, i had told many friends to come here for the Razor clams. Don't bring your kids here though, the crowd is kinda punk ist with attitude, can be intimidating, but good food, i will over looked that

SjIfHEOh2cxo4-ZYBSjW8Q.text: I eat here 1-2x a week and I live In NW Las Vegas.   Beef Carpaccio is sooo savory and is def first thing you try if you come here aside from the spiced hen.   Staff and Owners are super accommodating and you can tell they love to host.

gkDcrB--zcMD-BbFQOXuXg.text: Took my kids there and they loved the food. Don't remember our servers name but the runner took care of us (Richard). Food came out fast which was great. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Yj-oflMVhsXfgLEuCao5lA.text: Really love the difference in scenery for a Vietnamese establishment. Really nice elevated booths makes it feel really americanized right away when you walking. You get that aroma of pho all up in your face. Got the beef carpaccio, and the roti rice dish. Darkmeat was awesome, white meat is dry as usual at all Vietnamese places. Service attentive very friendly, lastly I really enjoy the phrases all over the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The elevated booths are a plus.

EacBfn8hTwoxyWtpk_RzKA.text: Wow! Pretty perfect to me! Open late till 2am. It's my first time here and I'm blown away. I had the pho veggie and it's a generous portion with an amazing broth...and only 7.99! For real. I'm eating the leftovers tomorrow. Lots of other stuff on the menu that I will have to come back and try. I also had some oysters that were on special. They were also lovely and topped Caviar. Looks like they have a full bar but I had a craft beer  and happy with that. Highly recommend, it's a great place.

TGB-WCUFrkoz6Wm4ZAHWsw.text: In the Hunger Games series District One is supposed to be the holy land riches and beauty. Er... maybe a better comparison would be the first class flight or flying coach, you'll both be getting the same destinations, just certain amenities of first class makes the experience all the better. The cushier seat, the dim lighting, more leg space, and more flight attendant service. District One should probably take a cue from Jet Blue.   The service here unfortunately gets worse and worse each visit. The first few visits started with longer wait times for food and progressively gotten to one of the worse service experiences I've had in a long time. No one was necessarily "rude" but the lack of sense or urgency really killed the experience. Maybe I should of seen it coming when it it took a day and a half to have our waiter take our order, which is usually not a big deal, you're busy I get it.   We told the server our orders and less than 2 minutes after we tried to cancel the fish tacos (because even with the happy hour pricing the cost/value was in the negatives).  When we asked the response was "I just put in your order". I know, you came to our table right after you placed it, but you're telling me that you can't change the order now because somehow in the past 2 minutes the fish was being cut fresh from the Pacific Ocean and the taco shell was being made fresh (obviously this is an exaggeration because the fish tacos took over 20 minutes to get to our tables, which many would presume is ample time to tell the kitchen to cancel the item).   What confuses me the most is that our orders were repeated to us by the server, yet 1 order of pho tai nam and an order of steak and eggs were missing? Maybe the kitchen is having a delay, no problem, but ten minutes later we followed up with it and the steak and eggs came out within minutes, perfect (except for the fact the rice should of been in a cereal box considering how crunchy it was) and then another 10 minutes later (a total of 40 mins waiting for our food) for a pho tai nam (came out minutes later as well).   The check was another hassle of its own, and in short, the party of 4 split the check 2 ways (which we wrote in pen) and it was still messed up. It took two reprints to fix things. Water refills? Wishful thinking.  So Kevin T, you obviously had terrible service, why the 2 stars? Fortunately and unfortunately D1 has the best pho (noodles cooked inconsistently though) and food for the majority ranges from acceptable to great. Sometimes theres lots of love in the food and sometimes... none.  Things to order:  Pho (any except lobster) Mekong River Noodle Soup Beef Carpaccio  Wings Beef (from their fairly crafty craft beer list)  Things to pass: Belly buns Lobster pho (really? #onlyinvegas) Expectations of great service Fish tacos (I have dog treats bigger than these)  Will I come back? Maybe someday when the raging hole in my heart after getting burned so hard by the service heals.

Ob54GQ-PvC11bmAO6N5X9A.text: I've been to this restaurant on more than one occasion and the staff are always amazing. They take time out to explain to you all the specials and address any other additional questions that you have. Whether you're there in the middle of the night or right before closing. The menu is very versatile as well and gives you many different options to choose from, which I like.  Definitely a place everyone should try out!

e6v-JNLbweWEv9RwRzXzKw.text: Ordered the Steak and Eggs, where the rice was stale, the steak was cold, and the eggs were likely bad. Woke up a few hours later to severe food poisoning that left me throwing up, nauseated, feverish, and aching. Never again

eggzzkXhf6reH5Qe1HVH3A.text: Jason is one of the most rare quality people you find this days.    It takes me 4 yeas to try. Big bone marrow soup and it was worth every day of it..

H84aVrot2aYtfQOy0XuDpw.text: The oxtail pho and the oxtail fries are my favorite here. Their service was also probably one of the best I've received at any restaurant like this. Would go back every time I am in Vegas :)

_adK5q8uNFcJkP9-utHGtg.text: *Disclaimer - this review is biased only rated one item - the Ox Tail PHO!!! *  I've actually been to D One twice but all that is on my mind is their Ox Tail Pho!  Now for most stereotypical asians paying more than $10 for a bowl of Pho is insane unless you are at the TI on the strip but this bowl is worth every penny of its 11.95 price tag.  On work days when I'm having an ox tail soup craving and can't make it out to the California with an 11pm Ox Tail start time, I'm S-O-L but now I get to go to District One for the best of both worlds - Ox Tail and Pho.  Genius - yah, i know.  The soup is so rich from all the fat tender ox tail goodness falling off the bones as you gently prick it with your chopsticks. Im getting off thinking about it as we speak.  Anyhow go check it out.  Oh yah they do have other things like the Shaking Beef Salad, or Shaking Beef Steak and Eggs, Cornish Hen.  Everything here is pretty good but the first thing I'd order is their Ox Tail Pho!

2zGmv_BSKs_Kq4fPw6Vi6g.text: This place is awesome! If I could give it more stars I would. Everything I had was so delicious. I highly recommend the Vietnamese Donkey cocktail. It's a Moscow Mule made with Lychee Vodka and it's amazing. The service was great and just an all around great atmosphere!

_XlQ_FhjrF12BB_ae5_Png.text: So good, fresh, unique. I love the oxtail pho, so flavorful; grilled squid, bok choi & garlic, beef carpaccio, yellowtail sashimi tacos, fresh coconut, coconut ice cream, macha creme brulee. All amazing.

VxnRJFUqOf5MZA7WIvx40w.text: Super friendly and delicious food. They keep checking on you and they do their best to satisfy you.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hours only  Big D the best

D6kZsi3BXCoxrIxqMdsNBg.text: Came here for the surf and turf pho and it did not disappoint. Market price lobster is very expensive but it was almost worth the experience. The broth was well made and there was a generous portion of the lobster. The rib eye didn't wow me, but it was good. Service was friendly. The restaurant was clean. I would recommend this for a great off the strip option.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf pho

FEEzp04NamlIfU_KIUlmHw.text: Loved this place!   Much nicer than my usual Pho place.  Great atmosphere.  But they dont have an alcohol license at all!  At least they didn't when i went :(  but other than that everything was great, with super friendly staff and decent prices.  Loved the lobster pho, and the fried calamari was excellent with a little twist... comes with pieces of fried jalapeno and garlic mixed in. Super yum!.  On that note, i was not a fan of the oxtail chili fries.  Bachi burger has them beat by a mile on these

TbshmmiOLRixoTeU6B4wig.text: Pulling in its easy to find on jones. Friends have been recommending it so i though i would give it a try. Entering the place seemed clean with booths around the edge and a bar with like 5 tvs directly to the back. Alot of Japanese whiskey and scotches on display and a good selection of draught beer. Bartender was attentive and it was happy hour. I ordered pretty much everything he recommended from the pork belly to the oxtail fried rice. Food was served in a very timely matter and was good!  Great place will definitely come back.

VjFadbt_2tvfPS2cFcIQUA.text: Came to try the sea snail. DELICIOUS!!!!! Some skinny kid name Richard took my order really nice kid greeted me with a smile. Another reason I love coming here.

3CDmjCvrIQxb7UGHxawLFA.text: Went here on a weekend night and surprisingly we got seated right away! I was expecting a long wait, but the host told us it would be about 10-15 minutes for a table. She also offered us bar seating (must be 21 and over) which allowed us to be seated right away. So my boyfriend and I decided to sit there instead since we were so hungry.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It reminds me Urban Seoul or even a boiling crab. Staff was friendly and attentive.  I ordered the oxtail pho and my boyfriend decided to go with the most popular pho lobster. We also ordered half a dozen of fresh oysters and king crab legs with aioli!  1) oxtail pho: The broth was so yummy. It was very clean! I was happy not to see an immense amount of oil cruising around. And they were generous with the oxtail!  2) pho lobster: It had a nice presentation with the whole head and tail in there. I just wish there was more lobster. Pretty good. 3) oysters: So fresh. blue points. 4) king crab legs with aioli: Was pretty mediocre.. I expected a lot more of a taste to it for such a price.  I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a dozen of oysters. So fresh.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho. Look how clean the broth is!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab legs with aioli. Meh.

sexFqdolKNV-7ShuwGUkcA.text: One of my faves. Have never had a bad dish or bad service. Be sure to always check out what's fresh and on the specials board as it changes daily and they always have some fun and interesting dishes on there. Great beer selection and some great cocktails. Absolutely try the oxtail pho. So good!!!

aX-UOOeWSWDY1-qdTP0oqA.text: A little pricey for pho, but the soup was very good! And the beef ribeye on top was an added bonus compared to basic thin slices beef you'd get from other places. They have a lobster pho that we wanted to taste, but at $40+ a bowl we decided to pass.

e2cQfBr0BbJ2YuSrGd1pNA.text: Consider me a big fan!    I was perusing potential spots for dinner last night and then I saw My T's picture of the 5 spice game hen and it..waS...ON.  They bake the game hen and THEN deep fry it!  Why don't more spots bake and then fry things?  It tasted even better than it looked.  The side of tomato rice was really good too.  I almost never rave about eating bird but I will be having this again.     Another favorite was their shaken beef salad.  I was shaken up after my first freakin bite!  The beef was so juicy and so tender and only $12!  The hot grilled beef mixed with the cool lettuce, onion, tomato and spices made for one of the best salads I've had in recent memory.   The Mekong River noodle soup was just ok.  It looked great and was filled with lots of fixings like fish balls, pork tenderloin, quail eggs, veggies and shrimp but the pork based broth fell short for me.  I saw a lot of customers going for the bone marrow soup and holy shit what a spectacle that was.  HUGE bones!  Me would feel like caveman and raise bone like champion (grunt!).  Check out the pics of it.    But man oh man so much other stuff I want to try like the slow braised pork belly entree, crispy bird nest noodle and more shaken beef!  They're located in the old Cravin Cajun spot so it's great for groups.  I hope they get their liquor license soon.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly stew
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shaken beef salad is awesome!!

-sZL_jRm2gRa0xYq4zNmsg.text: Everything we got tonight was awesome!!! The food was phenomenal. We came in for a late night snack and ended up ordering a few apps. We started with the beef carpaccio, it was an unique twist but really tasty. After we ordered the pork belly buns, fish tacos, and oxtail fried rice. We actually ordered the fries but I'm so happy theres was a mix up because I'm sure the fried rice was better. It was my favorite thing we ordered!  Overall I'm excited we tried a new place and we will be coming back soon, they have a happy hour 12 to 2 that were gonna be sure to check out!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos. So good!

BpkMPqFgP7QB5clXnR0jCw.text: Been wanting to come here for awhile, but it is always packed and I don't like waiting.  We got lucky today, with no wait...    Excellent Service!!! Great Food!!!! Good Portions!!!!  Will be back for sure.... now I know it's definitely worth the wait!!!!

P3qAdPdaDip7VyM1OJbYNg.text: I give it a 3 1/2 stars.  Maybe we just ordered wrong?  I was super hyped about District One and I even braved the cramped parking lot with our SUV just to try this place out.  But we came away just a bit underwhelmed.  No pop!  No wow!  Just a long, drawn out poot.  District One was hoppin', no joke there.  Sports on the TV, alcohol flowin' freely, and lots of heads on tables.  Very busy but luckily no wait when we visited.  The place is nice - modern, vibey, nice leather booths.  Shiny & new!  But the food...eh...was a bit lackluster.  I love me some Vietnamese food, and I love me some fusion.  But while that may be good and appreciated, I gotta sway back to the classics.  What good is fusion if you don't have the classic down?  Does one not learn how to walk first before trying a 360 kick flip?  Do you just approach Heidi Klum and MInka Kelly without mastering the art of taking the 'grenade'?  I think not.  Perhaps we should have ordered differently at District One, because what we had just didn't impress.  The menu looks delicious, rice dishes, soups, noodles, lots of Asian-inspired cuisine.  But that day I really wanted pho, and the wifey really wanted wings.    We started off with the Tamarind Wings.  Wow.  For $6, I'm sorry to say, I felt a bit ripped off.  These were 6 of the tiniest @$$ wings I've ever seen!  At $1 a piece damn were they small.  I mean, these wings were literally half the size of those you see at a place like Wing Stop.  Nearly no meat!  I guess I wouldn't have complained if they were some bomb-diggety wings...but...they were bland.  Oh, just bland.  There was a bit of sweetness to them but that was it.  One note.  No mixing of flavors, no sour, no heat, no crunch, no nothing.  I don't think they were properly seasoned as well because I didn't get much of a salty flavor either.  So plain.  This app definitely left the wifey and I hungry and hoping the main dish would fit the bill.  We both stayed basic and got the Pho Bo Vien, the beef pho.  It came to the table steaming hot, nice.  But again....what's with the portion?  The bowl was smaller than what we were used to at other Vietnamese places around town.  And for $8 each, we were a bit surprised.  At other decent places around town, for the same price I can get the special pho with more goodies, and in a bigger bowl.  We got our little plate of veggies as well for sharing.  This included some basil, bean sprouts, and fresh chilies.  The pho was pretty good, District One has some great broth.  Not overly salty, lots of complex flavor, good on the palette.  But boy did I crave for more noodles and more beef to sop this broth up.    The service for us was excellent.  Server was very attentive, wasn't hesitant to let us know if we had any questions on the menu to just ask.    Water was kept filled.  Overall it was an OK first visit to District One.  The wifey and I left hungry and were eating again less than two hours later.  I think place does warrant another visit, but maybe next time we'll go with the more popular dishes they serve.  I do fancy some Big Bone Soup or some Oxtail Pho!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Bo Vien
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamarind Wings...so tiny!

_X3zq-c53-UU2jZt8_XJeg.text: Superb fusion of American and Vietnamese cuisine.  on the table are plates of oxtail fried rice, fried oysters, mekong river soup (made with beef, fishball, shrimp, and pork)... Dungeness crabs and Branzino.    All entrees are well prepared and are an explosion of taste. Yummy to my tummy.  Can't wait to revisit.

7WhQYAnQGW5QHXfRw-dU5w.text: One of the best asian fusion restaurants I have ever tried--top notch food, service, and ambiance! I've heard so many good things about this place and now I can finally say I've tried it. This restaurant is unlike any other pho restaurant you expect it to be. In fact, upon arrival, you are nicely greeted by a host and directed to your seat within seconds (this could have also been due to the fact that we dropped in early for dinner). The lighting inside the restaurant is dim and the comes equipped with a bar and cushioned table booths as well! District 1 definitely puts a modern twist to the typical pho restaurant. Here is a list of what we ordered:  -Hot Jasmine Tea: Not too pungent, not too bland. Perfect for a cold winter night or if you are sick. -Grilled Squid Appetizer: Very flavorful and huge portions! Perfect amount of chewiness and flavor. Comes with a full squid (size of two hands); tentacles included! -Pork Belly Steamed Bun Sliders: So yummy! I wish there was more. They offer two different kinds of buns--crispy or steamed. We opted for the steamed and it was magnificent. Comes with three sliders. Pork belly was flavorful and melted in your mouth. They also have an option to add one more slider if you are planning to share this dish amongst an even number of people. -Oxtail Pho: Very plain, but still very good. The broth for me was a bit too salty, but the oxtail melted right off the bone. The chunks are gigantic, but the texture of the oxtail makes it super easy to eat. -Shigoku Oysters: this was a special the time we went. Raw oysters from Washington. Each oyster is $3.50. Man oh man were these oysters goooooood! The sauce they put on top of the oysters were spot on. It left me wanting more!  The service was also top notch! They even offered free beer flights of a new beer they were trying to promote when we were dining. We didn't taste it, but it was a very sweet gesture! Will I come here again? YES YES YES! I can't wait to try all the other options on the menu!

oluDdI9HSYs5yyW4oQYtjA.text: Had the ox tail pho and the ox tail fried rice. Both were delicious but the fried rice was my favorite. I also recommend the flight of sake if you're a fan of sake

uGtEhYKpODvxLt5cBqREfg.text: Always. And I mean always THE place to go for some of the best Vietnamese comfort food in town.  And the drinks are amazing also.

9loXGsxtv4-KFs_X0QNqHA.text: Made reservations for a birthday dinner, great service and food!  We ordered a lot of food, but can't remember all the names: Pork belly fries -okay Squid -okay Pork belly buns- GREAT Bone marrow soup- okay Thit kho -okay

jdM1G12oBmj3d3O-Th7dtA.text: We came here because of the Lobster Pho, but I can't get myself to pay $50 for a bowl of noodles.  Instead, we had the regular pho & Bird's Nest Noodles along with Oxtail Fries and Chicken Wings.  I liked the idea and flavor of Oxtail Fries, but the fries were disappointingly lukewarm.  Wings were enjoyable.    The pho portion was generous, and the meat (ribs or shrimps) were ample.  I ordered the Bird's Nest but switched with Hubby because it resembled a Chinese dish too much.  Hubby did finish the plate.  Service was OK.  I'd give it 3  1/2 stars.

atT0YWxR8bwSDDnw8jGoHw.text: This is my 3rd time coming here and this time I am truly convinced that they should get the 5 stars. Each experience got better and better for me, and the service compliments the food very well.   The ambiance of the whole place is very urban and trendy. The music goes well with their overall theme, and it ties the whole place together. All of the servers were knowledgable with all of the dishes, especially with the weekly specials they have. They checked in with us every so often and our glasses were never empty.  We ordered the spring rolls to start off, and I have to say that they are a must try for everyone. Each of us got an entree, but the ones that stood out the most would have to be the oxtail fried rice as well as the oxtail pho. The oxtail here is very tender, and we finished every single bite of it.    In conclusion, If you want great Vietnamese fusion with exceptional service to top it off, definitely come and give them a try. Sadly, I wasn't able to try the lobster this time, but I plan to in the near future!

GKy9wXksZPAGI857fxbamQ.text: Didn't order the Lobster Pho $49 (1.5 lb Lobster) due to the mediocre reviews and hefty price tag.  Do get: grilled shrimp ($4/shrimp). Baby bok choi ($8).

E-M7cNL6O_kTwDKy6F9-wA.text: This is the coolest spot to hang out and grab a bite of new generation Asian.  District One pays homage to so many of the traditional Vietnamese / Southeasy Asian staples we had growing up, but puts such a great modern twist on each item.  The interior setup is awesome, conducive to discussion and sharing of food and stories.  I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.  Definitely geared towards a younger and hipper audience with a wide selection of craft brews on tap.

3FCgdSVQ-pkerV1K71uXxg.text: If you got money to blow (maybe because you won money from gambling), do yourself a favor and get the lobster pho to celebrate.  If you don't got money to blow (maybe because you lost money from gambling), do yourself a favor and get the lobster to cheer yourself up.

JOgzt353NBsKgo1eD1vUBg.text: Food is good and quality of ingredients are great. Service is not good. Basically removed two stars because of the poor service

trMTdaqFkoEIqyCAe0Aw7A.text: Really like the soup here after a night out.  The oxtail fried rice is great. And if you are feeling fancy et the lobster pho. Khai designed a great menu and you won't disappointed. There is also a full bar for hanging out and watching games.

qb2vX1Ftx90TNk6WqOT3wg.text: really good food. great flavors and quality, the biggest issue i have is the quality of serviceware... cheap silverware and plates are a turn off with good food, feels like im eating off cafeteria plates....okay so i don't like melomine .... it would be like serving their great drinks and or awesome beer menu in plastic cups...

L-Zyh74-jLbZnc27qwYSEg.text: I had to get the lobster pho. Last time a friend and I came here, they ran out so I made sure to call in ahead of time to make sure they had some. It was market price which came out to $49.99. It was good, lobster was an ok size.  They body came out deshelled and declawed.  The only shelled part were the head and tail. The broth was AMAZING! I wanted to take the bowl and sip right out of it (couldn't tell if there was MSG or not). Overall it was good but I probably wouldn't order it again. It was one of those dishes that I wanted to try once.  We also go the Oxtail fried rice and beef carpaccio with truffle oil. The oxtail fried rice was as good as the last time! Oxtail was tender and plentiful. The carpaccio was different than I expected - the beef was also slightly cooked which made it a littl3 chewier than I would have liked. I only had a few slices and left the rest for my husband to finish.

gD2QZscRV0KFkn7nHy3MtA.text: It was our first place at this restaurant. The service was ok. It wasn't that busy yet we had to walk the check to the host to pay.  As far as the food, it was good. The oxtail fried rice was really good, but there wasn't alot of meat. I would still get it again. The flavor was perfect and not too oily.   The chicken pho was good, but again don't expect too much poultry. It was more than enough for one person.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail rice

zTLoIRWUvCG394yhmx6KyA.text: I heard it gets super busy on a weekend night but lunch on Friday after Thanksgiving was not crowded at all. We were seated quickly, even with our huge party of 15.  I heard that this is one of the best pho places from multiple Vietnamese folks. I personally can't tell the difference, but they offer a variety of pho, and everything was delicious. The oxtail fried rice is a must as is the mikong pho. The ingredients are fresh and broth tasted clean, which are always pluses for me! We like to eat our pho with sliced onions as a side dish covered in chili sauce, and they came out with sliced red onions which was yummy and not usual at pho joints in LA.  We didn't get the infamous lobster pho (market price was $45 when we went which is quite steep for pho...) but I heard it's overrated and not worth the big bucks. They also had a Instagram special where if you post a photo on Instagram, they take $5 off the plate. Even that incentive was not enough for us to take part.  I'd recommend stopping by for a lunch meal, but I don't think it's worth any sort of wait. It's a fun atmosphere though!  We did have a slight issue with one of our dishes--lets just say we found an unwanted item floating in it. The server was really nice and apologetic about it and took it off our bill rather than sending out a new dish, which was perfect for us.

kNOMF65-6BM58oL8xzXA_Q.text: All in all, this is a great place for late dinner! The chicken wings were perfectly garlicky and spicy, but a bit hard! The oxtail fried rice was flavorful, the pork sliders, a must because they're so yummy, and the steak pho hit the right spot.
