b20kj9jL4AzOC8MKL7ucLA.text: Whole lobster pho is amazing! Had it twice here already and still good every time. Although the bowl is much larger now so that's a plus.  Short rib and pork chop dish is great too!

C18glq42can325NTztUrTg.text: I've been coming here for years every time I go to Vegas. It's one of those "I gotta eat before I go back home kind of joint." This is the local/tourist trendy spot that has that good good. With all that being said... The decor upon entering is nicely done in rustic and metal undertones. The fonts and quotes on the wall gives it a urban/chic feel.  Now to the food. The menu is pretty creative with all of my favorite classics with a twist. Asian fusion at its finest. Such as the Ox tail Pho or Lobster pho or fried rice. I usually order the Ox tail Pho. The broth is rich and savory with a hint of sweetness kissed by my hoisin and Sriracha.  The pork buns with is pork belly on an Asian bun never disappoints. You can get it regular or deep fried! If you're from the South like me, deep fried is a no-brainer! They also have razor clams when it's in season! It is  paradise in your mouth!  I can go on and on about the food...but what they do they do well. Their menu showcases everything you want in an Asian Fusion dish. A bit of influences everywhere.  The service is attentive. The staff even recognizing me although I am not a local. It makes you feel like this place is home!  Whenever you're in Vegas, or if you're craving some mind blowing food... stop by. You will not be disappointed. But this is strictly just my opinion. But what do I know?

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kuVk1xm0yykt__wN4D9JjA.text: Unique Viet-Cuisine off the strip. Great vibe, delicious menu and drinks as well. A new twist to the flavors of Asia.

UqFFAgTiJP2g2-dJCm-_Rg.text: This has been recent favorite pho joint! I enjoy the customer service as well the decoration of the restaurant. I love the idea of whoever decided to put the bar inside too it really makes this place stand out. Last not least, the pho is amazing here!! My favorites are pho tai nam, pho ribeye and the shrimp pho!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xEKsIa-5CEyxcWY2Yn1HIA.text: Social media hyped this place up too much, because District One was a total let down. We tried the oxtail pho and the oxtail fried rice, and we were very underwhelmed by both. $16 for a bowl of pho? I don't care if it contains unicorn meat; at that price, I could get TWO bowls of pho from a traditional Vietnamese place that tastes infinitely better. The oxtail fried rice (also $16) was too greasy and contained shreds of meat so small, I wouldn't be able to tell it was oxtail unless you told me.  Sadly, they were out of coconut shells for their coconut ice cream that day, which was odd considering we were there on a Monday afternoon. Disappointed by the food and general lack of empathy from the staff, we decided to save our money and get dessert elsewhere.  Did we arrive on an off day? Who knows, but I don't see myself coming back to find out anytime soon.

fi7A8MbgTfChQGWClM_p4w.text: Good fusion of vietnamese and modern. Really catered to the young adults. It's always busy so plan to come early to get on the waiting list.   They have a big parking lot in the strip area. During our wait I just tried some matcha  ice cream from the shop in the same strip.

265CjfNpwW2p1JX9G9oYgg.text: District One was not our first choice for dinner, but was a pretty decent back-up option! We actually wanted to eat at Asian BBQ & Noodles next door, but didn't realize that the BBQ place was closed on Fridays - so we "settled" for District One. And it was a pretty solid find!   HAPPY HOUR menu is from 5pm - 7pm and includes quite a nice selection of food & drinks that are TOTES worth it.  [Snacks to share] 1. Belly Buns (steamed) were good but nothing too amazing.  2. The fish tacos were a refreshingly crunchy bite-sized way to satiate our appetite for a bit.  3. The Green Papaya Salad was generous in raw shrimp, but was pretty one-dimensional in salty flavor. 4. Beef Carpaccio was super doused in truffle oil, so if that's your thing - you gotttaaaa get it. Just be ready for the fact that it's super bloody!   [Entrees]  1. At 6pm on a Friday, they were COMPLETELY sold out of their famous Big Bone Soup, which we were SUPER disappointed by. They said they were sold out since lunch and if we wanted to try it, they had no idea when it would be ready (since it takes hours and hours to make). Our sad faces weren't enough to convince the waitress to try to find some big bones they may have accidentally lying around. Bummer!! 2. Oxtail Fried Rice was probably the winner of the night! Large heaping mound of fried rice was warm, satisfying, and generously served with tender oxtail. It was very simply flavored, but super well done. It WAS a little on the oily side, but it did gave the rice a delicious smoothness. Plus it's served with an egg on top, cooked to whatever style you like!  3. Garlic Noodles were a close runner-up for the fave of the night. It's simple noodles, cooked in super garlicky oil so you may not see the garlic chunks, but it's there in EVERY SINGLE DELICIOUS BITE! The noodles were firm and had a chewy texture that I would liken to spaghetti that's just perfectly al dente. YUM!   [Dessert] The Coconut Ice Cream was a disappointment. The surprise is that it's not coconut-flavored ice cream, it's VANILLA ice cream served in a half-cut coconut, so you get just a wee bit of coconut meat with every bite. It was very dissatisfying and such a misnomer. We totally regret getting this.   [Overall] It was a variety-filled meal where you'll definitely find something for everyone. Service was A+ and food came out really quickly! Would recommend if you're feeling munchy and want to get plates to share. Plus there's a HUGE selection of alcoholic drinks to pair with all the feastin'!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream wad a big disappointment! DO NOT GET IT!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Carpaccio was heavy on the truffle oil and the bloodiness.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic noodles were a delicious garlic bomb!

YeMTDfAmP8uYQ6qL8SBJtw.text: Summary: flavorful Vietnamese food, addicting cocktails  in a sports bar style restaurant  Atmosphere: dark, sports bar like with TVs everywhere.   Service: easy going but attentive. Gave us honest personal opinions and didn't steer us wrong.   Cuisine: get the CHICKEN WINGS- with fish sauce variation (not on the menu). They are crispy and smothers in a sweet, salty sauce. CHICKEN CLAY POT is delicious. Flavorful but not rich or overwhelming. PHO TIA NAM is also recommended if you like how the broth is altered by adding in beef before cooking. The anise and nutmeg flavors are subtle, perfection.  I would NOT recommend the BELLY BUNS. they are good but not great. They are lacking something bright to cut the fat. They vegetables are not really pickled and lack flavor. I added a squeeze of lime to the last bite which really made the last bite not so boring.   Cocktails are thoughtful and fun. I had the coconut mojito .... I am obsessed with coconuts. This cocktail is served in the freshly cut coconut used to make this cocktail. It. Is. Delicious.   Dessert: got the PANDAN LEAF CREME BRULEE. Light flavor of pandan and coconut. Very good but I wish they had a fruit garnish to complete the dish. Maybe mango or berries; either would balance out the dish.

zf0VErfr7_dOHithj7_ijQ.text: Found out about this place from Chef's Night Out a segment from Munchies on Youtube. District One is known for it's lobster pho that goes for marketplace value of $50.00. We made reservations for 11:15am and realized we're coming in right when they opened so we really didn't need a reservation. The interior is very hip and modern looking with our hostess being very friendly and our waiter being informative funny and very attentive to our needs. What i liked when we ordered was that our waiter asked if we will need separate bills which is great as we don't have to bug the waiter/waitress if we can all have separate bills at the end of our meal so we divided our group into two to get 2 separate checks (to make it easier for our server).   I ordered the specialty ox tail loco moco after seeing it on yelp. The dish was very rich and heavy; it came with plenty of ox tail and the egg was cooked perfectly sunny side up however it did not come with a meat patty like normal loco moco and may have helped with the richness of the dish. The Ox tail fried rice is what i should have ordered as it was balanced in flavor and would be good if it came with little side dishes (like korean style banchan). My friend complimented on how good the Bun Bo hue and big bone marrow soup was.  The Lobster pho is basically pho that comes with a whole lobster. I must say that this dish is all hype imo. The broth is not infused with lobster it's just regular pho nothing to special about it. The lobster itself was over cooked to a rubbery chewy meat; though it looks amazing in photos and video it is what it is; basic pho with overcooked lobster for $50.00. The Vietnamese donkey which is a beefed up version of a moscow mule was extremely refreshing  the strong ginger taste is welcoming and the drink is just well executed.  many people believe the Lobster Pho is this restaurants staple, but for me the ox tail fried rice is where it's at.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho... Was okay...
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese donkey aka a buffed up moscow mule. Really resfreshing
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail loco loco was super rich and harty

vGL6LQb3om4D-zlzOEBCyg.text: Nommmmmmmmm! Loved this place. It's outside of the Las Vegas Strip! My friend spotted 'lobster pho' on some website and wanted to go so we tried it out and it was delicious. Not only was all the food delicious, the customer service was excellent. I'm glad we discovered this place.   We ordered: * Coconut Juice - came in a real coconut (I originally thought it was going to be like those viet restaurants that come in a cup and some coconut pieces) but this came in a legit coconut and you can carve the inside for yummy coconut * Matcha Thai Tea - I was tempted to get this, so I was asking the waitress questions about it and she offered to give us samples which was very nice of her. The taste of this was a little too sugary for me, very sweet combination. I passed on this.  * Belly Buns - they ask if you want it steamed or fried, we got steamed! This was very tasty and had a big pieces of pork belly * Bok Choy - we got two different kinds. One with garlic only and the other with spicy garlic. Both were really good. A tad oily, but the spicy one had a really nice spicy kick to it. * Oxtail Fries - it reminds me of poutine fries - it had oxtail meat pieces with the gravy all on top of the fries and we had egg on top. This was sooo good and creamy. * Oxtail Pho - If you love oxtail soup, you should try this. It's pretty self explanatory for the oxtail pho. The broth tasted like oxtail (not heavy/strong) - it was light and tasted delicious.  * Lobster Pho - expensive, but worth to try it if you love lobster. This was my friends bowl so I only tried the broth ~ the broth had the lobster kick to it. It was soooo good. Good hangover soup for sure.  In the end, they were nice enough to give our bride a complimentary congrats coconut ice cream in the end (we were all dressed up in our bride squad tanks). THAT WAS SO GOOD. I love coconut, it had something else in it I believe, but it was just nice of them to give it to us. If you love coconut - get whatever ice cream dessert they got!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boc Choy Spicy
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boc Choy Garlic
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries

O-U32FmJlw_Y0t6YRWPmHg.text: Oysters were amazing!!!! We had 6 regular and 6 house special. Both were great flavor and freshness. House specials were my favorite though. I can't remember all the yummy stuff they put on top of the house special ones, but it was delicious! The Oxtail Fried Rice was also really really good! I will absolutely be ordering this again on my next visit. Last, but definitely not least was the 5 Spice Roasted Cornish Hen. Flavor is fabulous! I substituted the garlic noodles ($3.00 charge) for the tomato rice that this dish usually comes with because we had the Oxtail Fried Rice........ and personally, I am so glad I did....... the garlic noodles were perfect texture and super garlicky!!!! (that probably is not proper grammar, or spelling, but oh  well, you get it right?) Tons of garlic flavor!!!! I will definitely be back to try the Pho..... that Lobster Pho looks like fun!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster fried rice...... special 1/5/17
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho&#39;getti.... special 1/5/17
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cornish Hen with Garlic Noodles

D0oNaSZK2_2v5x4pG7QdZQ.text: If I could pray to anyone, it might be to whoever made me those short ribs. OMG! Pretty sure I just found my faith with my love for this meal. I got it with the fried rice which is worth the extra $3. The server was also nice enough to let me try some of their broth they use for the pho and it was 10/10. Definitely coming back to try everything else.

7nUwwz8lB9KJLlbxint5ug.text: Off the strip and worth the 10 minute trip. Found it from yelp reviews and wanted to try something new. Great Asian fusion spot. My favorites were the grilled squid and ox tail fries. Pair it with beer & saki, left this place very satisfied. This place tops the stuff you get on the strip and for half the price, ditch the tourists places and take an Uber over here. Looking forward to getting there on the next visit.

hn1IX0O-m2N039rdGz5ZTQ.text: Good food. Family fun time. Good service. Would recommend coming back. The ice cream is a must have.  Update: Came here two more times during my trip in Vegas and once again I was not disappointed. Everything was excellent and the service was good. The coconut ice cream is always a must have.

TPIPpooQNpg8tj4wEY0teA.text: I was in Chinatown to get my tickets for the Las Vegas Fringe festival at the Las Vegas Little Theatre.  Instead of cooking when I got home, I decided to hit somewhere in Chinatown and eat there.  I saw the District One sign and made my decision then.  The restaurant had a fair number of people so I sat at the bar.  For one person, that often is a good option.  I looked over the menu for some time and opted to eat healthier than normal.  I ordered the Shaken beef salad with house dressing.  It was a nicelyu done mix of greens with tender, warm beef slices, and topped with the house dressing,  The flavor was a little spicy which was good.  After finishing my salad, one of the servers asked me about dessert.  He named two things and when he said coconut, he had me.  I got the coconut ice cream which is a half fresh coconut with ice cream inside and nuts on top.  As you eat the ice cream, you scoop out the coconut meat and it's a very good combination to get ice cream, fresh coconut, and nuts in one scoop.  Service was very good.  My iced tea was refilled a couple of times and I didn't need to ask.  A very pleasant stop!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shaken beef salad.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the interior.

2PtResxXf-P_uS__yupUYA.text: The bone marrow Pho is something I will never forget. Razor clam specials and my friend's Lobster Pho was out of this world too. Great find in a strip mall. Go check it out.

tjTy_GNW1XuiVvS_mr7k7w.text: Came in at 11pm after my shift (I'm a server as well) with my coworkers. Our server seemed to be in a rush with taking our order after we told her a few times that we weren't ready. We ordered some drinks to start (sake and a few beers.) We had never been there and were unsure what to order food wise. She brought our drinks and continued to hurry us. We then ordered a few dishes. One of which was market price which she didn't explain. It was shrimp skewers which came untraditionally meaning it was an entire prawn grilled on a skewer head on and all. We also ordered oyster. She waited until all of our food was delivered to then let us know they were out of oysters for the night. After finishing our food my friend was still hungry so we tried to order steak and eggs. Our server never came back to the table as we watched her do her closing procedure (Flip chairs and mop) we had to grab another person. I then decided to ask the busser to bring our server over. I wanted to make sure she got our order and also we needed straws. She replied yes and then never came back again until we asked for the check. Btw the steak and eggs wasn't traditional meaning steak was chopped up and marinated with a salad over it. Also egg was over rice. It just would've been nice for someone to explain these things to us. Overall the food was okay, the service wasn't terrible she just wasn't present... being a server I know how it is and I like to give the benefit of the doubt but she really didn't seem to care about her tables and mostly just wanted to clean so she could go home after closing. Mind you we finished our meal at 12:20... the restaurant closes as 1... anyways, our tip reflected your service. Not sure what her name was because we didn't get it but she was young and had braces. Try to care about your tables a tad bit more, doing the minimal isn't that hard.

RHLTA2tUtV7p0HRzSWo2WA.text: I got the lobster pho and it was so freaking good! I also saw other people ordering pho with big bones & meat, looked delicious as heck! Definitely must try !

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum yum yum

tjvAn_BQ7pMn2QTguQ3DGA.text: My kind of place and very unique for what it is. Great bar with great bartenders, interesting whiskey collection and great food! I had the oxtail fried rice, fried whole fish and steak carpaccio. Everything was excellent! Will return for sure!

lMV2Q2u4TjxZnJKTT25pHA.text: Got there just in time for happy hour and ordered the oysters which was served with lemon and a spicy cocktail sauce. Had the oxtail fried rice as well that was amazing!! Definitely will be back!

KHdVc27xD37fdOM-M7NiUA.text: Oxtail Pho!!!! It's so flavorful... I would eat it, on a 110 degree weather. Their Vietnamese Donkey was refreshing. Service is phenomenal,  they're always friendly and always checking on my party. 20% tip or more... that's how good service was. Hardly find friendly service in Asian restaurants. when I have family in town from the Bay Area or Hawaii, this is my go to place.

LoBIHHoUPptHIVkMk8itVg.text: How did Southeast Asian cuisine become so extraordinary? District one nailed it for me. The decor is inviting and friendly which is always a good sign. The menu selection is overwhelming with the array of choices. Where do I even start? They have snails, lobster, ox tail, and even oysters! They bring out the chart of specials and we decided to get the black peppered lobster, surf n turf pho, and the snails. Snails can be done in a few different styles and we picked the spicy Thai chili. It was such a delight. The flavor of lemongrass and chili and spice combined well. Take it from someone who does not enjoy spicy food as much. I'm a weak one but I sucked it up for this particular dish. The black peppered lobster was my favorite and the noodles were wonderful. We actually didn't realize the dish came with noodles until it came out. The server are really sweet but I felt like our particular server was so so. The music playing was nice but the speakers were directly at our table which made it difficult for him to hear what I was saying. The last thing we had was the coconut ice cream. It is served onto of a coconut shell with real coconut. It was a great treat. Overall, it was a great experience and I am definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black peppered lobster special was my favorite
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf n turf pho special
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snails in Thai lemongrass chili sauce was so flavorful. On my list when I come back!

LaIZETfVgHLLa_If4XlqzQ.text: Food and service was awesome.   I had the salmon with potato hash which was one of the specials for the day.  Best salmon dish I ever had. The aioli sauce was delicious.

sJJ4xJZ3Q8MNUzbcC8ZIcg.text: I was so excited to try this place..there was so much hype and once I tried it, it wasn't all that great. I got the lobster pho and the lobster was over cooked, so chewy! I told the waitress about it and all she said was thank you for telling me. No discount or apology what so ever! Not worth the 40 dollars!  The bf had the ox tail rice and again, not that good, too salty and not what we expected. The customer service was okay, all waiters that were covering our table were not on top of our drinks or what we were ordering. We had to ask multiple times for our drinks, it seemed like they were too busy hosting a bigger group of people. Definitely not as good as it seemed.

Tzj4-Y6pF0QLIcoy-AEVtw.text: What type of cheap degenerate bastard sleeps all day and waits until midnight to go to a spot to hit up their happy hour menu?  ME!! Needless to say I was not disappointed.   From the happy hour menu I  had the oysters, chicken wings and pork belly buns.  All were terrific and afordable.  I will definitely go back when I am up late again. The only disappointment was the bone marrow soup.  For me it did not live up to the hype.  I was happy to see the oxtails in the soup, but they were luke warm and the broth was not hot either. Other than that I had a great time and the staff was friendly as well.

PaInADrLQnN389MlAs56Pw.text: I love that management reached out to me about my experience. It shows dedication to their business and customers. Definitely worth another star. And after a few more visits, I hope to give them the full five.

O7YvsY1ziOfiUZ7lpGG1wA.text: Saw the pictures on Instagram, so I decided to try this place out. We went on a weekday, so the ordering and delivery were spot on. The server did a great job of recommending the specials and what was popular on the menu. We ordered the oxtail loco, oxtail fried rice, fish tacos, and pork buns. The fish tacos were awesome, I liked the presentation but the taste is what got me. I ordered extra to go. The oxtail fried rice is a huge serving, and was good. Really good if you enjoy garlic. Wish I was a lobster lover, otherwise I would have ordered the lobster pho, there's always next time!

8BKUjyCITdh26ST-kF2FMA.text: My friend brought me here during happy hour. The atmosphere was Nice and clean. Food and drink was worth for what you paid for. However, I ordered a patron shot not knowing it was $10! I was not given a bar menu. I just thought it was be $5-8. Oh well

t9diQv_39E5jIEaqwuXiMA.text: The pho soup was delicious! Just wish that my oxtails had a little more meat on them cuz they were so tender it fell off the bone and probably got lost in their pot or something. For the pricey bowl of pho, I think the noodles could have been more plentiful. A few more strands couldn't hurt, noodles are cheap. My daughter had the garlic noodles and they were yummy. Definitely have to get here again cuz the other dishes looked really good. too.

ocf1Q_jGh2qq6l6HXXWnBQ.text: I wanted to give this place a five because i really liked the food but i felt the staff especially the manager was lacking. My bf and i started with the razor calms at $14.95. They were meaty but flavor was only ok. We also got the fish tacos which were pretty good. It came with three wantons skins fried and shaped like taco shells and filled with yellow tail and added veg. My bf got the oxtail pho. I thought the broth was very flavorful and i enjoyed it alot. The oxtail was fall off the bone tender. I had the district one rice combo. That included a large heap of white rice with a fried egg on top, pretty spicy kim chee, pickled veg, a small and thin but very tender and full of tasty goodness pork chop. The seasoning on it was to die for. Lastly it was suppose to have chinese sausage. My food came out and i noticed the sausage i was really looking forward wasnt on my plate. I told the waiter that explained yo mr thats what i ordered. I told him that what i read on the menu was different so he went to check then to the kitchen then back to me. He apologized and said the kitchen ran out of the sausage which i have never heard of a kitchen running out of a regular item on a menu that is in fact offered twice on the menu, even worse 168 supermarket is across the street and houses about 20 varities of chinese sausage. I was quite disappointed and shocked that the kitchen didnt inform my waiter and i guess i wasnt suppose to notice. To appease me they brought out free coconut ice cream that too was yummy. Upon heading to the bathroom i saw food come out with the sausage. I asked a waiter and they said i saw it correctly. I called the manager over who was comfortably dressed in running pants and nikes and explained what happened. She told me they did run out if the sausage and sent someone to the store after i was served and she felt the ice cream was a nice enough gift. I told her it was but i wanted the sausage now that was suppose to be in my meal to begin with she said the she thought the ice cream would have taken care of that which i replied that i would pay for "her kind gift" if its a issue but i wanted my sausage. I hate to say im coming back cause clearly customer service is lacking but i really enjoyed the food. I should have known the manager was a joke when i saw her behind the bar getting her hair played with.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Razor calms

FBC8iXu-d8DDD2ZOcgDKDg.text: Came in for happy hour. Only had some appetizers ranging between $3-$6 which included mini fish tacos, pork belly buns, and egg rolls (all were fairly tasty). Also had the cherry sake bomb which was indeed, bomb! $8 for happy hour pricing was a little steep but no complaints since the service was beyond stellar! Adrianne, our server, knew the menu from top to bottom and she owned the seafood talk! This girl knows how to sell the snappers and lobsters! It's a shame we only came in for drinks and apps but will definitely come back to check out the rest.

ub-x2PnSdadtIW99FxyOiw.text: We finally had an opportunity to try this spot out. Everything was amazing and the service is great! Our drinks were constantly topped and the waitress constantly came back to check on our table. The food also came our really fast, one dosh after another! Most importantly, everything was amazing! We ordered :  Pho with rib eye meat- The broth was really good and a good amount of meat  Grilled razor clams- topped with green onion and roasted peanuts (very good)  Beef Carpaccio- meat was very tender, and the sauce was perfectly seasoned (very good)  Raw Oysters- topped with their house special ponzu ( very good)  Green mango salad mixed with squid, Onions, mint, and a light vinaigrette- this dish was light, but it didn't stand out as I thought. Perhaps the squid can be grilled instead of blanched? I would try another type of salad next time  Fish tacos- This was my least favorite appetizer. I was thinking of a more similar concept to sushi roku or nobu yellowtail tacos.  Overall, it was a great experience. We have marked our spot for future returns to Vegas!

UNaPtHdY-Ek5Qm6SshlwPg.text: The waiter TK gave us the best dining experience ever and we dine out at least 6 times a week. TK was very attentive and made sure out experience here was great .  The food tasted very good but his service is what made me want to come back again just to see him . We were very impressed and will recommend all of our friends to specifically see him when we come back .  Asian fusion food and service at its finest .  Ask for TK when you dine here .  He's a young tall asian guy and I think he works the night  shift .

NqKmsSoF5PxgVH8N45B73Q.text: First time trying this place after seeing it in Instagram. Did not disappoint!! Everyone in our group gave their thumbs up on what they ordered!!! Delicious dishes- oxtail loco moco with extra oxtail meat, oxtail fried rice, beef salad, steak plate!!!!! You basically can't go wrong!!!   As for the serve, we had the best waitress EVER!!! Ask for JL, super friendly and honest! She has a great personality and she definitely uses it when providing serve!  Our family will be making this a must stop each Vegas trip and we will spread the word about District One!!!

Jwf9iZKeiZDvy2wuSO8gAA.text: Went here a few months ago for a business dinner and was more than pleasantly surprised. We were a large group and you could tell that the place was full of locals and mostly non Westerners (which I took as a good sign). The place is beautiful and had a very relaxed atmosphere made all the more inviting by its lovely and charming owner. Certainly not an expert on Vietnamese food but coming from NYC I can tell and appreciate well crafted food and this place definitely has it. From the Big Boned Soup to the Beef Carpaccio everything was wonderfully prepared, fresh and full of flavor. If you are in the Las Vegas area I highly recommend checking it out.

BYc_LunczOC3L1oN2F0i2A.text: This place is OK.   I think that the food is decent. I heard about this restaurant from some friends and decided to check it out. I had the grilled squid and it was much chewier than I would have liked.   The pork belly was pretty good but again, a little strange. Not really my cup of tea.   I don't think I would eat here again,

kdXP13NxOSV_iXne8F3FBg.text: Simply awesome. Their lobster pho is amazing. I usually add a side order of oxtail to it to make it a heavenly experience. They were also able to make a fish broth versio for my peacatarian fiancee. While slightly on thr pricey side, you get a lot for the money, especially when it comes to the lobster pho (lots of lobster).

h_1-oOBnKg4SCDianMf0ww.text: I was greatly disappointed given the 4 stars when we went there tonight for happy hour.  The 4 items we ordered as recommended by our server were unimpressive.

oOqLHghM2W5-IQPS73dYZg.text: Located in the same shopping center on Jones Blvd as "China Mama" and "Chada Thai," this Vietnamese-inspired, pan-Asian restaurant has a very different look and feel than most of the nearby Asian spots. From the huge drink selection, to the flat screen TVs playing sports, to the modern, urban, and industrial decor, it's clear the owners designed this space to be a cool destination to hang out, socialize, drink, and dine. District One Kitchen & Bar is also open until 3am and offers some decent happy hour specials from 3pm-6pm and midnight to 3am.  I recently tried this place with four friends on Friday night at 9pm upon the recommendation of an acquaintance. Besides the limited parking in a crowded parking lot, our only complaint was that our five entrees arrived at four different times -- each of them 3-4 minutes apart. The staff made up for it by being extremely attentive with our drinks, however -- three of us had 3-4 refills each -- and a female manager was very gracious and friendly as we exited the restaurant. The food we ordered was also just as good as advertised.   The five of us shared the garlic serrano pepper wings, pork belly buns, Vietnamese beef carpaccio, and fish tacos for our appetizers. The beef carpaccio was definitely our favorite and the fish tacos our least favorite (mainly because of the small portion and $8.95 price tag).  I ordered the Crispy Bird Nest Noodles for my entree and the dish was so tasty I didn't offer a bite to anyone in my group. Two of my friends ordered the Steak & Eggs and raved about the flavor of the steak but complained the eggs weren't cooked to their specification. We were collectively happy with our experience overall, however, and we each agreed we would be back in the future.

0lWW_AQ1l2UBZt-An8toCw.text: Oxtail pho was bomb!  Not sure if it was worth the price tag, but it hit the spot for sure after a long day of drinking.  The pork belly buns and oxtail fried rice were great items to share as well.  This place is worth an uber ride off the strip.

Jna2dQ6-dmVBhF_DFrVc1Q.text: My wife and I came here with our family friends for dinner one night. First of all, I loved the ambience of this place (full bar, tvs, chalkboard walls, etc.). Very hip and modern I would say. We shared the following:  Crispy Egg Rolls $4.95  Spring rolls $5.95  Green papaya salad $7.95  Oxtail Fried Rice $12.95  District One Rice Combo Platter $11.95  Hue Spicy beef noodle soup $9.95  First off, the one unfortunate thing was that they ran out of their bone marrow pho! :( But anyways, the food here was awesome! I would say the best dish was the combo platter with pork chop (or short ribs if you prefer), kimchee, fried egg, and chinese sausage. That dish can easily be shared by 2 people as the portion size is pretty huge. I would say the oxtail fried rice was the least exciting dish as it only had oxtail, egg, and onions. I wanna try their cornish hen and pork belly dishes next time. We will be back!   P.S. Oh ya, they got happy hour too!

xvkxIF97i90c48e08qGWVA.text: Being Vietnamese in town, sometimes you crave a good bowl of pho to cure your hangover, and this is the place to do that with the oxtail pho. They have other variety of food that are little americanized, but it's a good touch. Would come again after 3 750 ml of tequila

NyuGoecHP3ATWfVOhlkT0A.text: The Pho Tam and Vietnamese coffee was just superb!!! I highly recommend when in Vegas to check out District One Kitchen. The food and service was great!!!

Im7QmksoQ0cANb7RGfeuRQ.text: Oooooh em gee!!!  Serrano wings, fish taco, braised pork belly, steak and egg, ribeye pho!!  It was amazing.. Everything melts in your mouth, I can't wait to come back!  However.... On our steak and egg the egg was more than overcooked, it could've been a frisbee!! We requested a new one and OMG the same thing except the yolk was runny. Serious?! Hahaha I still can't figure out how amazing everything is and the egg is your failure... Isn't that like the very first thing we all learn to cook?! Lol.  Yum!

k36dCZvBXZiYWqtADdk65Q.text: If you're ever looking for quality Asian food off the Las Vegas strip, you need to try District One!  My family and I came in just in time for their happy hour! (Happy hours are Mon-Fri 5pm-7pm, Sun-Thurs 12am-2am.) The atmosphere is very modern and styled similarly to Boiling Crab, with lots of wall decor. They also had a really good reggae playlist playing in the restaurant.  Our server, Jewel, was super sweet and attentive throughout our meal. She constantly checked up on us to refill our waters or to ask how we liked the food. She was really knowledgeable about the menu as well; a majority of the food we ordered were recommendations from her!  BELLY BUNS - 3.95 during happy hour, 6.95 regular price You have the option of getting the buns steamed or deep-fried. We tried them deep-fried for that extra crunch and texture, but I've heard they tasted just as good when steamed. Definitely get these, as they seem to be a favorite among District One-goers. I'm not a huge fan of pork, but the pork belly was sooo good and juicy. I recommend!  OXTAIL PHO - 13.99 The pho is a little pricier than the bowls you could get at some of the Vietnamese places deep in Chinatown or elsewhere, but for good reason! They were extremely generous with the oxtail, and it was cooked to perfection; not too fatty, which is how I like it! The broth was just the right amount of salty, and I didn't end up with one of those nasty MSG-headaches after my meal. Broth-to-noodle ratio was perfect!  SHORTRIB RICE - 12.99 This was my brother's order, and I was able to get a few bites in before he finished it all! I believe it comes with steamed rice topped with an egg (anyway you want it), short ribs, Chinese sausage, and pickled carrots/radish.   OXTAIL FRIED RICE - 12.99 Again, the oxtail wasn't lacking in amount; there were pieces in every single bite. The rice wasn't too bland or too salty. The rice is also topped with a fried egg. So so so good, and enough to share with one or two others. I recommend this one too.  Overall, the food was extremely satisfying and didn't leave me feeling too full or gluttonous. I definitely see myself coming back the next time I'm in Vegas! It's open until 2am too; perfect for late night cravings!  (SIDEBAR: I ended up forgetting my wallet here and didn't realize it until I was back in my hotel room at the Vegas strip. Thank you so much to the District One staff for their integrity and safeguarding it until I made it back out to the restaurant to pick it up!)

hB4Gxq8llOHgGqxKGCP1qQ.text: Top quality food, great atmosphere, awesome staff and wide alcohol selection. Our go to place for pho!

HpukVPlACLHG_6_7nAtqXQ.text: Great place. Good people . Will be back with friends. Vi was very helpful with her knowledge. Love this place

oc5Sb94pCHPgB1t0l5Myww.text: Great food and decent service.  Lobster pho is delicious.  Variety of dishes in menu looks good.

xqJCAw5h5OnYCuCeRi7pyA.text: Every time my sisters ask if I want to get district I'm just like YAAAAAASSSS ugh this place is SOO good, the ambience is always soooo casual and so chill I love it and the food omg lets me tell you, their soups and their food is 5/5. So delicious, and if you haven't tried their lobster pho yet it is so unique and authentic yet so delicious but so expensive (so worth it though) the servers are really nice and the food comes out moderately fast. And what I love most about coming here is that they open late and so therefore while all the other restaurants are closing around 1-2 am this place gives you an extra hour to eat and I love it. This place is the perfect place to eat late at night and their food is so delicious I mean go try the oxtail fries next time it's well worth it I promise. Oh and price range may be easily $$ or $$$ but it's worth it I swear

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s see how good these oysters are
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. garlic noodles
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail loco moco

MZtVxEEov2jgczhiVzWJvw.text: I have only been here two times but I enjoyed my second time as much as my first time. It doesn't look like a typical Vietnamese restaurant but I enjoyed the interior mix. The music isn't too loud and the girl that served us both times is very nice! She knows what she's doing and she constantly checked up on us. That's some great customer service! The first time I came, I ordered the oxtail pho and it was so good. It was filling as well and I thought that this would become the place whenever I wanted oxtail pho. My family and I also ordered oxtail fries with shreds of oxtail meat in sauce that is poured on top of the fries. I don't eat fries at all and I was trying not to eat it but I have no regrets. If I was to eat fries, it would only be the oxtail fries because that was seriously the best thing I have ever eaten... In terms of French fries. We also ordered hot tea and they give you this big tea cup with tea bags. The hot tea served is green tea and they give you pots of hot water. I think that topped it all off because when you eat late at night to early morning, you just want good food served in attractive cups, bowls, or plates. This place is a must try and it is just wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oxtail loco moco. Honestly everything with oxtail here is just delicious!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oxtail pho

E548e1wO1PWMaiYbuUyxvw.text: The first time I was here, I ordered the belly buns, house special oysters, and of course, their famous oxtail fried rice. Everything was spot-on amayyyzing, and the fried rice was definitely one of the best I have ever had. The service was especially great as we the waiters were always ready to come whenever we group needed more water, wanted more food in the menu, or needed the bill. Very professional.  However the second time, not so much. We came during the night this time, so I do admit that it was fairly busy. When we were seated it took quite a while for a waiter to come and receive our order, and after that, it took 22 minutes before we were served our water (yes I counted). We were already dying of hunger, and then they could not quench us of our thirst!! I believe that every restaurant should not make this costly mistake of forgetting to serve the customer water. I had to remind the staff that they forgot it.  On the bright side, the oxtail fried rice was still awesome as ever, but for the blunder made earlier, I am only giving this place 4 stars.

120GuDzHhoNMVfQ-GB8myg.text: Service and food was overated!  It took too long to get the main courses after two entrees!   We were the first table at 1:30 pm. All other guests came after us got their foods while we were still waiting for our main dishes!  We were given excuses that main courses would be served after entree was done!  But after our reminder it still took us another 15 minutes to get the main courses! (Obviously our orders had been forgotten) This is not a five star dining restaurant!  With kids together, we expected all orders came up all together!  Kind of disappointing!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-nT-o2yMzbb2xB0jF-f6Lg.text: Love coming here! Deep fried belly buns is a must! Also try the fish tacos which are amazing and always fresh! Must try the beef carpaccio I really love that mostly!

lLlrZfpZzw1xYUsXwA56Cg.text: Food... since we only ordered pho and egg rolls, can't make comments on other food on the menu but as far as pho and egg rolls go, don't eat here, just DON'T. There are way better pho and egg rolls place in town.  Service... people are nice I have to say, but that's as far as it goes. To me they are lacking some common sense or proper eating etiquette. During our meal ,we got asked so many times "How is everything?" While we are trying to eat hot pho, how do you expect us to answer you when you can clearly see we all have mouthful. Not only we were "checked on" by our server but other 4 different girls stopped by and asked the same questions over and over. Can't we just have a peaceful meal? When we do need them to pay bills, no one can be found!!!  Tips... by the end of the meal, all of us were so annoyed just want to pay the bill and leave. They have the iPad bill pay at your table which is convenient but the tipping system starts 15%, we really didn't think the food and service deserve that but didn't have much choice there.  We won't be coming back here for sure.

TB-2Wp8gsiIB5IdcUkY7aA.text: We are obsessed with this place! Everything we've had here was delicious. From oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice, to their belly buns! This our number 1 go to place for pho! Kids love it too.  Amazing food! Great service.

msVA4Uj5dEoerrCKViBgGA.text: We had the big bone soup, the house special oysters, oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice and the vegetable dish (i forgot the name of the dish). Everything tasted bomb and the prices were just right. definitely coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BIG bone soup. Definitely worth a try!

W62FmCN-IzSuWE7h5GrBXw.text: The good:  I've been here four times and I have to say that their appetizers are really good...like really really good. The oysters are to die for. Seriously. They are so sweet and taste so clean and refreshing.  The beef carpaccio is really unique and our table had to re-order it twice in one sitting because it was that good. The wings were also a hit.   The mediocre: All of the entrees I've tried were just okay.  I've had the Mekong river noodles, lobster pho, shaking beef, bone marrow soup, and short rib with rice and none of them were really that good.  The lobster pho did not taste better than any other pho (actually less flavorful).  For some reason everything was very bland compared to the appetizers.   The bad: The Porkchop with rice was extremely dry. Three people at our table ordered it and had to force it down.   Overall, the appetizers overshadow the main courses, hands down. It's like they build you up for something really amazing and then kinda let you down. Regardless, I will keep coming back for the oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries. This was just okay. I would skip it next time.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio

LKF7Y83t5C30cnGzSQwzBw.text: The food and service here was honestly really good. The reasoning behind the three star rating is due to not honoring happy hour rates because of EDC weekend. I get it, business demands are high, however your website advertises happy hour with no restrictions on event weekends here in the city. I suggest placing thar disclaimer because there are other restaurants that will still honor happy hour rates regardless of busy weekends.

E6jUvHulRNJs8VA9L6p4fg.text: Where do I even start?  My family made me pick the dinner spot - I am always looking for something new (to me) and with some adventure.  Yelp it is - Yelp delivers again!  Typical Chinatown stripmall - check.  Non-typical entry and ambiance.  Man, they could serve burgers in this place and be poppin - well done to the interior setup and decorations!  Happy Hour.  Til 7pm.  Nice.  Tried the ENTIRE Happy Hour menu.  Superb.  Oysters??  Top 3 in town.  Crazy.    Pork Belly Buns - bam.  Yellowtail Fish Tacos - Bam.  Asian Beef Carpaccio - BAAAAM (unreal - must must order - doesn't matter what you eat.  Get this.).  And for good measure - awesome cocktails and lots of cool drafts.  Great service from Aaron and the owner; attentive.  Will. Be. Back... Lots.  Go.  Now.

aIjo5IU6a723ae_deKG7Ng.text: There's been a few moments in life where I thought "wow that was life changing"  One of them was when I got stuck in the currents and couldn't swim out while scuba diving 30m deep in the ocean.   Two was the free falling moment from skydiving over the island of Oahu.   Three was discovering the loster pho and oxtail fried rice from district One in Vegas.   One of my favourite to go to food is pho so naturally it's in the basket. I also like seafood so when I saw a whole lobster in my bowl of pho it was a happy moment for me.   The presentation was amazing but moving past that the flavor of the broth was superb . It was rich, aromatic and the noodle was perfectly cooked to my liking.   Oxtail was something I'm familiar with however not cooked in the fried rice format. I thought it would be bland and just like regular fried rice. I was utterly wrong. The dish was perfect. The rice wasn't too dry or moist, the portion of oxtail was very generous.   This spot is a must if you like Vietnamese cuisine or fusion cuisine. It's also a good hangover food spot seeing how it's open til 2am. Saving you from those sad chip bags from 7/11. Pretty considerate if you ask me .

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This may look sad but trust me he died for a good cause. It&#39;s like a party in your mouth and anyone who&#39;s important is there

U3E570UV4c6SVm9fFZfe0g.text: Great Chilled atmosphere with a nice Happy Hour Menu Mon-Friday 5pm-7pm and Sunday's 12am-2am. I highly recommend the  small plate items included in this review. They also offer a Green Papaya Salad, which was simply amazing, love the inclusion of pork. Juliet the waitperson was very nice and made everything a pleasure.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The damage!!! What&#39;s a steal.

suDu4HlHxC117kRNJa-JsQ.text: I made a reservation on July 4th through Yelp and the reservation was confirmed. However, I don't know how to rate this visit because the restaurant was actually CLOSED on July 4th!!! I don't know which party should be responsible for the loss of our time.....

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jmDHHpFxPbkuz7iUAKSEqw.text: Phenomenal food...I recommend the  yellow tail fish tacos, Serrano Chicken Wings and lobster fried rice. The service was awesome. A must go when you're in Las Vegas.

aJa2hblLEDpW7yGStGyNvA.text: I ordered the garlic noodles with steak and fried egg, oxtail fried rice and for the appetizer we had the oxtail fries.   Personally I felt that everything tasted too salty to my liking. Not sure if they use any msg but possibly due to the saltiness of every plate except the fries I tasted.   It was definitely a new experience to try something new. Nothing really caught my taste buds to really want to come again though.

dU3m-gSKtae7ZNm6y3jjVQ.text: Loved the environment of the restaurant. I was a little bummed because there wasn't a vegetarian option for the pho soup.   Corey was awesome! He was very patient with me and went out of his way to make sure my order was just right. He also made sure the sauces I'd be having had no meat & let me know and accommodated sauces that I could use as replacement. Great customer service, left very satisfied.

ifv8kNNj_lIFeFEcw9FVqg.text: This place continues to make me happy! Their oxtail fries are amazing! IPA on tap and their pho broth is the best I've had in town!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tafIn0EaGphWIUYC09A6xA.text: First time eating here and I gotta say would definitely recommend to friends, family, strangers, etc.. We came in not knowing what type of cuisine they served and our waiter came over completely ready to answer any questions/uncertainties that we had. With their Vietnamese cuisine today we ordered: -Pho Tai (?) -Spring Roll -Fresh Coconut (drink) We didn't order much since we weren't sure so we shared the meal. I enjoyed every single bite.  My favorite dish is the Spring Roll and District One nailed it. Keep it up.

jGnzh1rp-OoFnSz8dZ7UPA.text: I love the atmosphere and decor.   The food is overall ok. I got the oxtail fries and lobster pho. The oxtail fries is good! The lobster pho is meh. Presentation is beautiful, but the taste is not that great. Lobster was kind of overcooked :/  I'd give it a 3.5! Will see if their other food is better!

Dht16hMHFj3LENkl3th9oQ.text: Hi  There is nothing I can say bad about this place . From when we arrived till we left...great service and food. India (totui?) was our waitress and she is awesome.  We got there at happy hour and beat the crowd.  Fried buns and garlic noodles Will definitely be making a come back and u have to try the coconut ice.cream

h-tyRerIzW8Ne2ogSY2JnA.text: Fusion Asian food in a sports bar type setting.  Ambiance is chill, slow, and great for guys night out or just any hangout.  Fun names for cocktails and unique combinations.   food sounds innovative....lobster pho sounds luxurious..  shared cubed sashimi tacos in a fried wonton like shell.  it was light and good way to start.  Also got the combo rice plate with korean short ribs, over easy fried egg, chinese sausages, and veges with side of fish sauce.

xVS0rAbs3Ko5sOjK_iUAHg.text: Come here for lunch . We have oxtails fried rice, spicy bun bo hue. Very good. Great atmosphere.awesome service

Kw-s17jIYlK41Vvm5CW8Xg.text: Grea5 place to eat and spend time in Vegas. Must go.  The most important thing is they have great service and super honest people there ( especially Brianna). Drop my wallet and got it back with everything untouched.

8wGh5irHGhI5Pga0IT4g7g.text: My lady and I arrived and waited patiently while there were open tables. We've made it clear we do not want to sit at the bar. A group of four arrived and coincidentally ran into their friends. Two minutes later they were seated, when I asked if they had a reservation, I was told they had a reservation that conveniently didn't "show up in our systems." Yeah, I wasn't born yesterday and will never be coming here again.

h33jBioX-FJVRDxiSJAvqw.text: The porkbelly buns were a combination of sweet and yummy with a little salty kick to compliment it. The price here is kinda expensive our tab was $400 for 16 people

xEhQfPQdSWilvKX9aYV5bA.text: They have the best whole fried fish. You have to try it. Their oxtail fried rice and fish tacos are also on point. If you love authentic Asian food then this is the place.

s0o6g-oX1vV--1xSr9E2qQ.text: Had to try this place after yelping and seeing all the positive reviews! This place did not disappoint! Server was attentive and friendly and made some good food suggestions. Stand out items were the belly buns (pork belly), garlic noodles, and pho chicken. Good variety of different types of Asian food. Even my mom liked it which is rare because she's hard to please! Will definitely come back to try other things when I'm back in town!

Lh6qjdFN8JhbfNJWwrv4wQ.text: District one is somewhat of a novelty restaurant. They get you to come in by offering things you would not normally see in a typical Vietnamese restaurant. Most notably is the lobster pho, where they put an entire cooked lobster in your noodles. While the idea is clever and unique, the price is a little steep for me. While I do love lobster and pho, I wouldn't pay $50 per bowl for it, especially when I can get a good bowl of pho for under $6 back home. Some of the more affordable dishes are the big bone soup, which has tons of delicious cartilage that just falls off the bone and juicy marrow. There's no noodles in it, just soup, but it's good nonetheless. Ox tail fried rice isn't something you see all the time, but they certainly make it good here. I wish some restaurants in Orange County would start picking this dish up.   Service is wonderful, but you better get their early or be prepared to wait in a long line!

e7lDrq9VukDmbQ2XNMIl5A.text: Food is on point was there for lunch. AAAaaamazing must try the lobster pho. Shrimp fried rice was Yummy. Staff is very chill and friendly. Will be  Back soon.

zKupnS9S3OUhydpmLBfnNA.text: Wow.  What a night.  I love this place and this was one of the worst experience I have ever had with the restaurant.  The food is amazing like always; but the service was horrible. Anna was not the best.  Beers came out after appetizers.  Then the incorrect beer came out.  On top of that, she rarely checked on us.  Didn't get our main order until we flagged her down; but once our main dinner came out it was incorrect again.  At that point I had enough.  I asked for a manager to give us another server because at this point the service was ruining the whole experience for us.  Aaron came out and immediately corrected the situation and he is the only reason this review is getting a 3 star and not one.  The food is to amazing to stop coming here; but I will definitely make sure Anna is not serving us after this night.

MkKRiFxuMb7aavQWxjnUaQ.text: Come for the overhyped pho but stay for the appetizers and other dishes.   This place is so heavily advertised that we had to make this a mandatory stop on our trip.  I was not impressed with the pho dishes at all. The Oxtail pho had decent flavor and the taste seemed to get more rich as I kept eating. The Lobster pho was bland and probably the biggest disappointment. I understand this is "exotic" pho but $14 and $MP, respectively, they weren't worth it. What was even more disappointing was paying so much for the pho and it didn't even include the basic meatballs, flank, tripe, tendon, etc. With these two bowls of Pho, you are very limited on meat. You're better off going to a normal Pho restaurant and paying less for more (food & broth quality).   Oxtail Fries were delicious. The gravy wasn't too salty nor was it too rich. It had the right amount of flavor and I would recommend it.   Grilled Squid was also a worthy dish. The squid had a hearty, meaty taste instead of being rubbery so you know it was grilled perfectly. The spicy aioli was a nice touch (as you know I love aioli).   King Crab with spicy aioli was my absolute favorite. The only thing I didn't like about  the dish was that it had me wanting more afterwards. The spicy aioli was a great compliment to the sweet chunk of king crab.   I would still come back here. There are many dishes that I consider unique, and I think it's definitely worth a few more visits. However, I wouldn't recommend the pho unless you're coming for the hype. And if you are, my opinion wouldn't matter anyways.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Squid with spicy aioli sauce

-oezxr0Nhv8ucS83W5SEmA.text: I had the aptly named big bone soup. Again, aptly named--it comes with some seriously big bones with some seriously tasty meat, tendon, and marrow on those bones. The broth underneath is a solid pho base. At $19 it is reasonably priced and a dish uncommon among restaurants of the cuisine in Vegas. Definitely worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big bone soup

DybAmjY0R8_W_VVvj4p8hQ.text: Trendy Asian fusion restaurant off the Strip.   Happy hour 5-7pm for food and drinks.   Tasty food. I recommend the chicken wings, pork belly buns and grilled shrimp skewers.   The green papaya salad didn't taste right.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail fish tacos
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled shrimp skewers with salt
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings

xMXLKJmExnuHVzxwOvj_2Q.text: Had a wonderful experience here. I had to catch a flight two hours from when I entered and service was fast enough where I made it with a lot of time to spare. My friends and I ordered... Bone marrow soup Oxtail pho Half a dozen of oysters (blue point?) Oxtail fries  Let me tell you. Everything was delicious. I got here ten minutes before happy hour ended and the server informed us so we quickly got a few oysters for $1.25 each. The size of the bone marrow soup was HUMONGOUS!!! It was larger than our head. The oxtail fries were surprisingly BOMB. I actually wish I had more room in my stomach so I could finish it :/  The pho was amazing as well. I think it is a bit overpriced, but I'm originally from the east coast so maybe there's a general price difference between the west and east coast? The broth tasted homemade for certain and the portion was huge as well. I would definitely come back again the next time I'm in the area.  I really wanted to try their lobster pho but it's $50 so.... maybe when I'm rich or something, I'll come back to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a dozen of oysters (I think blue point?)
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries

8n9Wjkx_5MTfWBvEMq8QkQ.text: I was visiting from San Diego and my friend from Vegas recommended this spot. It has a very modern/hip ambiance, which pairs well with the booming Vegas lifestyle.   My favorite appetizer was the beef carpaccio. I never thought I would enjoy rare beef because I'm a well-done (don't hate me) type of person, but this dish melts in your mouth leaving you wanting to for more.   Pho Tai Bo Vien is my go-to order at any pho restaurant. Paying a total of ~$12 for a bowl compared to $6 from SD is just not what I'm used to. It was $3 extra for tai (rare steak). But granted they do give you a TON of meat. The rare steak is cut thicker than most traditional pho places that clumps into balls when left in the soup broth for too long. I'd recommend getting the steak on the side.   Staff was pretty nice! They were quick with filling our waters and picking up the finished plates.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio

Pjs_W69aQki1JPnvU9ew3w.text: I was looking forward to trying the food here. But nothing stood out.  Chicken wings: over battered and salty. 5 spice chicken: nothing amazing. Oxtail fried rice: different, tasty but not spectacular. Close to $70 for food and 15% tip for lunch. Somewhat outrageous. I'll go for sushi or a good buffet instead.

XDVUmQeqOsP_b_APoY7REQ.text: The food was ok.  A bit over priced.  Nothing to write home about but no terrible missteps.  There are better options in Vegas.

HAQEK6-6n506IWbWwE5pYA.text: Every time I feel upset or sick I go to district one by my self and I get a big bowl of pho tai rib eye extra spicy and some couple drinks! Every time I love it a little more

_a0TwdEkcFNQw6gXRLoXDA.text: Loved the foods here. My favorite appetizer was fresh oysters and ox-tails fried rice, so delicious!! The wait was 45 minutes every time but worth it every minute!!!
