amFTbCfIcyJLpPFJ8ZuS4g.text: Delicious,  you wont be disappointed with anything you decide to order.  I had the Garlic Noodles and my Husband had the Oxtail Pho and we shared the Crispy Egg Rolls. Such a good treat.  If in Vegas stop by for some good eats.

fEHtix3E7ovpZC79mcun9A.text: Was craving pho & came here on a Friday night. The host seated us right away! (Group of 2) The ambiance was cool. It reminds me of boiling crab but with a bar!   Review based on the pho. I guess I'm just used to golden deli in Cali but yeah the pho was a little off to me. Also, the spring rolls was a little different to me just cuhs the flavor was an acquired taste. The only way I can describe it is "sweet & minty." I like the little crunch tho.   On the plus side, the service was great! I don't know if we had a specific server but there was a couple girls going around. Myra was super attentive! She kept making rounds for anything we needed.   Overall, everyone was great. Pho alone was ok, but I might try to chicken rice next time. Everyone seems to be eating that when we came in!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1W7MSFJvBJGnjYbj4f-emg.text: I made reservations through Yelp and luckily I was able to reserve for 10 people right away last minute. They were close to being on time too. Parking can be tricky and we were there on a Saturday night around 8pm. We ordered a lot. We ordered the snails, oxtail fries, their infamous lobster pho, oxtail pho, oysters and this thin slice meat appetizer. OMG!!!! Everything was so good. Each dish didn't need anything extra to my opinion. It wasn't oily, greasy and didn't make you feel heavy even after all that food. I couldn't stop eating! We saw the bone marrow pho and that can feed at least 3-4 people! It was huge!!!! I'm so coming back here! Customer service was great. It was my cousins bday and and they brought out a coconut ice cream dessert and that was really good too! Highly recommended to anyone coming to Vegas. So worth the wait! See you soon District One!!!!!

YvVVTj0iCpKWaNAwFWgYng.text: The food here is pretty good! Not the cheapest but they're reasonable and you pay for what you get. The service was good and food came quickly. Definitely a place I'll keep coming back to.

nD6wz8bkaQvWrb1fpjA_MA.text: Came here on my lunch break this is the spot ordered the ribeye pho it came in 5 minutes so quick! Highly recommend the service here they are attentive and quick. One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas with their wide variety of Asian alcohol too in their drink menu.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Pho it&#39;s amazing!

LxPEApCda9301PzcB9eXzA.text: 3.5 stars for this visit, I will round up to 4.  My friend suggested we come here for dinner since he was in the mood for Asian food. District One is trendy Vietnamese fusion restaurant. I had trouble finding parking (Saturday night), so had to park across the street.  Service was good, and people checked on us regularly and refilled our waters. The menu wasn't huge, and I decided to pick one of their specialty dishes, lobster pho.  The pho comes with a whole lobster, and a decent amount of meat. While the dish was tasty overall, I was actually expecting the broth to be richer, considering that it was cooked with an entire lobster.   The menu did say market price, and I knew lobster wouldn't be cheap, but the bowl of lobster pho ended up costing $49, and after tax and tip, I spent $61 on my meal. Not really worth it in my opinion. I could have bought an entire fresh lobster and made my own pho for under $30.   Not super impressed by my first visit, but I'm sure other dishes are more reasonably priced, and there were many seemingly appealing dishes on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior.

QOED_lEPgxilZEjmfz6ikw.text: We ordered big bow of beef bone with pho soup, grilled squid, and oxtail fried rice - the soup was full of MSG and quite salty that made us feel headache. The squid was not fully cooked. The fried rice was good but not sure if they added MSG into the rice or not. We Feel disappointed for the night of 4th of July.

7tu0AjpOT0JvsaMEwwgtyg.text: Thoroughly enjoyed the food last two times I came here. Today was an exception. They took a while to acknowledge and seat us. Service was subpar. Food was salty, especially the lobster fried rice I was looking forward to.  Such a disappointing experience for me and my family.

cJeM2WJzTpYI0kALrnzZpQ.text: No complaints here, food is good. A little pricey and out of the way far from the strip though in case you're hoping to stay close to the strip.

qgLAf6IRTCsRSZzsJElohA.text: My third time here and frustrating nite..the big bone marrow meat was tough that you will not enjoy eating it....the meat leftover was a waste that I have no intention to take it home....a bummer dinner....not a happy camper .... a replacement was offered but did not accept it...did not even have anything other than that...but that's cool...

QX02nRd_Mry-l6qNuO5pEg.text: I've gone to district one several times now and I always leave with a satisfied feelin. I never have actually tried the lobster pho - so that will need to be the next thing I try.    I've sat at the bar and have also sat in the booth. I have always had friendly service and quality food. I have tried the wings, the squid (both calamari and grilled), oxtail fried rice and the crispy noodles (birds nest type dish).   ALL THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS. I will say, they are also quite the portion sizes. The dishes can easily be shared with your group. Sometimes it's great to have the small plates to be shared with your group as well.  I find that they make great drinks as well.  There's quite a variety that you can truly explore from their menu. It's also great to hangout at the bar. The bartenders are always friendly and fun to talk to.   The restaurant also has a great vibe. Music isn't too loud--perfect for a fun casual dinner with some friends. I believe you an also rent out one of the smaller rooms as well. I will say one thing that would increase this from a 4 to a 5 star would be having more food selections.   I'll update when I try the lobster pho! haha

pyEP_bZCd5vKpI8SamffcA.text: We've been going to District One since it first opened a couple of years ago. It has always been a pleasant experience but not anymore.  Servers took their time to take our order and were not super friendly like before.  Sorry District One, you are no longer my number one spot to go to.

vtNCj7aSoqLjEaPsH-0xNA.text: Absolute great fusion food! Different variations of asian and mexican twists in my opinion. My must orders would have to be... - Lobster Pho - Oxtail Fries - Pork Belly Sliders - Oxtail Fried Rice  The staff is super informative with the menu and provided great suggestions as far as what I like in certain foods, and they were very honest on what they thought I would enjoy.   I also would like to touch on the parking lot, since it was pretty packed. The center that the restaurant is located in, is very filled with popular places, so I actually ended parking about 5 rows away from the spot. Mind you this is at about 9pm. Definitely worth it though in my opinion!!

RPyls4d_huu1wOLYTp-A2Q.text: Best oxtail pho....actually best oxtail everything, even the fries. They except reservations, walked right in with great service. We always stop here when in Vegas. Recommended the fried rice and the Kalbi beef. Must stop in!

dGt_s6hmKQOY-5dqonKRAg.text: Bottom line first:  if you're prepared to spend $50 on the black pepper lobster, get it. You can thank me later. Parking is atrocious   So I stumbled upon this listing while looking for new places to explore. The more I read from others, the more I became obsessed with it. However, the fact that I could not make a Yelp reservation nor get through by phone twice to make said reservation almost turned me away. Fortunately, my persistence prevailed, and I was able to secure a spot.   All that effort seemed to be unnecessary, as the restaurant was not that full on a Saturday night. On the contrary, parking was a nightmare, as I already predicted from not one but two prior visits to this plaza. I even had to switch from a spot designated for the pizza place for fear of getting towed. Fortunately, I was able to stalk a nice family to their car and secure that treasured spot, with at least 4 other cars floating around.   Nonetheless, once we were seated, we were greeted friendlily (wanna go down a rabbit hole?  Search "friend" and "adverb") and were provided with recommendations of the popular dishes. Although the specials with the lobster were pricy at $50, we had to go for it. With all the nice reviews of the oxtail fried rice, we ordered that as well.   Thankfully, the black pepper lobster was every bit as flavorful as I had hoped. It was a little more spicy than I expected, but in a good way and not overwhelming. The portion with the accompanying chow mein was filling too. The oxtail fried rice was also delicious. We couldn't finish both dishes between the two of us, as I wanted to save room for dessert elsewhere. Thus, we boxed the fried rice for later.   Although the lobster was excellent, its price makes it hard for me to label it as excellent value. That, along with the shortcomings from the reservation and parking (I understand the latter is not within the control of the institution, but it's impractical to park elsewhere), will prevent me from giving it all 5 stars, but I still highly recommend the place to people who are prepared for the challenges. I also look forward to returning and trying new dishes.

Q-SPZfaGfBS_aRElyvsbww.text: I've been here like 25 times....so why am I now just writing a review? With that being said, I have probably tried everything on their menu atleast once. They have a full bar inside, with plenty of seating areas. Some of my favorites include: house oysters, oxtail fried rice, garlic noodles, and shaken beef salad. From the bar: Kronenberg, vietnamese coffee with Hennessey, and vietnamese donkey. Catch me here at happy hour or any hour, sometimes just for drinks. Many times, when I have visitors from out of town, they request to come eat here. Parking can be hard to find during dinner time or late night due to all the other businesses in the plaza.   Just go....you wont be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese donkey
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue

sUM7th0KWw1oM5wgwm4t3g.text: The best place to eat in Vegas. Hands Down! I love this place. This was the last thing we ate when we left Vegas and now it's the first place I ate coming back. If I can only put a ring on it, I would marry district one

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fried Rice
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Down

WnM576Nk7UWTkEOROtyXEg.text: This is definitely a place to stop by when you're in the area. Not like your average Vietnamese restaurants. It has some unique items on the menu and all their food has so much flavor. It was pretty impossible to order just one thing. But their portions were so huge, thankfully both times we went we were in a group so we were able to share food.   The first time we went was at night. I was pretty drunk so I didn't really know what to order. I ended up getting the Oxtail Fries. SO FREAKING GOOD! It was pretty big so I took it home and sadly it wasn't good in the morning. My boyfriend got the Oxtail Pho and he let me taste it and I loved it. My friend got the Wonton Soup but I didn't try it until the next morning since she ended up taking it home.   The next morning when we were all leaving Vegas my friends decided to come back again. This time we had an even bigger group. I just ordered the Oxtail Pho and Fresh Coconut. I was able to finish my noodles but I ended up giving away my Oxtails because it was too much for me. My boyfriend got the Oxtail Fried Rice. One of our friends got the Lobster Pho. I loved it, the Lobster was very meaty and the broth didn't taste like regular Pho broth. It pretty much just tasted like Lobster, no other way to really explain it. My other friend ordered something that was like sauteed Green Beans? I wish I remembered what it was called! That was probably my favorite dish out of everything we all tried.   They had a wide variety of alcohol and I was so tempted to try the Vietnamese Coffee mixed with Hennessey. But I didn't want to leave Vegas feeling weird since Vietnamese Coffee is already strong for me. Plus alcohol was pretty expensive.   Customer service was great. Food came out pretty quick. It is a bit on the pricey side but I feel like it's worth it. I can't wait to come back to Vegas just to come back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries

bUvxxuPoL3acVp1x5aaEag.text: Was not disappointed at all! Another great find off the strip!  Great place to have drinks and enjoy authentic Vietnamese flavors! Definitely a step up from regular Bar food. They even have Henny Privilege on tap!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2pt25h73SsMWoQjwBFTyJA.text: One of my favorite restaurants! When I have friends or family in town, I always take them here. I've tried multiple dishes on their menu and honestly, you cannot go wrong with any item. Last time I was here, I had the chicken wings and those were so bomb! Fried perfectly on the outside while the inside remained juicy. I do have favorites which include shaken beef salad, fish tacos,  oxtail fries, and fresh oysters. Wash everything down with a nice cold glass of Kronenbourg and I'm a happy woman!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shaken beef salad with Kronenbourg in the back!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings

7IQS7wlttLTw1qnnog0hpA.text: District one has a great atmosphere and even greater food. The only downside to this place is the parking. It took me almost 20 minutes to find a parking space due to the limited amount of spaces shared between District One and about ten other restaurants.   The bar has an impressive menu of specialty mixed drinks, beer, and wine. Once our table was ready we ordered the oxtail fries, lemongradd beef, fried calamari, pho, and more. The oxtail was so tender and flavorful that it almost melted in my mouth.   However, I wish the fries were fried slightly longer so that they would be a little more crispy to hold up to all of the oxtail gravy. The beef pho was great, the broth was flavorful and not too salty and there was a good ratio of meat and noodles. Delicious food but next time I come I will make sure to ask for extra crispy fries.

qQImTBwOirXoVJ8vKYFdEg.text: I've been a regular here and I feel as if they aren't as good as they use to be. The staff is still very friendly and made it an enjoyable place to dine. I ordered the veggie pho, the broth was a bit lacking but I did enjoy the variety of vegetables in the soup. It had broccoli, zucchini, tofu, sprouts carrots, all cooked to the perfect tenderness. But there wasn't a lot of noodles. The bf ordered pho tai. He enjoyed it, they didn't skimp on the meat at all but there wasn't a lot of noodles. We ordered the spring rolls, average but the peanut sauce was perfect.

a6jQPpfXS_fhcvG4lDDq1w.text: Whole fried snapper excellent, Squid excellent , and the pho broth was amazing.    Highly recommended!  Wonderful food. Wonderful service.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole fried snapper

laOE7huDB8oypxlMwChMWA.text: This used to be my favorite Pho place in Vegas. After this last visit I don't think I'd come back.  They used to be packed with people waiting inside and outside but this last time there was no wait.  I initially thought 'nice, got seated right away' but then found out why.  The waitress took a while to come to our table and the service was just slow on everything. I ordered the Pho tai nam and there was so much fat on the meat that I ended up not finishing it. You can see from the picture that's what I ended up leaving behind.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Rib Eye - so much meat
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s Nhau!!! Yes, let&#39;s!

_RxZMIZydf_b5x-8eHnpIw.text: Mostly this review is of Cory my bartender, who did an exceptional job coming up with some amazing creations despite them being out of many ingredients.  I'm a big believer that people make all the difference and he certainly proved this!

i67Cr_pus1A2RMP1HqIUBg.text: We came here for Bun bo Hue. This place has the best bbh in Las Vegas as I have tried so many places. Besides sitting for dinning, they have bar area & serve alcohol as well. This place looks trendy & neat which good service. They are always busy for the type of food they are serving fusion Vietnamese which fit in the taste of different food culture as well. The beef bone bowl was super impressive for it size.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This bowl is very big &amp; good for sharing
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

004RsK8cO1J4g7GJPUjcJg.text: Finally we made it to District One!  After so many times driving by this place, we decided to go eat here. I always heard about the good food from other people, and reading the recommendations on Yelp, I was so happy to finally came here to eat. I always loved the Oxtail dishes before, and immediately I decided to order the Oxtail Pho, the Oxtail fried rice, and also ordered the Grilled Whole Squid for appetizer. The waiter told us that our order is the most popular in District One. Knowing that, I was very comfortable with my order.  The air was filled with very good food smell, and I actually got very hungry. Very soon our food arrived. Everything looked amazing! After the first bite, I immediately knew that everything will be delicious. And it was! Truly, I think they serve the best Pho, the best fried rice, and everything.   The Oxtail Pho was very delicious, not salty but very flavorful, with lots of tender meat and rice noodles. I didn't even put in any of the vegetables from the side. That is my most favorite Pho in Las Vegas! The Oxtail fried rice was also very delicious, with tasty oxtail meat pieces in it.  The Grilled Whole Squid was also amazing, according to my friend. I didn't eat that.  The restaurant has lot of tables and seats , has a full service bar. We didn't order any alcoholic beverages but next time I will try some of their specialty drinks.  This place is open late! Very popular, so don't be surprised if you have to wait for a table!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Oxtail

XZg03Anv3Gp32rPaFdpPbA.text: If you're looking for bomb ass Pho in Vegas, then look no further.. I have tried a lot of Pho places here and I must say District one is tha place for authentic delicious Pho!!! I tried the Vietnamese Meatball Pho and that was delicious... from the meatballs to the broth!! So delicious and the spicy Serrano wings were the best wings I had in a very long time!! My husband had the Beef Sirloin Pho which stood no chance against his appetite!! A place that you must try while visiting or if you live in Vegas!! This is the place!! Staff is also very friendly and a good environment to be in!!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Serrano wings!!! Delicious!!

jN6T3eO6opDkoeDVhOq9gQ.text: I think this place is a very hip and fun place to be. It totally reminds me of a revamped cajun shrimp place because there are (3?) sinks outside of the bathroom. The decor and what not also remind me of boiling crab.  They have beer, wine, cocktails, and other liquor. They pump up some rad music too. The food is actually very flavorful, but there are some drawbacks. The price is so-so in that most things are just a little expensive, but then again they have some super expensive dishes  (Lobster pho and the big bone soup will be more expensive)  I tried their: -Mekong River Noodle Soup- This noodle is the best bet for someone looking for a light noodle soup for a hangover. It is light and flavorful. Sometimes beef pho feels a little heavier, so the mekong is a great alternative, especially for older adults. I feel like my grandma would be able to eat this happily.  -Shaken beef salad" stir-fried beef over salad. This was actually my favorite because the meat was super flavorful. So you have some delicious savory meat mixed with raw vegetables. It's a delicious balance that makes you feel like you stayed healthy, yet your heart is fulfilled. However, the beef is quite salty! -Crispy bird's next noodle- was crispy and then softened by the heavy sauce they add. Very flavorful and quite good. It was just too thick and heavy for me. I didn't even finish half of it. I had to take the rest home. It's a huge serving, so you could easily share the one dish between two hungry individuals. Or do family style and split it as a side between 4-5 people (it's a lotttt of food). It's very similar to a chinese noodle (hong kong pan fried noodle?), so I ended up not liking it as much because the noodles were not the way I personally like it. -sea snails: not as bad as I thought it would be but definitely not ever going to get that again. It's kind of chewy like geoduck.

72VSVmulHdxmSagCUBsc8w.text: Pretty expensive but all the food is good! Tried the lobster pho and it was actually pretty good and filling. Service was great

eHVW8zJr9SBJE5Ui4W9zEA.text: First time here. Staff were very good and the food had lots flavor. They have lots of tv's so we were able to watch the warriors game. Would definitely come back to this place again!

Tl3SU3DASIb_yyLlAOCzmg.text: This place is always good! The atmosphere and waiters/waitresses are some of the best. Very professional and willing to accommodate. One of my regular go to spots. Must try: Hamachi tacos, pork belly in young coconut juice, & tomato rice!

pl5dL2ry6vpXinp0dyHWjw.text: I've been here a couple of times. 3 Stars for food and 4 Stars for atmosphere.  Being Vietnamese, I have a certain standard for our food. I also appreciate fusion food. I love what District One is trying to do by modernizing Vietnamese cuisine and appealing to a certain demographic. This place is cool, hip and a joint I would want to hang out at with my friends. However, I am less impressed with the food. Pho is very lacking in flavor, portions of appetizers are really small and prices are higher end compared to other Viet restaurants. I was most dissapointed by the hamachi tacos. 3 of the tiniest tacos the size of a pinky finger and literally a teaspoon of fish in each for over $10. I also ordered the oxtail fries. It had an interesting flavor with Viet spices that were very pronounced. It was ok but the 6+ chunks of gelatinous fat really grossed us out. These pieces were about 22" of pure fat! I think they were trying to pay homage to the oxtail fries at Bachi but really fell short. Wings are always good and the steak and egg platter was as well. There was a nice selection of seafood on their specials board including razor clams, octupus and oysters. I'll try more menu items next time and adjust stars accordingly.

8QKTaexMNNVh2t7nZOfMfA.text: I was very dissatisfied  with my first visit to this restaurant. I saw some nice pictures from friends and I wanted to experience the same. Early in the afternoon they had run out of two popular dishes (big bone soup and lobster pho) as well as their coconut ice cream. I know certain dishes in restaurants do run out due to popular demand but in those cases I would expect the staff to at least suggest alternative dishes. They didn't even do that or show much empathy to the fact that I was disappointed that they didn't have what I wanted. This staff lacks customer service and pride for their food and restaurant. What I got was a waitress that alternated with another waiter while they clearly displayed a miscommunication of service. At the beginning these two made them selves available to take our order at different times when we had already given our order to one of them. Then they alternated breaking the news of the dishes they ran out of. In my opinion one unavailable dish is permissible , two is cause for concern, and three means they may need to fire their purchaser. They have good product but the business is amateur. My visit was 1/3/15

_d5k-ZFVyqzvo_ThnRKTtA.text: Over priced, bad portion size, lousy atmosphere!  Menu is ridiculous not sure what kind of restaurant this is. Way overpriced!

_GI9vX0TcE-oO8HQ8QD0AQ.text: great food and great service:) will come back:) love their beef pho soup and spring roll:)

bio6FHOVKxCIIbpuEMBr5w.text: Omg! I cant even right now. This is the best vietnamese cuisine i have ever eaten in my life. The king crab, the beef tatami, the squid, the oysters, the pho, the lobster.... Incredibly delicious. The staff and the owner are super nice and friendly. I come here every single time im in Vegas and Distroct One never dissapoints me. Highly recommend this place to everyone out there.

ycCE4zWwS3GsK7NJGX_DNA.text: Very underwhelming. Heard great things about this place but it was honestly mediocre. We got the squid, fish tacos, pho filet mignon, oxtail pho, and pork belly. The only thing that was worth it was the fish tacos. Everything else was kind of blah and not worth the price. The service was also very slow. Our waitress was friendly, but the food took forever to come out. All the tables around us got their food faster than us. Some of our food actually came lukewarm, but we got so hungry from waiting that we didn't care. Don't think we'll be coming back.

AH_12mmv1QuSwKF82UY7pw.text: Stopped in this place for drinks while waiting on another reservation. The staff was the most friendly of any Vegas establishment we have been to so far. The drinks were great and they helped my husband pick a nice Japanese beer. After our other reservation, we came back to finish out our night! I ordered the sea snails but didn't care for them. I don't have much experience with that type of thing but I am pretty sure they were over cooked (very rubbery) and they had sand in them still. Did not try anything else on the menu but will definitely go back.

30Gole6WcIbBYJ3B3ko9VQ.text: Papaya salad was awesome. Chicken pot also very tasty. However pork belly was not very tender.  Squid was overdone. Easy to get a seat. Nice service.

Q8JgXio2Sut0MxgMGZwaTg.text: This is my favorite new restaurant. There's a good variety on the menu and I can't wait to try every single dish! Here are my recommended dishes: tamarind crab (the best crab ever, albeit a bit messy to eat), fish tacos (most reviews recommend this one), spring rolls, pork belly buns, and crispy birds nest. Besides the good food, the service is superb.

g9SMt_qWKv_SGPYIwUf86w.text: Great service. I was underwhelmed with the oxtail fries (gelatinous Demi-glace) and the fish taco's (no real flavor) had to add chile sauce for some taste. Pho was VERY salty...Due to reviews I was expecting much more!!

VftvmBf9Rczumx6uJxyDpA.text: I love it!  The oysters always taste so fresh and the veggie pho is my go to.  The tacos, although small, pack a wallop of taste.  But I reiterate, they are SMALL.  They have Kronenberg Blanc on tap here and it's one of my favorite beers.  District One is a Pho restaurant so stick to the hits.  Also, if you get the big bone soup, be prepared, it is LITERALLY a big bone in some broth.  Go for the oxtail, you get bone, meat, and pho, not just the broth.  But those are small caveats to a great place.

gvgG_Rd3JM12eJkD_c0PaA.text: The best pho in town! I love to go here after i get out of the club! Its the best cure for hangover

DSKY7QNbm-737V-klqoLlg.text: Good food & service. We went for lunch ordering the pork buns, big bone marrow soup, steak & eggs sub the rice for garlic noodles, short ribs and rice combo. Everything was yummy and the booth had plenty of space for our kids. The customers continuously came in on a Sunday for lunch, I can imagine the dinner and late nights are packed.

Gp63BXXW5dnSkjAayEQYBw.text: Been here three times now and with each visit it gets better! Lobster pho, beef carpaccio,  and oysters are must haves. Service is great and the owner has come by the table to check on things each time we've been. You'll be happy you stopped in.

pwo4VDPl5vgL0re16ehNGg.text: Came here with a friend and his sister (both locals) at their recommendation before heading to the airport to return home after a business trip.  Initially, I was a tad put off, for as we entered the establishment, the hostess, possibly the manager, completely ignored us for several minutes, favoring she was chatting with near the bar.  Eventually, she came over, seated us, and returned to her friend and a group of young gentleman sitting near the bar.  She never left that spot the rest of the time that we were there.  In my opinion, not the best managerial customer service.  But I digress...we arrived during Happy Hour, so I ordered two orders of the pork belly baos and one order of the tamarind chicken wings.  The service was very friendly and prompt.  The food was delicious!  Definitely, an excellent recommendation from my friend.  Definitely a locals place, but worth the drive if you are staying on the Strip.   Hopefully, the manager will learn to be a bit more attentive to all of her customers.

2ldGCFFGs0PII_DC8082SA.text: This place is so awesome! Love the atmosphere, love the happy hour menu, love the bartenders (especially Tomas and Marcus)! Great beer selection, if you go, i mean WHEN you go, definitely get the belly buns, the edamame (comes with spicy cuttlefish mixed into it in a gooey way, yum yum! for all you azn flavor lovers) shrimp spring rolls, and serano pepper wings:) thank you districtONE!

W7BKfR6BrkpHrqN1z43DPg.text: Superbly made dishes with an ever expanding menu... I've been there with my family and work colleagues on numerous occasions and they've never disappointed..

9xemVT0S_CZE57j0D_mgvA.text: garlic fries for 4.99 is a rip off, pork belly is good but a bit too sweet, pho is amazing, pork chop rice is good but steam rice is too hard

yoGEopTPfHY6oAHE1akZyQ.text: Friendly staff.  Limited vegan options.  No veggie broth for hubs.  My spicy beef soup was ok, not great.  10% off for hour wait because told 20 minutes.  My fault for not getting details about food.

BNbB92Xej1UdS1b4skF56g.text: I want to give this place more stars because my food was delicious but unfortunately my last two visits had terrible service. I am not one to complain, but they just made their second strike with me last night. My first time I got the oxtail loco moco and my boyfriend got the shrimp with the D1 goodness sauce. The loco moco came out in 10 minutes. It was super flavorful and came in a big portion. My boyfriend's shrimp came out 20 minutes later which makes the cooks or servers seem really inconsistent. Not only did he wait 20 more minutes, but the shrimp was cold, not cleaned properly, and the sauce was tasteless like some unsalted vegetable broth. Luckily, we got it off our check since we were dissatisfied. We came in last night and ordered the wings as our appetizer, the oxtail fried rice, and the braised pork belly. Our server asked us if we wanted to have the appetizer come out first or have it all come out at the same time as the entrees. We asked to have it come out first. After waiting, we both receive our entrees both from different servers for whatever reason. Our wings came out 10 minutes after the entrees which wasn't a big deal, but it made the server look bad. All the food was so delicious, but we noticed that our server just seemed to act like she wasn't even serving our table anymore which is funny because I don't know how hard it is to serve ONE table. She would walk by and avoid eye contact and we kept trying to get her attention by raising our hand and etc. We ended up having to ask other servers for a to go box and the check since we were waiting for almost 20 minutes to grab her attention but she was too busy talking to her friend/co-worker who was standing right near our table. Since the other servers didn't bring us what we needed my boyfriend stood up and acted like he was about to leave and she still didn't give two shits to the point where we could have dine and dashed. He had to basically ask her loudly for a to go box and the check since she started walking away from the area of our table after she was done talking to her friend then she asks us if we want dessert. Are you kidding? She is a fucking joke of a server. Serving is such an easy job especially if you only have ONE table. I don't like tipping badly because I'm a server myself, but she didn't deserve the normal 20%. I know she wasn't new because I've seen her before so she needs to be retrained or something.

wTM9j5z00hKjIdzWrRQFsQ.text: Service is a huge component of the food and beverage industry. If you have 80% empty tables and three groups of people standing by the host stand with no host in sight, there is a problem right there. Having multiple groups of people waiting near the entrance for over 15 min just for an empty restaurant is incredibly disrespectful and rude. After making eye contact with multiple waitresses no one seemed to care to come over and give us an idea of the preposterous situation. It is only after I personally call a waiter to come over will they then come and acknowledge our ridiculous wait. I then asked, do we wait for a host or do we just seat ourselves, and the waiter replies, let me call someone over. This tedious process of waiting to get seated at an empty restaurant shows incompetence and a lack of quality in the staff. Our group then left the restaurant because we understood that our business was not welcome there.

1Rt4DXpNLRHzMIxuYPezDQ.text: Biggest problem which will be a disaster to one unsuspecting customer one day (like a child, senior or disabled person): Currently, their handrail exceeds the width of the platform you must walk on to get to your table. This gives the illusion that there is no drop off/step down when in fact the drop off is over a foot deep between the step off and the handrail. The whole purpose of a rail is for people to hold onto it and to prevent them from falling off of a ledge. Here, if you reach for the handrail, you fall off the ledge. One member of our party who had recently undergone knee surgery, almost fell off the platform due to the handrail illusion which would have been disastrous. I hope the restaurant fixes this and takes this seriously before someone gets seriously hurt. Inconsistent food with good service. Atmosphere is cool and light-hearted.

FqgLwyv6ntpLg6QFIFI4HQ.text: The food here is amazing. I'm actually at the restaurant right now and just wanted to share my experience. So the waitress took our order at 11:38 pm. We ordered an order of 6 garlic pepper wings, among other things. At 11:55, the wings are brought out to us. At 12:00, the waitress brings us a happy hour menu, on which the wings we ordered are $0.50 each. On the regular menu an order of 6 wings is $6.95. We had not touched the wings yet, and the waitress claims she didn't realize what time it was. I asked if we could pay the happy hour menu price for the wings. She asked the manager and the answer is no because she had put the order in before it was happy hour. COME ONNNNNNNN. You didn't even mention that happy hour was coming up. You know if you were the customer, you would feel somewhat cheated... I wish this experience wouldn't have happened because I really like this place....

tW96Cz3AhaFLO_zNa9GK_Q.text: This was my favorite restaurant then they opened. I went at least twice a week. The food was incredible and I couldn't get enough. Over time they stopped serving most of my favorite dishes and the food became very inconsistent. I asked what happened, apparently they lost their chef. After several disappointing meals I stopped going.

bAl0QGZ9eQmQjgqd9kAsTg.text: Just awesome place to eat. Price is reasonable for the amount of serving and the goodness of their foodhappy tummy.

wR3dIsKqAijWzoZRrO5rrA.text: Love the ambiance and location (don't dig that parking is 60 minutes max and impossible to find on a weekend), and the greeters got us seated immediately on a busy weekend. The food is a swell Asian fusion that is cheaper than expected for a swanky industrial-club like atmosphere (seems like a great place to bring a first-date). However, the food was not as OMG as some of the yelp reviews had persuaded me to believe. My steak and egg rice plate was not bad, and the portion size of stir-fried beef, a soft-fried egg, and ketchup fried rice was just right. But the flavors were just okay, about on par with any decent Chinese restaurant. But for $14.95 (their online menu prices are out of date), I wasn't blown away. Our party of six stayed well past finishing our meals, and the servers were attentive and didn't rush us. There was a server error however, where we ordered the oxtail fries but they mistakenly brought us something that may have been garlic fries. We ate a few before we noticed the mistake, and when we let the server know, he took the half-eaten garlic fries away and made us wait for the correct order. I know it varies from place to place, but I'm used to servers leaving the wrong dish on the table as a comp when they make a mistake--especially when it's an appetizer that they're just going to throw away anyway (hopefully \:0 ). Oh well. When the oxtail fries finally arrived, they smelled great--but honestly, they weren't anything really revelatory. I assume their fries aren't fresh-cut. They seemed frozen, but I could be wrong. Their service was fast and friendly, and the prices were okay, and they have that hipster factor going on. I'm not opposed to going back--would like to try out their spin on pho.

FsyQRuEt-Y8BMKbYXbhuMA.text: this place is great!!!! Great I tell you. Came here at midnight on a Monday. We wanted to try the lobster pho but it was sold out. Oh well, my fiancee got the oxtail pho with beef meetballs. I got the spare ribs + the porkchop with rice and a fried egg. We also got the pork belly buns for appetiver. Wow those pork belly buns were amazing. Very nice and perfectly seasoned a must try. The portions of both of our dinners were HUGE!!! Great place cannot wait to come back here with friends.

2KIyDe3D_u2lpaOVmwdvyA.text: Great food and great service. Each time I go there, my must items are beef carpaccio, ox tail soup, and fish tacos. You cannot go wrong with any of these items. The service are excellent.

9lR8rV5VF8y6-oML0MyueA.text: The food, atmosphere and service were good. I don't have anything negative to say about the place, but there is nothing special about the place either. The lobster pho was a fun and different concept, and they do serve a generous portion of lobster. Other than the lobster itself, the pho tasted like a beef broth pho. I expected it to taste more like lobster, or at least, seafood. The chicken pho is served with dark meat, not white. Not sure if white meat is optional. The steak and egg was good. The soft shell crab is good except the ponzu sauce that was served with the soft shell crab did not taste like the traditional ponzu sauce. Their papaya salad also didn't taste like the traditional papaya salad. The spring rolls were good. The worst item we ordered was the kimchi. They totally missed the flavor. All in all, if I want to eat Pho or any other Asian dish, I would go to authentic Asian places. This place was more Asian fusion.

dUVOxqRPsVUNxMieAYcbrQ.text: Omg yessss!!! This place is sooooooo good like seriously I wold come back anytime! I had there stake and eggs and it was so good! And there ice cream is the besttt!!!

Ogpm9zYLvggjwdhzkhDGgQ.text: lobster pho was the reason for my visit.  pretty good but not worth $40.  worth a try tho.  their shaking beef salad was on point.  good ambiance and good service overall

TvGaYTSSvMV65hInkgaXTg.text: My wife and I have been here many times. Great food and drinks. Creative and thoughtful. Beautiful decor and great service. The staff is always attentive and accommodating. (Even when we bring our kids ) Go to dishes include oxtail fried rice, veggie pho, spicy beef pho, oxtail fries, and oysters. The daily specials can be great as well. Also a great late night place. Many of us that cook on the strip come after work.

LZUe53zK4TvHELH-r4t28g.text: It is my favorite restaurant now! I went there again this afternoon and had two Pho, beef carpaccio, oxtail fried rice for party of three. Always so happy with the service and the food quality!

oL4U4-K4y6pfnJWT93W13g.text: First we love the decor, the atmosphere and how clean this place is.  Everyone is very friendly and helpful.  They have sake on tab! woohoo! They also carry such a large collections of wines, beers and Japanese whiskey. U gotta try Japanese whiskey such as hibiki, oh my it;s so smooth and trust me, no hangover the next day.  We ordered a lot of items on the menu, overall we are pretty content about the foods.  Oysters with house special sauce is very fresh, the tobiko on top adds a different texture to the oysters, we totally love it.  They said they only serve fresh crawfishes. Yup, no frozen crawfishes for me! Their sauce is less intense than other places in town. But i love it, less garlicky feeling the next day thank you! Tamarin crab was good. I wished the sauce was a little thicker but its still good, a balance between sour, sweet and salty. Yum yum! Their egg rolls serve hot and crispy. They have taro inside, my favorite in town. Their beef wrapped in betel leaves are yummiest. You can taste the lemon grass in every bite. It's very moist and well seasoned. It goes so well with the green onion and peanuts on top. We tried the pho oxtail and both agreed that its totally authentic. The broth is richer than other places, not too strong of the pho spices. It is not easy to make a good pho broth, you can kill it when putting too much spices. This place got it right, got it right! Oh and their beef carpaccio, I have never had it this way before. The truffle oil is such a smart move. I enjoy every bite of it, the beef melts in my mouth. Overall there are some room for improvement but for such a new opening place, it deserves a five stars.

qBhSeJLWyoC3uTgB262JUA.text: Pretty good food and atmosphere.  They have an amazing beef carapacio and my favorite is the grilled squid!

c_JaSLt-jIGuos6hNVpiMA.text: The pho was delicious, but on the smaller portioned than I would have liked.  I tried the lobster pho and didn't regret it.  The presentation of the lobster was superb.  They even de-shelled the claws for you!

C2fxCR_hQ2a2ItELnUjUwg.text: My buddy and I ordered and ate the same food except I also had 6 oysters. Within 15 minutes I was vomiting explosively in the bathroom. Then 10 minutes later I was vomiting again. After that I got better and by an hour or so after that I was back to normal. It was the oysters they were bad and I got them up in enough time to not have any lingering effects. I notified my waitress and she denied it. I have filed with the Nevada Health Department to let them know the issue. The waitress and cook were way too dismissive of what happened.

KU21Fwvw_pBnEKa7jzXggQ.text: So disappointed  I drove from the southeast  part of Las Vegas  I got there and there was no bone marrow  soup.  Lesson learned so 2nd time I called told me in about 3 hours I got tired of the long time so I went somewhere else. 3rd time I called they said they had the soup so I drove there again. Took them almost 45 minutes to prepare  it. I am thinking this  would  be awesome. Someone asked me if I wanted something to drink so I ordered  iced coffee. When  he came back he said there was no cream so I said forget the coffee bring me my soup. Finally it came it was a big bone soup, I was imagining  all the bone marrow  that I was getting I was so excited, I put my knife  inside the bone no marrow.  The other bone had a little  so I was ok until someone  ask me how the food was I told her about the situation  and she totally agreed  with me, she went to the kitchen  to talk to the chef and the answer was  it depends on the cut of the bone. The name of the soup was big bone soup the description  said it has marrow on it. But there was a tiny tiny marrow in this humongous bone. I'm sorry but I'm not coming back.  By the way the service was good but I  drove there  twice for the bone  marrow soup. For me it didn't  happen.

b-OWbh9edjGYBr3F17G-FQ.text: It's a great place to hand out with friends. Love their beef carpaccio. it's a must try item. The big bone soup is awesome. It really means BIG BONE or huge bone. My friends love it. Also, the ox tail fried rice and the coconut pork belly rice are really good too. Good restaurant. I recommend it.

The wings were crispy with a Serrano pepper on top, you can take it off it you don't want all the heat.   The oxtail fried rice has a fried egg on top, everything tastes better with an egg. 5fAsXmhra4eDMxtcdROLIA.text: Excellent food makes you forgive minor gripes like having to explain repeatedly Restaurant Week-to a clueless waitress who disappeared for most of our meal. But that's minor compared to the overall excellence of our meal.   We had the Restaurant Week Menu this visit and it was delicious. We had the spring rolls and lemongrass beef wrapped in betel leaves both with addictive dipping sauces.  Entrees were fantastic. The ox tail fries and shrimp pho were wonderful, replete with complex and unique flavors. The dessert was just as excellent. Their in-house coconut ice cream rests in a cradle of tender coconut in the shell.

qFZZmTrYf3A7jDz6TGhHqA.text: It's no secret that I love pho. All my friends know this so they suggested that I come check out District One. It is how Vegas does pho. I wanted to be surprised so I didn't even look on Yelp before coming to check them out. When I arrived, my friends already had a table and started on drinks. Guess we were drinking first before eating lol. Boy did we drink! Customer service was excellent the entire night. The staff was very friendly.   I quickly glanced at the menu while drinking and knew I wanted their The Original Whole Maine Lobster Pho. It was 1.5 lbs of Maine Lobster over pho so it was massive. Gotta be Vegas. It was Market Price so it'll change from time to time on price. The broth was delicious and sweet. Great lobster flavor. There was just the perfect amount of noodles in the bowl. I saw the table next to us order the The Big Bone Soup and it looked insane. It'll be my order next time I'm in Vegas. Maybe both so I can have Surf and Turf.

URHPcAfSCeSSJo6y93c_uA.text: LOBSTER PHO & WHOLE GRILLED SQUID  At DISTRICT ONE Kitchen & Bar   Saturday, November 17, 2018 around Lunch time  SENSATIONAL! I have never tasted pho broth so divine before! I am also delighted that my $49 bowl of Lobster Pho have bite size pieces of lobster already deshelled - no hard to get to hidden lobster meat to break your teeth over - and done just right.     I gobble it all up and shovel in the remaining broth in less than ten minutes. Still hungry, I order another plate of $12.99 Whole Grilled Squid. Perfectly cook; taste like chewy lard confection.  Great value!  I could not finish and doggy bag half for later enjoyment.  THANK YOU DISTRICT ONE FOR BEING A PART OF MY NAUGHTY BUT NICE XXX SOCIAL CALENDAR!

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole Grilled Squid - very tasty finger licking food &amp; good size!

WRsXwSkrwc1R10Bee5g7Uw.text: Great service and great food! They were able to accommodate a party of 20 without hassle and additional fees as we ran into other restaurants. The belly buns, Lobster Pho, Birdsnest Noodles, crispy wings, and the Rib eye pho! All delicious! The mojito in the coconut was on the sweeter side, with a good kick! Thank you District One for a great dinner and great service! Also, make sure you share. We've been here before while visiting Vegas and there is always left over food. They give healthy portions. They are super accommodating. We asked for 4 separate checks and did it with a smile. As an ex server I hated to do that. Lol  It's nice to get out of the strip area and have a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B6-zD_89DO4CeWif85K8Mg.text: Have you been to mom & pop Vietnamese family restaurants in the States where all the menus are nearly identical that never change? This District One (D1) joint is the opposite of that routine.  They are all over the news & is one of the top Las Vegas restaurants.  In Sai Gon (Viet Nam),  District 1 is where all the actions are, and features some of the best cuisines of the country.  This D1 restaurant represents well what Sai Gon has to offer; really brought us close to home!  They feature some of the most authentic Vietnamese dishes with a twist in style or presentation.  They are comfort foods that you come in not necessarily because you are hungry, but because you crave some of the dishes that mom & grandma haven't cooked in awhile.  This joint is owned & operated by my friend, Chef Khai Vu.  I tell ya what, I am really glad that I loved everything that I ate there, so now I can wholeheartedly endorse this restaurant & truthfully feel great about backing it! By the way, neither Chef Khai Vu nor his wife ask me to write any of this.  In fact, they have no idea I am writing this review.  Also, D1 frequently hosts watch party for live sports event, so follow them on Facebook for event announcements & special offers.  There's a lil something for everyone at D1; I guarantee it!

JB_g9jg-juvLROg1dT17lw.text: Well, where to begin... I have not posted on Yelp in a looong time, however, this place was worth it. If you mix an english pup, and one of the best Pho Places in Vegas, then you got District 1. From their signature beef bone pho to their hand-crafted, Asian Inspired Cocktails, District 1 takes the cake! Adria & Selena, took hospitality to a whole new level! They took care of us through this crazy soccer game, and made us feel sooo welcome. They new the menu and made Amazing suggestions, and the flavors coming out if this place are off the chain. Come here, it's busy, totally worth your time!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Nam!

o-qvBOBo6bfWMCRbbU5mig.text: "I'm the only white dude in the whole place" whispers Midwest Poker bud.  "Huh, I didn't notice" I say looking around at my two Asian poker buds and a restaurant filled with Asians watching March Madness.  "You guys order for me so I don't stand out" he continues.  "Whatever" I say, my voice brightening as my fellow buds break into huge grins.   District One has come into its own.  The menu has been refined.  The list of cocktails greatly improved.  Outstanding selection of Japanese whiskey and other brown libations.  Inviting with all the elements to back up a great experience.  To start, sea snails in a beautifully infused chili, basil, lemongrass broth is outstanding.  Chewy as they should be, the broth has the distinct smell of the sea (like boiling stones collected from the ocean) with good herbaceous overtones greatly enhances the flavor.  The Vietnamese beef carpaccio is different in a good way.  Thin slices of beef are arranged on a plate, lightly torched before being drowned with sesame, citrus, and soy.  Basil, mint, a bit of truffle oil all enhance the minearality of the beef.  Crushed peanuts and thin slics of onion add texture.  A squeeze of fresh lime makes the flavors explode.  The grilled whole squid so simple and so good.  Plump, not very tender but not dried.  Light charred bitterness and aggressive seasoning.  It doesn't need the accompanying spicy aioli (taste like siracha and mayo)  For larger dishes, the fried whole fish.  Deep fried, finished in a sweet tangy sauce supported by raw onions, fresh cilantro, and green pickled papaya.  Good eats.  Some places are overcooked and slightly tough, it adds to the rustic nature of the dish.  The lobster pho (whole 1.5lb Maine lobster) remains excellent; the broth becoming incredibly rich and flavorful if you mix in the tamale of the lobster.  Eat this quick else the tail rapidly overcooks and becomes tough.    Finally, the "Big Bone Soup" remains very good.  Loads of marrow and great extraction make for an unctious soup that delivers on flavor.  Very good, attentive service with just the right amount of casual familiarity.  Excellent libation list and well made craft cocktails that perfectly match their flavors.  Solid, solid, solid and worthy as one of the best "modern" Vietnamese eateries in the city.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese whiskey list (As of 04.2018)

bGS284ko0AbsZKW5MUT4WQ.text: Keep on coming back for their oxtail fried rice and their happy hour!!! Great service and fast kitchen.

k1Rp7JULykws7_0LR5LRgA.text: When in Vegas, we always love to dine out and this place was on the radar of one of our friends from Nor. Cal.  This place with over 1,400 reviews was all the buzz of the town. It's pretty much go BIG or go home for this place and their menu went big with the Steak and Lobster Pho.   Although we didn't get any of that, we as a group of 16 that came in at 10pm was easily accommodated.  Even though we sat in 2 split tables, I thought the service was excellent. They came back for water refills, drink orders, and was not hesitant about splitting checks due to our large Cali family that meets once a year in Vegas. I also appreciate that even though we had as a group of 16, they didn't automatically charge us the 18% tip and thus, we gave them 20% since we appreciate that kind of service.   As for the food, here's the sketchy part. Some items I do feel was a little overpriced. Ordered a Pho Tom for $11.99 and it came with about 5 shrimps. So value wise, it was not great and taste wise, it was just okay.   However, the Oxtail Fried Rice was excellent. It comes with a perfectly cooked egg on top and though it was $16, it was terrific. Also ordered the Spicy Hue noodle soup. Their shank was excellent though it was sliced thin and there wasn't enough of it. It is spicy, maybe a 7 out of 10. The broth was excellent as well.   Love the flavors here, just a little torn about how much you get for the price. But I would definitely come back here, perhaps with a large group again so we can share other items from the menu. The shared parking lot at night took a little effort, so you have to be a little patient finding that spot.

S4hYkSgMKhLeBOxZXI0kwQ.text: So this was supposed to be the spot!  Or so we was told.  This place is usually packed our friends told us.  But, luckily for us, it wasn't too crowded.  We ordered the Lobster Pho and Lobster with Garlic Noodles.  The lobster pho had a pretty good broth.  But some of the lobster tasted old.  And $49 seemed a little steep.    The lobster with garlic noodle was better than the pho.  But once again, it was $49.    We finished it with some fucky coconut dessert.  It was okay.  $150 for this meal seemed quite steep.    The bartender was really friendly though.

t921OIlViaJyPEoA9rhP8Q.text: I don't even know where to start because we ordered so much... My favorites were the belly buns and the steak and eggs. Had to order a second round of those. The spring rolls and beef carpaccio were pretty solid and close runner ups. To be honest though, i enjoyed everything. We also ordered eggrolls, the double down of korean short ribs and chinese sausage, oxtail fries, and pho. Everything was demolished.  Service was excellent, restaurant is clean, and ingredients seem fresh and of high quality.

EePWqH400K3nEILjqFdFFw.text: I've wanted to like District One, but that may be the reason why I was disappointed with their food. A modern Vietnamese restaurant that has the city talking and even some of the country talking with their introduction to whole lobster pho a few years back.  I didn't dig the interior. It reminds me of Boiling Crab with the log looking tables and wall fixtures. The emphasis on sports and drinking with all of the TV's make it an option to watch sporting events.  The thing about District One is that their pho broth wasn't good. We tried two bowls of pho, oxtail fries, and egg rolls. I had this thought in my head that they really had this modern Vietnamese restaurant that improved on a classic and elevated it, but the pho was so bland. With Vietnamese pho I am a purist. I add my veggies and that's it: no fish sauce no hot sauce, nothing. I had to hook my broth up so much to make it decent. The oxtail fries were good with lots of oxtail meat, but not as good as Bachi's. The egg rolls were so small and the filling very dry and at $9 for 4 pieces was a hard no from me.  I have to give them props on their staff. They have a lot of staff and they are very attentive-you're not only helped by one person.  At the end of the day I would not go back to District One for pho. If I want a good bowl of pho I would definitely try somewhere else. I recommend stepping the broth game up otherwise nothing is enticing.

jRVX97uwh5-PrEVyiT-D6g.text: First time here, not really happy with the service, slowness. Big bone to go was leaking in the grocery plastic bag. I think this will be our last time here as well. Took forever to get the food. Good luck everyone.

U7u60LpdvOlhzwslAIVrVg.text: I came here a on a late night eating with a group of friends. It was our last night together after EDC. This was the only restaurant on a Monday night where there was no wait time over an hour. The staff was great. The appetizers came really quick. The only reason I gave 4 stars was the grilled squid tentacles were more burnt to eat. Other than I loved the restaurant.  I will come back here when I visit Las Vegas!

The lobster pho was $50 so we opted not to try it.  -Bone marrow soup is huge, but does not come with noodles. Be ready to use your hands to pick off meat from the bones. You can order a side of noodles.  -Oxtail fried rice was really good. 9/10 -Pho with oxtail and pho with ribeye was good, the broth tasted clean  -Appetizer wings was lacking flavor, would not recommend   -Beef chopped salad was decent, huge pieces of lettuce

BYmbxTbenZMxYG_9kuaohg.text: Our first experience was good. We did recommend my friends check out this place if they are in Vegas too. But NOT this 2nd time. As we entered in (around 12:40pm) the restaurant not really packed. We signed in with party of 6 and the owner (or probably the manager) said the wait time about 25 mins. However, it took us more than one hour to get a table. (We got a table around 1:55p) We don't mind about the wait may be a little bit longer. But the thing is we saw they took the customers came AFTER us in first, just because they have the RELATIONSHIP with the owner, so they got priority? WE DON'T like that. It's not fair!!! Anyway, you have lose us (and many our friends) as your valued customers in the future. There are still many good pho places around here. We rather go to the places that respect and treat customers fairly. And now we just realized they gave us a wrong bill.  They over charged us. We ordered 6 bowls of oxtail pho, 4 side of rare steak on the side, 4 Vietnamese coffee, 1 fried rice and 1 grilled squid.   I would give this place 0 star but the waiters were nice. ESP, thank you the guy who took our orders and served us nicely.

8cT3ro7uRwhGpKq9QsZyJQ.text: I'm not sure if this restaurant is owned by a Vietnamese person but the foods here are very asian fusion and not Vietnamese tradition. I known district one restaurant through social media for their lobster pho.  Visiting Vegas this week and I  pay a visited to them. It was a disappointed experiences.  The restaurant was packed on a Monday night. A waitress sat me at the bar and I ordered the lobster pho,the sea snail dish and a coconut cocktail. She then told me that the market price for the lobster is $45 and I said ok. The foods came out at a  fairly time. The lobster pho tasted very mediocre with full of msg on the broth. The bowl have little noodles . Lobster meats only have a few pieces in the pho. The waitress never gave me any bean sprouts, basils, hot peppers for the pho. Very bad practice of services consider this place sell pho the most on their menu. The waiter should be educated and train how to serve pho to their customers. I thought the reviews about this place are very over rated and they foods are expensive compared to other pho restaurants in the area.

cysuYakXveGY00Y66Xqgaw.text: This place is worthy of 5 stars on the Garlic Serrano wings alone! The pho was great too but don't sleep on those wings.

0p0jcwmla0BikoduYewqvA.text: I'm from SJ, California and I have had my fair share of Vietnamese food. This place puts a twist on the original style of Viet food, but I can say that they done it well. It's modernized for the American and young crowd, but you can still taste the original cooking style within the sauce and broth. It might be on the pricey side but it was definitely worth the experience.  I had the Steak and Eggs which is basically Bo luc lc and I gotta say it was great. The steak was tender, juicy and had that similar taste of A1 sauce while the fried rice complimented the beef really well. It balanced out the rich taste of the sauce. The portion size was comparable to the price.  If you're in Vegas and don't mind taking a 10 minute ride off the strip, I would recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs yum!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1.21.2018 Menu

P3GU4CugccLDmGH2caFBwg.text: I don't like pho.   Wife loves it but not me.  Someone once said to me that is smells like feet and rotten cheese and I never shook it.  There are two exceptions.  Holla atcha boy Trinh Tran.  On special occasions, he would make a Maine sized lobster pot of pho that would make a vegan swoon.  Alas, he's back in Chicago.  The second is District One.   This is what pho should taste AND smell like.  District One caters to a young, cool crowd of Asian hotties, is clean, and has an attentive staff.  Their prices are very reasonable.  I like this place and highly recommend.  Thank you for restoring my faith in pho!

3XQtBSt3ogLzcZQMsteiMA.text: I find it rather strange that I've passed this place about a million times but have never tried it.  As of my new year resolution, it's time to end old ways and start off fresh! And that means fresh pho!  At first glance at their menu, their pho a little bit more pricier than most places but the broth seemed to have a little more flavor than other noodle bars that I've previously had before. It's also a little bit more salty for my own tastes, but comes with plenty of meat to fill you up.  I also got to sample their cooked ika (squid) with spicy mayo sauce. It's not bad and has a decently charred crust layer to chewy squid ratio on it. While glancing their appetizer menu, the prices can add up pretty quickly but I'm sure they're a decent discount on their happy hour times. Call me cheap but I just felt for a pho place though, most of the items seemed a little more outside my casual dining-post college grad-hard not life-price range.  The interior is clean and comfortable, but service was slightly slow. Maybe I just came at a bad time? I wouldn't mind stopping by again one day if I'm close by and too lazy to drive elsewhere, but it didn't really seem much to me to be a stand out from the crowd kinda place tbh.  District one felt more like a district three star out of five. But maybe I can try it again later on and have a change of heart?

-AI3o2ypGXW1sI6aJwfW-A.text: This place has the best oxtail pho in town. The broth was rich and full of flavor, and the noodles were soft and silky.  In addition to this, we also ordered chicken wings with serrano, spring rolls, and bok choy braised in garlic. The bok choy was so delicious and an amazing side dish.  Not to mention the excellent service and great reasonable menu prices. I would definitely come back and recommend this place to others. You will not be disappointed.

Cy4C7hvo_z3samwHq-GsNw.text: I think they have a lot of good food aside from what I ordered with my friends. Of course, we came here for the lobster pho! We ordered two different ones that they offered (one was lobster and beef pho, and the other was just lobster pho) and an oxtail fried rice. Surprisingly, I actually like the oxtail fried rice more.  I didn't like the lobster pho as much because I expected the broth to have some lobster or seafood taste to it. It was a good base for regular pho, but not good enough for lobster pho. I wish there was more seafood/freshness in its broth. It just felt like they boiled the lobster and placed it into the pho--meh. Disappointed. BUT THE OXTAIL FRIED RICE! AHH! It was really good. They definitely did a good job with that--please do yourself a favor and order that okay? Yes.  I like the way this place is set up and the staffs are super nice. As I was walking out of here, I saw many interesting dishes that people ordered. When I come back to Vegas, I definitely would LOVE to come back here! Eating the lobster pho once is enough, after all it's MP and with was $50 at the time of our purchase. Not worth $50!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fried Rice (please order it).

eY39nTDAl82JWoVSfxZuQQ.text: This place is always great! Great flavor and service. Make sure you get there hungry so you can try multiple  dishes :)

rpRt_J0z1QuO7ocZJJfLwg.text: The service and food is always good when I come here. The Oxtail Fries and Belly Buns are good appetizers! I always get the Oxtail Pho, which never disappoints. Getting the meat from the oxtail can get a little messy, but at least it's interactive. The Vietnamese Donkey and Coconut Mojito are excellent! Parking can be and issue sometimes, especially for dinner. You have been warned.

wd1dpo0nm_-RKuK6e_yaew.text: Updating my review to 5 stars because of the Ox Tail Fried Rice. I've eaten this at least once every time I'm in town. And man, it never disappoints.

4M6aGZDoKbq3xKGBeFoOqA.text: I love their appetizers and their drinks are good! The atmosphere is cool for a night of hanging out with friends. Not too loud either!

ePChQyEw4FYrAI8yNE7xcQ.text: Long line and wait, the only dish I would come back is for their bone marrow and oxtail fried rice. Employee, it's alright ., some are friendly and some are not,

BIrRyjy4EFU75HeU1EQfSg.text: My favorite new Vietnamese joint in Vegas!!!!  Came here to have lunch on my birthday with fam bam. This place was recommended by a friend of mine but since it was cold and rainy out.. decided to have something warm for lunch.  Oxtail soup - Im a biggggg fan now. Ever since I had their oxtail soup.. I've actually started making it at home because of this. I love how there is soooo much flavor packed into the broth. Its $15 for a bowl and you get 3 big pieces of oxtail (which is a lot more then most places who serve oxtail). Very filling and worth coming back.  Shaken Beef Salad - my mother-in-law ordered this dish because she wanted something light. But the portion was pretty big for one person. Again.. the meat was packed with flavor and balances out with the salad.   Coconut pork belly - my husband ordered this plate and I tried a piece of it. It came with CHUNKS of pork belly which is always a plus!!! Very sizeable portion & delicious.  Since it was my birthday the restaurant gave me a complimentary coconut ice cream served in a coconut. Light but sooo goooooddd. I especially liked that it was served in a coconut so you can shave a little bit of coconut into your ice cream. Not overly sweet but super creamy. Wish I could bring a gallon of this ice cream back home

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Pork Belly

zWaeNi7lO7eQcdsdSFnwNg.text: Man. I barely write 2 star reviews man... but this past week has been cutting it.  Everyone's been telling me about District One and how great their food is, especially the Lobster Pho. Apparently, it was on Buzzfeed, but Buzzfeed hypes up spots so easily and it's really not that great.  My friends from OC and LA said good things and I was like okay, let's give it a try.  First off, I am not a fan of fusion food.  It takes off the authentic taste of the origin. I am not against the idea, but I am just not into it.  I looked at the Lobster Pho and it just seems extra and not tasty, so I didn't bother. I've tried it before, and I was just not happy with it.  Today, luckily we went with 8 people so I was able to try various options. Oxtail Pho - Soup was bland, had no flavor. Eggrolls - I don't know why my basket had so much Basil and Mint. (Yes, I know how to eat Eggrolls correctly) I practically am Vietnamese. Oxtail Fried Rice - This was the only dish which had flavor. But wow, there was so much oil .... was it the Chinese Sausag?? Steak and Eggs - It's basically the Shaken Beef plate. Rice was bland, the beef was sauteed with vegetable... but it wasn't mind blowing or anything. Double down - Garlic noodle... I didn't taste any of the garlic in there. The meat was all whatever.  Overall, there was just no flavor. Presentation is important but what's the point if the food doesn't pull through?

9IKgKdDYRBvPA4UZDyqMhg.text: I have to come here every time I'm in Vegas! The good is something you have to come and try for yourself! My favorite dish is the bone marrow soup! It's big enough for 3 ppl in my opinion. The vibe is nice and drinks are good. Usually pretty busy so make a reservation!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow soup!

UzoTkfVIia21yON6VtmVJQ.text: So we are in Vegas, tired of the buffets and the high end dinners, so we stopped by this place after seeing a video on Buzzfeed.   We ordered the lobster pho (for us, it was $49) and oxtail fried rice.   To be honest, both of the dishes were pretty salty, the fried rice being a little more bearable, so we politely complained and they remade our lobster pho and to apologize for the inconvenience, they gave us a creme brulee dessert.   The oxtail fried rice was BOMB (despite it being salty) I would 100 percent recommend this dish.  As for lobster pho..  if you like lobster and pho, it might be a good choice for you, but honestly,  it wasn't that special.    O, and the creme brulee is so worth it.  Get it!! Fyi, happy hour from 5~7. Look at my pics for the happy hour menu.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu as of June 1st.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brulee, so worth it!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho

wDviRcm4hr4ZNgXHraxpZQ.text: We ordered three entrees. The first one showed up twenty minutes before the next two.  We ordered two Black Pepper Lobster.  It came out so hot,  like it was microwaved. The tail had been removed.  I will never return.

Ce2vYKb1lexY9MhJUnOlDw.text: I am a frequent flyer at district one,  the staff is great always smiling the bartenders are on top of there game, great recommendations for food and drinks

9tAMmN-6Dj-Z_N9DKeCbbw.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas, I have to make a stop here.  A lot of people come to check out the Lobster Pho, but I come back for the other delicious items on the menu!   A modern, hip take on a pho restaurant, District One offers items that take it up one level.  They are known for their lobster pho, which features a whole in the bowl!  It's quite tasty, and the broth has a delicate balance of traditional pho and the exquisite flavor of lobster!  However, set at market price, it has pretty hefty price tag, typically above $40 a bowl.  I recommend getting a bowl for the table and sharing it along with another item per person.  The Bone, which features a hearty serving of bone marrow in pho broth is a delicious go to! Use a straw to slurp the marrow out!!! Does not come with noodles.  If you are looking for something more traditional, the Oxtail Pho will hit the spot.  Speaking of oxtail, the oxtail fried rice is one of my favorite things here!   They have Hennessy Privilege in two here!  I suggest you get it! There is also a Hennessy iced coffee which is insanely delicious!  It's Vegas after all!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t8XTf_klrDnmySGbsjEVJg.text: We love this place!  We've eaten here a number of times and it is always a knock out.  Our most recent meal was a late lunch.  We shared the prime rib pho, spring rolls, lemongrass beef, and the shrimp skewer.  For two people, it was PLENTY of food.  The spring rolls were delicious and the peanut sauce is excellent.  The beef was succulent and very flavorful.  The pho is a huge bowl with lots of meat.  The fresh vegetables served with the pho were very fresh and crisp.  Excellent.  The only disappointment was the shrimp -- sadly, there was only one shrimp.  We wished for more.  Add two beers (drafts) and we were done.  Friendly service and knowledgeable staff.  We'll be back, as always.

fzeAOdsXm8KWlSJO_fjfmA.text: I've been here before many times but this time  oysters  tasted old and the carpaccio was buried in nuts

-cRJl3EseaEOsFiYurNTMg.text: All right earlier tonight after driving around we ended up at District One in Las Vegas on Jones just off of Spring Mountain. We decided to give this place another try after a few months. To start we ordered the garlic fries which has fresh crushed garlic and Cajun seasoning. We  ordered the fries well-done extra crispy and they came out soggy I wasn't a fan.  We  ordered the fish tacos which was yellowtail sashimi, Avocado, cilantro, and cherry tomatoes. The tacos were delicious we were  very happy they had a unique wonton taco shell which really made the dish no complaints. Next we ordered the belly buns which was braised pork belly, Cilantro, and peanuts with a typical bun. I was very disappointed with them they need a lot of work, they are average at best. Next we tried the Oxtail  Fried Rice which had Shredded Oxtail meat, red onion, soy sauce and a fried egg. Another disappointment they said it was one of their more popular dishes but failed to deliver amongst our table. Lastly we tried the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio which consists of beef carpaccio, citrus soy, sesame oil, truffle oil, white onions, basil and peanuts. This was very good, nothing that I would completely rave  about but very good. No complaints I would order it and the tacos again for sure. Pros: Good food, cool atmosphere, good crowd and they're open late. Cons: although some of the dishes are good the rest of menu definitely needs some work. They really could be doing better. The staff seemed a little distracted with each other talking and on their phones at times and not really paying attention to a lot of the tables my friends and I had to wait a few times for water and drinks. After ordering appetizers our waiter disappeared for at least 15 minutes before he came back to take our entree order. Lastly no wifi this is always a bother considering it's 2017 and every business should offer it to their patrons. We are leaving disappointed for a second time which is very frustrating. This place has so much potential and they keep dropping the ball. If they step their game up and improve the menu and food quality we would go all the time. As of now they have two strikes against them and I don't want there to be a third. We will give them another chance in a month or so and we will see. As of now they get a C maybe even a C-
