sg1kyUN0lHvNwRW1WPosQw.text: I was very happy with my food choices until my poached egg was very under cooked. I will probably not go there again for breakfast, maybe try lunch or dinner. The services was good.

CdiJaYR0EX-JjzQVWkB2nw.text: By far the best pho I have ever had! They also served me one of the better bloody mary's I have had as well. Prices were decent and fair. I ordered the surf and turf pho which is half lobster and half beef flank. They were definitely generous with their meat portions but the bowl of pho came out to $35, which I should have asked about before ordering. Beware the wait! My group of 3 people had to wait over half an hour but the hostess was very sweet and accommodating, she offered water several times to everyone waiting.

Ogin29F2ziEhO40pjTvhlg.text: This place is a great find. Service is excellent, the prices are great and the food is delicious! Bone marrow pho with rice is the bomb. The bone marrow is massive and the broth is so good. Best place to go the next day for a hangover.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow pho

msZN_NWmDprjwrtq2FZn3A.text: I quite like this place. Well, I like their service.  And what I also like is they also have a bar as well. Warming atmosphere and space booth.  We order egg rolls, spicy beef noodle and fried rice.  Along with 2 beers. Fried rice doesnt stand out to me. Egg rolls presentation was very nice. Crunchy, hot and tasty wrapped with lettuce and pickle veggies dipped with fish sauce. The (bun bo hue) spicy beef noodle will be off my list on my next visit sorry. It's too greasy To the point I can't even scoop a spoon of soup enjoy. Ended up just ate all the noodle and meat.

K60H4ti-kU751_AH4zaLAg.text: Went there after seeing videos online.  Service was top notch. Waitress and owner gave grade A service which I haven't seen in awhile. :)  Lobster pho was good but not great.  Lobster fried rice was better in my opinion.   Papaya salad has a nice blend of Korean and Viet flavors.  Snails were good as well.  Didn't care too much for the beef gravy fries though.  Think it's good if you're drinking.  Would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho good but not great.  No complaints tho.  One thing good is that the lobster was not over cooked.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster fried rice was the best here

_VBq7oaO4_LSXE3B2Viu_w.text: Wow this place is amazing. They have a lot of Vietnamese dishes, I ordered their take on the bun bo hue, which is spicy beef noodle soup with like pork. Traditional bun bo hue has pork knuckle, pork blood and beef shank, but they skip the two former and keep the latter. The broth wasn't too spicy, but you can ask for this chilli paste, which elevates the spice level by a lot if you'd like. I tried out some of my friend's oxtail fried rice, and that was delicious, ox tail meat, and an egg served however you like. I will definitely order that the next time I am in town.   The restaurant itself is pretty big, plenty of parking in the plaza they are in. Tons of TVs set up so you can catch the game and what not. They also have other delicious looking items, like king crab, soft shell crab, oysters, spring rolls, oxtail fries...etc

a95nBM8ST5MS9rQKshbP5A.text: District one is okay, but their menu is a lot smaller than any Viet restaurant in town and is definitely more expensive. My bf and I ordered the beef Carpaccio, big bone soup, pho-ghetti, and stuffed jalapenos. The food was slightly below average. Beef Carpaccio didn't taste fresh and the meat was brown in some areas. Big bone soup was more for presentation than practical for eating.  Stuffed jalapenos were really bland. Their special, pho-ghetti was actually decent, but that was it.  Don't think I'd be back. Price and food wasn't worth it.

trerO7ooXtipqwXWeaqIJQ.text: Not my cup of tea really.  It's a hip place to go for sure though. The bar looks really good so that might make up. We ordered the calamari, papaya salad, Serrano chicken wings, and pork buns. Calamari was decent but I think I got more fried jalapeno slices than calamari. The wings were completely overrated.  Came out burnt with no seasonings other than some diced Serrano peppers sprinkled on top (no lie). The papaya salad was different being a soy sauce and seasoned oil base instead of the traditional lime.  I'm still up in the air on that one.  The pork buns were pork buns, nothing to write home about.  The best part of the whole meal were my kids meal. We ordered the short rib with Chinese sausage entree which came out looking pretty good.  Overall the place looks like a really nice place to hang out with some friends and chit chat over a few brews. Food wise I can find better places to spend my money on.

273QkL5kndljRFdJ-a6Z0A.text: Our original dinner plans for the night was yakiniku however for some reason Gyu-kaku was packed so we called a Yelp audible and settled on this place. Asian Fusion is what drew us to this place.   Their claim to fame is here is the lobster pho ($33 mkt price today) which of course I did not order!  Fish Sauce  Hot Wings 5*.  For those of you who do not know, this is the business. I know it sounds strange but the fish sauce glaze was very well put together and gave the wings a subtle salty flavor.   Oxtail Loco Moco 3* This dish was very deceiving as it was not a True loco moco. I was expecting the hamburger patty smothered in the oxtail gravy and topped with an egg. Instead, all I got was oxtail gravy and an egg. So basically it was just gravy rice topped with an egg.    Oxtail fries 4*  I like their rendition of the oxtail fries. It was generous serving. the gravy was loaded with the  oxtail meat and not just essence of oxtail like those other guys (bachi)  Spring Rolls 4* These were your standard fair spring rolls. They were served the real way with leafy lettuce to wrap them up and eat with. On point!  Vietnamese Carpaccio 3* This was a very cool and different take on traditional carpaccio. It was like eating the raw beef steak that comes with pho.  .      Birdnest Noodles 3* This was the "safe" dish that we ordered. Nothing wow about this one. It was Hong Kong style crispy noodles topped with veggies, meat and gravy. This is my favorite type of noodle dish hands down so it was a win for me.     I enjoyed all of the food that we ordered and think that we got a good sample of what this place is all about! I give this place credit in the creativity and skill in creating these dishes. Vietnamese food is very strong in flavor and can often be overpowering for the novice eater. This place is a good starter for those who aren't familiar with Vietnamese food but want to give it a try. For those of us who grew up on these flavors this place is a breath of fresh air from the traditional...  I Likey...  Eat with confidence....

I was able to eat it has the way it came out as. Definitely coming back here when I come in town. The service was quickly and the people there are so nice. It was my birthday and they gave me free homemade ice cream. It was so yummy!!!! Go check this place out for their lobster pho

fIPXWC2197QgZqu2iqVACg.text: This restaurant is amazing. I love the decoration, the service and the food! Got referral from a friend and I tries out the Lobster Pho bowl. It turned out GREAT! xPaUOAZAiV3n14tFMYxTwQ.text: Went on a Tuesday night with a group of 8.  I liked the space.  It was open and reminded me of a couple of hipsterish places in New Orleans I frequented (e.g., Cochon Butcher).    - The service was solid and very helpful with those that have dietary restrictions - The wings were crispy and tangy and the jalepeno/chili sauce accompaniment was very nice.  Nicely balanced tang and spiciness - The spring rolls were above average.  The mint was a little stronger and the shrimp were larger.  Nice mix - The beef fried rice was delicious.  The beef was shredded rather than cubed and had a nice meaty and rich flavor.  Mixing it with the egg and some sriracha and I was in heaven

W8lK_lSKhPQeZ4Htbe_FUA.text: The first time (and second) my husband and I ate here, the food was amazing and we couldn't stop thinking about it. We honestly kept joking around that we would drive out to vegas just to eat here. But the last few times we've come in, it feels like the quality has gone down. I'll start off by saying that out of the last 3 times we came in (once in June, July and August) they were always out of the bone marrow soup. The beef carpaccio (which was our FAVORITE dish...I had dreams about this dish), was just ok. It didn't seem to have the same amount of flavor it had the first two times we came. The pork belly buns always came out with dry pork and one of the days we had lunch, my husband ordered a fresh coconut and was given one that had absolutely NO coconut meat inside! He waved down a server and asked them if they reused the shells, and she said absolutely not and promptly gave him a new coconut....and lo and behold, this one actually had coconut meat. Maybe it was just a coincidence...but he hasn't ordered coconut juice here since.

4h_sOUQ1u1wsVREyVMYDKA.text: My boyfriend and I are visiting from out of town and I really wanted some PHO Glad we decided to try District One. My PHO had such good flavor and was fresh, my boyfriend had the "daily special" Ribeyeamd loved it. We'll definitely be back since we are here in Vegas every few months and I highly recommend District One

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmmy!!!

nfBbVqXRUId-NzHkGW5yDw.text: This is our go to pho place during every vegas trip. That doesn't mean that all they have is the typical pho and vietnamese food. The pho here is decent at best, but they have other items worth noting.  Oxtail fries - delicious!! I love this here and its a nice change if you don't want noodles or rice dishes. The meal is very tender and flavorful, topped with a nice crisp egg cooked over easy.   Spring rolls - These were really good. I really enjoyed that they put the crunchy eggroll wrap in there that usually is in nem nuong.   Pork belly buns- My favorite thing here! The buns were delicious and the pork belly slices were melt in your mouthhhh.   Garlic noodles - I added chicken for 3.00. This was my entree but the most disappointing. The noodles were p bland and flavorless with only a hint of garlic and the chicken did not make it any better. I had to add soy sauce.. Incredibly disapointing, I would not recommend this at all.   Service was good and attentive and the ambience is nice. Very clean and spacious establishment

OuoRyaTUXeittZ58xLmNig.text: Came here for a Saturday night dinner with my brother. Good Yelp reviews, and they take reservations. The food was great. We ordered oysters on the half shell and side of baby bok Choy.  I had the oxtail pho, meat was tender, soup was light (not salty or thick). Hubby had the surf and turf pho (generous lobster tail and rib eye meat). My sis-in-law ordered the spicy noodles, she loved it but too spicy for me. My brother ordered the Cornish hen and rice. The 5 star rating is because the food was delicious and the service was great. We will definitely go back next time we're in town.

nojQUpG3Yi62W0MsnRrguA.text: Good I guess. Pho broth kinda sucked really. Actually the meal sucked it was just flashy and different. Throw the lobster head in my pho but have no lobster stock. Why wouldn't you save the body for stock you dumbasses. I don't care what my pho looks like I just want good quality stock. Instead I got some over cooked lobster meat in a big bowl. Omg how special

bn4AzYmsoErrtYWmSK9a5w.text: My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place! The location is right in the heart of Chinatown but it doesn't make you feel like it...like you're cramped in a small restaurant, touching elbows with the next couple. It's very spacious - you have options of sitting at the bar, nicely spaced out tables, or booths accommodating large groups.   We're addicted to pho hence our regular check-ins here! This is one of our favorite spots in town. Pho Tai Nam is my go-to dish to order. The secret is in the broth and it is delicious. My boyfriend, on the other hand, loves to mix it up. He likes the Pork Belly Buns, Hot Pepper Wings, and always has room to devour those Crispy Egg Rolls. I think the Vietnamese Coffee is to die for.  I love Happy Hour! Monday thru Friday 3pm-7pm and Sunday 12am-3am. There are specials on drinks and appetizers.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Rolls w/ veggies

PzzNKUTn8drd8i00RtBJrw.text: I heard about this place and decided that the next time I was in Vegas I would check it out. Luckily I was here this past weekend with some friends! I came here for one thing and one thing only -- the Lobster Pho. At the seasonal price I paid $40 but it was worth every penny. You get a whole lobster chillin in your bowl of pho and he just stares back at you as if he were saying "eat me!" The broth itself was lobster in flavor and it was delicious. My boyfriend can vouch for that because he's Vietnamese :) Our friends ordered pork belly buns, pho tai rib eye, and steak and eggs and were pleased with their dishes. District One gives out generous servings and their service is quick and great. I might have to make this a traditional spot to eat at every time I'm in Vegas. Thank you District One for a wonderful dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There&#39;s something in my pho!

rHGqX-ySkHl-RN7ctjTiew.text: Oxtail pho and lobster pho were the biggest hits with our large group. Also loved that carpaccio!

NsTFl0HaorsUqU07rmXlZA.text: I've been to District One twice, on my weekend getaways to Vegas. Let me tell you, what a great spot to have our last meal on Sunday's before heading out to Cali.   Restaurant was clean and very modern, great vibe, and servers were very well accommodating throughout our whole stay. They kept checking up on us making sure we enjoyed our food and not in the ridiculously nagging way, either! Our first time there, we sat at the bar and the Bartender was one of the owners/managers? She was very friendly and gave us the rundown on what their specialities were and a little background on the restaurant as well!  Food: Both time, for those Sunday Vegas Hangover Cures, I've gotten the oxtail pho. Omgggg, to die for, honestly. Also, their broth is a bit different from other Pho restaurants I've been too, but not in the bad way!  They are also known for their lobster pho, which I have yet to try, but I am sure trying it the next time I go. I've also tried their Vietnamese Coffee, and that definitely lived up to expectations. For those that know the Sunday traffic on the 5 going towards California, definitely order the Viet Coffee, if you had a long weekend!  All in all, I'm always really excited when we get to stop by District One!

fV4-XsbEefWx8CKv0RXgcw.text: The mission was to come to Vegas and rock out at Rock in Rio. The side mission was to find delectable grub and not settle for overpriced offerings on the strip. The answer...hook up with a buddy who knows how to cut through the grime and find us some grub. Who knew we would find grub so good we would come back three times in a span of 24 hours kind of grub because that is exactly what I did here.   This place is unique. You see the word "fusion" tossed around now a days like casual sex at pool parties. But this is fusion at its best. It's fusion because for the most part it has stayed True to what it is. You have your choice of pho here but not like anywhere else. Here a few things stick out like ox tail, lobster, and ribeye pho. Crazy right? Then they have the big bone marrow soup, which is exactly that but hot damn it's good. I have come back three times now for the ox tail fried rice. This is perfection. It's carefully blended ox tail soaked up in every particle of rice topped with an egg over easy. It's awesome and flawless. I would not do anything to change this but ask for more. I tried the ox tail fried rice and put it in a bowl. I then topped the bowl with broth from the bone marrow soup and I think I died for a moment. It was definitely a few moments in time that paused because my taste buds didn't know how to process the information my taste receptors were communicating.  Also tried their wings here, and spring rolls. Those were delicious. I wanted to get to the garlic noodles but I couldn't make myself move past the fried rice.  I'm still here so who knows? Maybe I'll make it for a 4th time before leaving?  Update: yes we did make it a 4th before leaving Vegas. So four times in 48 hours.   Now you go try it and you try not to come back 4 times. Tell Kai the owner how much you love it and he might just give you shots of Jameson.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is just to show you how big the bone was.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hollowed out bone
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big bone marrow soup

uYumZN5khBQGTZZjz_AZSA.text: I was looking for a late night restaurant and was lucky enough to have read a thrillist article with District One on it.  Love the atmosphere,  the drinks and the food.  Great place!

qbDbYPj9pSTvuKJsjvzyag.text: Spring roll, short rib and belly buns are delish! First time here today. We will definitely be back when we're in town.

D7uTq4OJ-FhgElBAWTevEw.text: Long weekend in Vegas and decided to go off the strip for dinner and so glad we did. Everything we ate, drank and the service were all top notch! We shared quite a few dishes including the lobster fried rice, oxtail pho, spring rolls, birds nest noodles all so delicious! The margarita was one of the best I've had. The coconut cocktail was delicious served in a fresh coconut and they served the extra juice on the side. Delicious! Service was friendly and fast but not too fast, knowledgeable and didn't oversell us. Highly recommend!

SrL1ethTrRxEolJbXt_Nrw.text: Ok four stars for having Delirium on tap!!!!!  Food is good and their HH is excellent.  Wings are delicious and they even have Fernet Branca on tap!  Lighting is a bit strange and a little to bright. They have some cool old fashion bulbs, but then have some bright led type near the bar...just a bit bright.  I think if they had all old style bulbs, I'd give this place 5 stars!  ;)

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH menu.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delirium on tap!

laFbNRK8r5b6FyM0116lHw.text: We have been here a few times and brought friends & family when they come in to town. No one has been disappointed. There's just too many delicious dishes to mention. We have our favorites like the chicken wings, garlic noodles, squid and my husband has to have the coconut ice cream. They are open pretty late and in prime time they are busy.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream

Hyo8LBfysnumEBm5-UuLvA.text: I love this place. Great food, good beer, and awesome whiskey selection. Everyone is always friendly and welcoming and makes you feel at home. The best part is that all of these great things come at a great price. I always feel like I get more value then I pay for. Only draw back is the parking on weekend. It gets really crowded in the parking lot because of all the other businesses but I brave it to visit this awesome place.

svVpK0ZufA22ZM17f_6NKA.text: 4 stars is what this place averages and rightly so. With quite a few traditional Asian restaurants in this center and across the street this place offers traditional Asian dishes with a twist.   Had the oxtail fried rice - excellent. A bit greasy, but it's OXTAIL!  Chicken wings - meh......could use a little kick of something either spicy or sweet, they were just kind of there   Bao - good, missing something to stand out and knock you off your seat, but good  Bone marrow soup - good. Wife thought it was too salty, I thought it was right. Like the fatty tendon and meat you can pick off. Fun and different.  Service was great. Didn't catch her name but she was very active, filled up water constantly (any foodie knows Asain restaurants usually get an F- on this) but she was great! Helped us pack up our take home and did it all with a smile.  Cost wise it was fair. Chicken wings were a bit expensive for what you got, fried rice was well worth the 8 bucks and the soup and bao were fair.  More than anything this place can clean your standard Asain food palette with something different. Will come back and order the fried rice and soup.

n7zEwjyr4z6Up7_gG_AlUA.text: Once I heard they served a beautiful dish called "Lobster Pho," I was sold. I made it a mission to include this on my short vacation to Las Vegas.  Nice little setting in a strip mall.  The lights were on the dim side, making it a little more intimate.  I liked the modern decorations/graphics along the walls.  TVs in every corner so we were able to enjoy the basketball game while dining.  They even have a bar if you just want to grab drinks and relax.  Now comes the exciting part, FOOD. Appetizers: Oxtail Fries - 3 stars.  I would compare this to poutine.  Nothing too special in my book. I believe it was $11.99 and for the portion and quality, I wouldn't get it again Shaken Beef Salad -  4 stars.  If you're Cambodian, it definitely reminds me of Loc Lac without the rice.  Delicious flavor and generous portion size but $11.95 could be pricey for most.   House Special Oysters - 5 Stars!  Mmm, they were really fresh and had great flavor!  This definitely made me crave oysters more often. Entrees: Steak  & Egg - 4 stars.  Amazing flavor of the beef on top of lettuce and tomatoes.  Egg cooked to your preference.  We substituted the rice for the garlic noodles which was an additional $3.00, so the dish came to a total of about $15.00.  It was good but I don't know if it was worth $3.00 good.   Lobster Pho - 4 stars.  Boy, did I enjoy that lobster.  It is based on market price and ended up being $40.00 when I went.  They give you the entire lobster, head included with the meat cut up so its more convenient for consumption.  The broth was okay.  Of course you can't expect beef broth pho so it was a little different on my pallet.  They also didn't bring bean sprout and didn't have limes so I had to resort to lemons.. meh.  Great food experience but I'm not sure I would get it again for that price.  Service was a little slow, granted we were a big group.  They were only able to split the check 4 ways.   It wasn't too busy when we went, which was a Saturday night.  Dining here was definitely an experience!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pho Market Price: $40.00 5-2-15
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Egg (Garlic Noodles $3.00 additional)

HqgdlMGWwddGAVoNfDB0vg.text: Amazing food and modern decor .  The lobster pho is so good and innovative, and we loved all the appetizers we ordered  .  If you saw it on the food network then you best head over and try this place out because you won't be disappointed . Chef Khai Vu is on top of his game .

fL5XlgwiWBmoH3Pbcrf1fw.text: I cant get enough of the belly buns!! Steamed or fried!! Also the Pho, any kind, is amazing! Also tried the Mi Wonton soup and the flavor is fantastic!! If your looking for something light, the beef carpaccio is the best!! Everything we've ever tried has been really good. I would recommend this to anyone and we will be back!

XjsTBSwo3Iw6mgkmw2Gmyg.text: omg, this place is amazing!!  it's off the strip, there's parking,no waiting, and the food is absolutely delicious!!!  we were in town to celebrate our friend's 30th birthday and before getting all dolled up, our friend recommended this place.  Fantastic choice! We have 7 girls and 1 guy.  We definitely ordered the whole entire kitchen.  Almost all the appetizers, small dishes, and then individual orders!  Love the fried calamari, love love LOVE the oxtail fried rice!!!  it was so good that I, personally, ordered another one!  The pork belly bun was good, but not the best.  Typical spring rolls and egg rolls.  We ordered oysters on a half shell, that was a big disappointment and we all love oysters.  It did not taste...good.  not bad, but definitely not good.  We didn't even finish it.  So we all ordered individual entrees aside from the 20 dishes we had already.  I ordered the Marrow bone soup dish...thing.  I love bone marrow and I just had to have it.  While I'm chomping on the oxtail fried rice, main entree is trickling in.  Wondering where's mine and all of a sudden my friend's eyes looked like a pug.  Just sticking out like it's reaching for something.  I turned around and I saw this monolithic prehistoric bone sticking out of a bowl.  "Marrow Bone Soup" they called out.  Whoa, it's my dish.  I think I had a T-rex bone marrow.  Two giant bone sticking out of my bowl.  I didn't even know how to tackle it, but hey, I love food and I'm not ashamed of it.  I ate it like a True rockstar, my hands and a straw.  Absolutely devine!  I was so happy and enjoying my "bone", hahahaha.  Friends took pictures of me left and right.  It was on point, to perfection.  I definitely enjoyed that dinner.  So if you're there, order the oxtail fried rice, fried calamari, and the marrow bone soup and you'll be just fine.  Man, now I was to go back just for it!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the size of this!!!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Marrow Bone Soup

dB79TuyEtJ0mgKN4CIz5_g.text: Sometimes fate has a way of getting you where you need to be.  After aimlessly driving in the rain to find out my destination was closed, I found myself checking nearby restaurants on, you guessed it, the Yelp app when District One popped up.  Long bookmarked but not previously sampled I pulled a u turn and made a very good food decision.    First off, I have never felt so welcome in a restaurant.  First the hostess greated me and proceeded to ask how I was doing before explaining the concept of Asian Fusion.  She escorted me to the bar where I had a personal flat screen and she told me to ask if I wanted to change channels.  The bartender Adrian (sp?) was also amazing.  She took time taking my order, was way more knowledgeable about the menu than most bartenders need to be and was happy to explain the options.  She recommended the oxtail fried rice and the fish taco appetizer.  She even discouraged me from ordering additional food items as the rice was a large portion instead of letting me waste my money. I was also impressed that she asked about food allergies.  The fish tacos arrived three small wonton tacos with what can only be described as a light and crisp cerviche.  The flavor was amazing and it was the perfect appetizer as it was not too filling but really pleased the taste buds.  The oxtail fried rice came with a fried egg on top.  At Adrian's recommendation I got mine runny which really helped the flavor spread through the rice.  The rice itself had a large portion of oxtail mixed in and a great mix of flavors.    I wanted to lick my plate clean when finished the flavors were so good.  However, she was right and I was full, so glad I didn't order any other dishes.  I highly recommend this place.  For those of us who budget, the rice was $12.99, and the entire meal, with a beer came to $30.00.

k3rEWcUUup5FdOweN-Km0w.text: Whenever we would come to Las Vegas, we would have to visit this place at least once. We love their oxtail fried rice and oxtail fries. The oysters are very delicious too.   Now that we're locals, we can eat here all the time. The best thing about this place is they open super late.

ctKv2UgmJMJ2ebooLM3R7Q.text: This place is more than a gathering to have dinners, everyone that works there is now our family/friend. We love everything from the decorations to the entrees to the desserts. From start to finish. I love the oyster features they have, the rice dishes, lobster pho. I've had everything on that menu can't say I have a favorite because it's all so damn good. My wife absolutely loves their coconut ice cream and green tea cream brulee. Our family and all of our friends come here, so don't be surprised if you bump into some people you know. Come give it a try, it's amazing and very welcoming. We appreciate you Khai.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some karaoke after
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The girls after dinner getting ready for karaoke!!

X4yXbzlbRpfkuBKrKb1ORw.text: Used to be one of my favorite spots to snag a couple of appetizers and some drinks. Never had an issue until the bartender took it upon himself to turn a $20 tip into a $60 tip off of a $27 tab. Basically was scammed. Accounting admitted they were in the wrong, and that the bartender got a slap on the wrist. they were supposed to send me the $40 back, but didn't. Repeated attempts to get ahold of said accountant after this were useless. Needless to say I will not be going back.

bptWQzEiFhtoZQ3xhnCpCA.text: This place was such a great find! I was visiting with family while on a business trip. The plaza is so nondescript you may pass it except for the metal backed signage that stands out.   The staff is very pleasant and the food is delicious. The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars is...   1) We arrived around 3:30pm and the sunlight was bouncing off the cars in the parking lot, right into our faces. They have shades but didn't have them rolled down. Booths line the windows and were full with patrons so it might have been inconvenient for them to pull them down right then. The windows span the entire restaurant though.    2) I tried the oxtail pho. It tasted amazing but the meat was still on the bone. Getting the meat off was a little difficult and it was also boiling hot. I don't know if my expectations are too high but I don't enjoy burning my fingers to get the meat off. I tried with a fork but it was too hard. I wouldn't mind it on the bone if the meat was falling off.   We also tried the pork sticky buns, beef lemongrass wrapped in grape leaf, and ribeye pho. All were amazing! I did notice that the ribeye pho broth was definitely different than the oxtail. The ribeye was a little darker and heavier. The oxtail lighter overall. Both very good just different. This place is a must try if in Vegas!

YSISvfw8JSTc9uTDGDREOA.text: The lobster pho was okay I think it looks better than it tastes I would not order the lobster pho next time I'm glad I got it for an experience but I don't recommend the lobster pho to anyone else everything else on the menu was pretty good very reasonable in price great service very great atmosphere  here I will be back

3XQ3qV4Lakug5EIEESRP5A.text: Excellent food,  great staff.  Staff was willing to work with first timers from out of town and explain menu items.  Food was served fresh and In a timely manner.  Loved the music,  trendy without being vulgar (so it's safe to bring the kids)

5qdJhPrb5OG3H2HjQE7DYg.text: I'm not a fan. I stopped in based on Yelp reviews -- around 3:15 pm as I was in the neighborhood and needed a snack. I knew from other reviews it was happy hour and there were food specials. I was given the regular menu -- no big deal, maybe they changed happy hour. I ordered the serrano wings (6 for $7.95) and a side of steam rice ($1.50). The waiter then showed me the specials on a chalkboard -- none of which I was interested in but then I asked what the difference was between the wings on his specials board and the wings that I ordered. He said nothing -- but his price quote was more expensive than the menu he gave me. He really seemed confused and said the price must have dropped. Interesting. Anyway, he then said, what time is it? I said like 3:20, he said oh it's happy hour, there is a happy hour menu. He left, provided it to me, and the wings were $.50 each ($3 for 6), so, then I also decided to order the fried spring rolls ($3.95), and steamed rice. My bill with tip was $11 so, cheap but the food wasn't very good, the wings tasted a bit like chicken liver -- not sure what was happening there. The spring rolls were the highlight but I did not like their sweet chili sauce and asked if they had hot mustard -- they do not. The rice was not quality. It was not sticky, but very separated like American (uncle ben's) rice.  The clincher was -- while I was finishing up. The owner or manager maybe, drove up (Toyota beige truck), parked in the only handicap spot in front (no handicap sign or designation on plate), and walked in the restaurant/pulled up at bar and was still there 20 minutes later when I left. It is totally is rude and annoying when perfectly able body people take the handicap spots (I'm in tuned because my mom is disabled and I drive her around a lot and its annoying that spots are taken by those with no disability and just lazy-asses).

v405SwZ79R48W2xRbcN8eg.text: Cool looking space with that "industrial-hipster" look of exposed beams, metal, wood and a bar with wood pallets as a base.  Food was pretty tasty with the grilled squid being a must!  If the coconut ice cream is available then get it because it's a sweet, palate-cleansing mix of Filipino/Vietnamese type dessert.

M6xD3CuPdMrui-_zdH0xJQ.text: This is the next to go to hotspot.  The owners of this restaurant are friendly.  Fast and convenient service.  The food is phenomenal!  See a lot of promising things for this Vietnamese fusion.

K9KzDQ2K-LBRz0t5V_19aA.text: Welcoming environment, clean and modern decor. Came in here for a quick lunch, ordered the Mekong(shrimp and pork) river pho. The broth tasted natural and flavorful and not over powering. I like the added garnishes(roasted garlic and ground pork meat). Not your typical pho joint(in a good way)

Gmu7PzMh5RsSsGUaINzROQ.text: Simply AMAZING! Love everything from the atmosphere to the food -- great establishment! First Stop: Lobster Pho and Oxtail Fries = success! Until next time!

eBeIvN30I-HfY6VpmUWgQw.text: I liked the setup and people are friendly. I wish they would have more seafood on stock but thats the price you pay for fresh ingredients.

7fjhfd_WdaqtIW7JoXjKaA.text: Every year for my birthday I try to find a new spot to have my dinner. With the help of yelp ;) I stumbled upon District One. I decided to give it a try based off all the positive reviews.   First, I wanted a place that was open late because the second part of my night didn't start till much later so I was pleased that they were open until 2.   I loved the interior. It's not typical fancy birthday dinner type of decor (but that's not really my style) It was very relaxed, and even though we were dressed up, we felt very comfortable and we were able to relax and have a good time. I was a little hesistant at first choosing this place because most of my friends had never tried this type of food before but luckily everyone found something to fit their taste buds :)   Our server Jason was very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable. A couple of my friends got spring rolls confused with egg rolls, but they took them back with no issue and brought them back what they meant to order :)   I had the fried pork belly buns and the beef pho, which both were super tasty! I'm a lover of soups and this one did not dissapoint. I also tried a peice of my friend's egg roll (very good) and some pork chop from her combonation meal, which was also really good and flavorful (she said it was better than her mom's lol). My sister complimented the chicken wings and said the sauce that came with them was very good. I also tried the chicken fried rice: nice, moist, and had a little kick which I didn't mind. At the end of the evening I recieved the coconut ice cream for my b-day treat...it was delicious! My friends even ordered some for themselves. All in all I had a very good experience that evening and left full and happy:) Thank You District One for making my birthday even more memorable.   If asian fusion is your thing (or if you just want to try something new) I highly recommend trying District One, you won't be dissapointed!

XeOCjJwfLlKpkSd_oYxyGQ.text: My first time at District One Kitchen. My son-in-law had told me about the place and said how great the food was. I had their rib eye pho with a side of veggies and spring rolls. It was very very good! I will definitely go back to try something else on their menu! This place is a keeper!!

JaBBYffFZvRkxn1CzHZI6A.text: I love the pho here . The flavor of the broth is just right. Go to this spot if ur craving pho while visiting vegas

GXQDphBG9gqvPjWqQUwtTQ.text: Was introduced to this place by another friend visiting Las Vegas. Great food, great drinks, great people!!! The owner, servers and bartenders went out of their way to make us feel welcomed.  Added this to my must have's when in Vegas!!!

tmOJUcGDzxkmq5_Wm9s2OQ.text: Great place for date night!  Clean, fun, incredible food and awesome service. My hubby had wings, fish tacos and steak & eggs and loved all of it. I ordered the lobster pho....AMAZING Our server, TK was so attentive and V is so friendly.   They even have extra outlets and USB ports to charge your phone at the bar. Get in your car and go to District One now! You won't be disappointed.

_SoMTDvjPFwSzw3zRQmlhQ.text: Food was very good-above average-but the service is what got this place 2 stars.  We waited 14 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us. Finally the waiter came and took our order. Food came out expediently as they weren't that busy. We were joking because we thought our waiter went home as we hadn't seen him. We had to pull someone to our table and asked for our waiter as we hadn't seen him since we ordered. He informed us- "he went home". OMG-serious ? We started laughing. Then he informed us he was supposed to be taking over but forgot about us. Lol lol lol The service is the reason I won't return

rNg9n86we3z389IGCBohFQ.text: This place is very clean and the food is so good! I ordered the pork bun sliders, garlic fried rice with goat meat, and a couple of coconut mojitos!! The waiter was very nice and always asked if we needed anything.  I would definitely come back. This place also has a huge bar!!

7ht2H7xY6bd9_6bgOOLQLw.text: I've been to District One twice in 1 week - that's how good it is.  See Marcus or Khai.  They'll make sure you get exactly what you want.  I ordered the pho with shrimp the first time I went, which was very good.  The 2nd time, I asked Marcus how to get more veggies in my pho, so he had me order the veggie pho with a side of shrimp.  Perfect!  Clean, reasonably priced, great music & they'll be receiving their liquor license soon.  I can't wait to go back!

0MFmOxbrUxE5zmnPIDwXBg.text: Amazing service here!! Came In and at first was overwhelmed by people asking to get me drinks but ended up loving the attention all the people that work here give . Servers were on point about all menu items. Never had an empty glass... EVER!! Good was good had the spicy beef noodle soup, wings for appetizer, but the yellowtail collar (hamachi Kama) oh man!!! I was obsessed! So good. I'd go back for just that!!

ixWWORo8pNQM--TyRCAkMQ.text: Best fried rice ever! The Oxtail fried rice was simply amazing! Every bite of rice was filled with meat. Rarely happens with fried rice.  Next time I go, definitely going to try the bone marrow pho. Looks crazy!

1XMdQhOuQSpanxRqkT61Zw.text: Great drinks with creative presentation, nice vibe, and very attentive servers. Food was ok.

RIR0vaFLNMiHVaSde2BGPw.text: This is a must go for us anytime we visit sin city. The lobster fried rice and oxtail pho are delicious! Service can be rather slow so make sure you have ample time when dining here.  The Vietnamese iced coffee is on the sweet side so be prepared to add extra hot water.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail pho - really good!
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Fried Rice

27DFgFpbPhheDhQJrAF8pA.text: I wasn't impressed. All of us at my table ordered the ox tail pho. I don't know if they gave me the end of the bag, but the longest noodles I had was like two inches. Plus the total Noodle I had was like three bites. My sister gave me some of her noddles because she got more. So, they are not consistent. The sever seem like they don't care and they are not knowledgeable. The coconut pork belly is basically soaked in fish sauce.

Qtv-TS4MgC8jNS5jKbPHGg.text: District One is a hidden gem. The chef is great.  He loves to play with his ingredients.  You can tell by his dishes.  I came here a year ago with my mother.  It was great and still is.  I came here a few weeks ago with my husband.     I was able to try a few different dishes this time around.  Oxtail Fries is a must!  Pork Belly Buns was tasty, the balance in flavors is great.  Pho was good and fresh ingredients.   Can't wait to come by to try their other small dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Buns
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai

ulOUQDnyaLgs3Dh2CvnxzQ.text: They offer one of the best oxtail pho in town. I like the simplicity of their menu and their food is really good. Their staff is friendly and the environment is more hip and modern compared to other Vietnamese restaurant.

JdOEcFbT_fozI0nui68SKg.text: I usually don't like fusion restaurant but district one gets my 4 stars rating. We had the veggie deluxe dish, regular pho and the oxtail fried rice. All were tasty!! No msg in the soup! Servers were friendly. Love the interior design.

t7TY42WpQK0Xk9v2oocXvQ.text: One of the better spots for pho in Vegas!!! I came here late one night and was blown away by how much better the pho is compared to the other spots around the area. It's a little further west from the strip but it'd definitely worth the drive, or cab ride.  The interior of the restaurant is more of a sports bar, since they do have a full-service bar at the restaurant. It seems like a great spot to catch a game or two since there are TVs lined throughout the restaurant. The tables are nicely distributed across the restaurant so you don't feel like you're crammed. It's clean throughout the place and the service is exceptional. They definitely go out of their way to make sure you're happy. If I could describe this place in 2 words, I'd called it a "Hipster Pho" place.  I got an order of the pho tai rib eye ($9) and I was really happy with my choice. The amount of meat that they give you is really generous; not to mention, the meat is really tasty and tender. On top of that, the broth is really flavorful. It's definitely not 100% free of MSG but you're not complaining when you're eating there in the wee hours.   I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai rib eye
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

SELPelQ9T4-RXcp1UT_y8g.text: Came here once a couple months ago and had dinner and dessert.  I love exploring restaurants in Chinatown LV. I've heard so many good things about this place and was lucky enough to stop in while visiting the city for work.  Everything is good here... there's something for everyone. I had the beef carpaccio, chicken wings, noodles, fish tacos, and two desserts.  I love the late night hours and the chill vibes here. Great for big groups.  I would love to come back here again to try more things off the menu. If you're in LV or visiting the city... I highly recommend.  Thanks Chef Khai!  I'm a fan.  - Miss Yelp 2017

bU9oMl5uvnN0zqhU_FINXg.text: One of the best lunches ever.  The food was so flavorful.  We had the Serrano wings, garlic edamame, bok choy, wonton soup and the coconut pork belly rice.  Every item was drool worthy.  We sat at the bar and the girls were super attentive and very friendly.  Can't wait to come back!

TxZ3yvwSaYxIeWoin5uk-w.text: Service was great, and the inside has a trendy atmosphere.  I had the veggie pho and had no complaints. Generous portion of root and leafy vegetables. However, if you're a vegeterian, you might not like the fact that it uses beef broth. We also ordered garlic noodles, and although they were pretty plain, they weren't very oily. I actually enjoyed them more than the pho. Haven't tried anything else there yet but my carnivorous fried loved their pho tai nam.

XvFlyS9-G2iId6bYhgtsrg.text: Surprised after the other glowing reviews.  No bar at this "kitchen & bar", week menu, week service, week concept.  Would not return.

vse5166JsJUJXiQmb1AaWQ.text: In my opinion, this is a Vietnamese fusion restaurant aims to attract non-traditional Vietnamese food lovers with mostly English speaking waitstaff.  Most of the menu items were named in a way that non-Vietnamese could understand with the exception of standard items like pho.  Ironically, as a person that used to traditional Vietnamese food, I find myself trying to figure out what was the equivalent traditional items.  Unlike most fusion restaurants, The price of the items were not too pricey, compare to the Vietnamese restaurants on Spring Mountain Road.  The most intriguing item on the one-page menu was the Lobster Pho.  It was set as market priced.  I was told that it would be $50 that day.  I didn't have the courage to put down $50 for a bowl of pho but it's interesting to know that it exists.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DrqcBSwhxXTGfa6dDlcX4w.text: If you love oysters you gotta check out their $1 oyster deals... late nights and atmosphere is fun.  The service is inconsistant tho.  Sometimes a good waiter... other times... crickets... your waiting on the waiter.... ugghhh not good.  I work in the service industry... so I know, how you should take care of customers.  They need to actually like their Jobs, if they plan on doing them well.  Got the feeling they didnt want to be there. anyhow over all,  a kinda cool place to go chill out for a quick bite.

M3_lyA4-VbEiEqny4i36sQ.text: Some of the girls wanted pho since they were a bit hungover. I'm not a fan of pho but as long as they have vermicelli and other dishes I'm good. We took an uber here but there seemed to be plenty of open parking spaces in the lot. The inside is pretty nice. A definite fancier version of most Vietnamese pho places I been to. It's pretty big and spacious and a bit dim. Very inviting, good setting for big groups. The menu is more updated, instead of just pho. So pretty good for someone like myself who does not want pho. They have a little bit of everything for everyone.  _Crispy Egg Rolls ($8.99) Pork, mushroom, taro. I don't know if it's the taro or a certain oil they fry this in, but this was one of the best crispy egg rolls I've had. The crunch from the egg rolls was nicely fried, the inside was fresh and was nicely packed with ingredients. Simple but lots of flavors, it was a tad sweet and had a nutty flavor to it. I loved the greens that came with it. You can dip the roll in the fish sauce then wrap it in the lettuce, it takes it to another level and makes you feel a little less guilty for eating fried food hahah. _Spring Rolls ($6.99) Shrimp, pork, vermicelli, lettuce, peanut sauce. This was good and pretty standard. The rolls were fresh, the ingredients inside were a generous amount and the flavor was light and subtle. Of course this isn't complete without that yummy sweet and nutty peanut dipping sauce.  _Steak & Egg ($15.99) Shaken beef, white onion, fried egg, tomato rice. I ordered this, since they did not have the vermicelli bowl. I was skeptic to get this at first since most shaken beef I have are always salty. So I asked the waiter if possible to make it less salty or easy sauce. The tomato rice was good, different from white rice, but just adds a nice little sweetness and acidity to the dish. The beef itself was okay, well cooked and all evenly chopped. The sauce was still salty but I've had worse so can't complain. The egg was a bit raw and runny so they were nice enough to recook it a bit more. The dish taste way better with the eggs, when you mix it altogether. This dish overall was okay, I think the rice and egg alone was the best part.  _Baby Bok Choi (8.99) Wok fried, garlic. Pretty good and standard veggies. The garlic flavors were great and tasted really good when I ate it with my shaken beef. _Spicy Pork String Beans ($10.99) Ground pork, chili, green string beans. The whole group loved this. My gg, whom is allergic to garlic ordered this without the garlic, but I guess they forgot the memo. The flavors were great though, lots of garlic aroma, a bit of a kick and the beans itself were perfectly cooked. It had a nice little bite to it, white still being soft as well.  _Coconut Ice Cream. They were nice to give us free desserts for the mess up on the garlic mishap on the green beans. Presentation was pretty. Served on a small coconut bowl. The flavors were light and refreshing, it had a bit of that icy texture to it. There was also small bits of coconut inside and topped with crushed peanuts. I love peanuts so this added an extra roasted flavor to the ice cream. I will say though, the more I ate it, the more it tasted like vanilla ice cream with hints of coconut. Either way a good dessert.  _Green Tea Creme Brulee. This was pretty darn good! The green tea custard was nice and silky. A very subtle hint of green tea. The brulee on top was perfectly caramelized and sweet. A small size which is great to just end the meal.  Service was good, and yes pretty pricey for Vietnamese cuisine, but you are in Vegas so high prices are to be expected. I don't mind paying as long as the food is good. Nothing is worse than overpriced food that isn't even good. I would come here again, and try their popular oxtail pho.

EL6bW4rgjr5TkdU9wPpUFg.text: First heard of this place from a video from Facebook. They were promoting their lobster pho. I'm not a huge fan of pho but everything else on their menu looked good. So my friends and I came to visit while we were in Vegas. I ordered the oxtail fried rice and it was really good! It was a pretty big portion so I took the rest home. My friends and I shared the oysters that were $3.50 each and they were really good! They were better than the bluepoint ones that we got a dozen of but still pretty good. I tried a little bit of what my friends got as well and we were all pleased with what we got. I would def come visit this place again when we visit Vegas!

6jsQGKW2ZQa3YyGFfqu7Pg.text: Excellent date spot, fun vibe, lots of parking, and nearby options for after the meal. This place is perfect if you like a fusion spin on tried-and-True favorites.

ggYjX3z89iT8syHQgijGUQ.text: Late night rendezvous??? You've come to the right place. Open and serving food unroll 2am.  A wonderful Asian fusion restaurant, with a hip Vibe, and an even hipper liquor list. If you want only one thing from the menu just to get the big bone soup. It's essentially Pho but with a GIANT beef bone in it,  so you get all that good marrow and tasty bits in your broth.  The spring rolls are delish, and they have a lot of really great beers on tap as well. Service was fast and accurate, and the staff is really friendly. I loved the music selection the night we went.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls and some vino

kyH_AWJaCyULjQ6qVYHvow.text: Came across various reviews on Yelp and Chris V. review actually convince me to give this place a try. So we decided to come last night around 11pm on 7.11.16 for late night dinning.  First of all the atmosphere reminded me of a Joe's Crab Shack just with Asian Influence with a open floor plan with a good size bar. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable with the items they offer. We end up getting an order of Spring Rolls, Shaken Beef Salad and Oxtail Fried Rice. All the dishes we had was great especially the Oxtail Fried Rice. Coming from Hawaii, Oxtail is a staple. This dish was seasoned well and cook to the way fried rice should be, not being too dry and bland. It was balanced and consistent especially with the easy over egg on top.   A few things when going to District One:  -Not a traditional Vietnamese Restaurant but Asian American Fusion style in a modern setting with a Vietnamese twist.  -Menu is only a page long on a clip board but they have an extensive drink menu which was like a small booklet.  - Great place to hangout with a group of friends or family members with open floor plan and large size tables.  - Awesome place to grab a bite after a long day at work and late night dinning.  Will be back to try more of their delicious food and drinks.

My bowl was tasty as the flavors from the oxtail made it great.  I liked how the meat was cooked and easily comes off the bone. We also ordered the oxtail fries and the beef salad. The fries almost reminded me of poutine fries. They were a bit soggy as the juices/gravy soaked in them. The beef salad was good as the beef was very tender (I wished the pieces were a bit better).

_5FCEeBQZuXYSi2ayHkg_g.text: Just one of the best restaurants off the strip, period. The food is amazing, the service is great  and the ambiance is lively!  Been here twice already and have not been disappointed at all. The wait staff are incredibly polite and  courteous. The wife and I have had the Vietnamese Mule, which was tasty and very well done. We have tried the following:   Chicken Pho - The Pho broth is delicious and the wife and son loved it. What my wife liked was how her clothes didn't smell like pho after eating it, like if you go to a normal Pho restaurant.  My son was all about the broth.  Lobster Fried Rice - Outstanding. Incredibly flavorful and presentation was just delightful! Garlic Serrano Fried Chicken -  Fried chicken with a wonderful kick to it. Just delicious!  Oxtail Fries - Heavy but really full of flavor to comfort the palate. Clay Pot Chicken and Rice - just outstanding! 11 year old son loved it.  We look forward to coming again and trying out more things! For what you get and what you pay  - No brainer. This place rivals Mr. Chow or a good handful of restaurants on the strip... IT is just sooooo good...! Try it! You will not be disappointed.

nZM7V5xIfpOfrz2ljrzcoQ.text: Fun place.  Great food.  Great ambiance. Sit in the bar and look for Aaron. He mixes the best drinks in town.  The oysters are  good especially the happy hour price. I ate a dozen and a half.  Highly recommend this place for a great foodie and drinkie place.

o6dEbhtVk6LBO7D33WobuA.text: There are so many options to try in Las Vegas.  Somehow I ended here to try their massive big bone soup.  It was a great experience to try to finish the bowl, which I failed.  The best part is the richness of soup flavor.  It is one of the best soup I had.    I surprise hit was the spicy soup.  I am going to talk my family to go back to this restaurant before we end the vacation to go back to the east coast.    If you are visiting Las Vegas, I strongly recommend you try District One.

nuDrIuo-jF4x-WbMc0vrog.text: This review is based on what I observed in my first visit...  I wanted lobster pho or the surf and turf pho, but for the price tag of $49 (I think) and $35 respectively, I compromised with oxtail pho which was a lot more reasonable at $14. After all, pho is pho right?  The oxtail soup was clean. It was refreshing and the meat was falling off the bone. Good size meat pieces too.   As the lobster pho passed by, it did look like a legit size/portion and looked AMAZINGLY good, but still don't know if I would be willing to fork out the cash.   The service was good and the menu looked very interesting. I'm looking forward to going back to try other items on the menu.  Update: I went back and had the surf and turf! My friend had the lobster pho. Either way, it was delicious. We also had the oxtail fries and they were just as delicious. Can't really go too wrong here!

xF8v7TXQGR3O7qegDJGIpg.text: Came here to try the famous whole lobster pho with some friends. We thought it was good, but agreed that it  wasn't enough to justify the $49 price tag, but with trying once!   I ordered the Surf and Turf ($35), which is half a lobster and sliced ribeye. The ribeye was very tender and the flavor of the broth was authentic (according to this Viet ). Their matcha Thai iced tea was also very good. My fiance ordered it, but I ended up really liking it and ended getting one to go too.

glmUI3WNpGdi-_idbvVypg.text: Lobster phooooo! This place is so cool, and their highlight product is a delicious precut lobster in a tasty pho not to be missed. Dont stop there, try their pork belly buns or vietnamese carpaccio to die for! Highly recommended!

IVEkoyZQRQQKtQN5V4T9bw.text: So I have eaten here a couple of times with the family.  Once for dinner and once for lunch.  The food is good and I do appreciate the good service we got on both visits.  On the most recent visit the wife and I had Pho Oxtail, fish tacos and Steak and Egg Rice.  The wife so enjoyed their Pho last time she quickly selected the Pho Oxtail for her lunch.  I went with the Steak and Egg Rice and we went with the fish tacos for our appetizer.      The fish tacos were good but got to be honest not great.  The lacked the depth of flavor I expected and were kind of bland.  The Steak dish was slightly too salty which but it was a tasty dish.  It was sweet with a little sour taste and paired well with the rice and over easy egg.  I enjoyed the dish but wish the salt was used a little more sparingly.      The highlight of he meal was the Pho Oxtail.  They do some very good Pho and the Oxtail is one of the better ones. The broth was so so good.  It had such a good depth to it.  It was a beef broth with the nice accent of mint in the background.   The mint didn't overpower the dish but was there to add to the delicious flavor.  The meat was plentiful and very tender and good.  The wife was so happy with her choice and she prefers District One's Pho over several other places in town.      I do love their ambiance and have been in later in the evening when the crowd is there to have a mixed drink or two and enjoy some great food. It is a happening place and can get very busy in the evenings and on weekends.  The staff is excellent and took good care of us on both our visits.  Funny thing the daughter had been there with a friend just the day before.  She brought home some leftovers and they were so good that we wanted to have D1 for lunch.  I will gladly be back and look forward to another meal at D1.

dI1jZ_nLLdMdrSMsZShjNQ.text: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(89/365) "Cravin' Cajun Reincarnated"  A bunch of us stopped in as a plan B after we sadly found out that I-naba was closed for the evening. Restaurants these days have the wierdest names!?!? I kept calling this restaurant One Direction!? After finding out the correct name, it still reminded me of The Hunger Games, not a restaurant!?!?  Oh well....  We shared a few apps and started out with the Tamarind Wings and the Garlic Serrano Pepper Wings which were both puny in portion and very underwhelming. We also shared the Beef Carpaccio which was delicious and the star of the appetizers.  For my entree, I ordered the District One Combo Plate with The Kalbi short ribs. I asked to substitute Vietnamese Red Rice with extra garlic. This plate was good, but not great. Nice taste and char on the short ribs, but unfortunately, the rice was red, but kinda bland and there was no extra garlic like I asked for. there also was pieces of Chinese sausage and a little pile of kimchi on the plate as well but seemed like it didn't really flow with the rest of the components.   After getting a taste of Amelinda's Slow Braised Pork Belly in Coconut Water (SO FRICKIN' ONO!!!!!) That would be THE dish I would return for. If you have the chance, order this dish. Don't ask questions, JUST DO IT!!!  ALOHA!!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  3.5   *Little more than A-Ok right now with wiggle room for improvement...

fjrPfGPpa_fvLYOJyxKy_A.text: Uhhh i was really hungry when i went here so i thought i would end up giving this a lot of stars but i didn't like it. We had a ton of different things like some items from happy hour. The belly buns were okay. The fish tacos were alright. I liked the egg rolls bc i didnt like anything else. I didnt care for the steak and eggs nor the oxtail fried rice. I tried like 5 different things and they were all eh. I liked the atmosphere and decor tho! I gave a third star bc they let us order happy hour 2 min before it was over. And their pandan creme brulee was actually bomb!

ea6EokGKWly9qLCPfqky8w.text: I had pork belly on my mind when I tried this place for lunch, but was a little disappointed to find out that they didn't have any since it was still cooking and it wouldn't be ready until dinner.   Since I had my heart set on pork belly, it took me a little bit to recoup and figure out what to order. I finally decided on the combination rice plate with shortrib and my dining companion opted for the steak and eggs. The food came out pretty quickly, although my dish came out a few minutes before my friends, which was a little annoying. The lobster pho looked good as they were serving it to a neighboring table, so that definitely piqued my interest for my next interest.  I enjoyed my shortribs and everything I tried was solid, just nothing amazing. Service was good but refills were a little hard to come by. I especially enjoyed the kim chee which was on the spicy side. That was my favorite thing about the meal. I still couldn't get the pork belly out of my head, so I'll likely have to come back for that, but I've learned my lesson and will call in advance to make sure that they have it ready before coming in.

h0WIzX3KjDB4LeIhLQ3bvw.text: Came here on a Saturday for dinner.. there was a wait for a table so we decided to sit at the bar for a drink until the table was ready. Ended up ordering food at the bar and giving away our table because Emily was so cool!! Seriously, my favorite bartender. EVER. Attentive but not annoying. Handled everything (being the only bartender there) very well.. timely and efficiently.  Drinks: Moscow Mule and Vietnamese Donkey BOTH SO GOOD.  Food: Lobster Pho.. 5 stars. Delicious Ox Tail Fried Rice: 5 stars. Really good, and actually had good chunks of meat and a yummy over easy egg on top.  Fried calamari: big portion (we had leftovers) really good kinda spicy dipping sauce!   Overall, 5 million stars

so5WNCC2rcWrBW-G4UnsNg.text: What an expensive Vietnamese pho restaurant. What they are advertising is their ox tails. Almost everything is ox tails.  -parking: a big parking lot for this plaza.  -service: we came in and the lady sat in the counter told me if I was ok to seat by the bar, we can go for it. I asked her there were not two seats together, I didn't want to have my brunch with different seats with my hubby. She said she could grab a chair which she never did, she didn't even remember she told me what she would do for us. Maybe she's over busy, but it didn't seem very busy that she could handle with the crowds. As soon as we settled ourselves, we had to wave to ask for service, that time was not much people ordered drinks either.  -ox tail fried rice: it tasted like they pre made in the kitchen, as soon as we placed the order, they brought to us in 5 minutes. It's a heavy dish, ox tail meats was stuck together, not evenly. We definitely felt heavy after this plate.  -ox tail soup that is what they are famous for. We have to wait about 30 minutes for them to bring it over, we didn't have any updates with our order. Nothing special for this bowl of soup. The ox tail was hard to chew on, the meat was still stick on the bone. The noodles was very hard, it's tasted like lack of time to cook. The soup base was a bit sour. Flavorless !  -price: the fried rice was $15.99, same as the soup. Very expensive ones.  Good to try and also good to not going bav

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Expensive ox tail soup and it&#39;s

8a62T8RMseLRMsAV0nfVEw.text: This place has good food and good service. Although it is pricier than a typical pho in chinatown, it was worth it!   The interior was very modern and somewhat americanized so I honestly had my doubt about authenticity at first. There was no wait for 3 people since we sat by the bar. Our bartender/ server was very friendly. She recommended me to get oxtail pho so I did.  To decorate on the service, my friend had a surprised feminine call of nature and the server rushed to get her some emergency feminine hygiene products very discreetly! ( Mind you, we were sitting at the bar next to a few guys!)   The oxtail pho had very flavorful clear broth as it should be. The noodles weren't impressive; however, the meat was so tender it fell off apart from the bone itself. I was so in love with every spoonful.  My friend got lobster pho. She was so hyped about it since she saw the video online and that was merely the reason why we went in the first place. Sadly, it didn't live up to her expectations and it was just average.  We had a very good experience nonetheless!

XlDjxbYplDAoHwSp32UOLg.text: Restaurants that have a WOW factor sure will be much more memorable than those without it....that's what I learned coming to District One.    Their wow factor you ask?  Just order the "Bone Marrow Soup"  and you will be WOW'd! I mean, they give you the entire femur (cut in half of course) of the cow in a bowl!  Can't be more WOW'd than anything else!   To describe their menu, I'd say a modernized vietnamese restaurant with lot's of different Pho's, side dishes and specials.  One thing that was pretty interesting was the Ox Tail Loco Moco with gravy made from Pho broth.  I was pretty impressed with the taste! Definitely get that again!    I also go the Ribeye Pho, which I must say, probably the best mean in a bowl of pho I have ever had!    There's lots of goodies to try on the menu, so be daring and try something new!  Although we did have one mishap, and that was with the razor clams.  I think they didn't soak the clams long enough so it still had the gritty sand particles in the meat itself.    Definitely be back to try something new!

The big bone soup (5/5) really has big bones and the soup is very, very tasty....BOMB! I loved it and ate it with a bit of rice.  I tried the hubby's steak and egg and wow! that dish is delicious. I want to go back and try other things.

Rdc9nnRO6_iaZWgssPYUvw.text: Amazing food! Amazing service! Everything was quick and delicious. The atmosphere is trendy, unique, cool and comfortable. We will be back!! What a great spot.

OlMIEOYbV9PnwZ_lmMUB5Q.text: Come here for the PHO. Everything g else was pretty good but the lobster phi is delicious. Service was amazing too

ClFA05fvSBBxE1uo1dxyUg.text: Oh district one why do you have to be so good but be pricey for the amount you get. I absolutely love their oxtail fried rice, but I'm not sure if it's just me but they keep raising their prices every time I come here. Their wings and the oxtail pho is really yummy as well, but I feel I could go somewhere else in China town for the same stuff for a couple bucks less. I come here as often as I can, but you don't really get the biggest bang for your buck. Get their oxtail fried rice, nuff said.

XZp4HLp3O5uGFh8_M4Um8g.text: Came here for the big bone soup. It definitely had the wow factor but the bone lacked any meat. It had a lot of ligaments and the soup was good but otherwise, it was A-OK. Their ox tail fried rice was really good. Pho was ok.

tz4D0melcZCZkpRqCfYTIg.text: I had a great time at this restaurant with my son. Atmosphere was trendy, customers young, wait staff attentive. We ordered the The Big Bone Soup...Chicken Wings....Spring Rolls....Slow Braised Pork Bellies....2 dozen fresh oysters...and Ox Tail Fried Rice.  Definite hints of Vietnamese Fusion in their one page menu. Perfect menu before you go clubbing, raving, or whatever.  I focused my attention on the Big Bone Soup.  Bone marrow galore....I felt primitive but happy as I gnawed on the bones like Scooby-Doo!  The Chicken Wings were inhaled by the son....so no reviews.  The spring rolls were great once I wrapped them up in the green veggie leaf, along with fresh green herbs...then dipped in the sweet chili sauce....delish.  The braised pork was delicious.....just take an extra Lipitor afterwards.  The 2 dozen oysters were inhaled by the son.....so no reviews.  Finally, the ox tail fried rice was delish....meaty....goes great with the bone soup.  My grade on this place.....good enough for a return engagement!

qiB8AA0OOCwbFv3s-IeprA.text: While visiting for a few days in Vegas, I was introduced to this cool hip asian fusion establishment that served an amazing vegetable pho soup along with some delicious spring rolls and of coarse desert; ice cream served in a coconut and the creme brulee. Absolutely one of the best asian fusion restaurants with great friendly service that makes you feel right at home. This will be a for sure stop for me next time I'm in Vegas.. Try it out.

N_UctnNmhMzbqHfGD5Z7Eg.text: This place was awesome! I ordered food to go and it was some if the best pho I've had in a long time. The place was really inviting on the inside, I can't wait to go back and eat there. The service was was amazing the guy who rang me up also took the bags to my car! Defiantly exceeded my expectations.   When I got home and put the pho soup together it was great. Will defiantly be back for more soon!

eEJvAOaghf2bJ6Gc-GwqLg.text: My friends and I came down for EDC weekend and stayed an extra couple of days and one of them recommend this place after a night of clubbing. Thank god! This place had that cool industrial atmosphere while staying clean, modern, and classy. But that's not what we came there for. Everything we ordered was AMAZING! The prices weren't bad either (besides the market priced Lobster Pho, which was BOMB AF and I don't even like pho). Did I mention it was happy-hour when we went? I can't wait to come back so I can order more of those fried Belly Buns!!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Market-priced Lobster Pho
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can order the Belly Buns either steamed or fried!

Ig8zVG3p71934jA21tmCkw.text: District One is a place I eat often.  I have always had excellent food. The room is open and inviting.  If you can get the suckling pig do not hesitate. I do not think it is on the menu but on special occasions  it can be ordered.  The only negative thing about the place is that the parking lot is always packed and parking can take a bit of patience.

g8aXAEGM05CTZtL16Tf1tQ.text: Went in today to check out the food and also from all the Yelp reviews because I'm from San Diego and didn't know where to eat. Food is not really my taste buds but they get a two thumb up for their oysters and service. The girls were great. They greeted they smiled they checked on us. Environment and atmosphere was good as well. Will be returning if I'm back in town for some more oysters.

Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eh89yKjJewLnRGsvDHC0ew.text: Came here with a big group so we tried a little bit of everything. After you get enough dishes here you notice that most dishes come with a fried egg which I think is nice since they were all cooked well. While the service was good my only complaint was the waitresses would talk things up like the donkey or the pork belly in coconut nice which we found to be just okay.   To Get: Pork belly sliders: favorite dish of the night ox tail fries: Better than Bachi Burger's Garlic noodles with beef ox tail fried rice Whole grilled squid  Okay: Pork belly in coconut juice big bone soup - a hip bone? in pho broth.   Skip: coconut mojito - Way way too much ice, barely anything to drink donkey drink - I prefer a real moscow mule.  But it does come in a cool cup

RvczgPlS_rxA351berAyBQ.text: Service was great but the food was subpar. A lot of grease and was served luke warm. Unique menu I am going to give it a second try.

WsiZOJfv6Gg49vCbalFxmQ.text: Late night Vietnamese bar food to the MAX. We visited around 10pm and noticed the service at the bar was better than waiting to be seated. Pretty simple ordering. We did the spring rolls, garlic & Serrano pepper chicken wings, and Pho ga soup. Everything was awesome. Very modern feel to the space with a lot of TV's. I guess not your typical Asian spot. Food was so good, a lot of beer and cocktail selection. I'm now a big fan of this place. Open til 2 am on a Sunday. Very good!!!!! And Paul at the bar was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries. Whoop woop

gNKCsb42dL98F047ezJwSA.text: Amazing food! Had the chance to eat here while in town and loved every bite! The pork belly buns were amazing and the oysters were so fresh! I also tried the carpaccio, spring rolls, pho, and coconut ice cream. Honestly, the food was so delicious that if I lived nearby I'd make eating here a weekly ritual. Great thanks to the owners and staff of the establishment.

6o83s3NA0C_pbRF8MIa1RQ.text: Very good hip Pho spot near China Town. I've had the oxtail, rib eye, shrimp, and veggie Pho.  Each are excellent in their own right, I prefer the oxtail, they put a ton of meat in plus offer fixins and extra broth on request. Haven't tried the Lobster Pho yet, but this place goes far beyond the gimmick of a $50 bowl of soup. The menu has a variety of tasty options you wouldn't expect to see in a reg Pho shop, like calamari and oxtail fries (both excellent!). The late hours and bar options make this a late night grub necessity. Comfy booths and informed waitstaff round out an altogether solid  experience. Only docked a star for extreme lack of parking, and menu items are around 15% overpriced across the board.  I generally split an app with my Wife and we each get a Pho, after tip total averages $50.

x7RKv9ik7iLpGg9zoTNzkg.text: Delicious Ox Tail pho! Definitely a necessity when your visiting Vegas! Perfect dish for replenishing!

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox Tail Pho with added Won Tons. The broth is really good! I eat pho all the time and this places broth is legit!

mVhq3EpgQrB-NDrQHi7zBw.text: Well what can I say. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I come here a lot. It just has everything in one place. It's far enough from the sometimes overwhelming buzz of the strip, but has a full bar in case you still want to catch a buzz of your own. They have friendly servers, dope atmosphere and cool decor but what really does it is the food. Man I can eat here every day.   They have traditional vietnamese dishes, like pho and BBH. All pretty good, and being that I come from living in LA and OC the land of vietnamese food I can say it's comparable to some of the better spots out there. As far as Vegas goes it's one of my favorite spots for pho. The quality of the meat in particular when you order it raw is better than most out here. And the oxtail pho, man. Oxtail everything is good and they have good oxtail. But what really kills the game is their specials. Where else can you get lobster pho? Nowhere. At least not till they brought it. They always have fresh seafood specials like oysters, crab, and crawfish. I've eaten basically everything. I could keep going on and on but better to let you try it for yourself. Here's a few recommendations tho.  Lobster garlic noodle. Their version of it is so bomb.  Black pepper lobster. I'm a fan of black pepper already but with lobster????? Beef carpaccio. My go to appetizer.  Oxtail fries. Because damn. Oxtail. And fries, but if you don't feel like french fries then try my all time favorite dish here... OXTAIL LOCO MOCO.  Add an extra egg, just because you got it like that.  I get that every time and then I get another main dish too because I'm fat. But happy.

photos.caption: Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t get enough of their oxtail so I asked them to put it over garlic noodles this time. Don&#39;t ask for it though. It&#39;s mine.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another oxtail loco moco from another time I ate there because it&#39;s seriously that good.
Photo of District One - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail fries. Duuuudeeeee

PDgJbQBc3FP3azoPa1Q-4g.text: Food is great and the prices match. Service was good, we were a large party.  I had the Pho Tom and it was so good.
